review_body: Stayed for 4 days in March 2020. The location was great, close to FIDI, the 9/11 Memorial, Brooklyn Bridge, and other sightseeing. The room was clean and we liked the boutique-style decoration. The Fitness center is quite small, but you have the same on 3 floors so it was not packed. They also had hand sanitizer by the entrance when the coronavirus outbreak has started. We would like to thank all the front desk staff.

We had a great experience at Gild Hall. As a Globalist, we were supposed to receive a complimentary upgrade to a standard suite, which was available during our online checkin. Despite a 1 King Suite being available, we were assigned a 1 King Premium. When we mentioned this at checkin the hotel said they had no suites available to place us in and we could pay for an upgrade to the Penthouse suite. We paid for the upgrade but this is not how it should work per the World of Hyatt terms and conditions.Rooms are tastefully decorated and functional and have a great selection of snacks and drinks inside. Very spacious but that is what I would expect for their top room. Our breakfast was also covered and the restaurant staff were very friendly and the food was delicious.Our stay was very short but it was a great one. Gild Hall offers a good value for cash and points stay. I would recommend booking as late as possible because the hotel dropped their rates for that night sometime in the afternoon.

From soup to nuts this hotel was great. Price, location, staff and the rooms. We were more than happy with our stay here. The fitness center is so so but serviceable. The staff went above and beyond to make our stay enjoyable.

This is a very beautiful boutique Hotel. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. I loved the glass of Prosecco upon arrival. The restaurant associated with the Hotel was top notch. Room was exceptionally clean and great decor. The pillows are the most comfortable i've ever experienced.

The decor was a bit dated when I arrived at the hotel, which was fine. The nightstands were covered with a film of dust which made me worry about the cleanliness of the rest of the room. Considering the Coronavirus, they should really pay more attention to clean the room .

Stayed for 2 days in March 2020. It was unusually warm outside - 59F - but the hotel had the air conditioning off, so my room was a sweltering 75F the whole stay. It was too hot to sleep well, and, on top of that, the bed was hard as rocks. I will stay anywhere else but here next time in lower NYC.

dirty and clogged sink , tiolet has orange stains that I hoped it was only rust musty smell in the room, very loud A/C, I couldn't sleep entire night because of disgust however there were no coffee machine in the room...

Tuvimos un fin de semana excelente en este hotel, el servicio fue excelente. El cuarto limpió y la cama cómoda, en una parte silenciosa de Nueva York, así que pudimos dormir con gran paz y tranquilidad. Caitlin fue muy amable de ayudarnos en nuestras preguntas al igual que Ángel y Amber la mánager.Me and my wife came to visit new york, I have been to new york before and stayed, with not so much of a good experience unfortunately. This time I was taking my wife, this was her first time staying in new york and visiting since she was 5yrs old, so she was really excited. This hotel came as an option and I decided to give it a try,I wasn't expecting much since the couple times I visit New York before I never had a good experience in any hotel, but oh man was I so wrong about this hotel, thinking it was just another just ok hotel. Since the time we arrived everything was smooth, great service. The room was nice, the bed big and comfortable. Another couple went with us but stayed at a different hotel, and they wished they stayed at out hotel. Caitlin was awesome at customer service, answering questions checking on us, as well as Angel who helped us out even after we checked out, and their manager Amber. We are planning on going back and we will definitely be staying here again.

Thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. Rooms were probably the biggest we’ve had in NYC without spending up for a non-standard guest room. Everything was simply but elegantly styled with dark colors and touches of leather and brass here and there; great retro-modern vibe. Felt very much like a boutique hotel, which we always appreciate over a cookie-cutter upscale chain option. Staff was very friendly, and Moisey and Paolo in particular were great. Helped us find a late-night drink at check-in even though their bar had just closed (11:00 on a Thursday felt a tad early to us, but then we appreciated the quieter lobby on subsequent nights). We didn’t visit their attached restaurant and bar during our stay since we were always headed out to visit friends in other neighborhoods, but it looked nice and we are a little bummed we never slowed down enough to grab a drink at the small but enticing bar. We look forward to returning in the near future and enjoying more of their amenities, like the cute cruiser bikes available for check-out (in a few weeks, they’d be perfect to take to Battery Park and/or go on a longer ride to Riverside Park). Very conveniently located near the Fulton Street subway station, too.

Location is mixed based on where you're trying to get to.Service overall is pretty good. Check-in host was friendly (although my digital check-in didn't complete and he had to run through the whole process). The check-in sparkling wine glass is a nice touch (not sure if they always have it).The attached brasserie looked interesting but wasn't open late enough when I arrived.The lobby furnishings are nice though certainly not luxury - more boutique.As with almost all NYC hotels (perhaps aside from the Conrad that's all suite), rooms are tight. But they are functional.Biggest complain was no in-room coffee. I know not everyone needs it but for me it's a must.

The Hotel is very nice. The staff contacted me before I arrived and asked if I needed anything. They responded very quickly with answers to my question. Angel at check in was very helpful. The prosecco at check in is nice Wall Street area is not very active on the weekends. So you would have to travel to get to more lively neighborhoods .The room was clean and spacious enough for me and my wife. The decor works, it is definitely masculine. I would stay again. So if you have business on Wall Street it is worthwhile, or if you want a quiet neighborhood on the weekend consider the gild. Subway is very close.

Everything was beautiful will definitely be coming back the front desk was very helpful as well as the bartender made me and my boyfriend the best cocktails we’ve had in a while and I love presecco I’m the walk in

First but not last stay in this gem of a hotel. Nice vibe at check in plus a glass of Prosecco. Nice sized room and bathroom; plenty of space for suitcase and work area. Most importantly the bed was very comfortable. Breakfast was a joy; no buffet but you chose from a menu. Very nice experience; give it a go!

My friend and I recently stayed at the Gild Hotel, during a 4 day trip to New York City. We were very impressed with the hotel. The hotel is quaint and has a cozy feel, and the hallways smell so good, not musty like some hotels. Our room was very decent size and the bed was comfortable. I must say, however, that what made our stay so enjoyable was the wonderful people at the front desk. Angel, Ciarra, and Amber went out of their way to be friendly, and gave us excellent tips and pointers for navigation. They also recommended a restaurant (The Crown Shy), that was literally right around the corner and had the most amazing food I have ever enjoyed in a restaurant. I will definitely stay here again when I return to New York City.

This hotel is just gorgeous - modern, sophisticated with a warm and friendly staff. It's close yet far from the hustle of the financial district. And Felice is a must ---the food is excellent and accommodates all diets.
user_name:
michellebenedict2020
Point Pleasant Beach, New Jersey

review_body: Work brings me to NYC about once a month and I always stay at Gild Hall. The service is fantastic, especially by Angel, a front desk agent. He remembers my name and my preferences, is quick with friendly conversation or a recommendation for dinner, and makes the stay much more pleasant. The rooms are clean and comfortable, with space to sleep, work and lounge. The other staff - like the room service staff and cleaning staff - is also kind and welcoming. And the restaurant in the lobby area, Felice, is delicious. It's hard not to eat there every night!

This hotel is fairly low frills, but nice, clean and comfortable. I like that it has a small, boutique feel and the employees were very friendly. The bathroom was nice and the bed very comfortable. My only reservation in giving it an even better review was that it was a bit noisy. I could hear people talking in the hall a few times during the night.

Everything was near perfect only minor imperfections but service is unmatched in comparison with other hotels and service is unique and genuine as if it’s their own unique swagger that stands out from any other hotel
user_name:
brandonanthonysteele
New York City, New York

review_body: Extremely please with the level of customer service received. Angel check us in and was very attemptive. He even remembered my name when my spouse and I checked out. The beds and pillows were a dream!Thank you

We enjoyed our stay at Gild Hall. Room was warmly designed, reasonable size, clean and reasonably quiet. Staff was kind and attentive. We didn't eat here, but restaurant looked good. Location was on a quiet street but walking distance to good food and subway.

My husband and I stayed at Gild Hall. Great location! Walked Brooklyn bridge and close to South Street Seaport. Angel and Ciara were awesome. Angel constantly going out of his way to make our stay perfect!!

I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. Gild Hall is a boutique hotel located in the Financial District. Even before we arrived, we were greeted with a nice text message from the hotel saying how excited they were for our arrival and wanting to know if there was anything we needed to prepare for our visit. We travel with our dogs (who are fashion models and model in NYFW) and it is always a pleasure to stay at a hotel that embraces our canine pals. A BIG bonus is that they do not charge a pet fee. One of my pet peeves when traveling with dogs is that the hotels tend to give you a ‘worn-out’ room, not at Gild Hall!! Our room was pristine! Beautiful all the way around including a gorgeous high ceiling. Staying at the Gild Hall was so amazing. Everyone knew our name and our dog’s names. We were welcomed by Robert with Prosecco upon check-in and complementary Prosecco every afternoon. After we settled into our room on our first evening, we got a knock at our room door. When I opened the door, we were presented with a lovely fresh fruit bowl, artisan water, glasses, 2 water bowls for the dogs, and the most beautiful card from the hotel staff with an illustration of our dogs done by Caitlyn in the front office. Another shout out to Caitlyn is how she went above and beyond by recommending a car service for us from the airport. Let’s just say these folks went out of there way to make our stay so welcoming and we will be returning on our next stay!!!! Love you all!!!

Everything was very good, except I could have done without the sex toys and accessories. What was the point of that? Otherwise, the room was clean, bottled water was relatively inexpensive for the financial district, and food at felice was convenient, tasty and wholesome.

Staff was super friendly, very clean, good size room, extremely comfortable beds. door/wall between bedroom area and bathroom was a frosted class with a pull curtain, nice from a decor perspective but with a family of 4 I would have preferred a regular door and wall. Multiple garages for parking nearby in addition to the hotel parking.

We stayed here for 3 nights as a NYC and Transatlantic cruise holiday for my friends 50th. I have to say on arrival (once the taxi managed to find it!) you do think where on earth are we staying! The street doesn’t look the prettiest! Once inside, a nice welcome with a glass of prosecco and we were quickly in our room. By NY standards it was pretty big, 2 decent sized beds, enough wardrobe space for a few nights and a decent sized bathroom. It was also pretty quiet. We had both been to NY before so wanted a different area/viewpoint. I really enjoyed it around here, very close and very easy to get to Ground zero, seaport, lots of cafes/restaurants/bars, pizza places, underground on your doorstep and also, only 15 minutes to Brooklyn cruise terminal for our cruise back to the Uk (usd35 in an Uber). We didn’t eat or drink in the hotel as with it being December, the bar was full with what seemed to be xmas do’s/nights out so I will try again next time I stay. Also, everything worked well so didn’t really speak to any staff apart from check in/out but those that we did speak to were lovely. Overall, great value and location. Definitely one to stay at next time!

This hotel was the choice for the wedding we were attending.. We got a great rate that the hotel also extended to our 3 day earlier arrival for our NYC sightseeing days.I do not have experience with NYC hotels... I thought the room was small and there wasn't sufficient drawer space (I'm one of those travelers that does NOT live out of their suitcase!).The bed was very, very comfortable. We slept really well. We were never bothered by any outside noise. Loved the reading lights over the bed.The hotel was easy walking distance to the main things we wanted to do: Statue of Liberty, 9/11 Memorial & Museum and walking over the Brooklyn Bridge. Walking was easy up to the Highline. We also had no trouble walking north to the Empire State Bldg (on Valentine's Day!). Many options for meals surrounded us, but I think that is the case with any hotel in this city. There are restaurants everywhere!The staff was fabulous. Very friendly and polite, always eager to assist you in any way.The complimentary glass of wine when we arrived was MUCH appreciated.Minor issue with tub draining, but staff took care of it as soon as I contacted them.

Thought customer service was a lost art? So did I. Then I stayed at Gild Hall for a business trip. Every single staff person (housekeeping, restaurant, check-in/check-out) was friendly and welcoming, from the glass of prosecco at check-in, to the host who created space for me at the bar, to the delicious veal meatballs, both my tummy and spirit were satiated. I came for business, but my stay was a pleasure!

Great look and vibe. Beautiful property. Bar was great and the bar tenders made it such a great time every night. Location is a little far from uptown major attractions but close to one world and memorial. Great place

The whole hotel was a great experience and I did use the exercising room all but one day and it was very nice. I really came to get married there and we did, my wife said she wants to come back too thank you very much for all of the hospitality we received and kindness and love

Charming staff in this gem of a hotel on a quiet corner in the financial district. Rooms are well designed, clean and quiet. Great beds/linens. Breakfast in the dining room is wonderful, as are drinks in the lobby area bar. Wonderful hotel. Wonderful staff. I will return!!

I travel to NYC with regular frequency for work and stayed in Midtown for 8+ years. When my company recently relocated its offices Downtown I set about to find my new 'home away from home', coming across this little gem on my third trip. The hotel staff are unfailingly polite, friendly and attentive. In particular, Amber, Robert and Caitlin have gone out of their way to make me feel welcome and are already addressing me by name (I've now stayed three times). This alone sets them apart when compared to the two other hotels I tried nearby. The location is off the beaten path and has more of a neighborhood feel, which means a laid back vibe, quiet rooms and a good night's sleep. The rooms are cozy and well-appointed and what I would refer to as standard size for Manhattan. It's a very short walk to Wall St. and the subway and there are plenty of food and shopping options nearby. There's a popular Zagat-rated restaurant Italian restaurant and bar off the lobby that I look forward to trying during future trips. It's affiliation with Hyatt is an added bonus and distinct from other boutique hotels. In short, I highly recommend this hotel for your next trip to NYC and don't believe you'll be disappointed.

I travel to NY all the time and Gild Hall is my absolute favorite place to stay. The rooms are giant for the price, the bar and restaurant (Felice) are top notch, and the hotel employees couldn't be more friendly and helpful. I love the books in the rooms -- always nice in case I forget something to read. In particular, Angel at reception is a gem -- he always remembers me and is fantastic about making the hotel seem like a second home!
user_name:
lisacX2475FH
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: This was a very chic hotel located just blocks away from a subway stop as well as lots of wonderful restaurants. It's easy to get from here to essentially NYC landmark you'd want to visit. The staff was helpful and responsive, and they really went the extra mile to make our trip memorable. When I called ahead to tell them we were celebrating our recent engagement, they sent up a treat to the room after we had checked in! I highly recommend this to anyone looking to stay in lower Manhattan.
user_name:
mcclearks
New York City, New York

review_body: It is a wonderful hotel. It is located in a quiet neighborhood at night. The receptionist is warm and sweet. The room is clean and neat. I like 10 feet ceiling and retro design. The bed is very soft and comfortable.

If you want to be wake up at 6am due to construction (weekends included) this is the perfect hotel for you. The hotel was conveniently located in the financial district. Short walk to 1 World Trade Center and Battery Park. $10-15 uber/ taxi to Time Square.

Excellent service and incredible restaurant at this hotel. The rooms were very clean but were rather dark inside due to the interior design. We really enjoyed our stay here because of the staff. They were incredibly helpful and very friendly!!!! Will stay again.

Happy of my stay, and I’ve really appreciated the assistance of the staff.Personally I’ve found heating system very noisy - It was waking me up during the night - so I had to turn it down... which means that mornings were a bit cold in my room-:(

Wonderful find if your looking for boutique hotel downtown warm and inviting in every way. Bar and restaurant great addition to our stay. Staff helpful in detailing things to do in the area breakfast at Hole in the Wall two blocks away was an added treat.
user_name:
kenr745
New York City, New York

review_body: Lovely boutique hotel convenient to just about all you'll need. If you don't feel like going out, the onsite restaurant and bar will suffice. Across the street is a pub that will do you'll do well by also. Want more? Ask the front desk. There's too much around for me to go into it. Staff is friendly, helpful and polite. I have been staying here for years whether on business or with my family. (Hint: Getting a suite is a good idea and worth the extra $$$).

This was our first stay at the a Gild Hall! It was recommended by a friend and it lived up to his recommendation. The staff was excellent, the rooms clean, very well appointed and had a modern yet traditional flavor. I’d happily book here again.

Having stayed at Hyatt properties across Manhattan for both business and pleasure I can say with certainty that Gild Hall is in a league of its own – stylish, modern, and welcoming – this property offers a uniquely personal experience that’s hard to find in New York. Located in a quiet and charming neighborhood in the heart of the Financial District. Gild Hall is conveniently located to all the lower Manhattan attractions and the Brooklyn Bridge. The guest rooms were spacious, clean, and accurately depicted on the website. The staff at the property checked in with us regularly via text message. Upon request our needs were promptly attended to and we were never made to feel like we were asking for too much. We were truly sad to leave at the end of our stay and look forward to an opportunity to return visit again in the future.

The staff in this hotel are amazing ! Rob at front desk greeted us with Champagne and chatted with us. The room was clean and specious for NYC hotels !! Good vibes in the lobby. Professional staff and fun place to relax and unwind. Thank you all.

Centrally located, allowing access to financial district, the east river, 911 memorial, and shopping. The hotel restaurant is above reproach, excellent food with a gracious staff. One of the best wedding photos was in the hotel's lobby.

Hotel is an interesting boutique play. Room was nice size and good condition. Furniture was eclectic. Some service issues (bathtub didn't drain and had to be serviced). Forgot towels in room after housekeeping serviced room.

Nice boutique hotel. Was greeted by Amber who was terrific and upgraded us after a short convo where I mentioned that my wife and I were celebrating our 20 year anniversary. She recommended the in-hotel restaurant Felize, and we could t be happier that we took her word for the quality of restaurant that the place wound up being. Would stay here again. Thank you Amber.

Good things about Gild Hall:- High ceilings- Next to good coffee (Blue Spoon and Voyager)- Interesting and unique atmosphereCons:- Nothing that distinguishes them against anyone else aroundI need to fill this review up to 200 words, but since I feel I got to the point pretty quickly above, I'm just filling space here.

We were weary from traveling all day when we arrived, but Moisey's warm and cheery greeting propped us right up. We found the room exceptionally comfortable and clean. The bed mattress was firm, which we like, and we fell right asleep. We took a long nap and nearly missed our show... But easily fell right back asleep when we got back to the hotel. Highly recommend!

Celebrating a special occasion at this boutique Gild hall part of Hyatt product, lovely and staff can’t be nicer, received a message from Kristen to see any special request for the stay as I am a globalist status. Upon arrival, Kristen had arranged a nice upgrade to one of the best suite and a bottle of bubbly was sent up.An excellent boutique hotel in the Wall Street area and staff can’t be nicer.A true recommended boutique hotel in the Wall Street area.

My girlfriend and I celebrated our six year anniversary at Gild Hall. Upon entering, we were greeted with a warm welcome. Caitlin, the assistant office manager, asked what brought us there and we told her it was our anniversary. After check in and dropping our bags off, we got a bite to eat. Upon returning, we found a hand illustrated card under the door with two drink vouchers at the hotel-restaurant with a handwritten note. Not only does this place exhibit a pleasant atmosphere, but the employees are just as delightfully pleasant. For all of our future visits, we will be booking at Gild Hall. The atmosphere of warmth displayed by the staff and hotel itself is well worth your time. Additionally, the price was a steal for the quality of the room. I have only been to one nicer hotel room, and the price ran triple of the one at Gild Hall. Do yourself a favor, and book here.

This hotel clearly goes out of its way to make the guest feel taken care of. Amber at the front desk greeted me with a smile and I was delighted to know I was able to check in early before heading up to see To Kill a Mockingbird. Amber was an efficient and welcoming beginning to our stay. We opted for a stay in the financial district because our son lives nearby.The hotel is very clean, rooms are designed well. Our room was one of the smaller ones, nevertheless it was beautifully appointed. The restaurant Felice was great for breakfast as well.Robert ( Roberto) at the front desk was wonderful too. He seemed to be on duty on a 24/7 basis. When I had a glitch with my bill after arriving home, I called and there he was. It was resolved right away. Thank you, Robert!Many complements to Gild Hall for a terrific stay.

Christmas-season weekend getaway. It was great to be in Wall St area to escape the madness of midtown. Hotel was very nice and people very hospitable. Nice to be offered a prosecco at check in. Would reserve again.

I stayed at Gild Hall for NYE and walking into the hotel lobby made me feel like I was transported into another world. It felt so cozy and warm while keeping a classy vibe. The front desk staff--Simon, Caitlin, and Anthony--were extremely helpful in answering my questions and accommodating me and my dog into our hotel room. The hotel dog (?) was an adorable golden retriever called Maya, who is in the photo I've posted. She definitely added to the whole hospitality experience. The lobby itself was beautiful, with leather couches and candles on the tables with an antler chandelier that hung from the ceiling. I settled myself into my room that had a king-sized bed. I was pleasantly surprised to see that the staff had provided two bowls for my dog for food and water. There was a full length mirror right by the door so that I could get one last check of my outfit before I stepped back out. The mini-bar was fully stocked but I had already made a reservation for the restaurant downstairs, Felice. The bed was huge and the pillows were nice and plump, with crisp, clean sheets (as expected). Mina, the restaurant manager of the night, was so inviting and made me feel as if I were truly a guest at her own home. I sat at the bar for my dinner and the bartender (sadly I forgot her name) made some delicious drinks for me. Even though she was hellishly busy as it was NYE, she spent time to speak to me and find out my likes/dislikes to make sure that she makes a drink that would fit my palate. Later on in the night, I wanted another towel to use and Simon was so pleasant and polite over the phone, regardless of the fact that it was around 3AM. He made me feel like my small towel request was such an important one. Amber was also courteous during our interactions. Overall, I'd definitely recommend a stay here. Also, the complimentary prosecco was a plus :)

For the record, I reached out directly to the hotel before posting here. However, I didn’t feel that their response was sincere and acceptable, especially as a Hyatt Explorist status. The very least they could have down was return my point redemption I used for this as it was a waste. Instead I received an insincere email offering a discount next time I want to chance staying there again.My stay here was marred by a series of small incidents that ultimately led to a very disappointing and uncomfortable stay.First, while taking a shower, the water repeatedly stopped flowing every minute or so, leaving you standing there with no water for several seconds at a time before spitting back out. Also, there were dirty room service plates and trays littering the hallway which was very much a turn off. I understand that it may take time to clear these away. However, they were all present when we checked in and still there the next day when we checked out. There was a pile of dirty plates and utensils right in front of 188 as soon as we exited the elevator and more l scattered near the electrical room door directly across from our room. Being this is a NYC property, space is a premium and several times I had to cautiously navigate my suitcase around these as not to make an even bigger mess. Next, I realize that Gild Hall can not control the behavior of other guests but our room was next to the Penthouse which was occupied by a family whose children were repeatedly screaming, fighting and running around. What Gild Hall can control is the insulation and soundproofing of their rooms. We were woken up repeatedly by the shriek of screaming children and fighting. On top of that, Gild Hall has the most uncomfortable pillows I have ever experienced, they are very flat with no head support. In addition, we found the air conditioning system inadequate. I realize that the system must be turned to heat only for the Winter months. However, it left the rooms stuffy and too warm with little opportunity for relief from the stifling heat.

Really friendly front desk staff and good atmosphere / vibe in the lobby. Room was very nice and modern and room service is available if required. Plenty of food options available locally and close to all lower Manhattan attractions.

We stayed at Gild Hall for a family and friends get together and we were extremely happy with the accommodations. The location of Gild Hall was one of the reason why we chose to stay there. The free prosecco was just a little extra treat that we all enjoyed. The decor and the library in the lobby along with the board games was also very enjoyable. In the future we will consider staying in another Gild Hall hotel. Thank you for providing an enjoyable experience.

From the minute we stepped on the property we felt special. The front desk staff was wonderful. The room exceeded our expectations. The restaurant had great prices and food. The staff called us by name when we returned from a walk.

I like the location since it’s in the financial district since it will be less busy on the weekend. Walking distance to the WTC and Brooklyn Bridge. The local pubs and restaurants are great. The hotel staffs are fantastic, very helpful and knowledgeable. The room is clean. The hotel is in a small street so perfectly for sleeping. Overall, having a great stay.

Great little find, just off the beaten path, but oh so close to everything downtown NYC offers. Warn, inviting lobby and attentive staff began the trip. Great clubby but welcoming feel to the adjacent bar area and a restaurant that looked superb. (Alas, our plans were already made for dining). Room was comfortable, well equipped and spacious. Bathroom was clean, modern and elegant. A fine alternative to the usual chain hotels.

The hotel staff is gracious , courteous and efficient - Knowledgeable about local restaurants and attractions. Inviting, comfortable lobby is a warm and welcome contrast to it’s Financial Distric location. Only a short walk to the Brooklyn Bridge, Battery Park, the NY Stock exchange, Charging Bull, the Trade Center Memorial - from this hotel, we walked them all in a single afternoon.

Great hotel! It's a very nice boutique hotel. Ask for a room with the high ceilings. :)We had a small VIP corporate event with rooms and a dinner in Felice for 13. It's an upscale, quaint atmosphere that I truly loved. We travel the world and stay in all kinds of hotels and I would recommend this one. Felice is a smaller restaurant so you better like the people you are dining with, but it's a nice change from huge dinners with the same atmosphere and same menus. The food is very very good and the staff is wonderful. Both hotel and Felice staff were great to work with.

Stayed here first weekend of December. Room was cozy, perfect for our small family of a couple with a little baby.The bar in the lobby had a lively crowd, though we never checked it out. The lobby elevator was a little slow, but not a big deal. Only inconvenience was when we arrived early Saturday morning, we had all our luggage with our outerwear. We were traveling from Miami, so naturally we needed to change into clothes for a 29 degree weather day. We were told to use the second floor restroom where we had space. After being there a few minutes, a gentlemen who said was the hotel manager (Male - about 5'7 , with glasses and what sounded like a french accent) told us we had to get out because there was a baby shower they needed to prep for. If we would have known this prior, we would have moved somewhere else where we can change peacefully and patiently (especially with a two year old)Overall, I would be back if given the chance. Thank you for everything GILD HALL team.

Stayed here for one night. Really liked the decor, this place has an old clubhouse / library feel to it, with leather seating and books going up the staircase. As the first time staying at a Thompson as a Hyatt Globalist, I am happy to report that the property really does honor the World of Hyatt benefits. Caitlin the manager, and Angel at the front desk really did a great job addressing my requests. They made it clear that on the award stay valet parking would be free, that I had a free breakfast, and they even managed to score me a great upgraded room.

We stayed there for one night only. The hotel is centrally located in the financial district next to the FED. Check-in was vers friendly and fast and we were served a glass of sparkling wine as a welcome drink! The room was nicely designed, but not very spacious. Nevertheless I would choose this Thompson hotel again in the future!

I travel to NYC frequently for work and will never again stay anywhere else if I can avoid it. The staff here is amazing. The decor is stylish and the restaurant superb, as is the bar and in-room dining.

My husband and I just returned from our anniversary trip to NYC and found this little jewel of a hotel thru our Hyatt membership. Gild Hall is part of Thompson Hotels and is an extraordinary place to stay in the FiDi. The rooms are comfortable and classy, the staff was hands down some of the friendliest and most helpful we have had in our recent travels. Kudos to Caitlin Newman and the rest of the desk staff for a job well done. If you need a quiet, yet convenient place to stay in the financial district, we highly recommend Gild Hall.

Robert went above and beyond in solving a problem for me. He also is delightful. The hotel is lovely, nicely appointed, quiet with attentive service. This is my second visit here, and I intend to become a regular.

Gild Hall is almost easy to miss when viewing from the street. The property is nestled close to Wall St and the World Trade Center, but just outside the busiest parts of FiDi, providing a calmer atmosphere in a rather busy city. While the outside of the building is nondescript, the inside is absolutely gorgeous. The hotel is on the smaller side, but the rooms are quite spacious and well thought out. The staff is more than willing to go out of their way to help accommodate any needs you may have during your stay. All of the staff were incredibly friendly and polite, the rooms were clean, and the location is perfect should you find a need to stay in FiDi.

Nice small hotel. Rooms were rather small. I was told they did not have a computer for guests to use. Cost of a beer at the bar was $10!!! We were able to walk to the 9/11 Museum from the hotel and the subway.

Lovely hotel - couldn’t fault anything apart from the extortionate deposit and facility fee (WiFi, Prosecco etc - bit of a con for those who don’t drink) that we had to pay on our room, over £900 was taken from my Fiancé’s account. Discussion and explanation would have been nice before just asking for our card. Free upgrade on our room to a bigger room. $9 for a bottle of water again expensive and unnecessary. If deposit process/price was to be change we would definitely come back. This trip was extra special and will always hold a special place in our hearts as we got engaged at the Top of the Rock on Thanksgiving (a novelty for us Brits).

Was a great location for the Thanksgiving holiday. Walk-able to all the sites we wanted, 9/11, Pier 15 and museums in the area. Fulton subway close and a quick ride to uptown for shows and Times square. Plenty of nice restaurants and bars in the local area. Even a local grocery store steps away. Rooms were well appointed and very comfortable. Could maybe do without the glass door to the bathroom, but not a major issue. Staff was very helpful and prompt. Recommend it over the larger hotels.

We had a wonderful stay and appreciate how welcome the staff made us feel. We would definitely stay here again! The room was lovely and the location was also very convenient for our time in NYC! Thanks again to the staff!

The hotel is not that big but it is conveniently situated, close to One World Trade Center, Wall Street and Seaport and good restaurants among others. When I entered the door, I commented to the hotel check-in staff, "I could not believe why Hyatt bought this hotel because of its size", no harm intended of course because I am used to bigger Hyatt hotels. After some time, I realized that in this location real estate is a prized-possession and you do not expect a large-sized hotel. The rooms are reasonably sized, the staff is friendly and very helpful and these together made our(me and my wife) 2-night stay pleasant and enjoyable. I have to thank the following hotel staff, namely: Paolo, Caitlin, Robert, John and Christian for welcoming us and helping us in various ways- where to dine, places to see, etc.

The Gild is by far the best hotel for me whenever I visit NYC for business. The rooms are nice and clean. The staff is great. Angel at the front desk is always helpful and knowledgeable of the local area. It’s always a great feeling when the staff ensures that you have a great time at the guild and the surrounding attractions. I will always try to stay at the guild whenever I’m visiting manhattan for work or leisure. The restaurant “Felice” is also an amazing Italian restaurant. Best in FiDi. Overall, great location, attentive staff, (thanks Angel), and great restaurant (Felice). Highly recommended.

Cool, lumberjack meets hipster themed decor. Lighting is low and subdued throughout the hotel for a mellow, chill log cabin vibe. Paolo, Angel and Christian were very hospitable and helpful with a genuinely friendly attitude. My only gripe was that I had arrived earlier than expected after taking a red eye flight from San Francisco. So I was a bit cranky. While the room was not ready, no one offered us so much as a cup of coffee, tea or even water to freshen up..... We were ask to leave our luggage and fend for ourselves in the freezing cold. I read that an online internet influencer known as the “points-guy” posted on his blog that as a Discoverist, he was offered coffee even when his room was not ready upon check in. When my room was not ready, I was welcomed as a Globalist but was literally shown the revolving door!

Recently stayed at Gild Hall and found my accommodations extremely disappointing. Certainly did not meet the standards I had been accustomed to at Hyatt.There was no bar soap in the bathroom, no coffee maker and no complimentary water bottles. The bed was made without a top sheet which is frankly disgusting. Hyatt paid lip service to my complaints and has failed to address any of my concerns. The lack of bar soap and top sheet has given me cause to rethink my loyalty to Hyatt.

Melissa and Leah were absolutely amazing! They were very patient and attentive to each and every detail. Staff were amazing as well. I received nothing but compliments of our guests that stayed at The Guild.

My husband and I arrived on Saturday 11/9. We dropped off our bags and tried to check in at 1:30(our room was ready at 3) There are plenty of sights to see and the WTC memorial is a 10 minute walk. The hotel lobby is compact, but has plenty of seating. There is also a decent size bar with a sassy female bartender that keeps everybody entertained. There is also an excellent Italian restaurant on site that is very busy with the locals. We had breakfast there the following morning and the menu had a lot of healthy options plus the everyday favorites. The avocado toast with poached egg was delicious.Our hotel room had a rich, sexy masculine feel with very high ceilings. There was a beautiful chandelier with a leather upholstered headboard. The bathroom had a sliding barn door. The staff surprised us with a bottle of Prosecco in our room and a card signed by the staff. This hotel is a good choice for couples. I will remind any Hyatt reward members that you may need to remind the reception desk of any perks that you are entitled to. I really enjoyed my stay and look forward to returning.

Quiet weekend in New York before the Holiday rush. Attentive staff at the Gild Hall. Breakfast in the Felice restaurant was quick, pleasant and delicious. Short walk to restaurants at Pier 17, South Street Seaport.

I'm staying at Gild Hall on business and came in on a Sunday evening. I was greeted by two lovely people, Amber and Christian who were so friendly and helpful. I had a long day and was given complimentary champagne and given printed directions to my meeting the next morning along with arranging a car back to the airport. The room was lovely and very cozy and I felt very comfortable staying here and will definitely be staying here in the future. Thank you for a great experience!

Gild Hall was a wonderful experience. From the moment I walked in for check-in with my SO, we were offered complimentary prosecco while waiting. Additionally, the lobby was clean, had a log cabin/library type of feel, the room was clean and lastly the staff were all very professional and pleasant. All in all, I felt that overall the experience was much better than I had anticipated. I had never stayed in a Thompson Hotel previous to this experience, but I intend on doing so in the future.

Gild Hall is a lovely boutique hotel close in proximity to the 9/11 museum and the World Trade Center.It is a very warm and inviting hotel with a very friendly staff as well. Felice is an exceptional Italian restaurant with authentic Tuscan cuisine. Everyone is thoughtful and considerate

After realizing I had forgotten my belt, I went to the front desk and Moisey, Rushika, and John helped me avoid disaster. They found a belt in lost in found and even pounded another hole in the belt so it would fit. Great service. Thank you!

We have stayed at this hotel in the past and were very happy, until this recent visit. Totally unexpected from a such caliber hotel. Under a chair in the bedroom we found a used condom. I ran to the bathroom and puked from disgust. I cannot believe the cleaning crew let this happened. Makes me think how clean were the sheets we slept in. In the morning, i mentioned it to the guy at the front desk, and saw his disbelief and shock, even though it was very embarrassing for me to talk about it. This experience has completely ruined our stay, leaving us disappointed. It would be very difficult to consider to come back.

For a weekend visit to NYC this hotel was great. Upon arrival we were greeted with complimentary champaign which was a nice way to sit and relax after we arrived. The front desk staff were friendly and welcoming. The lobby has a unique "reading room" decor with custom built leather seating, couches, bookshelves and plenty of small tables for small gatherings. It is open to the bar and restaurant so there was a nice balance of lively chatter in a comfortable and warm setting. The rooms have unusually high ceilings for a hotel which made them feel spacious. This boutique hotel is located within walking distance of the 9/11 museum and the Brooklyn bridge. Parking was by valet. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this for a weekend respite from the workweek, but it's location is right in the financial district so if you are on business, this is a great location.

The hotel is a unique experience with a wonderful restaurant in the lobby. A boutique hotel ...and a cut above all the rest. I must also point out the staff, especially Angel the front desk staffer, are the best I've encountered in many years.

We book this hotel every couple of months via Hyatt. It's a good value if you're a Hyatt member. Best in the City. Good restaurant and staff. The rooms are a little small and I've never been upgraded, but we always have a great stay.

I will cheat and combine with Felice, the onsite restaurant.From the time of booking to time of departure the hotel front desk staff members were friendly and helpful. Rob helped me most of the time. I was recognized by name, from checkin to departure. My car arrangements from LGA and back were taken care of by the hotel staff, nice job. The public spaces and rooms are tastefully decorated and comfortable. The room was quite large by NYC standards. Nice bathroom, interesting and comfortable furniture. Bed and sheets very comfortable, high thread count sheets. Closet was adequate for 1 person for a few days but would be small for 2 or for more days. HVAC appeared to be the ubiquitous earth friendly or perhaps hotel electric bill friendly stuff that cycles off if it senses lack of motion - possibly vacant room. Or maybe it just liked to swing up and down in a wide range. I was OK with it. Loved the food at the onsite Italian restaurant, Felice. I sampled breakfast, lunch, dinner, all excellent. Restaurant staff worked me even when they had good crowds and reservations in the books, bravo.I highly recommend this hotel and the restaurant, Felice.
user_name:
Steve B
Richmond, Virginia, United States

review_body: We had a fantastic stay at the Gild Hotel. We were there for 12 nights and the front desk was fabulous and specifically, Kristen, Amber, Christian, John, Daniel and Angel. The room was great. The free preseco every night is a nice touch. The restaurant and bar are always busy. The entire staff was very accommodating to all of our requests. A real gem of a hotel in NYC!

From the wonderful welcome and efficient check-in and gracious treatment honoring our anniversary (thanks Caitln Newman!) to the cozy lobby and great restaurant and bar therein, this hotel was perfect. Rooms were well sized for NYC, clean,quiet and comfortable.Can't wait to return.
user_name:
PT826
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: My husband, pup, and I had a wonderful staycation at Gild Hall this past weekend. The room was beautiful and comfortable, and we loved being able to have our dog with us. We ordered tapas and cocktails at the bar of Felice and were happily surprised at how delicious and fresh each dish was. We felt incredibly welcomed and appreciated by all the staff, including Caitlin, the front-desk manager who left us a beautiful card and cookies in our room and made sure to follow-up after our stay. We will definitely be back for another staycation and for a delicious dinner at Felice!

Stayed here for 2 nights for a business trip as I needed to be based downtown. Warm, friendly staff on check in and offered a glass of prosecco which was a nice touch. Room was stylishly furnished and on first appearance seemed very cool.- no bedside lighting meaning you have to get out of bed to turn lights on and off.- lighting was a little gloomy overall- no heating in bathroom and it was a little chilly in the morning..- no accessible plug sockets near bed The restaurant was fabulous for breakfast and dinner.With a little more thought into practicalities this could be an amazing hotel..

Overall I had a wonderful experience at Gild Hall! Upon checking in, the customer sevice was top notch. Matt one of the mangers was super helpful and kind. He upgraded our room to a deluxe room with a king size bed. That was super nice and expected! Angel and Simon both work the front desk in the evenings and late nights, both super accomodating and easy going. They were very helpful with NYC recommendations and turned me on to Leo's bagels, so good! When I mentioned to Angel it was our annivarsary, he offered us a free bottle of champaign! I will definitely be back!!

I've stayed many places in NYC (4-5 stars) & this place instantly jumps into the top 3, I have nothing bad to say & would definitely stay again, this was my first time here. There is Prosecco on check in! I've never had such a check in experience, Angel at check in was a major help throughout my whole stay, bathrooms water pressure is beautiful, the bed is super comfy & indulged in their quaint fitness center everyday of my stay. I stayed a Friday to Monday--I actually live in NYC, but the interior of this place gives you the vibe of a completely different country. 5000 Stars, I actually never even left a review on trip advisor is how good the stay was, see you all again soon LOVE Johnny OH and the food was amazing I actually just finished eating

The staff are truly nice here but somehow I expected more from this place after seeing the reviews. Maybe it’s the cold and gloomy weather outside or the financial district location, which makes everything darker, but I found the whole mood of this place not to be my favorite. My room seemed dark and creepy. High ceilings but little lighting so that the central light fixture dominated. I didn’t appreciate the lack of bedside lighting. The pleasant library area pictured in photos is not exactly secluded, being cheek by jowl with the restaurant, hotel entry area and reception. Wall radiator cycled on and off all night. No coffee makers or tea are provided. The restaurant personnel were lovely and food was good value especially the three course menu. Overall I much preferred staying at the Park South in NoMad if you’re looking for a Hyatt hotel. Better, central location and much more cheerful furnishings. I also much preferred their restaurant, Covina, which is more of a hotel restaurant while Felice has more the feel of a local gathering spot.

Gild Hall is a nice addition to the Hyatt chain. The downtown location is convenient to restaurants, stores and transportation. The Felice Restaurant is one of a very fine, of three, Italian restaurants of the same name. Active after work bar scene.

Loved the location, the area, the hotel, and the room, but what was truly special and impressive was the staff. Every time I entered the lobby via the revolving door or the elevator door, I was greeted by the friendly staff at the front desk. Robert P was friendly, professional and so accommodating. A guest can tell that the staff is very well trained, but the interactions at Gild Hall were actually sincere. I actually felt like a valued guest. It was not just training. Thank You Gild Hall for a fantastic to visit. We’ll be back!

This past weekend my spouse and had the absolute five star pleasure of staying at the Gild Hall in NYC. First thing we did when we returned home was post a review on trip advisor- giving five stars of course to the hotel, its warmth, chic interior and amazing staff. Then after posting, it dawned on us that we did not provide enough of a shout out to the team of employees that take this hotel over the top ... as they say "a pretty face without personality, does not make for a "10" . With that being said, Amber, Kaitland, Robert, Angel and Kristen give the Gild Hall its extra big bang making it a "perfect 10" in our book. Check out our earlier review which describes the total package. A definite five star experience.

The Gild Hall Thompson is now part of the Hyatt network and it’s definitely a worthy addition. My stay was great, from check-in (with complimentary Prosecco) to check-out and anything in between. The rooms are spacious with a high ceiling and a great vibe as far as design goes. The location is the hotel is very good as well if you need to be in the Wall Street area. Highly recommended

Nice location (short walk to Seaport area and Brooklyn Bridge), smaller hotel tucked away in a back street but close to many subway lines - get a good map because with so many subway exits/entrances it's easy to get lost. More boutique style than chain hotel, though I thought a little outdated decor. Music often a bit loud and constant through the public areas - no quieter areas to sit. Restaurant food good, bar good, staff pleasant and helpful - but tables get booked quickly. Chain hotel ownership obvious from expensive room mini-bar - competitors in the boutique style are either having free or normally priced ones. Would definitely stay again.

I love this hotel. It will be my go-to every time I visit the city. The staff is so welcoming and helpful. The decor and feel are a blend of european lounge with modern day finishes. The restaurant was exceptional. It also had one of the best mini-bars and in-room service I've ever experienced. Fabulous location; safe and stylish!

The hotel is nice, the gyms are claustrophobic, the room is very cool and big for NYC standards. You can get it all but the hotel offers a good relation price-quality. On the other side, I had a terrible experience from a service perspective. For the 4 nights I stayed at the Hotel no-one brought any water and I spoke up to 4 times with the front desk asking for this request but every time they said "Yes will bring it up". Never happened until the last day when they did a nice gesture to compensate. For a hotel that is costing you 12 hundred dollars for a weekend, it is imperative to have a good service.

Hotel met all expectations & the food and drinks were excellent. We had extra attention with the special drinks we ordered. Vieux Carre is not usual on the drink menu's. I highly recommend Gild Hall for your boutique hotel experience!!!

Great customer service and nice hotel to visit.Robert P. at the front desk was professional and congenial. He was a pleasure to deal with and he took great care of us; thank you Rob.The room was clean and tidy with space enough for both of us to feel comfortable in.

This was our first stay at this hotel for birthday and (a BIG) anniversary celebration. Front desk staff and management team members were superior and very welcoming. Room was with high celling, it was very airy, and very clean, practical spotless. We were impressed with the hotel and the Gild Team.

We had a great stay for four nights at Gild Hall. I absolutely loved the location—it is so close to nearly every subway line you could want. We felt the decor was beautiful and masculine, but in the best way possible. The only issue is that everything was pretty cramped. The bathroom is tiny, and there’s little storage space for anything. Overall, I would recommend this hotel!

The front desk is the heart-beat of any hotel...not so at the Gild Hall. Location, rooms, cleanliness all great...just don't expect service or a staff that cares about their guests. With so many options in New York at this price point I would recommend going elsewhere.

I stayed here on a Sunday to Monday. It was a beautiful hotel and the employees’ customer service exceeded my expectations. I was given a glass of white wine when I arrived (~8 PM) and checked in. Later on, I needed to print a few things but the printing room was closed so the front desk allowed me to e-mail to them to print. They also provided local stores when I needed help. I would 100000% recommend staying here. It was a great stay. There are minibar snacks and drinks in your room (for purchase) as well as additional things to buy (I.e. razor). The room was comfortable and clean. I had a great stay.

Loved this hotel! It's in downtown Manhattan, within a couple of minutes walk of underground. Rooms were spacious and really nicely furnished. Staff were extremely helpful. Great Irish pub just over the road serving amazing beer - need I say more?

I wanted to like this place more than I did based on the reviews.The room was very spacious, if dark, and the bar/lobby area was quaint/cozy.Problems (admittedly first world problems):The plug in our bathtub didn't work. First it wouldn't drain, then they fixed it, and then it wouldn't plug at all. And it was still wonky and didn't work properly after two visits from repair people. Also -- two adults, one almost thread-bare bath towel each. I had to ask twice for a couple more towels. The second time they just never showed up. If you're a four-star hotel, the towels should be of higher quality, and there should be two per person. People often have two showers /baths a day if they've been running around doing touristy things all day.The water bottles in your room are not complimentary, and that's not clear -- so understand you'll be billed more than 10 bucks a bottle if you drink it. We didn't know til we saw the charges on the bill.The hotel is very central to lots of great things to see, so location was stellar.

This was our first stay at Gild Hall, and I doubt it will be our last. We had nothing but top-notch service from every member of staff that we encountered; everyone was friendly, professional and happy to accommodate our needs. I wish I could name them all, but I do want to recognize Caitlin, Rob, Angel, and Daniel at the front desk/reception/lobby for their outstanding customer service, as well as our great housekeeper, Gona. Our room was a good size for NYC even though it was just a standard room, and the high ceilings really made the space feel large and luxurious. It was also fairly quiet for NYC, since the hotel is tucked onto a small side street. Overall we could not have been happier with our experience and wouldn’t hesitate to return.

We enjoyed our stay here. Easy to hop on many lines to get up to midtown or anything in between. Front desk staff was very friendly. Free Prosecco (only a Saturday thing?) from 3-11PM - we were blown away! Fun bar area and the rooms were ample size. If you are looking to stay downtown this is a great option.

When I think of a normal New York city hotel, I think of busy and unpersonel. This hotel is friendly and quaint even when sold out.We stayed in the King Suite. Love it when Prosecco is served @ checkin. The room was nice. The bed was comfy. My 25 year old daughter slept on the sleeper sofa and said it was fine. The bar had all the needed utilities to use it as a bar. Most rooms in NY are small. This room was not. Plenty of space to lay out for 3-4 people.Block and a half walk to subway (3 min). Short walk to One World Trade Center. Very low traffic directly around hotel. They recognized my daughters birthday and made her feel special. The front desk and staff made us all feel special. Breakfast was good and coffee was surprisingly good. Seems like in a world of coffee shops and good coffee, most hotels can't do it right. Look forward to visiting again.Thanks guys.

Stayed for a long weekend in the fall last year. Great location to walk to china Town, the 9/11 memorial statue of Liberty and many other attractions. The hotel is well maintained and clean, the staff courteous and helpful. The room/bed were very comfortable. Would re-book again if back in the big apple.

As this is the only Hyatt that can be booked using a free night certificate, we gave it a chance on our recent trip to NYC. The location is in the Financial area in lower Manhattan. This can be good or bad. It is very close to the subway and to TKTS downtown, however, it can be not as convenient location if one intention if more in the Broadway theater area.PROs:The hotel itself is beautiful despite the grabby location in which it is situated. Once you enter the building the design is modern and beautiful, which continues into the rooms.The staff is one of the best and personable ever. They seem to really like what they are doing, which says a lot about the hotel management. All of our interactions with the staff were above and beyond, and when they learned about the special occasion we had they responded with sending a gift to the room. It is the only Hyatt hotel that can be booked using a free night certificate in Manhattan. Hyatt status was recognized (although being an entry level, it was not much)CONs:The rooms are small, despite getting an upgrade the room was quite small (though probably not too small in NYC terms). I cannot even imagine how small the basic room is.There is a glass door between the bathroom and the room which means that you probably wake up your partner if you go to the bathroom in the middle of the night.All in all, it was a pleasant stay. I’m not sure we will be back considering the less than ideal location for us, but I would not hesitate to recommend the hotel.
user_name:
MDDCFlyer
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: As some previous reviewers have said, don’t judge this hotel by it’s surroundings. The hotel was great, the staff extremely friendly and helpful. After being a bit hesitant about staying in the financial district, it turned out to be a good choice. So close to battery point and the 9/11 memorial, a five minute walk to the subway station had us up to time square in a few minutes. The room was large, nicely decorated, quiet and very comfortable. Would definitely stay here again.

Not often do you find such personable service at a city hotel. Rob at the front desk went the extra mile. Special thanks also to VH and Joseph for their honesty in securing our lost valuables. Rare these days... The boutique hotel itself is a gem. Nicely decorated and conveniently located in the financial district; very comfortable (if room is away from the antique elevator) and the Italian wine bar has great wine and food. The champagne on arrival was so nice! Highly recommend!!

A good hotel within walking distance for all places downtown Manhattan. Very friendly and helpful staff made us feel most welcome. Nothing was too much trouble and Amber and her team added extras which made us feel more special.

Hotel in downtown. Only World of Hyatt cat 4 property in Manhattan. If you don’t judge a book by the cover and it’s surroundings, the Gild Hall is a lovely property once you’re inside. Unassuming lobby, comfortable rooms, old school decoration. Decent breakfast at restaurant Felice connected to the lobby.

Our stay at Gild Hall was incredible! The room was awesome and the front desk team led by Caitlin Newman was fantastic! I would highly recommend this property! The location is great and the hotel is very friendly and accommodating.

Great staycation in NYC and walking distance to lots - Seaport, SoHo, Chinatown, LES, etcVery clean hotel. Rooms have lots of character and the bed was super comfortable. Prosecco was given to us at check in! Overall a classy hotel with great, memorable staff.Only downer: the 3 gyms were all tiny
user_name:
washnews
New York City, New York

review_body: We had a wonderful experience at Gild Hall from start to finish. The staff provided a warm friendly reception, including easy check-in and freeProsecco. The environment and service were an added positive vibe to our weekend activities.

I stayed here on Hyatt loyalty and had high hopes this hotel would be at least better than average based on the reviews, but I was sorely disappointed.I don't often post hotel reviews, but my stay here turned into a comedy of staff errors and miscommunications that cost me half a day of vacation and nearly an incorrect charge that I only caught on my credit card statement.First, I asked if I could check in early and was strung along by staff for half the day that a room would be ready soon while nobody made any apparent effort to pass this along. I had just gotten in from a red eye flight and really wanted to freshen up and change if it was an option. Despite my multiple check-ins with multiple front desk employees and physically waiting in the lobby for 5+ hours while being told a room might be ready soon, I ended up finally being pinged for a room 30 minutes from guaranteed check-in with everyone else and waiting in line to get a room. I know early check-in is not guaranteed, but just TELL ME YOU AREN'T GOING TO DO IT! Don't keep saying maybe in an hour while I stay either inside the hotel or nearby, screwing up my whole day. Because it wasn't until very late that it was ready and they suddenly had plenty of rooms for everyone, it was obvious that the staff saying they would let me know as soon as a room was ready was not the case and they had in fact made no effort to get me in early even after seeing me clearly waiting within the line of sight of the front desk based on this information.Then, after confirming with the front desk that the bottle of water in the room was free to me as a loyalty member, they charged me $9 for one bottle and sent nothing to my email so I only caught the false charge on my credit card bill. Honestly, this was not a big deal at all compared to losing half a day at check-in, but still annoying that I was charged after getting explicit verbal confirmation that I would not be charged.All in all, the staff seemed super uncoordinated and either dishonest or non-communicative to let these errors occur. I can never get that half day of my vacation back, but hopefully this review will help you consider any number of great other hotels you have to choose from in NYC.As for the physical hotel and location, it is convenient to FiDi and WTC and well decorated inside, but note that every room basically just looks right into the apartment complex across the very narrow street.

When we checked in for a 3-night stay, we were told the reservations would be merged (had to be booked separately due to award nights being used). We have had to do similiar when booking Hyatt award nights in the past, and this was handled seamlessly at an overseas location. Also the prosecco mentioned in other reviews was not offered to us at check-in, but perhaps this is because we arrived late in the evening from our flight.The next day we had to return to the desk as our keys had only been coded for one night would not work. The second night we had to return to the desk as again our keys were not working. After having been out and about traveling all day we were very tired, and had to wait for 3 separate guests to be checked in before we could even alert the front desk that we had a problem. Then we found out our keys had been purposely deactivated because they thought we were supposed to check out that day and had just squatted in the room. If this were the case I think a phone call would have been appropriate instead of just locking us out. Then of course when we got our keys fixed and returned to the room it had not been cleaned at all. Very frustrating.The location of the property is very convenient and quiet at night, and the rooms are lovely- but based on our experience I'm not sure we would go back.

Really trendy hotel with nice deco. Location is great with 5 minutes walk to metro. Staffs show truly hospitality which, to be honest, is very rare in NYC hotels. Onsite restaurant is fantastic - I tried both lunch and breakfast and both were great.

One of Lower Manhattan’s best hotels, Gild Hall A Thompson Hotel is a sleek palace of hospitality with a dedicated staff and a wholesome, delicious breakfast menu. No mishaps, no trivial health issues, no cockroaches, no mean employees, ergo no complaints!

My family and I spent several days at Gild Hall. Moisey’s service was outstanding and made us feel right at home during our stay! Highly recommend staying here and make sure to ask for Mosey. You will receive first class service and want to extend your stay!

Wonderful! Front of house staff were not only helpful but could always tell us which mode of transportation was best for where we were going. They always took the time to ask our plans for the day and/or recommend something in the area.

Just completed my stay and it was enjoyable! My early check-in request was well noted and a room was ready at 8am when I got to the hotel via redeye flight from west coast - it was really appreciated! Kristen explained all the benefits of Hyatt elite membership which were all nice. She also offered to upgrade to a better room proactively when it became available later on the day. The bed was comfortable and the overall ambience was cool - nice change from standard Hyatt setting.Breakfast at Felice was good as well - it was very popular for Sunday brunch, looked like. I thought their prices were very reasonable. Stopped by the bar one evening, the server was very friendly and welcoming.It had nothing to with the hotel, but the construction right next to the hotel was bit annoying - especially when they started breaking asphalt before 8am on Saturday morning! I noticed some guests mentioned the hotel’s rather old AC system noise, but it actually worked for me as a favor to cover construction noise...lolThe location was convenient with the easy access to subway nearby.

First time staying at a boutique hotel and it was honestly one of the best hotel experiences I’ve ever had. Very sleek and room was very spacious and modern. Conveniently located in lower Manhattan near various restaurants, attractions and subway system.

I definitely felt like one of the cool kids staying at Gild Hall this summer. But I have to say, the best part of our stay was the customer service.Amber at the front desk was so welcoming when we arrived, smiling and making us laugh, greeting us immediately with two glasses of champagne!! She was so incredibly helpful! She gave us awesome recommendations for restaurants, things to do, shows to see and bars with great drinks! She really knows her stuff! Definitely ask her for recommendations when you stay there, she knows all the cool, up and coming local spots.She really made us feel taken care of, listened to and at home. So grateful to her for everything! We will definitely be back! Our home away from home. Thanks Amber! :)

Hotel and staff were excellent and accommodations were rustic, clean and cozy. Restaurant needs to address an issue with little nats flying around food and beverage. This was a window seat, but no excuse, there should be no nats at all and we had many flying around us and we were swatting them dead. Only complaint for our visit.

I stayed here for three nights. I had my family and we had a suite. It's a small hotel and very comfy and good feel to it. Staff is excellent, very efficient and professional!! The restaurant connects with a restaurant that serves a great breakfast and dinner!!Highly recommended!!

This hotel manages to combine elegance with comfort and warmth. The staff greeted me with humor and Proseco, dressed in their Untuckit shirts. The room was spacious with the hallways decorated with 1960s photos. The location manages to feel quiet, while being just blocks away from the major avenues and sites.
user_name:
Elizabeth A
Long Island City, New York

review_body: If could give this hotel 10 stars, I would. We encountered a warm welcome upon our arrival and while the room was not ready, Rob happily took care of our luggage so we could go about the city. Angel helped us with check in, and went out of his way to make us feel at home. He took time to give us recommendations for incredible dinner and breakfast spots. I was celebrating my birthday and his pleasant low key demeanor and extra care made my visit really special. The hotel itself was clean, smelled amazing and the location was perfect for our stay. I will definitely visit again!

After arriving to the hotel a little late due to flight cancellations, Amber made sure to turn my frown upside down. Thank you for being so kind to me and my partner and showing us how customer service should be done at every hotel. We will definitely be back to stay again!
user_name:
Jason G
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I received a $4,000 authorization upon check-in for incidentals...Given I was staying for 11 nights and my accommodation had been paid for, this equated to about $360 a night... I know the minibar is expensive at $9 for a bottle of water, but even then that is a lot of water!When I first notified the hotel I was told the amount would be 'swiftly' returned to me - it has now been over 3 weeks and I am still waiting for the money back. Honestly, this is not a trivial amount of money and could have ruined my trip to NY and has upon returning continued to cause me financial stress. The hotel has not been proactive in the matter and does not seem to be able to tell me with any certainty when I will get my money back...

We were staying overnight to bring our son to college just a few blocks away. This hotel is gorgeous! The staff is wonderful and very friendly. We will definitely be staying again the next time we’re in the city.

My husband and I enjoyed our stay at Gild Hall over Labor day weekend. The hotel was affordable and conveniently located. We were able to walk to the waterfront, the brooklyn bridge, battery park, and the 9/11 memorial and museum. We also walked to Tribeca for dinner. The room was a good size for a city hotel and the bed was comfortable. We would definitely consider staying here again.

Felt like an old hotel that had been lightly remodeled. Staff seemed young and inexperienced. More like a 3.5 star hotel; not bad just a bit short of expectations when compared with other hotels I've stayed at in NYC. Electric vehicle charger has been removed from the garage; website not updated.

This is my second time staying at Gild Hall, and as before, I was extremely pleased with the pleasant accommodations. Amber was professional and extremely knowledgeable about places go, things to do, see and eat in NYC. Rooms were a good size and very comfortable. A very nice, quiet environment. I will definitely consider Gild Hall on a return visit.

Nice hotel but crews drilling and cutting asphalt during the night made it impossible to sleep. The vomit, piss and human waste in the area was pretty gross. The businesses in the area should get together to help keep it clean.

Everything is great and rooms are big. Angel and Max is great in the morning and Simon and Anthony are at your service through out the whole night. Would come to stay again. Felice is amazing too and jubilee deli around the corner is great breakfast.

Upon arrival, my partner and I were greeted with glasses of Prosecco by sweet Simon at the front desk. Not a bad way to start a hotel stay! The lobby buzzed of activity, but everything moved efficiently. The room was beautiful. Perfectly appointed. Very spacious for NYC standards, and exceeded my expectations. We were in the room class that was just above a standard king. We stayed for 5 nights, and found the space suited our needs just fine. Housekeeping was prompt, and our room was serviced every day at our request. All of the ladies were awesome, but Rashika is an absolute standout! She was very helpful, and has such a warm personality.Unsure on how to spend one of our evenings, my partner and I spoke to Amber at the front desk. Amber is extremely knowledgeable and personable. She gave us stellar recommendations for dinner and live music!Gild Hall is an excellent choice for those seeking luxury without pretension or stuffiness at an incredible value. Gild Hall- we will be back again! xx

Nice place, quiet for this part of town, room was spacious and ambiance is nice in the whole hotel. Location in town makes it easy to walk anywhere in the Wall St. area, so you don't worry about traffic or too much noise.

Stayed here for 5 nights with my partner. Room was modern and very stylish with a huge TV. It was in a great location and close to the subway station and wall street/freedom tower. It was also very quiet at night! Staff offered us Prosecco upon arrival and were friendly throughout our stay.

This newly acquired Hyatt property has such a unique and warming atmosphere like no other. The staff was wonderful and went above and beyond to ensure our stay was pleasant. The location is removed from the hustle and bustle but close to subway station and many great eateries. We will definitely stay at this establishment again.

Locale great, service and attention to detail great. Definitely recommend this hotel! Easy walking distance to south seaport area, Brooklyn Bridge, and other LES spots. Front desk area very accommodating/helpful. Parking garage across the street, and your car is easily accessible to you at all times. Thompson is a terrific brand! The rooms were clean and spacious, with plenty of cabinet/shelf space for clothes. Bathroom was roomy enough as well. Three small but useful gyms onsite if you need a quick workout, and also offered passes to local big chain gym. Bar was nice, though we did not eat at the restaurant. All in all, a great place to stay for a weekend or for business .Would highly recommend it!

Wonderful hotel & service! Angel Rivera at the front desks is professional & friendly. Highly recommend Gild Hall, which makes this quite downtown address feel like a small town charm. Easy walk to the Brooklyn Bridge or to the wonderful bars & restaurants.

My stay at Gild Hall was an overall great experience. The staff was friendly and helpful, the room was clean and very well appointed, the service at the bar/restaurant was very good. It exceeded my expectations.
user_name:
garyhowardjr
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We loved this hotel. Comfortable, spacious and incredibly nice people! Would highly recommend this hotel in seaport area! Robert was the best and gave us excellent recommendations always with a smile! This note was left in our room the last night which made us feel special. Not many places do this anymore!

Went above and beyond. Excellent staff. Excellent food/drink. Great location. Easy to find garage parking. Comfortable/clean rooms. Walked our bags to our parking garage for us! Robert P. at the front desk was wonderful.
user_name:
kimcN5303NW
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Thoughtful decor and attentive staff. We were given a room on a high floor and heard no noise from other rooms or people walking in the hallways. Comfortable bed and pillows. We loved the prosecco welcome drinks when we checked in and check out was quick and easy. Will definitely come back and recommend to our friends.

Stayed here on a three night business trip. The hotel has a small boutique feel and is located on a small street in the financial district. Kaitlin checked me in and offered some of the best customer service ever. Having an employee like that on the front line made my stay 5 star. The hotel is clean and neat and my room was pristine and well tended. The restaurant serves breakfast from 7-11 am and has a very decent menu. I also had dinner and found the restaurant to be excellent by hotel standards. The lobby bar is lively at night and serves a local crowd as well as hotel guests. Hyatt did well by adding this hotel to there NYC list of properties..I will definitely return

I had never heard of this hotel before. But let me share that this was a unexpected joy while staying at this hotel while waiting for my New York Property to settle. Van Hallen was the best and most professional team member i have expperienced while in New York.My room was second to none. The total experience was a complete experience.Thanks Van Hallen and team!Carlton Pressley
user_name:
Carlton P
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Was a amazing hotel in a very good location everything you could need was just a walk away and all the people were very nice. The rooms made you feel at home, very clean, good ac. The front desk people were very helpful and took very good care of me and my girlfriend.

The Thompson recently joined hyatt and I was very excited to try it out. The staff recognized my status with Hyatt and offered a welcome drink upon my arrival. The breakfast was also complimentary and the food was good.
