Every detail was taken care of. The staff is amazing. Personal, friendly, make you feel like part of the family. The bar cozy, the food yummy... All was above average! The rooms are well decorated. Amenities are pleasant. Location is perfect for Le District, South Street Seaport, Stone Street...

Our daughters both live in FiDi, and we were coming into the city to visit and have dinner with them on a summer Friday evening. Found Gild Hall in the listing of Hyatt affiliated properties, and since this was the closest property to our daughter's and would allow us to walk around, we decided to give it a try. What a pleasant surprise! Though the hotel room itself was small (yes, I know it's NYC), it was well laid out, nicely decorated, and had all the creature comforts we wanted & expected.  And when we went downstairs for coffee/b'fast early Saturday morning, the weather was a bit unsettled so we decided to stay in and try the restaurant Felice'. Again, we were pleasantly surprised as the coffee, service, and food presentation/quality were all much better than average.

I’ve enjoyed the hotel evening Prosecco and check in staff were very attentive. I only spent one night there. Fast paced location however hotel is slightly hidden.I would consider returning as the hotel was in a good location and staff were overall great.

I stayed at Gild Hall for three nights. It's a super sexy boutique hotel, but I did have a few issues. Some inattentiveness by staff, and no AC in the lobby were my two main gripes (primarily because I had planned on working in the beautiful lobby/lounge area during my stay). To be fair, the lack of AC probably affected the general mood of everyone there, so it probably boils down to being in the right place at the wrong time. That said...I let my concerns be known at the end of my stay, and the manager followed up quickly with an apology and a more thorough explanation than I'd been given at the front desk. Hyatt also stepped in and, after verifying the AC situation, comped me one of the nights. Classy and appreciated. I'll definitely be back!

Friendly service excellent location close to World Trade Center, Ferries and Broadway . Many food and entertainment options close by. Big room with excellent furniture and bathroom. I particularly liked the reading chair with lamp

Between the small, narrow streets and the large amount of scaffolding on surrounding buildings, it's a bit hard to find the entrance. Look for the restaurant (Felice) on the corner--the entrance is just past it. Once you get inside, it's a lovely experience. Interesting decor, nice sitting spaces, helpful staff. I arrived quite late at night, with two back-to-back bookings, and Anthony at the front desk was able to arrange things so that I had to check out and check back at the desk, in but NOT move rooms, which was great. It's very convenient to several subway lines, and the hotel went and flagged a cab when I needed one.

We booked the Gild Hall because it was a Hyatt property and wanted to be in the financial district to be close to our daughter who we were visiting. The hotel was very swanky and provided great service. It was walking distance to a number of attractions and easy access to a subway stop. Would definitely stay here again!
user_name:
Heather R
Bowling Green, KY, United States

review_body: Gild Hall was amazing! The pictures on the site do not do it justice and the staff was wonderful. We will definitely return and are looking forward to it. If you are looking for a lovely stay with gorgeous accommodations then stay at Gild Hall.

Nice large King Suite but it had Leaking bathroom pipes, 2 stained bathroom towels on 1 occasion and personally we didn’t think the bed was very soft. Lastly, requested the mini bar to be empty upon booking but was placed in a a room with a fullly stocked mini bar plus it had full bottles of liquor stocked on the shelf. Likely won’t rebook

We were in town to see a family member and ran across this gem on the Hyatt website.From the moment we met Caitlin at the front desk until we checked out, every need we had was attended to. The room was clean and comfortable. We also had breakfast at the restaurant and we're impressed with the smoothies and healthy choices.We will stay there again!

I started staying in this hotel in May of this year. The attention that the give each guest is second to none. The front desk, Angel and Van Halen specifically, are phenomenal. The treats in my room every week is great. I will not stay anywhere else as long as I am coming to nyc.

Gild Hall is a charming boutique hotel tucked away in lower Manhattan. We loved our stay here. The decor is very different from other places and we loved it! They served complimentary prosecco all afternoon/night. Such a nice added touch! All the staff were so warm and helpful! Angel at the front desk was very helpful with recommendations and very pleasant to chat with. Overall, we loved our stay here!

a little hard to find , not on gold street as indicated, staff was terrific, rooms were nice sized , parking was directly across the street, close to the world trade center and ground zero, priced approiately, would recommend

Had a 3 night stay here. The hotel is a little bit away from the general tourist area and serves more of the CBD type client. The hotel is really nice, good decor throughout and a pleasure to stay in. Prices were pretty good for NYC, and it's central location meant most places were a short walk away. Room sizes were good although the bathroom was a little on the small size. In house italian restuarant was nice, with a good range on the menu. Staff were polite and happy to help. Would stay again.

One of my cousin's turned 30 and so we decided to do a night in the city (we live in NY) from the time you walk into this hotel the infectious personalities of everyone is so addicting. Rob checked us in, he was such a massive help and a delight but bonus was for his ease in making us laugh, the hotel is very fortunate to have such talent. He was the first face we saw when we walked in and was very helpful and funny! Kristen the front desk manager I'm so grateful and appreciate you for allowing Rob to upgrade us! Caitlin and Paolo for being so kind and generous! This place was simply amazing. The room was beautiful, clean, very close to transportation. It's a beautiful hotel in a busy area, tucked away it's the gem you need to be at. I am extremely grateful to everyone for making our stay a remarkable memorable one that we will never forget. Thank you so much!

Lovely hotel, nice staff. Great location for lower Manhattan, if you prefer Soho, TriBeCa and Nolito then this hotel ticks the boxes at a reasonable price. Stay here if you want to avoid the tourists and enjoy the better areas of NYC.

I am Hyatt Globalist member. As I checked into Gild Hall, the counter gave me a big smile: this is my first time see a Taiwan passport! I told him this is also my first Thompson.We laughed. And he offered me a glass of Prosecco.The room is very clean and comfortable. I enjoy every minute in the room. What I like the most is the library style of lobby. I am a book worm myself. This setting does intrigue me. It is indeed a pleasant surprise.Oh, the omelette at breakfast is superb.

Enjoyed Gild Hall a great deal. All staff friendly and courteous. Great location. Wife really enjoyed ambiance. Easy to walk to anywhere in lower Manhattan. Highly recommend. Popular restaurant in hotel.

Our stay was very pleasant and Angel was great at checking us in! The bar scene was also a nice touch to the hotel!...Will come again!...Glad the HYATT has added this to there chain of hotels!thank you!

The Gild hall was a brilliant place to stay while working downtown in New York. Friendly helpful staff. Glass of prosecco every evening as soon as you enter the hotel is a nice touch. Very convenient for the Fidi working people

We first had a hard time locating the hotel property. The front is not clearly marked so it wasn't obvious it's the hotel we were looking for. The main front lobby was dark and over crowded with stuff and things (not people). The check-in process was lengthy and uncomfortable. The room was small and dark too, not enough lighting. The bathroom door would not lock - the latch couldn't reach the opening on the door-frame.

I don't generally take the time to post reviews, but our recent experience at Gild Hall stands out. We wouldn't have found Gild Hall if it weren't for the Hyatt affiliation, but Hyatt is the real winner here. The location is fantastic and the lobby and guest rooms are tasteful and well maintained. However, what was most noticeable was an outstanding staff. We felt welcomed and valued by the patient and professional front desk staff. I can't remember the last time I said that. It was a great stay.

The staff at GILD Hall made the experience so pleasant and delightful. I give them a 10 STAR. The location and Restaurant Felice were amazing. Your are in the middle of New York and so peaceful. WE WILL BE BACK.

first name basis with front desk from arrival....so super helpful and accommodating! I felt like I would miss them when I went home. I recommend this hotel for location and service, and the bar is lovely!

Very nice, very clean and very complete hotel experience. Ideal if you need to be in Lower Manhattan. Not a lot of services, but everything one needs for a stay including good wi-fi, great beds, and spacious (for NY) rooms!

We needed a last minute reservation and Anthony had no problem helping us get situated. He was eager to help us and was also very nice and professional. He was also very friendly and understanding of our situation. I would highly recommend staying here.

The decor is nice and the main lobby is nice. But the rooms are old and the AC system is a nightmare - always too hot or freezing cold. (It appears to be an old-school heating/cooling system where the options are "off" or "full blast.") The toilet seat is damaged and the shower head is rusty - I don't even want to look at it directly. These things would be so easy to fix. But that has not been done. Yuck.
user_name:
Nicole28970
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We were so pleased with our choice of the Gild Hall hotel. The staff couldn’t have been more helpful and considerate. And the restaurant, Felice, was outstanding. Delicious food, excellent service, and one of the best managed restaurants we’ve seen in years. We will definitely return.
user_name:
susanmB4954MD
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I booked this hotel at the 11th hour for a last-minute business trip - as travel delays and additional work assignments cropped up while I was on the train to NY, my management whiplashed me with a schedule change - due to ANOTHER meeting the day after tomorrow, I'd have to cut my stay short by a day. I arrived at the hotel ~10 pm, exhausted, and with what I thought would be a difficult conversation with the hotel ahead of me. Instead, I was pleasantly surprised by the sympathetic and understanding front desk staff, led by Angel and his manager Van Halen. Although I arrived after the 24-hr penalty-free cancellation, they agreed to my request quickly and courteously, with a minimum of fuss - Angel, perhaps noting the weary look on my face, offered me a complimentary glass of prosecco as well. The room was extremely spacious by Manhattan standards, and when I returned to the downstairs lobby to finalize meeting deliverables for the next morning, I found the lounge in the lobby comfortable and welcoming as I wrapped up the last of my work. The area, and the hotel in general, merges old school elements (plush, oversized leather couches, reclaimed wood, antique bookshelves) with smooth metal and glass chic seamlessly. Although I was not here for pleasure, I do hope to return soon, and as a former New Yorker, I can attest as well to the hotel's convenient location, to downtown attractions such as Battery Park, Seaport, and the WTC, and a hop away from Fulton Street and swift access via subway to downtown Brooklyn and Midtown.

We were splitting time in Manhattan and Brooklyn and this hotel was super convenient to explore both boroughs. The room was clean, comfortable, quiet & relatively spacious. The welcoming glass of prosecco was a really nice touch. The front desk workers were very friendly and helpful.

Blocks from the Fulton subway station & World Trade Center, this hotel was comfortable, clean, and wonderful. The staff was friendly & helpful. Pricey minibar, but great local food nearby. My daughter and I loved it!

We LOVE ❤️ THIS BOUTIQUE HOTEL NESTLED IN MIDDLE OF WTC/South-seaport/BROOKLYN BRIDGE......Outstanding customer service from manager MAX STyles friendly & offered awesome suggestions where to go & PAOLO GARCIA WHO ANSWERED a million questions & gave my daughter gift of sparkling wine for her birthday & LUIS CHAVEZ who patiently helped our transportation needs & arranged for our UBER!...soooo great to stay here !...staff & rooms incredible....Yummy FELICE ITALIAN RESTAURANT IN HOTEL!!!

Unable and unwilling to bend over backward.Not impressed!Ps absolutely no check in until 3. Plan your day accordingly.Pps Temple Court, which is a short walk away, has interesting cocktails and amazing food.

I choose this hotel out of necessity for just one night, and wasn't expecting much. But upon arrival and after concluding our 1-night stay, it exceeded all of my expectations and will be added to my list of preferred Manhattan hotels. Here's why:1. Check-in was simple, the front-desk guys were professional and friendly, and they offered us a glass of Prosecco.2. The room was very big by Manhattan standards, very well-appointed and clean.3. The lobby area, which bleeds into the bar/restaurant was decorated wonderfully and was modern, yet cozy.4. The bar had great drinks reasonably priced and a fantastic happy hour, with friendly servers who made you feel welcome.5. The check-out was simple and in general, all service was friendly, easy and without fuss.

Great Hotel, Customer Service.Front desk Mr. Vanhalen was amazing. Very helpful, cared about accommodating us to what we wanted. friendly, very well groomed and professional. He made our stay very enjoyable. Will return.

The mattresses were hard. They need to invest in good pillow tops. If you have any joint or back issues, don't stay here. The Italian restaurant attached to the hotel was not nearly as good as Harry's across Gold street.

My wife and I stayed at Gild Hall in June as a weekend staycation. The hotel is located in the financial district, so the neighborhood is a little quieter than other parts of the city. It is an easy walk to the South Street Seaport. You are close to the Seaport, but not too close and that's a good thing. Finding the hotel could be a challenge, as the streets in the financial district are narrow and turns are everywhere. It's not the most taxi-friendly area, so be prepared to walk. The hotel itself is very clean, modern and stylishly decorated. The lobby ambiance is inviting and great, but on the tiny side so it can get packed easily. The rooms themselves are a little on the small side, but comfortable and fairly quiet. The staff were very friendly and knowledgeable of the area and had good suggestions of places to go. The welcome drink is a nice touch. We would definitely stay back at this property, if we had the opportunity.

Did an overnight at Gild Hall for the 4th of July. We arrived very early and we were surprisingly greeted warmly and were told they had a room ready for us. They also gave us an upgrade to a slightly larger room (without asking). Room was nice, no view but everything was in working order. The water pressure was tremendous! Noticed a hair in the sink when we first arrived. No big deal as the bathroom was obviously cleaned, it happens, I quickly rinsed it before my wife noticed. :-)The mattress was VERY comfortable unlike most Hyatt properties. Oddly there was no top sheet, not sure if this was a miss or cost cutting. As part of the $19.95 destination fee automatically added to guests bill each day, they provide complimentary champagne at the front desk from 3-12pm. Its a nice touch and good way to pregame or grab a night cap in the lobby. The only issue is that each time we had a glass the champagne was warm. Hopefully this is something they will remedy in the future. Overall front desk staff was very nice. Kristen and Rob were awesome, super nice, fun to interact with and provided great local reco's. The hotel also has a couple of bikes available for guests to use inside the lobby, nice touch. All in all I'd rank it a 4.5 star stay, rounding up due to the staff interactions.

The staff and room were excellent. The aroma, comfort, decor, and general warmth of the place hits at all levels. The lobby is TINY so it can get packed and confusing about whose next (happened repeatedly). The location is really hard to find but easy after it's discovered. I used Hyatt points and was treated well. The front desk staff were efficient, helpful, and professional. That's great! The room was smallish, yet well appointed and bed was comfy. I would happily return!

We were welcomed at check-in. Front desk was very friendly and accommodating. Able to provide directions to any venue. Bar staff were quick to fill drink orders. Restaurant- good food.Rooms were clean. Location was ideal for 9/11 Memorial sit, Battery Park, New York Stock Exchange.I would definitely re-book for my next stay in NYC!

The Gild Hall is a great boutique hotel, getting away from the hustle and bustle of mid town. This is a quality hotel providing a first class individual experience with quality accomodation. A repeat visitor, I am treated extraordinarily well by the team and welcomed back each time. That welcome is through booking all the way to departure. They are very accomodating, taking in packages before arrival, offering to hold items for next visit etc. Robert on the front desk is a great asset and the management team is superb. The location is great, very close to Fulton Street station which gives access to all of the lines you can want (Fulton is a hub). Seaport is on your doorstep, Battery Park, Brookfield Place and Westfield amongst other things and also the World TraDe Center

Upgraded room, warm sincere welcome and incredibly professional staff made us feel special. THANKS to Caitlin who was exceptional and helped with special requests and kind words. We will return again and again. We stay in nyc often and the staff is one of the many reasons we plan to return. Lots of books available in the lobby. It is an oasis in a busy city with lots of things conveniently close.

This hotel is perfectly located for the south Manhattan area and the financial district. The decoration is classy and the rooms feel very comfortable and cozy. The beds are comfortable and luxurious.The bathrooms are very elegant and include a lot of amenities. The only thing missing is a coffee or tea maker in the room. Most importantly, the staff is excellent and very attentive. Robert provided excellent service.

The hotel is cozy, and very well located. The restaurant was excellent. But...the best part of this hotel is dedicated and professional staff. They genuinely seem to care about hospitality. Book this hotel is service is important to you. You will not be disappointed.

I was greeted at the front desk and immediately offered a welcome drink, which after a long day was very nice. The staff were friendly and helpful, very personable. Room was a generous size, clean and comfortable. The welcome note from the manager with a fruit gift basket was lovely. Overall would highly recommend this hotel.

The Good: The location is great near Fulton St, making it easy to get to JFK. Facilities; USB ports, mini-fridge, slippers & bathrobe. We received a complimentary upgraded to a Deluxe King Room from a King Room as we were visiting for our honeymoon. We found a bottle of prosecco and a signed card in our room congratulating us for our honeymoon.The Bad: The rooms look much better in the pictures. There is considerable noise even though the hotel is advertised as soundproof. The resort fee includes a glass of prosecco at check-in and WiFi, however no coffee and bottled water in the room or spa and pool. For the price you might be able to find better value for money given that you don't much space in the room or much for the resort fee.

I booked a double queen room for my family trip with my parents. The front desk upgraded my reservation to a king suite with excellent views without any charge. I was warmly welcomed by Catlin, the front desk officer. The rest of the stay was pure joy with large room space, clean floor and towels, friendly bathroom design... Everything you can ask for a hotel room at this level.

From the moment I walked in, I was taken back by how beautiful the Thompson Hotel was. The staff is great - very attentive, professional, and extremely welcoming. I am more than satisfied with all of the amazing service I received. I recommend the Thompson Hotel for tourists, newlyweds, or anyone looking for a breath of fresh air. Again, I want to thank all of their staff for making the Thompson feel like my home away from home. I am currently a Hyatt employee and have high expectations when it comes to traveling - trust me when I say that this Thompson hotel is oozing with hospitality 24/7. Thank you for an unforgettable experience - I will definitely be back soon!

They charge an extra 19 bucks per night, it doesn't show anywhere to please KNOW THAT when considering the hotel. Its for the wifi and the wine you can get a night for free, in the reception. Other than that it was a really good experience.

I really liked the Gild Hall. It was clean, the staff were nice, and the rooms were good.The location is also excellent if you want to be in the Wall Street area. While it’s a small hotel, it has all of the essential amenities.

Wonderful hotel and staff. They went above and beyond to make our stay memorable. Staff at checking very fast and frienfly. I would definetly will stay here again on our next visit. Convenietly located near train station. Area felt very safe. We travelled with our son (11). We love everything about the hotel, service,restaurant. It was a great choice.

Spend two nights at this beautiful hotel. Very friendly service , amazing views , and amazing food. The rooms were large. Everything met our expectations and we absolutely loved our stay. The lobby was beautiful as well. The guy who took care of us was also very friendly. This hotel is worth staying at.

We are a family with two young children and we found this hotel to be a good fit for us. Convenient to all the attractions of lower Manhattan, friendly staff and personal service. One thing we really liked was that, without prompting, the housekeeper brought us extra towels and toiletries, and even left slippers in the room for our little girls. Also, the breakfast (included in our rate) at Felice was simple and delicious.

great boutique hotel with large room and amazing service! we were greeted by the front desk attendant simon who handed us 2 glasses of prosecco and our wifi password! location was great, very quiet on the weekends but a 10 minute walk to tribeca/soho :)

Only had one sheet. Not sure if it was fitted or flat, as it didn’t seem laundered so I didn’t inspect closely. Had to decide whether to sleep directly on the mattress with the sheet on us or on the sheet without another to protect me and my kids from the dirty, blood-stained comforter.

The hotel is clean, the staff is friendly, and the service is good. The location is a little difficult to find because the signage isn't very "in your face". The location of the hotel is good. Close to different restaurants, walking distance to wall street, and of course a Starbucks.

I booked the hotel because I am a World of Hyatt elite member and the hotel recently joined the Hyatt portfolio. I was hoping that the membership benefits would be extended. This is not necessarily be the case as I suspect the integration has not been completed yet. Besides, the guest room, which is stylishly furnished, is very dark because it faces a narrow street with limited sunlight.

Great atmosphere and service - the King bed size was massive and extremely comfortable. Service staff were friendly and the place was spot-on clean. What more can you ask? I would definitely come here again for my stay.

We spent 4 nights in NYC and chose to stay at Gild Hall in FiDi since it’s a boutique hotel we have never visited before. We were greeted by very welcoming front desk staffs upon arrival and had a wonderful stay.

In the Financial District and close to the 911 Memorial, World One Tower, Seaport and the Brooklyn Bridge. Very helpful staff and large rooms for New York City. Modern decor and Restaurant and Bar on site.

Had a great stay at the Gild Hall Hotel. Staff and the front desk were gracious and helpful. Our room was nice and spacious. Did not try the restaurants in the hotel. Overall stay was nice. Would definitely stay again on our next trip to NYC.

This boutique property is a thoroughly enjoyable experience. Warm woodwork greets your arrival and the rooms are comfortable - especially the linens. The breakfasts are varied and delicious, the fresh squeezed orange juice tasty and the Lavazza lattes excellent. My first stay at a Thompson (now associated with Hyatt), but it won't be my last. If leisure, the subway is close and the hotel also has a couple of bikes available to explore the East and West side trails.

This boutique hotel is small in size but big in terms of service and hospitality. The front desk team was welcoming and cordial, the lobby fragrant, and set the tone for the rooms, which are kitted out in high quality elements. Overall we rate highly, just a few things to understand going in: unsure if there are any walk in showers in the house; the ac is timed to shut off so overnight unless you are walking around you might break a sweat; soft mattress.
user_name:
Ray S
New York, United States

review_body: This a great hotel and has wonderful service. When we mentioned it was our anniversary, they made every effort during our stay to make us feel special. Because of their kind, considerate, and generous efforts to do that, we think the entire service team at this hotel, including the hotel clerks, housekeeping, and maintenance personnel are special as well!

Stayed at the hidden gem recently and was very surprised, its in a nice location, quiet and the staff is very good. Rob in the front desk was excellent. The hotel itself is clean, rooms are nice, normal size for NYC. They appear to have two bicycles in the lobby for use, but I did not try them. You can walk about 3 blocks to south street seaport, or over into wall street area. Valet parking is available. I will definitely be back.

The Gild Hall is a small hotel with well equipped rooms and service on high level. Located within the centre of financial district it's the perfect basecamp for a city trip. Stores, subway and many sightseeing hotspots are reachable by feet within a few minutes. Personell is very kind and helpful. Atmosphere and ambiance are extraordinary. Everything was clean and tidy.

Quieter area in Financial District. Easy access to subways and close to Seaport. Short walk to WTC, Oculus, Century 21 and shopping. Hotel bar and restaurant are popular and a good place to relax and meet with friends. Great service and helpful staff. No coffee maker in room thought.

We spent the night here last week and we loved this hotel! Check in was quick and easy with really great employees. I requested a low floor and we given one on 5. The room was good size and so was the bathroom. The A.C worked well and we were very comfortable there. We had breakfast on Sunday at the restaurant in the lobby which was very good. This hotel is on my list of places to return to next time we stay over in NYC.

Everything about this property is amazing. The staff, the atmosphere, and the location. Definitely the place to stay if you want to be close to seaport/financial district. Front desk staff were polite, nice and amazingly accommodating. Area felt safe as well as easy access to get to subway.

We enjoyed our five day stay at the Gild Hall in New York City's downtown Mahattan. . The staff were very friendly and helpful. It has a small but homey lobby. Elevators were usually quick with minimal wait times. Close to several restaurants and there's a full grocery store one block over. Our room was very quiet and enjoyed good night sleep. Good climate control. We never used the on-site bar and restaurant.

Bring your own water, because the water in the room is exorbitantly priced. And be prepared for no coffee until you leave the hotel for the day, the only coffee available is table service in the restaurant.The bathroom is small but adequate. The shower was short of hot water.

Great stay in great location. Even though this is a boutique hotel, it was awesome for our stay with two young children. Room are spacious especially for New York standards, clean and well taken care of. Very close to the pier activities and numerous restaurants. Staff was always very helpful. Will definitely come back while traveling to the city.

Stayed here for one night only and it was perfect. The room was spacious, bathroom and shower were luxe and truly the most comfortable bed and sheets. My only drawback was that a bottle of water $9 but the hotel comped it which I appreciate. I would highly recommend this hotel, especially for a longer stay! Lots of shopping and restos in the financial area.

The staff at the hotel were extremely nice and did anything ask with a smile. Request were taken care of very quickly. The restaurant was not great. Other than that a wonderful stay. One request the hotel needs to have coffee available for their guest.

Great value. For a New York City hotel hovering at a bit less than $200/night I had very low expectations. But the room itself I thought was nicer than much more expensive hotels. The ambience was very like men's lodge, which I did not mind at all. I was impressed all around. Bathroom could use a fan.

We had a very nice 2-night stay at Gild Hall (our first experience with Thompson Hotels). We arrived on a rainy afternoon, and check-in was quick and easy. Our room (1 king bed) seemed slightly larger than your typical NYC hotel room and had ample space for the 2 of us. The room was clean and comfortable. My only complaint was the slight lip between the bedroom and bathroom - it's definitely a bit of a hazard and the cause of a few stubbed toes especially when walking in the darkness half asleep in the middle of the night.Nice location for the hotel - on a very quiet street, though sometimes hard to find (thank goodness for Google Maps!). Walking distance to several subway lines.A great stay in NYC, and I'm glad Thompson Hotels has joined the Hyatt family - otherwise, I may not have known about this property.

Great experience . Excellent and dedicated front desk personnel. Great location with access to main attractions. Good restaurant with average services. I had a non good experience last day during breakfast at Felice with one of the employees but I had the opportunity to speak with the manager.. Other days I was serviced very well at the restaurant

A rather small (how do they say: ‘boutique’?) hotel in the Financial District of some taste both in the common areas and in the rooms. Not many services available but WiFi is pretty fast; I did not have the chance to try its bar or its restaurant.

Over all a great experience and place to call home in NYC, excellent for ladies travelling on their own. Would recommend for friends to stay, easy access to the subway, Seaport and World Trade Center. Prosseco when arriving back at the hotel after the day a winner!

Had to write a review for this hotel, which made my one month stay in NYC amazing. The people, especially Luis, Paolo, and Van Hallen, were always there for a warm welcome, to offer dinner recommendations, or really for anything I needed. I truly appreciate all the care and attention they provided. Looking forward to staying there again in the near future!

Firstly, I understand the affordable hotels in manhattan is really hard to find. The over facilities are very well maintained (except for the heater which did not warm the room enough). The demeanor of the front desk staff was a bit too aloof and casual.
user_name:
Hyungjun L
Old Greenwich, United States

review_body: Excellent location to all downtown sightseeing (9-11 museum, battery park, ferries) and numerous subway stops. Rooms quiet and front desk staff very helpful. Breakfast at Felice each morning delicious!

The hotel has a unique, modern lodge feel to it. The staff were professional and accommodating. The area of nyc over the weekends is relatively quiet and there are subway options close by. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a change in scenery from the other cookie-cutter hotels in the vicinity.

Our second stay at Gild Hall, having also stayed in December 2014. Great location for enjoying Manhattan and Brooklyn, in particular. The Seaport, Brookly Bridge and One World Trade are all a very short walk away and the metro station is around the corner.

We arrived late in the evening and were greeted by a foyer/bar filled with people drinking and chatting having negotiated the pavement filled with garbage bags. The address of the hotel is confusing leading to our limo driver circling the hotel several times. The check in was efficiently abrupt but not friendly with no assistance offered with our luggage. The room on the first floor with an entrance through the hotel restaurant was somewhat "tired" in appearance and even lacked facilities to make coffee. Breakfast was in the restaurant and service was again abrupt. An attempt to eat supper in the restaurant was thwarted by unhelpful staff forcing us thankfully to a friendly restaurant across the street. Our view was that this hotel relies too heavily on its boutique status and would benefit from improved client relations. On the positive side the hotel was convenient for access to the World Trade Center and surrounding areas. Our advice ... look for another hotel in the area.

I wouldn’t change anything. The minute we checked in my wife and I could tell this was a very nice hotel. The staff was excellent during our stay. Everything from hailing a cab to giving directions to the subway, the staff was awesome. The room was perfect and our dinner at Felice on Saturday was excellent.

Reasonably priced hotel that gives a friendly and luxe experience. Offers a great restaurant with nice bar and nice public spaces. Staff is very helpful and honors special requests like late checkout and upgrades when they can. Plus, it won’t break the budget.

It is so nice to stay in a warm and charming style ambient, ad find a comfortable room with a perfect bed after a day of "olympic games" in New York... The staff of the Hotel si young and informal, ma always ready to hep you in the right choice about taxi, dininig etc...

Super friendly, helpful staff who tried to go above and beyond during every interaction. My Hyatt membership was recognized and greeted with a sparkling wine during the check in process - a first time as a lowly Hyatt Discoverist. The check in and check out process are flawless.Rooms are in good condition. The lobby are decoration are very cool
user_name:
asdfg12345
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Stayed at the Gild Hall for a week in April as my husband and I were getting hitched at NY City Clerks Registry. First of all excellent location as right on the edge of the financial district with Wall Street, world trade centre, city hall, Brooklyn bridge and the Staten Island ferry within easy walking distance. Also have easy access to the subway with an entrance no more than 5- 10 min walking distance from the hotel. So tick on location, in regards to the hotel itself decor very hipster and cool in both the public areas(bar, reception) and the rooms themselves. We had a couple of issues when arriving i.e. had to wait for check in past the usual time as rooms were not ready and was also disappointed by the hotel not fulfilling a request that they had promised to do(placing our wedding flowers from Hawaii in cold storage when they’d arrived a day earlier - we found them left behind reception in their original packing when we arrived having being left there for 24 hours) luckily they survived and Angel the guy checking us in immediately sorted it and also upgraded our room gratis. We had the bed and breakfast deal for 5 days and can’t fault the food and the staff were all excellent! Tip - I’d go for the American breakfast option every time as it set me up for the day. Overall apart from a couple of hiccups we had a good time at the Gild Hall and would stay there again. As mentioned by a few it is great place to start out from if you’re a walker we managed to get to most places around us and only used the subway for sights further afield - Times Square, Central Park etc. Tip - it’s about a 20 min walk to the Staten Island ferry port which is free runs 24 hours and gets you great views of the Statue of Liberty.

Great hotel, great location, great stay! Highly recommended. One night stay to do some shopping worked out well with parking nearby and a nice walk to nearby shopping and NYC little italy, chinatown neighborhoods.

Now that this hotel is part of Hyatt, it was eligible for me to use my annual free night voucher. I highly recommend this hotel. It was near the South St Seaport, the subway, good restaurants etc. The bed and pillow were very comfortable. And it was very quiet. I am happy with our choice. Note: There is no coffee pot in the room, although you can ask for one (and perhaps get it subject to availability).

In the heart of Wall Street, very close to the 9/11 Memorial and to the Brooklyn Bridge, Thomson Hotel has a strategic location! With the Fulton Tube Station and the Pier 16 you can start easily your New York experience!!!

This isn’t a cookie cutter hotel and I think you’ll appreciate that the moment you walk in the door. This hotel has a modern take on Prohibition Era style that feels a bit masculine and luxurious. I’ve stayed thousands of nights in hotels and can definitely say I recommend Gild Hall!

Hotel in Manhattan should have been better. No wash clothes in bathroom, no parking discount at recommended parking lot, no top sheet on bed, no exhaust fan in bathroom, no mirror other than the bathroom

I really loved staying at Gild Hall. The hotel has a really great boutique feel while still providing everything found in a bigger chain hotel. The decor is really awesome and unique throughout, so it adds to the experience of staying at the hotel. Everyone we interacted with was genuinely friendly and helpful, so customer service was awesome across the board. They even have bikes you can use for free and prosecco during check-in! The bed was comfortable, the room was bigger than average for NYC, and the in-room toiletries were nice. The windows were relatively small, but that's a minor complaint. The location isn't as convenient for the main tourist sites in Midtown, but it's close enough to Chelsea and the East Village. I'm looking forward to returning next time I'm in NYC.

Beautiful hotel in one of Hyatt's newly acquired beands. A real gem in New York. Loved the custom headboards, the welcome prosecco, and the spacious rooms. Service was top-notch. I will definitely be returning!

Now this hotel was supposed have the WOW factor according to all the great reviews but I didn’t see much of it! The room was mediocre agreed it was great size compared to other hotels in downtown Manhattan but I wouldn’t say it was as boutique as they offer! Now I don’t come from Anything special but when you are paying a lot of money you want to best possible service around and the rules and regulations to be the same all throughout your 4 Day stay!When we arrived @ the reception I was greeted by van halen ( please forgive me if this was an incorrect name) he offered myself and my partner a glass of Prosecco which was quite refreshing after the long journey! Before heading over on our journey I had correspondence via email about a special occasion and was assured they would send up a bottle and see what else they could do, after reiterating this on check in it was ignored which I found very ignorant.Once at the room we discovered there was only enough towels for 2 people when a family of 4 was staying (other than this the room was good sized and a massive tv alarm clock with usb slots for charging phones) I went down to reception to get more towels and they sent them up which was greatNext day after a long day out sightseeing came back to only 2 towels again I went down to reception again and asked for some extra slightly more p**sed off this time as it was van halen again!The third and final straw was on our last full day after another day out came back to only 2 towels again this time I made sure van halen knew about my frustration he said he would have them sent up, went back to our room and a phone call came around 20 mins later advising us that it is there regulation to only put 2 towels in, these rules must have changed over night as it was van halen who called and advised of this but previously gave extra towels, he also offered free breakfast at the hotels restaurant on the final morning we refused this and up until this moment we are still waiting on towels for the final night and a bottle for our big occasionThe location of the hotel is superb within a 3-4 minute walk from the local subway at Fulton street On checkout it was new staff and they were overly nice and attentive shame they were not on all weekendWe won’t be back or recommending this hotel to others

First time at Gild Hall. Wonderful people, food and experience. Very well decorated. Exceptional quality food and experience. Close to many locations. Quiet rooms for a good night sleep. Staff attentive to guest and ready to help.

Just had a perfectly serviceable stay at Gild Hall. The location was good, room was clean and I had a good rest on a lovely bed. The location is on a quiet street that is very close to Wall Street so it's great if you are working nearby. There are several train lines within a 5 minute walk so you can get to anything in NYC fairly easily. The lobby has a cool hipster vibe thanks to the décor that is trendy but also welcoming with oversized leather sofas, bookshelves and antler chandeliers. There is a good Italian restaurant in the lobby which is worth a visit. In my limited exchanges with the staff, everyone was always friendly and helpful.The room is on the small side but it has a high ceiling which made it feel more spacious. The furnishings are very masculine with a big leather headboard, brass fixtures and lots of brown and black. The bed was a highlight - very large and comfortable with 4 fluffy pillows and white linens. There is virtually no sunlight coming in at any time of day due to the tall buildings surrounding it. That was expected but you should be aware if you like a sunny room. The room did have several lamps which I really appreciated and made the room feel much more cozy in the evenings.Here is where it starts to deviate from a 4.5 star hotel. While the décor is nice, the age of the room shows and it feels a bit disjointed as if they took an older hotel and tried to make it more trendy without a full renovation. The television is huge and has basic cable channels but no premium movie channels nor an obvious way to connect your phone to the tv. The overall feel of the room felt very much like a "man cave" - I can appreciate the style they were going for but it fell a bit short of what I was expecting from a boutique hotel. The bathroom is the biggest let down with a standard tub and shower head, very limited counterspace and a travel sized hair dryer. There is no natural light and the magnifying mirror is mounted to the wall over the toilet making it fairly useless. The layout makes it hard to put makeup on or even have your products laid out to use. The towels are quite thin and they only leave 2 in the room. Overall it felt very much like you what you find at a 3 star - perfectly serviceable but not what I would expect from a 4.5 star property. Perhaps the other rooms have larger/better bathrooms?While I didn't need much during my stay, I did ask for ice to be brought up and was informed that ice machines were available on certain floors. It did the job but again, didn't feel very luxurious to have to walk the halls in my pajamas collecting ice.Overall, I had a good stay but I suspect the hotel was designed with male business travelers in mind. A few upgrades would make this a bit more friendly for all.

Went for a girls trip and from booking to leaving the hotel the staff was amazing, friendly and wanted to make our experience 150%. They knew it was a girls trip and left us wine and a note. Contacted us via text to keep asking how they could help. Exceptional service! The rooms are gorgeous and it’s in a quiet place in Manhattan so you don’t feel like you are in the hustle and bustle. Love it and will go back again and again. Caitlyn at the front desk is amazing - she is what customer service should model!

I lived in NYC several years so never needed to stay in an hotel. Visiting family this time I had to pick up one...Must say the fact that FELICE restaurant was part of the hotel helped me a lot...I m a morning cappuccino person!!!The hotel is just around the corner from the Fulton subway station. In the quiet corner of Gold Street and Liberty Street. Staff is very nice and welcoming. Good size room considering you are in NYC. Nice bathroom. Frette linens and bathrobe. They will provide you with slippers if you need them. Clean room and bathroom. Breakfast can be a la carte, if you don’t have it included in the rate. Cappuccino is excellent!I used to live few blocks away from Felice in the upper west side and I always loved to eat there as it is real Italian cuisine. So we had also a quick good lunch before our departure, at Felice in Gold Street. I highly recommend this hotel.

Well-designed hotel with a lot of books and chessboards (!) in the lobby. The rooms are equally well designed and clean. Situated in Lower Manhattan, it is in the middle of the financial district and close to f.e. Wall Street and the 9/11 Memorial. Very friendly service. Breakfast is only served a la carte. It is recommended b Lonely Planet. Rightfully so!

reasonably priced place that's not centrally located but is near subways. rooms are decent sized but beware of where you are located as trucks outside can be "in action" until around midnight. Also wonder if some rooms may be more updated than others.

Your loyal reviewer will stipulate for the jury that I like luxury hotels, and will gladly pay what it takes to have such comfort and service. That said, occasionally I will venture well beyond the Four Seasons path and dig out hopefully a hidden gem. The Gild Hall has turned out to be one of those gems which makes me occasionally question why I pay so much money for a luxury hotel when such delights are available at such reasonable pricesI was in NYC recently for some college basketball, and we wanted a place with reasonable prices, good location and a good bar/restaurant so we could hang out a bit. I found Gild Hall on TripAdvisor, and our stay exceeded all expectations we had coming in! This is a big winner. It starts with the price of rooms, but it is much more than that. We got rooms around $200 a night, but the value seemed to be much greater. The location is superb, a walk to South Street Seaport and One World Trade Center, steps from the Brooklyn Bridge, and about 50 yards from the Fulton Street subway. The streets around the hotel are quite quiet, a nice side bonus if you like being a step off the beaten path.The experience starts at check in when they offered me a prosecco, and said we could enjoy more in the lobby between 4pm and 10pm. The rooms are modern and well designed. Attention to detail is impressive in the layouts.The bar lobby is very comfortable and the staff attention to detail is impressive. We ended every night of three there, and they remembered drink orders, made sure the TV was adjusted to come basketball games, and got us some snacks right up to last call.The front desk pointed us towards a cheaper breakfast option for sandwiches and coffee steps from the hotel, and one night at midnight they pointed us to a local Irish bar when the hotel lobby bar closed.The traning for the staff is impressive. People were personable and attentive, right down to the maintenance man who was on the elevator, and the maid cleaning the rooms. Always a 'hello', and asking if we needed anything.This is not a grand hotel, with 500 rooms and the hustle and bustle of New York City spilling into the lobby. This is a smaller island of calm tucked into a quiet corner in lower Manhattan. It is comfortable and focused on making sure you get whatever support you need while a guest there. We will return!

The décor, service, food/drink are all of the gold standard!From the beginning where you are greeted with warmth and a glass of processco to fabulous dinner and wine. Vermintino chilled to perfection and the food is amazing. Even has great/delicious gluten free items.Excellent place to stay!

That was our second stay in that Hotel. Met expectations as the year before. Location is perfect for any activity, Subway station is very close.. Breakfast has high quality and tastes great. Lots of restaurants close...We come back.

Gild Hall is like Cheers, the staff greets you like you're old friends. We showed up impossibly early and they apologized to us for not getting us in immediately. Like our red-eye was on them! We still got in to our room a few hours before regular check in time. The room was big enough to walk around in which isn't always found in NYC! Nice bathroom (had a slow drain and that was fixed immediately), great bed, pillows, linens and service.Drawbacks: 1. Gild Hall is on a tiny street in lower Manhattan and it seemed like it was tough for Lyfts to get to the hotel, just keep that in mind when scheduling. 2. There was no dresser in the room.3. We requested a 4 a.m. wake up call to leave for the airport on the Sunday of daylight saving time change over and that call never came. All in all, I really liked the hotel!

We were given an incredibly spacious room at no extra cost with a very comfortable king size bed. The hotel is within close proximity to many great sights and restaurants. I would definitely recommend this hotel and book again in the future. TL;DR: Great value for money in a great location.
user_name:
mariodJ3669FW
New York City, New York

review_body: Gild Hall is an oasis of comfort tucked away in lower Manhattan! The location, particularly for those of us who rely on the subway, is rather perfect. And each time I return to Gild Hall, I am welcomed as a friend to a lobby that is warm and cool at the same time. The front desk staff are helpful beyond the call of duty, joyful and attentive.
user_name:
Ellen Percy K
New York City, New York

review_body: Just a night spent here but what a delightful find! Gild Hall is intimate, super clean and all the staff were very accomodating and efficient. We had a breakfast and lunch in Felice, the restaurant on main floor, and very much enjoyed both.

My mom and I stayed at Gild Hall for my mom’s 50th birthday, and we couldn’t have imagined a better place for our NYC home base. The location is fantastic - close to many attractions like the 9/11 memorial and monument, Statue of Liberty, Wall St., and the Brooklyn Bridge and easy subway access for others in the city. But the real shining star here is the Gild Hall staff. Caitlin, their assistant office manager, really went above and beyond to make my mom’s stay super special. I would without hesitation book a stay at Gild Hall again for my next trip to New York. The location, experience, customer service, room service, and value for the price are all exceptional. Highly recommend!

We arrived after a long flight in the early morning hours in down town Manhatten and the hotel made us feel arriving at home. Great atmosphere throughout the entire extended weekend stay. We truly enjoyed our time.

I was in FiDi for business and selected Gild Hall based on proximity to my meetings. I was extremely impressed with the hotel. The staff was very friendly and courteous, the WiFi worked well and the room was comfortable and quiet. I'll definitely consider booking Gild Hall again the next time I'm in FiDi.

We had a lovely stay at the Gild Hall. It is situated in a great area and is really well connected. The staff were welcoming and we felt immediately comfortable.The bar is a nice place to spend some time and the wine selection in particular was great. The rooms were a good size and the bed was really comfortable. The shower was also really great. Sadly the internet was a bit slow and the room did feel a little tired.

Unique hotel with a kind of international/hipster vibe. We are neither of these demographics but we felt very comfortable here. Elegant rooms with clean, comfortable beds and pillows. Beautiful lobby, lounge and decor. Enjoyed that the neighborhood was safe and quiet at night and only a five minute walk to subway. Reasonably priced for New York. We would recommend it highly! We are a family of four with two teenaged boys.

The room is clean and modern, met my expectation. Overall provides a good value with this location. Very convenient to the subway station and Lower Manhattan. Not much to complain. Check in was efficient and check out is smooth. The heat is making a bit of noise at night.

We looked at many properties for our stay in NYC. It took a few weeks to decide that Gild Hall was the best value. Once we arrived, we felt like we were on vacation. The staff was attentive and provided suggestions for dinner or drinks. The hotel is close to restaurants and things to do within walking distance. Gild Hall is also near a subway station that can take you wherever you would like to go. We said a number of times on our trip that we were glad that we picked Gild Hall. The tall ceilings are nice and the room is a good size for NYC. We encourage you to pick Gild Hall for your next stay in New York.
user_name:
Jason H
Egg Harbor Township, New Jersey

review_body: Beautiful hotel. Great location. Wonderful staff. Beds are very comfortable and there is really good water pressure in the showers. I wish I'd had more chances to eat at Felice (the hotel restaurant). I got to do one lunch and one evening of cocktails and snacks. The food was just fabulous and the drinks too.

A warm welcome & with a glass of bubbly greeted us on entering this stylish hotel near Wall Street. Tucked away from traffic yet only minutes from southstreet seaport / Brooklyn Bridge on one side and Fulton subway station on the other to take you midtown uptown or to another borough. Large comfy beds, crisp bed linen with leather headboards, high ceilings and heating - I always love the water pressure in NYC all showers are proper power showers - always welcome after a day/night out. If you are looking for a place to relax with great service one close to a number of bars and restaurants, without being in hectic midtown you would be hard pushed to find a better place to stay - highly recommended

We arrived at The Gild Hall at 11pm after our initial accommodation had been overbooked by the supplier. We were totally looked after by Robert at reception who was so helpful in ensuring we had a good stay after our poor start. The rooms at Gild Hall are comfortably furnished with the most comfortable beds, beautiful quality linen and Frette bath robes to boot! The bar is lively and furnished with fab mid century antiques. Whilst the hotel is located in the finance district it is easy to get around from Fulton Street subway and the local shops and coffee houses at South sea port are a couple of minutes walk away. I have to mention Robert again who really went out of his way for us and made our stay a 5 star one. I thought I had already sent this review via an email link but that hasn't appeared so apologies for the late review.

The hotel is so nice! The subway is close by allowing you to commute to anywhere in the city.The rooms are clean, comfortable and functional. Particularly I enjoy that they kept the double locks in the rooms so you can make sure that no one will enter your room with a master key.The hotel has an Italian restaurant which is simple delicious! You can either eat downstairs to the restaurant or order room service and have an amazing meal that will simple make your day better.

As usual, I stayed only one night, up and back from DC in 24 hours. However, the difference on this trip is that I was booked into the Gild Hall, just a few minutes from my work destination and a few steps from the Subway stop. When I walked in the door with my son, we were instantly handed glasses of prosecco as our bags were whisked away. Not a bad start. The hotel feels hip and friendly, the lobby and restaurant are nicely finished in a way that makes you feel at home, like you could just settle down in a chair and pass some time. But of course, there was no time to actually do that. The room was small, but not too small, and it was comfortable with all the amenities that I could have wanted. Black-out shades ensured a nice, dark sleep. The staff was well-trained and friendly to boot. We liked this hotel and have recommended it to friends. The price is attractive and the breakfast at the restaurant first rate. You might enjoy a stay here. We certainly did.

My daughter attends a college in the Financial District and when we visit, Gild Hall is our favorite place to stay! the staff is very attentive and happy to make your stay enjoyable. The decor is perfect and the bartenders make delicious drinks!

The hotel entry area was warm and welcoming. The staff were attentive and eager to check us in. We started our visit with an offer of an upgraded room and a reminder of the free flowing prosecco after 4 p.m. The room was a very good size, especially for a boutique NYC hotel. The bathroom was just spacious enough for two people. The bed and pillows were Goldilocks "just right", the light blocking shade sealed out street light, and the room was insulated from street noise. Impeccable food and service at the hotel restaurant, which was always busy. We will definitely return, as this has been our most favorite stay in the last 3.5 years of visiting Manhattan. We will be back.

This was our 5th stay here, and they have all been great. This was a real "deal" since it was Jan. We have come to enjoy the Financial District location. The Fulton St. subway station is very convenient. The staff at the hotel really makes you feel at home--clearly, they have been well selected and trained.The rooms are large and well decorated for our taste. An overall great experience.

This was our first stay in a Thompson Hotel. The Gild Hall provided a great location for our requirements in lower Manhattan. Excellent, friendly staff, quiet and comfortable rooms. A great stay. Would I recommend the Gild Hall? Certainly.

Just spent 3 nights on a NYC city break with my family.Didnt know Lower Manhattan, or this hotel group, but had a fantastic time.Friendly staff, great rooms, super-comfy bed, and wonderful ‘vibe’ throughout the hotel.A real gem..

We want to highly recommend the Gild Hall Hotel at 15 Gold St NY. It is a cozy, hip, stylish hotel with a lot of personality at a very convenient location. It is amazing how all the staff is so very much professional and ready to assist the guests at all time. Everyone makes part of a wonderful team! However, we want to point out the outstanding assistance of Luis Chavez and Paolo Garcia. They took the time to help us and made us feel happy and comfortable. Also, the assistance of the office manager Van Halen, makes this place very special as for us to keep it always in mind and return whenever we need to stay in Manhattan.

This is a quaint hotel and one of the best areas of Manhattan to stay. Great restaurants in walking distance and the subway is extremely close. TKTS booth is only a couple of blocks away. We’ll stay ther again for sure!

Location is good. Service was less than average overall. Onsite restaurant was nice and the wait staff was very friendly and knowledgeable. OK hotel for the money. Wouldn’t be my first choice when I return to NYC.

All was fine but the pillows and sheets were a bit old and weathered. The rooms were decorated nice but you could sense the construction was not great- it seems like whomever did the renovations rushed the job or did not care to perfect it- Smells in the room were strange ranging from hospital to a bit funky, just weird The shower head and pressure sucked

This property is a great find and downtown Oasis with an amazing restaurant, Felice, that also provides room service. All staff, to a person were friendly and helpful without being snobby. Paolo G. and Luis C. were extremely helpful as were Mario and Floriana in the restaurant and event planning. No better place to stay in lower Manhattan.

The Gild Hall is what I call a boutique hotel. We are regular visitors and I swear ou cannot get a more comfortable bed to sleep in anywhere else.The staff are so welcoming, remember you by name and cannot do too much to make your stay a perfect one: it is no mistake we do not go or even test anywhere else. The location is great for Fulton street subway which gives you access to everywhere.

A superb alternative to the typical hotel chains out there that offer run of the mill services. Not only is this hotel perfectly located but it’s a lovely place to come back to after a long day walking Manhattan.

Probably my favorite place to stay in Manhattan. Whether or not you are of royal lineage, you will feel like you are at Gild Hall. A warmer welcome or a more calming atmosphere, I have not experienced anywhere else.

This was my third stay at Gild Hall and I have had very good experiences every time. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful. The rooms are small (normal for a big city) but very nice and clean. The bar and restaurant are perfect for this size hotel and a great gathering spot. I would definitely recommend this hotel

4 star. Very nice for an overnight business trip. Bedding was luxurious; staff was helpful; on-site restaurant and room service were very good. I would stay here again. Only one suggestion...remove the $19.95 charge for internet connection. This is an expected amenity in 2019.

This spot is close to everything and it had a great restaurant on the first level- the staff is one of the best I have met so far. I love this place because of the staff , the rooms and the restaurant on site ! It is also across a Starbucks location and a great bar

We had a wonderful time there . Very attentive staff, who met all our needs. Our room was spacious and full fun artwork and a great bathroom. Enjoyed the restaurant and bar and all the shops and restaurants in the area. It is in a quiet and safe neighborhood,, within walking distant to Seaport district..

My partner and I stayed here when we visited New York In December 2018.It is exactly what you want from a hotel when you've spent all day walking miles and miles in busy New York!A comfy bed, soft sheets, soft pillows, cosy bedroom decor and lovely bathrooms.It felt like a home away from home and exactly what we were looking for. The staff were so friendly and couldn't do enough to make us feel welcome. They would make a point of striking up conversation with you when passing through reception. The only thing I didn't like was they charge an extra $20 a night for faster WiFi, free calls to other New York numbers and complimentary fizz in the bar at a certain time of day. This wasn't optional and was just added on. Although what a waste of money if you don't need or want any of those things? The WiFi that was included in the original room price was fast enough for what we needed and we were going to be out all the time exploring so wouldn't be there for the fizz. We also didn't need to ring anyone in New York as we didn't know anyone there!It would probably be useful for someone there on business but for us it was just throwing away $20 a night. The location is good - it's based within the finance district with subways located nearby so central locations and tourist attractions were only a 20 minute ride away. There are local coffee shops/restaurants etc nearby too. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in New York!

I strongly recommend the gild hall for its location. The room is very confortable good hospitality, the crew members are very friendly and kind They gave us advices when we needed information. I also recommend the Felice restaurant, Heartwarming welcome, great food and excellent service

We stayed here for 3 nights over Christmas and were absolutely delighted with our choice of hotel. From the second we entered the building we were greeted with a warm welcome and a clean, trendy lobby. The staff were some of the friendliest we’ve encountered on our travels and really made sure we were looked after. The rooms were exactly what you would expect of a 4 star hotel, Luxurious, warm and clean. The location of the hotel was perfect for us, around the corner from the 9-11 memorial and writhing walking distance of the ferry to the Statue of Liberty, the Empire State Building and the Rockefeller centre. 100% would stay here again if in NYC.
user_name:
mattttt
New York City, New York

review_body: Beautiful trendy property with excellent service and accommodations! Staff was friendly and professional. Room was beautifully decorated and extremely clean. The restaurant was cozy, food was delucious and the service spot on.

This was the second time my partner and I have stayed at Gild Hall; it's in a fantastic location just a few minutes away from Fulton Street subway station and landmarks such as the 9/11 memorial, Wall Street, Brooklyn Bridge and the charming South Street Seaport. During our most recent stay (Dec 14 to Dec 21, 2018), upon arrival the reception staff were friendly and welcoming, inviting us to partake in some on-the-house welcome drinks later that afternoon. Our room (175) was furnished and decorated to a very high standard... the TV is great, bed is huge and comfortable and the atmosphere of the room is cosy and warm... perfect for a New York december. The minibar selection is fantastic and has some interesting additions!My partner and I got engaged during our stay and, that evening, we had a celebration glass of champagne at the bar downstairs. The entire hotel (Reception, Rooms and Restaurant included) is very classy and atmospheric, I'd highly recommend visiting during the evening to make the most of it. During our celebration drinks, we took some time to take it all in and have a chat with the guy behind the bar (Mr Mee, thanks for your advice!).And, when the reception staff found out about our engagement, we returned to our room the next day and found a wonderful fruit basket, a bottle of prosecco and a handwritten note congratulating us. All on the house. How great is that?If the team read this, I'd like to thank you all again for this lovely gesture. Things like this make guests feel valued and add a genuine personal touch to the stay; we love the hotel anyway but this just added to the experience.Overall, I cannot recommend the Gild Hall highly enough. It's comfortable, well appointed and staffed by some great people. John on reception (and every other member of the team) are brilliant. We look forward to visiting again in the future.

We wanted a Christmas getwaway and we found it! Location is in a great spot, easy to be a tourist or stay in. Lots to do/see directly around the hotel with easy access to subway. Staff is extremely accommodating and friendly. Felice has amazing food/service. I can’t wait to go back.

Very happy by our stay in this hotel. Clean, comfortable, spacious rooms and a nice team.The evening ambiance at the bar really niceThe location was good, not far from the subway. The Felice restaurant satisfied all of us.

The hotel and the room are not new, but they are well appointed and nicely decorated. Happy to report that we had an excellent stay. Despite our great overall experience, I can see why people's experiences with the hotel can vary. I think at Gild Hall's price point, the expectation automatically becomes higher. However, I do think that the rate certainly also is a function of having centrally located in New York.Check-in was quick, we came by early, they didn't have our room ready yet, but they gladly stored our luggage as we explored the city. When we came back for our room key, they offered welcome drinks, which we gladly accepted. We went for the Premium King Size room and we were assigned one on the 5th floor. The room was probably recently renovated, it had a premium look with leather and earth tones. However, the bathroom was probably not completely gutted out during the reno, it definitely has character. Sliding glass door was slightly rickety. The tub and the shower head didn't look as modern. But the water pressure was great, and everything worked to its purpose. The bed and the pillows were super comfortable and the room was generally quiet.Service wise, I did notice that the restaurant was a bit shorthanded during their breakfast service on our last day there. But, I do think the people they have tried their best and did step up to the plate. Props to Van Halen at the front desk, he was super helpful! I would definitely stay here again if I'm in town. For what it's worth, location is great, they were a 5-minute walk away to Shake Shack!

This is, quite possibly, the best value in NYC.At check-in Caitlin was friendly and helpful with both restaurant and bar recommendations.Upon arriving at the room I was presently surprised with ow warm and comfortable the boutique-chic furnishings were. I spent 2 days/nights and found the room comfortable for both work and sleep. A tremendous attention to detail would appear to be the hallmark of this hotel. the room had several wine options and a wide array of snacks available for purchase. In addition in the bathroom was a full (high quality) shaving kit for purchase. While I didn't need it on this trip -- I have in the past and would have been appreciative of the convenience. There was also a hand-written note form Caitlin with a welcome box of Italian cookies from Felice, the on-site restaurant.The first morning of my stay I received a text message asking if there was anything the team could do for me. In fact there was, I needed a dress shirt pressed. Within 5 minutes I received the response, there was a laundry 4 doors down. Problem solved.I sat at the bar for dinner at Felice both nights of my stay. Menu options were broad and food quality was very good. I had the bolognese one night and the ravioli the next (although I must say the serving size on the ravioli left me wanting). Excellent selection of wines (not inexpensive to be sure -- that may be my only criticism).Upon checkout I checked my bags and was given an umbrella for the several block walk to my meeting -- it was pouring out! When I returned I was under a time crunch to get to Penn station -- one memeber of the team went out in the pouring rain to check pricing from the car services lines up outside -- he then took me to the car, loaded my bags and gave me the umbrella for use when I arrived at Penn Station. I was certainly capable of taking care of myself -- but the level of interest in helping was impressive -- and appreciated.If ever my business schedule takes me to the financial district -- I'll be returning to Gild Hall and I am 100% certain to stay there on kmy next leisure trip to the city.

The hotel is good. But it is really a pity that they are not honoring their promises. I booked two rooms under the “stay for nights and save 15%*. That included breakfast. However it was not explicitly mentioned on the confirmation. I checked with front desk and all they did is give a voucher for 1 day (we are staying 5 nights). So the name of the rate is there, I had a picture of that taken when I made the reservation and if you go to the website it is still there. So beware that if are making reservations on the Guild Hall, you might pay for breakfast and do not get it.

This hotel was very nice and not too far from anything! Very nice bed and decor all around, great place to relax. I would come back forsure as the front desk was very kind and helpful with requests, and the only thing I would say is to make sure to ask for something if you think you may be missing it in your room.

We enjoyed staying at this hotel for a weekend in the city. The room is comfortable and clean, and the staff are incredibly friendly and helpful. We had both room service and breakfast at the restaurant and the meals were very good. We would definitely stay here again!

Location was perfect for us as we have family right around the corner. Jubilee supermarket was there for any snacks we may have needed, as was the Rx store. Felice Restaurant was perfect--such gracious staff and hostess!

Good overall; the rooms are small which is typical of New York; the towels seemed a little bit old and wimpy for a nice hotel; Felice Restaurant was good food but service at our table on the bar side was below average. We like the location for lower downtown -financial district.

This was the second time I stayed at Gild Hall. The people working there are extremely service oriented. Very friendly and really eager to please. Rooms are very clean and are decent for the price range. Food at Felice is expensive and the quality can vary. However, the wait staff are excellent as is the bartender. The good thing is that you can walk to so many other great restaurants and bars so you aren't tied down to the Felice.

Tucked away in the financial district, with an unassuming exterior, Gold Hall delivers - excellent rooms, with excellent beds. The Thompson Hotel experience is here in all its warmth and efficiency. The restaurant has excellent food, and the bar certainly met my offbeat expectations too. Proximity to subways and landmarks added to the positive experience.
user_name:
divgic
New York City, New York

review_body: If you're planning on doing a lot of sightseeing in Lower Manhattan this is an ideal location. The staff is very welcoming and reception/check out were both smooth experiences. It's also down a small side street which makes for a very quiet stay especially on the weekend.Rooms are small but efficient and nicely laid out. Reading lamps are provided on both sides of the bed. I would like to have seen more easily accessible outlets for charging all the electronics I have to schlep from city to city. Also missing? A full length mirror.Plenty of storage space in the bathroom, but only one washcloth and one hand towel? That just seems stingy.

Excellent hotel for an easy friwndly informal approach. Around wall Street and close to the ferry to the statue of liberty. A cab ride uptown to central park time Square etc, or easy to get familiar with the subway. Cab is best, expect some characters in the subway, not please try but got us there.

Hotel was great, would recommend. Pillows were soft, would have liked a firmer option. Bed was comfortable. Environment great. Rooms do not have air, which was not an issue because we visited in November, although I am not sure how you could stay here in the summer.

We don't typically stay in the financial district as we were visiting family who all live midtown but the price was reasonable and we decided to give it a try. We had also been wanting to visit the 911 Memorial/Museum and staying a couple blocks away was a plus.I was pleasantly surprised to receive a text from the hotel a couple days before our trip asking if they could do anything to help before we arrived - a nice touch. During our stay, the staff was friendly and accommodating. Our room was very nice; clean and quiet. We would stay again.

I stayed here for business for two nights. When I first walked in the room I was very impressed by the decor. As I lived in the room a bit, i did notice it was starting to show signs of wear and tear - especially in the bathroom. It was nice and quiet - not much noise from the outside and very convenient to my meetings at 3 World Trade. My biggest complaint is that the room service isn’t 24 hours which after a late night out at a business function was much needed especially since there isn’t anything is that area open late. All in all, a comfortable stay if you are in the area for business.

Above all GREAT staff. They are really engaged and it's call can do. It stood out. Very nice rooms. No noise from between rooms or halls. Minor disappointments: no bathrobe at a fairly high room rate and found room service menu limited. Would definitely stay again if downtown.

Outstanding value for a European-style hotel located centrally between courts, Wall Street and seaport area. Some of the world's most pleasant staff. Visit the Italian restaurant located on premises for a warm and elegant experience.

I was blow away by the pleasant surprise I rec'd when I got to my Hotel room. The décor and amenities were modern, the room was warm and comfortable. The mini bar had a good selection of drinks but I settled for orange juice. Great place to stay.
user_name:
Verna R
New York, United States

review_body: Enjoyed our stay at Gild Hall over Thanksgiving weekend. This a nice place to spend a weekend in NYC if you like a quiet location near several subway stops. The rooms are comfortable and the lobby prosecco at 4pm is a nice addition.
user_name:
RayC372
Manchester, New Hampshire, United States

review_body: I took a chance and booked this awesome hotel via Expedia. Unfamiliar with NYC, I was nervous but found comfort in the TripAdvisor reviews. The hotel is super clean (housekeeping does a great job), stylish and comfortable. The hotel seems fairly new so it has a luxurious feel. The front desk staff is consistently professional, welcoming and very helpful. When you arrive, they offer champagne and just simply go out of their way to help. The room service menu is pretty good, food is delicious. I just wish they had more of a variety and were open later. Given the neighborhood is the Financial District, it does close down early so I can understand the reason for closing the restaurant earlier. The hotel location is fantastic and there are some good bars and restaurants within walking distance. I would stay here again for sure. Truly - this hotel is a gem and the reviews support this statement. Here are some opportunities but certainly does not discourage me: 1) Room Service closes down early but one can always do door dash or some food delivery; 2) The restaurant and bar staff is not the friendliest. Not rude but certainly not friendly like housekeeping and the front desk; and 3) No major amenities like a gym or pool.

I am writing this review as I am so disappointed having just arrived at the hotel. Initially our welcome was fab in reception and our room wasn’t ready so we stored our luggage.
