We came back shortly afterwards to receive our key and settle in to our room. Although it was only 4pm we had travelled from the UK so it was late for us and we were tired. No welcome drink had been offered to us despite having to pay for this in the facility charge. I am being picky when I say we had no offer to transport our luggage to our room as it doesn’t really bother me but in every other 5 star hotel the staff have been insistent on delivering our luggage to the room. I had a bath immediately - the water was yellow? And the bath wasn’t big enough for a soak. There were no bathrobes or slippers as suggested and the soap was out of the packet with the wrapper in the bin which leads me to believe someone else had been in the room before us. The worst part of the room is no coffee or tea making facilities. I queried this and was brought a kettle. A bit pointless without tea, milk etc and cups. Anyway they have now brought me 2 cups and I have been advised to go to the shop round the corner to purchase tea etc. Honestly I have never stayed in a hotel before where this had not been included. The previous night we stayed in a Travelodge which cost £32 for the night and there was tea/coffee making facilities. There was an offer by staff to say they would see what they could do but nothing has been done at present. The complimentary WiFi is a con as you pay for this in the facility charge. Hopefully my next few days will be much better. On a positive the location is fab! Also this is a deluxe room that I have paid for and not the cheapest.

We had such a wonderful time here. We have become honourary Downtowners. From the moment we arrived we were welcomed like old friends. The lobby and bar is such a beautiful place, and the rooms were a delight. We shall certainly be coming back

Great boutique hotel in financial district. This property is close to a lot of tourist attractions as well as restaurants and bars. The lobby has a ski lodge type vibe and there is a great lobby bar for light snacks and drinks. There is also an Italian restaurant, Felice, which serves a great brunch on the weekends. Our room was upgraded and was extremely spacious for two people. The decor in the room is eclectic and has a great flow. The bathroom is extremely spacious as well. There is a decent amount of space to put your clothes away for a long weekend. In my opinion, their nightly rate was a good value compared to other hotels nearby that were no where near as nice as Gild Hall. We had breakfast Sunday morning at the restaurant, Felice. There was a lot of choices and they were very accommodating to dietary issues. Hotel staff are all very polite, friendly, and knowledgeable. Everyone always has a smile on their face! Complimentary wifi was a nice bonus. I highly recommend this hotel whether you're traveling for business or pleasure.

The Gild Hall hotel delivers on its promise of coolness. This hotel has a distinct decor that sets it apart from the pack. Yes, it may not be for everybody, but it is certainly cool. Other pros are that the rooms have a nice size, and the bed is comfortable. However, it seems clear that they do not pay attention to the small details which ultimately is what defines greatness. In my room, the shower cap was loose, there was no coffee making machine, the ac unit was too loud, and am not sure what type of glass the windows are made off, but I could hear the pigeon that landed in my window at 1 AM as if it was inside the room.

We were invited to a wedding in NYC and this was one of the 3 hotels on the list. This ended up being a great choice and exceeded any expectation that we had. The suite was large with a nice sitting area with large, screen TV. it also had a beautiful in room bar area with everything you needed to make your own drinks and a fully stock fridge. The bedroom was very comfortable and the bathroom was large with double sinks and a huge shower. The room was exceptionally clean and neat.

Gild Hall, located in the financial district is a hidden gem for travelers looking for a budget-friendly hotel that still exudes a chic and refined atmosphere. The staff is incredibly friendly and helpful! We checked-in at 5:00 AM (after a concert) and were worried that no one would be at the front desk despite calling ahead and letting them know we'd be arriving at an "off" time. When we arrived someone was indeed at the front with a smile on their face! The rooms are little on the smaller side but still feels luxe. I would note that the mattresses are more on the firm side - something to be aware of for those who have a difficult time sleeping on harder mattresses. The rooms and hotel itself are quiet which is great after being in the city all day and night. Would definitely recommend this location for anyone wanting to stay in the Financial District! The location is also fabulous - tons of restaurants, bars and shops within walking distance.

I was down in NYC with a friend to tour the city. We chose the Gild Hall where we would stay in for our weekend trip. Luckily for us, the associate of the hotel named Moisey was there to check us in. We had questions and service needs at the check in and throughout our entire trip. He was always there servicing and answering our questions as needed and as professionally and politely possible. Moisey, thank you!! you have made our trip and stay at Gild Hall unforgettable.

Room was spacious, clean and quiet. Bed was comfortable and all of the amenities were top notch. Plan your day so as to enjoy the breakfast and your evening to include a visit to the wine bar. The staff are fantastic, particularly Mose at the Front Desk.

I had to fly in to New York for less than 24 hours for a quick Saturday meeting. Obviously not my favorite thing but Gild Hall made it feel like a vacation- especially with their excellent customer service. Luis Chavez at the front desk immediately offered me some prosecco when I said it had been a long day, and made sure my stay was as seamless as possible. My room was gorgeous and the room service was fantastic. Don’t bother staying anywhere else- the Gild Hall beats them all.

Great location thanks to the Fulton subway station and friendly and efficient staff. Room was clean, pleasant and functional. Did not have breakfast on site and did not eat in the restaurant in the groundfloor, but it looked good and busy.

I guess you get what you pay for. Good pricing and great decor at this hotel. However the service was sorely lacking. Location was good. I didn't give up on Thompson Hotels as my next stay I booked at the Beekman which was AMAZING and well worth the higher price. They staff there was kind, courteous and helpful. Not so much at Gild Hall.

My husband and I stayed here on a long weekend in late October. We were sightseeing in lower Manhattan and we went to the Theater in Midtown and visited with family who live in Brooklyn. The location was perfect for us. It is very convenient to the subway and easy walking distance to the 9/11 Memorial and Museum and Battery Park and Seaport. The service was top notch. The decor was unique.

Gild Hall is a great cozy hotel in the heart of the financial district- visited our daughter for a 3 day weekend stay- hotel has a great vibe - the staff was friendly helpful and authentically cared about the guest experience. Connected to a great restaurant- Felice- food is fantastic. We will book our next stay here for sure!

We stayed here for a conference. Very familiar with Thompson due to a fantastic hotel in Nashville, TN. The rooms here are small, the hotel is old. The bathtub would not drain, nor would the drain lift. The water that filled it was yellow. And then finally, the second night at 12:10am, the smoke detector alarm started going off. And, the bed is hard as a rock.DO NOT stay here. The price is absurd for this quality.The answer to these problems was a free cup of coffee or breakfast. Not the point.

A lovely boutique hotel just off Wall St with a convenient location for a number of key attractions including the world trade centre, battery park and ferries to Ellis Island/ Statue of Liberty. Our family room was well-proportioned and appointed with very comfortable beds. The staff were exceptionally friendly - complimentary prosecco on arrival and on return from a long day's sightseeing throughout our visit were very welcome, as was attentiveness of reception and concierge. Great atmosphere in the bar and a lovely breakfast. Despite issues with our booking on arrival (booking.com were less than helpful!), we would highly recommend this hotel as a base for anyone planning a recreational or business break in the big apple.

Quirky, clean, big rooms and great staff! planned a surprised visit for my partners birthday from the UK and the staff helped me plan my visit excellently the only blooper was that we had arranged for the champagne to be in the room on arrival and it arrived as we were about to go out...

We booked the hotel based on the reputation of Thompson Hotels and chose the King Premium room. The room was spacious and we loved the hip decor. Unfotunately we weren't on a high floor so the room was very dark - no natural light given the surrounding buildings.Service was ordinary - front desk seemed disorganized when we arrived and their restaurant recommendations were terrible. It was our wedding anniversary and there was no acknowledgement of our special occasion as other NYC hotels had done for us in the past.The best part of our stay was having dinner at Felice. It is a gem in the hotel with the best Tuscan italian food we've had outside of Italy. Worth a dinner reservation on anyone's NYC itinerary.

If exercise is important to you during your stay then I would not recommend you stay here. There are 3 tiny gyms on 3 separate floors which consist of 1 x treadmill, 1 x cross trainer and 1 x set of weights. This is not enough for me as a regular gym-goer. Other than this the room was lovely and the service was great although one of the lifts was out during my entire stay which meant I had to wait a fair amount of time each morning to get down to the Lobby.

Elevators don’t work properly, and only one is actually useable (smells like vomit though). It literally takes 20-30 mins to get into your room or to leave the building, so plan on leave 30 mins early if you have an appointment.The room keys stop working on day of check out, so if you step out for breakfast or run an errand before checking out, make sure to stop by the front desk to reactivate your key, otherwise you’ll be locked out and have to come back down, which will take 30-35 mins due to the elevator issue. Aside from that, everyone seems nice. Great asthetic. Nice decor.
user_name:
RayMercer
New York City, New York

review_body: Close to Fulton station and waterfront the hotel is in a small quiet street.Hushed and warm atmosphere in the comfortable bed rooms but do not expect too much natural light.Extraordinary staff!If you like Art Deco, do not miss the amazing American International Building in 70 Pine Street.

We stayed for a weekend and would definitely return. The room was very clean, modern, and quiet. The hotel staff could not have been more helpful, friendly, and accommodating. Good location downtown, close to subway.

My husband and I have just had 4 nights here to celebrate my birthday at the start of a 3 week tour. What a gem of a hotel, with character both in public areas and room. Hotel is within a 5 minute walk of subway which will get you to Times Square in 20 minutes. You can walk to Battery Park to get ferry to Liberty island.Front of house staff were incredibly helpful especially with orienting us in what seemed like a maze of streets. Also helped with taxis. Breakfast was included with the price which was a real bonus for us.We upgraded to a superior king which was well worth it for the extra room. Beds was incredibly comfortable. It was a pleasure to return to this hotel and get away from the hustle and bustle of the main thoroughfares.

We had a great stay at this hotel. Very comfy bed, cozy and stylish atmosphere in the room, lobby and bar. The staff was kind and helpful. We will definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family!

A superior hotel! A su[erior Staff in every area! Will recomment to my associates.bei,ng handicaped they went out of their wayto make access easier for me. They were able to arrange transportation that ensured me being on yime for all my sngagements as well as personal shopping.

Dangerous bed frame which did not fit mattress and projected out - injured my leg.No coffee maker in room. Internet was OK. Door access card was hard to operate - took multiple tries. Minimal storage for clothes..

A beautiful venue that uses space well and incorporates a more rustic yet elegant ambiance with leather features. The welcome was fantastic and all of the hospitality workers ensured we had an amazing weekend.
user_name:
docabc2017
New York City, New York

review_body: The location made it easy to get to my business meetings as well as many food options. It is also fairly close to the 9/11 memorial and some shopping. The service in the property was very poor. Both from the staff, and the internet. I would look for other options in the area.

8 out of 10. no bed bugs, front desk staff is great, prices are affordable (for lower Manhattan) and there is a small gym and restaurant on site. Walking distance from Brookfield Place. Only challenge - sometimes taxis and Uber drivers have a hard time finding the hotel

I may be old fashion, but I expect something a little special for $500 per night. The front desk staff was great and so is the location. The room was small but appropriate for NYC.My issues:1) The glass door to the bathroom is just wrong. I don't really want to see my partner in the bathroom.2) There were holes in the towels and a small amount of mold growing on the shower curtain.3) If you aren't going to have a coffee maker in the room, have coffee downstairs. Coffee service was $16.4) If you are going to charge a $19 "facilities charge," you should have some facilities. When i asked, they said it was for the internet.5) The shower gel didn't come out of the little bottle so I used the bar soap from the sink in the shower. Over the entire five days, they never replaced the sink soap. I had to take it back and forth from the shower.None of these are huge issue, but I wouldn't stay at the Gild Hall again.Because the survey asks if there was bottled water in the room, I feel obligated to add that it was priced at $9.

We recently stayed at Gild Hall and after a long day of travel mishaps, we were exhausted checking in at 1am. That all changed when Anthony Vasquez checked us in. I’ve stayed at a number of Two Roads properties and be was by far the greatest employee I’ve interacted with. He went above and beyond to welcome us and immediately the whole hectic travel day washed away. As a fellow hotelier, I can say that Anthony is truly one of a kind and worth re-visiting a hotel for. Thank you for making our weekend !

Nice change of pace being downtown. Hotel definitely has a welcoming dark and sexy vibe. The overwhelming majority of the front desk staff (mainly young men) were super friendly and accommodating. There was only one gentleman Sunday night at the front desk who didn’t greet us coming back that evening. The welcome champagne was a nice touch as was the $20 minibar credit and premium WiFi courtesy of being Expedia VIP guests. The rooms were a decent size for NYC (we were given a complimentary upgrade at check-in) and the bed was super comfortable. The room was lacking a few modern touches such as no lamps on the nightstands by the bed and no outlet by one of the nightstands by the bed. Also the minibar was a bit crowded, so difficult albeit not impossible to make room for your personal items. The bathroom was nice overall but slightly lacking in vanity counter space. The hotel was located convenient to 9/11, Wall Street, Battery Park etc. Neighborhood is quieter at night but still seemed very safe. The hotel is about a 3 minute walk from the subway with numerous eateries and shops nearby. Overall we had a great stay and I would gladly return to this hotel!
user_name:
White2tn
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: When hotel staff doesn't wear nametags, that has to be a red flag! The service and cleanliness don't seem to be priorities. If you do go try not to stay in any room is ending in the number three. They seem to be built in an area where the smallest rooms are. There's not even a full length mirror. I've had college dorm rooms that were larger and nicer than this hotel. It's a shame. I was really looking forward to this stay.

The hotel was very clean and the front desk staff were exceptionally helpful. We could store our luggage both before and after check-in. Room was small but the bed very comfortable. Ate in the restaurant downstairs and although expensive was excellent quality.

Perfect location. Easy to find and close to wall street. I like the style of the design. 100% like what it looks on the website. Very convenient to check in and check out. The staff here are nice. Highly recommend!

After a long day of working in the city I checked into the Gild after 7pm and was greeted with a glass of Procesco and a warm reception area. Very nice touch. The room was comfortable, the staff friendly, and location is perfect. You can walk to battery park and the WTC Memorial. The Path train to NJ is close as are other subways. The red carpet in the hallways is a little intense, but other than that, great hotel!

I've stayed here 3 times now - I travel for work and am in a lot of different hotels, and this one truly has fit my needs. The staff are terrific, and I was assisted especially well this last time by Paolo and Anthony, who helped me with a future reservation challenge. I can also say the rest of the reception team has been exceptional, and one even remembered my name. That makes a huge difference!I've been in rooms only on lower floors so far, and the noise hasn't been bad except from another room. Ammenities are nice, bed is comfortable, room is spacious! One improvement I'd make is new, fluffier towels - they are the kind you'd find at a 2-star. Aside from that, though, I have no complaints at all.The hotel is close to many attractions and excellent restaurants. It's about a .5 mi walk from my office, so I get to experience NYC each morning and evening as I walk - perfect for me! I imagine most visitors are here for fun, rather than business, but if you are working anywhere in the Financial District, it's great.

It was a nice stay. Room was clean, bad was super comfortable.. minibar was filled very good. The reception team was really amazing. I would like to return again. Champaign during check in after long road was really gorgeous)) Thank you guys

I loved staying here. It was close to many amenities and is a beautiful property. The rooms are large (for NYC) and well decorated. The food in Felice was tasty. The decor is modern and funky. The staff is young and hip. Very helpful.

why is this review minimum of characters? A short review would do I guess. Anyway, we had a nice stay in your hotel. Nice people at the desk, supporting us where we had wishes and questions. A accident with a damaged suitcase in your restroom was solved satisfactory and smoothly

The location and room charge is nice. We can walk down to the around hotel, Delli, Station and other shops and visiting spots. But room is dark. If darkness will be prefarable, it will be fine. Need water and hot water service at least.

Nice hotel in financial district , good area to stay if doing attraction at that end of Manhattan. Took bikes ( free of charge) to Brooklyn bridge , easy walk to 9/11, Ferry, etc . Staff very helpful, nice rooms and great breakfast . Would highly recommend

My boyfriend and I traveled from across state to just hang out for the weekend. We had an excellent time at Gild Hall and after our experience would recommend this property to anyone going to NYC. First- the price! This is defiantly a bang for your buck hotel. It felt luxury and 5 star for a steal for a price. Located in the Financial District it was the most quiet hotel we have ever stayed in in NYC. Access to the subway was incredibly convenient and since the hotel is located on more of a "side street," pick up and drop off from an uber/lyft/cab is simple and not rushed. We were greeted by the front desk staff, who were very friendly and were actually able to check in early. We also somehow managed to get a room upgrade in the process. While I understand this is all based on availability and luck, we were so pleased with this high level of customer service. The room was clean and comfy and we WISH WE COULD HAVE TAKEN THE BED HOME WITH US! We stopped by the front desk for the free champagne toast at 4PM which was a nice perk before heading out for the evening. The attached restaurant was decently affordable, swanky and worked for a quick meal when we arrived. The only slight "issue" we had was that our room was not refreshed during our 2 night stay. We are not sure if we left up the DND sign, but regardless it didn't make our break our experience at all. The hotel staff grabbed us some new towels very quickly without interrupting our getting ready. Honestly, it was a 5 star experience and we were lucky to have found Gild Hall. We would absolutely stay here or at any Thompson Hotels again.

The hotel was very comfortable, staff was wonderful, location was fun! We strolled out to the waterfront and down to Battery Park. We typically don't stay downtown - so this was an unexpected treat! We would definitely stay here again

This was probably our 10th stay at Gild Hall. I love the Financial District neighborhood and Gild Hall is just a welcoming, cozy, quiet, VERY CLEAN and comfortable hotel. The neighborhood is full of cafes, restaurants, and bars. If you go on a weekend, it's much quieter and so less congested than mid-town. Fulton Street metro station is just a few blocks away and from there you can go almost anywhere. Front desk staff remembers you and just go out of their way to make sure your stay is perfect. The hotel is also just a few blocks from the Seaport, Stock Exchange, 9/11 Memorial and Freedom Tower. Overall, a great place to stay for a weekend away.

The staff at this hotel seemed to really care about doing a good job. I was very pleased with my visit. The decor is sort of manly, but the hotel was very clean and comfortable and the restaurant service was very fast and the food was delicious.

Hotel was very comfortable and the staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was nice, of a reasonable size for NY and well equipped. The mini bar has a lot on offer, but it’s expensive. There is no free bottled water either. However, the hotel is well placed for sightseeing, has great subway connections and lots of local coffee shops and mini marts surrounding it. The do have a lovely, and very welcome, free glass of prosecco every day for residents between 6-8 (I think this time is right), which was very welcome!

This was our first trip to New York and we were pleased to be staying in this small hotel away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square! It was ideally located for visiting Ground Zero and the ferries. It had a lovely Italian bistro ‘Felice’ which we used on two occasions. It served up delicious pastas, seafood and soups. Rooms were comfortable, clean and quiet. Front desk staff were helpful and knowledgeable and we enjoyed our welcome drink of fizz! The only negative point we found was the reception area and rooms were dark but wouldn’t stop us from revisiting.

I would highly reccommend Gild Hall to anyone looking to stay in Lower Manhattan. The rooms are comfortable and clean, it's within walking distance of many historic sites and neighborhoods as well as the Freedom Tower and museum and transportation. They have a great Italian restaurant on site as well as a bar and the staff is very friendly and accommodating. All in all a very pleasant stay. Thompson Hotels always gets it right!

This hotel from the moment you walk in feels like a hotel for a man. Given it's location that should be no surprise. The lobby is dimly lit, I arrived in the evening, there was no one at the door to help me collect my bags. When you walk into the lobby the desk is to the right, and it was crowded because there was a wait in the bar. The staff at the desk was helpful. You need a key card to have access to any of the floors through the elevator, the hotel itself seems to be in good condition, but it just feels dim.The hallways once you arrive on your floor are beautiful, but reds and browns ... I stayed on 14, one of the floors with an ice machine (not all of them have them).The details in the room are thought out, robes, umbrellas, mini bar, (very expensive, $9 for water) safe, qtips, and basic soaps and lotions. I didn't love the blinds, no black out curtains :( it still let some of the light in, though the buildings are so close so there isn't a ton of light overall. The room is clean, the sheets and towels felt great, and there was good hooks up for electronics, in the desk, and the lamps, and in the clock. BTW, the TV was huge!I guess it was just a lot more masculine that I would have thought, so it was a bit off putting, and that is why I am giving 4 stars not 5. In terms of location, it was a few minute walk to my conference at pier 17, which was great, there is a starbucks and juice bar near buy, but the hotel is a little tricky to find the entrance to.
user_name:
bek822
New York City, New York

review_body: This hotel is an excellent choice if one is staying in the Financial District. My room was very comfortable. The food at Felice was delicious. I ordered room service which was prompt.I enjoyed my stay at this hotel.

Not only were the rooms larger than expected, the staff was superb with an ‘it’s my pleasure’ service approach. Great value on all points. We walked to all attractions with ease. 9-11 memorial, Battery Park & the Statue of Liberty, the Brooklyn Bridge, Wall Street & the NYC Stock Exchange to touch the Bull, and even the Classic Pearl Street Diner, with its Neon lights on life support.
user_name:
Peter K
Charlotte Amalie, St. Thomas

review_body: Our stay at Gild Hall was one of the absolute best hotel experiences I’ve ever had! Our flight was delayed an entire day due to weather— we were so sad to be missing a night in the city — the amazing staff not only alleviated my concerns as I frantically called from the airport— but once we finally got there the next day— the staff knew exactly who we were and they were ready to accommodate us and make us feel beyond welcome with their kind words/champagne/note/baked goods/fruit basket/etc. — we were so warmly welcomed! The rooms were incredible— comfortable beds, great view, high ceiling, clean room, comfortable robes, and wonderful amenities— and I would HIGHLY recommend eating at the restaurant (Felice). I’m so thankful for our stay with gild hall. We will definitely be staying with them again and of course recommending them to everyone we know!

We found the staff friendly and eager to please. Our room had a queen bed, desk , chair and a side reading chair. Decor is pleasant but in darker tones. Our room looked into another building so natural light was missing. The hotel room offered nice amenities like shampoo, shower gel, hairdryer, robe and oversized towels. The beds were firm and comfortable. Room was clean. Room temperature was comfortable. The hallways are decorated with quirky fun photographs. Best of all, the room rate was reasonable for New York. Wifi was neither slow or fast..... We would return to this hotel without reservation.

I spent 3 nights at Gild Hall when on a business trip in New York in May. I had been used to staying at the Andaz Wall Street, but after a less than satisfactory stay there in April, I decided to try the Gild Hall.After a very long and tiring journey the welcome I received at check was very warm, friendly and efficient. This attentive and professional service was apparent throughout my stay and the staff could not have been more helpful. It made a very nice change from the larger chains and it felt much more comfortable being in this more characterful and personable boutique hotel.The hotel is very well laid out, with a well-appointed quirky lobby area and a cosy, quite buzzing adjoining bar. Again, the service was great when I had the obligatory ‘nightcap’ with a great selection of drinks. The restaurant (Fellini) looked excellent, and very popular, although I didn’t have the chance to have a meal there.The room was of a reasonable size, given the location, very well appointed and clean, nicely decorated with a comfortable large bed. The room was a little dark, and the views non-existent, but this was to be expected given the financial district location. The Bathroom was well laid out with a bathtub and shower in a retro style with high quality complementary toiletries. The housekeeping service was top notch and the room was always spotless.Location wise it’s a short stroll to Wall Street and all area’s in the Financial District and with easy access to the nearby Fulton Street metro station.In summary, a very well located Boutique hotel which clearly puts a premium on a personable, efficient and authentic service. Highly recommended.

Booked here through my company perks on an impromptu trip out of state. The hotel was clean, the staff was friendly, it's located close to three major subway stops, and is removed from the major touristy bustle you get nearer to Times Square. All this led to a relaxing stay where I could come back easily and get away from the crowd to unwind and cool down.

I have stayed at Gild Hall quite a few times and will continue to stay there when in New York. It's in a great location and the service is great! It's not a sterile, typical-corporate style hotel. The ambiance relaxes you as soon as you walk in the door.

Enjoyed recent stay at hotel. nice room- a little dark. Very friendly service - felt very welcome. Cozy lobby and bar with cool library atmosphere. Convenient to Battery Garden area. Liked the bath products.

This place was a little bit out of the way, had to guess a little with my cabbie, but the interior was wonderful and the room itself was very clean and well laid out, staff were helpful and polite. Only issue was the bedsheets were too warm - woke up in the middle of the night in a sweat.

Everything about Gild Hall is perfect. The service is exceptional and intuitive, from the glass of bubbly at check-in to the daily texts making sure all of your needs are met to the bartenders who remember what you want before you say a word. The design is warm and sexy, from the candlelit lobby every night to the rich leather throughout to the cozy corners and moody lighting. The food at Felice is exceptional. The mini-bar selections are the most delightful surprise. The location is perfect if you need to be in the financial district. I couldn't possibly recommend Gild Hall more highly.

We stayed 2 nights for my daughter's wedding. If was very comfortable, clean, quiet. We slept great - which is something that doesn't always happen away from home. Wonderful staff and service. Our rate came with breakfast at the next door restaurant and that was very good.
user_name:
nancybny
New York City, New York

review_body: Rooms were large for NY, clean and staff was extremely nice and helpful. I was traveling with my husband and liked all aspects of hotel. bed was comfortable, air conditioning was well functioned. Room service was great. and i also loved free complimentary wine in the evening

Love everything about this little sweet boutique hotel down in the business district.Wonderful service and attention to detail. I am thrilled with the text service you can get from hotel before check in and during stay.

A fabulous hotel, well located in the Financial District and only a few minutes walk from the World Trade Centre Memorial, Wall Street, the Pier 11 ferry and numerous restaurants, bars and shops. The staff could not have been more helpful, the restaurant was fabulous (very popular with New Yorkers) and our bedroom had a large comfortable bed, and most importantly to me, it was quiet. I would definitely return to the Gildhall on my next trip to NYC. I also highly recommend taking the ferry across to Brooklyn if the weather permits - only $2.75 for a spectacular view of the FiDi and Statue of Liberty.

I have come o expect nothing bu the best from the Thompson chains and it continues not to disappoint. The Financial and 9-11 area is a must stay for weekends, so much to do. Get out early for a walk across the Brooklyn bridge, Seaport area, 9-11 at dusk is very moving. The Gild Hall is in the middle of everything, great hotel.

Awesome hotel, staff was very helpful and willing to go the extra mile. I really like how we were able to leave our luggage out front after checkout, which enabled us to hang out a little longer. Next time I come back, I will be staying with you again.

This place is absolutely fabulous! We visited and wanted to be near our event and The Gild delivered! No worries with the car, rooms are modern and super-clean, breakfast was great, the staff was superb and the price was right!! Couldn't ask better. We are returning soon!

Outstanding experience on all counts, particularly during check-in and room service. Staff is responsive, polite and helpful. Food is excellent and authentic, although a bit pricy (even for NY). Room was huge with all expected amenities. Only regret was I did not have the time to visit the fitness center.

Our go to hotel whenever we visit the city. It is a quiet retreat in the Financial District, away from the noise of Times Square, but we can be there in just minutes if we choose We also love Felice restaurant, the food is amazing! Service is outstanding in both the hotel and attached restaurant. Everyone at the front desk was so helpful. We also had a beautiful fruit and cookie basket along with sparkling wine and glasses waiting in our room when we checked in as it was our anniversary. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone!

Fantastic and trendy hotel in the financial district. Steps away from everything you could want. If you come here, make sure to ask for a high floor. The lower ones have some troubles with street noise. The staff make the hotel, doing their best to help and make you feel as if you are at your second home.

We had a great stay in the Gild Hall in New York. It was nearby the subway, which is always pleasant if you travel in New York. The Staff is very kind and if there was a problem, they helped us like it should be, with kindness and without any troubles. We would recommend this hotel if you want to be nearby Wall Street and the complete Financial District. We enjoyed our stay and would definitely come back if we visit New York again!

It's location is convenient. The accommodations are clean and comfortable. I like the atmosphere and appreciate the helpful, cordial staff. I had a relaxing, enjoyable experience. I will definitely make it my place to stay when I plan another family trip to the City.

Excellent service and very genuinely nice Team at this hotel. The rooms are very dark but reasonably sized and pleasant. The bar area is okay but more poeple use it to eat in the evening, but I managed to get a seat at the bar every night. We ate in the restaurant on the last day and the food was good, decent and always busy for the time we stayed.

Dependable product served fresh daily by any representative from any department. From check-in to check-out I have yet to have any remotely negative experience with this hotel or staff member. This was my 9th stay there and hopefully my business takes me there again. I look forward to my 10th visit.

Love the hotel, the people are so nice and very helpful, the room was great and bed really comfortable , the bar was a plus when you came in after a long day. Great martinis and breakfast was perfect  One of my top places to stay in the financial district.

It’s a really great 4 star hotel but generally feels a little dark because of the buildings around it. Amenities were similar to the sister hotel, The Beekman, with a lot less frills but the service were both excellent

Incredibly polite and hospitable staff. Complimentary prosecco at the front desk is a nice touch. Room was clean, bed comfy. Hotel was close to several restaurants and train lines at Fulton Street metro. Only cons were that the hotel is pretty dark (I guess this type of lighting sets the mood) and the bathroom door is frosted, so that could be disruptive to a guest still in the bed.
user_name:
saablue
New York City, New York

review_body: I loved EVERYTHING about this place, the customer service was great, attentive and in a timely manner. The food at the restaurant it’s superb. I really like the vibe of the place, very cozy yet classy a sophisticated, the perfect couple get away. :)
user_name:
kaguir772110
New York City, New York

review_body: Wanted to just spend a night in NYC after a Broadway show--had pretty much resigned ourselves to someplace crowded, overwrought and shamelessly expensive. Instead, we found Gild Hall--tucked in the Financial District, close to everything but just far enough away. The check-in staff was funny, good-natured and helpful above-and-beyond the call. We'll never forget being welcomes with glasses of Prosecco! Our room was cozy and quiet and well-appointed. We're almost afraid to post this review because we'd like to keep Gild Hall a secret!

I would recommend hotel for any business traveler. The food in rest/bar was excellent, room was clean and comfortable. And there is free quality wifi. Only challenges were small shower and week pillows. The healthy menu choices could be improved.

Outstanding in every way! Staff are amazing, friendly, remember you year after year, and care about assuring that your stay is perfect. Stay here over and over again and can't wait until next time. Location is excellent. Easy to get all over the city on subway and even walking distance to China Town and World Trade Center. Quality at every turn! Love the welcome champagne.

Great hotel in a convenient location. We would stay here again! No coffee in the room was a disappointment and the staff was not well informed on several questions we had asked. But rooms were great, bed super comfortable, and the decor was wonderful!

This is a small boutique hotel that is very laid back and stylish. They aim to please, and in some cases under deliver. First the positives - location is good, adjoining restaurant is decent, great happy hour, good atmosphere, and rooms are comfortable. Now, suggestions for improvement - the hotel toiletries are limited and poor quality, service is hit and miss and it lacks follow through. This hotel has great potential, they just need to focus on the details. (Rating is based on 4* hotel).

Swell place to stay for a long weekend with a significant other. Staff and atmoshpere was great. Location to downtown and other areas couldnt be better. Will definetly stay again when in New York City.

The Gild Hall is a really nice botique hotel in lower Manhattan, near the financial district. The staff is pleasant and efficient, the rooms generous in size, clean and comfortable, and the location perfect for access to the financial district, 9/11 memorial and the Oculus. The attached restaurant is nice as well. All in all a great value..

I would definitely stay at this hotel again. I usually opt for the chain hotel, but I would highly recommended it to anyone. I liked the location and was hesitate because I usually stay in Midtown. This was a great chose for me.

Quiet location, close to subways, rooms were ok. Every hotel employee treated us like royalty. Not as luxurious as some other NY hotels, but the service more than makes up for that. Would definitely stay here again.

We booked here to be close to some of the lower Manhattan tourist attractions. A short walk to Brooklyn Bridge, 9-11 Memorial, Battery Park and Wall Street. Also close to Chinatown for those who don’t mind a longer walk.Although there is not the multitude of dining choices available uptown, the Financial District still has a good range of options for dining. Not least the Felice at Gild Hall, which has good breakfasts and great Italian for dinner.Our room was not spacious but it was stylishly decorated, well maintained and clean. It was also quiet!Staff were excellent and helpful in any situation.

During my stay I received a very warm and gracious greeting form the front desk staff. Very outstanding service here and after check in you get a toast of champagne! Lounge looked fun and quirky if somewhat small, and the restaurant/bar had a lively scene each time I passed through. The room was comfortable and accommodating but watch out; while most hotels now give complimentary water bottles, there is a charge for the water bottle provided in the room. Business Center met my small needs (printing a document) and my room was quiet with no outside noise interference. The front desk were very helpful for every question/situation I had. The bed was *very* comfortable and gave me one of my best nights of sleep in some time.The hotel is only a 2 minute walk from the nearest subway to take you to midtown. The biggest quirk for myself and other guests was needing a room key to operate the guest floors within the elevator. My room also lacked a hotel information booklet which I found odd and led to me relying on the front desk for all of my questions. Outside of that, it was a pretty lovely stay and exceeded my expectations. This place is different, but in a good way.

Though it took me a little while to find the hotel, I was greeted by a friendly staff, the suite was absolutely sleek. The bed was the most comfortable I have ever slept on and it was very clean. Definitely recommend this hotel and I truly enjoyed my stay!!
user_name:
Michelle C
staten island, United States

review_body: I got a deal to stay in the hotel for ~$80 per night. The room is good and clean, but the AC sometimes was a little too noisy. GPS would not always work since it's cramped into a small area so close to Wall Street, very nice staff and clean service. Wouldn't recommend the coffee from the restaurant since you can get way better coffee if you walk out of the hotel.
user_name:
tonyshiqing05
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We truly enjoyed our experience! Very personal service down to remembering where my daughter is going to college in the fall! She felt special receiving a personal note with fruit and cookies! The bed was really comfortable and the room was immaculate

The Gild Hall is a cut above the rest. It is stylish, not a chain or cookie cutter, is unique, has the best and most comfortable beds and the staff are absolutely amazing and cannot do too much to make your stay a great one. Real ownership in the product, the experience and creating value and outstanding enjoyment

It made our NYC stay of 6 days very comfortable. This was a business and family trip for us and we felt so at home. People are super friendly, service is quick, nice neighborhood and we would go back in a sec

I loved almost everything about this hotel. From the moment I arrived and was offered a glass of chilled Prosecco at the door, I felt the warmth and welcoming atmosphere of Gild Hall. The hotel itself is in a great downtown location and is easy to get to on the subway. I took public transportation from the airport to Penn Station and then the subway line that stops at Fulton Street. My king suite was comfortable, beautiful and spacious and thankfully, the air conditioning worked efficiently and well during a very intense heat wave. The front desk staff was courteous and responsive to all of my needs including Robert, Roberto, Luis and Andy. Any time I requested anything from housekeeping to be delivered to my room, it would arrive moments later. The restaurant Felice is conveniently located downstairs, and with all of the hundreds of choices of fantastic restaurants in NYC, I returned to Felice many times because the food and service were outstanding. My only complaint is that the hotel does not offer premium TV channels or movie rental options and I would suggest that this policy be changed. Other than this, my stay at Gild Hall was perfect and I will look forward to returning here every time I travel to NYC. Thank you for a wonderful stay!!!

Most hotels in Manhattan are pricey and often you cannot open your door because it hits the bed. Gild Hall offers a great price with plenty of room (by NYC standards) and a complimentary glass of prosecco during check in is a nice touch.My only issue, as with most hotels in the financial district, is loading and unloading can be a bit difficult

beautiful hotel near the seaport. the staff was friendly, breakfast was included. the rooms and lobby are beautifully decorated. the only draw back was not complementary water, it was $9 bottle in the room and the mini fridge was stuffed with stuff they were trying to sell.

This hotel has so much to offer-I was amazed at the great service and the champagne at check-in! Super clean and convenient to everything. Great shopping and dining is just steps away. I will return on my next trip, I am hooked!

A gem of a hotel, amazing service, classy to the max. If you're going to book a party, this is the place. The food was great, the event planners go out of their way to make sure all your needs are taken care of, and the quality you get for the price you pay is unbeatable. A boutique experience.

I stayed for two nights on a business trip and really enjoyed this hotel. It's an improvement over the choices Corporate Travel has made in the past. The staff was friendly and helpful. The welcoming glass of Prosecco was a treat! They upgraded me and the room was lovely. I didn't have a chance to visit the restaurant but it looked quite nice and the crowd was cool. I hope to return!

Excellent customer service from the moment of arrival. The guys at the front desk were wonderful and very welcoming. Great first impression. Room was lovely and we were upgraded without a hassle. We had dinner in Chinatown, about 20 minutes away by foot, and wanted to have dessert in the hotel. The manager of the restaurant could have turned us away but didn't. He made room for us. Room was quiet.If service is important, book this hotel. Wish all hotels had employees like those at Gild Hall. Thank you for a memorable stay.

Came into town for a work trip.Gild Hall offers a clean, classic, dark, and handsomely appointed hotel. The lobby bar and second floor are quaint but spacious enough for dinner and a nightcap.The rooms are classy and handsome. I do wish the shower aligned with the vision of the bed but it lacked the same quality. The ceiling height offers a majestic and spacious welcoming.Staff was friendly and the welcome champagne when checking in was a great touch.I did struggle to sleep as a guest was smoking weed throughout the night. I did alert the front desk and by mid morning, our entire hall smelled like it. Even people on the elevator commented on the strength of the smell. The front desk told me they were trying to get to the bottom of it but still no luck. My floor reeked.Overall a nice hotel, down in the financial district. A bit of a pain for uber’s to find but the bellman was great in finding me a can.
user_name:
ExploringtheWorldNow
New York City, New York

review_body: Fantastic hotel! Exceptional service and kind hearts♡Thank you for helping me with my mom... a very special shout out to Anthony, the night manager, you are Amazing! Also Andrew at the front desk, helpful friendly and always smiling! As soon as you walk in the door you feel welcome warm and at home! The cocktails at the bar were exceptionally crafty and tasty! And finally I cannot forget the two guys at the front desk this morning (sorry I didn't catch your names) but I really appreciate you giving me that coffee when you could see how rough my night was♡

Spotty service. Coffee delivery was 35 minutes in the making. Room was worn. Third time at this hotel was not a charm. The restaurant, Felice, is great. Tuna steak was first rate. The bartender is phenomenal.

Was moved out of my room to another hotel at midnight!The only hotel to move me to wasn't half as nice - but they insisted since the evidence in the bed and on my legs was clear it was serious.The hotel staff was very nice about it. But having to move hotels in the middle of the night was the worst.

I was in NY for a four day business trip in the financial district and stayed at Gild Hall. Great room size, clean, yummy restaurant downstairs and the staff was very professional. 10 minute walk to NYSE, churches and parks. Highly recommend!

As far as hotels in New York City, Gild Hall is spacious, clean and has excellent customer service. I stayed for business for about a week and all of the staff from the restaurant to the front desk were so delightful. Moisey was especially accommodating- he made sure to continuously check up and make sure our stay was pleasant. His personal touch made the experience that much better. Would stay here again.

Stayed for 4 nights as a first time visitor to NYC to see the various sights, and really enjoyed Gild Hall. Good location convenient to walking to many things, and just around the corner from Fulton Street metro station for easily getting to most of the best known sights in Manhattan. Room was clean & comfortable, the staff were friendly, and altogether it was a pleasant experience. Price was steep by my standards, but good value compared to other options I looked at in Manhattan.

Just arrived at Gild Hall after traveling around west coast and staying in various hotels and Gild Hall is an absolute standout! The lobby and rooms are beautiful. Great atmosphere. Anthony and Eric have been so informative. We will definitely stay here again next time we visit NYC...

This hotel is definitely one of my top 5 ever. Great FiDi location. Clean, safe and very friendly, helpful staff. I didn't want to leave. Front desk team answered every question I had. Lovely meal @ Felice too. I will definitely stay here again.

I enjoyed my stay at this hotel immensely. The group rate was very equitable and I was able to maintain the fee for the remaining time I stayed beyond the group event. That was extremely lovely and permitted me to spend 11 nights there. I will certainly alert family and friends that if you're away for a length of time, this hotel is a valuable one.

If this was not a business funded trip I could not have afforded to stay there. Between the room price and cost of food this was beyond what I would have been able to afford. The rooms were very clean and the staff very friendly and Helpful. The location was great and I am happy I had an opportunity to stay there.

We recently stayed in the Gild Hotel, the location is great! It's a short walk from the Pier and 5 minutes from Wall Street. There are lots of restaurants nearby and you can walk everywhere.This is a very trendy hotel, with a beautiful lobby. Upon check-in, we were greeted with a glass of prosecco and a smile. Our room was small, but nice - quiet and the bed was very comfortable. It's rare to find a hotel in a quiet location in NYC, however, in the Gild, we heard no noise.People complain about the washroom, however, there was a frosted door and a curtain and I found it completely private. Similarly, the air conditioner noise wasn't offensive, more the sound of a fan.

Love everything about this hotel. The staff, who really truly give you personal attention. The rooms and the spacious king size beds. The bar and its wine list. The cool lobby filled with guests from all over the world. The excellent Felice Restaurant, great for breakfast and dinner. Finally, the location, which is within a few blocks walk to every subway line you need to get east side, west side, and brooklyn. Plus walking distance to Chinatown, Tribecca, Soho and The east and west villages. We're in NY a lot and this has become our go-to hotel.
user_name:
FrequentFlyer513
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The hotel is located in lower Manhattan with excellent connection to all subways. The rooms are comfortable and clean, being both the room and the bathroom of reasonable size considering NYC standards. The price/value relation is very good. Staff is friendly.

This is a beautiful hotel with attentive staff. Upon checking in, you are offered a glass of bubbly, a very nice touch. The rooms are stocked with a full bar and bottles of wine. The living room is comfortable and the bed was super! The shower had good pressure and the lighting was great for doing my make-up without struggling. The staff is very attentive and I would recommend dinner and drinks as well. I will stay here again.

My stay was brief but very enjoyable. GIld Hall has a very courteous and helpful staff. They are also knowledgeable, helping me find the event I was attending in the evening. The hotel was also very close to the office I was visiting so I could walk there each morning in a matter of minutes.

So glad I tried Gild Hall last year. It's so much better than other chain hotels. Lots of character and surprisingly spacious rooms. Good location for most of FiDi. Great staff and service. I book here frequently.

Staff is exceptional and the hotel offers top of the line service and amenities. The bed was super comfortable and the room itself was clean and plush. Great place to stay, they greet you with a glass of Prosseco and everyone is always smiling. Quick check in and check out too.

This hotel is a confoundingly good value. If you want to walk out of your door into NYC mayhem, go somewhere else. Gild Hall is amazingly situated so you will feel the unmistakable energy of New York but feel sheltered by it at the same time. Lower Manhattan (downtown/financial district) and particularly the area around Gild Hall is surrounded by great restaurants and bars, but also has a old world, cobble street charm and an amazing level of quiet compared to the rest of NYC. The rooms are well appointed, and the staff is top notch. I mean it. They are all just really nice folks who know how to do their jobs very, very well. I HIGHLY recommend this spot.

Comfortable and cozy. Wonderful stay in NYC financial district. Staff was wonderful and the cedar smell of the lobby made our arrival pleasant. Room was cozy but spacious and staff was responsive to our requests.

Great little boutique hotel, located very close to the World Trade Centre, Battery Park and the Manhattan area. Only one negative.....breakfast is very poor!, but the Felice Italian restaurant which operates in the evening time is super, with a good menu and authentic Italian plates.

Spent 5 nights at the quirky Gild Hall hotel. Makes a nice change from the large chains with a unique character and reasonable sized rooms. Bathroom was well appointed with a tub and shower over all in a retro style. Don’t expect great views as buildings are pretty packed in around the financial district but we did have a view, of sorts, despite this.The best aspect of this hotel was the attentive and professional staff who really made us feel welcome and truly important guests - not just a number; which is rare anywhere especially in NYC. Housekeeping also deserves a special mention as the room was always serviced to the high3st standard thanks to the lady from Croatia (didn’t get her name).Didn’t use the on site Fellini restaurant although had intended to but my wife was unwell on the day, but it was sure popular and looked good. Plenty of other places to eat around and about albeit mostly fast food joints but quality was generally good. Good transport links with nearby Fulton Street metro station and easy walk to Battery Park, 9/11 memorial and Brooklyn Bridge.Thoroughly recommended

I cannot say enough wonderful things about the staff and hotel. The hotel is nicely decorated, easy to navigate and spotlessly clean. The room was a great size and also spotless. What made it an even better experience was how kind and supportive the staff were. They were approachable, friendly, informative and willing to help with requests. I could feel how proud the staff feel about their work and it really made the difference. Thank you so much. We will be back.

Small boutique hotel but very comfy. Nice size room, great attention to details, great location, very accommodating. Nice restaurant in hotel with good food and great variety of wines. Great weekend spot, centrally located in FiDi.
user_name:
mkastner2017
New York City, New York

review_body: Great little spot in the lower east. Service was very personable, attentive and authentic. Lobby is nicely appointed as well with a great lobby bar. The vibe at the hotel is lovely and unique. The room is a bit cozy (even with an upgraded room size option) but that is to be expected in NYC. Overall, would definitely recommend this property!

Very good location and excellent service, this place is the best choice if you want to stay downtown. The Felice restaurant provides good food and drinks, breakfast is good, too. The room was very clean, good room service and mini bar.

In the realm of downtown NYC, this is a bit tucked away so I'd have never stumbled upon it without my work travel site. It was clean, safe, friendly and met all my needs. It might just become my go-to place for my NY work trips.

My friend and I loved everything about this hotel. The atmosphere was very unique and comfortable. The staff went above and beyond to make sure our stay was perfect. I’ll definitely be staying there again one day!

We were stayed at the Gild Hall because we participated in the 5 Boro 40 Mile Bike Tour on May 6,2018. The front staff were WONDERFUL (Van Hallen & Andy). I did not get the name of the staff member that stored our bikes and bags.He was so VERY NICE TOO! We have stayed at the Gild Hall several times. All our stays were GREAT!!!!

So I write this review with a heavy heart. Not just because I am no longer in NYC, but with a fear that I am going to encourage people to stay here and I’ll never get a room next time I stay ! It is safe to say that all the reviewers who are raving about this hotel are 100% correct ! I have stay in NYC fairly regularly for business and this is by far the best hotel I have stayed in (I always stay downtown). The staff could not be more helpful, the rooms and spacious and quirky, and the location is excellent .... lots of bars and restaurants around. I ran every morning of my 5 night stay and it’s easy to join the walkway at South Street Seaport. Overall a great stay ... I’ll be back as long as it’s not fully booked !

Stayed for four nights.Staff were excellent and friendly, happy to give recommendations etc.Didn't go to the italian restaurant, though it had a good menu and was always busy (a good sign).Very well located in the financial district. Would happily stay here again and recommend to others travelling to New York.

We stayed here for a girl's weekend. The location was perfect and the bar/restaurant are fabulous! The cocktails were very creative, unique and absolutely delicious. The staff was friendly and very attentive. Everyone in our group wants to come back here! Don't change a thing!

Greeted cheerfully at the front desk, we were anticipating a great experience at the Gild Hall. Our room was very small, with 14 foot ceilings which made the space feel unbalanced. A study in black, brown and grey, the room was furnished badly with black brown wood everywhere and two toned wallpaper in dull shades of grey and cat puke orange/yellow. Even the art on the walls was unattractive. The main light was a dim giant chandelier with no switch near the bed and no bedside lamps, so I had to get out of bed to turn out the light and then feel my way back to bed. The one window had wooden blinds that didn't fully block the city light at night and curtains that were solely decorative. The bed and pillows were very comfortable, but the ambient light from outside made sleeping harder.

Cozy elegant, friendly and helpful staff, good food, very comfortable room, small bathroom but with nice amenities. Quiet. Restaurant/bar quite good and better than average in room dining. An oasis from the hustle/bustle of financial district.

We wanted a boutique hotel in the up and coming financial district, and based on price, we chose this. We loved it! It's super cute inside and very inviting. The people working the desk were kind, helpful and attentive. They upgraded our room for free and didn't charge us when we went a little past our 24 hours on the valet. The rooms are so pretty. We got one size up from the smallest and it was huge for NYC standards. High ceilings, bigger bathroom, comfy bed, quiet halls. It was one of the best hotels in this price range that I've stayed at in New York. We have never stayed in the FiDi before and it was so quiet but with adorable places to drink and eat - it was like a NYC I've never seen. I would definitely go back!

It was an excellent hotel. Staff was great and very helpful, room very clean and provided all of the amenities that you could think of. The bar/restaurant was great too! All in all, it was an excellent hotel experience.
user_name:
dparsons2017
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The service was very good and friendly. It is located in a very nice part of NYC. The breakfast is simple but good. The rooms are very clean and big enough. We had a very nice holliday and will come back!

I stayed in the hotel for a week. Overall the hotel left a very good impression. I have a little reservation about absence of a kettle/coffee machine but apart from that there was not much to complain about. Staff were very attentive and professional. Food was also very good (but after a week of staying you start wishing it was not all so Italian :))

A boutique hotel with sensational staff and great (and I mean great!) food and beverage in Felice. From the moment one arrives until departure it feels as though the staff are proud and really want you to experience a great stay.

Overall - good experience. I appreciate the staff's attention to my needs and friendly attitude.Suggest you reduce your character minimum. I personally don't think a 200 character minimum is necessary to provide a review. Thank you

They made traveling with a toddler easier than most hotels. Customer service was top knotch and the hotel itself was beautiful. Being in the financial district made for a easier time to get cabs as we were away from the craziness of midtown! We were able to get a very late check out in our last day and had a ton of help out on our way to the airport. We will definitely be coming back.

Have stayed here twice for short stints and it's a great cozy hotel--the restaurant is great and it's a convenient location. In past stays I have eaten breakfast at the hotel and the bagel with lox was very good. They should provide free coffee (I paid $5 for a large at the restaurant) but otherwise, a a very good value and highly recommended

Great location for business & leisurely travel, very friendly staff, hotel and hotel guess rooms were very clean. FYI - Gild Hall hotel does have three very small 24 hr fitness rooms that are not listed on their website.

We stayed at the hotel for 1 night, and we had good experience.The price per night was good, comparing to the others hotels around. When we arrived it was easy to find the hotel, at the front desk the staff were very kind. The lobby + bar + restaurant designed really nice! It was very interesting to go into the hotel. Our room was nice, small, practical, well designed, WIFI works fine, and it was quite. If you need to eat in the middle of night you’ll find some places open in walking distance. Cool place to stay! With good vibes!

A great hotel with a lovely atmosphere in the downtown area. I stay there on business and love its 'non-corporate' feel. Nice, clean rooms, great bar and helpful reception. Well placed for downtown attractions, bars and restaurants. Fulton St subway close by for a quick trip to mid town.

This was a great hotel that far exceeded my expectations! The restaurant attached was great as well. Definitely will use on my next business trip to the financial district! It was very convenient in regards to location.

We stayed at this hotel with mu husband. The location is perfect if you wanna visit NYC as a tourist. Also close to the business district. The rooms are very nicely decorated and are very clean. The only begative part was that the rooms were quite dark. But I think this is a general NYC situation:)

This was our second overnight stay at Gild Hall... this time, for a quick babymoon before the birth of our second child. For the price, the rooms and amenities are well worth it. We ate at Felice for breakfast and dinner and found it to be excellent for both meals. Would highly recommend Gild Hall if your travel brings you to this part of the city.

Good value for money - at least at the price we paid. Decent location away from Times Square, good service, friendly staff, great restaurant and decent quality of the rooms. Overall very satiesfied with our stay.

I stayed at Gild Hall while in town for an event at the NYSE. The hotel was very comfortable and reasonably priced for the area. Well positioned for walking to all my event locations. I would recommend this hotel and stay here again.

Had a great week long stay at Gild Hall. The team was incredibly helpful and welcoming. Rooms are large by New York standards and tastefully decorated. Location was great - it was really easy to get around via the subway.

This is a converted office building much in the style of the Library Hotel in midtown. Being in the Financial District, this means that one feels as if one is a troglodyte in a canyon. The rooms are good, if a little idiosyncratic in that, while not offering tea and coffee, they do offer a romantic pack comprising two condoms and a French tickler. There are bottles of Fred Mineral water at $9 a pop in the room. Nice fridge. Nice bathroom, but it is part of the room with sliding corrugated glass doors and a curtain. New York tap water is exceptionally good. Did I say Fred water was $9 a pop?The lobby is decorated in Aspen style - think Bing and chums in Holiday Inn - with good sofas and, on the mezzanine, a fair library. All very comfy. It’s dead handy for subways and only a few minutes walk from the Battery and the Freedom Tower which, since our last visit in October 2014, has gained the Oculus centre which has to be seen to be believed. The breakfast is first rate as is dinner which is Italian served by Hispanic waiters. Breakfast was $50for two, while dinner - mainly Italian wines - was $200 with a bottle of the house rosé at $45?Did I say the water was $9 a bottle?
user_name:
louisdunn
Perth and Kinross, United Kingdom

review_body: Our first time staying here and we were blown away. We are here for Easter Sunday and took a chance by booking here and we are so glad we did. We received an upgrade to the king suite and it’s so nice. T

I have stayed at dozens of New York City hotels over the years. Gild Hall exceeded expectations in every way. It is walking distance to all of downtown in each direction. You can't do better at this price point.

Good hotel in nice location downtown some of the staff are suspect but overalll I would probably stay again as it kinda does the job watch for facility fee tho as you pay for internet usage but failed to tell me

Perfect location !! 5 -10 min walk to One World Trade Center or Brooklyn bridge. Confortable and lovely decoration (Aspen style). A charming italian restaurant with an amazing dishes.Really good !! Even the room service was excellent.

Staff were great, friendly and helpful and looked after me when my flight was cancelled. The hotel has a uniqueness to it for NY. It has a great Italian restaurant attached and I will definitely be back.

The Gild Hall was a very nice hotel - comfortable, well appointed rooms. Although it's located in the Financial District, there was plenty to do and eat without having to head uptown every day. The new WTC buildings has brought a lot more activity to this part of the city.

Great quality of rooms and Felice was great! Also, shout out to Anythony (Front desk agent overnight he was amazing! went above and beyond by assisting us with our rooms and suggested great places for food.

We stayed for 4 nights as a group over two rooms, one a double twin and one an executive king. Both rooms were a very, very good size and probably larger than the same price point hotels in New York.Rooms were serviced daily and any requests were met with promptly and without any fuss.We enjoyed breakfast at Felice every morning which was excellent, as was the staff.Although the hotel was located in the financial district the Fulton Street subway is a short walk away making it very easy to get uptown. The location also means a 5-10 minute walk to the 9/11 memorial and museum, Wall Street and a short walk further to the Staten Island ferry.The biggest selling point for this hotel though has to be the front desk staff, specifically Rob. All the staff were excellent and couldn't do enough for us but Rob took the time every day to ask us our plans and make suggestions or offer advice. It was this personal touch that really impressed us and we wouldn't hesitate to use the hotel thanks to him.

Nice hotel, very conveniently located to the Subways and great restaurants. The staff was very professional. My only complaint was the service at the restaurant during Sunday brunch . Will definitely go back and stay here.

I can not speak highly enough about this hotel or my experience at it. From the staff to the decor to the room to the location to the value, Gild Hall is without peer. I would, without hesitation, recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the financial district.
user_name:
ajmoore3434
New York City, New York

review_body: Nice rooms, good beds, easy check in/out. Loved getting a glass of proseco at check in. Good breakfast. Starbucks is at the end of the block if you don’t want to eat at the restaraunt. We were able to take drinks from the bar up to our room. Easy walk to the 9-11 museum and to the subway.

If you are looking for a stay with a room and hotel with great personality and staff, take some time to check out Gild Hall. Save time to grab breakfast in the morning. Bar has great life to it as well at night.

This hotel was amazing from start to end! Check-in was smooth, room was clean and beautiful with contemporary furnishings, and the bed was very comfortable. Hotel is located near a lot of restaurants and easily accessible. Highly recommend!
user_name:
tahirina k
Deer Park, New York

review_body: I booked a very affordable weekend stay here through Priceline. Gild Hall was a great value. It is very close to the Subway (A, C, 2, 3, 4, 5, J, Z), several coffee shops, and nice market (Zeytuna). The room was spotless, roomy for a NY hotel room, and well-appointed, and though I was on the ground floor facing the street, I had a quiet night (I can't say whether or not this would be true during the week). Staff were friendly and accommodating. I would gladly stay here again.

Sometimes trendy hotels have lame staff who are too cool to really help you out. Gild Hall is a stark contrast to that vibe - they are outrageously accommodating and add personal touches to make you feel like family. Our room was awesome, spacious and the bed was perfect. The rate was pretty great too!

I ended up at Gild Hall unexpectedly. A pipe burst and flooded my apartment leaving me no choice but to check into a hotel. From the very start, I knew this was the place for me to stay while my apartment was in tatters. First, I was able to get through to an actual human on the phone. I called other hotels but unable to reach anyone, decided this was a big point in favor of Gild Hall. The manager took my call and took pity on me, allowing me an extra early check-in of "whenever I was ready" given my circumstance. Upon arrival, they upgraded my room and made me feel at home. During my stay, the reception staff was beyond accommodating for my needs. PROS:An intimate, comfortable haven within Manhattan. Small but amply equipped rooms make you feel cozy and happy. Mini bar prices are also reasonable in case you want an impromptu snack without breaking the bank. There are tons of small restaurants nearby and places to buy groceries if you like, plus the in-house restaurant, Felice, is part of the Sant Ambroues family--score! Guaranteed good food and wine! The hotel has free bikes for loan and because of its size, design and location, the spot feels like a lodge hotel in Aspen as opposed to a hotel in New York City. For the price, you are getting a great, stylish hotel with friendly service. The staff is incredible. PLUS, it's pet-friendly! CONS:Essentially, there are no cons in this hotel for a few reasons. Although if I were to pick one I would say its location in the Financial District is slightly displaced from most Manhattan life BUT there is so much transport within a few minutes walk from the hotel that it is easy to get to where you want to be. Any cons you may have are easily overlooked by the price, style, comfort and service of this hotel.OVERALL:I highly recommend. You stay at Gild Hall because you want a unique boutique experience and service at a great price all within New York City. THANKS TO:Lindsay Sears, Van Hallen Loiw and John-Morriz Cruz who looked after me like I was part of the family during this rough event. I cannot thank you enough!

Excellent service and value in Manhattan. The hotel location is also great with stores and restaurants nearby. The entire staff was extremely courteous and sincerely interested in ensuring our stay was perfect. Only had a couple of very minor issues and the staff responded immediately and added my feedback to their continuous improvement meeting.

If you're looking for somewhere to stay in Lower Manhattan, Gild Hall is it! The staff is professional, friendly and helpful and the hotel is well designed and comfortable. The lobby is cozy and inviting and the room I stayed in was wonderful. Plus, the location is very convenient- easy to get to by public transportation and and a short walk to all the downtown restaurants and sites.

Beautiful and clean, very friendly service, 2 fitness rooms for flexibility, awesome staff - especially at Felice; when the restaurant was full the hostess offered us a complimentary drink while we waited and offered to take our order to send up to our room - fabulous all around!

I chose this hotel because of its convenient location just a short walk to the ferry terminal. Plus it's only a short walk to Battery Park and the 9/11 Memorial. The stay was just perfect, all on site staff were extremely hands on and helpful and very supportive. The room is quite spacious for NY.

I stayed here for seven nights and what great nights they were, before staying four nights at the Beekman.I particularly loved the helpful staff, who simply couldn’t do enough for you, but that is very typical for a Thompson Hotel from my experience,My suite was room 100 and it was absolutely lovely, with lots of space and the most comfortable bed I’ve ever slept in.The restaurant serves beautifully prepared Italian style food and it is superb, I found myself eating here most evenings such was the quality and atmosphere.The Gild Hall is fantastic hotel and I’m now planning to stay here as my regular base when visiting NYC.Try the other Thompson hotels too, certainly the Beekman is well worth a visit, although it does get extremely busy with walk in, off the street party goers, so you may not be able to simply nip downstairs for a quick drink, as it’s usually packed.The Gild Hall is my pick of the bunch however, it’s not as beautiful as the Beekman, but it’s not as pretentious either and the food at the Gild Hall is way better.
user_name:
Salmiakki69
New York City, New York

review_body: I actually enjoyed the hotel. I was lied on about charges to my room and then call to have it corrected but nothing has happened yet. This is reason for the low score. I don't understand why a hotel has to lie to make money. This hotel does have it going on with the staff, they are some of the best I've seen in the business. Very kind and supportive with anything. Daya is superb, she really is genuine and kind. My low score is because I do not appreciate the hotel lying about a room charge that I know I didn't do. Lesson learned I guess.

The Gild Hall is a convenient, comfortable and friendly place to stay if you are in the financial district. The staff treats you like royalty and the decor is relaxed and refreshing. We also enjoyed the restaurant and bar upstair. I would definitely stay here again or recommend it to a friend.

Clean room, pleasant staff, comfortable bed in the financial district NYC, close to food, transportation etc. Walking distance to WTC, and close to downtown Brooklyn. I would recommend for recreation and business purposes.

Had a great stay. Cool place. Nice people. We had a beautiful suite on the 7th floor which we really enjoyed. Hotel has a real nice vibe to it that starts in the lobby bar and permeates throughout the property.

We stayed at Gild Hall with two other couples over Presidents Day weekend. It was our first time staying in the Financial District. The hotel was very nice, the staff was very accommodating and our room was perfect for an overnight stay. We got a great rate for our three rooms. It was worth it even though we needed to use the subway to see some of the sites we wanted to see. There were plenty of Irish bars, restaurants and the 911 museum close by. We loved how close we were to Brooklyn and enjoyed eating pizza in DUMBO. I highly recommend this hotel especially if you are tired of the Times Square scene and want to explore a different area of Manhattan.

Excellent location if working in downtown/finance although not a business hotel vibe. I really liked the restaurant, it had a comfortable setting, reasonably priced given the location. The room was nice, modern/trendy but comfortable for anyone and not just a younger crowd. Bathroom was small but nice, its NY and comes with the territory.

Looking for a quiet, clean and perfect location go to Gild Hall. With a awesome restaurant, bar and above expectations service great place!! Rooms spacious and very clean. Home away from home with all the amenities.

As a native New Yorker with 3 small children, I wanted to take my husband to a nice local hotel to rest and relax without the kids for his 40th birthday. Gild Hall is incredibly beautiful in a chic way and the staff went out of their way to make us feel comfortable and special. We will definitely be back!

This is a really great place to stay. I was in town on business for 3 days. The staff is eager to help with anything - Felice has great food - the people were helpful - the room was comfortable, large, and felt like home.

The hotel and staff exceeded my expectations! The front desk staff made our check-in experience really easy and quick, which exactly what we needed after a long flight. They even offered us complimentary prosecco!
