Attentive staff, cool dining and bar area, and excellent coffee! I love this hotel. I have been here twice on business and the colleagues that I traveled with all agreed that they preferred the Gild Hall hotel to other hotels.

Great check-in/check out service. Room was big, but shower could definitely be better/upgraded, and area was quite noisy even late at night. I could hear a shower running from the floor above me, and some other random noises I couldn't identify.Thompson Hotels do not have a single sheet between their fitted sheet and duvet. I found the same in their Toronto hotel. I expected more for the price and popularity of the brand.

We arrived a little early and the clerk, Andy, could not have been more helpful. Arranging to store our bags, giving us guidance on tourist sites in the area and even calling when the room was ready were only a few of the extra services he provided. It was the beginning of a smooth stay thanks to his service and others.

Had the chance to stay at Gild Hall while in NYC for 2 days this past weekend. What a beautiful boutique hotel away from the craziness of Times Square. Rooms were very clean and beautifully appointed with old-school Sinatra-esque charm. The floors were all very quiet with none of the noise you would expect from a NYC hotel.The food at the restaurant downstairs was fantastic, though I did only eat brunch both times I was there -- and both times I ordered the avocado toast, and one time a cheese board. Eggs were done perfectly, cheese was excellent, the coffee was also very good as was the fresh OJ. My one complaint was the young lady who served me on the Saturday brunch -- she was cranky and acted like it was a burden to serve us... there was literally just myself and my mother in the restaurant at that time. The server gave nothing by way of friendliness, but certainly had the market cornered on a bad attitude (For that reason alone, I give the service 4 starts versus 5.) towards two people who were very low-key and undemanding. But, we all have our bad days I guess. Overall, a fantastic stay -- seamless check-in, loved the prosecco they give you to take up to your room... a very nice touch.

We just live over in Brooklyn, but we rented a suite here after getting married at the city clerk's office to do something fun and different. We had an amazing experience, the hotel gave us a free upgrade to the penthouse and provided a bottle of champagne, and the space was great for the group of friends and family that we invited to celebrate with us. The room itself was huge, very clean and well maintained, and very comfortable, and the staff was incredibly helpful and welcoming. We're already talking about spending our anniversary here next year.

Lovely hotel. Hotel location was very accessible to sights and sounds of Manhattan. Fresh clean rooms. Quality of food was wonderful. The check in/out was smooth and professional. Front desk staff were great. Only concern was service one of the mornings in restaurant.

Checked in just before midnight for my birthday weekend in New York. Anthony and Eric, at the front desk, welcomed us with flutes of Prosecco. Upon learning that it is my birthday, they upgraded our room. What a warm welcome and a great hotel!

I was staying here for work so it was a suitable locaton to walk to and from there. The staff were polite and helpful and there is a restaurant just next door which served good breakfasts and Italian lunches and dinner. The room was nice with a very comfy bed. The only downside was I left my luggage here after checking out whilst I did a tourist trip before going straight to the airport. Someone had tampered with the locks on my cases and tried to break into them (there were several knife slits on both sides of the case) which meant I couldn't open my carry on. I only discovered this at the airport whilst waiting to board, super annoying as I have great noise cancelling headphones and had to buy another neck pillow for my flight. To open my suitcases when I got home I had to break the locks and so break the suitcase. All this meant I couldnt report to the police and so I'm unable to claim on my travel insurance. A real dampener on a lovely stay.

In a couple words, it was great. Very nice hotel with clean and comfortable rooms. The staff is very friendly. There are several subway stations in a close surrounding. Besides, I liked the district so much, it’s a real New York, you go outside from the hotel and see all these skyscrapers :)

Stayed at the Gild Hall for about 6 nights over New Year. The hotel was lovely and the rooms a lot bigger than others in Manhattan. The lobby area is quite small so when we arrived it was a bit confusing as there was a large group blocking the desk. Once we got around them check in was swift - though no prosecco was offered like other guests have mentioned. During our stay the front desk team suggested some great places for breakfast and were always friendly when we were coming and going. The pub across the road is pretty good, as is Harry’s restaurant. Easy to get around with the subway nearby and attractions like 9/11 are walkable. We ate in Felice one night in the upstairs part and the food was excellent. Their red wine was also delicious. Would stay again but Midtown is probably a bit better for doing the touristy thing.

This is boutique hotel with an updated masculine wood and leather aesthetic.There is a small pleasant lobby and a casual Italian wine bar/restaurant adjacent to the lobby.The front desk during our weekend stay were uniformly friendly and helpful.Our room was a small suite with a nicely furnished living room with a leather sofa coffee table, two side chairs, as well as a desk. There also was a well equipped kitchenette,bar, and a brightly lit bathroom with double vanities in carrara marble. Every thing designed for a pleasant weekend getaway, which is what we were having until we were awakened early Sunday morning, by a forceful shower of hot water on our bed , soaking us, the bedding, and the floor. We called the front desk and maintenance men arrive almost immediately. Within a minute or two, the water stopped spurting, and it was determined that a radiator pipe had burst, presumably because the outside temperature had dropped very low ( it had gone down to approximately 6 degrees). The manager promptly arrived, was very apologetic, and sent us down for a free breakfast while our room was being cleaned up. The breakfast in the hotel restaurant, Felice, was outstanding, with wonderfully attentive service. When we finished our breakfast, we were notified that our room was being switched to the identical type small suite one flight up and that our payment for the first night of our weekend was being refunded.So while our shower in bed was unexpected, everything turned out well in the end. We were not scalded and the hotel staff went out of their way to try to make up sure that we enjoyed our stay despite the mishap, which we definitely did!Gild Hall is a great place to stay.

Front desk greeting was professional. I booked a king size room and was disappointed in the size of the room, as well as the bathroom. There as little space for hanging clothes and limited space in the bathroom for personal items.

We booked the Gild for our wedding and everyone including family and friends raved about the level of service, decor and location. The staff was so unbelievably kind, attentive and considerate to our entire party. I cannot recommend them enough.

Great place to stay. Wish the double beds were QUEEN beds as they are too small when you are sharing a bed. Would like to see some cabinet in the bathroom to put things and a hook or something to hang a jacket
user_name:
davidhK8680OQ
North Carolina Mountains, North Carolina

review_body: Top reception serious a professional StaffKey in elevator a struggleCool restaurant and room service is not expensiveGreat Room if you are alone 2 big suitcases wouldn't fit on the floorGreat bed with 4 pillows and ok linenCool design Not good enough with switchesTerrible A.C. functionBathroom luxuryNoise from Shower from other rooms not good A little noise from the street Good mini bar selectionSmalllll gym in 3 floorsTiled and marble floor in bathroom great feeling small bath tubeI will probably not go back if it's not cheaper than the nearby hotels only if so 4 the staff

The hotel is located in a relatively secluded spot for the Finacial District of Manhattan. Surrounded by a good number of bars and restaraunts with the Brooklyn Bridge merely walking distance. The room was great. Bed was super comfortable and the the TV was nice. A slew of things to buy in room. Only gripe was a lack of natural lighting in the room. The restaraunt downstairs has amazing Italian food. Best eggplant I’ve ever had and the gelato!

I had a fantastic stay with my family. The hotel is nice, but what made the stay extrodinary was the friendliness of Robert and David. They treated us very well. Angel also was very friendly. The room was spacey considering there was four of us, and the housekeeping did a fantastic job.

Stayed here for one night while visiting friends. Front desk staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Champagne at check-in certainly didn't hurt either. Room was a good size and better than average for NYC. Very well appointed and tastefully decorated. The bed was extremely comfortable and the bathroom was also a good size. Overall just a wonderful, pleasant experience. We will be back!

Totally recommend this hotel. I stayed for 1 night for business and it exceeded my expectations. Great downtown location, close to Wall Street and Fulton Stations. Comfortable, larger and nicer than expected rooms. Special shout out to Eric at the front desk who braved the cold to flag down a cab for me! Will be back for sure.

Our stay was very pleasant, the staff was super friendly and helped us out a few times. The rooms in the hotel looked very chic and clean. The kingsize bed was awesome and comfortable. Unfortunately the showers in the morning were cold as a lot of people were showering. But there´s a bath tub so we had a warm bath in the evening which was great.

I recently stayed at The Gild in the Financial District while attending a business meeting. Although not my first time at this location, each visit continues to impress upon me the value of a small, boutique hotel which offers premium service, and makes you feel at home. Efficiency, Effectiveness, Quality, Comfort and Style are all bundled together in one location. I just love this place!

A nice hotel and a pleasant stay despite the terrible weather (the ‘bomb cyclone’). The rooms were nice with the only problems being one or two issues with service and the information provided on check in.

The room size is pretty small. Dark and dirty room carpets need to be replaced. AC is way too noisy and interrupted our sleep. We left the bathroom door open and could smell very unpleasant sewage odor from the bathroom.

This hotel is a great option in the financial district with large suites and a nice quiet location, but it's not without it's faults. My main complaint is the condition and decor of the rooms. There's just not a clear design direction (chrome, brass, glass tile, marble tile, white marble, caesarstone, red Brazilian wood floors, gold wallpaper, silver wallpaper, black wood, brown wood- it's not eclectic, it looks like everything was bought at closeout.) Our bathroom door handle didn't work and was falling off, broken tiles, some bad patches and fixes, the window AC and Heater didn't work for most of the room and was loud.That said, staff was very good, the restaurant had good food, the location is quiet (although with limited options) and the rooms are a very good value. Our suite had a kitchen and a separate bedroom. It's difficult to find that in Manhattan without spending a fortune. I would stay here again, and it's a solid choice if you want space, and quiet and are OK with the area.

My husband, my 12 year old son and myself stayed at the Gild Hall in Lower Manhattan over the new year period. The hotel is tucked away from the hustle and bustle, yet still convenient for the likes of Broadway, Wall St and tourist attractions such as Battery Park, Staten Island Ferry and the 9/11 Memorial. The hotel itself is really quirky and the staff are super friendly and so helpful. We stayed for 7 days. Our room was made up each day. Fresh towels and toiletries and our room was a really great size compared to some of the reviews we'd read on Trip Advisor regarding small hotel rooms in NYC. My family and I were unfortunately caught up in the recent snowstorm which hit the eastern seaboard, which meant our flight home to the UK was cancelled. Prior to heading to the airport David, who we think was the hotel manager assured us that a room would be available for us if it was required at short notice - which we subsequently did. The reception staff were very knowledgeable regarding places to eat and visit and we would certainly have no hesitation in recommending Gild Hall to other travellers considering a visit to NYC. We will be back, albeit when it's warmer!

My boyfriend and I checked into Gild Hall just after getting engaged. When we received the complementary prosecco at check in we mentioned that we had just gotten engaged. Right away they took back our room cards and did some work on the computer and handed us back room cards for our new upgraded suite! Beyond that extra special treatment, the room was clean and nicely decorated and my fiance and I are still raving about how comfortable the bed was. We will definitely stay here again!

A nice boutique hotel that met every expectation. The staff was very friendly and went above and beyond to service us during our stay. Highly recommend if you are going to frequent the Wall St. area.You are close to Fulton Station which can get you everywhere you want to go in NYC.

We booked a last minute room, for New Year's Eve. Upon arrival, the reception staff were very pleasant and polite. The bar looked great, but we didn't get a chance to experience it, during our short stay. The room itself, was a fairly decent size for two people. The bed was very comfy! The bathroom was nice, but the shower was a bit of a letdown. The pressure wasn't great and the hot water didn't last very long. The location is great! There are a couple of restaurants and bars right outside the hotel and there is more to chose from, within a 10 min walk from the hotel. It is also a 10 minute walk from Oculus, so great if you want to pop in and do some shopping or visit the One World Trade Centre Observation Deck.

Overall I highly recommend- location is amazing, close to World Trade Center and close to Fulton metro station. Room facilities are a bit old however, the room was always clean. There is a bakery very close with amazing deserts and good coffee- “financier” and a nice place for branch “George’s”

I love this hotel, great location and really comfortable rooms. The King Suite gives you a massive amount of room and a very quiet bedroom for a good price. Recommend the French Toast by Felice for breakfast!

Our first time in New York and so pleased we booked this hotel! We booked based on trip advisor reviews and the Gild Hall certainly lived up to expectations. Friendly and helpful staff, spacious, well appointed rooms and enjoyed a lovely authentic Italian meal at Felice. Great location within easy walking distance of Wall Street, World Trade Centre, Staten Island Ferry and just round the corner from Fulton Street station for easy access to all the major sites of NYC. Would definitely return and recommend to anyone visiting NYC.

We spent 5 nights in this amazing hotel. The room was big and the bed was very very comfortable, the location is perfect the staff very friendly and always helpful. We really enjoyed our stay in this fantastic aspen--style atmosphere. We definitely go backViktor and Sophie

LOVE THIS HOTEL! It is cozy! The decor is warm and pleasing to the eye. The rooms are roomy, cozy and comfortable. The front desk people are kind and helpful. This place makes you feel welcomed. It has a library of books you may read. There are also books in your room. The downstairs bar is fun but still chill where you can relax and have a drink or chat with your companions and other guests.You can also retreat to to the leather couches or chairs next to the downstairs bar with your glass of beer/wine and a good book. It's in a great location ...down by Wall Street and the subway entrances.My fiance and I thought it would be cool to stay at a different hotel each of the five nights we were here. Bad idea! It's a pain going from hotel to hotel. We so wish we would have just stayed at Gild Hall all five nights. When we come back to New York we will definitely stay every night at Gild Hall. Beautiful hotel!I would have liked the gym to be bigger with a TV and Windows so I could look outside while working-out. It was a small bare room which was sort of depressing considering how nice the rest of the hotel was designed and decorated.And I would have liked a bigger shower head that generated greater pressure and a bigger spray.But other than these two things like I said I love this hotel!

The bed was amazing!! Good mattress and pillows. Overall the size of the room is large compared to other hotel rooms in nyc. Good location near subway and several places for breakfast and dining in neighborhood.

Excellent service and lovely rooms. The Thompson Hotels have a relaxing, magical scent that is in the lobby and hallways that I wish they would sell. The food at Felice is delicious and the staff is warm and helpful.

Had a pleasant stay here over Christmas. Staff were very helpful and was very impressed with the room & WiFi. My only criticism is that a waitress in the bar got my partner a drink and didn’t even ask me if I’d like one. I was disappointed in this because I did want one however she had already left and never came back to serve us again. Apart from that the stay was very good.

Lovely hotel with terrific service, rooms and location. Front desk staff works tirelessly to enhance your NYC experience. Bar and restaurant are way above average in terms of menu and attention to it's patrons.
user_name:
Michael S
West Islip, New York

review_body: Stayed here for one night. They were so accommodating and the bed was super comfy! It was so close to Wall Street which was the purpose of my visit. They were able to accommodate late check for me as well. Pet friendly! They also are available via text for anything which was convenient. The lobby bar is cute and tables offer checkers which was fun. The bathroom was large. Great hotel for a great price. Loved the authentic feel they had!

We drove to NYC for a romantic 3-night getaway and loved this little hotel. It was very stylish and upscale. Well located in the financial district, the staff knew all the right hidden treasures to share with us. Rob and the other Gild staff went over and above to make our stay extra special. Many thanks! We'll certainly be back...

Our flight was cancelled and we stayed here for one night. The hotel was beautiful, the room was incredible and we wished we had stayed there the whole time. The bed was huge, wider than it was long!! The bathroom was beautifully done in white tiles. It is located in the FiDi which isn’t very central to central Manhattan but we didn’t need it for that. Highly recommend

As a native New Yorker- the holidays can be stressful staying with family and being pulled in 600 different directions-Hence why we love spending part of our time in a hotel!We have become big fans of Gild Hall, staying here 5 out of the 6 times we have been back for holidays or family events.The rooms are clean and comfortable- the Financial is district is ideal (far away from the tourist insanity that is mid-town) with shops and restaurants to visit during your stay. Felice (Gild Hall on site restaurant) serves up great food and cocktails in a quaint and cozy atmosphere.The staff is friendly and accommodating,especially Andy who we recognized as being with the hotel for a few years (Andy rules!)We were able to have packages sent to the hotel rather than schlepping them across country and when they arrived found them neatly placed in our room.All in all, we love Gild Hall and look forward to many more visits to preserve whilst visiting family!

My trip was for business purposes and this hotel has become my favorite since last year. Wonderful staff, awesome rooms, and excellent location. If you are coming to NYC, this is the place and you will not be disappointed!

Location and service were great. Limit of 2 devices for internet was unacceptable. The in room dining food was horrible. The room was nice size for NY. However, the shower pressure was very weak which is an easy improvement.

The Hotel has good size & comfortable rooms, helpful and courteous staff and a great location in downtown NYC ! The italian restaurant in the hotel has good food n wine. In all, a very pleasant experience. Moisey Van was very good at the front desk !

Great service, quirky inside, awesome to get a parking available. Kind of far ($30 uber ride) from the sights we wanted to see. The restaurant was good. Loved the glass of prosecco we were served upon check in.

I have stayed here a few times now. It is a quirky boutique hotel that offers excellent service, is super comfortable and in a great locationNothing is too much for the staff, from the moment you check in. The rooms are not overly big but are very nice and the bed is the most comfortable I have had in any hotel. The restaurant is small but very good. Food is excellent and the ambience is good. It is well regarded as a go to restaurant in the city.Definitely one of my favs. You can get some great rates aswell

Very restful comfortable stay. Hotel is located in Financial District and we used a combo of Uber/Lyft and the subway to get around. Hotel is very nice with a friendly staff. The bar/restaurant looks very rustic and nice although did not get a chance to try. Next time because we would stay here again.

My boyfriend and I had a great one-night stay at Gild Hall. The staff was very kind and accommodating and we will certainly be coming back! We particularly loved the lobby and bar area and thoroughly enjoyed all of the board games :)

Ordinarily, when we have tickets to the theater in NYC, we stay in midtown, but wanted to include a visit to the 9/11 museum and memorial during this visit to the city and so chose to stay in the Financial District. Gild Hall was a warm and inviting hotel that put us in easy walking distance of the museum, and a reasonable cab ride to the theater district and back. We'd certainly stay there again in the future.

Angel the bellman was great! Helped me with Uber every day! The staff was very helpful from front desk to housekeeping. Location is great.....would return again next time I am headed to New York City!

The overall stay and service was great and the food at Felice was fantastic I did find the rooms could use a bit tidying and I did not like that every time I took the elevator staff were coming in with various items to deliver to floors. Maybe there is not way to avoid this but it was not ideal when the elevators are a bit slow to start.Overall, great property and service.

I stay at this hotel at least once or a twice a month and enjoy the friendliness of the team at the front desk, the room comfort and cleanliness as well as how they customize my experience. An added bonus is having Felice in the hotel. Great food and service.

The staff as this boutique hotel was very helpful. Even to the point of leaving the front desk to help me with the elevator! The larger room was spacious. Convenient location for 911 Memorial, South Street Seaport, and the subway to anywhere on the island.

The hotel was excellent. The staff was exceptionally courteous and helpful! The room was spotless and the bed was very comfortable. Good location. The food was just delicious! Would definitely recommend this hotel!

I'd highly recommend this hotel - it's in a GREAT, convenient location to Fi district, and one of the largest rooms I've ever stayed in in NYC. The appointments in the room are beautiful - very retro glam - and new.
user_name:
N3631USkarenl
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We enjoyed our stay here very much. The staff, especially Robert, were all amazing, the bar was super cute and fun, the atmosphere overall was cool and chic. Great value for NYC and will definitely be back. We didn’t mind the location as Uber/Lyft were easy to utilize from there.

The night went very well. The hotel was nice, clean and better than expected. We had some of the best drinks and appetizers at the bar. The beds were comfortable and rooms were cozy. Our only isssue was we took a shower in the morning and there was only warm water definitely not hot enough for our liking. Other than that we had a great stay!!

Great Hotel and Friendly Staff!! Check in was fast and smooth. Tom Mcmenamin and 2 other Front Desk Staff that worked Wednesday night, December 6th were super friendly and my check out was also fast and smooth Robert Served from the Heart and Deliver Greatness!!!

What a charming find! Personnel was AMAZING, addressed us always by name and went' out of their way to ensure we were comfortable. Hotel Assistant Manager David offered suggestions, humor and led his team to treat customers the same. Adorable restaurant attached and a very pretty and warm bar area that was quite active Friday after work.

Nice hotel well located in lower Manhattan, the area is quiet with really good restuarang / wine bar. The room had very good bed and the cleaning excellent .The staff were very helpful and the price affordable. we had a wonderful stay in new york

I stayed here during the Thanksgiving Holiday. The rooms were nice and clean. They were a nice size given that it's New York and typically living quarters are small. I must say what made this place standout was the customer service and attention to detail. Max and Andy worked the desk while I was there and always greeted us with a smile and inquiry about how are trip was going. They made suggestions for places to go and made sure we were ok before heading out. I was there for my mother's 60th birthday. They sent up a bottle of Prosecco and dessert for her to celebrate and upgraded our room. I will say I will probably only stay here from now on when I come to New York City.

I booked a double room at the Gild Hall over Thanksgiving weekend and wow am I impressed. Even though it being the holiday season, and i know it was packed, everything I needed was accommodated for, even late check out. Staff was super friendly, respectful, and prompt. The bar downstairs in the lobby was excellent! Love the champagne glass as you check in. I also got complimentary champagne bottle in the room which was wonderful! All in all, will definitely go back again soon!

My husband and I decided to go to NYC for an extended long weekend away. We decided to stay at Gild Hall after seeing it was a Thompson Hotel in Lower Manhattan (we had previously stayed at the one in Toronto and loved the experience). It was located about 5 minutes walk from the World Trade Centre station (and the beautiful Oculus) and dangerously close to Century 21 and Eataly (get read to spend!). The hotel was everything you can want: hip decor, friendly and attentive staff, very comfortable room with an excellent bed King size bed, and a restaurant downstairs (Felice) that was incredible! They texted the morning of the second day to check in on us and make sure we are comfortable. When we responded that the room was a bit cold, they brought a technician in immediately to check on the heater. Eventually it was an issue that was solved by bringing in a separate heater that kept us nice and toasty. Overall it was an excellent stay in a hip hotel that I would describe as industrial meets rustic lodge decor with a personalized touch that really stood out from my experiences with other hotels. I would highly recommend Gild Hall to anyone visiting NYC!

The hotel room was fine. The kitchen was brilliant. Unfortunately the dining room upstairs was closed for a private function. I would appear to have a warmer atmosphere than the main floor dining room. The food was nothing short of brilliant and was accompanied by a delightful choice of wines and great service.The front desk staff could not have done more.We will definitely come again.

I travel to NYC frequently for work and always aim to stay at the Gild. Their hospitality and willingness to go above and beyond is amazing. The atmosphere is fun and relaxing and definitely lives the definition of a boutique hotel with all of the amenities of a chain.

We traveled over the Thanksgiving holiday and were happy to find the Glid Hall near family we visited. Great location if you are spending 2 day's to see the 911 Memorial & Museum, the Freedom Tower Observation deck, Statue of Liberty, Ellis Island and shopping at the Oculus, and the hotel is located near Fulton Station for easy access. The location in lower Manhattan is much more quiet compared to others we've stayed at in Mid-town. The staff is friendly, and rooms comfortable and clean. The bar and restaurant downstairs were quaint.

A very nice and modern boutique hotel in a quiet area in the financial district, with an excellent value room for extended stay and very helpful staff who met all of our expectations in a friendly and timely manner

Great location and ambiance throughout the hotel and rooms. We loved the robes and bedding in the suite we stayed in. The service was impeccable from room service to front desk. Engagements with friends took us off the property for meals but room service breakfast was perfect.
user_name:
Alex J
New York City, New York

review_body: We were pleasantly surprised by this fine hotel. The upgrade we got certainly make us jaded, but forgetting the spectacular room that was like a one bedroom apartment with every fixing from mixed nuts to top shelf liquor, everything else was fabulous too - - - from the service to the ambiance to the restaurant and bar.

We stayed at Guild Hall in order to attend an evening wedding. It was probably one of the best I’ve ever stayed in. The staff was friendly as well as polite and professional. Our room was clean and comfortable. The bar was cozy and had a great Italian wine list. We had breakfast on site which was so very, very good. I would stay there again. Loved the location as well.
user_name:
AndreaN265
Port Jefferson Station, New York

review_body: Room accommodations were better than average. Very comfortable bed. Nice feel to lobby. Staff was very professional. Clock/radio with wrong time and unable to figure out how to fix. Sink drain slow. Extra fees, though known at the outset, detracted from the value.

Great location, Great value. We were very pleased. This is an efficient hotel. Staff were ready to help. Two bicycles available for use - a nice opportunity. WE are already planning our next visit to FIDI

We came here for an anniversary visit. It really exceeded our expectations. It's a true "boutique" hotel with amazing charm and service. It didn't even feel like "New York City" at some points because it is so unique and warm. Jeff was great and really made us feel at home. Will definitely be coming back every time we visit the city.

Spent a night at the Gild Hall on a layover and have only good things to say about the hotel.Its beautifully decorated and is very stylish but its best assest is the staff. They were all ( from the moment of check in to check out) warm, professional, helpful and considerate. I have been to NYC several times and this was my first experience of hotel staff that were this accomodating and gracious. It certainly is a stand out from the crowd. It will be my hotel of choice on future visits.The only note of advice is to be aware that if you have used athrid party to make your reservation, the hotel will charge for wifi even if your booking says its included. Apparently the policy changed in july 2017.

Delightful, attentive staff on Thanksgiving morning accommodated early check-in request. Clean, well-appointed room with ample amenities, including plenty of hangars. Delicious restaurant and lively bar within property.

The important thing is that we really enjoyed our 3nt stay and will return in the future. Which makes it sound like this review is going to be mixed but it's really not, I'd strongly recommend it,Location is great. This was our first time to NYC and we took the same approach as we do for London - being near a tube/subway station is more important than the location per se. The hotel is close to the Fulton St subway and is within walking distance of Wall Street, 911 memorial and museum, Statue of Liberty and Battery Park. Once we got the hang of the subway (not every train stops at every station on that line) we were fine with getting around.Staff were really helpful and friendly - in fact they were superb and we couldn't fault them. We checked in early and were given a choice of rooms (our preference was for 'quiet' over a view). Every time we interacted with anyone from the hotel they were professional and went above and beyond what we expected. Our room was warm feeling, quiet and comfortable. It was also really clean. A problem with the wardrobe door was sorted quickly. Being from England, I would have liked to have had tea/coffee making facilities and the water pressure/temp in the shower could have been higher but we enjoyed spending what little time we did there and slept really well. We ate thanksgiving dinner in the restaurant, it was very nice, and very reasonably priced. There's a happy hour from 4pm-7pm (I think!) for drinks and small plates, which makes it very affordable.Can't wait to go back!

This is a great hotel ,I enjoyed my stay. The staff were very nice and professional. The bedrooms are clean and they have very nice decor. The area is beautiful and there is plenty to eat and there are plenty of stores in the area you can shop at .

Had the best stay for my best friends birthday. The employees were amazing and so friendly. So welcoming! Coming back to stay whenever I visit New York! Definitely recommending it to my friends and family as well :-)!

The Hotel was very aesthetically pleasing, and in a great location in the city - the staff was great, especially Kolby - who went above and beyond making our trip really special, as we were celebrating a friends birthday! Staying here again :)

My girls and I flew in from Toronto to New York for a quick birthday weekend. Our flight had arrived early so we were a little worried about check in times, as soon as we got to the from desk Kolby luckily had checked us in right away and made sure we had a comfortable stay, we then were hungry and were unsure about what a good restaurant would be he was quick to recommend some really great restaurants. the one he highly recommended was in fact the felice that was in the hotel. hands down one of the best Italian food I've had in NYC. Kolby was a great help and later found out it was my birthday and sent some refreshments to the room.very thoughtful, definitely a must stay !!

Room was upgraded at no cost. We simply asked for a bigger room. The staff are very pleasant and accommodating. Good location in FIDI, room sizes better than most in NYC and it's very well maintained. This was our 3rd stay.

We enjoyed the hotel and the atmosphere. Great rooms, drinks, and service. The in-room water and snacks were grossly overpriced, but that's to be expected for a hotel like this. Overall, excellent experience. Highly recommend!

Not worth the cost. Nice location on paper,just happens to be located in the cut and not really walking distance to anything of convenience. The rooms are faux upscale with basic amenities. You can stay at a place with a more central location and updated bath for the same price or even less. Not sure how this place got such a high rating. Fresh paint and hip photos on the wall are nice and all but I don't think those things justify the price of this hotel. I would give it a higher rating if the cost were more reasonable but after I factor in the value, I can't give it more than two.

I stayed here on business in 2013 and loved Gild Hall but thought the area was empty at night so never stayed again. I got a great deal on Expedia for two nights and so thought I'd just deal with the location. I was shocked at how much the neighborhood has changed. I checked in on a Friday afternoon and the bar was packed. Lots of people on the street all weekend. And the hotel and restaurant were as wonderful on my second stay as they were on the first.

My husband and I hosted our small, intimate wedding here. This hotel was the perfect romantic venue for us. Everyone who worked at the hotel made the experience so special. We cannot recommend them enough!

Hotel was recommended by a friend, and wow, what a pleasant surprise. Staff was so friendly, room was clean and well appointed. Had a wonderful experience at Felice, where the staff is present but unintrusive. We’ll be back as soon as schedule permits.

Nice hotel. Close to Observatory and Brookfield Place. Restaurant food is good - Italian. Staff is nice and very helpful. Kinda hard to find the front of the hotel and elevators are a bit dated but nice hotel overall.

Great location but has a cavern feeling due to surrounding buildings. Would recommend for the price point and cleanliness....both favorable in comparison to other hotels. Restaurants serve great food.

Great location, great service. Small space, but very well kept. My boyfriend and I are local from Astoria, but it was a great, spur of the moment evening "getaway." Felice was a great accompaniment- didn't have to go far to have an extra special evening away from home!

I enjoyed my stay. The room was extremely clean, and any amenities one would need were all available. I would like to thank the staff for making my stay very pleasant. I look forward towards my next visit to your hotel in the near future.
user_name:
franciscogZ5052OW
New York City, New York

review_body: The hotel room was nice and internet worked. Elevators a bit slow but what really disappoints is the placement of two identical and inadequate exercise rooms on floors 6 and 7. Better to not have them. If on business and like to exercise to burn off a bit of the indulgence, I would recommend other accommodations.

This was my second time to Gild Hall and I will definitely come back. I like the at home & neighborhood feel and the high level of focus on customer experience & service.Rob was great and he made us feel welcome and at ease.

I love to tag along with my husband when he has a conference in a cool place- and since my business is slow this time of year, NYC here we come! We usually avoid the typical conference hotels and opt to take the allowance and book our own accommodations. The company covered $400 so you can find a decent hotel for that this time of year. We stayed right near the conference near Wall Street. We took the Acela down and arrived about 6pm Wed night. Upon check-in we were told they were upgrading us to a better room and we ended up in a King Suite with a bathroom that was bigger than my son's Charlestown apartment and a bar/fridge and half bath off the entry foyer. It was modern and chic and perfect. What a nice surprise! The hotel staff were young and gorgeous but not smug at all. They were warm and welcoming. The restaurant is very popular and was packed. We did not have a reservation but we found a seat in the lounge and had an excellent dinner there. We will definitely be back. Shhh keep it a secret.

My husband and I recently completed a two-night weekend stay at Gild Hall for our anniversary. The staff, who greeted us warmly and attentively, graciously offered us a complimentary room upgrade to celebrate the occasion (we booked a King Superior and they gave us a King Premium, which was well appointed with dramatic high ceilings and chandelier).The room was spotless, the bed was comfortable and the halls were generally quiet. The water pressure in the shower was strong enough to feel like a massage chair (love that) and the water itself got nice and hot. If I could offer one or two notes of criticism, it's that we could hear whenever the next door room flushed their toilet. Also, the key card access to the elevator and room was sometimes "fussy," taking two or three tries to work.All said, however, it's a lovely hotel that we hope to revisit again. As relative to the Manhattan hotel market, it's well worth it, and its downtown location is nice for those who want convenient access to lower Manhattan and away from the fray and tourist congestion of Midtown.

The staff, the rooms, the atmosphere... everything was perfect. I would highly recommend staying here whether you're coming for work or leisure. We were here for our wedding and we couldn't be happier!
user_name:
Jesse S
New York City, New York

review_body: I'd stay here again, but not my first choice. It's clean and serviceable, but not something I would "pay up" for. The location is decent, but coming from someone who lived in NY and visits often, it is less than ideal for the unfamiliar tourist.

After having spent my summer going through chemotherapy, I was finally feeling strong enough for a brief trip to the city. As my friend was checking in, she was asked what we were celebrating. She said “the end of my friends chemo.” When I checked in I was told I had a room upgrade. When we reached our room, my husband and I were pleasantly surprised to find we had been upgraded to a beautiful suite. As if that wasn’t enough, when we returned from dinner, we were surprised again to find a chilled bottle of wine, fresh fruit and amazing cookies. We were overwhelmed by the kindness of the staff at Gild Hall and cannot wait to return. I would highly recommend this lovely little boutique hotel in the financial district.

This hotel is a real gem. Tucked away in the financial area it is actually in a fairly good location for sightseeing. The decor is retro but good retro and the attention to detail is pleasing. The rooms are surprisingly spacious and very comfortable. The staff are very friendly and helpful. But it's the lobby, bar and restaurant that really impress with a wonderful atmosphere and coziness that is very seductive. We ate at the Felice Italian restaurant that is attached (or part of the hotel) and the food was excellent.

The hotel was in a convenient location near public transportation. The décor was very swanky and the bar was jumping on a Tuesday and Wednesday night. I did like that they offered me a welcome glass of Presecco (which was sorely needed). It was clean and the service staff were very friendly. I did not eat any food from the bar/restaurant housed in the hotel lobby area so I cannot comment on that. I personally would not pay their going rate but this was a business trip so I had no worries there.

Best hotel experience I can remember. The room was clean and a comfortable bed. Great ambiance in the lobby. I was able to adjust the room temperature. I loved the robe available for use and the umbrella.

Great staff and hotel, beds were hard. Ate at Felice, the food was OK, the service was gruff. Lobby, bar, and overall hotel are unique and chic. We had a light out in the bathroom and it was promptly repaired.

Excellent. Had a great time and the front desk staff was really good. The location was great to get to the subway and go around NYC. You could also walk to the 9/11 memorial and other landmarks. There is a grocery/pharmacy store and Starbucks in the area, too. Quite, clean rooms.

Decide on a name: hall or hotel and Decide on an address platt or gold street.Lobby is kinda dark but an easy, quick and professional check-in.The staff makes this hotel.Great staff, reasonable room and horrible location.Stayed here five days and still got lost finding it.Drained my phone returning each day.Taxi drivers had a hard time finding...using their phone maps.Room was nice sized but dark. Bed was comfortable and linens ok. Slamming doors in the hallway were way louder than faint street noise.Fire alarm-low battery woke me on my last night at 1am. The front desk was at my room within a minute or two to get it quiet...well done!Above average because of the staff. Below average due to location.Nope, I wouldn’t stay here again...I’d get lost again trying to find it!

My family and I stayed at Gild Hall and couldn't have been more pleased! We had 4 adults a 4 year old and a one year old in two rooms. The rooms were large enough for a king sized bed, twin cot, and a crib plus walking around room. The front desk staff was very accommodating to every request and we had the best hotel stay we've ever had with our grandchildren. The hotel is quiet, very clean, very convenient to the subway and seaport. We will definitely be back whenever in NYC!

Great boutique hotel in downtown. Wonderful and helpful staff, good sized room and amenities. Best of all, its quiet! Close to shops and many restaurants and markets. Perfect atmosphere for my pre/post marathon needs. The restaurant connected, Felice, is awesome too. Great combo. Highly recommend.

Very good service. The staff was particularly warm and welcoming. There was a tall, slender gentleman from England at the front desk that checked us in on arrival. This gentleman went out of his way to talk to us and inquire about our needs as we entered and left the hotel during our entire stay. Several of the doormen were equally as polite and welcoming. I am sorry I didn't ask for their names. Excellent service!

Gild Hall is unique and upscale, tasteful, welcoming and incredibly relaxing. The hotel is in a fantastic location in lower Manhattan. Breakfast is excellent. All levels of staff were exceptional. A wise choice.

I paid over $600 for a night and had a cold shower in the morning. Not happy about that. When I told the front desk personnel, they apologized and asked how often I travel to the city. I expected a discount or a discount on my next stay. When on business, the amount of time in your room is limited but a shower is an important part.

The staff at cheki in took a 100 dollars.from my debit card as a depoait and assure dme it will be refunded after chekout and i have still not been refundes. The internet was free at the hotel and yet i had to pay for it in the form of facilities fees...

Very clean, secure and quiet. Park your car yourself at one of the nearby garages (a.k.a across the street). Hotel was hard to get to with all the narrow one-way streets, so be prepared to circle the area a few times.

We had a wonderful 8 night stay at the beginning of September for our anniversary and husbands birthday. We were on the third floor and did not have any issues with any traffic noise. The room was a good size and the bed was very comfortable. We slept great every night. I so need to buy the pillows they use. The alarm clock had 2 USB ports so did not need to use the adaptor. Nice bathroom and the glass partition was not an issue at all. Received a bottle of wine and a lovely fruit bowl for our anniversary which was very nice. The staff are very friendly and were very helpful with directions and confirming our airport transfer for us. They alway greeted us warmly when we were leaving or returning to the hotel. They certainly make it very pleasant in the hotel with the wonderful staff they have. The hotel is in a great location in the financial district close to a great selection of restaurants and bars. Very close to Fulton street subway with direct trains to Grand Central and Coney Island. The area is great for strolling around with so many things to see and do right on the doorstep. We would definitely return to this hotel.

We stayed 4 nights at the hotel. The rooms are larger than average for NYC and the staff is friendly and efficient. The clientele seems to skew toward hipsters (no value judgment, just what we saw). Unfortunately the hotel has a $19.95/night "Facility Fee" which was not prominently disclosed on the hotel website when we reserved our room so we cannot recommend this hotel to others.

Clean room, good size for Manhattan; staff were friendly and competent. Room service breakfast food was hot and tasty (I got veggie omelet.) Was slightly disappointed that not everything on the menu was on the room service menu.

Stayed here for business travel this summer. Nice, clean rooms. Staff was friendly, helpful and courteous. Comfortable stay and hotel is in a great location. Bar / restaurant were lively and also, very good from a selection standpoint.

This hotel met all of my expectations. The staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. I found the room to be comfortable and the location was good for exploring downtown. We ate a light dinner at Felice and the bartender was also very friendly. The food and atmosphere were just right.

Convenient location, room small but fine for short trip. Rode in elevator with uncovered room service (would never order now). Took a long time and little explanation to get requested towels. Felice dinner was highlight.

My stay at Gild Hall was perfect! The hotel was beautiful and had a great atmosphere. Everything was clean and ready for us. The food in the restaurant was fabulous and the staff went above and beyond to make my NYC visit unforgettable. Louis Chavez and the rest of the staff were really helpful and I will for sure stay here in my NYC future adventures.

Kind and helpful staff, we were treated very Good. A cooled glass of prosecco upon arrival, Great recommandations of local restaurants and bars from staff, kind service when i had a problem figuring out how the shower Worked. And a Great hotel restaurant and wine bar!

Very nice and convenient place to stay in the Financial District. The lobby was a cross between a ski lodge with a British feel to it. We didn't get a chance to go to the bar but it was very crowded and looked like a fun place to be. Rooms were very clean and bed was comfortable. Also very quiet which was a bonus. Very reasonably priced for NYC and also pretty roomy. Staff was extremely friendly, especially Tom, who I made my reservation through over the phone and had the pleasure of meeting when we checked out. He was very knowledgeable about the property and Thompson Hotels in general. Very nice young man! We ordered room service one of the days for breakfast. Coffee was fresh and was excellent. I had the yogurt with granola on top - very good. My husband had a bagel and said it was good. The area this hotel is in is very convenient to a lot of bars and restaurants as well as subways. Some of the uber drivers had a hard time finding it, but that seems normal in this area of NYC with GPS. I definitely recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

SI primarily stayed here for a wedding. Room was spotless, well appointed. The hotel itself has a rustic, "manly" decor. Scottish plaid and dark leather. Very nice size for a NYC hotel room. Would definitely recommend!
user_name:
JPMOC
New York City, New York

review_body: We loved this hotel! Beautiful decor in the lobby, on arrival we were offered beer or prosecco (we chose the beer) and were given a very warm welcome. The room itself was lovely, very clean and stylish. I have to admit from reading other reviews I was concerned about the translucent bathroom door. It was absolutely fine, the wall on the side of the toilet is thicker anyway and there is a heavy grey curtain to pull across too. One time my partner went in there and forgot to pull the curtain across, and I still couldn't see anything so don't be put off if you like your privacy! It's absolutely fine!It was our anniversary and we received a knock on the door in the early evening, where we were presented with a bottle of prosecco and a huge plate of delicious fruit to wish us a happy anniversary. It was such a lovely gesture, we were both delighted! The room is not soundproof so we could hear the traffic and the subway trains rumbling outside, but for us this added to the experience of New York rather than being a nuisance. Just be careful when walking around the bed, as the wooden bed frame sticks out further than the mattress and both of us caught our legs on it a couple of times! This hotel is in the financial district, so it is walking distance to Wall Street, the World Trade Center & 9/11 Memorial, as well as to the Statue of Liberty Cruises. You will need to get the subway to go up to Times Square and Central Park (although one day we walked everywhere and ended up walking 15 miles in total!) Overall, a superb hotel - very modern, with a great atmosphere and friendly staff. Lovely and clean. If you are looking to stay in the financial district this hotel is a great choice!

This is a good place if you are not looking for your standard business hotel, but still want excellent service. Nice and cosy design. Restaurant and bar are more or less part of the lobby which creates lively atmosphere. Rooms are comfy and roomy. Friendly and adequate staff. What I didn't like: they charge 9 USD for the bottle of still water that is placed not in the mini bar, but on the table.

Love this hip hotel, and the staff is awesome and very helpful. The king suite was perfect. Loved the hotel bar; delicious cocktails!! I favor staying in lower Manhattan and am grateful I found The Gild Hall. My favorite boutique hotel in NYC!

This is the first luxury hotel I've stayed in and it was well worth it. I thought the room would be small but I was surprised at how spacious it was. The room was well stocked with drinks and snacks and other (let's call them) sundries. The bed was huge, had just the right amount of softness as well as support and the pillows were just perfect for me since I sometimes have neck problems. I LOVE the decor. The place is very tastefully decorated. The carpeting reminded me of the Overlook Hotel in The Shining, but I thought this was more 'cool' than 'creepy' and I love little details like that. The staff was beyond friendly and helpful and the front desk experience was top notch. Special shout out to Rob at the front desk. He was extremely professional and accommodating and really made my stay nice. I loved the hotel's location. I wanted a place that was kind of private, and the Platt Street location is perfect. I had the feeling of navigating cobblestone backstreets in some European locale. The location was also close to shopping, so whether you wanted whiskey, a leather belt or toothpaste, you can find a store that sells that. Overall, excellent hotel. I'll definitely be staying again.

The decor is exceptional, the bed is extremely comfortable, and you receive free champagne at check in. The only minor issues I had were that the bathroom door did not close completely and the toiletries smelled too masculine for me to use but otherwise it's fantastic.

We were attending a wedding in NYC and stayed at Gild Hall. Hotel staff was great and responded quickly to any request; accommodations were comfortable. (They have the best room sound insulation. We never heard a peep from outside or next door from inside our room yet when we stepped in the hall, we could clearly hear the party in the next room.) Felice bar staff and restaurant staff were friendly and the quality of food and drink was very good. Probably fastest room service in Manhattan! Great stay! And great location! Less than half a mile to Battery Park, Ground Zero, the Wall Street Bull, St Vincent's, and Chinatown.

My husband and I celebrated our wedding anniversary at this hotel after an unavoidable work conflict had me away from home for it. Couldn't have asked for better accommodations at a reasonable price in NYC and not only was the hotel clean, hip and efficient, the staff was super friendly and accommodating. In fact, when the front desk found out we were celebrating they sent us up a nice bottle of red wine to get started (in addition to our welcome Prosecco!). Will definitely stay here again!

From the moment we checked in to the moment we left, everyone and everything were excellent. Robert and David at the front desk were fabulous with every request for my son’s wedding. The entire event was amazing.

Service was top notch. The hotel is very nice and the bar and restaurant are lively but in a good way, nice crowd. The beds are Sooooo comfortable! Mini bar was fully stocked , bottles of water were way over priced but it’s NYC, everything is over priced. Overall it’s a great hotel and we’ll definitely be back.

First time staying in the Financial District of NYC and very pleased with the location and amenities of the Guild Hall Hotel. Easy walking distance to the WTC Memorial, Brooklyn Bridge and other tourist destinations in the area. Would stay again at this location as well as recommend it to friends and family.

Good central location for Trinity Church wedding ceremony. Good Service, Good accommodations, good facility to mingle with other wedding ;party guests, good food. This hotel provided a very personalized approach which was responsive to questions and needs.

Had a wonderful stay at the Gild Hall. Love the location (quiet) and the ambiance of the hotel. The staff are always gracious and down-to-earth, and the rooms are a great size for New York. Thanks for a great stay - I will return!

Had a great time. The bed was like sleeping on a cloud, but kept bumping my legs on bottom of the wooden bed. Also the cards to use the elevator an get in the room would not work had to recharge twice. Then told not to put near my cell phone.

After a red eye flight in it was such a fantastic surprise they were able to allow us to check in around 9 AM instead of 3. Perfect location near subway, etc. and near tons of restaurants and bars. Service was great, they texted a few times to see if there was anything else they could do to improve the stay. Beds were huge and comfy. Will be back.

I have stayed in NYC many times but will never stay anywhere else again. This hotel was fabulous. The rooms are small, which is to be expected in NYC, but the rest of the assets more than make up for it. The bar and restaurant are amazing! I highly recommend the restaurant - Italian - even if you are staying in another part of town. The food is incredible. I've been to Italy many times - eating at Felice brings me back to those days. The pasta is home made and wonderful. The beef stew was Heaven on a plate!

Just back from our 2nd visit to Gild Hall and still love this place very much. The staff are so professional yet personal which we like. We were also upgraded, not sure if this was because we booked this through Expedia and it’s one of their VIP hotels but it was a lovely surprise, along with a bottle of fizz waiting for us in our room. Nothing is too much trouble and although we weren’t staying due to business, we never once felt uncomfortable or out of our depth at this hotel. I’m going to selfishly stop reviewing this fab hotel we are lucky to stay in as we don’t want them to change as they become more popular. I hope Gild Hall never changes and stays as it is, a beautiful boutique hotel with quality in every department x

I had a good experience at the Gild Hall. The room was clean and the staff was friendly. I would recommend this place to other people. There are alot of good restaurants in the area. October is a good time to travel to New York.

The room was unique, relaxing, and comfortable. But, only had one blanket (a heavy comforter). No sheet or smaller blanket to sleep under. Was either hot or cold. Overall, I liked my experience though.

Stayed at Gild Hall for a night recently. The property is tucked away in a quiet alley in downtown Manhattan. I would give it 3.5 stars as I had no major complaints but also was not blown away by anything.Good: room had high ceilings, cool finishes/furniture, offer you a drink at check-in, pretty quietBad: dirty linens left in the room, no free water ($6 for small bottle, $9 for large), water from above dripped on my window for an hour in the morning, cable TV was spotty, no SPG status recognition

Gild Hall is a really great place to escape to for any type of trip, we always do our staycations here. The staff always remembers us and we are always greeted and treated with treats, prosecco (love this touch and anything else that we need to make our stay wonderful. My son loves being in this chic, peaceful setting. It's just a great spot to relax from New York City.

The Gild Hall made stay very enjoyable. The staff was so attentive and lovely. It is a very quaint hotel with a lot of character and ambiance. The restaurant and bar area and very pretty and inviting. The food was also amazing, specially their special sunflower bread. The beds are extremely comfortable. We will be back.

We stayed at Gild Hall for just one night but we truly enjoyed the experience. The service was wonderful from start to finish, the room was spacious and very clean, parking was right across the street and it's close to everything downtown. We will definitely come back!
user_name:
Mark S
New York City, New York

review_body: Absolutely Perfect.Best hotel and staff in NYC! The breakfast foods wee superb, bar selection plentiful and the front desk associates the most pleasant and professional staff we've experienced. The rooms were spacious, modern and beds very comfortable

My wife and I recently got married and had the Glid as our wedding hotel. They made us, our friends and family feel welcomed and relaxed to enjoy the weekend. They went above and beyond to make sure everything was perfect. We'd recommend staying here for excellent service and a quality experience.

Rooms small and tiny even for NYC . Dark and felt dirty, checked out 5 days early due to noise from room parties not being dealt with, Reception very poor and slow service, I know what a “boutique” style hotel is meant to be and this is not it.

I left s pillow in my room went back to the hotel and still waiting for a call from the hotel.l I think this is what made my trip an unhappy one that issue - otherwise good experience and worth staying here. Good service, good location, good services, room was large enough

This hotel exceeded my expectations, much due to the people working here. I felt like I was in the company of friends. Room was nice and clean too. Will definitely recommend this hotel and consider for future trips to NYC.

We booked this hotel 12 months ago so we got a really great rate and we were a little nervous that it was going to be too good to be true. It actually turned out to be so much better than we had hoped! The staff were amazing, so friendly and helpful. The lobby area was stunning and our room was so spacious, clean and comfortable. We were also a little worried there wouldn't be many good options around the financial district but we were so wrong! There were loads of places close by, within a couple of blocks, plus the restaurant downstairs from the hotel was great! We stayed at seven different 4 star hotels on our trip across US and Canada and Gild Hall was definitely our favourite. I can't recommend this place highly enough - we would definitely stay here again!

It's a month later and it was actually so great that I remembered to come back and write a review! I don't usually write a lot of reviews but the staff at Gild Hall really went out of their way to take care of my husband and I. It was my husband's birthday and they made sure to leave a bottle of champagne for us and had room service deliver a dessert (with a candle lit and all!) once we checked in. They also text you and encourage you to text that number with any questions or things that you need! This was super convenient. If I wanted something to be done by the time we got back to the room, I could text the number and it would be taken care of. The rooms are clean and well taken care of. Great location and in addition, the hotel is just very beautiful. It has a nice almost rustic chic feel to it (think lots of beautiful wood and warm lighting) and feels very upscale. We got a deal for our stay and I felt the prices were very reasonable considering NYC. Thank you for everything!

I stay here every time I'm in lower Manhattan for work. 5 minute walk from the heart of downtown but away from main streets' racket. Cozy rooms (not your boutique type), friendly staff, usually reasonable rates...this is NYC, you know.

Very nice hotel in a very nice area. Parking sucks in this area so you may have to park in a lot, but you'll spend more than that on a few drinks anyway. You're in Manhattan! Hoping to spend more time in this area next time. My fiancé wanted to spend more time in the lower east side this past trip. So we compromised and went to the lower east side. That's how that works.

I travel a lot for work and stay at a lot of different hotels. I usually have no problem finding a gripe with each place I stay. However, Gild Hall was such a great experience - I have nothing to whine about it.. I was actually in NYC to visit my sister who lives down the street from this hotel. Rooms are large for the city, very clean and have amazing decor. Although you are in the heart of the city, the hotel is on a quiet street. I was in a room on the 4th floor and am a light sleeper, so I expected this to be problem. It was not. FiDi and South Street Seaport have a lot more going on when compared with even just a few years ago. This was a great place and it's super close to the subway, so it's worth venturing away from mid-town or other "popular" neighborhoods for a wonderful experience at Gild Hall! Free internet is also awesome.

We've stayed in this hotel for 6 nights. We were really very happy to stay there. very freindly atmosfere , rooms were very well kept clean . Hotel is located in south Manhatten, location is very good, highly recomanded.

The hotel was very clean and the staff was attentive. Close to South Street Seaport. The front desk even sent us a bowl of fruit. The bathroom had a glass door from inside you cannot see out but you can see in! Don’t forget to pull the curtain!

The hotel was very nice and clean. The staff was very accommodating to the guest. The location of the hotel is central to a lot of site and was perfect for my work location. I was only a couple of blocks from ground zero (World Trade Center).

Hotel is nice, and room sizes are decent for New York. If you need to stay in Financial District, this is a good option. However, I traveled twice to midtown and the cab ride was LONG. Subway would be better option for travel from this location.

I couldn't have been more pleased when I arrived at this hotel. They was a perfect spot for unloading our car. Inside revealed a warm, inviting darkly paneled lobby area with a very intimate feel. The desk staff was warm, kind and helpful. They registered us quickly, no hassles and helped us upstairs with our bags. Our room was plenty large for our needs as tourists. The bed and pillows were soft and cozy! I have recommended this hotel to two friends whom have booked a room. I am also planning on booking a room this week!

This was a very nice hotel. Small, but typical for Financial District hotels. Very well furnished for the small size. There is a closet close to the door that holds a good enough amount of clothing/ironing board/iron. Small mini bar with drinks and snacks. Desk/table/chair for writing/business. Bed was very comfortable for 2 people. Ceiling are very high. Bathroom doesn't have vent (oh well) and uses frosted glass partition from the room but there is a curtain to pull for privacy so it worked for us. LOVED the soaps/lotions. Had a nice manly "campfire" smell (and I am female!). I prefer to stay in these boutique hotels for personalized service but really didn't need to bother the front desk for anything. There is even a shaving kit in the bathroom (I think it's $15)!The front desk/lobby area is nice, with a rustic feel. Elevators feel old and rickety, just like when I worked in the area in 1993. :) There were some retro-looking bicycles near the front doors - not sure if they were for decoration, for rent, or a guest's. There is a nice little bar in the lobby area that didn't seem too loud when we returned around midnight.I DID hear people in the hallway outside the room, but they seemed to be fairly considerate. Nothing crazy. Like all hotels, I arrive with ear plugs and an eye mask so not sure if the noise level is above normal or not.Overall, I'd definitely stay again. I parked around the corner on Liberty St for a decent fee.

I've never had a bad experience, it's always top notch. Extra love for text communications including delivering a toothbrush to the room! Great staff, great location, comfortable room and excellent design & aesthetics throughout. Thank you!
user_name:
F Reid S
Nashville, Tennessee, United States

review_body: The rooms are slightly bigger than other hotels I have stayed in Manhattan however Im not sire if the hotel itself is worth the additional cost when compared to the doubletree hilton and four point sheraton. Breakfast at the hotel is nice as it is provided by the restuarant Felice but wasnt inclided in our room rate.

We were on a holiday in New York when we arrived at Gild Hall. A hiccup happened when our reservation did not come up, but huge kudos to Anthony and Eric at the front desk who promptly gave us a nice upgrade! Their extreme helpfulness and great attitude saved us the tiring back and forth (which happens more often and not in situations like this).We really enjoyed our stay and the service, and will definitely return the next time we are in town!

I had a wonderful stay at Gild Hall. A very convenient location. The staff was great. Everyone was so welcoming and helpful. The restaurant was great. I was very impressed at how fast service was. The room was fine. I had no complaints. Will stay here again when I return.

Had a great stay at the Gild Hall, no issues, staff was excellent. In hotel restaurant was absolutely superb. I would stay at Gild Hall again, no questions asked. I wished there were less scaffolds in the are but ironically they provided great shelter since we forgot the umbrella, so careful what you wish for.

Stayed here for five nights earlier in the year on a good deal. The location was reasonably good for getting around Manhattan and was a short walk to the nearest subway. Rooms were really comfortable, quiet and with lots of amenities. Bar was good with a decent choice of beer. Staff were unhelpful but could be unfriendly at times. The hotel is geared towards business clients but is fine if you're not staying there on business.

Stayed on the weekend, so I couldn't tell you how it is during the week. Reasonable sized rooms for NYC. Modern, with lots of amenities in the room. Forget your razor? $15 will get you a Harry's starter kit (you'd probably pay that much for the kit online). Elevators are key-controlled and modern - not always a given in the City. The restaurant downstairs, Felice, has a very nice breakfast which we really liked and not too expensive. They serve other meals but we can't comment upon them. Staff was courteous, efficient and kind. There are several parking garages/lots within 1 block.

convenient location if doing business in the FIDI; convenient location if not doing business in the FIDI but want to be downtown. staff are friendly and helpful. somewhat intimate due to the small size. hotel dining and bar are excellent (more beers on tap would be a plus). beds are comfy and rooms are clean and well serviced and maintained. easy walking to a major metro hub; ferry services are a few blocks aware. riverside and battery park nearby if needed to get away from urban hustle

I only stayed here for one night so can't offer a comprehensive opinion but here's what I picked up. - Good sized rooms with super-comfortable beds and loads of storage. Free WiFi which worked well. - Excellent area in the fidi district. Close to loads of attractions and metro stations- good restaurant and bar attached (barman was great - super-friendly)- Staff weren't great. I never felt really welcomed and noted the complete lack of simple please and thank yous (at check-in, it was a "I need your credit card and ID" - sounded more like police than reception staff). I know this may be fussy but it really stood out to me when comparing with other hotels in NY, the States and all over the world - I definitely was not made to feel like a guest, more a business transaction. There was no comparison with the staff at the Even Hotel in Brooklyn where I stayed the previous week, who were fantastic. Maybe just a bad day but it is what it is and given this factor alone, I would probably not choose to return to what otherwise seemed like a nice property.

So I chose to lodge away from the main touristy area and travel in. Smart choice! The scaffolding and works going on in the area might discourage one in error. Its a beautiful area in spite of all the works. Financial district meant there were loads of everyday shops. I got my nails done a couple minutes walk from the hotel, local grocers, well served by the metro, food food food and more food places.The hotel, so lovely. Very cosy. Nice people. Nice decor. Quiet.

I have stayed here before, and I love the location small size and great amenities. Anthony treated us extremely warmly when we arrived very late, and the happy hour is one of the best bargains in FiDi.
user_name:
Joseph S
San Francisco, United States

review_body: Just go back - spend two nights August 2017. Nice big clean room - fantastic personal service. Excellent front staff - very accommodating. We left out bags (luggage) 5 hours before check in with no hesitation. I will be staying again.

Stayed here years ago and really liked it. Decided to stay here again after seeing it on Jetsetter. Loved it. Love the location. Very quiet. Bed was very comfortable. Great restaurants nearby and close to the subway. Walking distance to World Trade Center and the water as well. Would definitely stay here again. Glad to see the Financial District rebounding.

Stayed overnight with two other couples for our anniversaries! If I could give it more than five stars I would! The decor is fun, beautiful and very inviting. Absolutely loved the location! Went to South Street Seaport, Freedom Tower Observatory, Battery Park, and walked over the Brooklyn Bridge! What put it over the top was the staff and personal touches!!! We were given complementary bottles of wine and spring water for our anniversaries! The staff was very attentive, helpful and fun! Will definitely book again!!!

Hotel is trying and the staff are lovely, but it's August and it is 90 degrees Fahrenheit!! It's NYC and sweltering and the hotel has air conditioning. What they neglect to tell you is it is horrendously loud, like a jet plane landing in your bedroom and there is only one setting....loud jet plane. I called the front desk and they sent up a technician and unfortunately no improvement can be made. It's an old building with A/C window units which require LOUD HARD PROPULSION and power. I doubt I will sleep tonight. I travel a ton , and quite frankly, the hotel should have informed me about this issue. hotels are fore sleeping after all. Also the windows have curtain that are decorative (not functional) so stop short of blocking out the late. All I can say are there are other choices (i.e. 1 Brooklyn Bridge) for the smae price. More modern and accommodating than this place. Sorry to be so negative as the staff were sweet and tried to help. I hope the ownvr of this hotel see my review.

Hotel room was spacious and pleasant. Reception very friendly. Room was clean. Shower could be updated. Bar below lively. Location good if you need to be near Wall Street. I got charged a $20 resort fee when checking out and did not understand what it was for. I found that a bit sneaky and unnecessary.

My wife booked a surprise trip to NYC for my birthday and, thanks to Gild Hall it really was the most perfect way to celebrate it! The staff went above and beyond to make sure that our stay was the most pleasant and perfect that it could be. Rob, at the front desk was fantastic, personally checking in with us via text each morning to ask if there was anything we needed. We were greeted with a bottle of Pinot Noir in our room and complimentary breakfast, both of which were excellent. The room itself, a King Premium, was spacious by NYC standards with very high ceilings, huge TV, comfy bed and plenty of room for everything. I can't fault it and we've been lucky and stayed at many great hotels in all areas of Manhattan on previous trips. The Gild Hall is probably the smallest that we have stayed at but the service we received was outstanding. It was impeccably clean throughout and the lobby and bar areas were very cool. The location is very convenient to Brooklyn and we enjoyed exploring FiDi, an area that were not too familiar with before this trip. This was a trip to remember and it was in part thanks to this wonderful hotel. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again!

The Gild Hotel is one of the best hotels we've stayed, especially from a customer service perspective. We were getting married in downtown Manhattan and booked this hotel. We are so glad we did! Upon arrival, the staff greeted us, had our room ready and even surprised us with an upgrade to one of the nicest suites we've seen! That aside, the staff was really friendly, very accommodating and extremely helpful.The suite itself was quiet, comfortable and had all the amenities (and more) you'd expect from this wonderful space - a deep soaking tub with bath salts and a candle, a full bar with leather stools (you have to pay for the liquor, of course) and comfy bathrobes and slippers. We felt so pampered. The icing on the cake was the bottle of wine and handwritten note they left us the night of our wedding. They went above and beyond!Overall, we highly recommend this hotel - not because of the perks we received (which was thoughtful), but the rooms are quiet, the staff is super nice and the hotel itself just has a cool vibe. You will feel at home and welcomed from arrival to departure.
user_name:
Annie C
New York City, New York

review_body: I stayed for 7 nights in the Gild Hall in early August 2017; I was visiting the area to spend time with friends nearby. The location of this hotel is great: all the way downtown, near the ferry ports, riverside parks and historic buildings and important museums and monuments. Guests can go anywhere in the city from Fulton Street subway. The decor is a modern take on Edwardian style; dark leather, dark red walls, dim lights with art photography everywhere. Rooms are comfortable with enormous beds and good chairs. Staff at the front desk are helpful

We got a great price through Honey Travel clean courteous and pleasant. Only quibble was no complimentary coffee and lack of premium cable channels. Refurbishment a success. Felice convenient and congenial for brunch.

It was my first time staying downtown and I appreciated the nighttime quiet. The room was lovely, spacious. Service was excellent, from being greeted to champagne upon entering. Lovely dining and bar area. Would definitely return.

We have been fortunate to have stayed at Gild Hall multiple times over the past three years.
