Since our very first stay, David Finch has stood out at the front desk as the best example of hotel hospitality that we have ever experienced. We have travelled extensively, and have hesitated to publicly review our experience at Gild Hall because it was our "secret gem" when visiting the financial district. David is polite, efficient and so helpful that my husband and I felt completely comfortable when our daughter had an extended solo stay at Gild Hall for two summers in NYC. David Finch and the rest of the amazing staff at Gild Hall made my daughter and the rest of our family feel so at home, that whenever we visit NYC, even when our business dictates stays at other hotels, we make it a point to stop in at Gild Hall to greet our friends there, especially David. Stopping at Gild Hall feels like "coming home". It is a small European - like boutique hotel that takes us away from the busy pace of the Manhattan streets.  Another great aspect of this cozy hotel is that it is connected to a wonderful restaurant called Felice. The staff is warm and welcoming, and the food is delicious. We can vouch for this for breakfast, lunch and dinner. If your travels take you to the financial district of NYC, look up David Finch at Gild Hall. He will be sure that you are well taken care of, and visit Felice to enjoy their food and service. It is all quiet and unassuming, and I hope you will feel at home like our family does every time we visit. Thank you, David Finch and staff!

The room was nice and big - very unusual for a NYC hotel!Location was fantastic - just across from Brooklyn and easy to traipse to uptown on foot or via the subway. The staff are very kind and you get Prosecco when you arrive - an added bonus!

This is my first time in New York City and I DO NOT REGRET that I stayed in this hotel. I stayed for 9 nights and everyday was unbelievably comfortable. The location was perfect, close to the subway and every sightseeing places in NYC. Room service was great and most of all, Anthony, the hotel manager was extremely kind and helpful. He helped out with all the problems, even the trivial ones, and even gave us some advice about traveling around New York City. It was like meeting a nice friend! BEST hotel manager ever!!Restaurants and the mini bar were great too! Also, they offer you free champagne in the lobby to make you feel at home :) It was a great experience and I would definitely stay at Gild Hall if I were to come back to NYC.

From the moment you walk into Gild Hall, you feel like you're somewhere else. (Well, assuming you managed to find it, because the Gold Street address is totally misleading when you ask to be dropped off, the door is actually on Platt). The small lobby smells nice, the ambience and decor is indeed very Aspen-chic. (Even the amenities have a very clean, woodsy scent) The king suite room was a good size (and had the most well-stocked alcohol collection I've ever seen in a room). Yes, there was city noise at all hours of the night, but it wasn't terrible. What WAS terrible, were the impossible-to-sleep on pillows. The location is pretty great for the financial district, but the problem is... the financial district isn't really a tourist-y destination. It's a short jaunt back and forth to the subway, and if you want to get anywhere it's going to be a 10-15 minute ride on the subway... or a multi-block walk. Overall, I'd stay here again ... if it was in a different location.

I'm a local from the neighborhood who recently experienced having a major flood in my apartment due to contractor error. My cats and I had to evacuate as rain water was literally pouring into our home. I remembered my neighbor had stayed in Gild Hall during Hurricane Sandy with her pets so we headed over there. I can't say enough wonderful things about this hotel. The lobby is gorgeous and smells great. The room was beautiful, with its bathroom clad in espresso marble and smoky glass tile, leather furniture, and stunning chandelier over the bed. The king size bed was incredibly comfortable and was decked out in luxurious Sferra linens. The toiletries smell divine. The location is amazing. The restaurant, Felice, has delicious food and outstanding cocktails. But the absolute best thing about this hotel was the staff. From the minute I walked in, soaking wet in sweatpants and carrying cats, I was treated so kindly and respectfully. Throughout my stay, every single person that worked there made sure my cats and I were perfectly at home. All the managers and front desk staff- Kolby, Rob, Dea, Thomas, Andy, David, Max, Mark, Anthony, John, Angel, Mosey, & Van Hallen, as well as the house men Thupten, Ringin, & Ryan, knew my situation and were genuinely concerned with how I was handling my troubles. Their support was very helpful to me. The complimentary proseco in the lobby was also very helpful! At the end of all this drama, I left Gild Hall feeling like I made a bunch of new friends and I will definitely be back to visit! If you, and perhaps your children with fur, want to stay at a super chic hotel with an awesome downtown vibe that is local-approved and where you will be guaranteed to meet some of the nicest people NYC has to offer, Gild Hall is the place for you!
user_name:
Christina A
New York City, New York

review_body: I would recomend to everyone this place! Apart from having beautiful designed, spacious and confor6able rooms, dotated with everything you could need, the stuff is super nice. Anthony, the kind man working at the desk the night I came, helped me book online and let me do a very early checkin. No need to say how awsome the location is, you have all types of shops, metro and restaurants close to you. 5 stars out of 5 for everything!

We return to Gild Hall every summer and find it consistently excellent. The rooms are spacious, the staff so friendly and attentive. It is a very special place. You will not find a hotel more concerned about each guest's satisfaction, with frequent yet unobtrusive check-ins to see if guests are happy or need anything. We love this hotel!Also, the restaurant, Felice's, is top notch. Service, food and outstanding management make it a wonderful place for drinks, appetizers and delicious meals. A+ all the way!

Just returned from a quick trip to NYC and stayed in the Financial District for a change. Very much enjoyed the change of pace from the touristy Times Square area. Gild Hall was a beautiful boutique hotel close to Battery Park, the Waterfront, World Trade Center and Wall Street. Our room featured 12 foot ceilings, a comfy king bed, and updated bathroom. For NYC, it was actually pretty spacious! The staff could not have been more accommodating-quick to open doors, give directions even push elevator buttons for us when our hands were full! A special shout-out to front desk staffers David and Rob! They are the best! They made our stay effortless and we'll definitely return - in part due to their excellent attention to detail!

Lovely hotel in New York's financial district. Staff really helpful. Room amazing. Restaurant and bar on site. Free use of umbrellas if needed. Close to subway station, other restaurants and attractions. Only small draw back - bath towels could be nicer but me liking fluffier towels. Would stay there again.

Gild Hall is a great hotel! Anyone in the financial district this is a wonderful place to call home while in NYC. The staff was great, room wonderful and even the meal/drinks we had Felice were spot on!

We found this hotel on hotel tonight as a family friend is visiting NYC and would like to explore down town area, but she is a handicapped senior and walking is very difficult for her, so my only choice was to stay in downtown and driver her around. Gild hall is in the perfect location with a great price tag, also pictures of Gild hall caught my eye. Why stay in a regular chain hotel like Marriott when you can stay in a boutique hotel for $180 a night? Esp in financial district that's one block away from the federal reserve?After a very stressful day of driving around in the city, we arrived at Gild hall around 9pm. I was exhausted so I just pulled up right in front of Gild hall's front door, and walk in. I didn't even lock my car doors, that never happens! And that just shows how tired I was. Rob at the front desk greeted me with a huge warm smile, and told me "we will do everything we can to make your stay a great one, relax, we got you!", and offered me a glass of chilled champagne. That immediately took a huge load of weight off my shoulders. While he was looking for the best room available for my handicap family friend, a valet approached me for my car key and handed me a valet tag for my car. In less than 3 minutes, my car was taken care of, 2 rooms keys were in my hand, a glass of chilled champagne in my other hand, and we were waiting for the elevator to go up to our room.Our room was on the 9th floor, the hall way might not look like much but our room was breath taking! This is the definition of a boutique hotel. We were suppose to have dinner in Felice, the hotel restaurant, but my companion loved our room so much that they did not want to leave, I had to walk to Eataly to buy dinner for them. Look at what you did Rob!!!! Because we are a group of 3 people and there was only one king size bed in our room, Rob offered to have our sofa bed made whenever we are ready for it. We called the front desk around 9:30pm to have it made and someone showed up at our door with a full set of bedding within 10 minutes. He made the pull out bed with bed sheet, pillows and comforter in under 5 minutes!This was the first hotel that has everything you expect a 5 star hotel to have and more, it def is a hidden gem in NYC.We def will be back, and we WILL eat at felice next time!!
user_name:
wdee219
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed at Gild Hall on a Saturday night because we had a wedding to attend and the bride reserved rooms for the guests. This is a very nice and clean hotel in the financial district. Lots of places to go eat within walking distance and the hotel has a restaurant downstairs. We walked to a local deli for lunch and breakfast the next day. The staff at the desk was very cordial and friendly. It would have been nice if all the wedding guests had been on the same floor, but we were scattered all over the hotel. We had a pleasant and quiet stay.

Overall great experience. Staff was very helpful and insightful, rooms were spacious and clean, and the atmosphere was very hip but yet elegant. One of the financial district's best hotels, if not one of NYC's best.

While this hotel is in the Financial District I was pleasantly supervised at how quiet it was at night. My wife and I were in town for the 4th of July celebration and this hotel is very convenient to the subway and an easy walk to the Freedom tower and the seaport. The staff was great and the room was spotless. Considering the location the price was reasonable and I just cant imagine a better deal in the area.

This was a surprise find in the corporate portal for work travel...Downtown financial boutique hotel was stylish, in a very "hunting lodge" way. Felice, the restaurant is great..both for breakfast and dinner. Room is a reasonable size for NYC, I have had kings the weeks I've stayed...well decorated with a "spa" feel for the bathroom. Very refined, up-scale, and interesting vibe. Very thoughtful snack-tray held a few surprises.Front desk staff was amazingly helpful! They deserve 6 stars on excellence. Two challenges: Bathroom does not have a walk in shower, door is awkward, and the electrical plugs are not easily found near the bed to plug in my iPhone.

High ceilings, beautiful fixtures and finishes. Excellent value for the price. Great restaurant called Felice and the staff were super down to earth and accomodating--highly reccommend. One thing is --this isn't the bustling typical new york experience. but I like that--I don't want to be in the crazy part of town.

I stayed here for a week. This is not a fancy hotel and the room was not so big, but it was enough for one person. I recommend getting a bigger room if you are two. The room was clean, very comfortable bed and the staff were nice and helpful.

Friends and family stayed at Gild Hall for our son's wedding in Brooklyn. The staff could not have been nicer or more helpful. The location was perfect for a quick trip across the Brooklyn Bridge. Our guests all enjoyed brunch the next morning at Felice, the hotel restaurant. It was a perfect weekend!

The hotel was very clean (I'm a germ phobe) and I would definitely visit again; my only concern was there was only 1 seat in the room besides the bed because the room was a little snug. I will probably look to see what other rooms they have available and see if I can get a room that was a little larger next time. It was a quiet street in the financial district so there was not a lot of foot traffic as it was the weekend. I've never seen New York this quiet but it was a nice change!
user_name:
Nina S
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Enjoyed my stay. Very nice hotel. Nice size rooms and bathrooms. Services was excellent. Nice atmosphere in the bar. did not eat in the restaurant or use room service. Internet service was esy to use and connect to.

Small boutique hotel good for business stay as it's near Wall Street. Room was sufficient in size and comfortable. It had hair dryer and ironing board but no kettle. The checking in process could be quicker but it served its purpose.

After 16 hours of flights, I arrived at Gild around midnight. Anthony at the front desk was very welcoming, he had great energy and knowing that I would be staying for 18 nights, he offered to get me a bigger room. The room was super well designed, clean, spacious and modern. Love everything, highly recommend this hotel! Thanks Anthony!

I found the front desk to be very courteous. However, the building is dark and dingy. I would not stay there again. Decor is outdated and depressing. It appears that someone has put a lot of lipstick on a very old facility. Doesn't smell or look clean.

1st time visit to NYC. We came for a family wedding and Gild Hall was the recommended hotel. We stayed for a week and were not disappointed in any way. The hotel was quiet and very comfortable and the staff could not have been better or more responsive. It was a great base to venture from to explore downtown NYC and the financial district. Their close proximity to the Fulton Street subway station was very convenient.

Spent 5 nights at Gild Hall and "WOW" pretty much sums up the experience. The building is cozy, charming and comfortable, the room was well appointed and SO QUIET! We would walk out the front door and be surprised by the noise level. Did not hear that in the room- must have super glass on the windows. Restaurant had good food. Ate only breakfasts there but they were delicious. What made this stay exceptional was the front desk staff. They were attentive and helpful and could not do enough to make your stay happy and carefree. The location of the hotel is very convenient- close to the subway station. The staff will give you a subway 101 lesson so don't be afraid to be a real New Yorker and ride the subway.

Husband and I stayed at Gild Hall for a week while we were in NYC for a wedding. The property is lovely. Rooms are comfortable and the beds are extremely comfortable, especially for beds in a hotel. The on site restaurant prepared the best breakfast we ate during the entire trip. The staff is pleasant and more than willing to help in any way they can. The housekeeping staff in particular really impressed us. They have an uncanny ability to know when you are out of your room and to immediately come in and clean it and get it ready for your use. Being in the financial district was great for us. We were close to the wedding site and really enjoyed everything in the area. Subways are so easy to use that we had absolutely no problems getting to everything we wanted to see from the hotel.We would definitely recommend this charming place as a really great option for your stay in NYC.

Visited for 3 nights. Immaculate hotel with amazing decor. Great location and only a short metro ride from all the tourist sites. Couldnt really fault the hotel and staff were great. Visited hotel restaurant Felice which was pricey but great food and service.Only slight negative was the noisy a/c unit in room which woke us up when it came on throughout the night- all our hotels in the USA were similar though (we visited 4 on our holiday)

We came to Hotel in midnight, but Anthony gave us a warm and great reception. He gave us lots of helps. Great service. The room is very nice and clean. Quiet location in New York midtown. Highly recommended.

Terrific stay! The rooms, food, location, room service, common areas - all outstanding. But...it was the staff that put it over the top. They were phenomenal! I just wish I could have stayed longer! I'll be back!

This beautiful boutique hotel is tucked away under a little awning, but stepping inside changes everything. We found this gem on The Secret Escapes website, and we just loved it. We had two small but pretty rooms with top of the line everything. The staff could not have been more accommodating in every way, and the front desk was always smiling on us. Van Hallen and many others were terrific. The decor of the hotel was charming with bookshelves, leather couches and a comfy bar centered in the lobby. We had the pleasure of eating a most delicious lunch at Felice, where the eggplant and housemade pasta melted in your mouth. The wines and the servers and the view were all top notch in this pretty Italian eatery. You could get everywhere from this location and that made it a perfect stay. We had to leave at 4:30 am for our flight, but even that was made easy by this great Thompson Hotel staff!

Well designed, genuinely friendly, great energy, high levels of service, fabulous beds, good food, small welcoming cafe/bar, close to Soul cycle & yoga for fitness buffs, short walk/ run to the water and the waterfront path, close to subway...... So many great things to say about this boutique hotel that is hidden away in the financial district.

Arrived at Gild Hall & room had been upgraded free. No view but brilliant location for Subway and down town New York. Staff very friendly and room spotless. Would definitely recommend. Felice Ristorante attached to the hotel again staff very friendly and although we didn't eat here ourselves the meals looked at smelt wonderful every good selection of wines which I did sample!
user_name:
Marian W
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: Great location for the lower East side, everything within walking distance. Water Taxi is a great way to travel to Brooklyn. The Hotel is really on Platt, and not Gold, a little confusing for GPS directions
user_name:
Lisa Ann T
Mt. OLIVE, NEW JERSEY

review_body: After suffering many horrible hotel rooms in lower Manhattan, I finally found a true gem. From perfect customer service to amazing room accommodations, everything is wonderful at Gild. I will not be staying anywhere else on my business trips to NYC.

Was here for business and the stay was very comfortable. I felt like home. Nice boutique hotel without the pretentious attitude. Friendly staff and very welcoming. The style is different compared to most other Thompson properties. I found it very unique. Would definitely recommend this!

This hotel is beautiful in a great location if you are visiting the Federal Reserve (or other financial institutions in Downtown Manhattan). It is modern with interesting theming/decorating. The staff was friendly and efficient (even though I was impatient and unhappy after a terrible cab ride from the airport). Room service was very fast and delivered with a smile. Two things of note, on the side of the bed I prefer to sleep on, there was only one available outlet which was actually two feet down the wall and at the baseboard away from the nightstand. Also, if you have a vision impairment, please note that the lobby is rather dark and could be a problem for that group (it is very attractive, just note that it is dark).

Exceeded our expectations. Great restaurant options on Stone Street As well as a phenomenal chef inside the property. Nice proximity to shopping and all that lower Manhattan has to offer. They do a really good job keeping things intimate and expressing genuine interest in ensuring you have a positive stay.

Anthony at the front desk was extremely helpful and friendly. Many thanks for making me feel welcome and comfortable after a long, hot day. Will definitely be returning in the future for the exceptional hospitality.

Our stay at The Gild was awesome. The location was great with easy access to the subway. Loved the vibe of this hotel. Staff was friendly and the room was spacious and comfortable. I will definitely stay here again!

As a native manhattanite, the area around wall street was unchartered waters. Now that business is taking me back to my home town, I'm happy to have discovered the Fidi with a title help from my friends at the Gild Hotlel. Very homey and welcoming but with just enough Europe Boutique hotel feel to mix it up a little..Can't wait to return.. bravo.

We stayed here with 2 other couplesGreat location close to Brooklyn bridge and SeaportStaff were very friendly and helpfulNice bar and restaurant, breakfast was very good with a good choice of dishesWe had a room on 12th floor and weren't disturbed by traffic noise despite being a light sleeperWould definently recommend this hotel to friends

Upscale hotel, great restaurant, very clean,great NYC feel very close to seaport and WTC monuments. Highly recommend for anyone looking for a full service boutique hotel with excellent amenities and top tier service.

front desk staff (Moisey and Anthony) are great ! very easy check-in process. satisfying stay! our flight came into New York late, but the staff were able to accommodate us despite the delay. very happy with the stay here.
user_name:
timothyw2005
New York City, New York

review_body: Had the most amazing stay at this hotel , beautiful place with great service and huge rooms. Front desk staff was very helpful, thank you for Van and Moisey for making it a great experience. Both really helped me with my visit and gave me great advice. Will be returning very soon and staying at this hotel again!

Excellent service from all staffWonderful atmosphereFabulous roomStaff couldn't have done more to make me feel welcome including a room upgrade, complimentary bottle of wine for my first time in America and helpful advice and tips for travelling around the city, places to eat and visit.

My wife and I live in North Carolina, but we come to Manhattan often, and stay at the Gild Hall every chance we get. Rooms are clean, spacious, and so very comfortable. The location of the hotel is fantastic, with everything you need close by. Great dining all around, their restaurant 'Felice' is incredible authentic Italian dining at its best....you must try it while there. All of these great things make this an incredible hotel, but the staff are what really sets this place apart from everywhere else. The entire staff is so professional and courteous that it will surprise you. I've never experienced this high level of customer service at any hotel as consistently as they provide it. Everyone is helpful, all the time. It really is remarkable. They don't seem to ever have an off day or bad moment, and if they do they never do so in front of their guests. Special thanks to David, Rob, and John! They are always finding ways to make our stay more comfortable and memorable :)

My wife and I do not generally do reviews. We have stayed at this hotel since it first opened. We have been there three times this year already to visit grandchildren and children. The staff always remembers us with a glass of wine at check-in.Guest passes to a grade for service Gym 100 steps from the front door for those of us who need a couple hours of exercise every day. One block to century 21, four blocks to the World Trade Center, four blocks the Wall Street, four blocks to the Seaport. Small hotel with a small restaurant and barLaid back with my wife's calls shabby chic. Very good deal economically and comfortable quiet but very nice rooms. We have been to all seven continents, frequently travel Europe Asia and have been in $1000 a night hotel's and find this the best deal and most comfortable hotel in the financial District of New York. We love the place and feel like they do need somebody to review them. Therefore we did!

Not a bad place to stay. room was larger than most hotels downtown. didn't spend much time in the room but order a sheet between bed spread and top sheet. restaurant was really good. which I could eat there every night.

I stayed at this hotel so that I could be somewhat close to an exam I had to take in Brooklyn (the hotel is about 3km from the Brooklyn Bridge). The staff went above and beyond to make my stay comfortable.They were also very fast with room service which was delicious. They also always got my cabs and gave my directions to nearby places I wanted to go (convenient location if you need to be by Wall St). The onlybad thing about the hotel (not their fault) is that the people taking the garbage out outside on the streets can be very loud at night. I strongly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a cute boutique hotel, far downtown with great service!

In searching for a stay for New York's Governor's Ball music festival, and the first trip with my girlfriend from across the country since April, I found this boutique hotel which amazed and surprised me online. In person, the property did not disappoint. My girlfriend was wowed by the room. It was spacious, intimate, and a great place to rest and recover throughout our weekend.Unfortunately, we were unable to experience the restaurants of the facility, however the location, and activities around were perfect for our trip. I would recommend this property for any couple, whether it be our long distance or living locally in New York. The staff was very helpful, and receptive to our needs. I would definitely return.

We had booked three rooms for a short break. The rooms were excellent with the most comfortable bed I've ever had. Atmosphere was so friendly with an excellent bar and restaurant.Location was perfect BUT the point of difference is its staff. Front desk couldn't be more helpful - directions, recommendations, bookings and transfers all professionally handled. Will definitely return. Thank you for a great stay

I can't stress enough how great this hotel is. I checked in and was greeted by the friendly staff (with a glass of prosecco, I might add) and everybody at the desk couldn't have been nicer. John assisted me with checking in and was very accommodating; after a long week at work, it was just what I needed. The room was clean, comfortable, and exceeded my expectations. It was actually kind of difficult for us to leave the room, it was so nice. My friend and I ate at the restaurant downstairs, Felice, and it was delicious. We went a few times during our stay for drinks at the bar and snacks; the staff was awesome and overall, it was a great dining experience. Up until we checked out, my friend and I were so pleased with the customer service. Van Hallen at the front desk was great, as well. I normally don't take the time to review places, but my stay at Gild Hall was so great that I needed to share it with others. Thanks for a great visit, Gild Hall!
user_name:
Alexa G
New York City, New York

review_body: The beautiful and rustic decor is just scratching the surface of excellence at this establishment. The overnight Manager Moisey provided me with wonderful service upon check in at 5am after another hotel completely dropped the ball on my reservation. I walked in off the street and was treated like the king of Wall Street. I highly recommend this for visitors from across the country or even locals looking for a nice staycation in Lower Manhattan. Very impressed. Thank you Moisey and the Gild Hall team.
user_name:
A23properties
New York City, New York

review_body: I try to use the Gild Hall whenever I am in NYC on business as it has a very cool decor, super helpful and accommodating staff, conveniently located near Fulton St Station so traveling almost anywhere in the city is easy, good amenities, great house wine, and is usually good value for money. Highly recommend it.

The Gild Hall in the financial district was a great boutique hotel. The staff was friendly, helpful and engaging. The location was superb...a few blocks from Century 21 and the 9/11 memorial...blocks from the cool TriBeca area (had a great yoga class at the Lyon's Den). The rooms were just what you need to feel a bit pampered, but not over the top. We will stay here again! Oh...and no extra charge if you want to bring your dog! How cool is that?

I was referred to Gild Hall by a friend and had a great stay over the holiday weekend. The rooms have everything you need: comfortable bed, big flat screen TV, mini-bar, and a great reading chair. Staff is very helpful and the restaurant in the lobby, Felice, has great food. One of the best quality-to-price hotels I have experienced in New York. Will definitely stay again the next time I visit the financial district.

The accommodations were comfortable and aesthetic, but the very best was the level of good information and superb advice for getting the best Broadway tickets by buying them directly at the box office. We could never have dreamed that we would have such great experiences in our short stay!

Had an excellent weekend stay at the Gild Hall Hotel. The location is great if you plan to sight see around the financial district, and it's not hard to find a cab to take you up town. The hotel has really cool décor, and a nice lobby area with a hotel bar. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful from check in to check out. Our room was great, the king size bed was extremely comfortable. There is a mini bar available as well as other little products available for purchase around the room. There wasn't much a view, but you can venture outside for great views anyways. There are several little restaurants and shops within walking distance. They will hold you luggage after checkout if you are waiting to leave the city. I also love that the checkout time was 12. Everything was really great about this hotel and I'd definitely stay again if I need a hotel in the financial district. Thank you for the excellent experience!

I came from another hotel which was a horrible experience with no customer service. I was so aggravated when I checked into Gild and that changed immediately upon meeting the front desk staff. They accomodated my early check in and brought by luggage up to my room so I could sit for a drink before to relax a bit. My experience was so amazing I have already booked new reservations in a few weeks. I would never stay anywhere else in Manhattan.

We were not satisfied with breakfast and service ! Two occasins the room wasn't finished made up before we returned from a long day in the city,once we need to contact reception for at least change of towels ( after 3 pm there days ) To smile is Free and why be so stricht When we asked for an ekstra slice of bread and a small glass of juice ? You serve the smaleste glass of juice we have expierince ! We are travelling a lot ! You have a Nice Hotel located perfect for our stay but Please do something about the service !

My husband and I decided to arrive NYC earlier and the place we were booked at was sold out. Since my husband loves the Battery Park area, I decided to give the Gild Hall a shot. Boy, were we glad we did!It was raining and we couldn't catch a cab from Penn Station. So we decided to take the subway. It wasn't difficult to get to the hotel via the subway. But locating the hotel in the rain took quite a bit of effort. Once we found the entrance (somewhat misleading since the hotel's address was Gold street but the entrance was on Platt), everything went smoothly. Firstly, check in was a breeze and the lady who checked us in was very nice and friendly. The room we got was well appointed and on the larger side for NYC standards. I go to NYC a lot and am used to tiny rooms. Here we had room to spread out a little. The bathroom was also on the larger side though we had issues with the sink and shower. Somehow the sink splashes out a lot of water like the sink bowl is too small for the faucet. Not sure why. But no worries as using the towel to dry it off was a simple fix. As for the shower, it didn't drain fast enough and we would be showering in a pool of water. It didn't bother us enough to complain though.What blew us away was the friendly staff that strive to go above and beyond for us. They would greet us each time they see us. Even offered water to us several times including when we were waiting for our ride after checking out. As part of my Expedia elite status, I was given $20 mini bar credit and free premium wifi which was nice. But mind you, the minibar is expensive so $20 doesn't get you much. While en route to the hotel, I cut my foot in the rain against the sidewalk and found myself bleeding and bruised after checking into the hotel. I called front desk and a staff member showed up almost instantly and gave me a bunch of band aid, alcohol rub and antiseptic cream. I truly appreciated it as going to a pharmacy in the rain would have further infected my foot. Happy to report that my foot is healing well without having to go get a tetanus shot!The location is convenient and central. It is close to the WTC and a lot of food and shopping spots. We were able to walk everywhere and it was convenient for us to get to where we wanted to go. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. I highly recommend this place for adults traveling without children and professionals. You won't regret coming here. The reason I specified adults only was because it doesn't appear to be a place that a family with children would like. There is a thriving bar in the lobby and the room's minibar came with a box filled with adult toys. I am guessing this is not kid appropriate.

This was our first trip to NYC and after 6months researching hotels we chose to stay here and we are so glad we did.The location for us was perfect. I loved the area around the Seaport and was so glad we did not choose to stay midtown. The hotel is located near subway stations which are so easy to use.The hotel itself has a nice boutique feel to it and the staff are so helpful in every way, they kindly organised our return transfer to JFK.We booked through Expedia and got a good deal on a deluxe double. Check in and check out was smooth and straightforward. Our bed was big and very comfortable which was welcomed after a day exploring the city.The bar and restaurant also looked lovely but unfortunately we did not have time to try them out but will definitely try out on our next visit.I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel and will look forward to returning some day.

The hotel offers great value in NY downtown area. Unfortunately, the hotel check out process is not up to scratch which led to a restaurant charge billed to me 5 hours after I checked out of the hotel. The charge was eventually reversed after a fairly tedious process. I will be back at this hotel nevertheless given the great value it offers but I will be a bit more vigilant.

From the front office staff to the Felice (resturant) staff it's hard to beat this hotel. Rooms very clean and the food and drinks are out of this world at Felice! I stay there every trip to NYC every other month dusring the year.

This was our family's first hotel stay in NY ever and we feel totally lucky that we stumbled on such a gem. The staff was unfailingly friendly and helpful, the decor was charming and the room was extremely comfortable and attractively decorated.

Even when our room was not ready for hours so no ability to clean-up before a dinner meeting; the staff with their smiles made it at the very least feel better with empathy and trying to achieve other items the best they could to offset the bad experiences.

The staff here are a credit to the customer service industry! Nothing is too much trouble and the warmth and efficiency is second to none.We have travelled extensively all over the world and can honestly say that the level of service here is exemplary.; swift, efficient, friendly and always polite.A great hotel in a quiet and convenient location. The restaurant serves the most wonderful breakfast. Shame we ran out of time to have dinner but Mina our hostess for evening drinks was amazing! Would highly recommend!!
user_name:
Huntershaw
Windsor and Maidenhead, United Kingdom

review_body: 4 StarsPros:Really nice room, esp for a small, boutique hotelEase of getting to financial districtCons:Very dark decorI found the location to be really odd?I wanted to love this hotel but I didn't get there - I think simply because it's not my style. It's very dark and masculine. I also found the surrounding area to be so empty and odd, especially when I walked home a bit later at night from dinner. Location was nice for those who need to get to Fidi/Path.That being said, the actual rooms were lovely. Huge comfortable bed, great bathroom. They were especially nice compared to some of the other boutique hotels I've stayed in while visiting NYC.Overall, solid four stars. Thanks for the stay Gild Hall!

I stay at this property regularly for work in NY, and the front desk staff at my last visit was so helpful and sooo nice. Shout out to Moisey & Anthony for helping this hotel feel like a home away from home.

We thought we were in a Harrison Ford Movie like the Indiana Jones because the entire Hotel has that theme feel. The furniture (Exotic Wood) and finishing (Leather) are made of very expensive materials. That was one Hotel that we enjoyed our stay, because it is on the quiet side of New York City. The Hotel front office staff were friendly too.

I stayed here for three nights by myself on a business trip. Arriving early after a 24hr+ journey from Australia, the staff gave me a much appreciated early check in. The room was small-ish but completely adequate, very tastefully appointed and impeccably clean. Importantly, the bed, pillows and linen were extremely comfortable and high quality. One of the highlights of my stay was the food in the restaurant downstairs. They serve some of the best breakfasts I've tasted anywhere - I can see why it's so popular with locals. I will be sure to stay here again.

Great Hotel, fantastic, friendly and helpful staff, rooms very comfortable and clean. So very well located in the financial district, close to the 9/11 memorial, and easy walking distance to most places. Hotel also has a restaurant attached, Felice -great food excellent breakfast.

Gild Hall is a charming, comfortable hotel a block from the Federal Reserve, convenient to subways, etc. Very comfortable room, beautiful lobby. God value for Manhattan. The nice lady at the reception desk told me I didn't have a view (it didn't matter), but I actually had a lovely view of the surrounding street and neighboring buildings.

I have stayed here many times...always stayed at Smyth Thompson in TriBeCa but when they renovated they lost the feeling that the Gild still has. (ie restaurant changed ownership and as a hotel guest could not ever get a seat at either bar or reservation), Enter David (front desk manager) and company (Robert/John/lquiet gentle housekeeping etc.). When we pull up to valet they are actually waiting for us...I can't believe that I am in NYC (which I love but it does go fast and to stay here pulls you right out of the pace), The lobby is small but so comfortable...the furnishings remind me of a ski lodge in the 1980's out west. Some of the things are European (ie never enough hooks in the bathroom and the layout of some rooms is very different than an American hotel) but I think that this adds to its charm. One GEM is Felice the restaurant bar. Mena (right from the BOOT in Italy) makes you feel like you are in Italy...service is so warm....and the menu/food...oh my, you can't miss. The bar is delightful hosting regular customers as well as hotel guests and folks who live in the neighborhood. I love how the hotel is filled with people from all over the world as well as people on business in the Financial District. I don't think that you can beat the warmth/service/price of this hotel. I was hesitant to write this because I am afraid it will be known to the world...but in fairness to all the great men and women who work there I had to share.

Dark, brooding...yet warm and friendly....love the character and feel of this boutique-y hotel. Leather, wood, candles await you in the lobby, almost like an urban hunting lodge. Upon entering the staff were cheerful without being over the top. Check in was efficient. The rooms are typically on the small size for this area, but the space is well laid out and overall very comfortable. Location is useful if you need to get around the city quickly, or want to be sure to get to Century 21 first thing in the morning when they open!

Great bar, cool vibe. Really made a stressful business trip better. I arrived later in the evening and the atmosphere at check-in was friendly and fun. The team at the front desk was very helpful. Felice is a great restaurant. Great coffee.

Gild Hall is an underrated property downtown. It has the small boutique feel that guests who enjoy a lot of character will find comfortable for business travel. It has a lot of great details that make it work from the leather headboards to the excellent showers and bathtubs (in-suites) along with good products and proximity to the rest of Wall Street. The rooms are of excellent size for hotels in the neighborhood though you won't find spectacular views (that's just not part of how Fidi hotels work, go uptown if you need a fancy view). But the lack of views make for a quite respite. It is a very masculine hotel which makes the story I'm about to tell all the more charmingI actually have a very different relationship with the hotel than the average guest and have stayed with numerous occasions but notably for special occasions. Why? Well it is where I first met my husband. I happened to be out of my apartment and was staying at Gild Hall when I accepted a date with what was to become my now husband. The very comfortably upstairs lobby and lovely restaurant are now part of our story. We now have tried to stay at Gild Hall on our anniversaries when we can. We've even booked out the largest suite to have a gathering of friends celebrate with us as we've come to love the property so much (keeping in mind that we live within a few blocks of the hotel) Alas today May 10th is our anniversary and we aren't spending it at Gild Hall but I'm hoping that in the next week or two we can find a way to do another stay.
user_location: New York, New York, United States
user_name:
Julie F
New York, New York, United States

review_body: From the very beginning I felt that David, the first person we talked with behind the registration counter, must know us. He treated my wife and me as if we were old friends. The staff at Gild Hall is the best! Everyone we ran into, be it someone who was on the way to another floor with fresh laundry or a vacuum, or someone we asked something of in the lobby or restaurant, seemed to be having their best day ever. The brief conversations in passing were uplifting and joyful, which made the downpour we had sloshed through trivial and in the past. The room, even though opposite the elevator, was so quiet! The shower is great, the water is instantly hot, the lighting is perfect. I didn't care for the frosted glass enclosure of the bathroom, however. The door is glass between the bedroom and bathroom; I would prefer a more private partition, but this is a minor complaint. The bed is very comfortable, the t.v. is large, the mini bar is well stocked, the entire stay was delightful. The breakfast is quite good, too. We would definitely return.And thank you, David, for the helpful hints and voucher for a discount at the One World Observatory.

angel and anthony totally hooked me up when i checked in. hotel protocal i asked for an upgrade and was given the best of the best!! my room was divine. will definitly come back soon!!! love this place!
user_name:
Nicole P
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed at Gild Hall for my niece's wedding . Some of the weekend wedding functions were being held there. We found the hotel very comfortable and met our expectations in every way. The lobby, although small, was roomy enough to meet family and friends. The room was comfortable, clean and fairly well laid out. The bed was comfortable. The accessories in the room (TV, lights, clock, etc) were easy to use. It was a fairly large TV. We had plenty of hot water. There was a good selection of snacks, beer and wine in the mini-bar. Two criticisms... there was a shortage of drawer space to unpack our bags. There was also not a coffee pot in the room. We would have liked a cup while getting ready to leave the room. Maybe the best part of our stay was meeting Valentina, the bartender. She was an excellent mixologist and took personal care to make sure our cocktails were made just to our liking. She is also very creative and suggested some different drinks we might like. The location of the hotel was central to our activities during the weekend and could walk to every place we wanted and needed to be. We were quite happy with our accommodations at Gild Hall and will go back again.

When you first walk into the Gild Hall, its like you walked into a completely different world. You do not feel like you are in NYC or even in the financial district. At check in, you are greeter with smiles and champagne! I mean, what could be better. After the smooth process of checking in, you get to go to your room. When you enter your floor its like a scene from a movie or tv from the 50's but its modern 50's. The only thing I did not like in the room was our AC unit and the occupancy sensor. I know they are in the thermostat for a reason, however, the rooms do get a bit warm at night and the only way the AC turns back on is if you get up and move.

We celebrated our wedding anniversary at Gild Hall. I can't even put into words how incredible our stay was. We had complimentary drinks that were superb, more than once! Thank you Robert! The hotel was intimate and lovely. The room was clean and comfortable. We are going to return again and again, especially for our anniversary. Perhaps make it a tradition. Thank you.

Love this boutique hotel in the financial district. Close to South Street Seaport and 911 memorial as well as the new Fulton Street Subway station. Very comfortable, staff very attentive, nice bar and restaurant. Rooms very comfortable and unique.

I stayed at this hotel for a few days in April and it was perfect. The location was convenient and the staff was incredibly friendly. My room was a bit small but I appreciated the cleanliness. Would definitely stay here again!

Upgraded to a suite on arrival due to some kind of physical problem with our reserved room, then due to a cancellation, we were given the room for the next 5 nights. Room service was prompt & thorough. Patrick and Christy at the front desk were helpful and friendly, offering advice on car services, loaning an umbrella...We had a gathering in the bar, which has a good selection of wines & appetizers.One oddity was that the suite kitchen was over-stocked with alcohol, glasses & bar tools but not a piece of silverware.

Staff are welcoming and helpful. Rooms are a nice size, very clean, every day. Felice is excellent. Prosecco on arrival at the weekend was a nice touch. Room service was very smooth, food was hot and delicious.

I recently stayed three nights for business. I typically stay at one of the chain hotels nearby and will say this boutique hotel was a really nice change. The hotel has character and is nicely decorated. My room was average size for NY but I found it to be extremely clean and comfortable. Noise level was fairly quiet in comparison to other hotels I have stayed at in the neighborhood. Bathroom was well lit and had good water pressure. The best part was the ability to get room service from Felice. I have dined at Felice on a number of occasions for work events and it is quite good. So, to arrive at the hotel at 8PM and have a great glass of wine and a salad/appetizer delivered by 8:15 was absolutely perfect! I will definitely stay at Gild Hall again in the future.

The staff was most excellent, the hotel is beautiful and beyond clean. Felice is really good for authentic Italian food and wines. It's a little pricey, but comparable to any other nice upscale New York restaurant /bar. The only weird thing was check in. My wife and I were traveling together, we are both femme looking females. We were asked repeatedly by the staff if we were together and sharing the same room. I understand asking the question once, but the repeated questioning made us feel uncomfortable. But, other than that 5 minute interaction, everything was spectacular.

We stayed here for the Tribeca Film Festival..excellent front desk and concierge. The lobby was very well lit and decorated in a quirky yet polished decor. Great rooms, quiet also! Very accommodating staff. There is a fabulous little restaurant, Felice - vegan and gluten free options available. The olive oil was so delicious we took some home!Good location for financial district, plenty of restaurants, close to Tribeca. Slightly stingy on towels, but that's my only complaint. I will recommend to friends and probably stay again.

This is a real find! Stylish, spotlessly clean, quiet, affordable, secure, and conveniently located in the FiDi. The room was very spacious for a NY hotel with room for king bed, two chairs, full desk, suitcase stand, and plenty of room to walk around. Very chic decor. I am a very light sleeper, and I barely heard a sound up on the 17th floor even with construction nearby. No sound from nearby rooms. Very cute restaurant and wine bar. The room came with a choice of Continental or American breakfast, which turned out to be a huge plate of eggs, bacon or sausage, and potatoes or delicious grain toast, with really strong and wonderful coffee. Servers and desk staff were so nice. Bathroom was spotless with nice products and very strong water pressure. The bathroom door/wall is glass, but there is a curtain hung if you want privacy. Fully stocked mini bar with plenty of snacks if you need them. Plenty of outlets for charging the devices, which isn't the case in a lot of hotels. Very comfortable bed and pillows. A suggestion -- the puffy quilt had a nice soft duvet, but the bed could use a single top sheet for those of us who get hot and cold during the night. Also, the first night, the bath had 2 small bath towels, 2 hand towels, and 2 wash cloths, but the second night a single big, beautiful plush bath sheet appeared (but no wash cloths). I am sure they'd have sent more towels if I had asked, but the maids could stock a little better. Quite minor in the long run. I will definitely choose Gild Hall in the future for my FiDi and TriBeCa meetings. Now NY needs a Thompson Hotel on the Upper West Side too!
user_name:
RobinNatsFan
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The hotel is great and the staff generally all very good. Food nice although service at breakfast was a little haphazard sometimes. But they really need to sort out noise issues. Woken every time someone else in the corridor banged their door and by housekeeping calling out 'housekeeping' to other rooms from 8am. We were there on holiday (not business) so this was a real issue for us. Shame as it was otherwise a great hotel but if you can't get a decent nights sleep then it kind of defeats the point!

If you are looking for a reasonably priced hotel in this part of the city look no further. Max at the Front Desk was wonderful to work with. Rooms were very nice. Clean and modern. Great little spot in the financial district and very quiet.

The hotel's location was great! Absolutely a great decorated lobby, restaurant and room. Loved the colour choices, the large bathroom, and the masculine touches. I would stay here every time I visit FiDi NYC.

Great location in walking distance to most sights at the southern tip of Manhattan. Very helpful staff. Cool design concept in the lobby and the rooms. Rooms surprisingly spacious for NYC standards. Breakfast and dinner in hotel restaurant are also recommendable.

Gild Hall was a great hotel! From the moment we walked in the staff at the front desk was very helpful and accommodating. They even upgraded me to a suite for almost nothing. The room was like a one bedroom apt. Spacious living room area with a small kitchen. The bedroom was a very spacious as well. The decor and design of the hotel is very modern, sleek and cool. After work I would enjoy cocktails in their lobby bar which also had a restaurant. I strongly recommend Gild Hall to anyone that wants to stay away of the hustle and bustle of Midtown.

Excellent stay. Great service. Everything was very good. Even the weather was nice. I have recommended the hotel to many of my work colleagues and have had a lot of my referrals stay at the hotel over the last 9 years. I even had my Birthday party at the Hotel's second floor party room!

This was a great hotel with exceptional rooms and wonderful staff. Despite being downtown and a little further removed from the hustle and bustle of midtown, this hotel is within very easy access of subway stations and all of the downtown attractions (9/11 memorial, Battery Park etc). The only thing worth noting is that the bathroom was only separated from the bedroom by frosted glass and a door frame, not leaving much to the imagination. If you're sharing a room with someone but prefer your privacy when it comes to bathroom use, this is something to take note of, though this was not personally an issue.

I usually stay Midtown just off 5th Avenue and would not previously have considered the Financial District. However, this time I was attending a family wedding in Battery Park and was given a choice of three reasonably priced hotels nearby. By sheer luck, Gild Hall was an inspired choice and I much enjoyed my stay.Nondescript from the outside (and difficult for GPS to locate exactly), Gild Hall is a delightful hotel with somewhat quirky style and particularly charming and helpful staff. My Deluxe King room was spacious and well appointed (apart from the protruding bed base which can catch your ankles) and very good value at $266 a night. I paid twice as much uptown for inferior accommodation.We ate lunch and breakfast in Felice, the hotel bistro style restaurant, and were pleased by the friendly, swift service and the quality of the food - some of the best smoked salmon anywhere. In the bar it was puzzling that there was no Schweppes tonic to go with my Gin - the tonic from the multi-dispenser was horrible - as they stock Schweppes in the minibar in the rooms. However, on request the correct tonic was produced.If you need to be downtown on a budget, I strongly recommend Gild Hall for location, value for money and ambience.

Fantastic accommodatoins; fantastic staff; fantastic location and restaurant.David at front desk facilitated all things grand. They seem to specialize in making the ordinary, extraordinary. Inviting design and room features.I will stay at the Gild Hall when in NYC - Fidi.

If you are looking for an intimate, welcoming, charming, European style hotel, look no further. The front desk could not have been more accommodating, offering a glass of Proseco upon checking in. The lobby area is very inviting, stocked with books and board games, adjacent to the bar and eating area. Our room was not ready when we arrived, however we were promptly called upon the room availability. When we returned to the hotel, we were upgraded to a larger room, and given vouchers for a free drink at the bar. The room was lovely, large, had comfortable bedding, and was spotless. We had a fabulous stay, and plan to return again very soon.

3 friends and I had Hamilton tix and decided to stay in the financial district instead of our usual uptown haunts. The experience was very positive. The staff at Gild Hall are wonderful. Our safe would not open and they sent someone right away to replace it. The rooms are larger than typical NY hotel rooms. Clean and quiet. If you have plans to visit the 9/11 Memorial, walk the Brooklyn Bridge, see the Stock Exchange, take an early trip on the Staton Island Ferry, visit Fearless Girl and the Bull - this is a great hotel for a visit.

The hotel was super cosy although the rooms are a shoebox the service is great everyone is friendly the cleaning is thorough. The room has everything I need a safe, wifi, clean bathroom. The restaurant downstairs serves a lovely breakfast its worth trying out but also it's always packed and there are just good vibes from the patrons there.Location is walking distance from station and other foods places.

I recently finished coordinating a long, extensive, and complicated group business trip with Gild Hall. The space was ideal for a large group, and the staff worked closely and productively with us in order to customize the space for our needs.In planning our stay, I found the sales staff to be eminently helpful, reasonable, and responsive. They worked closely with me to develop a plan for our group with our unique needs and budget in mind, and they were quick to answer my questions and address any concerns. During our stay, I was blown away by the helpfulness of the rest of the hotel staff. The front desk staff was particularly friendly and attentive to us: they went above and beyond for our group in a way that I’ve not seen in all my years of business travel. The housekeeping and engineering staff were similarly impressive: warm, friendly, highly adaptable, and willing and able to accommodate even highly specific and surprising requests. Overall, the thoughtfulness, consideration, and professionalism of the staff at Gild Hall at all levels sets them apart from other hotels. I’ve traveled extensively for work and have never encountered a place like this. It was a joy to work with the Gild Hall team, and I look forward to returning there for all of my lower Manhattan travels. I cannot recommend them highly enough.
user_name:
SaraJanPan
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Tucked away from the hustle and bustle of midtown, among the labyrinth of the Financial District, we found Gild Hall. I immediately became 10% cooler when I walked into the swanky lobby. Folks at reception were personable. We were fortunate to stay in a well appointed Suite which was decorated with comfortable furniture with a modern design. A fully-stocked bar with half bottles of liquor as well as cocktail implements put this room another notch above most. I would heartily recommend this hotel to both business and leisure travelers.

Excellent in all respects, friendly welcoming extremely helpful staff. The offer of immediate access to beautifully decorated, comfortable and clean room when we checked in around 9am! The staff were only too eager to do our online flight check in, print off booking passes when we asked for assistance and even insisted on ringing to confirm our transfer from hotel to airport! When asking about restaurant we were given our first 2 drinks on the manager! Nothing was too much trouble and always offers of assistance from the staff! A lovely hotel already have recommended it to others!!

Seriously this hotel exceeded my expectations. I surprised my husband on a mini vacation to NYC -- (he was hoping for tropica)l BUT going to the Rock and Roll HOF Induction ceremony was my carrot and choosing this hotel for proximity to Barclays Center and 9/11 Memorial was my impetus. WE were not disappointed with any aspect. Greated by the front desk attendant, Patrick, with a giant smile and two complimentary cocktails to welcome us (and recommended this lasagna made with crepes -- exceptional, we tried it) ...SO we went to the restaurant and it was packed. Mimi greeted us there as if she were the owner and wanted each and every guest to enjoy their experience, both for dining and drinks. She made sure we had our drinks right away and then found us a wonderful table by the window. Every time my husband or I left the hotel we were greeted immediately by all staff and when we came back from getting coffee in the morning each person opened the door, pressed the elevator button and held open the door. Yes that may sound like a small thing, but there were many moments like that through out the stay. The location is fantastic. We went by South Street Seaport to rent bikes and biked around Manhattan;we went to the Memorial Museum. We tried cocktails and delectables all over the city, with a great place to stay when we came back. Loved the room and a GIANT TV had we been awake enough to watch it. My only regret is not getting everyone's name that we came in contact with from the hotel to give them proper accolades. Congrats Thompson Hotels and the Gild Hall. (Oops forgot to mention I needed my tickets printed for the R&R Hall of Fame...they kindly acquiesced to my request and were as excited for us as we were)

Fidi is becoming more and more of an acceptable alternative to staying midtown and gild hall is the best hotel in the area for the price. The rooms are really cool and match what you see on the website. The staff is flexible, accommodating, and highly competent. The restaurant is very solid too. Would highly recommend!

We had a wonderful time from the moment we checked-in till the moment we checked out. The front desk staff (especially Patrick and Andy) were very friendly and accommodating. Rooms are spacious and comfortable. Excellent beds and linen too. Breakfast was nice and reasonably priced. Very cosy bar area too. I loved it and will definitely be going back there !! :)

2 guest - 2 devices allowed for internet; this does not make sense any more. Only 1 rope for 2 guests on the roomWe could hear the construction at 2-3 AM even though the window was completely closed - not acceptable.

Front desk staff was wonderful. Greeted every time we passed. Inquired about our plans. Made recommendations and offered to help plan. Very clean. Quiet room. Restaurant was great. We ate in restaurant on our arrival evening. Even though we did not have reservations, hostess quickly got us seated. We will stay there again. Our only "issue" was that the hotel was not as "green" as I would have expected from a large city hotel. Bath linens were removed each day, even the ones left hanging. Multiple times we returned to our room and all of the lights were left on. The hotel was set to "heat". We lowered our t-stat to the coolest setting. Every evening when we returned, our t-stat was set back to a much higher temperature.

Room was great, service was excellent. Two staff stood out - Patrick and Molex. Had a problem with our room upon arrival, solved even before we physically showed up. Hotel bar and restaurant is great, location is excellent for what we were doing and where we we going. We've stayed before, and will continue to select this hotel. Great value.

Good experience at Gild Hall. Good location within the City, confortable (and big for NYC) room, great bed, nice staff... I would recommend this hotel for people who want to stay in the south of New York.

We stumbled upon Gild Hall when booking an anniversary trip 4 years ago. We loved it so much that we have stayed there every year for the past 3 years to celebrate our anniversary. (We are from Iowa, so it is not a hop skip and a jump.) There are great coffee shops, a market and nice restaurants nearby. Also the South Street Seaport and the TKTS booth there are within walking distance. (You can get tix and avoid the Time Sq crowds!) The best part of this hotel, though, has been the staff. They have been thoughtful and attentive during all of our stays and have found ways to make our anniversary extra special each time we have visited. Rooms are well-appointed, clean and tastefully decorated.This year, we are celebrating 20 years together and have finally decided to bring our kids (12 and 15) with us. We thought about another hotel, for about half a second, and then booked Gild Hall again. I can't wait to share our vacation neighborhood with our kids in May.

This hotel is great; The staff from the front desk to the cleaning staff was always very attentive, polite, friendly and very endeavor to make the stay as nice as possible. The rooms are very attractive and cozy. Also the location of the hotel is optimal; You can reach many sights well on foot, but also the subway station is nearly.

A good option to consider when staying in the Financial District. Staff at front desk were extremely courteous, helpful and friendly. They were kind enough to extend my checkout by a couple of hours. Rooms (mine was approx 240 sq ft) are clean and well done, though small and so is the bathroom. If staying for more than 1-2 nights then it may feel cramped. For the price per night that I paid for this room, I felt I could have gotten more value for my money.A few things that would have made a difference in 4 vs 5 point rating:(1) there was no kettle in the room for hot water and I had to keep asking the hotel staff for the same. While the tap water in the bathroom is drinkable, a kettle to boil water would have been nicer and most hotels do provide one.(2) there should be an option for half day checkout. Normal timing is noon and the staff was kind enough to extend till 2 pm, but were unable to accommodate a half day request as their housekeeping staff leaves by 4 pm. So anything till 6 or 8 pm would be charged another full day.(3) Lifts take a long time to arrive at the floor. There are two lifts and one broke down during my stay, which made the delay even more excruciating.

The guys who worked the Desk were so good, funny, efficient, quality!!!! Accommodations also great. Loved my room. Decor, linens, bathtub, room service....all of it was top notch. The Lobby Bar is beautiful and an amazing wine menu.

I highly recommend this small boutique hotel for anyone wanting to visit lower Manhattan and the very much revived South Ferry/Whitehall/Wall Street/World Trade Center neighborhoods. As to design, the exterior is red brick and the ground floor and lobby area is really dominated by Felice, the in-hotel restaurant and bar. The lobby space, featuring a library of books with nice bindings and no intrinsic value or particular interest is rather cramped and overshadowed by Felice, as mentioned. Guest rooms and other inner design features are difficult to describe as I've never seen anything quite like the odd chandelier high ceiling lights and brown leatherette bed headboards with straps and buckles and the blue and gilt hues of the walls. The hotel describes the motif as a blend of "Aspen" American rustic and European understated elegance courtesy of a world-acclaimed architect and designer. I'm saying here that it's best to check out the pictures themselves on the hotel web site.With all that odd lighting, the room could still have been brighter. The bar area at peak times can be quite cramped and noisy, but more of that when I review Felice, where we delightfully dined a number of times during our stay. In fact, cramped is also a word I'd use to describe the entire neighborhood down here with trucks and cars and delivery vehicles trying to negotiate the impossibly narrow streets and alleys and with constant construction creating further blockades and the cavernous buildings blocking out the sun. I grew up on the upper west side and my wife was raised in the West Village and we were both happy when we had business at certain points in the "wild blue yonder uptown". Still the great graciousness of the entire staff made the experience worthwhile. On Saturday night around rush hour we tried to get a cab (impossible) in the icy rain. At which point the front desk folks put on heavy jackets, hats and umbrellas and walked quite a distance to finally flag down a cab for us as we waited snugly in the lobby. We showed our gratitude, but the attitude of the front desk persons was: "No problem, we are just doing our job". No substitute for that kind of grace.

Great hotel... staff very attentive... room are nice size and clean. Would definitely go back again. Enjoyed the hotel very much. Walking distance to many great attraction. Will hopefully be back soon.

A great hotel in the heart of the financial district. The rooms were well appointed and the beds were hard to get out of. The staff exceeded expectations. I will definately visit again the next time that I am in NYC.

Hotel exceeded my expectations in all points. Room was clean, modern and recently renovated with a very large flat screen tv. Bathroom was spotless. They also provided me with an upgraded room. Check in and check out was quick and efficient. Hotel was quite convenient to the several subway lines. I would definitely stay there again.

Gild Hall is a great place to stave when in the Financial District. The hotel is beautifully decorated, from the lobby to the bar & restaurant area to the guest rooms! The atmosphere is sophisticated & low key at the same time. The staff is very friendly & accommodating, especially Chris & Patrick, who went above and beyond to make us feel welcome!

This hotel is clean, roomy by NYC standards, and the staff is helpful. Slighly off the beaten path for subway travel, but plenty of restaurants nearby including Felice 15 in the lobby which has excellent food.

The Financial District is an underrated neighborhood to visit. The neighborhood is much quieter than Midtown and has subway connections to anywhere you would want to go. Gild Hall has gorgeous interiors, comfortable beds, and great service. I'm an unabashed fan of Thompson hotels in general, but this one is really a gem.

The staff was pretty amazing. The hotel is very well located near the subway and the room was excelent the bed was very comfortable.Experience NYC almost as a local I recommended it for a short visit in NYC.

Didn't have food there cause there was so much choice around hotel. Paris cafe on south Street is a must for breakfast if the weather is there for about a 10 mins walk. Plenty to see and do around hotel

From the minute we arrived at Gild Hall, we were made to feel extremely welcomed and the front desk people could not have been nicer. When they heard it was our anniversary, they upgraded us to a special room that was exquisite. They went out of their way to take care of all of our needs. We loved our stay and will definitely be returning again soon .
user_name:
Edwin S
New York, United States

review_body: I was visiting NYC this weekend and stayed here because I've heard that The financial district has become one of the best neighborhoods in NYC and my friends and I wanted to stay some place trendy. We stayed in the deluxe double and it was great. I've stayed in many NYC hotels and this one was definitely one of the largest eliminating my usual NYC claustrophobia. The room was also very clean and I did appreciate the modern touches and indulgent toiletries in the bathroom. I would've preferred a deeper bathtub but considering really can't complain too much. But above else- what takes this from four stars to five is the amazing staff- I mean top notch customer service. They provided prosecco for me and my 3 friends when we checked in and they accommodated any question/comment we posed to the front desk. Stellar. Probably goes without saying, but yes, of course, I would stay here again.

our '5 *s' says it all. The best hotel we've ever stayed in NYC. This is not based on the actual accommodation which is good, functional and stylish but on the quality of the staff who couldn't do enough to help.

This is a gem of a hotel with an intimate feel in downtown manhattan. The location is ideal for exploring the areas landmarks, bars and all sorts of eateries.The hotels rooms are spacious and well equipped. The bar and restaurant are great. And the staff, they are just Fantastic.

Check in was easy. The staff is so polite and go out of their way to help you with anything, inside or outside the hotel. The restaurant has wonderful food. The rooms are very cozy. Bed and pillows very comfortable. Rooms are very clean. Shower water pressure perfect. We had to stay an extra day due to weather and they helped us right out. We even were able to stay in the same room. I loved the location of this hotel because the area is quite. Very close the the subway. We will definitely stay again.

A nearly perfect stay at this hotel in NYC. Great service, cool designed rooms, hall and a delicious breakfast!!! There is nothing to improve!  One thing for athletes: the Gym unfortunately is terribly small and poorly equipped. :(

A group of us stayed at the Gild, and were blown away the moment we walked in the door. The staff was fast, friendly and courteous. The front desk was accommodating, and knowledgeable when it came to our many questions. The atmosphere was homey and the rooms spacious and comfortable. We loved our stay, and I plan on recommending Gild Hall to anyone visiting the FiDi in the future.

Wonderful property, decorated with taste and style. Amazing restaurant on site (check out the wine list!) and lovely amenities. A special thank you to Mark, Patrick and Max for their professionalism and fantastic hospitality. This is what a hotel should be, and what a Thompson hotel is.

We had a wonderful timeCan't imagine any improvement People the accommodation The dining room the food. All were more than satisfactory. Our arrival to our leaving we only encountered pleasant and helpful people.

Stayed in Gild Hall for one night with my boyfriend. When the hotel knew it was our anniversary they upgraded us and gave us some free champagne - incredibly generous. Our room was so nice and the bed was HUGE - probably the biggest bed I've stayed in, in New York. Great decor, very modern and the food we ordered from the restaurant was great, all be it, a little pricey. Great value for a wonderful room in an underrated area of Manhattan. Would stay again and recommend to friends!

It felt like coming home! The staff provided authentic service and were welcoming. It is a lovely, beautiful and quaint hotel in downtown Manhattan! I highly recommend this hotel. The restaurant in the hotel is beautiful and cosy and it was certainly a treat to eat there - the food was very delicious. Excellent value.

Booked this as it's around the corner from Wall Street. Location is really good and the staff are friendly. I was on the 5th floor and the noise was low from outside as you are off the main road. Rooms are very clean and practical. They are not massive but more than enough for a week long stay. Several bars and restaurants located very close and a 5 minute walk to Ground Zero / 911 Memorial. All in all a pleasant stay and a reasonable cost for the location.

I loved the masculine decor of the room. I really have no complaints. Everything was quality. There were complimentary champagne and treats waiting for us. I love the boutique vibe. Very intimate. I definitely recommend this establishment.

Gild Hall is tucked away on a small street in the Financial District. The hotel has great decor and furnishings. My only issue is that the door to the bathroom is glass. There is a curtain you can pull to block the view, but, if you're traveling with someone you don't know well, this might be awkward. The hotel is a short walk from the 9/11 Memorial Museum and is close to several subway lines so you can get to other neighborhoods quite easily. We were very impressed with the staff. Every single employee greeted us with a smile and a hello throughout our 3-night stay. I highly recommend this hotel for the exceptional staff and value.

This place is amazing in décor, service room amenities and overall experience. My new Favorite in NY, The food and beverage, Staff and location are all excellent. I recommend both dinner in the restaurant or room service. The wine by the glass list for Italian wines is outstanding and the staff are all very knowledgeable.

Clean, great location, excellent, friendly, professional staff, quiet, very convenient to the office. The hotel rooms are a decent size. The snack food in the room as well as the beverages was plentiful.

We booked rooms for my son's wedding. Although the hotel can be tricky to find in the maze of downtown streets, it was cozy enough and the rooms spacious for everyone's needs. The staff (including the front desk) extended themselves over any little detail or want. There is an onsite bar and restaurant, Felice, and you are very close to the 9/11 memorial and the Oculus shopping center, in addition to Wall Street itself. Upon our checkout on Sunday, it seemed quite a few business travelers were checking in, so I gather the hotel works well for both business and leisure.

live in Harlem..no television, looking for room for the night. Gild Hall popped up, 55 inch television, delicious and extremely affordable room service from their restaurant Felice, ordered dinner and dessert AND breakfast. Delicious. Bed and pillows so comfortable. Staff so helpful and happy.
user_name:
susangW643XH
New York City, New York

review_body: Friendly, knowledgeable staff + convenient location + great bar/restaurant downtown = a terrific gem in the heart of the financial district. We were told the check in process would take a few minutes so were encouraged to wait at the bar with complimentary drinks; by the time we were done, our bags were already in our room!
user_name:
sin l
Canton of Geneva, Switzerland

review_body: Great hotel, the staff is very friendly and have an extensive knowledge in customer service, as well as Manhattan as a whole. The bar and restaurant have an excellent service, staff and cuisine. Especially Anthony at the front desk.

Thompson Hotels never disappoint and Gild Hall exceeded expectations. The staff was friendly and accommodating, the decor is gorgeous and the price is right! I would highly recommend for couples or business travelers staying in FiDi. Would highly recommended.

We have daughters living in the Fi-Di area and visit often. We look forward to staying at the Guild Hall. We love the rooms, the staff, and the location. The staff makes the hotel! The are polite, helpful and knowledgeable about the city. The bar / restaurant is cozy and relaxing. The rooms are a good size and very clean. All in all it is our home away from home.

I enjoyed my stay, the modern and thoughtful decor and the restaurant exceeded my expectations. The staff was pleasant and helpful, and went above and beyond. The rooms are nice, not exceptionally large, but adequate, but the public spaces in the hotel are really exceptional.

Everytime I come to New York for business I stay at this hotel. It is close to my office but I just love it there. The hotel is so quaint. The rooms are very clean.
