Staff is extremely polite and helpful. They have a great restaurant and bar. I have frequented the bar while there but only had breakfast, however, the food is excellent. The location of the hotel is close to many NYC attractions and subway. I can't think of a better place for the money to stay while in New York.

We did a quick overnight at Gild Hall while visiting friends in the city. The hotel is decorated flawlessly, from the lobby to the guest rooms. Our king room had beautiful high ceilings, making the space feel open and airy. Modern bathrooms, excellent linens, and comfortable beds... this hotel is a gem in the financial district... I would stay again in a heartbeat!

The first time we stayed here was in november 2013 when i ran the nyc marathon.It was a great stay comfortable beds, quit, good wifi and the service staff were all great. The location is good near fulton subway stops and easily accessible by air train and A line subway from JFK for international travel.There are many restuarants, grocery stores, shopping and 9/11 memorial within 10 minutes waliking distance.The hotel has an adjoining restuarant, a gym and will store your luggage and parcels between stays.We like Gild Hall so much we stayed again in January 2017 on our way to Ecuador. It was even better than our 2013 stay. Patrick, Max, Robert and John all went out of there way helping us with our luggage, deliveries, reservations, directions and weather forcasts. We look forward to our next stay on the way back from Ecuador late February!

So I just came home from a three day trip to Las Vegas last week; stayed at Aria and was pretty disappointed for what is suppose to be a luxury hotel. On the plane back to Canada I was thinking about the hotel and the trip and I realized that I'd been spoiled, this was only the fourth time in over 12 years that I stayed at a non-Thompson hotel. And comparing this stay with my previous vacation, 31 day stay in New York during the summer, just emphasizes how fantastic Gild Hall is.I was going to write about the amazing staff last in this review but they are truly the crown jewel for the hotel, without a doubt the most valuable asset of Gild Hall and it just seems pointless to try and describe the hotel without detailing the individual things that make you feel special and valued. I love the front desk staff at this hotel. They are so competent and cheerful and friendly, qualities that I think are pretty hard to display when they have arguably the toughest job of the hotel. If any visitors are unhappy with anything, regardless of it having to do with the hotel or not, the front desk people are going to bear the brunt of it. At Gild Hall I have had nothing but positive interactions with each one of them. Led by managers Monique and David, I was always treated like a VIP. Max checked me in, what a great person he is. Seems like a jack of all trades, and when you stay at a hotel for 31 days you have the opportunity to see staff with other guests and it’s pretty impressive the level of care that people like Max and Rob treat other guests with. Any of the front desk staff that saw me when I entering or left the hotel during my stay would wave and smile and all remembered my name. Sometimes when I would be in the lobby reading I could hear them interact with other guests and saw that they treated others the same way that I was treated. This is especially important in a boutique hotel and even more evident after my stay in Las Vegas. It is the mark of an excellent hotel and one where Gild really excels. I'm sorry for the people who's names I've forgotten, I can picture you in my memory but your names escape me and it's my fault for doing this review so late but I really do appreciate how welcome you made me feel.The bellman here are fantastic! I saw these guys multiple times each day and they were great and hard working. Really nice to talk to "regular people" when you are way from home so long and these guys are the friends from home that you can talk with about everything from sports to restaurants. Really appreciated my conversations with them and also appreciated how hard they worked to try and help other guests too. I also have great things to stay about the housekeeping staff who were highly curtious and efficient. My room was always cleaned perfectly and I had a few phone calls from a housekeeping supervisor during my stay to ensure that I was happy with the room. And over the last couple stays I’ve run into an engineer named Topeton; man this guy is an asset to the hotel! Super dedicated and outstanding service.Lastly, I was happy to bump into the General Manager Mr. Koster, who went to great lengths to check in with me and ensure that I was enjoying NYC numerous times during my stay. Occasionally I would see him and other staff when they were "off duty" on their way home and they were just as cheerful and genuine as they are back at the hotel. One of the nice things about this hotel is that it doesn't seem to employ a ton of staff members so you do see the same people and it is really nice to have a familiar person during your stay, especially if you travel solo.Gild Hall Hotel is truly excellent in every single category that I value. The hotel itself is very stylish and really well constructed. Gild had just completed a room renovation and all I can say is that the rooms fit the Thompson style perfectly! I wasn’t crazy about the decor of the rooms before the renovation but this one is totally my style. I’ve included some pictures but you can see more on the website. The lobby and public spaces really suit the FIDI district and when you sit down in one of the leather chairs or sofas I am reminded of sitting in a modern, masculine den or lounge. It's a place where you feel very comfortable in relaxing while waiting or contemplating your next move. The atmosphere of the hotel with the music and lighting seems to be perfectly suited at all times. Walk around the hotel a few blocks and you can see why FIDI is one of the more expensive places in Manhattan to live. Such character in the streets and neighborhood, you are literally located at the birthplace of NYC. Tons of restaurants are around, including some pretty hot ones in Gild’s sister property The Beekman Hotel. The South Street Seaport use to be a tourist trap but has evolved into a really cool area with tons of restaurants and pubs and a fantastic new movie theater. I use to run each morning I was at the hotel and I quickly grew attached to the area. I needed to because the new Eataly just opened up a few blocks from the hotel lol. Over to the west, you have the new Westview World Trade Center mall within the Oculus and just across West street the shops at Brookfield Place. And a super fun french food hall called Le District. Dining is one of the things I look forward to when traveling and it's so convenient to be able to eat at so many great spots and be able to walk back to the hotel rather than take a cab. And you don't have to spend a lot of money with entertainment in NYC either; there is 3 different movie theaters, Whole Foods, Barnes and Noble, and most importantly… a Shake Shake all just a few blocks away. Other conveniences of staying at Gild Hall include transportation; there are 4 major subway lines all within three blocks of the hotel. You can get anywhere in the city within 30 minutes by transit.While the location will definitely attract people for business others who value this hotel will be young (and older) travelers, not tourists. People who appreciate the nicer things in life and don't mind spending a little to enjoy good food, wine and clothing. If you value your time and convenience over a dollar, you appreciate quality over quantity, if you prefer to be treated as a neighborhood friend rather than as visiting royalty then you are going to be right at home at Gild Hall. It's run by a hotel group that has a strong concept of what its guests value and has employed staff who believe in that experience. The people who work here truly make Gild the hotel that it is. I have referred several people to stay at Gild and they all have raved about it. The staff here have delivered the same experiences to my friends that made each trip so special to me and I personally cannot put a high enough value on this experience. When a hotel contributes so many positive memories to your experience they earn your loyalty and this is why I will be staying at Gild Hall whenever I am able.

When we go to NYC, we tend to prefer staying in the Financial District, especially over the weekend, as it is well connected with everything we want to do but also much quieter and less chaotic. This is the second time we have stayed at Gild Hall and every time we come back, we are more and more inclined to make this our only hotel when visiting the city. The staff were attentive and took good care of not only us, but also our pet. The front desk staff even offered to pet sit while we were out of the hotel and to walk our doggie if we wanted any assistance. Room service was top notch, and we were taken care of, even when we went downstairs to grab a quick drink and ordered some snacks to go. We got a full tray with water, olive oil, breads, salt and pepper from Felice when we were just expecting some to go containers with the food. Really really love this place

A really lovely-looking hotel. Our room was huge (especially for NYC) and we had plenty of space to sleep and relax - when we weren't sightseeing! The hotel is located in the Financial District which means you're only a few minutes' walk away from the World Trade Center, Brooklyn Bridge, Seaport District and historic Stone Street. And if you want to head north to explore more of New York then Fulton Street subway is very handily placed a few minutes away.

Gild Hall is an absolutely wonderful hotel. Gorgeous, welcoming, large (huge, for NYC) beautiful rooms with excellent amenities and linens. Lovely staff, to a person just great. And the restaurant and bar are lovely and the food truly excellent. At first, we thought the only thing we could think of to complain about was the thermostat not going below 68, but then realized that we had functioning windows -- problem solved! Seriously, this property was wonderful in EVERYway. I can't wait to explore other Thompson properties.

Great hotel and staff. Stayed last weekend for my husband's birthday and the staff made us feel like VIP's. Great location for exploring FIDI. Also very attentive service and food at the restaurant and bar at Felice located there

I stayed at The Gild located in the Financial District in NY this past weekend. Everything was excellent. The hotel was very clean, nice ambience, the food at Felice was delicious and the staff was very friendly and attentive. Robert was very hospitable and his assistance and professionalism was top notch. I will definitely return and also check out the other Thompson hotels in NY. My boyfriend truly enjoyed his birthday celebration and we cannot thank Rob enough for his exceptional service.

Stayed here for three nights at the end of our New York trip. Great end to the stay. Loved the room and the bathroom, really comfy bed- only downside was the bar service was really slow. We were waiting for a drink for about 20 minutes while sat at the bar- kept being told we would be served next whilst others were popped in first. Ended up leaving without a drink. Shame as it looked like a nice bar. All in all a great stay and thanks very much to the wonderful front desk staff- so helpful and kind at all times.

Large rooms, great amenities, close to the subway. The front desk staff were super friendly and accommodating. I would stay at this hotel again in a heart beat. I didn't eat at the restaurant but the morning croissants looked super fresh and amazing.

I stayed here for a week on business the staff made everything better then hotels in the area. I came in not feeling well. Every morning the am staff has a cab ready for me. In the early evening, pm staff was ready to assist with making me feel comfortable. It was a long week. Had accommodations not been above acerage, I would have endured even more issues. My family from NJ says this was a great place. The restaurant on the property was an added bonus. I ate there three nights in a row. Authentic Northern Italian fresh food. Can't wait to come back when it is warmer. I stayed Jan 23-27,2017.

Checking into Gild Hall I expected my stay to be nothing short of wonderful. As a fan of the Thompson Hotel Group I typically prefer to stay in the midtown locations whenever I come to New York. This trip in particular was during the holiday season and I did not want to be amongst the million tourist. Gild Hall is quietly located on a small side street in the Financial District which I found to be so peaceful. I was able to coveniently park my car in front to check in. Checking in I was assisted by Andy and David. Both gentlemen made the process so easy and were genuinely pleasant. The style and decor of Gild Hall is so point. Unlike the other hotels that I researched i the area I didn't feel as if I was staying in a conference center. I had the luxury of booking the Pent House and boy was it amazing. The room was very spacious and extremely useful. I absolutely adored the leather bed and how even more so how comfortable it was. I slept like a baby! Overall I truly enjoyed every bit of my trip to New York and almost sure my new visit will yet again be at Gild Hall.

I've stayed here more times then I can count, and it never disappoints. If you frequent NY on business, you may feel as I do that after a long day you want quiet. This has become my go to. I love the wine bar. The service is always great, grown to look forward to the welcome glass of champagne. I'm obsessed with their breakfast offering for room service and appreciate being able to order the night before and hang it on the door. The rooms are modern comfort, hints of flannel and luxury touches. It's always quiet in the rooms, cozy.. you feel away from the bustle. Great work spaces. Highly recommend.

We had a wonderful stay at Guild Hall, mainly because of the friendliness and helpfulness of the front desk staff, especially Rob, Max, and John. They are role models for great customer service. The rooms are clean, comfortable and quiet. The decor is warm and subdued- a departure from the cookie-cutter furnishings that you normally see in hotels these days. The hotel is situated in a good location to see everything in the financial district. We had a delicious dinner and breakfast at the elegant Italian restaurant attached to the hotel, Felice. We would definitely recommend Guild Hall.

We stayed here for 3 nights. All the staff were friendly and helpful. Rooms were smart and tidy and relatively stylish. The public areas were always clean and tidy. The gyms are a bit too small with limited equipment. The bar is great as is Felice restaurant. We were able to borrow the bikes from reception which was great. Location if perfect for ground zero, brooklyn bride, brookfield plaza and west fields as well as close to downtown soho, china town, little Italy.

I stayed in the Gild for 3 nights over the MLK Holiday weekend. On check-in, I had an issue with my credit card; the staff was patient and helpful in getting it successfully resolved. My room was just lovely; well decorated, spotlessly clean, tidy and the aesthetics were very appealing. On day two, my smoke alarm backup battery hit its low charge point and began notifying me (via an automated voice and a beep). I contacted the front desk, and they had someone up to take care of it literally within 5 minutes! Finally, the bed was ridiculously comfortable and the room was very quiet (having lived in NYC for over a year, I know how exceptional that is). The net result was 3 nights of the best sleep I have ever had. The property location on the eastern side of the FiDi makes it a little bit of a hidden gem, but subway access is good (short walks to Fulton Station, the R and the 6) and it is a 10 minute walk to ground zero, southside seaport, Battery Park etc. For what it is worth, I have now stayed in 3 Thompson properties, and in each the quality of the experience has been excellent.
user_name:
Ted Z
Lake Havasu City, Arizona

review_body: Stayed at Gild Hall for two nights in November 2016; choosing it because of its relatively low cost and nearby to an event I was in the city to attend. The hotel was serviceable. Nobody stays in the Financial District on a personal trip expecting to entertain themselves in the vicinity, but the Gild Hall is reasonably close to the Metro. What I was surprised by was how run down the rooms were though large (except for the bathroom), and comfortable. Ensure you ask for a room away from the elevators if staying during the weekend.

From the second we arrived (in the middle of the night) the staff were delightful. Our bed was so big and comfy that even when I slept in star jump position my boyfriend didn't get annoyed! We ate in a number of local restaurants all recommended by the staff that were delicious- as was the Italian attached.The tuscan beef stew was 10/10 however the special pasta dish that day was a little underwhelming especially for the price. The location of the hotel itself is great for exploring- lots of subway connections and a short stroll to the Brooklyn bridge. The jubilee Delhi opposite has EVERYTHING. A special shout out goes to Robert at the front desk who went above and beyond on a number of occasions, including giving us drink vouchers for the bar when we had already checked out and our flight was delayed and we were feeling a little lost. We will most definitely be back!

My wife and I stayed at Gild Hall for 3 nights in December as part of an extended stay for Christmas. We wished we had had stayed here for the entire stay we loved it that much. The night we arrived in NY we had huge issues with our shuttle bus as it was over 2 hours late collecting us from the airport (that's completely unrelated to the hotel). When we finally arrived at the hotel we were greeted with warm smiles and helpful staff. We immediately felt completely at home as the hotel had a warm cozy feel. Upon check in I shared our shuttle experience with the young guy at reception and he without hesitation offered us a couple of complimentary drinks in the bar. This was a most grateful touch as it was in no way the hotel's fault our shuttle experience was poor. The room was very modern and in great condition. The whole hotel appeared to be recently renovated which was great. The Italian restaurant Felice at the hotel was amazing and was buzzing every night we were there. We loved it so much on the 1st night that we ate breakfast in the morning then dinner again on final evening. Price and quality wise is was probably our best dining experience in NY. The hotel being in FIDI is well away from the chaos that's Times Square. Its located close to the 911 memorial and museum and the ferry to Liberty Island. It's an easy walk to the Brooklyn Bridge as well. Stone Street which is short walk from the hotel has some great bars and restaurants and is located on a pedestrian only cobble stone street. Our overall experience in NY was not great for various reasons however if we were to return we would definitely return to Gild Hall and will recommend it to friends and family.

We recently went on a two-week vacation to New York. Gild Hall was an extraordinary surprise for us. It is full of the elegant glamour you would expect in New York, with great decor. The rooms were large for New York standards and always clean and extremely comfortable. But beyond all of this, that would have already been enough for us to want to come back, the absolutely best thing about Gild Hall, hands down, is the excellent, kind service we received from everyone working in the hotel. They went out of their way to help us and make us feel at home. When my older father's flight arrived 5 hours late at 2:00 a.m., Fitore helped him to his room with his suitcase and a bottle of water to make his ordeal a little more manageable. Every day we were received with smiles and help with directions, tickets, suggestions, and everything else we could possibly need or want. I could go on and on about service, and no amount of reviews would be enough. The only thing left to say is thank you so much, John Rob, Chris, Fitore, David and anyone else I haven’t mentioned. Thank you for making this trip more memorable than could have even dreamed of. All of you deserve a promotion, and of course, next time we go to New York, there is no other hotel we would stay at.

We stayed here for 2 nights over New Years eve. From the moment we walked in we were impressed, the entrance is small, with dark wood accents, but is very welcoming. The gentleman who checked us in was very friendly, he was talkative and funny and gave us some great recommendations for places to eat and drink. Our room was on the 17th floor, away from the elevators, we couldn't hear any traffic, which is very surprising considering it's the city that never sleeps. Our room was very clean and spacious with a massive tv. A couple of downsides would be there were no tea or coffee making facilities in the room, or a mirror in the bedroom, just in the bathroom. If you are looking to stay away from the usual tourist areas, this is perfect, with loads of amazing places to shop and eat close by. The restaurant next to the hotel was amazing and reasonably priced also.

Not only is it in my favorite place of NYC, the captivating scent upon your arrival sets the mood for the rest of your stay. Pillows and bed = WOW! Front desk Service was impeccable and incredibly helpful.

This place is lovely. However first impressions from the outside were of lots of black bin bags piled up in the street. I think this might be a New York thing, but it made it look a bit grotty from the outside. The lobby is well appointed and designed well in keeping with the age of the building. We ate in the hotel's Italian restaurant one evening and the service was very good, food lovely, portions too big for us though. Our room on the 11th Floor (via elevator) was very quiet, clean and had some lovely touches, like ipod dock. The in room snacks and water (~$9) were very expensive; we bought water from a grocery store around the corner. The wifi worked well, although only free for 2 devices.The service in the bar was good, although was busy most evenings and we had to sit on one of the sofas in the lobby (which meant you were out of the atmosphere of the bar area and next to the drafty revolving door). Location was 5mins from Fulton St subway, 10 mins to battery park and Wall Street round the corner. We would definitely return and liked the location better than the busier hotels of Times Square.

Perfect room. Perfect restaurant. Perfect breakfast. Perfect pasta. We stayed here for our wedding trip. It was so good.I think it's one the best smallHotels it New York. If you want to stay in nice stylish place - it's a great choice

My three teenagers and I loved staying here. The hotel is cool and laid back and we got upgraded to the fabulous Thompson Suite. The location is perfect...close to many attractions and the subway station that connects you everywhere. The staff was helpful and nice. We will be back!
user_name:
Caroline G
Akron, Ohio, United States

review_body: We return to this hotel because the staff are friendly, customer service is top notch and the rooms and linen service is pretty good!!We will return again but not for Christmas next time, nothing wrong with the time of year just that this was our second time and reckon that it will be good to experience another time of year.Our thanks again to David and the team on the front desk for all their help and courtesies.Is there a negative - just one - another small chest of drawers in a corner would have made a big difference to us as we were staying a week.Visit this hotel. you will not be disappointed.

My husband booked this hotel as a surprise for our 10 year anniversary requesting a room on a high floor, away from the stairs/elevator. On arrival the staff were extremely friendly however we were put on a lower floor right in front on the stair well. We didn't think that would be a problem at first, but unfortunately the stairs seemed to be used a lot and the door was heard opening and shutting during the night. Our first night was horrible as the couple in the next room decided to argue and shout at each other from 11pm until 2:30am in the morning. We rang reception during the night and understand that it was not the hotel's fault but would have hoped it was handled with greater urgency. We really value a good night's sleep when on vacation so this was obviously frustrating.On the second day a wet patch appeared on the floor next to my husband's side of the bed (may be from the air-conditioning unit on the wall) and grew each day which made the room feel damp. I would like to mention of the housekeeping team as they were extremely friendly and thorough when cleaning our room, leaving little thank you notes and happily meeting our request for additional blankets. We have stayed in NYC many times and anticipate that the rooms are a little smaller than other cities. I only wish there had of been a little more closet space and a robe provided for the room. The room was showing a little wear and tear with furniture chipped and peeling. The location was fantastic, close to the subway, dry cleaners and a quick walk to places like Pressed Juice, Sweetgreen, Eately and the new Westfield Shopping Center. I think this hotel would be good for a short stay for business, however we were there for 8 nights for a special occasion and unfortunately felt underwhelmed.

We enjoyed our stay at the hotel.I found the staff very courteous and helpful.I liked the place as soon as I walked into the Lobby.There was a nice chess board with draughts(checkers) and a nice set of x and o.The rooms were roomy and sound proof.We could end not hear other rooms.Great showers too

The hotel is situated in a great location in downtown Manhattan, close to the 9/11 Memorial and Museum. We found the rooms to be quite small in comparison to other hotels that we had stayed in during our holiday in America, especially as we had two fairly large suitcases. We agree with other comments regarding king size beds within the rooms, we were lucky enough not to get cut, but a few bruises are inevitable. As guests, we seemed to get the grumpy barman on our first night, who seemed fine fraternising with the locals who lived nearby. We didn't stay in again. Staff at reception were very pleasant and helpful.

Great rooms and service! Highly recommended! They received us with champagne at the lobby. The concierge was kind enough to recommend restaurants that would be open for Thanksgiving dinner. Rooms are way spacier than other NYC hotels! Beautiful hotel and the location was spot on!

The Gild Hall is conveniently located in the Financial District close to several subway stations, Wall St. and the 9/11 Memorial. The hotel has been recently renovated and the interior is cozy. We had one snag on the first of our 4 night stay. The king bed is just a bit to big for the room dimensions including furniture. I banged my shins on the corner of the bed frame trying to get around the room- left a nasty cut. Let the front desk know the next morning and they moved us to a suite a day later when it became available. The staff was very accommodating, courteous, and professional. I would recommend it based on location, room rate, hotel staff, and the property (except for the premium king room dimensions).

First time in NYC we stayed here for three nights and I have to say I was more than satisfied. Great front desk service, clean room, comfortable bed and a convenient location. Also the Italian restaurant on the ground floor is great for lunch and dinner. Worth a recommendation!

I wanna say so many things about this hotel. This is such a beautiful and appealing place to spend your quality time and money. What a awesome weather and pleasurable place to stay all time. Most fabulous part is gorgeous rooms and presence of everything is just soothing.this is a Scenic place.

Convenient location right in Wall Street - walking distance from the Oculus, Century 21, subway, etc. Room was spacious and very designed, loved the amenities provided. Service was outstanding, great value hotel. All-in-all a wonderful experience and will certainly be back!

We sure enjoyed our stay at Gild Hall a couple of weeks ago… My wife liked the “feel” of the hotel. I concur. It was comfortable and you can’t say that about every NYC hotel room.We were impressed by every staff person we encountered - very friendly and helpful. We stay at nice places, so have come to take it for granted that we will be treated very well, but this crew really made an impression. We also very much enjoyed our meals and service at the restaurant.

I ventured a little further downtown that I normally do and was very surprised how much I enjoyed the area and hotel. It has a very current boutique feel, the staff was very friendly and accommodating and the room was way above my expectations. All around a great experience and value.

This is a beautiful hotel with careful attention paid to every detail. From the time we walked into the lobby we felt comfortable and at ease. Our room was spacious with beautiful finishes. Service was exceptional as well. Every employee we met went out of their way to be friendly and helpful. We'll definitely be back and highly recommend others try it as well.The restaurant is also a must. While a bit pricey, the menu is original and the food is beautifully prepared and presented. There were so many things we wanted, we'll have to go back to try more!

We have just returned from a 4 night stay in this superb hotel. We were a party of 4 and would recommend this hotel to all of our friends. Our room was lovely, peaceful and quiet. The bed and the pillows.... Well what can we say, it felt like being wrapped in a loving softness that is too hard to describe. Our only gripe is that breakfast on Sunday morning was a shambles. My husband was ill with food poisoning so I joined ny friend with her husband, they ordered the continental breakfast and I ordered the American breakfast. We waited nearly 50 minutes, when my friends asked for their orange juice they were brought tomato ketchup !!!! The waiter then brought one orange juice and one grapefruit juice seriously ??? We felt that people who were coming in for breakfast were given priority to the guests staying in the hotel. We paid a lot of money to stay here so really feel strongly that we should have been looked after too. On our first morning we were given teapots after that it was a cup with a tea bag to be told sorry we have no teapots. Please you must be consistent. Would this put us off NO, but hotel staff please remember to look after your guests. Our money is just as good as Joe Bloggs off the street !!!! I couldn't fault the staff on their knowledge of the subway and all their advice. This was me and hubby's 3 rd time to NYC and we will not be returning... Too many other places to visit before we retire. I can truly say book this hotel you will not be disappointed. Yes you are away from all the attractions but peace and quiet means a lot.

I was pleasantly surprised with the Gild not having stayed at at Thompson hotel before. It also helped that I got upgraded to a suite which was incredibly large for a NYhotel. The rooms are very well decorated - a little bit of a bachelor pad style so maybe not for everyone. Service was friendly and the food at the restaurant was not bad either.

This is a must when you're in the NYC. It's a true 4 Star Hotel with all the service and amenities of a 5 Star Hotel just not big enough for me to give it that extra nod. The rooms are creatively decorated. Must GO!

Clean,beautiful and fashion hotel in Lower Manhattan. Very close to the Financial District and near to the subway (Fulton street). Great breakfast at the Felice restaurant, right nearby/inside the hotel. Strongly reccomended!

Very nice hotel in financial district, close to everything we wanted to do such as ferry to Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island, North End Grill, World Trade area. Plenty of activity around hotel on weekend. Appreciated valet parking, fitness facilities and breakfast in hotel.

My friend and I stayed for an overnight on a Sunday night to see a show and the 9/11 memorial. We arrived early and were able to drop our bags and go out to the city. The staff called within an hour to say our room was ready. Really nice lobby. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The room was modern and actually pretty big for a NYC hotel room. I prefer staying downtown because its a little quieter. I'll definitely stay at Gild Hall again.

Stayed here the night before the marathon - really enjoyed it. Rooms are large and well appointed, the restaurant downstairs is very decent. I chose this hotel for it's specific location but would have been glad to have stayed longer.

Our 2nd visit to NYC and we decided to stay in a different area to our last visit. We stayed on 5th avenue last time and when we first booked the Gild Hall i was a little worried that it wouldn't match up to Langham Place. The price of Gild Hall is slightly cheaper and its down in the financial district and not right in amongst everything which for us we preferred. We were not disappointed with Gild Hall at all, in fact it was more personal, with welcoming staff that couldn't do enough for you, from the Welcome drink to umbrellas given to us on a night out. Fab location and close to the many subway routes. The rooms aren't huge but for the amount of time spent in them they were spacious enough and i loved the styling of them. We were that impressed with this gem of a hotel we have already booked to come back next year. Also there are a few lovely bars and restaurants close. South Street Seaport area is being renovated and there are bars/restaurants down there if you fancy a walk and Brooklyn bridge a short walk away also. All in all a fab boutique hotel in an excellent area x

This hotel is well priced for New York if you want to stay in the Financial District. We wanted to stay near family who live near here but otherwise would recommend staying further uptown, with more nightlife etc. That being said, this hotel is great. Trendy, helpful staff, decent room size (for a New York hotel). The welcome champagne was a nice touch too!I would definitely recommend this hotel - or others from the Thompson chain (having stayed at another one of their hotels in Mexico). No complaints at all!

We had originally booked to stay up in Midtown for our first trip to NYC but began to be put off by some of the reviews - large hotel, busy, service not great etc. As a result we went back to our tour operator and that's when we discovered Gild Hall was available as one of their alternate choices. Switching to the Gild Hall is the best decision we could have made. Our experience of the hotel was fantastic from start to finish - our only regret is probably that we made so little use of the hotel, we were up and out early each day and not back until late in the evening. The accommodation itself was great, we opted for a suite and were situated up on the 9th floor and we were blown away by the size of the room. The bed is the most comfortable I've ever experienced in any hotel - we both had wonderful nights' sleeps despite us both being notoriously light sleepers in "strange" beds. There was no traffic noise at all. The bathroom was excellent too.Don't assume (as we did initially) that you need to be in the thick of things by staying up in Midtown. We found getting around to be an absolute breeze - no more than 5 mins walk from the hotel to Fulton Street subway and no more than 15 mins or so on the frequent subway trains and you're up in Times Square.We can't speak for the restaurant, Felice, as we tended to eat out every day but it looked fantastic.I can't recommend the hotel enough.

My wife and I stayed here on a Saturday night to celebrate our anniversary. The hotel has a small lobby with games (chess, checkers, tic tac toe) and books set out that you can enjoy. There is an Italian restaurant connected to the hotel that looks really nice, although we didn't get a chance to eat there. The room has great modern décor that my wife especially loved. The décor is so modern that you can even see through the bathroom door (just barely blurred). So if you are staying with someone else and like privacy while using the restroom then this may be a bit of a nuisance for you. Otherwise, there was nothing else we had to complain about the entire weekend at this great hotel.The most important thing to me is the bed and it was a very comfortable king size bed. The duvet was the perfect size... I'm picky about that and sometimes they are too thick and hot for me, but the one at Gild Hall is perfect so that we weren't getting too hot during the night.Overall, a fantastic place to stay and great price on the Saturday night that we stayed there as well!

Gild Hall is a nice boutique-style hotel in the Financial district, down a quiet, unassuming street close to the 9/11 Memorial, Wall Street and a short walk to Tribeca or Battery Park. Rooms are surprisingly big (for New York), decorated in hipster style, quiet and clean. Staff were friendly. The Italian wine bar and restaurant in the lobby is quite good.

Only stayed at this hotel due to a cracking deal at the time of booking. Having previously visited New York and stayed near Times Square I was weary of being some distance from the main tourist hub but found this to be no issue. On arrival myself and the girlfriend were given complimentary prosecco (she had mine too!) and as our room wasn't ready were given complimentary drinks vouchers. We had to rush out prior to using them as we had a Mets game to catch (they won!) so used them for more prosecco from reception on our return. The hotel is 20 minutes by subway from Times Square - close enough to be an easy commute on the 2/3 trains but far enough to get away from the hustle and bustle and annoying street vendors. In fact this hotel was more ideal for the Brooklyn Bridge, World Trade Centre, Statue of Liberty and other attractions at the south end of Manhattan. The room we booked was massive for New York standards with separate living and bed room, large walk in showers and his'n'hers sinks. The kitchenette was basic but usable. The room has it's quirks - there is no minibar - but items are left lying around the room with a single price card in the kitchen! The cleaning staff were fantastic - a few mornings we were late heading out and they didn't mind coming back later in the day. They also thoughtfully arranged the girlfriends beauty products on the 'make up' table and provided extra flannels for her. The included breakfast vouchers were only valid up until 11am despite it being available until 2pm on weekends, this wasn't mentioned on the vouchers and therefore our plan for brunch was foiled on the second day but subsequent mornings were set up with a good American breakfast of sesame seed bread toast, fantastic scrambled egg and bacon. Checkout was just as easy and the concierge/doorman was great in grabbing us a yellow cab cable of taking 2 people + 4 suitcases to LGA - saved us over $50 compared to an Uber/Town Car.Definitely stay again if the price was right - keep an eye out for deals on the booking sites!

My girlfriend and I visit NYC together for the first time in the begging of November. We could not have asked for a better hotel to call our home. From the warm welcome with a glass of Prosecco to very nice recommendations, the staff was genuine and never over the top. Thank you for making our anniversary special! If the weather allows, hop on one of the hotel's complimentary bikes and explore the city. Great location I would definitely recommend for business or pleaseure.

We enjoy this chic hotel in Financial district area. Italian restaurant on site, quite big room compare to other hotel in the area. Bottle water in room is not free. Great amenities kits. No parking, nearby has garage for $40 a night. Great staffs. We got pretty good rate for this 4 stars hotel. Will return if we get the same rate below $200 a night.

Best bunch people work here! The service, courtesy and comfort provided by a staff who clearly values their guests is more than impressive. Wonderful and considerate while terribly professional this group of people are the best in the business. And I didn't even mention how chic and sophisticated that is the decor. Also, tip them in CASH, not your credit card.

Great place for the price. Rooms are well design, mattress is great and comfortable, bathrooms have all you need. Water is a bit expensive, make a note that is now t free. Also a good restaurant in the lobby, enjoy.

My wife and I stayed there during our wedding night and could not have been happier. The staff was fantastic and as welcoming as could be. The "out of towners" were extremely impressed with the entire experience. The local guests mentioned wanting to make an excuse to stay again. Thanks to all!

We loved Gild Hall. The lobby fun and eclectic. The staff was super friendlyand helpful. The room was inviting, a great chair for reading, good lighting on each side of the bed. Bathroom very bright with blue glass tiles. Hallways well lit and cheerful.The restaurant, Felice was fantastic. Best mushroom lasagna ever, and wonderful wines.The neighborhood felt very safe and so much history and great architecture all around you. A really fun place to explore.

Hotel entrance is on a small street amidst a lot of construction. However once you enter the Hotel is quaint , nicely furnishes and above all their customer service was A+The front desk associate was so accommodating ... when you you comeinto NYC , you arent sure what to expect, but he made us feel so welcome. I think you will have a great stay here.
user_name:
Maria J
Morris Plains, New Jersey

review_body: Stayed for 7 nights with my husband. We had an upgrade on arrival. Room was huge by Manhattan standards, bathroom was big too and both spotlessly clean. There were robes and very good quality bedding and towels. Bed was extremely comfortable. Location is good for Battery park, 9/11 memorial etc. Staff were always friendly and helpful. There were a few disappointing things. The website uses clever photography, the lobby looks so much bigger than it actually is. This seems to happen a lot these days. There was a lovely smell as you enter the hotel, unfortunately this did extend to the room which smelt stale. Again I find this happens a lot, why not carry fragrances t through to the guest rooms? The shower was disappointing, was expecting something more modern, same with the air con system, very old fashioned. There were also some odd house keeping habits. After 4 nights we suddenly received a turndown service with chocolates. The next night there was just one chocolate one side of the bed and no turndown, go figure as they say! Something to really watch out for and be aware of is the price of water in the room. If you arrive as we did from a transatlantic flight really thirsty, beware of the water bottle in the room it is priced at 9 dollars. Despite these issues, we enjoyed our stay at The Gild Hall which represents very good value for Manhattan.

Spent 4 nights and very impressed with the quality and service. Front desk staff were top notch, outgoing and happy to help with my requests. Room very comfortable and clean. Excellent location in financial district. Nice Italian restaurant with very good food and top end service. A great experience, would definitely come back on my next trip to New York.

I chose this hotel based on its location, reviews, and unique style. I did a quick 2 day/1 night trip and was very pleased. I requested a high floor and was way up on 17 (18 is the top), so that was great. They also stored my luggage after checkout while I visited the 9/11 Memorial and Statue of Liberty, both of which were less than a 10 minute walk. Wanting a little getaway for myself and having flown first class, this hotel fit perfect into my weekend of fun in New York. The decor and ambience of the hotel was a huge draw for me, a single man in his early 30's. There are lots of plain hotels, this one stood out. And the room was exactly like the pictures, very clean and tidy.

We booked the lovely Gild Hall hotel with ease, and a great price! I loved the leather headboards and the chic décor of the lobby. We arrived and got a complimentary upgrade to a larger room, which was unexpected and very kind. Unfortunately, the room did seem smoky, which wasn't expected as we had originally booked non-smoking. The bathroom doors leave little to the imagination, as they are semi-opaque when the light is on (silhouette of your roommate/SO on the toilet). Then there was the bed, which was quite hard, but the bedding was nice.We did get to enjoy some drinks in the bar/restaurant, and I recall being happy with it.

While I had a pleasant stay, and can't say enough good things about the helpful and courteous staff, I feel there are better values out there. It definitely has a boutique hotel feel, but is not as charming or cool as other NYC hotels I've stayed in, especially at that price level. On premise Italian restaurant and wine bar has extremely charming atmosphere and decent but not stellar food. Had several small but adequate exercise rooms. Very nice business center. I had a nice stay and no complaints. But I feel there are nicer hotels in this price range and at this star rating level.

The hotel is in a great location. The reception and restaurant are beautiful. We were on the 4th floor which meant the room was a little dark, however the room was clean and nicely furnished. The leather bedhead is beautiful and the bathroom was very nice.The staff were very helpful and friendly and certainly added to the comfortable feeling of the hotel.

The property is gorgeous. The rooms are really comfortable and well appointed. But it is the staff that really sets this hotel apart. They remember you on return visits and go out of their way to make you feel special and help you with anything you need.

Heard a lot about it so we booked a quick overnight to NYC. It's deep in the FiDi on Platt & Gold St. We ate onsite at Felice.. fantastic Italian with gracious servers. We checked into a Deluxe King; across from an apt building but blackout shades provided privacy. Cool but small room with a tub/shower combo. Built for function with funky and fun masculine form. Meh bath products and a nice selection of snacks at the minibar so we bought a few.. (stale though...) Overall a comfortable stay until checkout.The desk associate made sarcastic (but he thought they were funny)comments about our stay. We are def older than the target demo Im sure and with that comes the luxury to stay where our $ is appreciated. One time stay. We've stayed at other THOMPSON properties and loved them btw...Decent weekend rates too. Interesting lobby and everywhere you look there is something to talk about.Go for the cushy bed, not for the staff chat.

I discovered Gild Hall about a year ago, and I stay there every time I travel to New York for work (several times a year). Perfect location in FiDi, unique decor, fabulous hotel bar and a warm, welcoming atmosphere. Customer service is impeccable - I use their corporate traveler program that has excellent rates and a direct point of contact for effortless booking. After my last stay, I needed to change payment on my final bill to correctly expense the stay for business purposes, and it was the most hassle-free experience I've ever had post-checkout at a hotel! I really love this place and highly recommend.

Staff was great, young and helpful. Rooms were fine, great location, breakfast was good, but the morning people while friendly and accommodating were in need of training...orders weren't always correct.

I stayed at Gild Hall for a couple of nights. At check-in I was greeted with a glass of sparkling wine by the reception staff. The room, located on the ninth floor, was spacious and clean. The bed was huge. Some of the equipment seemed a bit outdated but generally the place looked nice. Slow elevators and fussy magnetic cards. Reception staff is very kind, notably Anthony who will patiently cater for your every need.

Gild Hall was a great setting for our "wedding weekend" in NYC. They handled a large group from out of town, the rehearsal dinner and subsequent reception for those in the hotel and a sumptuous brunch for a large group on Sunday morning. The rooms were comfortable and the service excellent. Thanks for making our son's wedding accommodations memorable.

In town for a family weekend, we stayed at Gild Hall in mid October. The rooms were spotless, the staff helpful and friendly, and the food lovely. Gild Hall staff catered two events for out-of-town guests and the food and beverages more than met the needs of a wide variety of people, from children to seniors, vegetarians and omnivores. Look forward to a return trip one day.

Stayed here for 7 nights in June. Excellent reception staff, comfortable room which was surprisingly quiet for New York. Small restaurant which was great for breakfast. Great bar area. Near to Wall Street, World Trade Centre, Battery Park and close to Fulton subway to easily go uptown.

I had high hopes but was dissapointed. Pros: Very close to subway, staff friendly, restaurant service excellent and breakfast was delicious, comfy bedCons: Feels old/overused, rooms dark (which makes it harder to tell if it is clean), bathroom very small, elevators in poor condition, noisy in between roomsOverall it was adequate for our 1-night stay and we booked on priceline so paid slightly below $300 for a Friday night stay, which I suppose isn't bad but overall was expecting something much better. If you just need a place to stay it is fine but if you are looking for a special hotel experience, I don't think this is the place to go

We had such a nice time at the Gild Hall hotel. Robert and John checked us in, offered us champagne and bottled water, and when they found out that we were in NYC for a "babymoon," they gave us a complimentary breakfast in the hotel restaurant! The hotel was very clean and quiet, the bed and shower were comfortable, and the decor was relaxing and nice. Even though the Financial District is a bit far from the action of NYC, we had a nice walk to Battery Park and the 9/11 memorial, and there were many convenient quick dining options, as well as a corner market, nearby.Two minor complaints with the hotel: 1. When they cleaned our room, it seems as though they picked our wet, dirty towels up off the floor (where we had placed them to be replaced) and hung them back on the towel rack. I'm not sure why they did this, but the front desk gladly gave us clean towels. 2. Most NYC hotel rooms are tight, but my husband and I both hit our shins numerous times on the corner of the king size bed and ended the weekend with multiple bruises--I think that the furniture could be better arranged to prevent this problem. Other than that, this hotel was perfect and we would definitely stay again!

It's a very nice hotel in a modern industrial design. Location in Finantial District is key for bussiness travelers. My only complain is that being the near buildings so close, and being the carpets and some walls in black or dark colors, the rooms are quite dark even during daylight hours...A little pricey breakfast (but as in every other place in NYC).

I like coming to Gild Hall since is so conveniently located to my son apartment. The hotel unlike similar places in New York, has rooms that you can move in without bruising yourself against the furniture. The beds with comfortable mattresses and the bathrooms with clean towels, as well as all the modern conveniences for a traveler. An item that you find less and less is a fridge in the room, although some of bar items are beyond outrageously priced.

I stayed here for 3 nights, solo vacation. The aesthetic is nice enough, but the place didn't provide the value and service I expect for what I paid. My check-in was routine, but when I came down from unpacking several people checking in were given champagne. Is that a random selection? No coffee makers in the room, which is fine, but no complimentary coffee in the lobby either. First night there a couple across the hall were fighting, and I could hear every word. My toilet flushed on its own about every hour. I guess the thing I disliked the most was the darkness of the room, even with all the lights on. If I was looking for something in my purse I had to take it into the washroom. Also would have preferred a walk-in shower instead of small tub. It wasn't horrible but this is the second Thompson Hotel that I've stayed in (the other in Toronto) that has underwhelmed me.

Modern Luxury with a cool twist hotel. Loved the decor and this hotel probably had the biggest beds I have ever seen, extra king size, would probably fit 3 people comfortably.Staff were friendly and welcoming, rooms were very clean and modern. Hidden Gem in downtown New York within walking distance from Wall Street, the 9/11 memorial and brooklyn bridge.

Great little boutique hotel . It's a great location right in the center of the financial district. Lots of tourist things to do. Through cheap tickets .com got free breakfast included...a plus. I only gave it four stars because it does need a little TLC in some areas. I.e. Elevator needs a face lift, doors have some bang up Marks can't order a movie in house.

This was such an awesome place. A quaint boutique in the heart of Fidi. The décor is amazing, the restaurant is even better and the staff are accommodating and friendly. A great price for what you get in NYC. The area is a little removed form all the sites in midtown but I liked being in a quieter area. Transit is close and you can walk to lots of cool places in the area. Staff was awesome, helpful and allowed me to do late check out due to some flight changes. I will be back!

I cannot believe that I had not written this review before now! We stayed in March 2015. We came over from the UK to get married and we picked the Gild Hall as it was close by to Worth Street. We were not disappointed! Love the Financial District and love the hotel. We had a lot of snow while we were there and despite it causing a few changes to our plans we had a magical wedding and stay at the Gild Hall. The staff were fantastic and when they found out we were going to get married they gave us a voucher for a drink in the bar when we returned after the wedding. Food in Felice was delicious and I could have eaten breakfast/brunch in there everyday!We are planning to come back to stay at the hotel in March to celebrate our 2nd anniversary. But please not the same amount of snow this time!

Before we got there, they asked me in a text what type of room I wanted. I replied on a high floor with a good view. We got a low floor with a bad view. I think you shouldn't ask if you are going to give the opposite!But the room was nice, the lobby is funky fun and we had good food at the bar. We needed an extra hour before checkout, and that was granted.Overall good experience.

The staff at check-in were great. The bar staff were helpful, informative and attentive without being in your face. The service in the restaurant was very good and the breakfast was excellent.One very minor issue was the bottles of water in the room that was extremely expensive..... the name on the bottle was "Fred", which at the wrong angle looked like free....apart from that I couldn't fault the place.

We stayed for a week here in September, the hotel staff were all very polite and helpful. Rooms were clean and big enough. The bed was huge and pillows were really comfortable too. David the front office manager was really helpful in particular. We ate at the restaurant which was nice and always popular, easy to just nip next door after a busy day out.We found using the subway to get to the main part quite easy, but download the app as they sometimes do rail works and it's easy to get confused if you have to swap trains and rail staff are not that helpful.We also found a really good place for beakfast called the Open Market, loads of choice and mega cheap compared to restaurants around. It was on Beaver Street and did great breakfast sandwiches and omelettes for a fraction of the price of other places, the fresh orange juice was good too.

We stayed here with some friends in August 2016. The hotel has a great New York vibe to it with a great looking lobby and bar area. We found the staff very attentive and checking in very easy.Location wise we were close to many metro stations as well as the World Trade Center site. We were also close to a number of good bars and places to eat.The rooms were comfortable , though a bit small in the bathroom. The air con unit was very loud though and there wasn't much natural light in the bedroom - though I am sure this is common in New York .A bit pricey but overall very good .
user_name:
Aaron C
Dubai, United Arab Emirates

review_body: I recommend Gild Hall to any and everyone. Nothing but great vibes from the moment you first walk-in, all the way until you check out. The rooms are super comfortable and very clean and well maintained. Customer service at the front desk was phenomenal. Anybody considering to stay here make sure you request Robert! He made my stay here at Gild Hall everything I wanted it to be for my anniversary really really great service. I will most definitely stay here many times in the near future no complaints here at all!
user_name:
R3911UQmikeh
New York City, New York

review_body: I do enjoy staying here and have done so multiple times. Rooms are very clean and nice - bed is very comfortable. The staff/service is what sets it apart though. The bar & restaurant make Gild Hall a complete package.

I loved everything about this hotel. From the lobby - which has the feel of a warm and welcoming "inn" to the beautiful room and extremely comfortable bed. The bar - off the lobby - is small and intimate. The meals in the restaurant ("Felice") which is part of the hotel were amazing. I would have been content to spend the 4 days I was in NY just hanging out in the hotel. Also, the housekeeping staff were top notch.

Loved this hotel. Stunning design. Loved the room. Loved everything about it, right down to the headboard, curtains and bathroom doors. Just so tasteful. Staff were friendly. Location is fine, but quite a walk from Times Square. May need to catch the subway if you're not into walking. But it's such a walkable city, it's absolutely manageable.

Our room was smallish. Air conditioner too noisy. The room was clean and bathroom was new. We staid in 125. Location of the hotel is great. Not far from World Trade Center and other downtown locations. Subway is close. Breakfast was good. The restaurant of this hotel is very good.

We stayed here for two nights at the start of our recent holiday. It was a really nice place to be. The small footprint of the building means that there are not too many rooms per floor and that seems to keep it quiet. The staff we spoke too were all really helpful and friendly, useful as this was our first time in NYC. The room itself was good, very comfortable bed. Only two minor downsides: Being British we're accustomed to complimentary water, tea and coffee in the room. Here everything is (very) chargeable, so buy a bottle of water at one of the local shops. The other was the aircon beong a bit on the noisy side, but we were so tired is was not major issue.Recommended - nice place.

We had a lovely time staying at this beautiful boutique hotel, the staff were all amazing from the Reception Staff to the Cleaners, everyone was helpful and very kind, nothing was too much trouble. We also were surprised and delighted to be given a bottle of Prosecco for our Anniversary which I thought was very thoughtful. Our room was lovely and everything was spotless including the bathroom, the cleaners came in every day which I thought was very good. We would most definetly return to this hotel when next visiting New York.

Really a unique hotel! Service and atmosphere were great! The room was really well decorated and clean. Parking was expensive, but not outrageous for NYC. The gym was very small, and didn't have a lot of equipment but that is really the only negative thing I can say about the hotel. I would definitely stay here again!

The pictures on the web certainly were spot on. The reception area is very cozy, smart and you think this is a hotel out of the ordinary. The bar in the hotel is very popular for happy hour. and the restaurant serves Italian food - it looked nice.The reception staff was courteous.The room is nice looking too with an ambience of a gentlemans club. This is real great for the night time but dark during the day... It was not a big size room and traveling with 3 suitcases the floor space was pretty much used up. It had a great minibar with some extraordinary things that underline the hip atmosphere. Great bed. Noisy aircon but I guess it keeps city nice out. With earplugs we slept fine. However checking into a double room we found one bathrobe, 2 towels of each size and we had to ask for replenishment several times. In a hot city we had showers twice a day, the second time always drying with a wet towel. On the occasions we did call for fresh replenishments it didn't take long - I just don't expect to have to call in an establishment like this.The hotel doesn't have many facilities - the have 3 tiny fitness rooms that are great if you are not claustrophobic. Needless to say not much equipment.We asked for a later checkout but was asked to pay $140 to extend from 1pm to 4pm. Extending to 6pm was another night. The price was based on a percentage of the daily rate (which in this case would be $1.120!!). Ridiculous. We stayed 6 nights in total and I would have found it a nice gesture to allow for the late checkout - either complimentary or at a small fee. I take it it is pure business. They did keep our bagage free of charge though.It is a nice looking hotel but nevertheless I was disappointed and left with the feeling of ohh that was it ? Would I chose it again ? Probably not. There are so many great hotels in NY so I will go elsewhere the next time.

Based on the awesome pics, I honestly expected more but have to admit that the high level of service more than offset my initial disappointment.If this location works as well for you as it did for my staff and I, quirky, hip and relaxing are how I would describe Gild Hall. Definitely worthy of a visit.

Enjoyed a two night stay here prior to boarding a cruise ship(which was excellent thanks for asking!)Taxi had difficulty finding the hotel but luckily I had checked it out on Google streetview so I was able to direct him lol.It's in a very European feeling location with it's twisting,narrow streets so we felt right at home.There is nothing remarkable about the hotel exterior at first sight but the interior is a real surprise.It's difficult to describe to a stranger(reindeer antler chandeliers,yes really)but it's very individual and probably one of the least corporate hotels in NYC.Bedrooms are cool with plenty of room,and,oh yes,the beds are great - truly appreciated after 8 hour flight from the UK and a few hours desperate cramming it all in sightseeing.Bathroom and shower was OK,did what was required.Nice toiletries provided but I was about to have a complimentary shave when I saw the shaving kit costed $15!Decided stubble looked better.We didn't use Felice,the attached restaurant,although it looked very nice and had a good menu.We are renowned cheapskates so we ate at Jim Brady's on Maiden Lane and had breakfast at Pearl Diner on Pearl Street(a real authentic NY experience,mixing with construction workers and a couple of NYPD's finest) As others have said the location is ideal for many sights and transportation hubs.Being NY first timers,we used the open top bus tour from City Hall to travel to Midtown - well recommended.To sum up,this a good hotel in a great location.No hesitation in recommending to fellow Tripadvisor fans.

We stayed overnight with our daughter for a family wedding. Hotel decor was very cool, and we loved the smallness of the hotel. The staff was helpful and the parking fee wasn't outrageous. ($60) The bathroom was very well designed with really great toiletries and flattering lighting for makeup application. AH but the beds! Very Comfortable! The location worked out great for us as well.

This hotel is not the most exciting place to stay in but it does not disappoint either. My room was clean, the Fulton metro station very close by and the staff seemed to be highly professional.All in all a nice place to stay if you have business to do in the FiDi or tour the city as a visitor.

Stayed here with family for a wedding inAugust. From the moment you enter this hotel oozes luxury - stunning leather couches in the lobby, quirky chandeliers and a very welcoming bar/restaurant area. This luxury extends to the rooms which are all well appointed with incredibly comfortable beds that you won't want to leave. All this aside what sets this hotel apart is the staff - from front desk to breakfast service and room cleaners everyone was just so helpful! Half our party stayed at another hotel nearby that was marginally cheaper but their place couldn't compare to the Gild Hall - thoroughly recommend this place to anyone visiting NYC and looking for a touch of class!

Stayed two night after flying in to New York before we traveled on to other parts of the US. It was very easy to get to from the metro, which we took from JFK. Nice and modern, rather masculine interior design. Big room. Great bed!!! Nice service. We didn't try the restaurant since it honestly seemed a little dull.

So we waited to see what the weather forecast would be before pulling the weekend away trigger. We have stayed at their sister property in TriBeCa - the Smyth - and loved it so when I couldn't get a room at the Smyth I booked Gild Hall. It's a very comfortable, new/modern with a young and hip feel. The front desk staff were awesome. Super helpful, quick with the door, great recommendations for the nearby bodegas that carry vegan food. The bar was a great place to chill when we were in for the evening - great craft beer selections. Loved everything about it and will book again.

Very impressed with the size and look of the King room and bathroom. The staff were very friedly and offered us an umbrella when we were caught out by the rain.Being in the financial centre it is not too busy at night so we had no noise whatsoever.The location is perfect for access to the subway as it's only a short walk to Fulton which has multiple subway lines running from it.We recommend this hotel as it has good value for what it is charging.

The Gild Hall was in an Ideal location, it was well priced , we were given a spacious room. There is a fabulous Italian restaurant , offers really authentic Italian home cooking with really friendly staff - would stay again.We spent 2 nights there, great base to explore NYC.

Stayed one night at The Gild Hall in August, we had booked in April to stay The Beekman, then were let down as opening day was delayed, so moved to The Gild Hall. We love a room with a view, and unfortunately there are no views here. David and his team did everything they could to move us to another Thompson Hotel, The Smyth, all within a couple of hours!! We can not thank you enough for all you did for us! It was customer service at it's finest. Our bags were sent over and once at The Smyth we were treated in the same manner.If you want an excellent hotel, very comfortable bed, amazing shower, large TV, clean and with the friendliest staff The Gild Hall is the place to go. Again THANK YOU!!

We stayed here with two other couples in August as part of a week in New York. The hotel is slightly hidden away but in a good location near a few subway stations. It is an easy 5 min walk to the Freedom tower and also Wall Street and has good bars and places to eat nearby.The lobby is pretty small but has a nice bar and good atmosphere. The rooms are clean and comfortable, though the bathrooms could have been bigger, especially for a couple. There was not much natural light and the windows don't drown out 100% of the noise . it isn't too bad but as a light sleeper it did bother me a little. The bed though was very comfortable.I found the staff very friendly and helpful though I do feel the price was a bit more then it should have been.

stylish boutique hotel with a restaurant/bar attached to the lobby area. The hotel has subdued lighting in the rooms and in the restaurant that gives it an air of sophistication without being stuffy The rooms are stylishly decorated with large flat screen tv , the bathrooms are also to a high standard of décor though the glass wall curtain combo seemed a little too indiscreet for me.The hotel is close to the subway and situated in the financial district close to the 9/11 memorial.The only negative for me was the noise from the air conditioning unit however we got used to it.Would recommend this hotel.

The hotel appears brand new, very stylish, and the room was extremely clean, comfortable, and surprisingly (by NYC standards) not tiny. Bed (king size) and pillows were awesome. Shower was good. Staff were always friendly and accommodating. I called ahead because we were traveling with a baby, and they let us check in early and staff set up a portable crib in our room prior to our arrival (no charge). Note that valet parking is available, but there is a parking garage literally across the street from the hotel entrance that is $10-15 cheaper.

As soon as we arrived at the hotel we were made to feel very welcome and given lots of advice on place to go and things to do that might interest us. The room was gorgeous and a perfect size for the two of us. Every evening when we got back the staff would ask us about our day and we were made to feel extra special. It is in a great downtown location, walking distance from The Brooklyn Bridge and has good connections to reach many other attractions. In particular Chris, Angel, Max and Tom were fantastic!

After a two week trip, we ended in NYC and we splashed out a bit to make sure we had a nice hotel for our short stay, but even so with prices in the city especially in August, we weren't expecting the world - small but clean room would have been fine for us, we however were extremely pleasantly surprised. The hotel isn't the easiest to find if you're just going off street names, it's nicely tucked away off any major streets, if you're coming from Fulton Street St and turn onto Gold Street, just keep walking, you will see it eventually.After a prompt check-in, we were blown away by our room, the room was huge for city standards never mind New York standards which we had been warned about, the bathrooms are lovely and modern, and the air conditioner very effective. The rooms were cleaned to a high standard each day, and although our room was near to the elevators we were not disrupted at all at any point in our trip.Unfortunately we didn't have the easiest ride in NYC with lost baggage, cancelled and delayed flights (obviously nothing to do with the hotel), but we could not have asked for more in terms of customer service, helpfulness and pure cheerfulness. We didn't let things affect our trip but the hotel truly did everything within their power to help us out, in terms of locating luggage and finding us a room on an unexpected extra night in the city.We would just like to thank you once again for making our trip so memorable. We were truly blessed to stay at a hotel that looked after its guests so well. All of the staff should be commended on their customer service and unfortunately there are too many to list, however we would like to give two extra special acknowledgements to Robert, and the gentleman who worked the alternate day shifts, unfortunately we never got his name - these two really are fantastic assets to your establishment.We look forward to returning (with better luck next time), and will be recommending your hotel.

Had a great stay whilst in New York for a friends wedding. The hotel was a short walk from the church so perfect location. It is a beautifully decorated boutique hotel. Front desk service was good as was the maid service.Bad point - air conditioning is ridiculously noisy. Good point - hair dryer in the room is amazing for a hotel hair dryer.Definitely worth a visit.

Looking for a place to stay in NYC, look noFurther than The Guild Hall Hotel on Goldstreet. Our room was brilliant, clean, large and luxurious. The staff were always keen to help With recommendations and advice. It has a really good bar and restaurant attached as well As gym facilities. Close proximity to numerous subway stations means your around 15 minutes to get to Midtown (Times Square). Great value for Money in a safe neighbourhood. I will definetly visit again.

Beautiful hotel. Friendly and helpful staff. Gorgeous room. Loved our stay. Good location for attractions such as the one world trade centre, 9/11 memorial and the ferry to the Statue of Liberty. Very close to Wall Street and Brooklyn bridge. Plenty room for 2. Rooms spotless. Cleaned everyday.

My recent stay at Gild Hall was awesome!!! First reaction once you arrive is that it's a hotel for grown-ups. The atmosphere and overall ambience is quite attractive. The complimentary glass of champagne that I received because it was Saturday was also a very nice touch. Staff was very friendly, room was excellent and I was made to feel very welcome. I'd definitely stay again for another weekend getaway ☺.
user_name:
Happy0500
New York City, New York

review_body: The service is courteous, prompt and attentive at this hotel. We liked the location especially since we wanted to walk over the brooklyn bridge. IT's also near Battery Park and One World Trade Center. We opted for the premium king room and thought it was worth it since we never felt like we were bumping into each other which can happen in some NYC hotel rooms. The next time we need a room in lower Manhattan, we would come back here.

Me and my Fiancé had a wonderful experience at Gild Hall, A Thompson Hotel! We were impressed with the friendly and knowledgeable staff and the spacious rooms. This was our first trip staying in the FiDi Neighborhood but we will definitely be back! Gild Hall feels like our new home away from home!

Highly recommend this hotel! My husband and I stayed here for a long weekend celebrating our wedding anniversary and had a fabulous experience! They truly create a top notch customer experience here for each of their guests! We were treated to a glass of champagne upon arrival and then after sharing that it was our anniversary we were upgraded to a nicer room with no extra charge!

We stayed in this lovely hotel for 3 nights. It was a perfect location, quiet, and a stone's throw from the 9/11 memorial and the One World Observatory.It's also located in a small Italian area, which was just fantastic.Great food, spotless, lovely helpful staff. Difficult to beat.

This was our second time staying at Gild Hall and regardless of where I need to be in NYC this is the only hotel I'll stay in from now on. The location is perfect, the staff is friendly and helpful and most of all the rooms are impeccably cleaned. The furnishings and amenities are up to date, the beds comfortable and did I say CLEAN? Spotless is more like it. You can't go wrong staying here and you won't be disappointed.

Not easy to find near Wall Street and the South Street Seaport..Lots of construction in the area...but very quiet inside. Friendly efficient staff...lots of value packed into a small space. No rooms with views but very comfortable...good idea to ask for an upgrade if available. Parking in garage directly across the very narrow street but almost no traffic. Enjoyed our 2 night stay. Uber will find you if you if you need transportation.

I love the location of this hotel in lower Manhattan. It is in walking distance to many areas such as the Seaport, Wall Street, the Piers and many great restaurants. It's only about a 10-15 minute walk to the Trade center area as well. The staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful. There is a restaurant in the hotel that was wonderful and the waiter we had was awesome! The room is very comfortable and we had no issues with cleanliness. The only minor snafu we had was with room service not getting the order right, but is was no big deal and they quickly sent up a person to correct it.

My boyfriend and I stayed here for 3 nights during our trip to NYC. This hotel is awesome: the staff is very friendly, the rooms are clean and spacious, and there are lots of great places to eat nearby.

I really did not like my trip to NYC and got really really sick due to the air quality. However, I loved my room, the hotel and the staff. Everything was perfect! Such a wonderful gem! Everything was extremely clean and the staff was soo soo nice! You can look at as many pictures as you want, but none of them will give justice. Really got the wow factor! And location is so convenient right by Fulton st which has subways to pretty much anywhere in the city

Stayed here before, and recommended it (on Trip Advisor). Unfortunately, my second stay wasn't as good.Yes, the rooms are large with high ceilings, and have very nice fittings. It's the service that seems to have dropped.I noticed over my six day stay that I was treated a lot differently if I was dressed up, or down. If I was dressed in casual clothes (to do siteseeing in the heat), I wasn't acknowledged in the lobby - or had the door held open. However when I was dressed up, the staff were all smiles and "hello's".There were some problems with the elevators during my stay - the card readers weren't working. The staff seemed clueless as to how to deal with the problem, and guests had to tell them what to do (i.e. send the elevator away from the lobby, and then put it out of service, so that the other elevator would accept calls to the lobby).A few other problems - my room AC wasn't working on the last evening, which made the room uncomfortably hot. Also, when I checked in I noticed that the pack of M&M's on the mini bar had been torn open (perhaps by the previous guest?). Nevertheless, they weren't replaced during my stay, and my credit card was charged $4.50 after I left (I'm guessing for this item).I'd like to say I'd enjoyed my second stay as much as the first, but that wasn't the case. The hard product hasn't changed much - but the soft product (service) has slipped. NYC has a large range of choice for hotels, so I'll be staying elsewhere when I next visit.

We love this hotel and we look forward to returning year after year. Service is outstanding! The hotel is small, lovely and well located. We can't imagine a better experience all around. Absolutely wonderful hotel!
