Everytime I go to New York on business I stay here. I love this hotel. It is so quaint and cozy. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The bar and restaurant are wonderful. I would recommend this place any time to anyone traveling.

This is a very nice hotel downtown near Wall Street but the decor and furnishing are definitely on the masculine side. It is also dark, as in romantic lighting, but I think it is supposed to be a Wall Street guy's idea of romantic. As a matter of fact, as soon as I walked into the lobby I wondered how many office affairs went on there during the day. My "view" was the side of an office building (8th Floor) but the decor was designed around that drawback, with a vaulted ceiling offering a sense of space. It really is well designed and the furnishings nice. Beds and linens and bath terrific, very quiet. I stayed 3 nights. I have to tell you, though, when I saw a "Thompson Toys" package on the bar I was a little floored (and laughed out loud). In this kit, it said, there was a condom, a vibrator and scarfs for bondage. "Oh THAT is what those brass rings are in the headboard!" I thought. Restaurant was great. Staff extremely attentive. Very nice stay but I would not bring the kids here.

The room was quite lovely. Large and with cool furniture and a comfortable bed. The restaurant was excellent - had a terrific dinner and breakfast there. But the lasting memory that I have of this hotel will be the 20+ bug bites that I woke up with after my second night there. I spoke to the reception and asked to be moved to a new room because I believed that there were bedbugs in my room. They told me that if there was a risk of bedbugs they were unable to move me but were willing to let me out of my last nights stay. So I moved to another hotel.The next day they tested the room and claimed that they found no bedbugs but did find a mosquito. As a result they would not refund my stay. I can't believe that a mosquito (which I never saw or heard) can leave you with 20+ bites, many in the straight lines characteristic of bed bugs (see photos attached). We had some back and forth and they eventually agreed to refund one of the two nights that I stayed there. I was not happy with this outcome.

Quaint Lobby, friendly and attentive staff, cozy bar with delicious food, spacious room with lovely high ceilings, comfortable bed, cool room on a VERY hot weekend, clean and decorated with a handsome charm. Would recommend and stay again!

We've been to NYC many times. This was first time we stayed in the financial district. Staff very helpful. Rooms very nice. Very clean. They gave us a fruit basket and cookies for our room upon arrival. Restaurant in hotel was good. We enjoyed our stay.

Had an overnight stay. Very nice quiet room (yeah, QUIETNESS is a rarity in NYC). Quite spacious for NYC real estate @ a very affordable price. A little bit hard to find because of the dark signage. Coffee and bar are in the Felecity restaurant in the lobby. These are the reasons for 4 instead of 5: creepy and narrow hallways service was so so-nothing spectacular.

Gild Hall is GREAT! The staff is very pleasant and helpful. The rooms are nice. Gild Hall is located in a very quiet easy to get to neighborhood. The only negative is that it is a bit hard to find the first time. After getting there the first time, you will know where you are and this won't be a problem anymore.

We enjoyed our trip to Manhattan. The Gild Hall was the perfect location for our visit. We booked knowing the Gild would be nice but it exceeded our expectations! Only one issue - it took 20 minutes for hot water to reach the 14th floor early in the morning - we are early risers and that delayed us. The parking next door was reasonable.

Our 3 night stay here was fantastic. From the moment we arrived we knew our stay here would be fantastic. It's in the financial district so was impressed with the business feel of the place but also that you could easily relax here. The rooms were luxurious, the food was fantastic, the staff were just faultless. In particular Max and Andy from the front desk and James from the bar. Both Max and Andy were very professional and extremely helpful and went out of their way to be as helpful and friendly as possible, they were the first two people we interacted with in the hotel and definitely made us feel welcome. James from the bar was great and the cocktails were amazing. I really wish we didn't have to leave but understand we couldn't stay there forever. Well done everyone, you're doing an amazing job.

I LOVED Gild Hall!!!! Will definitely be staying here again! Boutique hotel with extremely chic and high end rooms and spaces. I was extremely impressed! Hotel is HOPPING! Great location in he Financial District- 15 min walk to Battery Park. Lots of dining options nearby, but don't discount the hotel restaurant, Felice! It's great! Staff were friendly and welcoming. Dogs are allowed at no fee. Valet parking available for $65. Great snacks and unique mini bar items. Loved!The only thing that surprised me was the quality of the bathroom linens. My towels were ratty, which was disappointing, but didn't take away from the experience as a whole.

Arrived at Gild hall for a 4th of July getaway and immediately were impressed with the lobby, staff, and ambiance of the hotel. Shout out to Rob at the front desk for making us feel welcome while checking us in, and giving us some recommendations for places to eat nearby. The room was wonderful, especially the giant comfortable and clean bed. The staff is on top of stuff at this hotel as every day our room was refreshed for when we got back. On top of it all, the location couldn't have been more perfect for our sightseeing plans. Lots to see within walking distance, and very nice transit hubs close by took us anywhere we wanted to see each day (especially easy to get into Brooklyn). Would stay here again!

This little hidden "Gem" is just that!! The customer service we have received here is absolutely fabulous! From the moment we checked in a very warm welcoming staff! I must say David the Manager is a very customer service oriented individual. He takes great pride in offering the best service, funny sense of humor and just so pleasant. I needed some extra help with baggage and a few other items and he made certain that was available to us! That brings my next favorite person into the picture John The Bell Person! He is a delightful young man and so very helpful, he knew I had made an incorrect turn and came running after me to help me out! Seriously I just thought this never occurred in NYC. So I must say New Yorkers are friendlier than you think, they take pride in what they do especially to make an out of towner feel welcomed! Let's not forget Sydney she is the beautiful smile at the front desk! Thank you for such an amazing visit! Can't wait to come back!!

Everything was perfect from check-in to check-out. Visited for a quick July 4th overnight and it couldn't have been better. Decor is a cross between British hunting lodge and Aspen resort! Room was comfortable, staff friendly and my requests honored. Definitely will return!

This hotel has recently been updated and is well designed and incredibly comfortable. I travel for work and really appreciate how genuine and helpful the team is here. The team is on the ball and provides excellent, proactive and friendly service. The cafe/bar provides a casual atmosphere for solo dining or casual meet-ups with friends.

Gild Hall was perfect. Location, rooms, staff were all exemplary. From the moment we walked into the hotel the staff couldn't do enough for us from guiding around the city, ordering cabs to printing off vouchers for our return shuttle back to JFK. Pay them a visit you won't be disappointed. We'll definitely return

We stayed one night before an onward journey from Newark.It has a good central location for Wall Street, Ground Zero memorial.There is wifi and the rooms are nice size and perfect for short breaks.South street seaport is very close with some good restaurants.

Checked in thursday afternoon, early, and were accommodated right away. The room was just perfect. 12th floor, no view except of neighboring buildings, but didn't matter at all. The windows open for actual fresh (by NYC standards) air which was lovely in addition to excellent A/C. Clean and well laid out room (not cramped) with a stellar king bed, and excellent pillows and bedding. Some have said the frosted bathroom door was an issue, but I'm not sure how that could be anything but simply a cool feature. There is a curtain that pulls across so if someone is sleeping, you can pull the curtain across as you are going into the bathroom. So easy and brilliant. All finishes and furniture were classics and in perfect repair, and the huge smart TV was sweet to watch after a long day of touring the city. We requested a Keurig beforehand, and they provided pods as well. Piece of cake. If you check in fri/sat/sun there is Prosecco chilling at the front desk. Staff are young and keen and extremely helpful. We didn't eat at the hotel, but the bar had a beautiful, cozy and convivial atmosphere. Fulton St. Subway is a 4 min walk, and many amenities right beside/nearby. We often stopped into Jubilee market a block over for some fruit or bagels etc...All in all, a really special place, that had welcoming staff, quiet rooms and although downtown (so not central to Manhattan), every event/location we went to was basically on 1 subway line (ie, Yankee stadium/ Times Square etc)...so very little need to transfer and completely worth travelling the extra 5 mins downtown to come "home" to the hotel. It is our go-to from this point on, hands down. After spending 5 nights there, we're certain about this.

This hotel is located right in the middle of the financial district near the Federal Reserve. This trip, myself, wife and two daughters were spending a long weekend in NYC for my daughters birthday. We arrived at JFK and took a limo to Manhattan. Upon turning down Platt st, you notice that the road in narrow and dark. Ahead on the right are the flags in front of the hotel. Now we hadn't been to NYC in quite a while so initially, we were nervous. We couldn't have been more wrong. A gentleman greeted us at the door and helped us with our bags. The check in process was great and the two gentleman behind the counter were polite, receptive and courteous. Upon getting to our room, we noticed that there was no crib and roll away bed for my kids. We placed our bags down and headed back out to find food. Upon returning to the lobby, the gentleman we checked in with greeted me by my last name (very professional and great attention to detail in my opinion). We spoke to them about the crib and roll away. They told us that the room we were in was to small to accommodate that so they moved us to a king deluxe room at no charge and provided us with the beds needed. This was just the groundwork of how amazing their customer service is. I say that in the present tense because I believe this is how they treat all of their guest. Upon returning back from dinner, we received our new room keys and proceeded to the new room where we were greeted by all our bags, fresh fruit and a bottle of wine. The room was beautifully decorated with at least 16 foot ceilings. The bathroom was very well lit and the shower had water pressure that could literally strip the rust off the hull of a ship (HUGE PLUS in my book). Prior to arriving, I spoke to the manager via Email regarding our upcoming trip and explained how this was for my daughters birthday. On Sunday (her actual birthday) we arrived back at the hotel and on the table we found more fresh fruit and a box addressed to my daughter. They had given her a box of amazing cookies as a small gift. Another thing I noticed is the first night, I went to the restaurant in the lobby area for a drink. Upon exiting the elevator, a new worker had greeted me once again by my last name. This attention to detail and professionalism is amazing. One last thing for this review. This hotel was absolutely affordable. We did search all the sites to find this place, but the affordability coupled with the outstanding service and stay makes this 5 stars!
user_name:
Tim M
New Ipswich, New Hampshire

review_body: This cozy hidden gem continues to be my favorite NYC go to location. The staff always goes above and beyond to make sure each customer has a great experience from the check-in to departure. The newly renovated rooms are very cozy. Bottom line, you can't go wrong, great value in NYC! Looking forward to my next stay already

We where so thrilled and relived to arrive at Guild Hall. As we arrived with our suitcases the outside of the building was very modern and clean, someone held the door open for us and helped us with our bags and check in was quick and easy. We found all the staff very friendly, always willing to chat and help you. Our room was beautiful, massive bed and massive television and very clean. The hotel is in great location, at the centre of the financial district, 2 minute walk to Fulton Street subway station and very close to many nice restaurants and bars (Starbucks across the road) Overall we had a lovely time and were very impressed

We just returned from a 3 night stay at this hotel and was thoroughly impressed. The location was not where we usually stay but were very impressed with the location with lots to see around the area: Brooklyn bridge, South Seaport, World Trade Center, New York Stock Exchange and one of my favourite stores, Century 21. The Fulton subway station was also very close and we never had trouble getting a cab (though not directly out front of the hotel) but a minute walk away. The area was really quiet on the weekend which was perfect for us and during the week was quite busy but went back to quiet at night. We ended up really enjoying the location.The hotel itself was nice - the rooms were a bit dark but I don't think you can really expect a room with a view in NYC. We stayed in the King Deluxe room and were happy with the size. Plenty of closet space, the bathroom was a good size and the bed was very comfy. The decor in the room was great as well. It's also great to have wifi included as we usually pay about $20 for wifi a day at other hotels. We were really only in our room to sleep but were happy with it.The only compliant about the hotel is that I saw on instagram that the hotel has bikes that they lend out, however when we were there the bikes were out for repair. That was a bit disappointing but not a huge issue.

I've stayed here before and this second stay just reaffirmed the experience I expected. Modern boutique hotel that provides value for money in a centrally located area of the financial district. I recommend this property and look forward to staying there again.

This stylish, cozy hotel is in a great downtown location. The room was a bit dark- no sunlight- but otherwise comfortable and quiet. The hairdryer and a replacement broke by just trying to switch the button on. There were often room servicetrays in the halls which never looks good. Otherwise no complaints and we would return.

This hotel is very convenient if you're in the financial district for work or sightseeing. Very clean. Comfortable bed. Lovely shower and bath. Bar and restaurant both terrific. Service top notch. Highly recommend.

The staff was fantastic, friendly, and attentive. The rooms were very comfortable and well appointed. We stayed here while visiting NYC for 5 days. The room was great. Especially the bed. Great AC to cool off after a log day. Thanks Gild Hall staff!!

After reading several reviews about this hotel, we decided to stay here for our weekend in NYC.We arrived late around 11pm, which was no problem. Parking was immediately taken care of for $60 a day, which is fairly normal for Manhattan.The check in was quick and the receptionists very friendly.Having booked a superior room with king sized beds, it was very roomy. The bed is comfortable and we had a good nights sleep. What We also liked a lot was the unusual but amazing minibar! Although we didnt consume anything from it, it was a very innovative and nice gadget.Unfortunately, the bathroom was not as clean as i would expect for $215 a night. The glass tiles next to the sink had visible water stains from the guest before and even a few spots that looked like toothpaste stains.When i unrolled the shower math, a big lump of dirt fell out. Appearently someone hadnt used or cleaned it in a while. The toilet was clean and the shower itself too.At first i was worried the hotel would be too far off from the main sights of the city, but it was perfectly located. We started aroud noon and reached the times square, empire state building, central station, wall street etc, all by walking.Our highlight in the hotel was definitely the roomservice we used for breakfast one morning. The food was very delicious and was served fast.Again, I want to point out the wonderful staff this hotel employs, so helpful and dalways a smile on their lips. Thank you!

Comfortable room with good beds and linen. Nicely located close to subway. Staff very nice and cleaning exellent. No noice and we slept very well. We would not hesitate to book again. I can recommend this hotel.

My wife, 10 mo. old daughter and I stayed here.This place is great! The weekend rates were the best that I could find. Don't let that fool you though. This place is top-notch. The rooms are as advertised and the staff is very friendly and professional. The location was good enough if you will use the subway to get around. The statue of liberty, one world trade center, wall street and brooklyn bridge are all within walking distance.

We booked a block of rooms for our recent wedding in lower Manhattan at Gild Hall and it was the best decision! The hotel was very accommodating with early check-in and the front desk staff and our sales coordinator could not have been nicer. We and all of our guests were very pleased with our rooms and the service at the hotel. We also had a morning after brunch at the on-site restaurant which was excellent!
user_name:
kobesmommy
New York City, New York

review_body: I flew to New York for the Jazz Age Lawn Party (a must go!) on Governor's Island and wanted a hotel that was near the ferry station and reasonably priced. The Gild Hall met all my requirements and then some!So what were my requirements:1. Not a Holiday Inn/Days Inn/Motel 8, etc. Those hotels are great when you are on roadtrips but not when you're in a city like NYC. And I accept that may sound snobbish, but unless you are a frequent traveler to NYC, why not treat yourself with something different?2. Walking distance to subways. This hotel is about three blocks away from the Fulton stop which has four or five different subway lines...including the A line which dumps you at JFK. 3. Food options. I am vegan and there is a great vegan local fast food spot on Maiden Lane (Terri's). Next to Terri's was a Chipotle, Dunkin Donuts, Salad Shop, Sandwich shop, Mexican Restaurant, 2 Irish bars/restaurants, an Italian restaurant (not including Felice's which is housed in the hotel) Starbucks, etc.. Maiden Lane is a block south. 4. Price. New York is tricky and I knew I would be spending more if I wanted to meet requirement 1. I got an amazing deal on Gild Hall's website and when the price dropped, they offered the price drop. If that isn't service! Not too many requirements, right?So, I met my girlfriend at Gild Hall and loved the decor. A bit masculine but in a nice way with book lined shelves, leather chairs, an antler chandelier. The staff was incredibly friendly and check in was a breeze. They actually let you check in the day before online, with any preferences you may want. So the (my) perfect room was waiting for me. The room was large and well planned out. There was a built-in book case, small closet, built in mini/bar fridge. Massive bed and chair, high ceilings and really looks just like the pictures. The bathroom was well lit and clean. My view was of the building across the street, but I wasn't staying there for a fantastic view. Only downside, my TV seemed to be on the fritz, it took ages to change the channel and then it would start going on its own. Since I turned the TV on once, while getting ready, it wasn't a deal breaker for me. Felice's bar and restaurant which is next to the lobby was a wonderful place for a drink and snack. They close at midnight, but the library bar upstairs is open to 3. This was helpful as I didn't get in until almost 11 pm and NYC is the city that never sleeps, right?The staff was friendly, knowledgeable and overall wonderful. Everyone there would say hello and with a smile, ask if we needed anything, it was wonderful. Overall, I was incredibly impressed and they deserve the reviews they receive.

I chose to book Gild Hall for two reasons, the first being it's superb reviews on TripAdvisor and the second being both my partner and I didn't want to stay in Midtown with all of it's hustle and bustle. This was 100% the right decision! The hotel is situated on a very quiet street which was perfect for us, as after our action packed days we needed to get our heads down to catch up on some much needed sleep (I had requested a high room which they granted - the room was on the top floor). One other point which is very important, the hotel is located just a few minutes walk from Fulton Street station which has many different connections to the different boroughs in New York, plus a direct train to Howard Beach and Jamaica station's which means you can then catch the Airtrain directly to JFK which both my partner and I did - all in all it's approximately an hour from airport to hotel. On to the room now, the room had all the amenities that we needed (hairdryer, iron, mini fridge etc) and a huge, comfortable queen size bed! The only issue with the mini bar, is that the items were incredibly pricey for what they were - but there are numerous supermarkets close by where you can get juices, waters etc at a fraction of the price. However, the best part of the hotel without a doubt is the service/staff who worked there. When we arrived, we were asked how our journey was and then were walked over to the bar and given a welcome drink. Every morning the staff took the time and effort to ask what we were doing during the day (and had a genuine interest, weren't just making small talk). If we needed any advice, such as what trains to catch or places to eat the staff would take the time and effort to assist you. Before we even left for our holiday, I had emailed the manager of the hotel and told him I was intending to purpose to my fiancee (she said yes), where he made a note on the system and said speak with one of the team when you know the day and we will sort something out. So, I spoke with the team on the morning of the proposal and gave them a rough time when we would be returning and returned to a complimentary bottle of Prosecco, a trio of deserts (which they had gone out and purchased from the bakery from down the road) and had put some rose petals out over the floor in a heart shape to welcome us back. Brilliant effort! All in all, a brilliant hotel in fantastic location which is substantially quieter from anywhere in Midtown at a very competitive price. What more could you ask for? thank you for putting the finishing touches on a magical stay in the Big Apple!Lloyd and Kelly

Gild Hall was truly a blessing - a nice hotel that was not too pricey for NY standards, but still offers a clean, comfortable, and stylish experience. Obviously wonderful for business given that the hotel's situated near Wall Street, the location was also good tourists, especially those who may want a quiet night of sleep during weekend visits without sacrificing too much for convenience (just a few minutes' walk to Fulton).Special mentions need to go to the staff. I was actually there for a professional examination. Upon mentioning that when I arrived, I received an envelope under the door the next morning with a "Good Luck" note and a Starbucks gift card - a touching sentiment especially when travelling alone. Housekeeping was also very prompt with changing out and replacing amenities. On a related note, the bed was one of the most comfortable I have slept in among all hotels I've stayed in. You can imagine how welcoming a feeling that was after a 20-hour trip.The only minor shortcoming was the fire alarm - it blared several times the second day I was there for testing, the first one being very early in the morning. Thankfully I was jet lagged and awake by then, but I can imagine that causing quite a scare with the rest of the residents.Overall a fantastic experience. Will definitely consider staying there again whenever I pay NY a visit next.

We called up and got a better rate than online. The woman was so friendly. When we checked in they gave us water and were able to upgrade our room. The service was terrific, the people were sincere. When we were leaving we said to each other, "this is our new place". It's nice to find good, clean, small places with ambiance.

I booked this hotel at the last minute while I was in the US and really enjoyed my stay. The hotel has a great atmosphere (very stylish) and the location was perfect for me downtown where I was working. The rooms aren't huge but they were all I needed. Easy for Battersea Park area and the river and also for metro trains to mid town for evenings or the weekend. The staff were friendly and helpful and the cost was very good for New York. I have no negative comments about the hotel.

Very happy with the Gild Hall experience. The staff are friendly and helpful and the room was very comfortable. The location was perfect for us; financial district close to shopping and restaurants and subway.

We almost missed it. This hotel is tucked away on a side street away from all the hustle and noise of the financial district but only a short walk to great eateries, shops, and points of interest. The room was very clean and the bed incredibly comfortable. Staff extremely friendly and helpful.The restaurant is very good. We stayed in one night just to take advantage of the menu and the upbeat atmosphere. We will return.

Our family is still talking about the exceptional experience we had at Gild Hall last week. The staff did many things to accommodate our infant baby and the rest of our party for several days. We were made to feel like part of the Gild Hall family. The room was extremely comfortable, clean and quiet; in fact, the staff was most accommodating in terms of cleaning around the baby’s sleeping schedule which was greatly appreciated.All of the members of your staff, as well as the wait staff at Felice, made certain that every detail of our stay was carefully attended to. We would especially like to thank Jon, Andy and Robert for your assistance at Reception and James, Carlos, and others at Felice for their kindness during our meals.We very much hope we have another opportunity to spend time at Gild Hall in the future.

Upon arrival to Gild Hall, we checked into the hotel by a very engaging and friendly staff member. The hotel was decorated very nicely and we really loved the spaciousness of our room. The see through bathroom door was a bit odd, and we didn't notice the curtain until the last day, unfortunately!On the second day of our stay, we went out to explore the city very early in the day and only returned to the hotel close to midnight. We were not informed upon check-in the first day, that the water would be TURNED OFF from 11 pm to 7 am on our second day of stay at the hotel. We were not given notice at all regarding this loss of water, so we could not prepare for the day accordingly. Upon calling reception and learning of this water outage, we were disappointed that we were not initially informed and the response of the hotel. Upon learning of this water outage, my husband went downstairs to talk to reception and was told that if I wanted to take a shower, I would have to go downstairs to get a key to the 2nd/3rd floor as those floors still had water. When being escorted to the 2nd floor, the staff member was half-halfheartedly apologizing for the inconvenience and when I was responding, I was told to stop talking as guests were sleeping, which I found to be pretty condescending. I took a shower and returned the key. I then called reception again as we had to use the restroom and we had no water to flush the toilet. i was told that the 2nd and 3rd floor would have water all night so they allowed me to keep the key for a suite on the 2nd floor in order to go to the restroom. Turns out, the water stopped working on these two floors as well! We were told twice that we would get a discount on our stay at the hotel due to our inconvenience and the hotel forgetting to inform us of this water outage, however, they did not follow up with us regarding this matter at all during our stay, or upon check-out. Instead, we were given a box of baked goods from Felice and a note from the manager saying he was sorry. If we were initially told that we were going to get a discount on having no water for the night, then I really don't think the hotel should have substituted this discount with a couple of baked treats. For the rest of our stay, the staff were cold to us and did not speak to us. I've never experienced this at a hotel before. If they had notified us about the water outage in the first place, then we wouldn't have been so outraged. We paid good money for the hotel and wanted to enjoy our vacation, and shouldn't have had to worry about lack of water in the hotel. If the hotel was nicer in their response, then I could have let it go, but at this point in time, even though the hotel was comfortable and in a convenient location, I don't think I could ever return.

We experienced friendly and gracious service from the staff. After mentioning it was our 35th anniversary we were welcomed with a bottle of wine delivered to our room, which we enjoyed. The hotel is small to medium in scale, so there are no sky scraper rooms with a big view. The rooms are comfortable with a muted feel, with dark woodwork and blends of medium browns, saddle brown leather bed headboard, and white, gray wall tiles and brown marble floor worked into the décor. This gives the room a modern, masculine look. The location probably bustles during the week when the financial district is in full swing. On a holiday weekend it was relatively quiet around the hotel with only a few restaurants to walk to. The subway was a short walk away, so our theater and museum trips were easy to start and finish. The One World Trade Tower and memorial fountains were an easy walk.

This is an odd hotel. Very good service and pretty characterful, if a little gloomy. But the noise!! It's directly opposite a vast underground car garage extractor fan that blasts out sound waves 24/7. The feeble double glazing in the windows does nothing to stop this sound assault. My advice - get a room at least on the 6th floor idle higher. My wife also had the ice machine in the corridor to contend with - what is it with you Americans and ice that you would put a machine that sounds like an industrial meat grinder outside the door of a hotel bedroom. Hotels are designed as places to SLEEP not consume ice!! If you aren't sensitive to noise (or you are stone dead) this place is fine. Centrally located, reasonable size rooms, good showers, nice breakfast (if pricey) and comfortable beds. No curtains only blinds and no tea or coffee in the room. But her is an iron and ironing board. It's reasonable value if you don't mind the gloominess. And by the way, South Street Seaport is closed for redevelopment so don't book here to visit there.

I stayed in a two queen room for 3 nights at the Gild Hall (05/29/16-06/01/16). As soon as I stepped in, I was greeted by the hotel staff with a nice smile which is always a great start. The check-in process went very smooth. The hotel also sent us a nice bottle of mineral water with a note welcoming us which was very thoughtful. Although the room is not very large, we had a comfortable stay. We had some problems with the thermostat in our room which the engineer quickly fixed for us. Unfortunately, the thermostat didn't work again when we got back to the room at 3am. It was a hot and humid day (05/29) so we really needed the A/C. We called the front desk and Anthony (Vasquez?) picked up and immediately helped us with our issues. He handled the situation very well and made sure we had a room to sleep in comfortably with a running A/C (thank goodness!). Considering the late hour, we were given access to a different room with the option to move all our items the following day or remain in the original room which we later decided to move. Thanks to Anthony and all other hotel staff members, we had a very comfortable stay. Thank you!

My wife and I stayed seven days at Gild Hall in order for her to have medical procedures nearby. Gild Hall is located in downtown New York City, near Wall Street and the World Trade Center memorial but far from most tourist attractions, such as Broadway, museums, etc. It is also near the Seaport area. Per other reviews, Gild Hall was recently completely renovated from its former life as a Holiday Inn. Pluses:1. Responsive, courteous front desk staff and housekeeping dept.;2. Excellent breakfasts at Felice, the restaurant in the hotel. We did not eat lunch or dinner there since the menu is limited to Italian food and the prices are fairly high, although not out of line for New York City;3 If you like decorator design rooms, you get them here;4. Bathrooms are modern with in-tub showers with plenty of hot water and good pressure;5. Free New York Times and Wall Street Journals available at Front Desk;6. In the same block are same day dry cleaning and laundry, a convenience store for magazines, candy, and soft drinks; and Starbucks, as well as a Blue Cup coffee store.A short distance away is a Duane Reed by Walgreens Drug Store and a small Gristede's grocery store, as well as some other informal restaurants & fast food, including Zeytuna, which has a sort of food court. Also some ATMs, a hardware store, etc.7. Large screen TV in room but no channel guide information on the cable system and missing premium channels, like HBO.8. Comfortable beds;9. Effective and quiet air conditioning;10. We did not hear any noise coming from other rooms and although we were opposite the elevators, we heard no noise from them.11. A good happy hour in the bar upstairs from the lobby - we did not attend.Minuses:1. No store in hotel so one must go out to buy soft drinks, water, etc.2. The designers of the rooms did not think it necessary to include an alarm clock or dressers to put your clothes in. 3. All rooms have only three feet of closet space, not enough to hang up clothes for a couple. Only the more expensive rooms add about three feet of open shelving. We had the hotel set up a small clothes rack in the room and it helped a lot.4. The bathroom has some glass shelves for your bathroom (shaving, makeup, etc.) items but the sinks do not have counter space surrounding them. You need instructions to work the in-tub showers, one handle is for temperature only and one is for volume of water.5. Many rooms have no view other than the office building next to the hotel.6. $9 bottle of water in the room and no water is sold in the hotel - so go to the convenience store near the hotel and buy water at normal prices. 7. One taxi from Midtown could not find the hotel (this driver did not know how to use his GPS) - suggest you ask to driver to go to Gold Street in Downtown (not the Gold Street in Brooklyn) rather than giving the name of the hotel or street address.;8. A business center where you have to pay for over 5 minutes of computer use, although you can print your boarding pass for free;9. So - so wi-fi- free but it doesn't always work and if you want to stream video you need to pay for premium wi-fi 10. Like many hotels, only two elevators, so on the one day that one was out of service, long waits for the elevator. in a good location for businesWall Street area (called fidi - financial district) or if you especially want to be near the Seaport area. It is not in a good location for most tourist activities, such as Broadway theaters, museums, and high end shopping.Pluses:1. Excellent breakfasts at Felice, the restaurant in the hotel. 2, Very good service from the front desk staff and from housekeeping. 3. Free New York Times and Wall Street Journal daily at the front desk.4. Attractive modern guest rooms;5, Bathrooms where the shower has good water pressure and plenty of hot water;

My boyfriend and I stayed at Gild Hall this past Memorial Day weekend. He's from NY and I'm from Jersey, but this hotel still felt like an escape for us! Although the hotel can be a little tricky to find, it is in a great location if you're looking to stay in the financial district or by the seaport. South Street, Wall Street, and One World Trade Center are all nearby on foot. Gild Hall is elegant and very clean. The beds were comfy and there was a nice minibar in the room if that's important to you. There are many pubs and restaurants around the area. The lobby is beautiful and definitely different from anywhere in NY where I've stayed. Max helped us check in and he was absolutely wonderful. He wound up upgrading our room which turned out to be perfect since we got engaged that night! Thank you again, Max! This hotel will always hold a special place in our heart. We had drinks at the bar and while they were priced at the usual NY rate (high), they were delicious! We would love to come back soon.

My husband and I had a great stay at this charming and very affordable hotel, which has a quirky but comfortable "Adirondacks lodge" vibe and furnishings—rather unusual for Wall St. business travel, but perfect for a weekend getaway. Our king room was larger than those at most of New York's boutique-type hotels, with a very comfortable bed, large bathroom and more than adequate storage. (Also very quiet, despite our location across from an elevator.) We didn't dine at Felice, the hotel's Italian restaurant, but from the wonderful gift selection of cookies delivered to our door we suspect the menu is first-rate. Check in/out was very smooth with helpful staff, who also welcomed our dog (a border collie mix) at no extra charge. Overall, very pleasant accommodations, and we would definitely consider staying at Gild Hall again.

Enjoyed our stay. Very friendly and amenable staff. Slight problem with a blocked toilet but that was rectified immediately. Our room was for 4 of us (my wife and our 2 children) but was a bit too "snug" and not as spacious as other hotels we stayed at in the other cities we visited on this trip.Hotel location pretty good for most south Manhattan points of interest.Bar staff very very friendly and helpful. Special thanks to Max on the front desk for the help he gave regarding problems we were having trying to check in online for our return flight. He stayed beyond his shift end in order to rectify for us - thank you very much.

We stayed there due to its proximity to the finish line of the New York City Half Marathon. I thought the rooms were outstanding - high ceilings, great beds, great bathrooms, and that rarest commodity in NYC hotels - SPACE. Plenty of room to spread out. Great bathroom amenities, lovely room accents, tremendously friendly staff. The downtown location was a little quiet for a weekend, but perfect for our needs. Very reasonably priced and a very positive experience.

Great boutique hotel in the Wall Street area. It has a cool vibe and is definitely more a masculine hotel with the decor and color scheme but nicely done and well appointed. The bedding in my room featured a soft, comfortable duvet and the pillows may be the best I have had for a hotel stay; they are a nice large size and so comfortable. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful. They also have a small bar area with lots of great choices for cocktails and food. Thank you to the staff who acknowledged my husbands birthday by leaving us a complimentary bottle of champagne in our room. Would definitely return for another stay.

I really like this place mostly because the staff was so wonderful. They were incredibly friendly, gave great recommendations, and greeted me with a smile at each arrival and departure. We were also lucky enough to get a room upgrade when they had learned that I was celebrating a special occasion. Just those little acts of hospitality, truly left an impression with me.Only con I can recall was the lack of privacy with the sheer bathroom door as the toilet was right next to it. P I was aware about this beforehand, but slightly still uncomfortable. And water temperature from the shower was a tad inconsistent at times.Still can't say enough great things about the service though, so I will surely return.
user_name:
CharmieC
New York City, New York

review_body: The hotel is located in a great part of the Financial District. Arrived late on a Saturday night and found the staff to be very helpful and provided great service, the rooms were very comfortable, no tea making facilities though. Would recommend for the business traveller.

Love this hotel (for some reason I'm addicted to the smell of the rooms). It's in a great location if you're in NYC for business. The shower products are awesome (wanting to buy some separately) and the service is as you would expect in America - first class. The rooms are nice and modern - it's just a good service all around.

We had a family party to attend and this hotel was in a good location to family and the party venue. I found the hotel to be comfortable and welcoming. The staff were top notch and very helpful. The room was clean and while small, it worked fine for us. They are pet friendly and we brought our cat, she enjoyed it too. We will definitely stay at Gild Hall again. I find that my trips to New York take me out of the hotel more than in it and this room was great and I liked the frosted glass bathroom, there was a curtain if you want more privacy.

Gild Hall is a gem in New York's financial district. The hotel exudes old world charm and the staff are very welcoming, thoughtful, and attentive. I arrived exhausted from long travels and was treated with such kindness despite the hotel being completely full and the staff quite busy. They did everything they could to make me feel comfortable. And the attached bar/restaurant are equally wonderful with fantastic menu choices. I hope to find a way to return soon!

Cute & comfortable boutique hotel at FiDi. The staff was very welcoming (not like your average Newyorker) and provided helpful information of places to go, eat, drink and just enjoy the city. Even though its all the way downtown it is still very well located since you have plenty of subway stations close-by. The neighbourhood is very up-and-coming. Definitely recommendable.

My girlfriend and I stayed at the hotel May14th to the 16th (2 nights) and loved it. The decor is really cool and the room was very clean and spacious. Service was excellent as well. We were able to check in early and when checking out, we didnt have to ask if we could leave our luggage while we were out before our flight, they just offered. Also have bar and small restaurant. we only had breakfast there but again great service as we were rushing a bit that day and when we mentioned this to the hostess, it took literally not even 10 minutes to get our stuff. The area was 5-7 minutes from the subway and on a weekend, it was nice and quiet being in the financial district. Highly recommend this hotel. We would book it again for sure.

Quite good beds, small room. No view at all. Stupid glass (!) door to bathroom, little privacy. Very nice people in reception. Expensive. Would rather spend money on something else next time in New York.

Overall a good experience but this is not a premium hotel. Small hotel in an excellent location for sightseeing and for business (seaport next door is a hidden gem for good food).Reception staff are very welcoming. Corridors between rooms are red and have a slight brothel feel. Bedrooms are small (including the King Premium) but as we only slept there it is not too much of an issue for a few days. Tiny but serviceable bathroom is situated inside the bedroom with an opaque wall and curtain for privacy (not the best!). Gigantic tv. Breakfast was included in the stay. It is tasty but very small with only 2 options- a small bowl of fruit and 1 slice of toast or a cooked breakfast. This needs improving if this is going to be a boutique.Gym is laughable. Literally a cupboard with one treadmill and one x trainer in front of each other and 5 dumbells. No space for more than one person.So overall we enjoyed our trip and decent value but certainly not high-end boutique and hotel website photos taken have been done very carefully!

I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights while in NYC on business. It is a decent hotel located near the Federal Courthouse and in the financial district. Plenty of good reasonably priced restaurants nearby and the staff was always warm and friendly. The price was also decent considering it is New York and the room size and bathroom size were good. I had a room on the 10th floor right by the elevator. To be fair they asked if I wanted a room higher up or away from the elevator and I choose poorly. The elevator rattles all day and all night so it wasn't just the dingy from people on my floor getting on and off. However, the excessively loud air conditioner did an adequate job of drowning out the elevator noise and sort of sounded like a white noise machine (only louder) at night. The room was stylish as was the bathroom where the shower had excellent water pressure. There was no top sheet on my bed and I am not sure if this is standard or just happened. Hope they change the duvet cover after each guest. The room was very clean so I wasn't concerned. The Wifi worked well. There wasn't a coffee maker in the room which would have been nice. I ordered room service one night and it came quickly and was tasty. Overall I would recommend this hotel. It is not as nice as some I have stayed in while in NY but it was a solid choice and met my primary criteria of safe, clean, well located and a boutique hotel.

Converted hotel - (old Holiday Inn) that upgraded everything - modern - sleek - and contemporary.Not the best views - but close to all major attractions downtown - and close to many subway lines.Classy entrance lobby and bar. Former location of Bobby Flay restaurant - (closed) - decent Italian restaurant there now

I have stayed at Gil Hall several times but this has really gone down hill. Overall the room was just dirty. The bathroom was disgusting. In the shower I had water above my ankles - gross. Shower curtain dirty. Glass door to bathroom is so dirty. Breakfast arrived completely cold as well.For the money there are plenty more options.

From the moment we were first greeted by Robert P. and colleague at the front of the house until the moment we left, my wife and I were made to feel welcome and at home. Close to the September 11 Memorial in the heart of the financial district, this hotel is a terrific choice for a couple visiting the city for a special occasion. Upper rooms looking out toward Pearl St. are preferable for a little view.

This is a very nice boutique hotel not far from Wall Street or Hudson Bay.The decor and device make this place. The food served in the restaurant downstairs is very good. I had breakfast their twice and highly recommend it.The rooms are a very good size and the decor is very quirky. The bed is very comfortable. The bar is busy and has a nice vibe to it as well.Overall a very positive experience and this will be my go to hotel in NY.

Stayed here for 5 nights during a work trip and it was a bit of a gem to be honest... would definitely stay here again...Supremely helpful and friendly staff... a boutique feel and nice sized rooms - all very clean and comfortable.... Wifi was good and the bed was very comfortable... Noise levels very tolerable for NYC! ;-)Definitely would come back and recommend...

The looks, the service, the feel - their standards will set your bar high for anywhere else you plan to stay. Thank you Anthony and Victoria for being so accommodating! Best night staff ever - they made sure that my stay (several times) were absolutely flawless from check in to check out. HIGHLY recommended!!!!

The hotel from the outside is unprepossessing. It is up a side street. Inside it is quirky and atmospheric and quite small. It does have an atmosphere. The rooms are fine but not great. The restaurant was full and I had a 20 minute wait to get a table even although I was a guest - so I didn't bother. Some of the staff are ok (the barman from Alaska, the receptionist) to and others are wonderful, such as Fitoria from Kosovo, who made my entire trip special and led me to overlook some of the hotel's shortcomings. She was friendly and welcoming.

We stayed at this hotel for our daughter's wedding. Most of the guests were staying here and everyone thought it was a lovely hotel. It was 2 blocks from the subway, across from a Starbucks, and the staff was really accommodating. The couple of things we needed or weren't working were quickly taken care of. The bride and groom had the Penthouse suite and it was wonderful to have so much space to get ready and sort things out. We couldn't have been happier. It's a fairly small hotel, which we liked, not like the huge Hilton's or Marriotts. We had a family dinner around the corner at a wonderful Italian place called Giardino d'oro.

A charming, welcoming space tucked away in the financial district. The glass of prosecco upon arrival set the tone for the extra care that the Gild Hall delivers. The rooms are quirky with great design flair and appointments. The staff are friendly and helpful. The bar and restaurant (Felice) are exceptional - and, unusually for a New York hotel, make it feel like a home away from home. Don't expect a view but expect to have a wonderful time with great staff and facilities. The area is now vibrant with great bars, restaurants and facilities.

We stayed at the hotel for a week on a business trip and I would gladly come back. It's in a walking distance to WTC; most importantly, staff is really helpful in a practical sense. They have a restaurant in the lobby with good breakfast. The only issue we had was the internet connection, which is provided by another service provider; however, again, staff was very helpful with solving the issue.For a business trip we weren't looking for a nice view from the window. The hotel itself is in a narrow street with not much sunlight, but it didn't bother us.

I can see why some people like this Hotel : It has a real boutique flavour and is popular with the hipsters. There are positives and negatives here and I think it's purely personal taste if you like it or not. As a regular business traveller who usually stays in Ritz Carlton, Hyatt etc., this Hotel probably wasn't the best choice for me in hindsight.Positives : Helpful, friendly staff and the cosy bar is decent. Good access for the Financial district.Negatives : Dark room with very little natural sunlight and small bathroom. Also, I have an allergy to animal fur and had the feeling a prior occupant of the room may possibly have had a dog as my usual allergy symptoms were suddenly present when I was in my room (the Hotel website does state it is pet friendly - I must have missed this when I made the booking).I think the under 40's will like this Hotel.

Old South Seaport Area. Close to our family and close to the Metro that can take you in every direction Not all Metro stations can do that. Love the European influence and the quirky decor. Not too trendy, not austere like so many hotels. Love the restaurant in the hotel-Felice.

I enjoyed my stay at Gild because it's a fun, boutique hotel in the heart of the financial district. I usually stay on the Upper East side, but business was down town on this 2 night trip.The lobby is especially fun. Being asked, "may I offer you a glass of Prosecco as you check in" was a telling sign that this would be a fine stay. The basic room was kind of a sophisticated funky with a comfortable bed. Not much shelf space in the bathroom (almost none), but the shower was good and strong and birght because of all the glass and classic fixtures.The room is well lit and functional. My only complaint (which I told them) is the lack of free coffee in the morning. Kimpton and other like hotels always have coffee you can grab and bring back to the room while dressing (or grab on your way our). The Gild makes you order it from the bar. This means $4.5 dollars and precious morning time lost. I know this sounds petty, but this just doesn't fit with the level and type and spirit of the Gild Hotel.The staff is very nice and helpful for recommending restaurants. The Gild is well located with many restaurants and subway near by.This will now be my go-to hotel for down town needs.

Quiet place and well situated within the Financial District with an excellent italian restaurant and a nice bar at the hotel, don't miss the Happy Hour. The bed was incredible comfortable and the staff friendly and courteous

Second time staying at Gild Hall. It is around the block from my company's New York offices so it is the perfect location. For all other travelers it is ideally located within a short walking distance of all the lower and mid-town locations. Top notch service , excellent hospitality and customer service from the property team. I will continue to make this property my go to stay and I have already directed more from my company to stay there. Updated furnishings, a classy modern feel hotel!

Enjoyed my stay here. No issues, good location for downtown and subway access. Would stay here again and recommend to others. Better than the typical big hotel in nyc. The atmosphere and decor put it a notch above.

Stayed two nights in April- great location convenient to FiDi and everywhere else via 1-2-3. Team remembered us each time we walked in and was more than helpful in helping us find late night food. Property was clean and perfectly decorated- masculine and comfortable. Room was awesome- best bed! Good size bathroom, awesome tv.

This is definitely a great place to stay. It is very close to the subway station. Also this subway station is a big one with multiple trains. You can go anywhere you want. Also there are a lot restaurants and market around. The service in this place is awesome. Everyone will say hi to you when you come back from outside. The room is clean and big. I would like to choose this place again next time when I visit NY.

Gild Hall was Great Time. The location was perfect the staff was Excellent, Especially Jon the Mgr,and Andy the Bell Capt.The bar was so nice and very welcoming. The Restaurant Felice was amazing. Even the incredible Art works that were on display made us stop and take notice. Simply a great experience.

I was traveling to the hotel when one of the staff, Angel, stepped outside and waited for me so he could grab my bags and help me to the hotel. After I got in, Anthony offered me some water and made sure the check in process was fast and easy. Considering I had a long flight, this was very welcoming. I had been lost earlier navigating the streets of the financial district and the fact that such southern hospitality exists even here amazes me. I've booked at many hotels over the years as I travel much for my work. Let me assure you that the room was clean, the lobby had a spectacular style sure to impress any tourist or regular in NYC with the moose lodge feel. The beds sleep will have you sleeping like a baby, nothing short of what I'd expect from an a niche hotel that came highly recommended to me. Outstanding and amazing!I would like to thank the amazing management and staff for making my trip to NYC such a pleasant one. Kudos to the front desk staff Angel and Anthony for exemplifying what a 5 star hotel service is suppose to be like. I couldn't have asked for more. I'll be flying in again in two weeks and already know where I'll be staying (hint: it starts with Gild and ends with Hall). Cheers!
user_name:
cityguy2014
New York City, New York

review_body: This hotel has a great location in the financial district with easy walking access to almost anywhere you would want to go. It is also easy to access the subway from here. The room was very small but it was nice! This hotel has a very "manly" vibe with dark colors, leather, etc. The bar and restaurant are typical overpriced hotel drinks and food so plan on exploring the area for better food and drink options.

Had the pleasure of staying for 3 nts in the Gild Hall hotel over the Easter weekend. Easy to find, very friendly check-in staff and even a complimentary glass of prosecco during check-in! Thanks guys.Refreshing to see and experience a boutique hotel in NYC, having stayed in large hotel chain properties during previous visits to the city.Room was large (by NYC standards) and well equipped. Clean and tidy with large flat screen TV and well stocked mini-bar.Free WIFI worked well in the room and public areas.We took the room option including breakfast. Breakfast did not disappoint and was open from 06:30am. Effectively a set menu, either continental or American breakfast, both of which were excellent, served by friendly staff always happy to top-up your coffee cup.Can highly recommend this hotel, whether staying for business or pleasure.

Hotel has a very stylish and unique decor. The rooms are quite comfortable in size, and the bathroom was surprisingly roomy. Very nice amenities in the room, although an in-room coffee maker would be a nice addition. Overall, a very nice location in lower Manhattan for a single or couple. Check-in time is strictly at 3 pm or later- no possibility of getting an early check-in, in contrast to larger hotels. Other downside is that the staff at the desk and at the bar were somewhat unfriendly and slow to respond to requests, which is why I rated four instead of five stars. Regardless, I would consider staying here again.

Gild Hall is a boutique hotel in the Financial District that often offers great discounts. Contacting the hotel directly can prove an effective way to find a good room and good deal. The hotel has a very trendy and unique decor, featuring an odd but attractive mix of art. The rooms were spacious by New York standards, the beds luxurious, the bathrooms immaculate, and it was amazingly QUIET. The place is located near a wide range of popular destinations including, the newly-opened 9/11 Memorial, Southport, Chinatown, and Tribeca. There are great restaurants nearby, along with several Starbucks for your morning fix. The hotel features an excellent restaurant and martini bar. The staff was super friendly and the service first rate. Avoid the big chain hotels and the discount dumps, and do yourself a favor by staying at one of New York City's most interesting and fun places.

There are some less than ringing endorsements on here which I find a little surprising. This hotel is stylish, comfortable and given the location the rooms are spacious and well equipped. The bathroom was perhaps a tad small and a third lift would probably help. We stayed here for 2 nights over my birthday. The staff were really friendly and provided a few nice little touches. The bar and restaurant attached are also excellent and I can really recommend the breakfast. We will be back at some point.

King "Superior." Comfortable bed, but small room. Shower was updated, but the faucet was not working right in the shower.The Internet was spotty and if you plan on streaming anything, be prepared to pay a lot extra.

Our stay could not have been better, it was our honeymoon so it always going to be one to remember but this hotel was the icing on the cake.Before travelling I emailed Jonathan the manager with a couple of requests which all were catered for without any hesitation. The rooms are spacious, the beds are huge and comfy, but I believe it is the staff that make this hotel as good as it is. On every occasion we spoke to staff they were chatty, polite, happy to see you, offered complimentary drinks where possible and asked about your day, it is this personal touch that makes the stay enjoyable a makes you feel like you matter to them.We will of course be back.

Positive points - reception staff are really friendly and you get a nice glass of prosecco on arrival.Common space is well decorated - quite unique and a nice place to hang out although not big.Negatives - The rooms are tired and they offer nothing more than a Holiday Inn at best.Bathroom is tiny and the towels were seriously poor quality - they don't match the nice thick robe supplied..the only hint of 4stars.The rooms have a theme that makes them dark and depressing.The pillow case on my bed was badly stained ....not picked up by housekeeping.The black furniture in the room is showing its age - heavily chipped.In terms of facilities and decor this is a 3 star property
user_name:
Peter E
Palm Springs, California, United States

review_body: The room we stayed in was comfortable and as we were on the 15th floor there was little traffic noise despite building work being carried on up the street. The breakfasts in the restaurant were good and we enjoyed the fact we were able to people watch while we were having our coffees. We had one dinner in the restaurant and it was excellent. The service from the reception staff was excellent as was the service from the restaurant staff.One lift was out of action during our stay but maybe we were lucky as it didn't inconvenience us.Overall we were satisfied with comfort and facilities.
user_name:
Edmund M
County Antrim, United Kingdom

review_body: I travel to the Financial District several times a year on business, and I have stayed at several hotels in the area trying to find a favorite. I found it at Gild Hall! The staff were very welcoming and helpful, the business rate for rooms was reasonable, and although I did not get to check it out, the attached restaurant and bar were very inviting. They offered a complimentary glass of prosecco at check-in! If you're traveling on business, they have a program for reduced rates. Room was nicely appointed, high ceilings, all the amenities you would expect. The bedding was very comfortable. I used the complimentary Wi-Fi and was able to stream content with no issues. One morning it was raining hard as I left for the office, and they gave me very nice umbrella to use all day. I really had a lovely stay and am looking forward to my return.

I have just returned from a week long business stay at the Gild Hall. Whilst there were several positives to be attributed to the hotel, overall the hotel did not meet expectations.To begin with the positives; the hotel is in a good location for the Financial District, within walking distance of Wall Street and close to several subway stations that provide easy access to the city. The hotel itself is on a quiet street by NY standard and i did not experience excessive outside noise whilst staying here. Check-in staff were pleasant and able to answer several questions regarding the area and local transport links knowledgeably. Unfortunately, on arrival to my room things took a turn for the worse.The first room I was allocated was on the second floor, seperated from the hotels restaurant/bar by only a few feet. The noise from the bar was significant and I was informed that it would be finished by 11.30pm; 2 hours later the noise was still preventing any chance of sleep and I was told i could be moved to another floor the next day as they were fully booked that night. Granted this was a Saturday night, however over the course of my one week stay i often returned late in the evening to find the bar still open so i recommend those travelling on business to request a room on a higher floor.The next day i was transferred to a room on the 15th floor which was very quiet and to their credit the staff handled this well.The room itself was well decorated throughout with a King size bed and large tv with many channels. The bathroom was spacious clean and the shower provided warm high pressure water. I personally found the room quite dark with little lighting available and whilst this style may suit couples for solo travellers it was not ideal.Unfortunately, despite there being snow on the ground outside the hotel had no heat available throughout the buiilding. This resulted in the hotel being far too cold to be comfortable for the first three nights of my stay. The hotel staff made no mention of this and I was not informed until I asked that there was even an issue . For the price paid It is expected to be able to be to have some heating provided or at least informed of the issue before returning late to a cold room!On raising this to the staff i was offered a space heater which thankfully provided some respite although not enough to warm the room to an adaquete standard. To add insult to injury, on checkout I was told I had incurred a $9 charge for a bottle of water! This is despite being informed on the first day that water was complementary, as in the norm in hotels of this calibre I have previously stayed at. I was then told whilst it can be provided in the same bottles free with reception, in the room in incurs this frankly ridiculous price. I would have thought a bottle of water would have been the minimum they could waive for three days without heat! Overall whilst I feel I was unfortunate with my staff here compared to other reviews, for my personal stay it simply was not good enouugh.

Gild Hall has plenty of reviews and before selecting the hotel I read through many of them. For the most part, a lot of the reviews are accurate. Rooms are great and styled funkily. Reception is attentive. Lobby and bar/restaurant are lively.I chose the hotel because I wanted to get away from the standard and boring hotels of mid-town. You know which hotels I'm referring to: National brands with standardized accommodations and service.From that perspective, Gild Hall exceeded my expectations. There's nothing boring! At every turn, I found myself intrigued. From the artwork in the hallways to the decor in the lobby. It grabs your attention and makes you look.The room is also meets this criteria. It's decor is eye-catching and the accommodations are comfortable.I uploaded a bunch of pictures, take a look.I rated Gild Hall as 4-stars (very good). I would have given 5-stars, but there was significant construction at the hotel during my stay in early March 2016. This led to long waits for the elevator and a significant slow-down of traffic at the hotel entrance (dumpster blocking road). Uber's and taxis were taking forever.I'll definitely stay at Gild Hall again. I'd expect once the construction is complete, it will be a 5-star experience. I love Thompson hotels!

I really wanted to like Gild Hall. There is an obscene amount of construction going on around my building in NY and I thought this could perhaps function as a second home when it became too unbearable. Unfortunately, the glitter of it all ends after the lobby. When I book a 4/5 star hotel - I expect the basic amenities to be something I don't think about, a given. In other words, the last thing I want to worry about at a luxury hotel is the AC/water pressure/lighting. The AC simply didn't work, was loud, and the room remained at nearly 80 degrees the whole night. When it chose to turn on from its mandated Eco setting, it was loud and emanated warm air. I was uncomfortable and kept up the entire night. While the shower has amazing pressure, the temp oscillated by itself from the temp I chose to scalding me intermittently on its own. Needless to say, I had to forgo spending any more time than I needed to in there. The hot water was jarring. I ordered room service as soon as I checked in and specially asked that they make sure there is no pork at all near my food, Lo and behold - a cold burger arrives smothered in Pancetta. They were nice enough and corrected the burger after I called and apologized. Now...what really annoyed me about this experience is that I asked the attendant when signing for the food whether his tip was already included (I was a bit confused bc there were two service charges, a flat $5 charge and another $9 service charge) He told me - "no, none of that is my tip - it's for the hotel" so I gave him a $10 tip. I don't know if he was lying or not...but either way - a $5 charge, 18% hotel service charge, and then having to tip another 20% is just insane. Nearly 25 dollars in service for a hamburger that was done incorrectly and dish of pasta. Now, onto the lighting. It is depressing. Even in the morning...it is just so dark and gloomy. There is a difference between an avant-garde, gothic chic feel and just terrible and depressing lighting. Truly, if only one of these things were amiss - I would have not even noticed...but to have all of them be poor experiences was just too much. I went down to complain to the front desk and while the young gentleman was nice enough, and he was - he seemed like a deer in the headlights dealing with a complaint. He offered me free breakfast which I politely declined...I wanted a place to sleep...I was not here to rack up freebies. I asked him if I could please just checkout because I needed to find a new hotel now. He asked if he could send an engineer to check the AC and other things...truly not a satisfactory solution - an appropriate one would have been - let me find you a new room where you won't have any problems. The last thing I want is to sit in my room after a night of no sleep to have someone come fix things...that only adds more to my discomfort. He pulled up my bill, said - ok, I will take care of the room service. I said ok. We left it at that. Gild Hall, I really really really wanted to like you. Alas, I will have to stay at more traditional albeit more reliable options during my NY Staycation.
user_name:
sarahjamalnyc
New York City, New York

review_body: We arrived at the Gild Hall hotel ready for sleep. I'd hoped for a larger room, so in the morning we discussed it at reception. By the time we returned from a fantastic first day in NYC we had a larger and better located room. We had breakfasts included with our deal and were absolutely delighted with the continental breakfast that was more than enough to keep us going till lunch - a delicious bowl of fresh fruit followed by our choice of a bagel, toast, muffin or croissant, juice and a hot drink. Best of all we found the reception staff were always calm, patient and really really helpful ( especially when our return flight was delayed). Special thanks must go to David, Monique, Violet and Jessica who all went out of their way to help us on more than one occasion and always had a smile on their faces. We would definitely recommend this hotel for its position and the superb staff.

Excellent hotel the staff couldnt do enough for you.Very comfortable room on the 16th floor.The deb manager David Finch is a very professial chap.The hotel is within easy reach of numerous tourist sites and there are plenty of good bars/eating places within walking distances.Only negative point construction is still going on so only one working lift and 17$ for a glass of wine is over the top even for New York

We just got back from a mini babymoon trip to NYC. My husband had done extensive research and booked Gild Hall knowing that I love fun boutique hotels. Unfortunately, there were many more drawbacks to staying at Gild Hall than we had anticipated.Pros:- Friendly staff, very clean rooms- One of the best showers I've ever had in my life. The water pressure is like a fire hose.- Nice linens, comfortable bed- Spacious rooms for NYC standards with high, beautiful ceilings- Mad Men style decor - Delicious food at Felice, and complimentary breakfast was a lovely touchCons:- NO HEAT. In NYC. In March. When we let the front desk know that we didn't have heat, we were told "Oh, we turned off the heat for the whole building because it's so warm out. We can send you a space heater, though." So warm out? The days we were there it was in the 50s, 40s and 30s respectively, and on the final day a snowstorm rolled in. We are from Boston and we were freezing. To us it seemed like a coverup for the heat simply not working. It was also uncomfortably cold in the lobby and restaurant. - The lights in our room stopped working twice. It was fixed quickly, but come on!- The neighborhood is far from most tourist destinations aside from the World Trade Center memorial and Staten Island Ferry. If your goal is to see most NYC tour destinations you will spend a lot of time on the Subway or a lot of money in taxis/Uber.- Construction on the street. At 7 months pregnant I was hoping for a peaceful getaway and a chance to sleep in. Unfortunately they chose to put us in a room overlooking jackhammer construction that began early in the morning. I wish they had put us in a room further away.- Terrible wifi. We had to disconnect from it in order to use our phones properly.- One elevator was broken for the length of our stay and we often had to wait 5+ minutes to go up or down to our room, plus share the elevator with stinky trash bins.The bottom line is that our stay was fine, if a bit disappointing. I will not be staying here again as heat and electricity are things I require when spending hundreds of dollars on a hotel room. There are so many great places to stay in NYC, I will be giving them my money in the future.

I had very high expectations and unfortunately I was a little sad to see my room.There was no doorman, no help with luggage nor a warm greeting outside. We where checked in by a the front desk staff, she gave us a room next to our friends, pleasant and simple check In. The room for me was the biggest let down, the bed it self was very well presented and comfortable, the rest of the room was nicked and scratched and clearly needed some attention. Bathroom was very small, the shower curtain was torn down but was fixed during our stay. The aircon/heating was very loud. The room was small.The restaurant was excellent, we enjoyed breakfast and dinner. Service at dinner was exceptional, each and every dish was extremely good & great wine selection. Breakfast was also very enjoyable.Overall I would come back if I knew the rooms had been renovated. I have visited other Thompson hotels and loved them.

We loved this hotel the staff was so nice. The hotel was lovely. The only complaint I have is that there was construction outside our window. Not the Hotels fault. We didn't think it would go on on a Sunday morning. Other than that great location great hotel.

The staff were very welcoming and helpful. The room was clean and the beds extremely comfortable.Disappointing part during our visit was the amount of time we had to wait for the lifts, they were very slow and one of them out of order for 2 days.Breakfast was excellent, fresh and tasty.Good place to stay

We have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Gild Hall, and what a brilliant stay it was.This was our second visit to New York, last time staying close to Times Square, but we much preferred this end of town. The area around the hotel has numerous bars and restaurants and especially at night, was much quieter.I emailed the hotel in advance and asked for a quiet room if possible and that is exactly what we got, thank you. They also acknowledged the fact that the trip was the start of celebrations for my husband's 60th birthday, which was a lovely touch. The room was on the 17th floor and when I woke during the night there was no noise either from the street or other guests in the hotel, which meant I slept well on all 3 nights, in what was a comfortable, huge bed.The room, although not particularly large was tastefully decorated with good quality linen, towels and a bathrobe. A little dark but that is due to the décor and the fact that you are surrounded by other buildings, but that is New York.We had dinner in the Felice restaurant on one occasion, which was without a doubt the best meal of our trip. The restaurant was busy, but the service and attention was spot on and both my husband and myself said that it was the best steak we had eaten in a very long time. Breakfast was included in our deal, either the American or Continental, both of which were excellent and set us up for the day ahead.The greatest asset to this hotel though has to be the staff that work here. Every person we spoke to was polite, friendly and extremely helpful, special thanks must go to Violet on reception, who was particularly helpful. This hotel would definitely be my first choice when we return to New York and I would have no hesitation in recommending it to others.

We stayed at the Gild Hall for 4 nights in March, and loved every minute. The hotel is beautifully decorated throughout and every member of staff we encountered was incredibly helpful and polite. The room was well equipped, and although rather noisy, I wouldn't really expect anything else given the location. In hindsight I should maybe have asked for a high floor, but it wasn't a big problem. The hotel is situated within walking distance to a number of subway stations, close to the Brooklyn Bridge and is a great base for exploring this wonderful city. The Financial District has quite a good selection of bars and restaurants, the nicer ones tending to be around the Seaport area. The Lower East Side and Chinatown/Little Italy are also all within walking distance, with all they have to offer. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a boutique base from which to see the sights of NYC.

Had the pleasure of spending one night at Gild Hall on a recent business trip. I stayed in a King Premium room and it truly felt premium, especially for a hotel in NYC. This hip, trendy and beautifully decorated had beautiful furniture in each room, with lush materials and ample style. Beautiful room from the carpet to the bed to the materials of the bathroom door.I felt this was a very masculine hotel -- being in the Wall Street area, I wonder if majority of clients are men. Only thing that was missing from this hotel was a view, as even as high as floor 17, the immediate view was into another building. I was one of a group of 16 people, and I can tell you that each of us received wonderful service every step of the way. We held a private dinner in their upstairs private dining room. Mina and Carlos provided EXCELLENT service, even when we through them a curveball and had them deliver two meals to guest rooms.Leah in group sales was also wonderful to work with.As the event organizer, I can honestly say that every moment, from the first email to checkout, was a wonderful experience!

This is a small boutique hotel in the financial district that we have gone to many times. Walking distance to Freedom Tower. Walking distance to subway station. Excellent staff, great location and a very nice lobby with bar and restaurant. Highly recommend it!!

For NYC we got this hotel at a really good value, the decor is beautiful and our room was nice! The only thing I would point out, was some of the staff weren't as friendly and helpful as we have experienced at other Thompson properties.
