Being referred to grub hub when we wanted a suggestion on what was good to order wasn't the warmest welcome. As well as being called out of the room numerous times, when we were only ten minutes after checkout. Minus those occurrences our stay was nice.

I don't ever write reviews, but Gild Hall was exceptional so I must. My gf and I wanted to do something special for our 1 yr dating anniversary so we decided to ditch our crappy BK apt and stay at a swanky hotel and have a fun, crazy, night out. Well usually my gf (an event planner) handles such arrangements, but I wanted to show her that I have booking skills too, so I took on the task of arranging the evening. I found this awesome deal on a another website and and Gild Hall looked awesome so I booked it! Oh, there's one little thing I forgot to add: I had this crazy idea to propose to my gf at some point in the evening!Not knowing if they would even care, I contacted the hotel and let them know what my plan was for the evening. Jonathon, David, and the rest of the team sprung into action! They immediately offered me a room upgrade (granted, this was already a possibility in the package deal I purchased, but it was by no means guaranteed), and an amenity to be sent to the room once we arrived. All this to make the night feel even more special! And perhaps more importantly it really impressed Ms Event Planner who is extra picky about where she stays...David even contacted me personally when there appeared to be a problem with my booking to make sure we didn't show up and have a nasty surprise! Who does that?! Well thank god he did, because I had indeed messed up. Totally saved my backside.Needless to say, the evening was magical! Starting with the hotel to all the other stuff I had planned, the night was a dream. It reminded me why we put up with this crazy city and just how cool people can be! Thanks Gild Hall! We will never forget it!Oh, She said yes!
user_name:
Roto G
New York City, New York

review_body: My boyfriend and I enjoyed his birthday weekend at Gild Hall in the beginning of February. From the moment we walked through the door, we were very impressed with the eclectic decor and the wonderful staff. Our newly renovated room was cool, comfy & quiet. Mr Goldberg, the manager thoughtfully sent up a bottle of chilled champagne and glasses, perfect way to get the bday started! We really enjoyed the neighborhood. Drinks at India House, Battery Park & Battery Pk City, Pier A, Stout. Can't wait to be tourists again soon!

We chose this hotel because it was convenient to our son, who lives a block away, but the location turned out to be ideal. 3 minutes walk to the subway, 2 markets within a block and a half, 5 minute walk to the water (Southstreet Seaport). The hotel has a very "boutique" feel and they are undergoing a complete renovation to their rooms. We were in a renovated room with incredibly high ceilings, beautiful bathroom and extremely comfortable bed. What really stood out to us was the exceptional service. All of the people at the front desk could not do enough to help us out. My husband wound up sick in bed for a day and a half and all he wanted was some hot tea. After we initially ordered a pot of tea from room service, I came downstairs to refill the hot water and the front desk not only filled the pot, but gave me a big thermos to make sure he had enough through the night.Each time I came downstairs they asked about him and offered to do anything else, including finding us a 24 hour pharmacy close by.Also, they are dog friendly, but I didn't hear or smell any evidence of dogs. Our son just got a puppy and they were all so kind and genuinely excited when he came for a visit.The restaurant Felice, attached downstairs was delicious!! We went for an incredibly reasonable Happy Hour. The food was so good that we decided to try dinner and we were equally impressed. This place is a total gem and we will definitely return!!!

We stayed one night. Very friendly staff, clean, different style than most chain hotels. Was walking distance to World Trade Center. We had drinks in the Felice bar and bartender was very friendly and made great specialty cocktails. We parked at a nearby lot, though not the one I think the hotel recommends, it was $48 for overnight.
user_name:
julie h
New York City, New York

review_body: Went Dec 10th; very warm 17 C and festive everywhere! The entrance was packed because the restaurant bar was overflowing. Getting out of the hotel they have a strong fragrant scent in the hallways - I don't have an allergies but I could see it would be a problem for some. Room small we did not like the fact that the bathroom had glass and it was facing the bedroom-doesn't allow for privacy. Things were missing in our room but front desk was prompt; Maintenance fast when key broke in fridge. We can't complain about service. Location was good close to water and coffee shops. We walked to SoHo and the memorial site. Restaurant good food.

Staff a true asset to the hotel.Very welcoming staff with a nice bar and restaurant with great ambiance giving a warm invite to an ideal place to unwind after a day touring the sites. Only disappointing part during our visit was the amount of time we had to wait for the lifts, this was due to workmen abusing the control of them. In fairness, all staff went out of their way to resolve this when they were aware of our dilemma. A fab hotel in downtown Manhattan away from the non stop life of Midtown.

Love this little place - I have stayed here on business a few times - old but well maintained property. It has a clubby and warm feel. Rooms are well appointed, albeit small. Service is good. Most of the clientele appears to be business oriented. Prices are okay for Manhattan - hopping bar scene and great restaurant on first floor. Very close to Wall Street and the 9/11 memorial. Will go back when on business or with my wife for a wekend visit - doesn't seem conducive for families though! Incidentally, the subways are close by - the property itself is in a somewhat low-traffic section within a very busy region of that makes sense - for cabs you may need to walk a block sometimes.

During my last visit, I was surprised with the addition of a coffee maker in my room. The staff had responded to my comments and interest in having access to morning coffee in my room. This was gesture was deeply meaningful to me - providing a quiet, slow morning of rest and work.
user_name:
Ellen Percy K
New York City, New York

review_body: Hotels in NYC, specially if the world boutique is involved, tend to have tiny rooms and even tinier bathrooms. Not this place. My favorite Manhattan hotel used to be the Mondrian Soho for when I came in to visit from the CT burbs. This is now my new favorite. quick list: normal size rooms, tasteful original decor, beautiful coffee table books everywhere (in your room and the lobby) real glass not plastic cups in the very roomy bath room and fancy D.S. and Durga toiletries. Quiet Fidi street, and you really do not hear anything if you are in a high floor. Wish I could keep this one a secret.

Had a two night stay in New York on short notice and there were zero rooms anywhere.Found one night at the Gild Hall and even at reduced price was $ 600.00Had no choice but really enjoyed my stay. Suite was amazing and such fine finishes.I would stay again but only for a special occasion.

My husband & I recently spent the weekend in NYC & stayed at Gild Hall. It was an incredible experience from check in to check out. The front desk gentlemen David & Rob were very professional with great personalities & could not have done better with their recommendations. Our room was ready when we arrived earlier than expected. The room was just great, very, very clean & very spacious. The bathroom was huge for NYC! It was extremely quiet & the best night sleep my husband & I have had in a long time. Thank you to the entire staff at Gild Hall and can not wait to return.

We arrived late so had dinner in the hotel restaurant. The waiter seemed a bit dismissive and uppity....but we enjoyed the food a lot so we pretty much ignored him.The decor in this hotel is fabulous! Plaid wool throws, dark wood, leather, old photographs. It you like sleek and sparse, this is not the hotel for you.

Our stay was very nice the front desk was wonderful the room was very nice and comfortable and quiet We stayed on Christmas day so the restaurant was closed but we have eaten there before great pasta and wine Thank you for the champagne

The staff here is incredible. Was by far the most cost effective hotel in the city. Only a few minutes walk to the metro and so much more. I can't wait to come back and bring my brother! Thank you for being such amazing hosts for our last minute stay!

This hotel is in a good location. Close to the metro stop Fulton Street which connects with several lines. The hotel itself is very handsome, with an inviting bar and attached restaurant. I really like the dark wood and fancy leather wibe. The check-in staff is very helpful and these people really go out of their way to make sure your stay is a good one! My husbans and I were celebrating christmas for the first time alone in a hotel, and I had requested some help with making the room full of christmas spirit. I had orded some packages online and had them delivered to the hotel. The staff at Gild Hall had unwrapped the packages and put up some christmas lights, stockings, filled the stockings with candy and even went out and bought several bottles of christmas beer. It was totally awesome! We had a room in the 15th floor. The soaps provided for shower were amazing! First time that the hotel shampoo and conditioner smelled so good that I want to take it home! The free wifi worked well with two devices. The mini bar is well stocked with a lot of items I have not seen before. The bed was the most comfortable I have ever had, the pillows amazing, lovely duvet and such soft and pleasant covers. The only downside to the room was the noise from the aircon/heating. It was not that cold when we were in New York so we did not have to use the heating.
user_name:
Alina Beate D
Notteroy Municipality, Norway

review_body: What can I say about this hotel that has not already been said?It's a lovely hotel with lovely people working in it.The rooms are big and comfortable, the beds are if anything far TOO comfortable, you don't want to get out of them in the morning! The pillows and linen are lovely.The reception staff are fantastic, all of them, kind, helpful and thoughtful.I stayed here in March and they impressed me so much I travelled back for Xmas, New York at Xmas, snow, jingle bells, magic, Santa Claus - I'd seen it all in films and on the news. I so wanted that experience.Well, as everyone now knows that didn't happen BUT David and Violet on reception knew that was why I had come to New York and they decorated our room with flashing icicles, snowflakes and christmas decorations. It was a lovely thought even if it was 72 degrees outside on Christmas Eve.The location of this hotel for me is perfect, South Street Seaport is growing and there are a lot of good bars and restaurants in the area not far from the hotel.We even walked to Times Square a couple of times, once via the Highline. Subway station is not far from the hotel.Yes, I will be back to visit Gild Hall, I love New York and I love Gild Hall.

My wife and I checked in a few hours ago. We were greeted at the front desk by Robert P, Violet and Paulina. The 3 of them could not have been more attentive or courteous. They answered all of our questions and handled any requests with a cheerful manner. We haven't even left yet and are already talking about coming back again.

I stayed here for work and LOVED this hotel. The rooms were very clean and recently updated. The staff was extremely helpful with anything I needed and I spent an entire afternoon in the restaurant downstairs drinking tea, writing, and eating off of a cheese board. My waiter was wonderful as well.The beds were very comfortable and the closet space for hanging my conference clothes was perfect for this business trip.The location was also conveniently located near the subway so I could get around easily and the Financial District was a great area to stay in. Would definitely come here again!

Will definitely stay here again when in the city. Great location, friendly staff, I especially liked the complimentary prosecco ! Rooms are clean and overall ambience of hotel is very pleasant. Nothing but positivity

Having had more than a few weekend getaways in NYC, my wife and I have rarely returned to the same hotel in Manhattan. We have been searching for something in a quiet location, easy to get to, nice sized rooms, and good value. We finally found a hotel to which we can safely say will be our go-to hotel from here on out. The Gild Hall is an excellent hotel. The lobby is very warm and inviting. It is so nice to walk into on a cold day! And with the hotel bar/restaurant just to the left, there is always the option for a hot or cold beverage. Upon entering we were greeted warmly by the front desk. Unfortunately we were a bit early for check in, so we left our luggage and went to explore the area. We were supposed to get a text message when our room was ready, but we never received it. That and a little confusion at check in about our requested upgrade were the only two slip ups by the staff. After lunch and shopping we returned to find our room ready. We stayed in a King Suite and I would definitely choose this option again. There is a small bar/kitchen area fully stocked with everything to get a good party started. It is probably the first time I have ever encountered a cocktail shaker and every type of cocktail glass imaginable as standard fare in a hotel! The sitting room is a VERY nice size with a great flat screen tv. The leather couch was very comfortable and a much needed refuge after all the walking we had just done. The bathroom for our suite was very nice. However it is awkwardly connected to the sitting room and not the bedroom. Not a big deal, but make sure you clear a path from the bedroom to the bathroom so you do not trip over something during the middle of the night. The bathroom was a nice size with a great tile shower. Lighting is good and space is adequate for anything you need to store. The bedroom was again a very nice size. The king size bed was firm but comfortable. The linens and pillows were excellent. On the wall opposite the bed hung another 40+ inch flat screen tv. (I almost convinced my wife that was what we needed in our bedroom at home, but I don't think I won that argument.) Oh, did I mention the very tall ceilings in the bedroom and sitting rooms? It definitively made the already large rooms feel that much bigger. We were celebrating a very special event that we have celebrated at a couple of other hotels in NYC. I always let the staff know as it is an important life event for my wife and I to celebrate. I have to say the Gild Hall staff went all out and I thank them for all that they did. It definitely made for a special stay. We will 100% be back to the Gild Hall for our next city get away. I recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a quiet place to stay, excellent service, clean rooms, and a large floorplan. Keep up the good work Gild Hall! We will be back soon!

We stayed at the hotel for 8 nights including Thanksgiving. The staff were friendly , courteous , professional and helpful. This is a very well run hotel , reflected in the relaxing ambiance that flows here. I especially liked the decor, you actually have to remind yourself that you are in New York. Violet and the team at reception were very helpful at all times , simple greetings as you leave and return to the hotel at the end of the day are much appreciated. Monique was always on the go but still had time for a pleasant smile and genuine greeting. I would definitely stay here again, the food was delicious and the wine bar was very popular with locals and visitors.Congratulations to the team and Happy New Year :)

We stopped for four nights and couldn't fault the service - this is the second Thompson Hotel I've stayed in. The room by NY standards was large and clean and the bed comfortable. We had the free complimentary breakfast which was lovely.

We stayed here for a couple of nights including New Years eve. Really enjoyed our stay. The deco in the public area and in the rooms is sophisticated yet relaxed. The staff are helpful. Our room is very spacious, especially for NYC. It's also very quiet for good night sleep. There are several good markets within a block, a few minute walk to the subway station and the major sights in lower Manhattan.

We honestly did not plan on staying at Gild Hall, however our flight got canceled after suffering multiple delays and we had to stay in NYC two more days before our rebooked flight back home. By the time our flight got canceled it was pretty late and I searched TripAdvisor for a hotel for two nights. Gild Hall turned out to be much cheaper than airport hotels or other hotels in manhattan, and it seemed to be ranked very highly, so we decided to book it. We're glad that we did, because our stay there was great. As we arrived, the front desk informed us we got a complimentary upgrade to a better room which was really nice after spending a day stuck at the airport. The room was lovely, with plenty of space and a comfy bed. There's free wi-fi in the room and the speed was quite good, however it is free only for two devices. The bathroom was also quite big and the soap and toiletry products were wonderful. We tried the hotel restaurant for dinner, and it was delicious. The hotel also has three small fitness rooms, each with a treadmill, stepper machine and weights, they were quite adequate for my cardio work out. Overall this was a great and unexpected surprise and a nice relaxing experience after a stressful day at the airport. I would be happy to stay there again.

We chose this hotel when they were offering a Cyber Monday deal that we could not resist. I was unsure about staying in the Financial District at first, but it turned out to be the perfect choice for us. The rooms are big by New York standards. The staff was amazing - can't emphasize this enough. There is a major subway station a very short walk from the hotel (Fulton), that will literally take you anywhere you need to go without having to change trains. There are several grocery stores and restaurants nearby that are super convenient. But best of all, it was completely quiet when it was time to sleep - no sirens, honking, or intoxicated patrons pouring out of bars in the middle of the night. This is a great place to stay!

Our stay could not have been more pleasant! We checked in at midnight, asked for an upgrade, and were given one! Also, we were both given a glass of champagne and a voucher for a complimentary breakfast! What a welcome!The staff was always helpful, the breakfasts were delicious (be sure to try the sunflower seed bread!). Wonderful coffee! The room was a little funky, but the bathroom was a good size. We will definitely stay here again! Free WiFi. We were on the 18th floor so we had no street noise. What a good deal in NYC!!

Great location in the middle of the Financial district and relatively quiet for being New York. The hotel staff was incredible helpful and made sure we had a great stay. Perfect place for a weekend getaway.

Having had a lot of trouble with the agents we booked with we were more than anxious what to expect from our hotel! But oh what a lovely surprise! We arrived tired after our long journey but were met by lovely reception staff and a glass of bubbly! We were shown to our room which was the best so far I have stayed in the big apple.We had a good nights sleep and had an excellent breakfast in a small intimate restaurant which was so very nice from the sometimes imposing large hotels. The chef brought our huge breakfast to our table and everyone had a big smile and nothing was too much trouble flor them. We also dined in the the Felice restaurant in the evening and although busier and a great atmosphere, we were still well looked after and the food was lovely.The location was good as we had not done that area of NY much before, so a lot quieter but refreshing to come back to after a busy day. There are many restaurants nearby if you don't always want to eat in the hotel.We would definitely recommend this hotel and hope one day to return. Thank you Gild Hall!Jan and Annie

Better late than never. We stayed here for one night but it was "great stay." It was our first time in what's called a boutique hotel. The service at check in was fantastic and they were very accommodating when we asked for a late check out. The room is tight in comparison to your more traditional accommodations but it did not taint our stay. The bed was large and comfy. It had a rather large flat screen television. I read in previous reviews that the bathroom was "very small" but I did not find it to be a problem. There was adequate storage but I could see issues if you were staying for an extended period of time. There is adjoining irestaurant and bar and the food. We had lunch and found the food and service very good.

We were upgraded to the Penthouse as our original room had a problem with heating/air system. The staff were fantastic and the penthouse apartment was an unexpected treat. The rooms included decent books, free WiFi, ample workspace and a lovely soaking tub.

Have been to New York on 3 previous occasions and this is by far the best hotel we have stayed in. The staff are fantastic. We were offered a glass of prosecco whilst checking in and were upgraded as a gesture of goodwill (due to a travel agent nightmare), and everyone went out of their way to make our trip memorable. Rooms are quirky and cosy. Lots of leather and wood and interesting artifacts scattered around. As it was Christmas week there were groups and parties going on which added to the sense of fun in this small and friendly hotel. Great attention to detail, and someone always available to help with whatever you need. You can tell that staff enjoy working there and although we are past our prime we loved the young, happy and fun atmosphere. Breakfast in Felice (see separate review) was great, and we also had a couple of evening meals. Would highly recommend this hotel and will certainly stay again when we next visit New York. Congratulations to all!

Great location for business meetings/vacation in lower Manhattan. Great staff - very welcoming. I recommend this place to my friends and colleagues - for business or vacation stays. Very good restaurant - on site.

This is a funky but nice boutique hotel in a not so touristy part of town. My friend and I had a lovely stay there. The linens were fantastic and the location was exceptionally quiet - because it was the weekend.

Flew with the Dreamliner, norwegianair, excellent service, arrived JFK, that airport is terrible, but when we finally arrived at the hotel, what lovely people, room was amazing, met some lovely people in the bar, breakfasts were to die for, walked miles, definitely recommend the helicopter flight along the Hudson. Hopefully going back in April 2016 to see the other bits.

We found this hotel on Trip Advisor for a business trip and have now made it our go to place to stay when we need to be in New York. Every single staff member I came in contact with was genuinely friendly and helpful. The rooms are so comfortable and well appointed - the books on the shelves are such a nice touch. Very quiet, clean and nicely upgraded. I'm on my way back there today and can't wait to try the restaurant - which I heard was wonderful. This is probably the best hotel I've stayed at in the city. Not only that, but it is very affordable! Love it!

Stayed here whilst away for work, for 5 nights, and it was a great place. Ideal location, cool interior and excellent service/staff. The rooms have a distinctly bachelor feel about them, all leather and wood, so not to everyone's tastes and the bathroom is separated from the room by a glass wall - if you like your privacy it's not ideal. I didn't mind and liked the little touches like USB ports inbuilt in the bedside cabinet for charging your phone.The restaurant downstairs has great food - and it can be ordered to the room. Gorgeous breakfasts and huge pots of coffee! I would recommend for a long weekend with friends (not oozing romance!).

This is the fourth time in NYC and probably my best hotel experience in the Big Apple so far. Amazing room size is well above the average, and is great value for money. It's located in the Financial District, so it's far enough off the beaten path for some peace, but not too far to feel distant from 'the action'.Very helpful staff, a good atmosphere throughout, and a well decorated place in general. We stayed for a week and would definitely recommend this to anyone else.

This hotel is located in the financial district, right near the federal reserve. The staff was friendly and very helpful, and the room was comfortable and functional. Elevators are fast. We didn't eat at the restaurant or visit the bar. I'd recommended this hotel for a stay in lower Manhattan.

Stayed from 8th Dec for 3 nights in a superior king room. Interesting decorations in the hotel. Staff were helpful and friendly. A bit overpriced and not great value for money. The room itself (8th floor near the end) was very dark...so it felt a bit dingy. Going for a vintage look, so expect distressed furnishings if that's your cup of tea. Toiletries were great but that's about it. Just temper expectations and I think this hotel is 'just fine' - nothing special...

The staff treated us like royalty! We mentioned at checkin that we were there for my granddaughter 's 13th bdy. Less than 15 min after we checked in we were delivered a box of Baked By Melissa cupcakes yum! I most highly recommend this hotel !!

I loved this hotel, the staff was so friendly and helpful. Our room was a pleasant surprise, bigger than I expected and the bed was comfortable. Location is great, close to so many attractions, restaurants, subway. I would stay here again and would recommend it. I hadn't stayed in the Financial District before but enjoyed it, quieter than mid town. Enjoy !!

You walk in and are immediately impressed by the lobby decor. From there, it just gets better and better. The service is AMAZING. Shoutout to the entire staff, but David was our main man. Rooms were very comfortable. We had 3 ladies in a double room and were very happy. Looking forward to staying here again!!

Simply, this hotel is very stylish and attractive. The hotel lobby has a sort of '70s outdoorsman catalogue aesthetic. It's hard to explain, and I'm certainly not doing it justice- but it looks cool.When you check in, you're also offered a complimentary drink of the alcoholic variety from the front reception desk. This also is pretty cool. Then, when you get up to your room, you quickly will realize your room is just a room. Nothing too beautiful or particularly noteworthy about it. Furthermore, the bathroom door is corrugated glass, so your partner or whomever you're with can easily see you, leaving little to the imagination. It's highly awkward.Overall, it's a beautiful hotel, but you're certainly paying for it. Two nights set me back about $900 on a Saturday Sunday. I recommend it if you don't mind the cost. But with the cost in mind, I can't say I honestly found it to be worth it. Nonetheless, nothing notably wrong with the place either (other than the bathroom door situation).
user_name:
dmegalos
New York City, New York

review_body: My wife and I spent time in NYC this past weekend. We decided to try a new Thompson Hotel called “Gild Hall”. We were not disappointed. The staff was warm and sincere; the room was well appointed and spot on clean. And the bed was comfortable. We decided to order in and the food and room service was great. Gild Hall – just moved up the list to one of our favorite spots to stay in NYC.

We recently had an enjoyable one night stay while visiting friends in the Battery Park area. Very friendly staff, good sized room and nice lobby. Easy walk over to Wall Street area and the 9-11 Memorial.

My stay here was excellent! I stayed for one night for a special occasion and the staff went above and beyond in making this such a memorable night. The vibe of the hotel is great, rooms are comfortable and big with extremely high ceilings, and the staff was phenomenal. I will definitely be returning.

We stayed at the Gild Hall in November as part of our anniversary weekend in the city. I have nothing but nice things to say. The room was new, modern, clean and comfortable and even a respectable size.The rate was good, the amenities were good and the staff was pleasant. I would stay here again.

Stylish, comfortable and affordable. We had a wonderful stay in this great hotel, the bar has a great selection and great range of drinks, the room was large & comfortable with a really good en suite bathroom. The only downside was when a noisy family were in the hall at midnight and the sound proofing wasn't overly effective.

Just spent three nights over Thanksgiving Weekend at Gild Hall. Have stayed in Manhattan many times but this was the first time in the financial district and we loved it! Hotel and staff could not have been nicer. We were upgraded to a king suite on the 9th floor. Great room and so quiet. (I really appreciate a quiet room) Our stay included breakfast at Felice which was delicious and cooked to order. Had sunflower toast for the first time and now I want to find it a the store. We also had lunch one day at Felice which was also delicious. The location is truly tucked away and you feel like you are in a neighborhood. Great grocery stores near but. Five minute walk to the 911 Museum (be sure to book tickets ahead of time). We went first thing in the morning when they opened and that helped with the crowds. Also explored the historic seaport for the first time and it has a great biking and walking trail along the river. The Fulton subway station is two blocks away and virtually every subway line is served at the station so wherever your plans take you the subway is accessible and easy! We will return and definitely will stay at Gild Hall again. Cheers Gild Hall!

I stayed at Gild Hall when I was in NYC for business and highly recommend this hotel. The location was perfect for my business plans and was also close to restaurants, a couple grocery stores, and other shops. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful by recommending restaurants and giving directions. They offer champagne upon check-in, which was a bonus. The room was clean, comfortable, and nicely decorated.

Excellent service, great location, time to renovate the rooms. Great beds though. Very good location for subway connection. The restaurant is very nice.Poor elevator service, can be enjoying. The biggest minus is that they don't have a proper gym.

We were here for 4 nights - 16.10.15 I deliberately chose this Hotel to be downtown ie to visit 9/11, Wall St, Statute of Liberty & Brooklyn Bridge - which is ideal!The Hotel is well serviced with places to eat and open to all hours which was GREAT!!Staff = very helpful and patient re-info and directions etc.Room was lovely although décor was dark eg no curtains just black vertical wood blinds.It didn't bother us but it might someone else the bathroom was part of the bedroom and was all glass - no sound proof and no privacy at all - although lovely fixtures etc.All in all good stay!!

Gild Hall which is located in a rather congested but historic area of New York proved to be an oasis from the crowds. The lobby and staff provided a warm welcome. The room was spacious by NYC standards and the facility was quiet throughout. We also ate dinner one night in the hotelRestaurant and I was pleased with the waiters willingness to have a specialVariation of a menu item for me.

We stayed here for 7 nights while visiting my sister. The staff were very helpful and polite. Our room was very spacious, bed comfortable and cleaned (with turn down) every day. There is a nice bar and restaurant down stairs but we didn't try the food. My sister came to see the hotel and is now recommending to her friends for when they come to stay. It is close to Faulkner subway station.

The Gild Hall is supposed to be a boutique hotel, and probably it was, in its better days... now, furniture appears more worn-out than vintage, and it definitely needs renovation. Rooms are scarcely illuminated (maybe to hide particulars?) and the general feeling is sad, more than cozy. Not a good value for money, even in the expensive Financial district.

Very cool hotel in a great location in the Financial District. It has a cabin feel with dark wood and amazing bookshelves in the lobby. There's also a restaurant and bar attached where you can have a great happy hour drink. The staff is amazing and super nice. The rooms are typical--- small but lots of character and decor is cool. The ceiling are super high. Very clean, intimate and romantic spot. Close walk to subway and South Street Seaport.
user_name:
deliriouslyhungry
New York City, New York

review_body: This is great little gem in the financial district, wonderful inviting staff, beautiful interior, rooms are nice size and beautifully appointed, everything you need is there. Room service is super prompt and when I needed ice for an ongoing ankle injury they were so accommodating! I will certainly return
user_name:
wbreece R
Chapel Hill, North Carolina

review_body: I stayed away from the Financial District thinking there weren't decent shops or dining, but found that it's centrally located, with quick walks to several metro subway station lines. There are several good coffee shops close by, and decent for breakfast, lunch, though not for dinner. Surprisingly the streets are busy, probably because of the Trade Center Memorial, so it feels quite safe at night.When taking taxis back to the hotel, be specific about where you are going. Took 4 cab rides back to the hotel, and only 1 knew where he was going. Don't state hotel name but major intersection - Platt and William. The hotel entrance is on Platt.The rooms themselves were clean, quiet, and well designed.I would definately stay again.

Room was nice and clean. I liked the high ceilings, large flatscreen TV and there was good wifi coverage. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful with an early check-in and arranging a car service. The restaurant and bar were also nice for dinner and lunch. Would definitely stay again.

As you walk in the front door you are greeted with wall to wall books and a beautiful "lodge" feel but in the heart of the city! The staff was amazing and most helpful with everything we needed. Traveled there for a weekend getaway and can't wait to go back to stay here!

Recently came back from a 5 night stay here at Gild Hall with my girlfriend. From the moment we had arrived to the moment we checked out, staff were readily available to answer any questions. Staff provided us with a few hidden spots to check out and how to get around the city. Some notable landmarks close to the hotel include: Freedom Tower, Wall Street, SoHo, Brooklyn Bridge, and much more due to the close proximity of subway service available nearby to the hotel. Rooms were big for new york standards and very reasonably priced. (Some of the staff had joked that rooms offered by the hotel were bigger compared to their own personal apartments.) Overall if I do go back to New York I will definitely come back to this location and would definitely recommend others to book here at this hotel as well. Some of the amazing staff here at Gild Hall which we would like to thank in making our trip truly unforgettable include: Cyma, Violet, Jessica, Monique, Mark, Paulina, Khloe, Max, Rob, Andy, Angel and Thupton!

I wondered if this place would look as great as the photos--it does. The lobby and restaurant are warm and inviting and make you want to linger there with drinks and good conversation. My first impression: old, cool and funky--very masculine. The location can be tricky for taxis / hired cars to find, but it was very convenient for my Financial District meetings / quick work trip to NYC and I found this property to be quiet and comfortable overall.I had a pretty small room at the dead end of the hall. This made it very quiet for sleeping but was a bit dark because it just had one window. The fittings of the room impressed me with their detail, style and quality--from the leather headboard with a cool kind of "belt" on it, to the mirror, to the desk and large, mounted flat screen TV. The bathroom also had nice finishes and quality products. One small note due to the room size: working at the desk with the TV on is a bit odd because they're so close to each other. The staff were helpful and the room service dinner was tasty. I'll definitely be back, and I want to try other rooms that may have more windows and a higher ceiling. This is a cool place place for work or for a leisure trip.

Hotel was suggested by Wedding family. Reasonable rate for NYC. Tucked away in financial district. No cabs from Hotel so UBER, a must! Rooms neat clean and medium size. Bathroom small but well lit. Had to call desk for robes as none in the room. My sister-in-law had to do same for her room. Staff friendly and helpful. As it turned out, we could have probably stayed anywhere in Manhattan for the wedding. Rather to have been in Midtown as can always walk around and shop or window shop there. I would recommend Hotel if one has business in the financial district.

We live in Brooklyn but wanted to treat ourselves to one hotel night after getting married at Brooklyn City Hall. This was the perfect spot! They even left a bottle of prosecco in the room for us, a very nice touch.

Gild Hall is a real find. Great vibe right away in the intimate lobby area with attached bar.playing jazz, low level lighting and a complimentary glass of prosecco upon check in. Rooms are good sized and quiet with a real nice layout and big screen tv. All for a very reasonable amount although it is in the financial district.

How could you Beat this place in downtown NYC. You can't! Reasonable price, great location, delicious food. Only issue is that the didn't offer a glass of sparkling wine this time when I checked in? Rooms are small, but it's NYC so par for the course. See you next time.

Great hotel a couple of blocks from Lower Broadway and WTC. Perfect location for business or vacation interests in lower Manhattan. Incredible lobby. well sized rooms. The staff was incredibly helpful and responded well to any questions or requests I had. Would come back in a heartbeat

Stayed over a weekend for a conference. Location is good in the financial district, its quiet on weekends, but there is some life, and nice restaurants, seaport is nearby and walkable to Battery Park. Really friendly helpful service, always attentive at the lobby bar, at the checkout/concierge and in Felice the restaurant. The food in Felice was really very good and the vibe, an industrial lodge mellow vibe, was REALLY pleasant and inviting.We were in a deluxe room which I found very small. The bed was large and comfortable with a super large flat screen tv, pretty good bedside lighting. A desk and outlets for recharging behind the desk were across the room. The room was pleasant though dark, both because of the brown decor and the small amount of light which makes it through the NYC high rise canyons to the one window in the room. Storage though was really tight, nothing to put a suitcase on, so mine simply lay on the floor for the weekend (a luggage holder or bench at the end of the bed would go a long way!) The closet was very small, with doors that were awkward to move, and with the room mostly taken up by mini-bar and glass storage. Bathroom was a decent size but not a lot of storage room for toiletries. While I generally enjoyed staying in the area, I found our room , a Deluxe King, a little too small for a repeat visit to that room at any rate.Wifi was excellent. If doing theatre in midtown its a long trip so take that into account. Cabs in the area may be an issue at times but if you use Uber that will help.

This hotel makes you feel like you have your own apartment in New York. The guestrooms have hardwood floors, tall ceilings, and layouts that work with the slightly quirky old building. The bar and restaurant are intimate. The lobby is cozy. And the unique historical/retro photographs add a layer of decoration that is much more interesting than the usual over-design that is so common in a more boutique type hotel. The hotel is on a quiet corner, but is a short walk to Wall Street, the Battery, the World Trade Center, and Tribeca. And if you want to eat like a local, the Pearl Street Diner is just two blocks away.

The term "boutique" is often used to describe a certain type of hotel - unique, friendly, intimate, welcoming. Gild Hall is all that and then some. A weekend visiting NYC with my wife - the location is excellent.Convenient to many subway lines and also found that if we arranged for an Uber as we left the room, the car was waiting for us at the door. The Finance District area has its own unique charm on the weekends and the South Street Seaport is just around the corner. The staff is welcoming, personable and very helpful. The glass of Prosecco is a nice touch but would feel "gimmicky" if not accompanied by a true human touch. The lobby is small, quiet, easy to navigate. The room was large with high ceilings, large, up-to-date flat screen TVs, fridge, microwave, safe. The bathroom was modern and spacious. The bed / linens comfortable and the rooms quiet. The free wifi worked well and was easy to sign on. There are several small gyms - the one we used was well equipped and more than adequate.All in all, a great stay at a very nice boutique hotel in the Financial District. Looking forward to a return visit.

Our first kid-free weekend in four years was chosen to be spent in lower Manhattan and we found very good reviews of Guild Hall. With my wife's previous stays in NY involving tiny rooms and sketchy service, we were encouraged by the reviews and web site. Our trip out was tough; a two-hour delay at the airport and a slow train from Newark to Penn Station. We arrived at the hotel just at 10 and were presented with a very gratefully received glass of Prosecco. We asked if the restaurant was still open and our host checked to see if they could accommodate us. Well, they kept the kitchen open while we ran up to the room and back down for a delicious pasta meal. Absolutely superb! The room, when we got back up to appreciate it, was spacious and modern; very comfortable. The next night, after dinner out, of all the places to choose for after dinner drinks, we came back to the Gild Hall and had a great night! Great food, good drink, wonderful staff and a very clean and comfortable room. We know where we're staying next time we get away (though hopefully it won't take another four years!)

Great hotel with kind, friendly staff whonwent above and beyond to make our girls weekend something special for us! Thank you! Trendy, but still appropriate for older kids! We really had a great time... It was convenient to find great places to eat, too!

For a 4.5 star hotel, and a Thompson Hotel at that, they are falling drastically short on customer service. The Prosecco glass upon arrival was a nice touch, but that is where the positive ends. When we got into the room we noticed a very heavy cigarette smoke smell. I was firstly worried that we would be charged for smoking in the room so we decided to tell the front desk. It was everywhere, in the bathroom, in the towels, sheets and the blanket. When leaving for dinner, I spoke with the front desk and his reaction was "Can I go to your room to see?" Well, I suppose, but that's strange. If I say it smells, then it does. After coming back he had said he sprayed deodorizer and that it was 'all better'. I realized that night when taking a shower that it was coming from the vent in the shower. I called downstairs again and we were told that we would be moved the next day. Next day comes around and we were promised an 'upgrade' and to the 14th floor but just 5 minutes later we were told that we would be on the 18th floor. While being escorted to our new room, the bellman informed me that the cigarette smoke is from the neighbors and it was a well known problem. WHY did the front desk request to go to my room to smell said aroma? Why not just move us? Unfortunately, when we walked in it was the exact same room. No upgrade because they evidently didn't have one to give. If you're not a cigarette smoke connoisseur then I would definitely request to not be on the 4th floor.

There is a reason I like to stay at chain hotels. Ritz, Marriott, Hilton, Four Seasons. You know exactly what you are going to get. Consistency is the name of the game. Boutique hotels on the other hand are a hit or a miss kind of deal. This applies to Gild Hall to a great extent. I also feel that Trip Advisor has let me down for the first time ever. I rely on the site and usually properties ranked high on Trip Advisor are worth staying at. Not so much this time around.Location - financial district. I don't have a problem with it. Close to Wall Street, Battery Park and close to the subway stop.Property - former Holiday Inn site, fifteen stories has seen better days. Dark almost black carpet, small room with no view even though we were on floor # 12, tiny bathroom, forget about a separate shower stall, forget about dual sinks. Glass doors into the bathroom leave little to imagination. In a word, dreary. I understand Thompson group bought this property from Holiday Inn about 8 years ago but they have not done much with the interior of the hotel. Shabby is another word that comes to mind. At $320 per night plus tax I prefer anything but shabby.Cheap pillows, thin towels, did I mention the black carpet? Positives, huge TV in the room, nice front desk staff. No bellboy. Restaurant Felicity was ok for breakfast.We were in NYC last time back in 2011 and stayed at Sofitel which I loved. This time Sofitel has gone off the deep end and wanted to charge $750 for the room so we ended up at Gild. In retrospect I should have spent a hundred dollars more per night and stayed at Ritz Carlton Battery Park.Hotel is ranked very high on Trip Advisor (38 out of 1400 NYC hotels) but I believe this to be misleading at the very least and I can think of at least a hundred better hotels in New York City. Stay away.

I came in to town with friends and my now husband so we could elope and spend Halloween in the city this past week. Half of our friends stayed at the hotel and the others stayed else where yet we all ended up spending our time here. The decor of the hotel is fantastic and it even has an amazing smell that you get no matter what part of the hotel your in. The bar has a great selection of alcohol and mix cocktail drinks. The only thing we didn't try was the hotel restaurant which we will next time. Checking in was really easy as we were able to check in ahead of time and pick our preference for a room (quiet, high floor, etc). One of our friends who came early was able to have early check in (around 12:30pm) which was amazing that they were able to accommodate for her like that. That's something we typically don't experience with other hotels. The actual rooms are really nice and are a typical size for NY. It has a huge flat screen and the beds are extremely comfortable. The only downside that we saw was the bathroom. The actual bathroom is nice but the doors, like other reviewers have said, leaves little to the imagination. The shower is small as well, in the rooms with the standard tub/showers. The shower head was probably one of the worst I've had in a hotel. It was old so it just pointed down and the pressure was really screwy. I hope that in the regular rooms that they would upgrade at least the shower head. All in all we definitely want to make this our go to hotel for when we're in NYC. It has a great value and its on par with hotels that aren't as nice as it. One more thing to note is because we were in town to get married we had mentioned it to the hotel. After we had checked in and left to get get dinner we arrived back to a bottle of their house champagne and a nice note congratulating us. We thought that was a nice touch and they did something once again not other hotels typically do. We hope that they continue on like this because we'd love to keep coming back.

the lobby was intimate and inviting, the staff was energetic and friendly. beautiful environment, was offered prosecco upon arrival. Rooms exceeded expectations- l loved the high ceilings! will definitely stay here again

Fabulous hotel, friendly and helpful staff, given a triple upgrade to a suite. Great size for New York, fashionable but stylish decor, very comfortable bed. Few miles to midtown Broadway etc, but lovely and quiet for that reason, easy to get around on foot, bus or train/ subway,plenty of restaurants close by. New One World Trade centre and viewing tower nearby and 9/11 memorial both should be visited- incredible. Would defo recommend and would stay again

Trendy establishment, excellent front desk and restaurant service, roomy well appointed rooms. Yes, I said roomy, (for NYC) a definite plus. Quiet with little weekend outside noise, although walls are not sound proof so a rude guest can be heard if you are unlucky to bunk near one. Walking distance to Battery Park, Wall Street, piers. Stayed with our 2-year old and the staff did not bat an eye, offered us a crib and spoke to her when they encountered her. Felice, the bar and restaurant serves very good Italian fair. Get the room w/breakfast, excellent deal. A glass of prosecco at arrival. We'll be back...

We stayed here the night of our wedding, five years ago, and we returned to stay this weekend. What a wonderful night!! Anthony and Andy were at the front desk and they were so very helpful and kind. The rooms are beautiful, clean and spacious. The bathroom is to die for! I can't rave enough about this hotel. Still spectacular five years later!

Welcomed at check-in with a glass of prosecco! Our large suite was clean and perfectly appointed. The evening turned down service included closing the blinds and leaving a basket of fruit and chilled champagne. The staff was more than accommodating and came to my aid with chamomile tea in the middle of the night when I could sleep due to a stress induced headache. Thank you for making it a pleasant and memorable stay for a bride and groom!
user_name:
WhitneyB357
New York City, New York

review_body: Highly recommend. A lovely, stylish room, with huge TV. It's a perfect gateway to a fascinating area of NYC that I hadn't previously explored. There is easy access to Brooklyn Bridge (highly recommend a walk across it), Seaport area and Fulton Street markets.

i tend to travel a lot for work and relaxation but till now I've never felt compeld to comment on a hotel witch I've stayed. So ill start with the main point the staff witch are extremely kind and so so friendly. it seem each one of the staff relish the opportunity to help. but i have to say this is no more apparent then with Robbert and Violet and for me its normally about the people why i visit a city. and my return to this Hotel will be in part h to do with the two members of staff i have mentioned. the other things would be the location its all with in walking distance Subway / Dry Cleaners / Wall Street / Bars / Restaurants / Chemist / and oh the site seeing. the layout and decor of this building is such a long way a way from the norm cooky cutter feel of must Hotels of witch I've stayed.the attention to detail is just so refreshing. i always say when asking someone about if there brake was any good you just need to ask one thing. WOULD YOU GO BACK. and for me its Definitely Yesand as for Robbert and Violet thanks agin for being so so help full with places to see and eat. oh and the Cooky Place oh wow thanks again. i think a Pay Rise is in order.
user_name:
Pablo B
Greater London, United Kingdom

review_body: We found the staff were Super friendly and the free sparkling wine at checkin was a treatGreat sized room and all very clean and stylish There is quite a unique feel to this hotelHighly recommended for a short stay in the city Walking distance to the tourist spots in this end of town

Stayed 2 nights, super amazing. The room was perfectly clean and equipped with high quality free wifi. I joined conference call via the hotel wifi and it was so smooth. The breakfast I had at the restaurant was also great.

I stayed at Gild Hall for three nights with my mom in the beginning of October. I booked online directly through Gild Hall. We stayed in the King Superior room.Pros:-Location is nice, walking distance to subway stops and nearby markets that open late. The 9/11 Memorial and World Trade Center are within walking distance.-Design of hotel and room was fantastic, and it was very clean.-Size of the room was fairly spacious, and the amenities were a nice touch (a hearty shout out to the Frette and Sferra bathrobes!). They do have a $12 Dollar Shave Club kit available for purchase, but I do wish that they had provided lower end razors for free.-I was able to check in online after receiving an email from them- super convenient! You can even communicate with them via text before you arrive.-The attached restaurant is tasty, and the complimentary breakfast we received was delicious.-I slept very well, and the room and lobby were quiet for the duration of our stay.-Free wifi for up to two devices, but it was unreliable at times. -The Business Center provided free Boarding Pass access and printing.-Management was receptive via email prior to stay.-The Front Desk held our luggage after check out, so that we could roam the city for a few hours before our flights.Cons:-The location is a bit confusing, and made it hard for cabs to find us when we called them to the hotel.-We noticed the first night that the thermostat was not working, and we were very cold the first evening/morning. When I called the front desk, they sent up a technician, who informed us that the heating for the entire building was not working, and would not be working for a while because they hadn't turned it on. They provided an extra blanket and a portable heater instead, but I don't believe the heating was turned on for the entire duration of our stay. The shower also had erratic heating, and would get extremely hot and random times.-Management told me that they would provide breakfast for us for every morning of our stay, but when we arrived, we only received vouchers for one morning.-The hotel was aware that we were traveling to commemorate a special occasion, but we didn't receive champagne like others traveling to celebrate, nor did we receive any upgrades (even though the hotel seemed fairly empty). All in all, I'd stay at Gild Hall again if we see a good deal online. I'd probably opt for a nicer room to get the full experience. Thanks, Gild Hall!

Our room was divine! Arrived prior to check in and room was not made up - so we went for a drink! When we 'mentioned' this..on our return, the room was made up of course...and a basket of goodies was sent up....completely not necessary (as we were early)...just thought this was lovely! Also, when returning on Saturday night after dinner...we were greeted at the front desk with a glass of Prosecco to take up to the room! WHO DOES THIS! ...overall...a fabulous hotel that treats you like GOLD!

Room ticked all the boxes, clean, spacious and well equipped. Front desk responded promptly to any requests. All staff encountered were accommodating and very friendly. Exceptional service by the young lady waitressing at breakfast. Can't fault. Would definitely use this hotel again.

What a nice hotel. Loved the sparkling wine when we arrived. Loved the rooms. They were roomy and I didn't mind the glass bathroom door except when we were in our friends room but not a big deal. Wish I had gotten to try the wine. I will be back though.

Booked here when in town on business, and I was happily surprised at what I got based on the location and rate. The space was formerly a lesser brand chain, so I was reluctant. Instead I walked in to a nicely-designed lobby (and a glass of proseco upon check in!) and a small, but well done guest room. Everything about it gave a sense a warmth while being right in the middle of the financial district. I would recommend for business travelers but also for couples who aren't looking to be stuck in the swirl of the heavy tourist areas. I would not recommend for families. The place is great, but families are just not the target. You can easily walk to the WTC and the Statute of Liberty ferry. Otherwise, the rest of the city is easily accessible from the couple different subway stops that are close.

I have been to New York my first time in April 2015 with my girlfriend and I stayed for 6 nights at The Gild Hall hotel.The hotel is located at gold st. in the financial district, walking distance to the world trade center, to the river hudson where you can take the ferry going to the liberty statue.7 minute walking to the tube station where you can take the train going up to central park or 5th avenue.The hotel was great; we arrived around 23:00 and the guys at the front desk helped us doing the check in and answered to my questions.We had a king premium room, spacious and clean.We had a complimentary drink at the bar where a lovely lady served us a really nice sprits.The hotel has a small gym and you can find the ice machine on the floors.At the end I have to say that I did the right choice.High recommend!!!!

This hotel was beautiful. It has a fabulous traditional setting with a modern twist. My boyfriend and I like to sneak off into the city for a night or two. Hotel is clean and comfortable: they greeted us with champagne when we arrived. My only complainant was the room-service breakfast. It wasn't very good, but the manager totally took care of us, which made the situation so much better because we were about to pay $60 for a horrible breakfast. There also weren't comfy robs (a must for me) in the room, but like the breakfast, the staff fixed that right away. Overall it was we had a fabulous stay.

This place is amazing. I was blown away by the decor/ambiance, but most of all by the incredibly kind and generous the people who work here. Anthony, the manager, is honestly one of the best people I've ever talked to in NYC. I woke up early to explore the hotel and wandered down to the lobby where we had a fantastic conversation about our lives. Throughout, it became clear that he strives to provide the best guest experience possible, through small things like their complimentary prosecco to suggestions for fun, unexpected nearby outings. Obviously, I'm coming back, to hang with Anthony and enjoy the beauty and goodness that is the Gild Hotel

We went to the Gild for our first time in New York. The hotel was swank, clean and comfortable. It was my fiance's birthday, the staff really went out of their way to make it memorable. We had a delisious happy hour and breakfast. The hotel was actually one of our favourite parts of our trip to New York. This is a MUST STAY!!!!

The hotel is nice, in the sense that you will not hate it, but will not love it. Room is small but well lit and clean, but the king bed is more like a "mini king". Reception desk is super nice, and all requests are timely and professionally looked after- in regardless of the shift, they were all nice, professional and efficient. Gym is not a gym, it is a little exercise room and this should be disclosed when you book it... but the really bad surprise is the breakfast- although the restaurant is nice and the menu is all right, service is rude and food below average, with the wrong attitude.

We recently had our wedding at Snug Harbor in Staten Island and most of our out of town guests and bridal party stayed at the Gild Hall hotel. This was a great location as everyone could take the ferry over to the venue really easily. The staff was phenomenal and helped all our Canadian and out of town guests get used to the big apple. Everyone was happy with their rooms and we made use of the penthouse suite as our bridal suite. It was awesome and was spacious enough for all the wedding party to get their hair and makeup done there. Our families hosted a number of meals at the Felice restaurant over the wedding week and were well treated, enjoyed the food and wine, and loved the staff. They gave us a great wedding block rate and were in constant contact up to the wedding providing guest counts and help with coordination. They delivered our gift bags to our guests and helped getting people taxis when needed. Our contact with Leah and she was really professional and easy to work with. The Gild was the perfect hotel to meet our guests needs and we would recommend them to anyone.

The room was a good size for NYC. The mattress and bedding were excellent. We had difficulty adjusting the water temp in the shower due to the unique faucets. Cute but tough to see the little blue and red lines without glasses on! We had a large group staying in the hotel for our son's wedding. Everyone raved about the hotel, hotel staff, restaurant and room service. My brother in laws loved the chess board in the lobby too!

Once again on a work trip, this hotel was a very pleasant surprise. Ideally located for Wall St (and PACE University in my case) it offers quirky rooms which are larger than my typical experience of NY coupled with a very pleasant bar with friendly and talkative staff (a real bonus when travelling solo). For the same price as a faceless identikit Marriott or Hilton I'd very much rather stay here...

WOW, the Gild staff was great from the moment we arrived until our departure. They anticipated our needs, handled numerous requests and made us feel like part of their family. The rooms were very comfortable and service was great. Meals in Felice restaurant, room service and private functions were delicious, served with elegance and staff was so gracious and accomodating. Great knowledge of wine pairings. Very informed about what to see in NYC. The stay for our family and friends was amazing and the compliments to the Gild staff were numerous. We would definitely recommend the Gild and will be regular guests when we stay in NYC>

I believe my rating is based upon my taste in hotels. First, the good news is that the staff there was great. They were kind and very helpful with a very late check-in. Also, after stating my displeasure for my room, they immediately changed my room to another. Last, the lobby was warm and comfortable. Now, in regards to the room, I was unimpressed. First, it is quite dark and gloomy. Secondly, it seemed like the room was dirty, as the furnishings were old looking and I was afraid to walk barefoot on the carpet, as it seemed like it could be dirty (although I saw no visible dirt). Simply put, I did not like the style and was not my taste. If you prefer bright interiors & bed coverings with a clean feel, this may not be the place for you. That's just my opinion, although I know many people loved this hotel. After my first night, I switched to a different hotel, which was the same price off of Time Square and was much nicer!

The room was a nice size,very clean,nicely decorated.The only negative aspect I have to mention is the super noisy A/C unit.And the noise from the building on Pratt (their ventilation system was even noisier then the A/C unit in the room).The restaurant downstairs(Felice) is very good.The hotel staff was moderately friendly.

I don't know I can possibly do justice to the staff of the Gild hotel with this review; they have treated me so well I feel like I am reviewing my friends. I finished my second stay at Gild this summer, a little over 3 weeks at the hotel, and since then I've been trying to come up with words that can adequately describe the efforts of everyone at Gild to a person reading Trip Advisor.A bit about me. I am a teacher and I travel quite a bit during my spare time. I pay for each trip by myself, and I wanted to make the distinction because a lot of people who travel do so on business, where their employers pay the bills. I pay my own, and choose my hotels for the experiences that they provide as much as the cities that I choose to travel to. In the past I've spent time in Jamaica, Miami, Las Vegas, Los Angeles but mostly I go to New York, where in December of 2004 I first stayed at the 60 Thompson and was introduced to the Thompson brand. This was such a great experience for me, the Thompson hotel's seem to highlight all the things that I value in a hotel. I prefer boutique hotels that are unique and each have their own personality. Locations that are in stylish areas that are convenient for nice restaurants and most importantly I appreciate staff that are genuine in how they treat you. Places where the staff are unafraid to show their own personalities and interact with the guests. These are aspects where the Thompson hotel group have always outperformed and reasons why they have earned my business in any city that they operate. I first stayed at the Gild in late December of 2014 for a New Year’s trip and even within the high degree of satisfaction that the Thompson group provides, the team at Gild had set new standards in what a boutique hotel should strive for. You can read my previous reviews within Trip Advisor but if I can highlight one particular point, I was already planning my return trip, even prior to checking out. Most travellers tend to become "homesick" at some points of their stay; the people at Gild are so fantastic they make me never want to leave. Leading up to the summer the Canadian dollar had plummeted and it looked like my trip was in jeopardy but Gild was very generous with me and gave me great rate to help me come back. They were so accommodating and I am so appreciative of Mr. Koster, he really valued me staying with Gild. If you have read any reviews of Gild you will read about the fantastic front desk staff. Their location within the hotel is fitting as they are the heart of Gild. You will never meet a more dedicated team of professionals. When you stay at a hotel for the time that I have you have the opportunity to see many employees work above and beyond the aspects of their job and without exaggeration David and his crew take that extra step everyday. The friendliness that Monique and Khloe put into every request is genuine. It does not matter to them if you are staying at the hotel for your tenth time or your first, every guest is the most important person and they give 100% of their attention and effort to every request. Max and Violet take a genuine interest in everyone and truly contribute far more to the hotel than their job could possibly require. And Pauline and Jessica were great too, they both really treated me well. All the front desk staff are fantastic people and I feel like they are friends. When is the last time someone at a hotel has made you feel this way?Speaking of friends, the bellman here are awesome! Being in and out of the hotel several times a day gave me plenty of contact with them and they made me feel at home. So nice to be able to talk for a few minutes with them about anything. Sports, New York, weather, these are a great group of guys who work hard for all the guests. Thanks so much to Andy, Angel, Mark and Robert. Behind the scenes the staff were just as hard working. My room was always cleaned perfectly and I was very very happy with my housekeepers. Thanks to both of them for how they took care of my room and belongings. As far as the location of hotel itself Gild is fantastic. Being in lower Manhattan you can get anywhere in the city with ease as you have virtually every subway line within a two block radius. The FiDi district is quite residential but I enjoyed the quiet area and a fun restaurant or a bar is just a quick 5 min trip on any subway. Plus i loved walking around the area and looking at all the buildings that are part of New York’s great history. But you don’t HAVE to leave the neighborhood, Stone Street is quite fun and there are a number of restaurants and bars all around the hotel, not to mention Felice within the hotel. Lots to do around the hotel too. I think One World Trade is a must see and I find the 9/11 memorial quite beautiful. The south street seaport is nice to see and great for jogging but I also really liked the Battery Park esplanade and the new restaurants in Brookfield place.The hotel itself is very stylish and really well constructed. The lobby and public spaces are very sexy and have character. The atmosphere of the hotel was perfect for me, and the music always seemed to be suited to whatever time of day it was. I like the decor of the hotel (it really suits the FiDi area), and the rooms are stylish and beautiful (and easily the largest that you will find for the price in NYC). People who value this hotel will be both stylish travelers as well as first time NYC visitors. I think it’s pretty special that a hotel can maintain such a high Trip Advisor rank with so many reviews; usually hotels that have been around for this many reviews tend to drop down a bit. What sets Gild apart from other hotels is the incredibly talented and hardworking staff. Without them, the hotel is just a cool building in a great location, and frankly there are many of these in New York. It is the combined efforts of those within the hotel which create that special environment that keeps me and others coming back. And as long as that remains intact, I will be staying at Gild whenever I am able.

I visited New York to do business there and my company could not choose better hotel than this one:) very nice and clear rooms, kind staff, near to everything actually if you are doing financial business in that district.

A great combination of fancy and business in the middle of Manhattan. Went there for business and had a lovely staying. Great food at the restaurant Felice. Comfortable bed. Nice staff. For the location, it is close to financial district and waLking distance of the World Trade Center. Would definitely recommend it.

We just stayed with my husband at Gild Hall and it was an amazing experience. We were greeted with prosecco when we checked in and by an amazing staff. The rooms were spacious and very clean. And the chocolates during the evening room service were delicious. We cant wait to go back and bring our friends and family with us.

If you just got out of prison and are use to people watching as you go to the bathroom, this is the place for you. The trendy designers who thought this place up went too far with the glass door and glass wall that allows your every move (no pun intended) to be seen by your roommate. I'm sure they have a solid wall and door on their bathroom at home! We have been married for 26 years and found this design unsettling, never mind how a couple going away on a get to know you trip would handle it! In my mind nothing else maters if you are not comfortable. A great location, superior customer service, far-out whimsical trendiness all take a backseat to the basic reason one rents a room. It is to feel like you have a home away from home. When we brought up our uneasiness with the glass wall and glass door we were asked politely if we desired to have the engineer address the issue. The last thing I wanted was another person in the bathroom. The hotel attendant made it seem as if we were the only ones that like a little privacy when nature calls.Note to the trendy designers:If the rug was a lighter color all the dirt in the corners and against the walls would not show as mentioned in other reviews. I know that the manager or representative from the hotel will respond to this entry as they do with all but unless they can assure me that the bathroom walls have been boarded up in all the rooms I will not be staying at Gild Hall on my next visit.

Stayed here for 3 nights and were pleasantly surprised with the hotel. It has a rustic feel in the heart of the Financial District. Had a good size room, the staff were friendly and the drinks were great at the bar. The hotel was sold out but you couldn't tell by the quietness when in the room. We would definitely stay here again.

Two nights over the weekend. Good location, I like being away from the tourist areas. More professional service maybe? Good quick check-in after a long trip. Upper level room was great for 2 days. It's wasn't large but perfectly adequate. I liked the room some might not, it was quirky but I like that it's a personal taste I suppose. The restaurant was good, pasta excellent nice bar area. We went twice!! Breakfast good.Overall modern sleek professional.Would I stay again Yes Recommended

Stayed here for only one night but enjoyed every minute. Beautifully appointed lobby and rooms were spacious, clean, and had a well stocked mini bar with snacks. No coffee maker in room and didn't notice a coffee bar in lobby. On a side street so noise is at a minimum, although construction at every turn. Staff was exceedingly friendly. Pricey all around, but room was large, which isn't the norm for NYC. Didn't like the opaque glass walls for the bathroom walls, light was a bother if you get up and the other person is still sleeping, light and shadows are visible. Would stay again if doing business in that area if town.

Great location in the financial district, away from the hustle of Times Square etc. We were in New York for a wedding and it was used by many guests who were all pleased with the rooms, staff, and smal but very adequate and very good restaurant.
user_name:
Janice M
Greater London, United Kingdom

review_body: Just returned from new York and stayed at the gild hall, got too say, what a great stay, from the moment we got there, we were given a great room by frank, and found all the amineties excellent, a special mention for Rob who looked after me when I took I'll, he was outstanding. The hotel is in the lower end of town, and perfect, close to everything, I have no hesitation to go back there. In fact all staff had a good get up and go attitude.

The service is great and people at reception are very friendly, especially Anthony. The room worth that money. I really enjoyed staying in that hotel, and I will certainly stay there on my next visit. I just enjoyed the stay in Gild hall.

This hotel was a terrific find down near the financial district. We were able to get two rooms at a very inexpensive price. The decor is modern, crisp and clean with a barn-shabby twist. The staff is great. Rooms are comfortable, attractive and clean. The bar and restaurant on site is a great bonus for a small boutique-type hotel. I will definitely stay here again!

The room was the perfect size, beautiful bathroom, and very friendly staff. There was also a small bar in the room but it's additional charge if you decide to use it. Definitely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in NYC!
user_name:
Joong Y
New York City, New York

review_body: If you have the chance, book it! The service is amazing. The front desk team are the friendliest you will find in the city.The rooms are large in NYC standards. The bathrooms can use some upgrading but all in all great place for a week's stay in NYC with friendly and helpful staff!

I stayed here a few months back. No complaints about anything. The room was fairly large. The bathroom had a modern feel. The hotel was clean. If you are looking for a less busy area of NYC to stay this may be for you. We usually stay more midtown so this was a big adjustment for us mainly to find food late at night and the cab rides to different places cost more due to a farther ride. Cool place to stay though.

I can't say enough nice things about the hotel. The staff were amazing and the location was perfect. It is literally steps from Fulton subway station which pretty much can bring you ANYWHERE in Manhattan. It is walking distance to Wall street and the 9/11 memorial. You'll end up going to these places anyways so why pay to stay in midtown. It is literally about a 10 min subway ride to the High Line and maybe 15 min max to Times Square. My one minor complaint to keep it real - the room could have been vacuumed a bit better, you can see they don't get into the corners/around furniture legs. But seriously, stay here. Its great. And ask for Victoria she is fantastic!! This is a boutique hotel done right. No need to be an anonymous guest in a large hotel when you are a city swarming with people. This is cozy and friendly in the heart of NYC.

Reserved two rooms at the Gild Hall and was pleasantly surprised the hotel had a rustic feel to it. Staff was great and the rooms were spacious and very comfortable. Great location, lot less busy then Times Square. On our annual trip to NY we will definitely stay there again.

Max is the best!!! Friendly, smart, very helpful - greeted us & took very good care of us. Take his suggestions on where to go - he is spot on.A terrific place to stay to visit the Battery Park, Wall Street area. We walked to our sunset cruise as well as our Ellis Island Ferry to do some exploring. We are native NYers & have stayed at quite a few mid-town hotels. This hotel is a great value by comparison. Also the food at Felice (attached restaurant) is quite good & the service was attentive without being intrusive. Kudos to all!!!

I was a last minute checkin to this hotel since I ended up staying late at work during a very busy week. Upon Checkin I met Anthony at the Front Desk and he was terrific in handling the process. He was very efficient and quite accommodating in helping with my request. This Hotel is hidden down in the finacial district of New York and has a lot of charm and comfort for those who search it out.  Ask for Anthony when you check-in. He will make your time in New York even more enjoyable that you possibly thought.
user_name:
patrick d
New York City, New York

review_body: The Gild Hall hotel was a small, very nice hotel, in a quiet spot in the Financial District in NYC. It turned out to be an awesome location with great accommodations. We walked to the 9/11 Museum and to the Ellis Island tour boats. We took the subway to the noisier areas like Times Square. Great little, quiet, affordable places to eat near by. The room was surprisingly quiet. Our room was right by the elevator and we never heard any foot traffic and we heard no noise from the street. The staff was very personable as you came and went. It worked out perfectly as I had never stayed in this location.

I came here with my family for a long trip and we loved our stay. The room was quiet, great and everyone was so nice and helpful, especially Anthony! Anthony rocks, he is the best manager and helped us with all of our needs during our stay. Highly recommended!
user_name:
Jason G
New York City, New York

review_body: Boutique styling in reception. Staff very helpful. Lovely room, restaurant really good and convenient location in financial district, close to underground station for ease of travel - what more do you want!
