Nice rooms, great ambiance, helpful staff in the financial district. And the restaurant, Felice, has amazing food (and did a fantastic job accommodating my son's food allergies) The rooms were nicely sized for NYC and the TV was huge too! And our room had a 12 foot ceiling!

On a recent weekend visit to New York, we stayed at The Gild Hall for one night and were suitably impressed.We arrived before check-in time, intending to just leave our bags securely before heading out. However, our room was ready and we received a warm welcome at reception. We found the staff at The Gild Hall to be pleasant and it was a real bonus to be able to put things straight into our room.The room we had was on the tenth floor and by New York standards, was spacious. There was plenty of room for us. Everything was clean, so absolutely no complaints there! Because of the hotel's location, there was no noise from the street during the night, which was another plus for us.At the weekend it is possible to get a good deal at The Gild Hall because it is in The Financial District which, as 'tourists', we didn't find to be a problem at all. The 9/11 Memorial and The Brooklyn Bridge are within easy walking distance, as are Battery Park and Hudson River Park. If you need to use the subway, that too is a short walk. Getting up to Midtown is easy. Personally, I think you get more for your money by staying at The Gild Hall rather than opting for more obvious Manhattan locations. Starbucks, a liquor store and a small grocery store are all a few minutes walk away.Very minor criticisms would be the lack of complimentary bottled water. Also, basic internet access is free but an upgrade has to be paid for. The bathroom towels could be a bit fluffier and we only had one robe in the room although, to be fair, we didn't bother to ask for a second one because I am sure if we had, it wouldn't have been a problem.I would certainly recommend The Gild Hall to friends and when we return to New York it would be somewhere that I would book again.

This was my first time at Gild Hall. I took my 10 yr old daughter to NYC for her birthday and booking this hotel was the best decision I made. Entire staff treated her like a princess and even sent up cupcakes to our room on our first night (we stayed 3 nights). Amazing room, beyond comfortable bed, and I just loved the ambience of the lobby, bar, and hotel restaurant. Hotel staff during our stay were so accommodating and friendly and that really made an impact on our NYC experience.

I have stayed at Gild 4 times in the past two months. Each time has been a great experience. The staff is very attentive and courteous. The rooms are large for NYC, clean, and stylish. The lobby is both sheik and comfortable, and the restaurant onsite is authentic and service forward. I can not imagine staying anywhere else in FiDi and this property would even make me consider staying in FiDi when not on business. It is that good.

What a gem, tucked away near Wall street.Early check in, friendly staff and large roomsset the tone. Luxury beds and super soft duvets and pillows added to the ratings. The giant TV and requested coffee machine completed the experience. Perfection was missed due to a noisy airconditioner and the light from the bathroom shining into the bedroom through the glass partion.Did I say exceptional staff!!

just perfect. Staff very helpful. the restaurant is amazing. See you next year. The hotel is near metro station, malls, restaurants, and..... a lot of nice spots. Room was perfect for 3 adults et 1 child.

We decided to stay here, as it was a good location for what we wanted to see. The location was the best thing I could say about our stay, and even that wasn't amazing. As previous, visitors have noted, staff are pleasant, but are not overly attentive. It doesn't compare to other 5* places we've have stayed in the past. We were given a room right off the bar on the 2nd floor. It was a dinghy little corridor that smelt of smoke. When we first found the room, I actually thought we had entered a maintenanace area. The room was ok, but nothing to shout about.When we return to NYC we definitely won't be visiting Gild Hall again. My recommendation would be to shop around and stay in a hotel that lives up to 5* standards. The restaurant and bar staff provided great service on our first night, sadly the rest of our stay was all downhill from here!

From the moment we stepped into the hotel we were greeted by a great staff; Max and Chloe we extremely kind and helpful. The location is in a quiet corner of the financial district in walking distance to the new world trade center and the 9/11 Museum. The South Street Seaport is also an easy walk. I loved the rustic lobby and the bar...my kids enjoyed sitting in the lobby playing chess and checkers. The rooms were quiet and very clean. I would stay here again!

Stayed with my partner from Thurs - Mon . . .staff was great, very friendly and helpful . . . loved the prosecco at check in . . . room was very clean and modernly furnished . . . location is 2 blocks from fulton subway stop and proved to be a perfect home base for visiting Manhattan, Brooklyn, and even making it out to Queens. Would definitely stay again, what a tremendous value in an amazing city.

So far the best hotel I stayed at in Manhattan - the room was surprisingly spacious, the bathroom really cute, the bed super comfortable. Just don't expect a room with a view in Manhattan - I was looking at walls 20 stories higher than my room on 9th. The other main criticism is that the card reader in the elevator was very unreliable, sometimes it took ten tries to get it to work.Nice lobby bar with friendly staff and good choice of beers.

Anthony and angel made our night extra special, the rooms are really nice. The hotel is near lots of trains, amazing food all around! Can't wait to come back!Next time I will love to see the suites for our next vacation. Hopefully we can get good rates

I stayed here last weekend for my birthday. The place is beautiful, the European Hall theme is a nice change of pace from typical Manhattan hotels. The staff was amazing. They upgraded me to a suite and greeted me with presecco. I highly recommend staying here. It was one of the best birthdays I have had in awhile.

Nice little boutique hotel located in the centre of business district. Extremely nice and helpful staff, special thanks to Anthony and Angel who went out and beyond their way to make things happen. The boys always are always happy and resourceful. Big smiles like that will definitely get you places.

Stayed here for business. Nice hotel. Nice people. U.S. Service so it was always going to good on that front. You can do a lot worse than this place. The restaurant also serves up interesting and delicious food. They've gone to the trouble of incorporating thoughtful add one (champagne on arrival), quick check in etc whilst maintaining a cool boutique vibe. You probably won't get to choose this place as a hotel but you won't be disappointed.

We were welcomed by very friendly and attentive people at the front desk. They were aware that we were having a wedding anniversary weekend celebration and took note of this with a spectacular room upgrade and a surprise of champagne and fruit from Scott, the general manager, on our return later in the evening. All staff were highly professional and friendly. The location was perfect for our exploration of lower Manhattan and TriBeCa.Richard and Susan

Friends DON'T let Friends stay in Midtown Manhattan. This gem of a boutique hotel near the new World Trade Center is neatly tucked away between two subway stops. WTC, Wall Street, China Town, Brooklyn Bridge, SoHo and Tribeca are an easy walk. I've been a typical NYC tourist for 25 years. I will NEVER stay anywhere else again ...! My husband and I (middle aged blah blah) stay in nice hotels in London, Singapore, and Dubai ... and Gild Hall rates among the best, especially if you are tired of high priced, cookie-cutter brand hotels with over-run lobbies. Stay here instead.We paid $270 / night for a glorious room that would have easily cost $400 in midtown. Then, we were offered an upgrade to a suite for an additional $75 per night (YES!!). So we ended up with an 1 br apartment - top quality linens, kitchenette (which we didn't really use), full living room and bedroom. Three days of spectacular sight seeing and sleeping.The property has a very trendy and comfy lobby, beautiful bar (our college age daughter and her friend were delighted to meet up with the parents here :), and excellent restaurant. Staff is great / efficient for check in, and offer texting for check-in which was super (but you don't need to do that if you're not a texter).I literally will not be staying anywhere else when I visit Manhattan (and / or Brooklyn).

I simply loved the hotel! Just a few meters from Wall street it is very convenient for business trips to the financial district. At the same time is not in a main street so it is quieter and you can have a good night of sleep. It has a colonial, rustic, wood, hipster style that I really enjoyed! The rooms are big and the internet connectivity is pretty good. All interactions with staff were zero to none. It will be my 1st option in future business trips to NYC.

Accommodated the furniture request for make-up artist. Complimentary gift basket, champagne, and hand-written card placed in room as congratulations. Clean, comfortable, well decorated (hotel and room). Spacious. The room was quiet at night. Close to some attractions and subway lines. Quick to respond to emails. Friendly staff. This was a great stay for me and my girlfriends the night before my wedding at NYC City Hall. Highly recommended hotel.

This hotel is definitely the best hotel I've ever stayed in NYC. And the nearby sites are very attractive such as Wall Street, SOHO, Little Italy as well as the China Town. Subways are 4 min walking distance away. And the nearby areas are relative more safe than others during the night.

What a find the Gild Hall Hotel has been! A friendly and attentive staff. Comfortable lobby and clean rooms. Quietly tucked away on Platt but near lots of restaurants and bars. Close to the Fulton station. Can recommend room 122. We will return when we come back to NYC

The hotel lobby is cozy and very inviting. We requested a quiet room and noticed they put us across from the ice machine room...our first mistake was not asking to be moved because it was noisy starting at 6 am. The room is small but with the high ceilings, feels spacious. As typical of boutique hotels, there is nowhere in the bathroom to put toiletries without fear of something falling into the toilet. Also, the bathroom has frosted glass walls...not conducive to a trip to the bathroom during the night if you need to turn on the light. The room is well shaded so it's dark in the morning...which is a plus! The biggest failing was that our room hadn't been cleaned when we got back at 4 pm after a day of sightseeing. I have never been in a hotel that didn't straighten my room in a timely manner. The management apologized and sent someone after we left for dinner.

A friendly hotel, good value for money, with an Italian restaurant / bar on the ground floor. Rooms are comfortable - a little noisy but then most New York hotels are. Staff are friendly and helpful. The restaurant is typical italian fare, a reasonable wine list both by the glass and by the bottle.For business - not a bad choice. Less than 5 minutes from Wall Street and 10 minutes from the subway and 15 minutes up to midtown.

This place is a gem in FiDi. Great staff, good size room, really nice looking, excellent location. It lacks nothing. Would definitely stay here again! I loved that they had some bicycles for guests to use.

This place is a treasure that I enjoy more every time I go back! The staff is the best I have come across and are not only friendly, efficient but caring in a personal way. They greet you by name and always wanted to know what they can do! Food is great, but a bit $$. Wait staff is OK. Room great. Would you believe the front door staff remembered us from the year before!
user_name:
k g
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: So even though we are from Cincinnati, I got the feeling of being the country boy in the big city visiting NYC for a wedding. The wedding party scouted out Gild Hall and everyone from our Cincinnati neighborhood visiting for the wedding stayed there. It was wonderful. It was within walking distance of all kinds of sites as well as near transportation and the wedding venue. The minute we arrived, Andy took care of the car and getting all of our baggage to the room offering to help with reservations, advice or anything else we could possibly need along the way. The hotel obviously had an over zealous designer and every surface and detail had some thought given to it. As an Architect, I appreciate that attention to detail. Nothing was run of the mill or normal but neither was it over the top. It was really comfortable.

I recently stayed at Gild Hall for five days/four nights and absolutely loved it. The staff were very professional and friendly; and, I loved the bartender. Also, the complementary Prosecco was a wonderful surprised after a long day of travel. To my surprise, the room was much larger than I expected. Likewise, the area was very safe and there were several eateries and stores in walking distance. The hotel decor was very nice as well.
user_name:
VV F
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Stayed for 2 nights with my spouse. The service is top notch; friendly, helpful, knowledgeable, and efficient. Room is larger than expected, modern, and very nice. Location is close to 9/11 memorial and a block from a metro stop to midtown. Only downside would be that I heard water flowing through the pipes making a squeaky noise in the morning.

I had booked this hotel on Hotwire not expecting much. I was amazed by the level of service the staff offered. I had a special engagement the night I stayed at the Gild Hall. Not only were the staff welcoming, but they provided us with a complementary bottle of high end champagne and a fruit basket. The hotel is in a great location. Less than a 2 minute walk to the subway and on a quiet street in an otherwise busy downtown core. The hotel itself is one of the most unique hotels I've ever stayed in.I cannot recommend this hotel enough. You will not be disappointed.

We had 28 rooms reserved for guests coming to our daughter's wedding which was held nearby. The staff did everything they could to make it a special weekend. Everyone loved the boutique-style rooms, and proximity to sight-seeing. The brunch we had in la soffitta was delicious and convenient way to wrap up a great weekend for our group.

I found this hotel through trip advisor and stayed there for 3 weeks on a business trip and I can say that I have no complaints whatsoever The entire hotel staff was professional and made sure my stay was really comfortable. The guys at the front desk are awesome as mentioned in many reviews Max, David, Chloe were really helpful .I got a really quiet room on the 12th floor. The service was great . The restaurant Felice is nice (doesn't have a lot of options for vegetarians) but the service is still really nice.. Would I go back there ...absolutely!

I have visited Ny many times , but with Anthony the manager i have had the best time of my life , besides his excellent service and kind hearted soul, the rest of the staff is Amazing to and Mina from Felice the restaurant is the sweetest girl in NY ...as you know New Yorkers can be pretty Rude ..but.i have nothing then love for this place and i can't wait for my next trip to be staying at the Gild Hall hotel again . From now on this is my home away from home .Love , Gillian van Exel

When looking for accomodation for a date weekend getaway in New York i was overwhelmed by my options - of course ! Somehow i found Gild Hall and frankly the pictures of the lobby area and bar/restaurant sold me .. i took a chance.. and i am soo glad that i did !! Even before i arrived the hotel was providing a personal and charming service by arranging a car pickup from the airport, welcome suprise of chilled wine in the room for my g/f and allowing me to have mail sent to the hotel to await me. Thankyou Monique !! Once there, Gild Hall proved to be a magnificent suprise .. so upscale and classy .. and yet warm and homely at the same time - that's hard to achieve i think ! Stepping from the street into Gild Hall was like stepping into an oasis of wood and leather and calm with attentive professional personable staff from the front desk through the restaurant. My only regret is not staying longer ! I hope this review makes its way to the management and staff so that they know they are amazing :)

A very stylish little boutique hotel in the heart of FiDi with unparalleled customer service. David Finch, Hotel Manager, was an absolute professional to deal with and we enjoyed every minute of our weekend stay. It was our wedding weekend so we also had family and friends there as well. We would all highly recommend Gild Hall!!!

I have never stayed at a hotel in the Financial District and Gild Hall has changed my mind about always preferring to stay in Midtown Manhattan. Gild Hall is hands down one of the best hotels based on the friendly staff, decor, quiet location and overall ambiance. I stayed at Gild Hall for a close friend's wedding and it was perfect. The ceremony was supposed to be outside, but canceled due to weather. The hotel staff was exceptionally accommodating in that they allowed my friends to have their small ceremony in the upstairs loft/bar area which was not being used. The hotel restaurant (amazing food, by the way) was preparing to close by the time the ceremony and post-celebration ended. The manager was awesome enough to keep the kitchen open in order to feed about 11 of the grooms' close friends. Our bartender, Mikey, was very friendly, kept the drinks flowing and gave great recommendations on the menu. I would definitely recommend Gild Hall and stay at this particular location again! Keep up the good work!

I had such a great stay at the Gild Hall. The staff was very attentive and professional. For example, Max at the front desk remembered my name when I returned to the front desk after work. I stay in downtown New York often and most of the hotels I've stayed in downtown are very stuffy or are cookie cutter business hotels. Not this one. The hunting lodge theme works, which makes for a resort-like feel without being over the top. I will be back!
user_name:
hlbrooksv
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Great rooms and quiet location in Financial District. Very helpful staff and the Italian Restaurant Felice on the Ground Floor serves very tasty italian food. Gyms are rather small, so better off running outside along the river.

Excellent staff especially accommodating for me with electric scooter and good ADA bathroom Great location for anything downtown - battery park, seaport. Custom house, world trade site, and accessibility to subway linesVery good restaurant on site. Would come back to this hotel

Gild Hall was a fantastic, unique hotel. The location and price were perfect. The staff was genuinely nice and very helpful. The rooms were clean and decorated well. I highly recommend this hotel. I would definitely stay there again.

Overwhelmingly impressed with the staff service at Gild Hall Hotel and Felice Bar. The restaurant manager Mina Dipalma and the rest of the hotel staff went out of their way to accomodate our last minute wedding venue change as a result of weather. We were traveling from out of town and staying at Gild Hall. Scheduled to have our wedding ceremony at Brooklyn Bridge park but torrential rain and thunderstorms forced us to find a substitute venue. We originally planned to return to the hotel only for a toast following the wedding but we ended up having the ceremony at the upstairs hotel bar. We could't have picked a more perfect space. Mina and the staff quickly helped us arrange furniture and corral our guests. They stayed friendly and professional and checked in with us throughout the evening and the rest of our weekend to make sure our wedding weekend went smoothly. The ambiance of the upstairs hotel bar was classic and I'm certain that the pictures will be unforgettable. We can't wait to return to Gild Hall to celebrate future anniversaries in our favorite city.

I have stayed here many times for business trips. I have always been impressed with the room and the comfortable bed, however the views leave something to be desired. The décor is fun and eclectic and the staff is always very helpful! The rooms are quiet and very well maintained and the bar/restaurant is welcoming and fun! Will definitely continue to stay here when able.

We booked Gild Hall for our short honeymoon to New York. When we arrived we were welcomed by the staff and they showed us to our room. In the room we found a box filled with mini cakes AND a bottle of prosecco. There was also a handwritten note to congratulate us with our marriage. Very thoughtful, kind and something we did not expect at all! A great welcome to the hotel and the city!I can be very short about the King room. It's great: big (by NY standards), clean and a nice bathroom and bed. The staff is also very kind and the restaurant looks great as well (we didn't eat there, but I read it's very nice). If you are looking for a nice hotel in (lower) Manhattan, look no further, you just found it :)Thanks very much to all the staff!

We stayed here 6 nights in a deluxe king room. The staff is outstanding. We were made to feel welcome by everyone who worked there. The room was tasteful and perfectly clean. If I had any suggestion at all it would be a grab bar in the shower, although they did have s slip resistant mat in the bathtub. We have family in Brooklyn and the nearby subway took us straight there, or we could go the other way straight into the heart of Manhattan. We could walk to the 9/11 memorial, southport pier, and Battery park, no problem. We will be back to this hotel for certain.

This hotel is located a few blocks of Broadway in downtown Manhattan. Quiet Streets so not much noise around. The hotel has only 18 floors and therefor is not too massive in comparison with other hotels around. The decoration of the hotel is very nice. We had a room on the 17 th floor and the room was spacious. It had a real kingsize bed with more than enough room around it. A desk is with chair, enough closet room and a nice size bathroom. Wifi is free for upto 2 devices and fast enough for us. The bedding is very comfortable. The front desk is very welcoming. The hotel has its own restaurant but we did not use it. but by the looks of the trafic inside we think it must be good as well. Furthermore the hotel is only 2 blocks of Fulton Street metro so in easy access to all point of interest in the city. All in all very recomendable!

If you are in town for business or just visiting this hotel is relaxing from the city that never sleeps... Great staff all the way thru. Don't forget Felice restaurant great match to the hotel food and service.

What a treat.This hotel was so very nice.The room was a good size and very comfortable. Very well decorated, and plenty of amenities.The bathroom was clean, large, comfortable. They offered a magnifying mirror, a razor kit, bath salts in addition to high end shampoo, conditioner and lotion.The amenities were really above and beyond.The staff was lovely- offering champagne upon check-in and bottled water when checking out.Nice touch.The restaurant there was also wonderful and very comfortable.

I am a wedding planner and worked with Leah Gabel and she always got back to me quickly with answers to questions that I had. I also loved the hotel lobby and how cute the hotel is... it is chic yet inviting. Thank you to the Gild Hall team and Leah!

My girlfriends and I really loved our experience at the Gild Hall from the minute we arrived thanks to the friendly staff (Monique, Robert, Anthony and especially David Finch) who handled all aspects of the front desk, concierge and bellmen services. The elegant and classy yet warm and comfy atmosphere of the lobby made it so fun for us to return after a long exhausting day. The bar and restaurant offered fabulous food and drink with exceptional service. Our room was large and roomy with the most comfortable beds and pillows. The furniture and decor is pristine with sophisticated style and the bathroom had lots of room to place all toiletries--we loved the great shower head. The hotel is located very close to the subway system surrounded by many restaurants, bars, shopping, museums and of course by battery park, the 911 museum, etc. We found it much cheaper to take the subway and walk than taking taxis when we stayed at the other hotels. It was so convenient to every area of NYC especially the theater district at the end of the night since we enjoyed the subway and the relaxing ride to our hotel. I look forward to returning next year!

The staff here is the real winner, but the rooms are great as well. At each encounter, I found the team friendly, positive and willing to help. They smiled, inquired about satisfaction and the visit to the city. The hotel is of fantastic design, particularly the public areas that merge a bohemian vibe with the luxury of a fine gentlemen's club. The hallways are narrow, but the rooms (we had a suite) were spacious and boasted hardwood floors (a bit worn out) and masculine feeling appointments, without being too trapped by tradition. Don't expect much by way of views, however. Downtown is not the most convenient area in NYC for tourism, but the location is excellent for business and Wall Street types. The hotel is on an out-of-the-way location, but makes up for it with really great style and staff. Be warned, however, I would stay closer to midtown if I were a first time visitor looking for the typical NYC experience. However, if one is a regular visitor and wishes to explore other areas of the city, this is a good location.

We stayed at The Gild Hall Hotel for five nights with a large group from all over the country. The hotel was excellent in every way with plenty of amenities, an excellent staff and wonderful maid service. We highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the area.

We stayed here in May 2015 for our wedding anniversary. The hotel helped me arrange things for the surprise trip. All staff were very friendly, the location is fantastic and the bar is really cool.I can defiantly see why the hotel has so many good reviews. They stored our bags in a safe location while we went around the city on our final day.We received very useful emails before we arrived advising how to get to the hotel.Thank you to all staff and we will definitely return

Very well maintained hotel with excellent service and great location if you need to be near the financial district. Beautiful hotel library/bar area and a great bagel place around the corner for breakfasts!

What can I say, what a lovely little hotel, set in a nice little side street, just down the road from Wall street and all the underground lines for great access around the city. The staff are so friendly and helpful, full of recommendations and Ideas, the rooms are big, have comfy beds, and the bathroom is spotless. The bar is great for drinks, the food is delicious. We stayed on our anniversary and was given a bottle of wine which the restaurant produce in Italy ( delicious also ). On the day we left it was raining so the host went out on to the street to hail us a cab back to the airport .. you can not get better service than that !! Fully recommend this for a stay in NYC. More couples place than family though. I will return to this place any time im heading back to NYC.

Stayed here due to a wedding we were attending. Hotel is in the financial district. All hotel staff were friendly and helpful. Maybe I am a small town dweller, but I do think that coffee in the room. Adequate towels and a top sheet on the bed should come standard in any hotel room. I would not have personally chosen a hotel with antler chandeliers, leather headboards and such dark decor, but it may appeal to others. The mini bar prices were so high that we chose not to use any of the supplies. I just won't pay 4 dollars for a snickers bar or 9 dollars for a bottle of water.

This quaint, boutique hotel in NYC's Financial District is WONDERFUL! We spent one night here and were greeted by a very attentive staff, who, upon learning that it was my wife's birthday, sent up a lovely bottle of wine! How thoughtful!The room was spacious (for New York) and the amenities were fantastic- "Dollar Shave Club" ($12) was a nice touch- yeah, you had to buy it, but, it's a GOOD razor and shave cream- totally worth it! Some people complained about the bathroom door being see though- it wasn't completely- but it certainly wasn't a problem! The restaurant that is attached (nothing to do with the hotel) has an AMAZING breakfast!The staff of the hotel was extremely helpful with directions- even offered the use of two bikes that were in the lobby! How great is that! We WILL be back! But next time, we will be bringing friends!!Jim

We stayed at Gild Hall Friday through Monday in early June and were very pleased. Staff were all excellent and very helpful. Room was spotlessly clean, incredibly quiet, with 50" HD TV, and very comfortable bed. It is literally a 10 minute walk to Freedom Tower/911 Museum and Statue of Liberty/Ellis Island ferrys. 5 minute walk to East River/South Street Seaport. If I was returning to this part of NYC, I would hands-down, choose Gild Hall.One tip: Gild's default is to use a fitted sheet and duvet only; we asked for a top sheet plus the duvet and they accommodated our request instantly and happily.

Stayed at The Gild Hall for six nights.The staff were friendly and helpful, special mention for Violet and David who provided excellent service and information. There were a few minor issues, such as the toileteries were not replenished as a set, sometimes only shampoo and conditioner were given and no shower gel, on one occasion only given one towel, we were a couple. There was no tea or coffee making facility in the room. But these were nothing serious.We had a great time. Hotel near Wall street, but there is a subway stop a few minutes away to get to Times square and other areas. Would stay again.

I've been in about 20 hotels at this price in Manhattan and this is top 3 for me. Number one in downtown. It is underpriced compared to what you get. In this case the pictures don't lie!Great boutique hotel with a great restaurant and large rooms with comfortable beds.I will definitely return.
user_name:
Szabolcs P
New York City, New York

review_body: We found this to be a very average Hotel. No coffee or tea making facilities in the room, bottles of water are in the room but cost extra. We stayed for 4 nights and our toiletries were never replenished. If you are just after a room in the city this is fine but I'm sure there is better out there for the price.

My then fiance and I reserved the Gild Hall Hotel and another hotel for our wedding guests. Gild Hall Hotel has a cool masculine looking lobby. Felice manages the restaurant, main bar area and upstairs wine bar. We also had a room booked at the hotel, so we decided to gather all the guests for a tea ceremony before the official church ceremony at the wine bar. Esther (Gild Hall) and Javier (Felice) both did a wonderful job of setting everything up for us. My guests commended on what a great job we did in choosing the place for tea and lodging. There were one or two small glitches but once they were fixed, all were perfect! Thank you Gild Hall Hotel and Felice for making our wedding weekend all the more memorable!

Loved walking into this hotel- great vibe, with interesting decor and lots of leather and books. Front desk service was welcoming and efficient. I checked in at 1am after a long day of flight delays and was offered an upgrade and a bottle of water right away. The upgrade put me into a King suite that had me wishing I was staying for days. Large comfortable living room, nice kitchen and bar, well sized bedroom. Everything was well appointed (C.O. Bigelow toiletries, Keurig machine and coffee, stocked bar with alcohol and food for purchase). The wifi code was freely handed to me (hello Hilton and Marriott- that's the way it should be!). In the morning, I headed down for an excellent breakfast in a comfortable room with the feel of a European cafe. If you're working downtown I would definitely recommend this over some of the other chains in the area- this has all of the amenities of a luxury hotel, and all of the charm and personal attention of your favorite boutique hotel. I did not get a chance to check out the gym, but I will be back again . . ..

I stayed at Gild Hall for the first time while on business in New York and was pleasantly surprised. It is a business hotel, where the staff make you feel like a honored guest in their home. Rooms were comfortable and roomy by NY standards, particularly when considering price. Surprisingly good restaurant and bar area for small hotel.

I booked this hotel based on the reviews on Tripadvisor, and I can only confirm all positive reviews I saw. The hotel is nicely decorated inside with a nice bar and restaurant inside. All personnel was very friendly and willing to help with any type of suggestion. Highly reccomended!

Me and my fiends booked for 5 nights in this fantastic hotel and when just arrived we feel a great ambient and very helpful staff at reception. The room maybe wasn't bigger for 4 people but enough and the bathroom a bit small. Everything worked very good. We used the bar a lot and was fabulous, didn't eat. Room service fast and they call us a taxi very fast as well. The area has a lot of bars and things to do but the concrete street is very quiet. I'll definitely recommend this hotel to everyone.

We really enjoyed the general look and feel of the hotel. The room itself was very sleek and modern looking, and most importantly comfortable. The only slight downside was the bathroom door which had problems closing, and has an odd translucent surface (other reviews have commented about this). But really, not a big problem.Also, we arrived very late for check-in, and were informed that our room wasn't available due to unexpected water damage impacting two of the rooms (we were told that this was not normal). Although this impacted our brief visit to NY, the staff did what it could to accommodate. The assistant manager on duty, Anthony Vasquez, went to great lengths to arrange booking at another hotel (and transportation) for the first night, as well as a few other kind gestures (by Anthony and manager Bjoern Blaha as well) for our inconvenience. We really appreciated both.Overall, we thought it was a great hotel, was close to the subway, and would enjoy staying here again.

We got a good deal on this place through Hotwire and enjoyed our stay. We were looking for street parking when we pulled into the city, but there was tons of traffic on the small lower Manhattan streets and I got tired of waiting so we valeted. It was $45/24 hour period without in/out privileges. Public transportation (subway) is a five minute walk and there's a really nice market (Zeytinia) at the end of the street. We didn't try the hotel restaurant (Felice), but the reviews on trip advisor seemed ok.The staff was friendly. The front desk rep gave us an upgrade to a larger room and allowed us to check in several hours early. The room was clean and comfortable, the bathroom was a good size and the TV/remote worked well. Wifi was complementary, but we didn't use it as our stay was just overnight and we didn't spend much time in the hotel. All in all a very nice stay in a convenient location.

The modern lay out and décor of this small hotel will make it stand out in your memory. Large new rooms and innovative lobby. Defintiely a younger vibe. stong boutique feel with little mainstream tourist traffic. Great down town choice.

Centrally located, 5 mins from Wall St subway, Gild Hall is a nice building, quirkily decorated and quiet (at least, it was on the 14th floor!). Staff very friendly and helpful. Bed large and comfortable. Bathroom clean. Ticks all the boxes!

This hotel is really interesting. The décor in the lobby is very old fashioned and masculine (wood accents, animal skin rug, etc) but then mixes with a modern and lively bar/restaurant. It was as lively as I've ever seen a hotel bar in this part of town.Front desk staff was friendly, attentive and helpful. Wifi worked fine without issues. The bed was extremely comfortable, I'm embarrassed to say I fell asleep with the lights on because I was too comfortable to move. The bathroom was small but adequate, and it was stocked with good quality bath products and even some bath salts. The room could use some fresh paint, but apart from that I kind of liked it. It felt almost...nautical? There was a round mirror that reminded me of a porthole on a ship. It was homey, not fancy by any means - but nice and comfortable.I ordered dinner from room service (Italian fare) and it was extremely good. Not cheap, but definitely reasonable by room service standards.All in all, a nice stay while I was on business and I would stay there again.

This was my first time at Gild Hall, or any Thompson Hotel for that matter. I was totally wowed by my experience. From the friendly check in (which included a glass of prosecco!), to the cool design (European hunting lodge meets library), to the awesome staff, I was impressed. This is the first ever visit to NY where I stayed in both a Kimpton hotel (Eventi - see that review) and a different boutique hotel and vastly preferred the non-Kimpton option. Stay at this charming hotel and you won't be disappointed. It manages to be close to all the good stuff in the financial area, while still being on a secluded and relatively quiet (nice for NY!) street.

Smart and tight, located amidst the Financial District and close to New York’s oldest famous attractions. I particuary loved the fact that wáter (East and Hudson Rivers) is five minutes walk in half of all the possible directions. Sort of discreet site in one the busiest areas of the world -in daylight. You can expect a pleasant time here, perhaps a bit more. If it wasn't for the Petite rooms, the stay would feel very indulgent. Equipped with brand new everything and displaying contemporary looks. Good for a few nights, I wouldn´t plan a long stay here. Neighborhood can get lonely in the evenings and weekends, and you may get hungry or bored since it is quite far from night blasts. I normally prefer livelier areas of NYC but really the hotel manager and staff do their best to make you feel you matter, the gorgeous breakfast and coffee are good evidence. A slight and appealing restaurant in it's main and only first floor corner, makes you feel momentarily in Paris rather than in NYC. Its ok for a business trip, could have better gadgets related.

Gild Hall is a lovely hotel with a great staff. It's charm is in the details. Our room felt like an old library, very masculine. The area is close to the freedom Towers, ferries to Ellis Island, The Statue of Liberty and the 9/11 Memorial. We took advantage of these attractions but found that we were far from most other things like museums and fine dining. We did find a lively street called Stone Street nearby filled with restaurants and outdoor seating.

This is my second stay at Gild Hall. The hotel is in a great location, close to several subway lines and easy to get anywhere in the City. After a long day of lots of activity and noise in the City, it was always nice to come back to the quiet, warm atmosphere of Gild Hall. The staff are all very warm and welcoming and the furnishings just make you feel safe and comfortable. The rooms are very comfortable and the bathrooms are well-designed. We had a premier King room which was quite roomy and very suitable for our 4 night stay. It is in a quiet area, but there are still plenty of options for food and drink. It is also very convenient to the 9/11 Memorial and Museum, the seaport area, the Brooklyn Bridge and Battery Park. I look forward to staying there again the next time I visit NYC>

This Hotel is exceptional the staff Is friendly, the rooms are comfortable. I would highly recommend this Hotel if you want to be in the heart of the big Appel We will be there in mid July hope to see all of you there. This time of the year is a great time to be in NYC

I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. This is in lower Manhattan, so you need to want to stay in this part of the city. Personally I had never stayed in that area before and I loved it. It is quite, the river, ground zero and Brooklyn bridge are very close and the hotel is one block from the metro, so you can easily commute anywhere. The hotel itself is a great value for money. If you are looking for 5* luxury this is not the hotel for you. This is an intimate hotel with charm and character, rooms are spacious for NY standards, lobby and bar are charming, artistic details abound throughout the property and the biggest plus of the hotel is its staff, hands down the most efficient and polite service I have experienced in NY. Congratulations to the hotel management and a big thank you to all the staff at the front desk. Book the premium rooms, definitely worth the price difference, bathroom is double size. Ask for a higher floor room, quieter, more light. Also, every single item we tried in their breakfast menu was excellent! The only con I would mention is that there is a humming sound coming from the building across the street and the result is a consistent buzzing that sounds as if the aircon is constantly on. Nothing that would disturb your sleep though, just annoying. Also, due to the location of the hotel in a narrow street, no light filters in and rooms are quite dark.
user_name:
Anny_C17
New York City, New York

review_body: This was my second time at Gild Hall. I stayed at the hotel a few months ago for a week and had a great experience, particularly from a customer service standpoint. This time was equally as enjoyable, largely due to exceptional service from front desk associate Jessica. On two occasions, she went above and beyond to provide outstanding service. In one example, I had been feeling under the weather and hadn't slept well, asked her for an additional hour for check out, and she happily accommodated me. In another example, I was looking to extend me stay by another night, and found a cheaper rate via Hotwire, and spoke to her about it. She was able to offer me a comparable rate via the hotel, that avoided me paying the Hotwire booking fee, and allowed me to keep the same room. Jessica is a great asset to the hotel and her work ethic represents the brand well.

Walking distance to 9-11 and Seaport. Easy access to subway. Breakfast was satisfying - fruit was good, service was good. We took ours to go on the last day and they were very nice about that. Shower had good pressure and was great but hot water was a little hard to regulate. Decor was nice and unique. Would have liked soap for shower in addition to or in place of shower gel. No big deal. We got a deluxe king room (I believe this is the smallest room) and it was great. I liked the touch of the decor of the little sitting area. TV was fine (limited channels but we were not here to watch tv). I was concerned because we were right across from the elevator but noise was not a problem at all. Staff was friendly and helpful and welcoming. Would stay here again.

We stayed at the Gild Hall for 2 nights. It was really comfortable, clean and smartly decorated. The room had a massive bed and a huge bathroom. There is a bar downstairs and you can get coffee etc there if you so wish. There were a couple of breakfast places close by as well, its also close to the underground. I would definitely stay there again.

We choose a different area of NY City to stay each visit. We had never stayed in the financial district so we thought we would give it a try. Very nice hotel in a location convenient to the subway. The bed was great, the Smart TV crisp and clear. The room amenities were better than average, the size of the room easily accommodates a couple. The staff was exceptional. We didn't eat at their restaurant due to previous plans but it seemed to be doing brisk business.

I chose to stay at this hotel after reading reviews on Trip Advisor. Situated in the Financial District, it is very conveniently located. Being my first time to New York I chose to walk from the hotel to Times Square. This was a long walk but what a great way to see all the different and gorgeous areas in New York. Great room service. Wonderful service. Room was nice but I know what the other reviews mean by see through bathroom door lol. Overall a great stay. Thank you...

This was our second stay at this hotel and this is my favourite hotel in NYC. This is a review for a Sept/Oct 2014 stay on a business & pleasure trip.My husband and I usually spend a week, twice to three times a year in NYC and on this trip, we had been to another hotel for 5 days. Though this hotel was decent, my husband said "let's get out of here" and go back to the Gild Hall for three days! So we took a cab and swapped hotels!the positives:- Amazingly comfortable king-size bed (firm). If you travel a lot and for a long period of time, this is where your search starts and almost ends! -Super quiet rooms, quiet floors, on a quiet street, in a quieter neighbourhood at night. More zzzz!- Huge room. Lots of space to open suitcases and move around (great if you're a couple).- All the usual amenities in the room (minibar, tv, desk, etc..) and stylish décor (modern version of an English library look)-Professional, friendly and helpful staff and service.-Starbucks (no surprise there!) round the corner, Century 21 (if you're into bargain shopping), tube stations, bars & restaurants, etcthe negatives:- the view of the room is the other building across the street so the rooms are on the darker side (this is however true about a lot of NYC hotels)- If you need the bathroom at night, don't switch the lights on, you'll wake everyone up! There is some sort of "frosted glass" (not see through but it lets the light come through unfortunately). Get a plug-in night light or use your phone!+ or -: -Please note that this is more of a small luxury/boutique hotel. I see this as a positive (the lift is there when you need it!) and it is a quiet. There is however a lively and very stylish bar in the hotel as well as a restaurant I think (we did not go to the restaurant so I cannot comment on it).-It is also situated in the Financial District so it will be hectic during the day but dead quiet at the weekend (and very quiet at night).This is an outstanding hotel. I would highly recommend it to family & friends. We also would not hesitate to book it again.

So all my NY trips are for business, and I'm not staying at the Ritz, but also not staying at budget hotels, and this has far and away been the best! The most spacious Manhattan hotel room I've ever been in. Extremely friendly staff, who offer you Prosecco upon check in. On a quieter street, and quiet rooms. Nicely decorated, quick elevators. Comfy beds, cute restaurant/bar downstairs.

I stayed here for 2 nights in April 2015: the night before my wedding and the night of my wedding. I also got ready for my wedding in my room (a King Suite) with my bridal party.I can't say enough about how pleased I was with the experience! Gild Hall was absolutely perfect for all of our many needs during the weekend and I did not want to leave! The King Suite was beautiful and had so many unique and interesting details in the decor that didn't make it feel like a typical, standard hotel. It was also very spacious - it had a very large bathroom, a small kitchen (that was enough for a couple people to stand in at once, and had a mini fridge, microwave, Keurig, sink, and counter space), a large living room, and a separate bedroom. For much of the morning, there were 13 people in the suite (between bridal party, family, hair/makeup, photographer, assistants, etc.) and while it didn't feel enormous, it definitely never felt too crowded.The hotel lobby is beautiful and was a great setting for my bridal portraits. We never tried the bar or restaurant, so I can't comment on that, but it did seem that people were always at the bar.The staff at the hotel were wonderful and they really made our stay great. They were so accommodating with people coming and going constantly and things like finding and delivering an additional full-length mirror and accommodating a late check-out so we could attend our post-wedding brunch before having to check out. They were very helpful with bags and luggage, as we had a lot. In particular, David at the front desk was great but every employee we encountered was very nice. Our housekeeper was also amazing, as he or she managed to clean up the enormous mess left by my bridal party and me while getting ready for the wedding, and left the suite in beautiful condition for my new husband and I to return to that night.I would highly recommend Gild Hall to anyone and even though I live in NYC, I hope to have another excuse to stay here!
user_name:
KRB222
New York City, New York

review_body: Based on my experience, I would say that Gild Hall offers outstanding accommodations and service in a small, excellent hotel. This was my second stay on a business trip for a client in a nearby location. The staff were solicitous and helpful. I at the restaurant twice, for dinner and breakfast, and it was excellent for both meals. The room was perfect, reflecting the delightful character of the hotel. I can't say enough positive things about Gild Hall, and only wish I had had more time to spend there on this trip. Although its location would be an unusual choice for a pleasure trip, I would definitely consider staying there the next time I visit.

For NYC the standard rooms are gigantic. The hotel itself is stylish, clean, and the staff is courteous and efficient. The location makes the hotel quiet... However being downtown at night can sometimes be a drag.

The hotel is really cozy and have a great service. Staff is always friendly and they did not charge anything to receive packages at the front desk. I would stay there again for certain. The location, however, is not so convenient if you want to explore night life, as the area is full of offices and it seemed kind of dead after office hours. It is close to Century 21 and the World Trade Center Memorial.

It is so tough for me to write reviews of Thompson hotels as each stay seems to be better than the last and my New Year’s trip to Gild Hall proves no different. I have been staying exclusively with Thompson since 2004 but this was my first stay at Gild Hall. While I had known Manager Bjoern Blaha was at the hotel the FiDi neighborhood just didn’t have that draw for me that the other neighborhoods did. What a mistake on my part in so many different ways!Thompson Hotels are sexy, urban sophisticated places; and each hotel has a distinct personality that usually is inspired by the location. As one would derive from the name, Gild Hall really updates images of the Gilded age in NYC and the Financial District in a fantastic space. The lobby and bar have great character and are extremely stylish and comfortable. I found these public spaces are luxurious and when you sit down in one of the leather sofas in a private nook I am reminded of sitting in a modern, men’s club or lodge. It's a place where you feel very comfortable in relaxing while waiting or contemplating your next move. The atmosphere of the hotel with the music and lighting seems to be perfectly suited at all times and I really liked the scent of the hotel. It also seemed suited for downtown.The front desk is right to the door and this is a major advantage for Gild because their front desk staff are outstanding. Have you ever been to a hotel where the front staff are incredibly friendly and a bit over the top? Where you are treated like visiting royalty? And then come to to the desk the next day and be treated the same way, but then realize that the person had no idea that they met you the day before? That will not happen at this hotel. Within one day these people were greeting me by name, saying hello or goodbye, or just a greeting with a wave. These people were always cheerful and genuine, and did everything that they could to treat me well. In particular, James was fantastic. In all my stays at Thompson hotels, I have always been treated like a VIP and have nothing but warm things to say about this group of people who have a tough job; as they are the ones who have to deal with any complaints, and do their best to make a great first impression with every new guest. They are genuine, happy and clearly part of Thompson’s DNA. Off to the other side is a great bar spot which always had people at it. I didn’t eat at the restaurant but had several drinks at the bar, it was really the perfect spot to start the night.Upstairs the hallways are clean and the decor give you an idea of what awaits in your room. I saw a few of the rooms at Gild Hall and they are all high class, the beds are so comfortable and the quality linen's add to your comfort. The furniture and surfaces are similar to the rest of the hotel, stylish, top notch and expensive to the touch. Loved my room! The rooms are perfect and the excellent housekeeping staff maintain them very well. The housekeeping people are very courteous and are quick to deliver any extra item you may need. They certainly gave me extra chocolates and shampoo. A couple times during my stay I was contacted by someone from housekeeping to ensure that I was happy with the service, which I certainly was. I wasn’t sure what to expect of the area as for the last 5 years had been staying in Tribeca but after 2 nights I loved it in FiDi. It is much livelier than Tribeca with tons of bars and cool new spots. I was also surprised how many people lived there. This is a fantastic area and the hotel’s location is further helped by the fact that virtually every train can be accessed within a few blocks, making travel to any part of the city extremely convenient. It's such a cool neighborhood steeped in a ton of history.Gild Hotel is truly excellent in every single category that I value. I keep coming back to Thompson hotels because of the outstanding staff and of all my stays I’ve never seen such a well rounded team then the ones at Gild Hall. It really shouldn’t have been a surprise to me because Bjoern was one of the original 60 Thompson people and it’s clear that his presence has instilled all those traits that makes a Thompson hotel so special. This trip to NYC at Christmas marked 10 years that I’ve been staying with Thompson hotels and definitely was one of the best! I loved Gild Hall and can’t wait to come back!

1 night stay was a pleasant surprise...great location as there is much in the neighborhood to explore - restaurants,shopping & the seaport..pls acc to public transpo to the city..the felice is attached to the hotel and though we did not have the opportunity to try it,i hope we get an opportunity to do so in the future...the staff were friendly and accommodating..they upgraded our room w/o an additional chg..size is at a premium in nyc hotels so were surprised at the size,quite lg..while it was a bit pricey,i have paid more for less in nyc...would stay here again in a heartbeat...
user_name:
francena m
New York City, New York

review_body: I've stayed in New York many times and have got used to overpriced very small rooms, so it it was a pleasant surprise to stay at Gild Hall with its huge bed in a huge room!The location is excellent in the heart of downtown, about 5 mins walk from the Fulton Center transit interchange (multiple subway lines) and not much further to the World Trade center with its PATH rail link to Newark Airport.The hotel is very stylish with boutique style rooms, with a vintage style lobby and lounge area - the bar and restaurant looked great though i didn't use it.

Great Hotel in downtown Manhattan. Walking distance from trains, WTC, restaurants. I was there for work but was accompanied by my partner and our 5 year old daughter. The staff were really great... helpful and friendly. The noise levels in the room are slightly high but that's downtown skyscraper land with lots of machines in the nearby buildings but I guess they could work on the soundproofing a bit. But great comfy room, pillows and beds.

I haven't even checked out yet but I love this hotel so much I had to review it now! CLEAN, roomy, great Wall Street area location, lots of restaurants nearby, huge TV, comfortable bed, LOVE the decor... The restaurant in the lobby is very good and the staff friendly and very helpful. The glass of sparkling wine at check in was a favorite perk! I come for business often and will make sure this is where I stay from now on.

my stay at gild was so restorative and lovely. the room was perfect, the bed was a slice of heaven. but nothing beat the front desk staff. i loved anthony, who went out of his way to track down my phone that i stupidly left in the Uber. from looking on the street in the dark, to downloading uber for the purpose of getting in touch with the driver, he did everything he could possibly think of, and it worked! got my phone back in less than an hour. couldn't have done it without him.

Gild Hall is a nice boutique hotel in the financial district in what looks like a remodeled office building on a small street. Even with GPS, the cab driver couldn't find the hotel. The staff are excellent, very friendly and helpful. Rooms are clean with high ceilings, but could use brighter lights. My room was cozy, enough room for a king bed, benches along the exterior wall and a small desk/vanity. Nothing fancy, but clean and functional. Hot water in the bathroom seemed to only have two settings, blistering hot and cold and could be my faucets. There is a nice restaurant/bar, and the lounge on the 2nd floor is nice. Wifi is free, but no coffee. Other restaurants, coffee, etc., are nearby. Prices are reasonable and notwithstanding the quirks, I would return
user_name:
Bryan F
Lincolnwood, Illinois, United States

review_body: We stayed for 3 nights which cost just over £500. The hotel is beautiful, big rooms which huge bed and TV. The room was very clean and modern.The bathroom floor is a death trap - slippy when dry!The reception staff were helpful and friendly and checking in and out literally took a minute. The closest subway is a couple of minutes walk away at Fulton Street.The 9/11 memorial and Statue of Liberty tours are all in walking distance. Would definitely stay again if I had the money!

We spent 5 days at Gild Hall a month ago and overall we were pleased with the hotel. The room was big enough (especially for NY), very clean, comfortable and very quiet although the hotel is located in the heart of the Financial District. The hotel is well situated and you have many different metro lines that will take you everywhere. Should you like to walk, you can definitely walk to SoHo and Lower Manhattan easily. The atmosphere is very nice as there is a nice/chic bar and restaurant in the hotel. It's always very busy either for after work drinks or diner. We enjoyed both a few times and we liked a lot the food at Felice as well as the service. That gives a charm to the hotel as well. However, we did have a small issue with the heater as it was quite noisy. Honestly, we did not ask to change room but informed the staff about the unpleasant issue. Apart from this and a little inconvenience at the reception, we enjoyed very much our stay at Gild Hall and it is definitely a hotel I would recommend. I have to mention that Mr. Blaha, the manager, was very attentive to my feedback and that was very much appreciated.

I would fully recommend anyone visiting New York to choose this hotel. Great hotel's are abundant in New York, finding somewhere that's comfortable and clean and stylish is easy to come by. However, what truly sets this hotel apart from the rest is the team who work there. The staff are without a doubt the friendliest, most accommodating team I have ever met. Special mention to David and Robert for their generosity and everyone at Gild for helping make my time in the city a truly brilliant one.

This is a gem of a hotel tucked away in the financial part of town. Lovely rooms, great bar and restaurant. Staff couldn't have been friendlier. Easy to get to all other parts of Manhattan. Would recommend to anyone.

My sisters and I stayed here for one night to celebrate my sisters 60th birthday. Jessica at the front desk checked us in with a warm welcome and helped resolve a couple of minor issues. Once she found out it was my sister's birthday she went out of her way to make us feel like rock stars including moving us to a larger room, sending a bottle of wine to our table for dinner. (The hotel restaurant has wonderful food, cocktails and superb wine list!) I have travelled to many top hotels and yet, this small hotel with the lovely Jessica was the best experience by far. Thank you for making this weekend extra extra special. We will be back for business, for pleasure, for anything! It is also very convenient to subway, 9/11Memorial and great restaurants.

We stayed here for 3nights over Easter weekend. The hotel was fine as we didnt spend much time in the room / hotel. Location was good with easy access to the city as it was so close to Fulton St station. Pro points 1)bed was very comfy and the hotel supplied firm pillows when asked. 2) bell boy was very good at getting cabs although you have to be careful as the cab driver adds on abt $5 as he is not just standing outside the hotel. 3) email requests were answered. Some con points 1) very dark hotel couldn't read in the lobby. 2) the big heater or cooler in room was unsightly 3) bathroom had no storage space esp around the sink. Again quite dark in room. But we had a good stay. And would stay again. Loved Leo's bagels for breakfast which is about 5mins away.

Our experience at Gild Hall was incredible! We're from Long Island and were visiting friends in the city. The unbelievably kind staff (David, Angel, Khloe, and Max) made our stay a breeze, no small task when you include our three children all under 4 years old. -Room was booked on Hotel Tonight, we upgraded to a King Suite (to better accommodate the children) over the phone.-Upon arrival we were immediately offered a glass of Prosecco.-Staff printed menu of a great local take out spot and was very knowledgeable about the best coffee / breakfast spots in area.-Staff was patient as we unloaded / loaded kids in from the car (left parked in front of the hotel on a busy day and narrow street).-The Hotel itself is beautiful, like you've stepped into an episode of Madmen.-Upon departure we were given small bottles of water for the road.One thing to be aware of: If you're driving in, there is little to no street parking in the area. Be prepared to plunk down $55 to park the vehicle for 24hrs with no in/out.My only regret is not dining in the restaurant or having a drink at the bar. The place was so cozy but our stay was too brief. We'll certainly be back, next time without the kids!!

I stayed at the hotel for three nights. Everything is clean and the staff friendly. For NYC the rooms were quite large. If you're the first time in NYC you might want to choose another location as it's in the very south of Manhattan, but on the other hand close to Brooklyn and Ground Zero and South Ferry.

Personally, I would be skeptical of any review that included the word "vibe," but there's no other word to describe this place. It is simultaneously intimate and roomy, classy modern and vintage throwback. The rooms are comfortable and quite modern in furnishings and layout without being a cookie-cutter reproduction of other hotel rooms. They are well-lit and adequately furnished with a desk for work as well. The bathrooms are particularly large and well supplied with high quality amenities. There are three separate "fitness centers" on three separate floors. Before you think this is overkill, it is simply that each one is quite small, with just a few pieces of cardio and weight equipment. If one is occupied, another is just a few floors away. However, in my 3-day stay I never found anyone else in them! The lobby bar/restaurant, Felice, seems to be a neighborhood gathering place and is quite lively. However, I was always able to get seated for breakfast and dinner, and the bar staff were very helpful and friendly if I just wanted to get a glass of wine. Most important, the bed was somewhat firm but very comfortable and I was not disturbed by street noise, which is a real plus for NYC. If you need a cab, give yourself a few extra minutes to do so. The doormen are happy to help, but they have to travel to a more heavily trafficked street to call one.

A great 3 nights spent at the Gild Hall. Very friendly helpful staff. A good size clean room (We had a Twin Double Room), with comfortable beds and good shower, set in a good location (Fulton St. Metro Station is about 3 mins. walk, from the front door). An excellent place to base yourself form, for a short break. 100% would love to go back, for another visit.

Beautiful Thompson Boutique tucked away on a side street in the city's fnancial center.I scored a great rate , very last minute on Hotel Tonight. The bed was extremely comfortable, great wifi in the room , beautiful bathroom including a bathtub which is often not the case in newer boutique hotels. Nice touch by the manager of a personalized note and a bottle of complimentary water. My only reason for not giving this property 5 stars was the treatment I received by Chloe who was amanning the reception desk upon arrival.I was very specific when I checked in asking if my room was quiet as I had about 4 hours of work ahead of me----I checked in at 1015 pm and also inquired if the hotel was full ( which I was told it was not). Chloe assured me the room was quiet . I was put on the 3rd floor inn he front of the house. Needless to say the noise was nonstop all night into the morning. Chloe could not get me away from the desk quick enough and it is clear to me she knew she was not putting me in a quiet room. I am not sure if the Hotel Tonight rate was the reason for being put on a lower floor or not---- frankly as a frequent Thompson guest in other cities as well as NY (which I mentioned upon checking in) I would expect better treatment.

Fantastic hotel . Gorgeous room with lovely big bed and soft bedding . Sooo quiet for New York. The room service was quick and tasty . Nothing was too.much trouble . Please try the restaurant , food sensational . I was with my daughter we felt at home and safe . Really can't speak highly enough . Thank you for a great stay . You made our week trip complete .

There's not a lot of places to stay downtown (let alone good places) but this place is in a league of its own! I worked downtown for years and never heard of it but now that I travel there on business, this place is my go to spot. From arrival to departure, there's friendly staff at the door, desk and bar. The place is super chic from the lobby to the room. I would not have expected a place this nice to be in budget for my firm or even me if on vacation but it’s well worth it! You won’t be disappointed!

We booked this hotel as an early family break to celebrate my daughters 40th birthday which is in May.On arrival we were each given a glass of bubbly and the manager knew all our first names.We were later presented with a box of 12 mini cupcakes and a bottle of fizz in each room which we gratefully accepted.All the staff were very helpful and friendly.Both our rooms were spacious and very clean.Everything was fantastic.Thank you all for a great stay and all the birthday extras.

My boyfriend surprised me with a night here and what a lovely surprise it was. The room was lovely. Huge bed with a decent amount of space, location was great, close to a tube and to the financial district and the room service was lush- good restaurant quality food. I'd definitely return.

Fabulous hotel, from arrival to departure. Extremely nice helpful staff, comfortable hotel, lovely rooms in a great location. Most important of all - everyone is friendly. I have to say I preferred the Financial District location to Times Square although we had a good hotel when we stayed there last year. There are many restaurants and bars not too far from the hotel and we enjoyed our evenings more in this area. When we return to New York we will stay at the Gild Hall once again, I really cannot praise them enough, A big thank you to Bjoern and Peri who helped out with my partners birthday surprise and gave me a list of suggestions as to where to visit.The good thing is - we still have a lot more to see!!

Great location for a quiet weekend place to stay in the city with great transport links using the Fulton subway where the express takes you to mid town in 20 minutes. Stayed in room 23 (Superior King) with a very comfy bed, great shower over a little bath. Wifi free in the room for 2 devices which was very useful.Allowed us a late check out at no cost and front desk was really helpful. Had lunch in the restaurant on our last day and would recommend it for a easy/lazy but expensive choice of meal. A great number of breakfast options locally for a less costly breakfast.

If it weren't for my husband booking this for me via Hotel Tonight, I'd have missed it. It doesn't look like much, hidden down the chasm of Gold Street in the Financial District, but it is a gem: friendly; reasonably priced; very comfortable; good food; good room service; excellent shower. Will definitely be back. Over the years, we've done virtually all the fancy, big NYC hotels; never again. Simply not worth it when there are places like this.

Arrived here in the evening and checked in at the front desk. There wasn't anyone to help with my bags and it was like we had just checked in at a motel, not a hotel. We were allocated a room on the 9th floor. When we got out of the lift it stunk of gas. I though it would pass but it was there for the duration of our 7 day stay. Plus side couldn't smell it in our room. Rooms were clean but could do with tea/coffee facilities in the rooms. The only good thing about this hotel is the location. You are able to get to anywhere in nyc on the train without the need to get other connections. I would say that the rest of the hotel is average and abit overpriced.

My husband and I just had our wedding near Gild Hall Hotel and we booked a block of rooms for our guests. The staff at Gild Hall was very hospitable and accommodating. They gave us very reasonable rates. I also booked a room for myself and my bridesmaids the night before the wedding, and they even upgraded me to a king suite (with a huge living room area and kitchenette) at the king deluxe room rate. I was so appreciative of their kindness. Their rooms are very modern, clean and spacious (by New York City standard). The hotel has gym facilities, free wifi, and restaurants and a bar that open pretty late. The staff is super friendly and helpful. This hotel is just minutes away from the Fulton Street subway station. All in all, my guests and I are extremely satisfied with Gild Hall.

I really enjoyed my 3 night stay at the Gild Hall. As many have said, the front desk staff were always very welcoming and greeted you personally every time you came into the lobby.I was dubious about the location, as it is quite far south and not near the theater and museum district, but the Fulton subway station is just a 5 minute walk away and many of the train lines cross through it so it was no problem getting around by subway.My only problem with the hotel was with the bedding: I found the duvet to be too hot, and kept putting it on and off all night which meant I didn't sleep well. The other throw blanket was wool, and would have also probably been too hot, as well as itchy. Perhaps a lighter blanket could be put in the closet as another option? Also, I'm not a fan of feather pillows, especially when I have to use them behind my back for support while watching TV in bed (my room didn't have an armchair), as I find they get flat and hard too easily. I see that someone else on this website asked for foam pillows, which I'll keep in mind next time I stay.I definitely will use the Gild Hall next time I visit New York!

I was searching for a hotel in NYC while we were going to be there for my daughter's wedding. I came across this one in the Financal District. It is a quaint little boutique hotel on Gold St. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful the entire time we were there (4 days, 3 nights). We never came across anyone who was not pleasant from the front desk to housekeeping to the restaurant. Everyone was more than willing to go above and beyond to help you out!The room was bigger than what you normally find in NYC and very comfortable. the only issue we had was with the water temperature in the shower. It was extremely hot and it wasn't easy to figure out how to turn it down. We had to call the front desk for help.I would have to say the hotel signage is not well marked though. We had taken a car service from the airport, arriving around 1 am, and even our driver was not sure where it was.The cost is also reasonable for a NYC hotel.The restaurant, called Felice, onsite (which I will also write a review for) was convenient and very good.The location is very close to the 9/11 Memorial, which we did visit.I would definitely stay here again when we visit our daughter!

The Gild Hall is an excellent hotel. Very friendly, helpful staff. Rooms are very spacious, cleaned every day with fresh towels and the beds are comfortable. The whole of the hotel is very clean and welcoming. Would recommend this to anyone.

We found Gild Hall when we were looking for a place to spend a few days in the city in January. At first I was skeptical. My husband and I go in and out of the city quite often and like to stay not too far from midtown. Not anymore. Gild Hall is nestled on a quiet street in the financial district. On weekends, this area is a wonderful refuge and it reminds me of the winding streets of some European cities. Gild Hall has a very European feel and a vibe that is warm and welcoming. This past weekend was our second stay and it was just as we left it in January. The staff go out of their way to welcome you, make you feel at home and make sure that everything is in order. The rooms are larger than most large chain hotel rooms. Our room was very nice and the bed was super comfortable. The bathrooms are a decent size and spotlessly clean. I asked for foam pillows and we were no sooner in our room when 4 of them arrived. The hotel is very close to several subway stops and getting around the city from there is so easy. Trust me, once you stay down in the financial district, you won't ever want to stay anywhere else-and Gild Hall is the crown jewel.The little bar off the lobby is a perfect place for before dinner drinks and a welcome site for a night cap with an espresso or cappuccino on the side.This weekend we did not venture out of the financial district. We had a fantastic dinner at Harry's on Saturday night and made the short walk to the South Street Seaport on Sunday morning where we watched the sightseeing helicopters start their day. Felice, Gild Hall's restaurant, serves a fine breakfast. We didn't eat lunch or dinner there but the menu looks wonderful. I am a travel agent and I have already recommended Gild Hall to many clients and friends. As I said, I won't stay anywhere else in the city.

My first impression of Gild Hall was that of a warm and cozy log cabin feel. The lobby feels darker and roomy, with a very stylish chandelier to top it off. The restaurant was always crowded, and the bar is terrific to grab a small snack or drink. The staff was accommodating and helpful, and easy to talk to in the mornings. Noise was minimal; showers had great pressure. Will repeat stay when I return to New York. Highly recommended hotel.

I have stayed here ten times in the last calendar year for business. Regardless of whether I book through a website or directly through the hotel, I am always treated as a valued guest. In addition, the people who work there are friendly and professional. The bar has a relaxed, casual vibe and the food is solid too. No issues ever.

Great vibe and decor in the lobby. Nice attached bar and restaurant - great good, and the room service is the entirety of the menu (as opposed to a small sampling). Super friendly and responsive staff. Rooms are good size by New York standards, only downside is the pedestal sink in the bath which I hate in hotel rooms - no room for your stuff.

I am currently staying at this hotel. It is situated in a great location however the views out of my bedroom (17th floor) consist of a window where I can see the man that lives across the street and lots of bricks. It is extremely expensive but I assume that's the standard for staying in a New York hotel. The bedroom is comfortable, especially the bed. And the bathroom is nice although the bath is so shallow you wouldn't actually be able to have one. The central heating doesn't work either... You have to blast it for at least 15 minutes until it turns moderately warm.Room service was nice. Small portion, big bill. The water is also extortionate at $8 for a litre! Oh and the gym is pretty rubbish, but hey, at least they have one! The Wi-Fi connection is good and free up to two devices.The main reception has lots of character, can't really say the same applies for the bedrooms.It's pretty damn noisy, it's a good job I was knackered so managed to not get disturbed. If you come here for holiday and want a lie in, good luck. All in all I'd say this hotel is average. Certainly not memorable!

My partner and I went to NYC for business and pleasure and really enjoyed our stay. The ambiance was really nice and reflects the feel of the financial district area and Wall Street. The customer service was excellent and we were welcomed by two glasses of champagne at check in. Rooms were small but decorated well and clean. They have two bikes available for use for guests. Location is great, walking ditance to all the main attractions in the financial district and subway that can easily take you to all other parts in the city.

The gild hall is a lovely hotel, we're staying here for 5 days during our trip to New York. The staff are very friendly and helpful especially Anthony. We checked in about 4am and he was very patient and welcoming and seemed like the type of guy who would go that extra mile for you. We had breakfast here on our first morning and it was delicious. We would definitely stay here again if we came back to New York.

This hotel is really nice. I enjoyed thoroughly there. Because as we entered we got impressed by its ambience which was well management, well designed. And staff members were congenial with all people. And rooms has great interior and balcony view is fabulous..
