Room service, cleanliness and food facility is awesome so, don't waste your time, grab an amazing opportunity of staying there..

Stayed here for 6nights in March the hotel is in a great location please don't think it's out of the way because it's in FiDi and it would cost more being around wall St. It's right by a very good subway with great links to all of Manhattan, Brooklyn, the Bronx without changing at other stations and food around this area is cheaper and better quality than you would think. And the hotel is great really spacious comfy rooms and you feel safe. I would only have 1suggestion please get rid of the glass bathroom partitions or put a curtain there it's not private enough. But otherwise I would highly recommend this hotel

Had to visit NY for business trip in Lower Manhattan. The hotel was walking distance from my conference, and plenty of options to dine were within the area. The hotel staff was great during the entire stay. My luggage was taken from the taxi immediately as I was exiting the vehicle. I was offered water everytime I entered the lobby. The receptionist behind the desk even put on a coat to hail a cab for me as I was leaving for the airport. The staff went above and beyond to make sure I had a comfortable stay. I would definitely consider staying at this hotel again.

My husband and I visited over the weekend. The hotel was great and the staff was wonderful.They patiently explained to us how to go wherever we wanted to go . They always greeted us by name and we would definitely stay there again.We would also recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a great hotel in the Financial district.

We had a very pleasant stay at Gild Hall. One highlight was the valet service (Mark), who went to great lengths to make our stay a good one, even lending me his tie when I forgot to pack mine! He also did an excellent job helping us juggle our car and luggage.

Friendly and efficient service are always the case here. The rooms and spacious (especially for this area) and clean.Hotel bar and dining facility are the best. The best feature is the price moderately rates. Full value for the money!

Just got back from our stay at Gild Hall and the hotel was lovely. From the moment you walk in it feels warm and cozy. The staff is friendly and courteous. The room was perfect. Hotel is located within walking distance to the World Trade Center site and subway stations that can get you anywhere you need to go. Highly recommended!

This hotel is located at the hart of the financial district. Confortable rooms, nice and polite service, and the hotel is very tastefully decorated in modern style. I strongly recommend staying there.

My Fiancé and I work in the Financial District, and live in New Jersey. The numerous times we have stayed here, has always been an oasis, or our second home. Though this is my first review (lack of free time, my bad), I want to highlight what triggered me to make time and write these few words. Rasheeda Perez, is an employee of this hotel, and I must say that she personally took it upon herself to fulfill a very small request a "dental kit"... I am not one to ever call Front Desk for anything or even complain, but her willingness to aide and ensure that I nor my Fiancé needed anything else floored me. I am a very simple person, and not easily impressed...but great customer service must be recognized because these are things that can be rare nowadays... and I appreciate this. This hotel offers pristine cleanliness, fast and delicious room service and location. I will have to write a whole other review to talk about its décor! So thank you Gild!
user_name:
Mary P
North Bergen, New Jersey

review_body: I love the Gild! They worked very hard to make my experience unique and will stay there every time I'm in NY for business. The staff is curteous, welcoming and so kind. It's a pleasure to do business with such a quality place. Thanks guys!

I checked into the Gild Hotel after finding a great last minute rate on the Hotel Tonight app. My power & heat had been knocked out after a manhole fire the night before. No one knew when it was going to be back up so I figured I might as well have a little staycation and treat myself. I arrived quite late as I tried to hold on as long as I could to see if they were going to get my power back on that night. So I walked into the Gild ready for some heat and power and definitely a drink. Anthony & Jessica took great care of me and gave me a room upgrade to help soothe their fellow Brooklynite. Yay!! They totally didn't have to do that but it was such a kind thing to do. I asked about the bar and it was just about to close but they said they'd see if they could hold it until I dropped my bags off in my room. So I hurried upstairs and headed back down for a night cap. Frank the bartender gave me a very nice pour of Scotch. It's just what I needed. This is customer service as its finest. So back upstairs, the King Suite is beautiful. There is a living room separate from the bedroom. There is a sink area with a Keurig coffee maker and a microwave. AND in addition to what's in the minibar, there are larger sized bottles in case you have guests! The bed is large & comfortable. The pillows are little softer than I would have liked but they were fine. The shower has great pressure, very important. There is also a full sized hair dryer. Yay! WiFi is $20/night but you can connect multiple devices. It's fast enough to stream Netflix/Hulu. The TV's in the room are huge and new. But I hope you aren't spending all your time watching TV because....The location is excellent. Very close to subways, lots of taxis around. Walk to the water, the bridges, South Street Seaport, tons of delis, restaurants & bars, etc. But if you feel like room service, the food from Felice is fantastic. Felice is the restaurant downstairs with really excellent Italian food. Get the french toast one morning and you'll be set for the day. If you order dinner, get those brussels sprouts. Oh man. They were so good. Service is very fast. If I'm nitpicking, I'd say I agree with the lighting. I didn't mind it being dark in the living room but the bathroom lighting made putting on makeup a little challenging. haha. It was fine as friends reassured me when I got outside. haha. So consider me your friend in New York who you get recommendations from - stay at the Gild Hotel.
user_name:
NYNeenz
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed here to visit a friend who lived in the financial district and were very pleased with our stay. We have a 1-year old and the hotel was very accomodating with him. They brought a crib (pack n play) up to our room and also gave him a toy rhino which is the hotel's "mascot" - it was a cute gesture. Our room was clean, the hotel was pretty quiet which was nice and the lobby and bar are just adorable. A nice stay and we would def. go back there if we were staying in that part of town again.

Just had a nice room with a King bed during a quick overnight in the city. We were so pleasantly surprised by the ambience and the kindness of the staff, as we had only just heard of this property. We are familiar with the Thompson Brand, and this hotel certainly lives up to it's reputation. All our requests were handled with ease by the knowledgable staff. Free Wi-Fi always makes us happy. Nearby subway lines made it easy to traverse the city. We will definitely return!

The hotel and restaurant is everything you need for a comfortable stay in the Financial District. The service was amazing - especially through help I received from Anthony on the morning of my checkout. The zipper on my bag disconnected from its track. I had called a cab and had a plane to catch. As I approached the front desk, Anthony stepped out to say he would be happy to help try to fix it. He spent a solid ten minutes wrangling with my suitcase and was able to fix the zipper and secure it. I was so grateful and again shout-out Anthony. I highly recommend the hotel - book with confidence.

I was pleasantly surprised with Gild Hall. It has a very cool ambiance, with unique accents, and a soft, relaxing environment. The hotel was very clean, and the rooms are modern and comfortable. The staff was friendly and knowledgeable about the surrounding area, recommendations, and directions. The restaurant at the hotel had great food, and was a nice atmosphere. I highly recommend this hotel and would stay there again! It was a nice change from the normal chain.

Hands down, Gild Hall was the coolest hotel we've ever stayed in. We recently took a weekend trip to New York for my 30th birthday and my wife surprise-planned a stay in the Lower East side, spending a night at Gild Hall.By the minute we walked through the front door I quickly realized this wasn't going to be a zen, spa-like retreat. More so, Gild Hall is a sweet little wine/whiskey spot with awesome decor, friendly and helpful staff, great food and if that wasn't enough, it's a top-notch hotel.About an hour after check-in we had a knock on the door. Much to my surprise, a member of the room service staff brought up a cake, with matches to light the candle, and a bottle of champagne on ice with two glasses. How cool was that? They also gave us celebratory cocktails on the house at the hotel bar. The gestures absolutely made my 30th that much more celebratory!We had room service for both dinner and breakfast the next day. The food and service did not disappoint. Go for the brisket burger!I can't stress enough how nice this place was. We will absolutely stay again!

Just wanted to commend the Thompson on their exceptional customer service during my Feb 13th through Feb 15th stay at the Gild Hall location in NYC over the NBA Allstar Weekend. After a not so favorable experience at another hotel, the staff at the Gild and more specifically “Andy” were extremely accommodating when securing a very last minute reservation and ensuring that my stay at the Thompson was both pleasurable and memorable. I will most definitely recommend Thompson Gild Hall to my friends and social network as a hotel that puts customer satisfaction at the top of their priority list. Keep up the great work!Best Regards,Wayne W

I have been to this hotel twice - both stays for leisure. I enjoy staying in the financial district because it is close to every subway station and tends to be less crowded than other parts of the city, so for me the location is perfect. I love the decor (kind of rustic chic) and the beds. Oh my god, the beds. I could sleep for a month in that bed. Plus you get champagne when you show up. I highly recommend staying here.

I live in newyork state on Long Island. On occasion I need to stay in NYC on business. This hotel is located in the financial district, and was very nice, rustic appearance, along with with some tartan plaid. Cute restaurant /bar area. Had a wonderful breakfast. Room was was larger than I expected. Bed was comfortable and very clean and quiet. Loved that they provided a rope in the room.

I love this place! Clean, classy and professional all the way! My boyfriend and I stayed here for the fourth of July weekend. We were met at the door with a friendly hello and the rest of our stay was just as nice. Very cute decor and artsy bar. I would definitely recommend for anyone looking for a romantic weekend get away. I even found parking on the street one block away!

Just spent six days instead of the planned 3 due to some unexpected flight cancellations. The hotel staff easily adjusted the reservation and kept the same rate that we had originally booked. They are courteous and helpful. It's in a great location, easy walk to Fulton subway station, World Trade Center and 9/11 Memorial. The Thompson Hotel signature scent in the lobby alone will make me come back. Thank you for a great stay!!

I frequent this posh hotel and am glad my friend referred us to it. They always provide exceptional service from the time we walk in the door to the time we leave. The rooms are ALWAYS clean, spacious and modern. Most recently February 2015, we were given a suite and it was well beyond what I expected and for a extraordinary price! My plan is to ALWAYS stay at Gild Hall when I am visiting the city.

I have stayed at Gild Hall twice, most recently in February 2015. Both stays, I was provided a clean, well-appointed room (although the King Suite was certainly far more spacious than the King Deluxe!). What stood out most for me was the outstanding service I was provided from the time I walked in through check-out. Every interaction I had with a staff member was pleasant and any requests I had were quickly and completely met. Worth pointing out for those unfamiliar with FiDi: if you're looking for walkable nightlife, or really any nearby activity after 7pm, you might want to consider another neighborhood. But its quiet at night and just a quick car ride or trip on the subway to more lively areas of the city.

We stayed here with our two kids and dog this past weekend and it was fabulous to say the least. The hotel lobby is incredibly chic and the staff were beyond helpful and kind. Check-in was a cinch and though our double bed room was somewhat tight, the decor and amenities made it all worth it. Dogs are welcomed here as well with no pet fees, so we did not feel bad bringing our medium sized lab. Our kids really loved this place, claiming Gild Hall was their "favorite hotel with room service in the Financial District." And as busy creative parents, it was extremely convenient to have a chic (and up to NYC standards) restaurant below to escape to and meet our friends and clients over delicious cocktails while the kids were safely upstairs in bed enjoying cable TV. Gild Hall has won us over. We're definitely coming back.

When my boyfriend and I booked the reservation for this hotel, it was under my name and contact info. Because we came from different locations, he happened to arrive first. When he arrived, I received a call from the woman at the front desk asking me to confirm that I knew who he was and that it was OK that he checked in. I really appreciated this... She wanted to make sure for my safety that it wasn't some crazy ex (or someone like that.) She did this professionally and politely so as not to make my boyfriend feel uncomfortable, or insulted. She really went the extra mile. The hotel itself was clean and had nice decor. For lack of a better description the decor was masculine and rustic. There was a lot of plaid and dark leather. The lobby has sort of a modern ski lodge feel. It was also very quiet at night.City noise doesn't bother me while I'm trying to sleep, so that's not usually a factor for me when picking a hotel. But if you are one of those people who is kept awake by honking horns and the bass from a club's music, this is the area for you. The financial district tends to be very quiet at night compared to other parts of the city.
user_name:
Marie E
Brooklyn, New York, United States

review_body: Had a great experience last week at Gild Hall - everything was easy, classy and without a problem. The front desk is helpful and the restaurant downstairs is really tasty. I ordered room service on the morning of the city shutdown from the blizzard - yum. The rooms are small but it's NYC ... loved the location though. No complaints at all!

Downtown is the new hot spot in NYC, and in the middle of it all, is a gem of a hotel. A beautiful, active lobby (there was a band debuting their new album in the loft), attractive and helpful staff, amazing restaurant (try the crostinis, and they have an excellent selection of wines from the proprietors very own vineyards). My only criticism is the WIFI. They offer a free option for checking emails, but if you want to stream, you have to upgrade to the $20 version. The good thing is you can add unlimited devices after the first upgrade. I had two phones, an ipad and a laptop running off the same $20. Easy access to the A, C, 2 and 3 lines. But seriously, cabs are so cheap in NYC and the doorman is more than happy to run out and flag one for you, while you enjoy a cocktail in the bar. Everything that New York is known for is in walking distance...Wall Street, Federal Reserve, WTC, Battery Park, countless museums and Tribeca. A $7 cab ride, or less, will get you to the Meat Packing District, SoHo, China Town or Little Italy. Take the subway to Time Square or midtown. Super easy. I will definitely be back. Gild Hall is my new favourite boutique hotel in New York!

I stayed 5 days at this hotel for a business/leisure trip. The hotel is very nicely located in the Financial District and the staff provided excellent service during my stay. The rooms are large and modern, the bed was very comfortable, the shower is amazing as the jet-spray is strong and warm. The bar is trendy and hip and full of young people. The staff is great. Felice, the restaurant, offers good food at good prices. I recommend the hotel and will be back. *** The WIFI is free and fast.

Gild Hall is perfectly located just across a narrow street from our destination. We were welcomed and honored as guests should be. Service was excellent. The upgrade we hoped for became available at modest additional cost. An unexpected treat: Discovering that the in-house restaurant was delightful. This hotel is business-styled, without amenities such a luxurious lobby. But it was near-perfect for our purposes.

I've stayed here three times now, it seems to be my go to for girls nights. It's one of my favorite hotels in NYC. The service is always amazing, from the door men to the front desk to the maid service. It's hidden away in the Financial District (all the way downtown Manhattan...at that south tip area..for those that may not know.) that's personally why I like it. It'll be great for the person that works down on Wall Street, but if you want the full Times Square experience, this may not be for you.The room is spacious and comfortable.When you walk in you almost get the Abercrombie vibe cause there's a intense masculine scent wafting through the vents, but it's adds to it's charm and is certainly not a deal breaker. Elevators are a smidge slow, so if you want to ride to the future in a crazy fast elevator you may not like it.But if you want great service, spacious room, comfortable bed and good shower you'll enjoy this hotel.The restaurant/bar is great and also provides amazing service.
user_name:
AsiaWerner
New York City, New York

review_body: Stayed here in January 2015 for our second visit to New York this hotel is stunning from the lobby to the rooms super cool design and quirky features. The rooms are not the biggest but have everything you need huge tv great bathroom and massive comfy bed the only issue was the wafer thin pillows but you can always ask for more from the front desk which brings me to the staff we spoke with a few different staff members all of whom were exceptional with there service. We asked for directions for one of our days out to Hoboken the guy at the front desk was so helpful with tips and directions and gave us the number for the hotel incase we got lost (we did not). The location was fantastic as Fulton street subway was round the corner with links to the whole city so easy all in all this was perfect for us and if we visit again will definitely use them again. 5 stars

I loved the decor, and the service was amazing. The bar (Felice) was also wonderful to visit in the early evening. The room was immaculate and very comfortable, and although in the financial district, we had no problem getting around the city. It was not too cold for January, and we walked most of the time, taking in the sights of New York. I would have given Gild Hall 5 Stars, It is probably my favorite hotel that I have stayed in, however I had a mini bar charge appear in my bank account that I did not make. I called the hotel 2 days after I checked out to inquire about the charge, and I was told it would be credited back to my account. Sadly this was over two weeks ago, and I still have the mysterious mini bar charge for something I did not consume. This may be a fluke, and everything else was wonderful, but I would keep an eye on your account after your stay.

My wife and I just returned from a trip to NYC, and stayed at Gild Hall, a boutique hotel in the Financial District. The staff at Gild Hall were professional, welcoming, and accommodating. Loved the lobby, bar and restaurant. Our room was very comfortable and well appointed. The hotel is in walking distance to some very good restaurants, bars, shopping, the 9/11 museum and memorial, and the South Street Seaport. It's also located very near the Fulton St subway station, making it easy to get anywhere around NYC. Next time you're in NYC do yourself a favor and stay at Gild Hall.

Over this past MLK JR. weekend I stayed at this cute little hotel in the financial district. The location was perfect because we were close to Brooklyn and the subway. The neighborhood is quiet at night. There are plenty of places to eat. Each morning I came down to the lobby and asked for a cup of hot water for my tea and it wasn't a problem! The only complaint we had was Sunday morning the hot water was not working for my friend to take a shower but when we returned that evening it was fixed. Not a big deal. Overall we had a nice time and I do recommend staying here. Especially if you are not exactly city folk like us.

Located in the quiet financial district, Gild Hall is a lovely boutique hotel that we would highly recommend. Very accommodating staff who were helpful in every way. We were upgraded to a king superior which was large and modern. Parking is convenient: there is a lot across the street, or the hotel will valet for a small charge.The hotel's public areas are a big plus: the lobby and wine bar offer cozy seating and the upper level wine bar has a speakeasy vibe with comfortable couches and candle-lit ambiance. We had brunch at the hotel restaurant (Felice), which was delicious. Free champagne was offered upon afternoon check-in and the staff braved the torrential rain to hail cabs.The only criticism is the difficulty regulating room temperature: woke up during the night uncomfortably warm and could not bring the temperature down despite turning on the A/C. Beds offered only a very warm duvet cover; a sheet would have been a good alternative. The hotel was experiencing trouble with the water system (which was politely explained upon check-in), but having no water during the evening and then no hot water in the morning was inconvenient.Overall we were very happy with our stay at Gild Hall and would return again!

My partner and I had a lovely 4 night break at the hotel over Christmas. It's in a great location in the financial district, in walking distance to Brooklyn Bridge, Wall Street, 9/11 memorial, Statue of Liberty and Century 21. The room was very maintained. Large comfy bed, huge TV, gorgeous bathroom. We tried Felice on my birthday as we were too tired to head up town to a restaurant we had booked and it was the best birthday meal I have had for a long time. Absolutely delicious! We also recommend Pearl Street Diner for a very affordable proper American breakfast which is just one street over. We will definitely return to Gild Hall on our next visit to New York.

Recently I traveled to New York City for a job interview. I'd stayed at Gild Hall before, so I knew what to expect - nice sized rooms, warm welcome, quiet nights (good sleep), excellent food. What blew me away was how well the staff at the hotel remembered me - by name. They also remembered the name of my partner, though she wasn't traveling with me this time. It made me feel right at home. The cherry on top was that I had mentioned in passing that I was coming for an interview, and the manager, David, left a personal note in my room to wish me luck. I can't remember the last time I had this treatment at a hotel. Gild Hall is definitely a place that puts PEOPLE first. They've earned a fond place in my heart, and if there's anyone else that needs a good night's sleep in a quieter part of town (at night), with fantastic food and service, then this is definitely the place to be!

I normally try and stay Downtown when in NYC - less tourists, and easier to get around (trains converge downtown). For me, this hotel is in the perfect location.Was lucky enough to get an upgrate to a suite, which was extremely roomy. Staff were extremely friendly, and room was very clean. Will definately stay here again.

There are so many excellent reviews here...why not add one more? I traveled with my partner to the city this December for his job interview, which also happened to land on his birthday. We were looking for a hotel that would be both quiet and comfortable, but also feel special and celebratory. The Gild was just the right fit. Rob and David couldn't have made us feel more welcome, or more at home, during our two night stay. There were small surprises waiting for us on our arrival, and they even facilitated the delivery of several birthday gifts from family members. The Gild surpassed our expectations in every category and is now the first place we call when we're visiting New York. In fact, my partner will be staying there again this month for his final interview. Is the Gild *also* good luck? We'll see!

The lobby is welcoming and though the rooms are small (as are most in the city) it doesn't feel uncomfortable or tight. The rooms were quiet, clean, and comfortable.On site breakfast was not impressive and a little pricy but there are plenty of places to eat in the city so that shouldn't be a concern.Would not hesitate to stay at Gild Hall again.

My husband and I stayed at Gild Hall on NYE. Traditionally, we book a hotel the day of to get a better deal and stay somewhere a little fancy. Gild Hall did not disappoint! I booked through the Hotels.com mobile app(which I love - that much closer to a free night somewhere!) and checked in around 4 pm. Our room wasn't the biggest but it was very luxe. I loved the decor of the room from the lovely plaid throw to the huge rustic leather headboard. My husband was very impressed by the technology - the tv, the wifi speed, etc. The bathroom was nice. I would have preferred the large shower rather than the tub/shower combo, but it's not a deal breaker and didn't take away from the experience. Very nice bath products - C.O. Bigelow and towels. The staff was very attentive - called us by name as we came and went as well as thanking us for our stay.Overall it is a lovely hotel with beautiful rooms that doesn't feel snobby or pretentious in any way. I would stay here again in a heartbeat!

My family was coming in for the holidays and I needed a hotel for them near my apartment on Wall Street. I wanted a place that would seem more like a gift instead of just a place to sleep. After visiting several local hotels to check the rooms and get a sense of the staff and mood, I visited Gild Hall. After talking with Ileana in the sales department, my search was over. Ileana was engaged and attentive. She didn't just casually show the rooms, she got involved. She was interested in helping me make the hotel a part of my family's holiday experience. I spoke with Ileana in late October and the visit was set for Christmas. The hotel had told me the morning of my family’s arrival that they could check us in no sooner than 3p. They were turning over nearly every room in the hotel from a fully booked night before. Understandable. But when we arrived at 3p the rooms weren't ready. That’s when the excellent staff really showed their worth. They turned the inconvenience into an opportunity to show off the extent of their hospitality. Khloe at the front desk was excellent. David the front desk manager greeted us each morning with a genuine smile. Bjoern, the general manger met with me to let me know we need not worry about another thing during our stay. I do not have time in this brief review to list the host of specific and thoughtful ways in which the hotel accommodated us after not being able to check in right away. The response was unlike any experience I've had at any hotel (and I have had extended stays at many of NYC's finest--The Greenwich, The Crosby, The Andaz, The Four Seasons, The Bowery Hotel, The Rivington.) I'll sum it up simply by revealing there was a Christmas tree involved—dutifully sought out, retrieved and adorned by bellman Rob. My family was wonderfully overwhelmed with the whole experience. We moved our plans for opening gifts on Christmas morning from my apartment to the hotel. We had Christmas Eve dinner, ordered up from Felice downstairs, at the hotel. Gild Hall exceeded expectations. It was perfect.One more thing. In a city district almost void of really great food I was surprised and overjoyed to find the food at Felice to be fantastic. Rustic Italian fare cooked to perfection and served by an attentive, smart staff. When you stay at Gild Hall, make an appointment for dinner. You won't be disappointed.

Excellent hotel! It was worth staying here. The rooms are nice size, very well maintained, and extra clean! The bathroom was really nice, super clean, and nicely designed. Highly recommended. The staff members are very friendly!

Best. Place. Ever. My boyfriend took me to New York for my birthday on January 2nd. We chose Gild Hall based on internet reviews, and our expectations were GREATLY exceeded! This place is wonderful....the rooms, the staff, everything....couldn't have been more pleased! Thank you, Gild Hall, for making us comfortable for our 3-day stay. I highly recommend this hotel!!!
user_name:
Dawn I
McKinney, Texas, United States

review_body: I stayed here last week on a business trip. I was greeted with a glass of Prosecco and friendly staff who helped me find a restaurant for dinner then kindly made a reservation for me. The décor was lovely (lobby and my room) and wonderfully different from the generic large chain where I'd spent the previous night. I also enjoyed a good (and reasonably priced) breakfast at Felice the next morning.

We got off to a little bit of a bad start. We arrived at 10pm at night after travelling from Australia, total travel time approx. 29 hours, tired, hungry and ready for a comfortable bed, only to be told they had no record of our reservation. I had the printed confirmation but they had nothing on their system. After about 15/20 minutes the lovely lady on the front desk got through to the booking company and clarified the error. She then kindly ushered us through to the bar for a complimentary drink and small platter to make up for the inconvenience whilst they just finalised the paperwork etc. The error was dealt with very efficiently.The hotel décor is beautiful and original. The hotel staff were wonderfully helpful and attentive.The room whilst a little on the small side for what I’m used to (which it appears is common in NYC) was clean, quiet, modern and very comfortable. Everything we needed and more, plus a fantastically stocked mini bar. The breakfasts served in the attached restaurant of Felice were really nice and the wait staff were extremely welcoming and efficient.The location for what we wanted was perfect, a good neighborhood, close to subway, a great selection of excellent restaurants and near to the 9/11 memorial, Wall Street and Brooklyn Bridge.I would definitely return here.

We spent many nights at this boutique hotel which was an excellent choice for family travel (arriving from JFK easy by taxi, good location near safe Fulton station). The room was quiet, clean, functional and the beds (also high-quality linen) were excellent. The interior design was perfect - if you are interested in design articles and furniture/ "clever" design this is something for you. The restaurant Felice offered wide range of good quality choices - again, if you are exigent, this is something for you:) It was so comfortable to start your day enjoying breakfast at Felice. Our family travels a lot and stays mostly at 4 (sometimes 5) star hotels: this is among the best ones; relaxing and delightful! This is another kind of stay which you respect if you have seen dozens of big and a bit boring business hotels. I cannot judge the price level because we chose the hotel due to its uniqueness and customer reviews - don´t know the season´s prices in NY. This was, however, definitely value for money and exeeded our expectations.

My wife and I spent our honeymoon at Gild Hall over Christmas and had a truly fantastic experience. The hotel itself is beautifully decorated, peaceful and has spacious rooms – a rarity for Manhattan. We spent one evening enjoying the hotel bar and lounge which had a very welcoming atmosphere and a great menu. The best thing about this hotel is the excellent staff, specifically David and Robert at the front office. They we’re great hosts when we arrived and couldn’t have done more for us during our stay. Extra touches, like prosecco during check-in, made it a great place to stay over Christmas.I would strongly recommend this hotel to anyone. It is by far the best we’ve stayed at on Manhattan and we will definitely be returning to Gild Hall in the future.

Gild Hall is a surprisingly cool boutique hotel in the financial district that is a solid choice if you're okay with this area of Manhattan. The rooms are larger than most hotel rooms in NYC and are well appointed with amenities like a huge TV, separate desk with plenty of room, nice decor, and high end bath product. As well the staff are very attentive and restaurant/bar area serves up good food and drinks. The only negatives are the mattress was a bit firm for my preference, the stylish bathroom should have used glass shower doors rather than a shower curtain, and because the financial district is quiet at night there aren't many good restaurants, bars or other nighttime activities in the area. So if you're okay with the area this is a good hotel choice for your stay.

After a stay at the mid-town location of the Algonquin Hotel in August, we knew we'd be coming back to New York in the pricey pre-Christmas period so took advantage of a good deal at the Gild Hall. This is just two blocks from the Fulton Street subway stop which - if you count the nearby Cortlandt Street stop, has four lines running through it, making it surprisingly flexible for getting around Manhattan.Our room was large and stylishly furnished and we like the cool retro vibe of the lobby.However we were less impressed by the adjacent Felice bar/restaurant staff who had a bit too much attitude (oh and we were charged $8 for 4 thimble-sized meatballs from their tapas menu). We were also VERY unhappy to find someone had illegally put my name down for their bill at the bar. It would seem a guest had overheard my surname and room number at reception and decided to charge it to my room. The girl at reception wasn't particularly interested, either.If the Gild Hall people want to keep their good name and avoid the taint of fraudulent charges, I suggest they use a card swipe system used in many of the Las Vegas hotels to approve charges.That said however, we would still stay here again.

Gild Hall is a great hotel. We stayed on the 16th floor and it was quiet enough every night despite being in the heart of the financial district. The hotel has nice furnishings and attentive staff. The location is ideal for the subway - Fulton Street is only a few minutes away and has both slow and express trains North into Manhattan. There's also a great little harbour side selection of boutique restaurants and shops in near by South Sea Port. Brooklyn bridge is a short walk away, as is the World Trade site and Battery Par. All in all a great value hotel which we will recommend to everyone!

My partner and I stayed at the Gild hotel over the Thanks Giving period and we have no complaints. The room and hotel was very clean and the restaurant makes a great breakfast omelette. Friendly staff and the hotel is well placed if you are looking for a quiet base to explore NYC from without the hustle and bustle of time square. Would definately stay again.

The location is definitely not in the center of NYC. However, that's what makes it great. You can make the trip whatever you want. It's location is on the quieter side of NYC and many restaurants around it. The restaurant there is also very good. They have a good wine selection and the bar has a great atmosphere. If you're looking to head to midtown or somewhere else, there are many subway lines nearby. They staff are wonderful. They are knowledgeable, kind, and helpful. They rooms are pretty, comfortable, and very clean. Such a wonderful place to stay.

We had a great five-night stay here at the end of November. The hotel is in a quieter part of Manhattan but it is close to subway stops which makes getting around very easy. It's also within walking distance from the hub of the Financial District and the Brooklyn Bridge.Couldn't fault the room at all. The main positive from our stay though were the staff with particular mentions for Mr Blaha and Peri, both of whom went the extra mile to make our stay special including upgrading our room and booking restaurants prior to our arrival (it was my boyfriend's birthday during our stay so I wanted to make sure as much was organised as possible, especially with it being a holiday weekend).Overall we would definitely stay here again and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to others!

Would recommend. Very quite for NYC. Room was very nice and clean not cramped like many NYC properties. The staff without exception was extremely welcoming and friendly. After we left my wife thought she left something in the safe. We called and the night manager immediately checked and call us back! Ate at thr restaurant in the Hotel. As the trip advisor reviews said, it too was excellent. Next morning there were several nice places to eat within a two minute walk. Will stay there again without hestitation.

Had an overall great experience here, particularly with the staff, whom I would like to recognize by name for their efforts. In one example, the original room I booked had a slow draining shower and was a bit noisy. Anthony at the front desk was able to move me to a different room, and get someone to deliver the new keys directly to my room so I wouldn't have to re-check in at the front desk. In another example, I asked Chloe from the front desk about laundromats in the area, and she looked into it and left a note under my door shortly after with a map of the closest laundromat. Overall the staff was incredibly helpful and made my stay a pleasure.

I stayed here for the first time because I had a business meeting nearby, and was very satisfied overall. The staff was very helpful. The room was spacious and comfortable. Best of all - very strong water pressure in the shower - a true rarity. I would definitely stay again if I have a meeting Downtown.

Stayed for four days over the 4th of July and had a wonderful time. First time visiting NYC, and the location was perfect, close to the Subway and just a short walk to the Staten Island Ferry. Cozy rooms but very updated and unique, definitely a nice well-priced boutique hotel!

We decided to go to NYC for my birthday and Gild Hall looked like a great option. We received excellent service even before arriving. After reading other tripadvisor reviews on how some rooms have bathrooms that are situated where anyone else in the room can easily see what's going on inside the bathroom, I reached out to the hotel manager, Bjoern, to see if we could avoid getting one of those rooms. We were so happy that he was able to arrange for us to stay in a room that had a more private bathroom. That cleared the way for a perfect stay. The front desk service was impeccable. So friendly and professional. Upon arriving, we were given complimentary glasses of prosecco. It was one of the best proseccos I've ever had and when I asked for the name of it, we were given a bottle for my birthday! The room was larger than what we expected for New York City. Plenty of room for us to move around comfortably. The bed was super comfortable with nice down bedding. It made it hard to get out of bed each morning! Great location as well. The Fulton St. subway station is only a couple minute's walk away. Everything about this place was perfect! Thanks for a wonderful birthday weekend Bjoern and the rest of the Gild Hall team! It could not have gone any better!!

Our daughter and son in law were married in Brooklyn and the wedding party and guests stayed at Gild Hall. I have to say that it was a great experience.The Gild is very much a boutique hotel, with great rooms and cozy bar and restaurant. The staff could not have been more friendly and accommodating.Saturday's weather was not great and the bar area served as a perfect backdrop for pre wedding pics and the bartender helped to make it an enjoyable time. We had a Sunday brunch for the guests in the Felice restaurant upstairs and Javier Martinez and the staff did a fantastic job. The food was great and the staff very attentive and accommodating. Overall a great experience all around. The rooms are very nice and the bed firm, but very comfortable. The bathroom "door" is something that takes a little getting used to, but by no means a reason not to stay. In summary though; great accommodations, and close to many tourist attractions !

This was my third time staying at the Gild, and I will can't wait until my next visit! The staff is friendly and always goes above and beyond in service. This is my getaway place, and is my number one choice when I stay in NYC. I love the check-in process, the front desk always offers a glass of prosecco, perfect to start your stay! The restaurant and bar area are fantastic, room and bath very comfortable and cozy. The location is convenient to subway, Wall Street/downtown area attractions and a short walk to Century 21 if you wish to shop. The bonus of staying here is no midtown noise! Planning next visit in a few months!

I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Gild Hall. The lobby is so cozy and homey, and the bar and restaurant are right there as you walk in, so it's a very fun welcoming feeling. I can't say enough about how nice all the staff were, from greeting us with a glass of bubbly on arrival, to helping us with suggestions for where to do and what to do, to getting us directions. I would definitely recommend this hotel, and the price was great too for that location.

Great location right near Wall Street and One World Trade Center. The Staff are driven to serve their guests. The Ristorante / Wine Bar at the Hotel serves terrific food!! The ambiance of the hotel gives off a European flavor...

I'd recommend this hotel. I had been to the nearby Club Quarters before but this is better, newer, bigger room, amazing restaurant downstairs, good internet connection, friendly staff, and overall a nice and well kept place. Location is quite good too.

We stayed here for 5 nights in a cold December. we absolutely loved it here. It's a really funky new york boutique hotel. the staffvare great, and welcomed us with prosecco on arrival which was a nice touch. The hotel is located on a quiet road in the financial district, with good access to the subway, opposite a nice bar called stout, ideal for a beer at the end of the day, and just around the corner from a starbucks and Pearl Street Diner, which is where we went most mornings for breakfast. The rooms are really nice, very funky, but not huge. my only complaint is the lack of a kettle in the room, but otherwise, a great hotel.

Just spent Thanksgiving in NYC and stayed at the Gild Hall. Great suite at a very reasonable rate. Excellent service. Felice, the restaurant on the lobby floor is great for breakfast and lunch. Highly recommend as not only great hotel but while the location may not be in the center of the NYC theater or restaurant districts, it is convenient to all and in an area that is much less hectic and much more relaxed.

Nice Hotel well located and the Restaurant downstairs I thought was excellent. Rooms were nice but not brilliant. Air con heating fan too noisy I had to turn it off (and it was 24 F). Friendly staff. I would stay again.

While most people would expect a Manhattan hotel to have attitude, the attitude it showed me in November was exemplary. I checked in at night with a really bad case of laryngitis. The desk clerk got the tea list and had me select a complementary pot of hot tea to be delivered to my room. This is the second time I've stayed in this hotel with nothing but good experiences both times. While cab drivers seem to have problems finding the entrance, the hotel is well worth the confusion.

Outstanding Staff!! Extremely professional and Very friendly....not pretentious at all - something i experienced in other boutique hotels in NYC. Rooms are very comfortable, layout was perfect for my wife and 18 mo baby (combined business and pleasure). I travel 40-50% of the year and highly recommend this hotel for NYC, located on a quiet street in financial district, near the WTC memorial (a must see) and conveniently located to nyc subway stations. Next trip back to NYC, i'll be back at the Gild

Gild Hall is a cozy place that I would defintely go back to. My 17 year old daughter and I stayed there for 2 nights and shopped all day. We had room service both nights and it was delicious. The prices are very good for NYC and the staff was amazing! Attentive, funny, personable. I loved the fun decor and the wine bar upstairs was sooooo warm and cozy feeling.

We visited the city and returned to the Gild Hall for a 4 night stay. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The room was clean and tidy, with the frosted bathroom door still in place. The windows are small, which makes the rooms a little on the dark side. There isn't much of a view, looking across to offices. That said, the neighbourhood is generally quiet. Some might find the room heating a little noisy. We opted to have the window open a little, which worked for us. We love the location, but you do need to be mobile. Nearby subways, serve all of the city, or you can walk. It's not in the heart of the city. There are plenty of dinners and pubs outside of the hotel restaurant. Most of these are frequented by office workers in the evenings. I would recommend the hotel.

This hotel is a terrific option for extending a business trip into a lovely weekend. The location is perfect for anyone working in the financial district, yet convenient to several subway stops, so it only took 15-20 minutes to get to Times Square. Rooms are fine with nice high ceilings. We enjoyed the restaurant for breakfast and I appreciated the gluten-free options.  However I have a suggestion for the one major complaint, the same one as other reviewers had here: the translucent glass on the bathroom door. When I read about this, I assumed the glass would be frosted, but it's clear glass with stripes in it. So you really can see right into the bathroom. This presents the obvious problem of no privacy, which, even for us longtime married folks, isn't desirable. And it is a big issue for anyone traveling with a friend or, more significantly, children. The other problem this creates is turning on the bathroom light in the middle of the nite wakes up the other person in the room, which also was very undesirable. When I checked in, it was apparent another guest was complaining about the bathroom door to the desk clerk so I asked if there was a room where the door wasn't so visible from the bed. Two of the staff, including the bellman, Rob, who was very helpful, offered to show me rooms, which I really appreciated. I was able to get a room where the bathroom wasn't in front of the bed. But it was still not totally private and the light shown through into the room. When I later discussed this issue with the weekend manager, Chloe, who, like the rest of the staff, was very gracious and helpful, she said the rooms will be remodeled next year to correct the door problem. Since that will take a while, she promised to pass this tip on to her boss: Just add hooks to the wood above the top of the glass panels, for each of the bathroom doors, then guests can hang the hotel bathrobes there and it will offer privacy. For guests,if you don't have bathrobes in the closet, ask for them. If there aren't hooks yet, (hopefully soon), you can hang the robe on wood between the glass but it's not as secure. See the photo. Also there are two light sources in the bathroom, so just use the softer light instead of the brighter florescent one. We will return often to NYC and plan to stay here again. But hopefully the bathroom doors will be fixed soon. And it also would be nice to have coffee /tea in the room, which is offered in nearly every hotel these days. With those improvements, I'm sure I'll be able to give this place five stars the next time we stay there.

Stayed here months back and forgot to submit a review . It's a beautiful hotel with a friendly professional staff . We would go back in a heartbeat . If not sure how to get here , use the old fashioned way ..... A map . GPS sends you over the Brooklyn bridge to Brooklyn . We know !

I have stayed at the Gild Hall hotel for business a number of times over the last two years.Twice now they have told me that they've been in an oversold situation when I tried to check in, despite my weeks-ahead credit card guaranteed booking.The first time they somehow discovered they did have a room available after all, after giving me a bit of hassle at the front desk.The most recent time, they did not have a room. To say the least, this was not welcome news at 1 AM when I arrived after a 6 hour flight from San Francisco, and given that I had morning meetings the next day.They found a room for me at another hotel and paid for it, but by the time I was settled in the other hotel room, it was 2:30 AM. The next morning, someone from the Gild called me to make sure I was leaving the other hotel, because they wanted to be sure I knew they weren't paying for another night.Then they sent me an automated email saying my "revised" reservation started that day, and I was already in the cancellation period. Nice touch! I was furious.I travel on average every other week for work, and have stayed at hotels all over the NYC financial district, including the Gild. It has never been my absolute favorite, but I have thought it was OK. The glass door to the bathroom would be a real problem if I weren't saying alone. And sometimes the rooms aren't spotlessly clean. I actually like the restaurant.However, the number one most important thing to me is that I actually have a room when I arrive, and that's a promise the Gild can't seem to keep.For around the same money and in the same neighborhood, I highly prefer the Andaz Wall Street if it's available.

I stayed for 5 nights - excellent service, clean, quiet room. Staff was incredible and attended to my every need. Felice Restaurant and Bar area great dining experience breakfast lunch and dinner. Definitely will return next time I am in NYC.

This Thompson Hotel tucked in a quiet neighborhood a stone's throw from Wall St. and Fulton St. subway stops is convenient, clean, friendly, and the in-house restaurant has excellent food and an intimate bar and mingling area. The rooms aren't very spacious, but the amenities, decor, furnishings, and bathroom are lush. I've never had a bad experience there.

This hotel is very clean and distinctive. I have had a problem finding a good hotel in Manhattan - Wall Street district. From its rooms, to the reception area, to the bar, to the excellent service - this is five stars all the way!

We stayed in the Gild Hall for five nights, and really appreciated the helpful staff and prefect location for getting around Manhattan and Brooklyn. We ate in the restaurant on the first night, and really enjoyed our meal. The hotel has a great bar, and the upstairs bar area is also lovely to sit and enjoy. We booked a King Deluxe room, which was very stylishly designed with a very comfortable bed. The complementary bathroom products were particularly lovely; I have since tried to find them to buy for myself!

The staff of this hotel is amazing. Always with a smile and a great attitude towards customers. The rooms decoration is beautiful and the Italian Restaurant is delicious. If you want to stay Downtown and the financial district this is one of the best options you have. Breakfast is great and room service works perfect.Overall this is truly a great Boutique Hotel that I recommend without a doubt.

We have been on a a trip from San Francisco, San Diego, Las Vegas and NYC before leaving for Hong Kong and back to Australia. We selected this hotel for the location and the expectation it would be a boutique hotel as we have experienced in Singapore, Melbourne and Sydney. I feel rather underwhelmed by the experience. The room was smaller than I would have expected and we didn't have enough room for 2 suitcases and 2 carry on bags. Being on the 4th floor on the road side it was extremely noisy. The room doors do not seal and light can be seen from below, i.e. you can hear other people walking to their rooms and their doors closing. The general cleanless was poor and I don't think I have seen a shower curtain in a hotel for years, especially a 4 star! With no coffee/tea facilities in the room I just felt its more of a 3 star. I do not feel the layout of the rooms is efficient and $5 charge for a jug of tap water makes it feel just like a major chain which is disappointing. The aircon was extremely old and we ended up having the window open as it was quieter than turning on the old fan! I would have also expected a reasonable amount of wifi for the room as I have when hotels charge a silly amount for something which is near to zero cost to them.

My husband booked made reservations more than 6 months ago so that we could stay at Gild Hall during the New York City Marathon weekend. The hotel did not disappoint. The styling is impeccable with an abundance of brass fixtures, old books, hide rugs. And, despite being on trend, there was a much appreciated complete absence of mason jars. The service was great: thoughtful and attentive. We enjoyed breakfast every morning in the adjacent Felice restaurant and also had a fantastic pre-race dinner there. The menu including great gluten free and vegetarian options. The rooms were a very reasonable size and well appointed. The bath salts were greatly appreciated post-marathon. Getting around town was easy with nearby subway stops. Highly recommend this place if you have an eye towards design and appreciate a well-curated hotel.

I was really impressed with the Gild. I booked this hotel due to its boutique nature and positive reviews. I emailed Perry and the manager Bjorn as this was a surprise birthday present for my husband. I cannot rate their service high enough. Perry even offered to book Amtrak tickets with their own personal card when she was not in work to accommodate one of my requests! As it was a special birthday our booking was upgraded to a fantastic room with the beautiful chandelier and high ceilings. We received balloons and cupcakes and my husband had chocolates every night for turn down. From the moment we arrived the door staff and check-in staff took the time to speak to you and ensure that needs were met. Our room rate included breakfast at the restaurant downstairs which was fantastic. My only two criticisms and these are very very picky(!), is the standard of lighting in the room - they are very dark. Also there have been a few guests talking about the translucent nature of the bathroom doors. As I was on holiday with my husband it wasn't a major problem but it isnt very romantic to see somebody sitting on the toilet through the door. I am all for trendy and boutique but this is a problem of privacy and functionality. Thank you Gild Hall- exceptional customer service and unique design made you a fantastic choice for our special trip.

Great place, great staff, altogether GREAT! Located in the Financial District, it is walking distance to so many things. I would definitely stay at Gild Hall again on another NYC adventure! The hotel lobby was unique and charming, and the rooms were quaint and absolutely perfect! The staff was helpful in assisting us in the right direction for out daily activities. Located across the street from Stout, a great little pub to start it end your night!
user_name:
Natalie G
Devils Lake, North Dakota

review_body: I emailed the Gild Hall before going, just to check one or two things, and I have to say thanks to the staff there who improved our first ever trip to NYC immeasurably before we even arrived! Special thanks to Bjoern and David for the help with our room, and especially to Peri who was full of great ideas for things to do around the city!The service when we arrived was just as good, the staff always smiling and helpful - in a city full of people who have somewhere to go and something to do, the staff at the Gild Hall always had time for us.The room was very clean and pleasant, and there were no issues worthy of complaint, though the bathroom had a very slow-draining plug and the bathroom itself was separated from the main room by a semi-opaque glass panel. This wasn't particularly awkward as I was staying with my wife, but had I been travelling with a friend, I'm not entirely sure I'd be comfortable sitting right next to the separating wall on the toilet!Overall, an outstanding experience - and if we're ever in NYC again, we'll be back for sure!

Well-appointed and with an excellent, accommodating staff, the Gild Hotel is a discovery. The smallish room is standard in NY, especially downtown, but still very comfortable. Strong wi-fi and a nice restaurant round out the hotel. Easy access to the subway to head uptown, rather than rely on cabs is an added bonus.
user_name:
Robert P
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Hotel is very well designed starting from the reception lobby, through corridors ending by rooms. We stayed in the hotel for three nights, we met different staff at the reception but everyone was very nice & helpful, service was almost on 5 star level. We really enjoyed our stay and will definitely recommend it to our friends. Thank you

My husband and I stayed here on our first trip to New York. Service and staff from the outset were extremely attentive, friendly and helpful. The hotel lounge was quaint and very boutique, as were the rooms. I was expecting a small room given its New York so the size was in line, however, a few irritations included when requesting a jug of ice water from room service, I was advised a $5 charge would be incurred! This did not seem to be mentioned it the room guestbook and seems excessive, even in NY. There was also no tea or coffee making facilities within the room which was disappointing but I'm not sure if this is a standard for NYC. Other notes include the heating/cooling unit is very noisy. Overall it was a nice hotel but for the money you pay, I'd expect the extra touches which I didn't feel were there.

Hotel was a last minute booking through a travel website. Booked two rooms next to each other for a friends birthday. The"birthday girl" mentioned to the front desk that it was for her birthday. 2 hours later management sent a bottle of persecco and some "baked by Melissa" mini cupcakes to both rooms. I stay in NYC hotels several times a year and I will def be returning to the Gild. The lobby and bar area are very nice. Also ordered room service while we were getting ready and food was delivered quickly and we received a follow up phone call to see if everything was delivered to our satisfaction. Its the little touches that make the difference between a good stay and an amazing stay. Thank you for your hospitality!!
user_name:
Danny C
Long Island, New York

review_body: My wife and I recently stayed at the Gild on a weekend trip to the city and had a great experience!The Gild was in a great location that gave us easy access to the subway and was within walking distance to some of the sights we wanted to see like South Street Seaport, the Brooklyn Bridge and Freedom Tower.The hotel lobby and rooms were stylish. Our room was spacious with king sized beds with pillows and duvets that made it tough to leave! But the best thing about the hotel was the staff! On our arrival, the front desk staff greeted us warmly and quickly made us feel right at home. As we headed out each morning the bar was quick with a cup of coffee and some conversation.Anytime we come to the city we will be staying here and recommend you do the same!

Booked this hotel last minute because I wanted to check-in early at 9am and the room I booked at another hotel nearby wasn't available.Pros: 1) Ease of booking - I was able to book the hotel on Expedia and confirm (by phone) my early check-in, and get my room all within 10 minutes. The entire process was smooth and seamless.2) Value for money - My room was surprisingly cheap for a nice boutique hotel in the area. 3) Decor - lobby and corridors are both very chic. 4) Room size is quite large in NYC standards.Cons: 1) Room Comfort: My biggest complaint is the in-room lighting. One of the desk lamps did not work. The lights that did work were very harsh i.e. too bright and fluorescent. This was particularly problematic because there's very limited natural light coming in through the window during the day or at night. In addition, the temperature control to be a bit wonky. The room was stuffy when I first checked in, and when I turned on the air conditioning (or heater), it quickly became way too cold. I couldn't find a way to make the room breezy and not freeze at the same time. Overall, I felt that while the room had interesting design elements, the comfort level is inferior to, say, a Double Tree or Four Point. During much of my stay inside the room, I kept thinking how much more I would have enjoyed chain hotel room... And sadly this is an issue I find with many boutique hotels. 2) The room service menu was a bit too Italian-centric. I think they should provide lighter or more generic options like a panini or more salad options.

Another great stay at Gild Hall. I first stumbled upon this hotel during their free concert series with The Shoe, a two member band that I was just starting to follow. After seeing the great lobby with its upstairs bar and the Felice restaurant, I knew I wanted to go back. I booked a room with my sisters for my bachelorette and it was a blast- comfy, stylish and a great location. My now husband and I thought this would be a great place to stay the night before our flight to our honeymoon destination- we were right! Wonderful hospitality including a bottle of prosecco delivered to our room to toast the start of our honeymoon. This hotel is a great spot to stay for a special occasion- I'm looking forward to our next stay at Gild Hall!

This is our 3rd time staying at Gild Hall. We really like the hotel. Really nice hotel. Centrally located to downtown, subway stations and restaurants. Super friendly staff, always ready to assist. The rooms are quiet and clean.

My boyfriend and I met in NYC to celebrate our birthdays together. I communicated via email with the hotel ahead of time to ask for a special surprise birthday cake to be brought up to the room for my boyfriend. Esther took care of my request and we had a lovely personalized birthday cake and a bottle of prosecco brought to the room!!! The front desk and all the staff we encountered were also great-- very helpful and friendly!We had a room with high ceilings which was really nice. The lobby area and restaurant have a nice atmosphere. We had a great stay and would recommend gild hall highly!

I stayed here for business and had a great time. The location was central to the financial district, had a nice vibe, and friendly staff. The bed slept great, and the restaurant served an outstanding breakfast.

This is an excellent choice if you want to stay downtown - especially on the weekends wherein downtown is more than a little bit quieter than downtown. The staff here really stands out as a level above those at other area hotels I've stayed in over the years. The food at the Italian restaurant, Felice, was very good as well. Rooms were fairly spacious by Manhattan standards, clean, and the bed was comfortable as well. The appointments and theme of the hotel is unique as well, with sort of a 60s vibe to it and excellent design and appointments to boot. The only discernible downside: the elevators are a little slow. But who cares about that really? Overall, this place earns the five star rating on pretty much every level. It is clearly well managed from the bottom up - a well oiled machine. You can't go wrong here.

If you have a reason to stay in Wall Street, this is a nice hotel. My room was small but comfortable. It had a nice shower with good toiletries, a comfortable bed and fast internet. Room service was quite good - I had a nice dinner and a very reasonably priced breakfast (for room service standard). Service was great and friendly.
user_name:
adamtope23
New York City, New York

review_body: The reception staff were amazing in not only letting me check in at 5am, but upon hearing that I was moving from another hotel down the street where my stay was less than enjoyable, promptly upgraded me. It was a nice touch. The rooms are very spacious, quiet and the air con works well. Beds are comfortable.The best thing about this hotel however is the staff, from the folk at reception, to the breakfast staff. All are incredibly professional, courteous and customer focused.I have no complaints about this hotel and am looking forward to returning in November 2014. Its my favorite hotel in NYC for business and pleasure.

My fiancé and I stayed here for the New York leg of our Honeymoon, and we couldn't have been happier. LOVELY staff - Chloe and co were so helpful and sweet on the front reception. We were upgraded to a suite, got a nice complimentary bottle of fizz and some fancy chocolates. The hotel itself is in the financial district, which is great as it's nice and quiet at night (as opposed to Times Square and the like). It has a lovely bar downstairs, plus all the decor in the whole hotel and the rooms is really stylish. It has old movie memorabilia and very chic and unusual furniture. If you like something a with a bit more character, this is the place for you. Plus - an amazingly huge and comfortable bed!

We booked this hotel for the night prior to our transatlantic crossing on the QM2. Rather late in the day, Cunard let us know that they were going to operate from the Manhattan cruise terminal, rather than Brooklyn as originally planned, but we decided to stick with the Gilt Hall and were pleased we did.The tariff was very reasonable, the staff were all charming, the room was quiet and well-appointed and the bed was very comfortable.We were joined by friends for an excellent and competitively-priced breakfast the following morning.All in all we couldn't fault the hotel and, if you are indeed departing from the Brooklyn terminal, it is very conveniently situated.
user_name:
Andrew M
Milton Keynes, United Kingdom

review_body: My husband and I stayed here at the end of September and it was the perfect location. The subway lines nearby will get you literary anywhere you want to go in the city and it's even walking distance to the Brooklynn Bridge and the World Trade Center. +The bed was very comfortable +Price reasonable for New York+Great water pressure in the shower+Clean rooms with excellent maid service +Location, Location, Location!! +Breakfast in restaurant downstairs very good. We will definitely stay again when we come back.

This was our first stop on our 18 day trip. David Finch on reception could of been more helpful. He was able to provide really good advice on where to eat and arranged bus tour tickets. Good location for ground zero however time square is a bit of a hike.

do not expect thompson 60 refinment but priced accordingly.service was attentive and kind. main drawback are the rooms, very dark, basic furniture, not as stylish as one would expect from such brand. lobby is nice though albeit small

Perfect place for sightseeing in New York. We were able to check in at 12am, which is not usual. But that helped us to storage our belonings and plan our sightseeing trip. The service was awesome. Free WiFi in the lounge, nice Room, comforable bet. I do not hesitate to recommend it to others.

I had a meeting in the Wall Street area and while I have previously stayed at a different property, I decided to give Gild Hall a try -- and I am glad I did!! it is a wonderful little (although I don't know how little it actually is, but it feels quaint, comfortable and oh so cozy) hotel tucked away in the financial district. The staff were completely amazing -- personable, friendly, eager to please, welcoming -- and the hotel itself is a little gem. My room was the perfect size (well, i was upgraded to a suite!), the bed was very comfortable, the furnishings were delightful, the bathroom was large, and it was surprisingly quiet for Manhattan. Being attached to Felice is a true blessing. The food is fantastic, the service delightful, and while I was unable to spend time in the bar, it looked to be a wonderfully warm and welcoming place for a cocktail. I will be sure to book my next stay in to Manhattan at the Gild Hall. Cannot recommend it enough.

This hotel would receive a 6 star rating if it were possible!The front desk staff are outstanding, very knowledgeable, and extremely helpful. The lobby is very well designed and looks amazing. The bar/restaurant attached to the hotel is equally as awesome. The bartenders like to flex their drink making muscles and can make you any kind of drink that suits your fancy. Even can suggest types of drinks you may never heard of and that will blow your mind (speaking from experience). They own a vineyard in Italy where they grow the grapes that make some of the wines available to drink. So aside from the front desk and lobby bar/restaurant where you could spend hours, the rest of the hotel is very nice. The rooms are kept immaculate, well stocked with supplies, and have luxuriously comfortable beds. King sized beds with pillows and duvets that will make you wish you could sleep in one at home. I have yet to find a hotel with a bed as comfortable as these ones!All in all this hotel would definitely be recommended as somewhere you must stay if you're in NYC. Steps from a subway station that has 4 subway lines that can take you anywhere in Manhattan or Brooklyn. Only about a 10 minute walk from the Brooklyn bridge but only about a 5 minute walk to the piers where you can get an amazing view of the bridge day or night. No worries about wandering around near the hotel at night as the area is quite safe. In the heart of the financial district, a couple minutes away from the new Freedom tower being built where the twin towers fell, you're close to many things that lower Manhattan has to offer. There are starbucks, dunkin donuts, burger king, mcdonalds all nearby if you choose to eat fast food rather than the better food choices in the area. I would stay here again in a heartbeat and very glad we found this hotel online and couldn't have asked for a better hotel to stay at.

I was thrilled to find this treasure in the Financial District. The rooms are spacious and well designed, nothing like the generic hotel rooms one is usually subjected to. It has excellent service and is in a great location. This is my first choice for my business trips to the Financial District and I do not hesitate to recommend it to others.
user_name:
Courtney C
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Max was so personable and nice when we arrived. He asked about the reason for our stay, recommended restaurants, and was such a great guy. The bartender was also great. Then our second night Andy at the front desk was so amazing. The rooms here are small and they have frosted bathroom doors but both of us agreed that we would definitely stay here again because of the people who work here. We have never been so blown away by such amazing service! You guys are awesome; I don't know how you do it.

I liked everything about this hotel except the cleanliness. On my first night I noticed a small blood stain on the sheet and marked it up for a miss by laundry service but then on my second morning found something similar on my towel. I have stayed at a number of hotels and understand that this type of stuff can be occasionally Missed but when it happens twice in 2 days I start to question the hotels focus on the details. For the good stuff, the hotel is nicely located in downtown near the 9/11 Memorial and Brooklyn Bridge. The rooms are very quaint and modern. My king bed suited my preference for harder mattresses coupled with flatter pillows. It was definitely more European approach. The lobby is very relaxing with a small bar off the side.

The staff are super friendly and make you feel very welcome throughout the stay, not the most romantic of places, but for a business trip it's great, rooms are very clean and comfortable and everything works as it should. The coffee is a little disappointing but plenty of other places to get this from.

It's taken me a little time to get around to writing a review on this hotel, we last stayed in March 2014, which was our third visit in about 3 years. Location is perfect for both those on return visits to Manhattan as well as first timers as the area is relatively quiet on an evening (perfect for recharging after a long day) while still being pretty close to Fulton St station if you want to travel up to the hustle of Midtown or elsewhere.That said there's plenty to do in the area later on within few blocks walk if you are in the mood to eat or drink. With Stone St not far away and plenty of choice about 15 mins walk away in TriBeCa. The Seaport, Brooklyn Bridge and WTC are all also in walking distance.The hotel bar is very welcoming. The bartenders are friendly and willing to chat , or if you just want a little peace and quiet there's seating away from the bar itself. Happy hour during the week is a good time to chill out over a couple of drinks after a busy day, or before heading out for dinner.We have never dined in the restaurant (neither Felice, or the previous Libertine) but the menu looks good, and it seems to get plenty of business.The rooms are of an adequate size for Manhattan. The bed is very comfortable, there's a good size TV with plenty of choice of channels.Every thing is kept clean and tidy and there is plenty of storage space. On tip for first timers would be to remember the cross st to direct the cab driver to. I tend to ask for the corner of Platt & William St. now as "Gild Hall, Gold St" doesn't seem to help them. The hotel is about a minutes walk from there, or you could point the driver down the street to the entrance.As previously said we have stayed here 3 times now, and are currently planning another visit in January, which won't be our last.

I stay here 2-3 times per year for business travel and every time have a fantastic stay. All of the basic amenities are provided and the hotel also makes an effort to take care of the little things that make a big difference. The breakfast downstairs at Felice is of good quality and the nightlife is far superior to the usual "hotel bar" scene. The gyms are small but workable. The rooms are stylish and yet have a classic and bespoke feel that gives the Gild Hall the look and feel of a modern-day inn.The repeated artwork that bedecks each of the floors belies a little bit of a cookie-cutter approach to concept decor. Otherwise, strong attention to detail and a strong sense of true character. A real gem.

Stayed here for 2 nights while visiting NYC. It was an amazing experience! Hotel is cool and hip, the staff were so helpful and the room was great! Spacious and clean. No issues. The area was great too. A lot quieter than the hotels you stay at in Midtown and Times Square, we were on the 5th floor and barely heard a car honk during the night. Close enough to everything you need. Plenty of restaurants in the area, great walk to Soho and Chelsea, 5 minutes from Century 21(a must for any shopper). Very close the the Seaport and the 9/11 memorial etc. Perfect stay.Would recommend this hotel to anyone looking to visit NYC but wanting to stay out of the tourist-packed areas of the city. My mom can't seem to stop telling everyone she knows how much she loved this hotel. Already planning our next trip!

The location was perfect for a quick business trip to Wall Street -- accessible to a number of subways and restaurants. Front desk staff was young and helpful, and I particularly found the room service to be above-board. Great selection and even faster service.The room itself was a little worn around the edges, but overall comfortable and quiet. The only real negative was the desk area right under the tv screen -- and that's hardly a negative at all.

We stayed here while dropping our daughter off for college, which would of been very stressful for me (mom), but the wonderful staff there (especially Robert) made what would of been a nightmare journey a wonderful and stress free experience. The hotel is super cute, comfy and clean!!! We plan to go back many times while my child is there at school, there is only 1 hotel in NY for us now, and that is Gild Hall!!! Thanks for everything!!!

Our stay at Gild Hall was the most delightful. We arrived a few hours before our check in time, after the night flight, in order to put our luggage in the storage and wait. The staff did not let us go: they had our room cleaned within an hour and let us check in. When I ordered a glass of sparkling water in the bar they offered it to me and did not let me pay. They allowed me to read one of their books and, as I did not finish it and asked if I could buy it, they offered it to me as a gift. They gave us numerous helpful advice and treated us with warmth, friendliness and dignity. The room was very clean, well maintained, nicely decorated, air conditioned and sound proof. The interior design as well as the ambiance are delicate and comforting. The location is unique: quiet atmosphere of a financial district at a walking distance from vibrant streets with a number of stores, cafes, food courts, restaurants, underground stations, ferry. Beautiful architectural design is very attractive. This hotel is definitely for people who love the combination of simple, comfortable, nice and high quality!

Stayed here on a weekend- lovely lobby, parking $50 per night, wifi is $14, desk staff were young, friendly and helpful. Room was clean, quiet and comfortable. Bed had clean sheets, and mattress comfortable. Headboard showed some wear and tear expectedly. Street was overall quiet, location was great, being less than a mile to Chinatown/ little Italy etc shops/restaurant etc.Great price for the room. Would stay again.

I had a lovely birthday weekend at Guildhall in NYC. In a passing conversation I mentioned I was more of a chips and cheese person than cake, that night I found a lovely lovely cheese platter waiting for me when I got in from my adventures. The room was large by any standards and the price most reasonable. No more Upper West Side for me. Thank you Guild Hall staff for making it such a memorable weekend.
