It has been a week since I stayed at Gild Hall and I am still on a high from my wonderful visit. I can not even begin to say enough wonderful things about this hotel. I booked an overnight in the city to celebrate my impending 40th birthday and from the second I walked in (upgraded room, bottle of Prosecco and handwritten note I felt like a superstar). I am a native New Yorker. Gild Hall-with it's friendly, non-judgemental staff and cozy feel had an incredibly "UN" New York feel to it, in the midst of the hustle and bustle of the city. I only wish I had the opportunity to take more advantage of the upgraded deluxe suite they gave me for my birthday. I had set plans with friends, and didn't get back until late and didn't get much sleep. Next time I will be sure to book a room just for sleeping as it is cozy and comfortable!!!! The hotel itself if beautifully decorated-masterfully mixing the old style of the NYFIDI with modern touches that accentuate this feeling. The staff is incredibly knowledgable and fun. I could have spent all day hanging out and annoying them in the lobby with my stupid NY questions and they would have graciously answered all of them! I implore everyone to do yourself a favor-if you need to visit NYC-book your stay with the wonderful folks at Gild Hall. You will feel like the best friend of an A class celebrity!!!! :) THANKS EVERYONE! Hope to see you soon.

We have stayed 8 week with my family. It was first time and we loved the hotel. It is in heart of lower Manhattan. Very safe area. Closed to FED, City Hall and subway station. Wall Street is around the corner. Very stylish building with high ceiling rooms and very nice decoration. Staff even better than the building. Very friendly and helpfull. We Will stay there again and again. I recommend every one for any type of vacation. Business or romantic Gild Hall is your place.

We visited NY on the last summer weekend and we really enjoyed our stay in Gild Hall hotel. We used the hotel's bikes to bike around Manhattan (and some of Brooklyn and Governor's Island. It is the best way to see Manhattan!! (…and with bike you get as a first one on the ferry!)We really appreciate the service at this hotel (especially help from Robert who is very customer oriented). The hotel is nicely decorated, clean and the service is excellent. The hotel is located in Financial District (on a quiet street. ..important in NY !)...close to bike path and close to metro (also important in NY)Jan

Stayed at the Gild hotel last week and have utilized this hotel over the past 3 years for business. This is a great hotel to stay at for business and take clients to . You can walk to the major offices and the rooms have been upgraded over the past year and are very clean. Want to give special mention to the front desk assistance given by Khloe. I was with a client and Khloe was very accomodating and extremely helpfull. Also pleased that they are now serving coffee in the lobby area early in the morning.

We were here for four nights for our son's wedding, along with many other family members and friends. The location is excellent, close to many of the sights we wanted to take in and easy access to anywhere in the city, the rooms were large, clean, and very comfortable, the restaurant and bar were great places for all of us to gather, and the staff was incredibly welcoming. I had to do a few artsy, craftsy things for the wedding, and they set me up with a place I could work and helped me secure a few of the items I needed that I hadn't brought with me. David, Violet, Phetoria (sp?), Max, and Mark (and those are the folks I was on on a first name basis with, but I never met anyone of the staff who were not fantastic) were all extremely professional, warm, courteous, and personable, and they each went far out of their way to make sure everything was perfect for us. By the time we checked out, it felt like they were part of our circle of family and friends. The wedding was at a nearby venue and it was magical, but the stay at Gild Hall contributed to the fairytale feeling of the entire weekend. We wholeheartedly recommend this hotel to anyone we can, and will always stay here whenever we return to Manhattan.
user_location: St Pete Beach, Florida, United States
user_name:
Donna K
St Pete Beach, Florida, United States

review_body: The hotel is tucked away down in lower manhattan near Wall Street. So a little out of the way for the more obvious tourist stuff. However, they have made the entrance area a cool place and with a glass of preseco on offer to help you check-in it certainly makes for a very warm welcome. The rooms are a reasonable size and comfortable although I so wish american hotels would replace the silly half depth baths with better quality showers. My only main issue is that they charge you $15 dollars a day for wifi in your room while it's free in the lobby!The attached restaurant is a decent Italian (lamb was superb) and breakfast is excellent.

We spent 5nights in New York last April together with family;5 persons. Plan was to find nice, clean, and reasonably priced hotel from Manhattan. We had two options finally, one from Times Square area and this Gild Hall from financial district. And I am glad we choose Gild Hall from Downtown. Location was great, walking distance to many sightseeing areas; Brooklyn Bridge, WTC, Liberty Island etc. Also subway was easy to reach from hotel. Rooms were spacious that I thought beforehand, clean and equipped with extremely nice beds/bedclothes. Area where the hotel eas located, was quite peaceful, but still there was places for breakfast and dinner around.

Having stayed here a few months ago (and writing a review) I wanted to write another given the great experience we had. Although our stay was only for one night from the start the end it was another great experience. We arrived early at 9:45 am and needed to drop a suitcase off before heading off to the office for a day of work. Amazingly, our room was already available and with the free WiFi we could do some work, freshen up and then head into the Financial District for meetings. Upon returning after a long day, the wonderfully comfortable bed and quiet surroundings meant a sound, a very welcome, night's sleep. If I have one slight negative it's that the aircon unit was unexpectedly noisy (certainly compared to other rooms I've stayed in at the hotel) but it's genuinely the only 'fault' I could mention and not even on that prevented me from dropping off to sleep even with my body still very much on GMT time.I cannot recommend the Gild Hall enough whether for business or pleasure, you'll find welcoming, friendly staff, a clean and well-proportioned room and one of the comfiest beds in Manhattan,

Couldn't find a better value for money place in NY. Very well furnished, modern and very helpful staff. What really impressed (other than the great Italian restaurant and wine bar downstairs) was its proximity to Fulton St subway station. A 1 minute walk around the corner and you can connect to anywhere in Manhattan - it's has multiple lines travelling to Brooklyn as well as JFK. It was also handy having a deli supermarket 50m away, and a few great pubs nearby.

Gild Hall is a hidden gem in the financial district of NYC. Rooms are large and comfortable. Bathrooms are large and modern. Quiet. The staff are very friendly and professional, always friendly, willing to help in any way. I have stayed at this hotel multiple times when in NYC on business. The restaurant, Felice, is a bit noisy, but food is outstanding. A bit pricey for dinner, but that is NYC. Great wine selection.I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a clean, comfortable, and cost effective lower Manhattan Hotel.

Tucked away from the main streets of New York City's Financial District is the Gild Hall, a boutique hotel offering upscale accommodations. Close by are the Stock Exchange, Trinity Church and the World Trade Center Memorial. The main entrance to the hotel is on Platt Street, as clearly marked on the hotel's website (and even on this page). I should have paid more attention because at first my driver couldn't find it! The restaurant is right off the lobby/library area and is called Felice Ristoranti.You can see the restaurant from the street, so look for that because the hotel entrance is hard to see. Right before Felice, there is a nice bar with a good snack/small plates menu. Try the short rib sliders and fries because I found them delicious. Great wine selection too (including by the glass, which is what I did). Breakfast was particularly enjoyable - organic eggs, sunflower toast and roasted new potatoes (bacon, sausage etc is available). Also, there is an upper-level wine lounge called La Soffitta with big comfy chairs. Rooms are a fair size for NYC and the furniture is functional. Bed was OK. The only issue might be the frosted glass doors to the bathroom. Through the door, you would certainly be able to see anyone in the bathroom. No problem for me because I was alone on a business trip! This was a very pleasant hotel with smart, pleasant staff who asked me several times if I needed help with dinner reservations, directions etc. I will certainly stay here again. So much nicer than the big, somewhat impersonal corporate hotels.

We booked to stay here as it was out of central Manhattan and neither of us wanted to be right in the hustle and bustle of the Times Square area. The hotel management upgraded our room after our agent told them it was our honeymoon and the room we were given was spectacular. We slept well and the staff at the hotel could not have been more helpful.
user_name:
Tanya G
Dovercourt, null, United Kingdom

review_body: We had a weekend off from our busy schedules, so we came down to have fun and visit friends in the city. Gild Hall was the perfect place to stay, for just such an occasion. A boutique hotel, the staff was friendly and accommodating, and made us feel welcome. The design of the room itself was unique and warm. The bed was large and comfortable, and the room itself was very spacious, with a killer aesthetic. We very much enjoyed our experience, here!

Our music group stayed here in June for an event at Battery Park and we all loved it! When I walked in the door I was pleasantly surprised by the cozy, comfortable and slightly funky and whimsical décor of the lobby. The rooms were great too. The staff was very welcoming and helpful at all times - very professional yet not too formal with a nice touch of humor. Easy walking distance to many cafes, museums and historic places. I'd definitely stay here again when I'm next in NYC!

We stayed at the Gild Hall for our 20th anniversary and we are so glad we did! Our experience surpassed all our expectations. The welcome and check in went smoothly. David, at the front desk, was extremely professional, courteous and helpful. When he found out it was our anniversary, he upgraded us to a suite. In addition, he and other staff sent us Godiva chocolates to our room when we returned from sightseeing that evening. What a delightful surprise!The rooms are beautiful and immaculate. The champagne welcome reception was also quite wonderful.Thanks again to Gild Hall for making our anniversary trip a very special one.Dorothy & John
user_name:
Dorothy M
Port Washington, New York

review_body: We just stayed at Gilt Hall for our 15th wedding anniversary, and we're so thrilled that we did. We have both worked in the luxury travel industry for years, stayed at some of the worlds most luxurious hotels, and Gild Hall did not disappoint. True service is when your expectations are exceeded, and your needs are anticipated. This is what we experienced, with all the hotel staff, the restaurant Felice (AH-mazing-and we're food snobs!), our room, amenities, service, staff and the hospitality in general. Because it was our anniversary the front desk manager David had a chilled bottle of Prosecco and a hand written card waiting in our room. When we arrived, we we're congratulated on our anniversary and upgraded to a Suite (thank you Tomo and ?!). I can't say one bad thing about Gilt Hall, and can't recommend it highly enough! Truly and unbelievable exceeded my expectations in every way experience. Thanks to the whole staff for treating us like royalty!

There are 1765 hotels in New York City (Google it!) and yet every time I’m there, I choose to stay at Gild Hall. The reasons why start as soon as you walk through the front door. It’s more than the warm wood floors or comfy leather appointed furniture that greats you; It’s the home away from home with friends feel you get from the glass of Prosecco welcoming you or the checkers board in the living room’esque lobby waiting to be played. But just a nice environment does not a great hotel make; it ultimately comes down to the staff. I’m not going to list all of the Gild Hall persons who consistently go above and beyond as it would literally be a reprint of the entire staff directory. Rather, I’ll list the adjectives that come to mind when I think of everyone I’ve met: attentive, warm, professional, attention to detail, conscientious, accommodating, welcoming, friendly… I’ll stop now before I run out of space, but these are the attributes that sets Gild Hall apart from a cold, sterile, corporate factory hotel with an ever changing staff. Instead, it’s a boutique hotel that you enjoy coming to as much as the city itself. In essence, that’s really the key to my love for Gild Hall. I just really like coming here because of the staff as much as I love coming to NYC. Which I do. A lot. The great location doesn’t hurt either. Gild Hall is about a 15 min subway ride, straight shot, from Penn Station. It’s close to the Fulton station which is a hub for the 2,3,4,5,A,C,J,Z lines and walking distance to the PATH train at World Trade Center and to the south ferry terminal. If you’re there for business, it’s perfectly located in lower Manhattan. If you’re there for pleasure, it’s quietly nestled away from all the hustle and bustle crowds and tourist masses so you can relax and decompress at the end of the day.I will end my love letter to Gild Hall with a recount of one of the many incidents that keep me coming back. I had been away for several months, long enough to have been forgotten by any chain hotel, and I decided to pass though NYC at Christmas on the spur of the moment. Someone saw my name on the register that day and when I arrived to my room there were cupcakes and a note saying welcome back waiting for me. Cupcakes! Not some pillow chocolates, but cupcakes! Waiting for me on Christmas Eve. That’s the warm feeling I get here and nowhere else. And that right there sums up why Gild Hall is my home away from home.

Usually stay at Millenium Hilton when on business in NYC - decided to change this time after another stay of being treated like one of many in the herdThe Gild Hall changed all that from the complimentary glass of Prosseco on arrival (I'm a sucker for a freebie) to the wonderfully friendly check outOne of the quietest hotels I've stayed at in NYC due to its positioning down a side street in the Financial District BUT still very close to 4 subway lines at Fulton Street and within easy walking distance of our offices in Battery ParkAll the staff are bright young things who seem genuinely interested in providing a great service to their guests - something they certainly achieved. There's free wifi in the lobby area which makes for a very convivial atmosphere there in amongst the phalanx of books on the shelves - certainly a favourite of the social media crowd keeping in touch with family at homeRooms were well decorated and very clean - beds excellent. My only quibble was that I didn't have a means to boil water for a cup of tea - yes, I am English!!I have already recommended this hotel to a number of colleagues and I'll be returning myself next time I am in NYC - for business or pleasure

I've traveled to NYC for over 30 years and finally have found a QUIET retreat from the sirens and noise...Gild Hall. A European style Hotel offering comfort in an area of the city I'd never really experienced, Gild Hall offers everything - a quality restaurant, comfortable beds and a wonderfully responsive and attentive Staff. Thank you Gild Hall for the stay - we will be back!

This hotel far exceeded my expectations. The room was larger than I expected after hearing stories about NY accommodation. It was clean and even with all the street noise it was relatively quiet. The only negative was the noise of the air-con but this didn't detract from our experience too much. The WIFI in the lobby was fast and reliable.The hotel is close to the Fulton St subway station so it's easy to go uptown and experience everything then return to the relative quiet of the hotel.The staff were all excellent and I would like to thank Andy for his directions and tips while we were there.

Just returned from a great weekend in New York City, stayed @ the Gild Hall, a few blocks from Wall St. This boutique hotel has all the charm of a private club and the staff were gracious and accommodating, a tranquil oasis in the midst of the hustle and bustle that is NY. We were upgraded and given a clean, quiet room on the third floor.P.S. Using one of the Hotels bikes was a major plus.

My husband and I visited NY, NY for the first time this past weekend. We really didn't know what to expect and were somewhat apprehensive about it. From the moment we entered Gild Hall until we left, we were treated like royalty. The staff were absolutely amazing. They made sure we were well taken care of without pestering us. The location was perfect. The hotel itself was really awesome, great decor, great setup, cool books everywhere, a chilled, but classy environment. Our room was perfect. The air was clean. We were right by the elevators, but never heard anything. Felice, the hotel restaurant, was superb with great food and excellent staff. We can't say enough good about this place. We've traveled a lot, but don't remember having such a positive stay at a hotel ever. We'll be going back!

I just finished a return visit to Gild Hall and I'm making it my go-to hotel when I visit the city. Once again, the staff was fantastic - walking around the corner with a luggage cart to help me unload my car, for instance. Our room was comfortable, stylish, and quiet. I also noticed in this visit that the neighborhood is quite convenient - there are many options for coffee and pastries within 2 blocks, for instance, which is great for me because I really need the morning jolt.

You never know what you're going to get, even when visiting websites such as Trip Advisor. But our stay at Gild Hall was an unbelievable experience! When you first walk in the lobby the smell of masculinity hits. Rich, warm, earthy. The lobby itself is decorated with dark hardwood floors, hip lighting and art, and oversized leather furniture. The staff is warm and welcoming and made us feel right at home, asking about our visit to the city and offering suggestions for eating. They were genuinely interested in the reason for our stay and offered encouragement to my 15 y.o. daughter who would be staying in the city alone for 3 weeks to dance at the Joffrey. Our room not only smelled clean but was clean, and again the décor was rich and inviting. The attached restaurant had a most delicious breakfast although a bit overpriced. I could not leave the Gild without a piece of the hotel to take home. I was able to purchase the plaid tartan blanket from the front desk. A much better token of my stay than an "I love NY" tshirt. The ONLY odd thing about the room would be the frosted glass bathroom wall. Very sexy if you are with your lover, fine if you are a family, a little weird if you are sharing a room with friends, which we were.

id just like to thank Anthony & Jessica from the reception in this hotel. they were brilliant help on my first night in the hotel when i had issues trying to contact my bank (bank blocked mu cards). they went above and beyond for me to help get it sorted hotel in general was great as well. would definitely stay there again and tell friends about the hotel if they were traveling to NYC

Recently I stayed at the Guild for a week during the wedding of my daughter. We chose the Gild as our wedding block even though the wedding took place at the Liberty Warehouse in Brooklyn because of its proximity to the venue. The service from the incredible staff was extremely professional and excellent, from the bell boys to the reservation people to the waitresses and host of the restaurant, Felice which is an added bonus. The "boutique" ness of the hotel provided sophisticated charm, comfort, and friendly atmosphere. The restaurant served brunch to 64 guests the morning after the wedding and seemlessly served two groups early and mid-morning. The food was hot and the service was wonderful. I would definitely recommend this property for your special event, and I look forward to returning in the near future to visit my newly married daughter!

Terrific location, very near to South Street Seaport where we boarded our dance cruise to party the night away! Room was spacious and very clean. Upon arrival, we were greeted with a welcome glass of Prosecco...yes please! What a nice way to start our trip. Shortly after arriving to our room, we received a complimentary bottle of Brut to celebrate my sister's bachelorette. I loved the complimentary NY Post in the morning. The hotel staff went above and beyond to welcome us and provide for a nice time. I also have to mention the hotel restaurant/bar Felice, which had a beautiful setting and delicious food. Lovely boutique hotel in the financial district. This was my first stay at a Thompson hotel and I look forward to more.

I recently was one of approximately twenty couples that stayed at the Gild Hall for a wedding in Brooklyn. We all concluded that the incredible staff made the event even more memorable. We interacted frequently with the front desk as well as the room maids, room service and maintenance and every one of the interactions was positive and professional. My own party of three rooms included my 95 year old mother and my 2 year old grandson and they both a great experience due to the fabulous staff.

I'd noticed this hotel on a prior trip to this part of Manhattan and thought it looked interesting enough to try as a couple. We were not proved wrong. The staff were helpful, the room was much larger than expected and was well equipped. It certainly falls into the 'boutique' category and was most enjoyable to stay. Yes, it doesn't have all the extras of a big chain and wifi is only free in the lobby area but the atmosphere more than made up for this. We did not take breakfast as there were more interesting (and cheaper) options just around the corner. That said, we did eat in one night and the Italian was good. I would certainly go there again.

Great stay and very pleased with every hotel representative I had the pleasure of speaking with or otherwise dealing with during my stay. Definitely plan to return to this hotel on my next trip to NY.

I can't say enough about how wonderful this hotel was! We were in NYC for my daughter's orientation at Pace University. The staff was extremely helpful, courteous and friendly. The hotel itself is beautiful. It has a unique, art deco kind of design to it. The rooms are elegant and well appointed (love the fluffy comforters) and everything was scrupulously clean! The location was perfect (5 minute walk to Pace). There were dozens of restaurants in the immediate vicinity ranging from casual pub or pizza to high end, and everything was easy walking distance. I didn't eat at the hotel restaurant, but I did look at the menu and found that the prices were reasonable. I will be making lots of trips to the city over the next few years and I will definitely stay at Gild Hall.

Don't let the exterior façade of the Gild Hall fool you. It's quite unassuming and architecturally uninspired. But walk through the doors and you'll be pleasantly surprised. This is one of the largest standard rooms I've ever had in Manhattan and for a very reasonable price, for Manhattan. In the financial district, this hidden gem is an easy walk to Wall Street, the World Trade Center site and Broadway. There are lots of shops, restaurants and pubs within an easy stroll but you're just off the path enough that it's remarkably quiet for downtown. There's a very short, safe walk to the Fulton Street subway station where the A, C or E lines will take you anywhere you want to go. Easy to get uptown or to Brooklyn.The interior of the hotel is sleek, modern and clean with very professional staff and a secure elevator. The bed is quite comfortable and the bathroom is very nicely done. I can't say it enough, the rooms are huge for Manhattan.There's a little cocktail lounge in the lobby and a restaurant serving a simple but satisfying breakfast. Around the corner is a great little pub with plenty of good beer and a scotch list to keep you busy. Ask for Finn. If that's not enough, there's a fully stocked mini-bar where you can have a glass of wine in the comfy robe they provide.Safe neighborhood, first rate staff, and luxurious appointments. This is a great find!

Gild Hall could not have been more perfect to host my family and guests for my daughter's wedding. The staff went above and beyond to make our guests feel comfortable. The rooms were clean and the location was great. I could not say enough about how friendly and helpful every staff member was. All in all, a really great experience.

The Gild Hall Hotel has lovely large rooms, the AC gets down to 65 degrees (can I get a hallelujah), the staff is friendly and helpful, great mini-bar snacks and not eye gauging prices (well maybe the water was a bit pricey at $6)...and the location was superb as I was there on business! Unique decor in addition.

Positives: Clean rooms, Very comfortable bed! Friendly helpful staff, good location for sightseeing!Questionables: We could not open our blinds in our room as their were offices and condo's directly across and close...felt a bit claustrophobic because of that.....No coffee makers in room. It feels like a budget hotel, room was small, one of the smallest rooms we have ever stayed in NYC. They wasted half of the closet space with a minibar and expensive alcohol and snacks. We’d rather have more space to put our clothes than expensive snack, alcohol that I won’t partake in. Bathroom also has two small shelves over the toilet disappointing if you are staying for more than a few days. There is a free standing sink with limited room for accessories. No storage area in the bathroom. There is only a towel bar to hang your towel and no other hooks to hang anything else. They had only 2 bath towels and hand towels, we have never stayed at a hotel that only provides only 2 bath towels, with no place to hang the wet ones if you have to reuse one. The Bad: The room we stayed had a glass bathroom door. This alone will make our decision not to stay here again. Whoever thought this idea up must travel alone. We have never seen anything so awkward and annoying. You are in a small room and the only privacy you may ever get is in the bathroom that has a glass door. We had to buy 2 cheap table cloths from the nearby store and tape the doors over. We will not recommend this hotel to our friends based solely on this design. Every time someone had to use the bathroom during the night and put the light on, the entire room would be lit up. Bad design! It our opinion, Gild Hall is an ok, average hotel, however with that bathroom design, there are much better choices in the city and will look elsewhere when visiting the city in the future.

We live on our boat but we were coming into the city on the ferry from Liberty Landing Marina in Jersey City to see a play ("Sistahs" at St Luke's -- great) so we wanted to spend the late night in town. We stayed at Gild Hall and LOVED it. The financial district is quieter on weekends (perfect for us) but the hotel bar and adjoining restaurant (Felice, Italian and wine bar -- very good) were busy and fun. Our room was a good size, clean, comfortable and I liked the design and color palette. If you are looking for things to do in that area, there are plenty, especially now that the 9/11 Memorial and Museum are open but, in addition,there are many ferries going to many places (Brooklyn, Liberty State Park, Statute of Liberty etc). You can't beat the bike ride up the Hudson River Greenway (the path up the East River is more disjointed). I believe the hotel has bikes (we rode ours from the ferry and they stored them for us downstairs). Cab it or easy subway ride up to plays, Time Square, Central Park, shopping, etc. BUT the best part was the staff -- smart, pleasant and beyond helpful. I'm looking for an excuse to go back soon!

First trip to New York we just started with a good experience, but expensive !after walking all the day and getting back to the hotel you will feel totally fresh.For the "coffee lovers! "no coffee machine at the room

We got a great price on a hotel in the Financial District because it was the weekend. This is a great location for exploring the southern tip of Manhattan. It is close to the World Trade Center (and the Century 21 store across the street from the memorial) and the Seaport, Staten Island Ferry and within walking distance of China Town. The hotel staff were very helpful and accommodating. There is a wine bar and restaurant that we didn't visit but it was very busy. The room was large and the bed was very comfortable. the bathroom is well appointed. It felt luxurious.There is free WiFi in the lobby. We took advantage of the hotel bikes (one speed, not great but adequate) and explored the bike paths along the water. There are Citi Bike stands throughout as an alternative. We rode across the Brooklyn Bridge (a great view but very busy on Sunday with pedestrians). There are some Citi Bike stands on the Brooklyn side.

I recently stayed at Gild Hall for the first time. Everyone was very pleasant and made us feel welcome, the room was beautiful and comfortable, and it was the ideal location from the office (I was in NY for business). I have recommended the hotel to my colleagues, and will definitely stay there again.

This place is great! The atmosphere is really cool and the staff are extremely nice and go above and beyond. The level of service is exceptional. This was my first time staying at a thompson hotel group. I would definitely recommend this place. I cant say enough great things about my experience at Gild Hall. A true GEM! All hotels should live up to Gild Hall standards.

I stayed here during Memorial Day weekend. The hotel was close to several train lines and easy access to everywhere else. The hotel staff was very friendly. They offered a lot of advice about the local area. The room was comfortable. I would stay here again!

Thanks Gild Hall staff for making my 3 night stay easy, relaxing (even for work!) and yummy! The food in the restaurant is delicious, the staff is thoughtful and very friendly, and my room clean and quiet. Great place to stay in the financial district.

I stayed here with 20 of my colleagues and I couldn't have been happier with the accommodations! I was able to book a room block flawlessly and for a reasonable price for the area. The staff went above and beyond to make sure our needs were met and we felt welcome. The interiors were swanky and funky and the entire group LOVED the hotel. The manager met me at the door with a champagne toast and I really appreciated the personal touch. I would definitely suggest this hotel to anyone.

Stayed at the Gild Hotel June 8th for 7 nights.We went to NY to celebrate my 50th birthday,from the moment we arrived there we recieved nothing but excellent service. Violet on reception organized cookies & cupcakes,to be sent up to our room, free cocktails,even glasses of champagne. David on reception helped us replace our tickets for a Broadway show that we had printed off - and then left them at home!! We were also given a code to enter which enabled us to recieve free Wi-Fi which was invaluable in a big city.Situated near to Wall Street it was quiet at night & the weekend which you dont find if you stay up town/mid town.Their care and excellent service is what makes this hotel a gem in a big city like NY.We would not hesitated to reccommend The Gild Hotel & their excellent staff.

The customer service at Gild Hall is top-notch. I felt so welcomed. The rooms are nice and the bar is fun, but the staff truly makes the difference. I wouldn't normally choose to stay downtown when visiting New York, but I look forward to staying at Gild Hall again soon.

What a great little boutique hotel! We traveled to NYC for the fireworks display on the 4th, as well as a birthday weekend, and couldn't have been more pleased with the accomodations. Gild Hall is tucked away on a little side street in lower Manhatten, on Gold St., but the entrance is on Platt St. Even the cabbie had a bit of difficulty finding it, but we made the block and viola! It has a classy, understated entrance with a red awning, but once you walk in...WOW! The upscale, hip, cool decor and wonderful aroma in the lobby welcomed us as much as the friendly staff. They couldn't have been more attentive to my lost luggage situation, and helped me with complimentary toiletries as well as finding a place to buy clothes at a nearby department store. Many thanks to them all! The lobby is attached to a nice and always lively bar, and the very nice Felice Italian restaurant is connected right next door. Both were wonderful.The room was right next to the quick response elevators, which worried us to start with, but we never heard any noise during our 3 nite stay. We had a spacious room for NY, with a soft king bed, and small fridge. Other reviewers mentioned the small rooms, but this one was very nice and plenty of room, especially since we were there only late nite. Great stay! We plan to go back again! TIP: the ice machine closest to the 16th floor was behind an unmarked door, but count 4 doors down on the right past the elevators.Close to Wall St. and the financial district and 9/11 museum, and fairly close to Battery Park and the Statue of Liberty. Easy access to the subway system, with Fulton St. within 3 blocks.

I booked Gild Hall solely based on TripAdvisor reviews, so I want to give a detailed review of my stay. The Good:Location: For people who want to be away from the crowds of the midtown this is a great alternative. I like the Financial District area; it is very quiet at nights and the weekends and very convenient via subway. I recommend getting a subway pass if you want to see the city though since walking to uptown will take you a good 40 minutes. Hotel is located to many subway lines and it took me 10 minutes to go to East 57th street with metro. There are many parking lots in the area if you have your car with you. Everything is within walking distance, restaurants, subway, various cafes, and pharmacies. Rooms: I had a corner room in one of the upper floors; it did not have any adjoining rooms and was very quiet. You could crack open the window a bit. Bathroom was clean also. Even though the décor is modern it is not a brand new hotel and you can tell. It had very limited furniture and next to none closet/storage space which can be an issue if you are staying here for long, but it was OK for me. The room did not have curtains, just wooden blinds that goes with the hotel’s lodge décor, but I would have preferred blackout curtains. Overall it met my basic expectations of noise and cleanliness. Staff: Staff was very nice, front desk employees were all young and friendly and helpful. The Bad: Luxury is in the details and Gild Hall did not deliver on that aspect. It seems and feels like a budget hotel, not at all a 4 star which is supposed to be above average. Room was tiny, the smallest place I have ever stayed which includes hotels in midtown and others in downtown. They say hotels in downtown have larger rooms, but this was not the case. I am a small person and I kept bumping into furniture because there was pretty much no room to move. Also I am surprised that in such a small room they wasted half of the closet space with a minibar and unnecessary snacks. I’d rather have space to put my clothes than candy that I won’t eat. And of course room is packed with candy, water, wine etc that they want you to purchase, a little too much I thought. Bathroom also has almost no storage with a free standing sink. They had couple shelves above the toilet but again not enough if you stay there more than few days. Standard bottles shampoo, lotion etc but no shower cap. They made sure there are no hooks to hang your stuff either. There is only a towel bar to hang your towel and no other hooks to hang anything else. In such a small space I would assume they would put hooks on the walls and doors to give people some extra space to hang things also they can easily add shelves above the bathtub to store towels, most hotels so that. They had only couple bath towels and hand towels, and if you are a couple or family you will not have enough towels and again no place to hang the wet ones. It was rather annoying. I drove to the city and parked in one of the parking garages in the neighborhood, most places are $30/24 hours plus tax. Hotel charges you $55/day, no clue why, especially when there are many other garages all around the place. There is no free WIFI in the rooms, I think they should offer that.The Ugly: I am not sure if all the rooms are the same, but the room I stayed had a glass bathroom door. Who on earth would come up with this idea? I have never seen anything so illogical in my life. You are in a tiny room and the only privacy you may ever get is in the bathroom that has a glass door! I cannot even imagine what families with kids thought of that. I will not recommend this hotel to people that are not too comfortable with each other solely because of this reason. I ended up hanging a pashmina over the door, and if I did not have anything with me I would probably ask for an extra sheet. From my perspective that is unacceptable. Even if you are staying there alone you may have guests coming up and imagine, a definite NO!Bottom Line: I recommend Gild Hall to solo travelers looking for a clean, quiet place. I do not think it is great for larger groups. It is not luxurious by no means, so do not get fooled by the star ratings, but it is clean and quiet and they do welcome pets!Tips: Don't forget to try pastries at Financier Patisserie down the street.

I stayed at the Gild Hotel as part of a wedding which was being held in Brooklyn. While not the greatest location in Manhattan (around the corner from Wall St in Financial District) it makes a great spot for centralizing any activities in NYC, and was very convenient for getting to the wedding in Brooklyn. There are several subway lines near the hotel making getting pretty much anywhere in NYC pretty easy from here.The room was nice - one odd thing was the location of the bathroom in relation to the room / bed. The entrance to the bathroom was very close to where you get out of bed. But the room was a great size for NYC and the bed was clean and comfortable. Service seemed pretty good, but I did not need much service. I had a really tasty Mezcal Margarita at the bar. I did not eat at the hotel restaurant, but others did and said it was pretty good.The best part of the experience was the fact that I got a great deal (booked as part of the wedding) which made it a really good value for Manhattan.

A very nice hotel, very clean and in a great location. We were able to walk around to multiple tourist spots as well as walk to multiple subway stations. Easy to get on them and back. Hotel wasn't too expensive and there are multiple places to eat and drink around it. Would stay here again for sure

We stayed at Gild Hall on our way through New York at either end of a trip to the Bahamas in March. It was recommended by a friend who stayed there for business and we were not disappointed. The location was great, with access to 4 subway lines within walking distance. The rooms were fantastic with huge comfy beds and plenty of space in the bathroom. The heating was a little noisy but we were absolutely grateful for it in the below freezing conditions (something we hadn't experienced often). The staff were amazing (even offering to help find something warmer for me to wear on our first sortie from the hotel). Even during the madness of the St Patrick's Day weekend, they never made us feel as if anything was too much trouble.I highly recommend this hotel.

Convenient for business - good subway close byFor business hotel you would expect free wifi in rooms. This was costly. Good thing company was paying.Water in the rooms was very pricy ($8 which is a huge price for an Indian -even in NY!)Bathroom very modern!

We loved everything about our stay: comfortable bed, room large enough to have our grandson stay in a Pac'n Play, great bathroom, and nice bedding. The medieval style chandelier plus 12 foot ceiling and huge leather headboard made it very unique. A bathrobe and iron/ironing board were very nice to have. We would have liked to have a small fridge in the room and a coffee maker, but we understand that this is probably geared to business travelers who buy their coffee and may prefer to use the mini-bar in the room. All of the staff was helpful and informative. Also, be sure to eat at the Toscano Restaurant which is in the hotel. The dinner was amazing and we also really enjoyed the breakfast. All dishes have interesting spices and everyone was pleased with the quality of the food. All in all, we would definitely stay again the next time we visit New York City!

Can't say enough about the complete experience. Price was right, location perfect, amenities were very good and service was excellent. This is a really nice boutique hotel! After 45 minutes I said to myself I would stay here again. The biggest disadvantage is not being able to earn miles on your favorite airline. The biggest advantage is having staff like Khloe, Robert and Mark who make you feel right at home!There are a lot of choices in New York... This is one of make again and recommend to anybody.

We booked Gild Hall at the last minute due to an error on the part of hotels.com. They gave us a credit and we stayed at Gild Hall which was a very nice experience. It is right near my daughter's apartment in FiDi in Manhattan and the reception was more than accomodating. We got Proseco at check-in and were offered more if we wanted. The room was wonderful and the 2 extra pillows we asked for were given to us within 5 minutes of our asking. I would definitely stay here again and I highly recommend it to anyone who wants to stay at an upper- end hotel with reasonable rates.

What a great find in NYC! We usually stay at Club Quarters, and this room was much larger which is a big deal in NY. What stood out besides the comfortable feel of the property itself was the stellar staff. Every single employee that we came in contact with was over the top helpful. We arrived very late our first night and exhausted, we were greeted with a beautiful smile, quick check-in and a ice cold glass of prosecco. When I asked housekeeping for something, they were super accommodating and with a great attitude. When my daughter got home too late for room service, the restaurant manager quickly gave her a bread basket to tide her over and then prepared a to-go meal to take up to our room. The bar and restaurant is very inviting and with all the other places to go in NY we found ourselves having a drink there 2 nights. This friendly place is now on my list of top places to stay on my future visits to NYC. Thanks for a wonderful and relaxing stay!

My partner and I stayed at the gild hall for our two year anniversary. It was beautiful and romantic. Rob, our front desk agent, was absolutely incredible. He made our stay beyond special and assisted us with any information we required. I left my phone in a cab upon our arrival to New York and Rob was relentless in his attempts to get it back. What a great guy! I really appreciate the family-like feeling that was created at this hotel. The rooms are beautiful and the hotel restaurant "Felice" was awesome. Can't wait to visit again!

We had a great stay at this hotel, located in Manhattan's financial district. The staff were warm and responsive; the room was clean and very well appointed. The lobby and bar were also nicely appointed, including comfortable chairs and nice lighting. The rate for the room was also very reasonable given the meteoric rise in hotel rates in NY in recent years, though the $15/day internet charges, PER DEVICE was a bit oppressive. Overall, highly recommend this hotel.

This hotel was a really good surprise. From rolling in from Newark at 1 am to be greeted by a friendly check in person and a glass of prosecco, to the large (for NYC), comfortable and very well decorated room, to directions as to where to go to get food, transport etc, and a fabulous bar and lobby area, this hotel really stood out. Value for money, too. One other great thing: there is a full supermarket, open 24 hours, only a block away.

My husband and I stayed here while attending a conference in New York. The hotel exceeded our expectations on many fronts. The rooms were clean and well-decorated. Even though our room faced the street, the noise was never a problem. The only thing I might warn other travelers about is the bathroom. The door and wall appear to be frosted glass but it is pretty see-through which could make for some awkward moments. The bar/restaurant has fabulous food and the service was fantastic. The lobby has a really cool ambiance and is a respite from the hustle and bustle of the city. Would definitely recommend to friends and family.

I had the pleasure of a weeks stay at Gild Hall in advance of a family life event WEDDING. The staff was so professional, kind and welcoming. The day after wedding brunch was catered at the hotel and everyone raved. Food and service spot on. Thank you Gild Hall for allowing the mother of the bride to have a truly relaxing wedding experience. Needless to say the beds are super comfy, quiet rooms and the Thompson Suite was hip and elegant.... Just like the bridal party.

I stayed at the Gild Hall over the weekend with my husband to celebrate my birthday and our anniversary. Our room was clean and spacious on the 3rd floor. We didn't have any problems with street noise. We ate breakfast at the restaurant located in the hotel and the food was wonderful along with the freshly squeezed orange juice! Complimentary champagne in the lobby daily was a plus! The location was perfect, only a couple blocks from the subway, restaurants and shops. The staff went above and beyond to make our weekend wonderful! Violet, David and Robert were kind, generous, and very attentive from setting up dinner reservations to delivering cupcakes, champagne and flowers to our room! We can't wait to stay here again! We loved it!

Extremely pleased with my stay. Boutique feel - very cool ambiance and vibe in the lobby/bar/restaurant. Rooms are designed and decorated very attractively. Fresh, clean, welcoming, cool, luxurious feel. Cons are that rooms are small but it's nyc.

Classy, romantic hotel right in the financial district. The streets around the hotel are small and quiet. Not what I expected for the hustle and bustle of NYC. The staff was super friendly. They welcomed me with a glass of prosecco! The attached bar/restaurant was great as well. 30 second walk from bars/restaurants/bodegas. About a 5 minute walk from ground zero. The staff helped me change rooms when a neighbor wouldn't stop smoking. They also had good recommendations for places to check out in the neighborhood. I really loved this place. The coffee was really excellent too. Clean, spacious, awesome!

excellent locaton for financial district and for all manhattan ( metro fulton street goes everywhere very easily) very clean and comfortablevery friendly teamexcellent restaurant downstairs very healthy and at reasonable priceThe bar is pleasant toonear of stone street for quick dinner or drinkI will certainly return

My experience at the Gild Hall was for business. I would definitely return for personal/vacation. The service was phenominal as well as the accomodations. the living room was very comfortable, the wine bar and restaruant were also very accomodating and delicious.Thank you.

I stayed one week at the gild hall with a friend! The room was just amazing and staff very kind! The location is great, the furniture is so cool and there is an unforgettable scent all over the hotel. Simply one of the best!

Stayed here for two nights amid a hectic trans-Atlantic schedule. I was immensely grateful for the sheer class of the hotel, extremely relaxing to have such space and elegance. Great bar staff who helped with the unwinding, and just an all round top class stay.I'd like to say it was expensive, however the location pretty much sums it up.

the stay at gild hall was pleasant and we were so glad to have had a good deal which made the stay even better. the restaurant in the lobby is nice - dinner was much better than brunch though. the rooms are modern and clean - the bathroom door/wall is very thin, so make sure you are sharing the room with someone you know well. :)filled in their survey and got a response very quickly - they do care about their customers!! would recommend this hotel to my friends for sure.

My fiancée and I stayed at the Gild Hall for 8 nights for our wedding. We had a great experience and the hotel staff really contributed to our enjoyment. Everybody was professional and friendly especially the fantastic receptionist Violet. We were frequently offered prosecco at the reception and generally looked after very well. The location is second to none with a great array of bars and eateries close by. Checking out Squires and Pearl St diners is a must for breakfast! The rooms were very spacious for NYC however a little noisy at night due to passing traffic - to be expected. Thanks for a fantastic stay!

This was my first visit to NYC, ( not my last) so I wasn't to sure where to stay, I read reviews on this hotel and they were positive so I picked the Gild Hall and glad I did, everything was perfect till the moment I left!

We stayed at The Gild Hotel in lower Manhattan because we were attending my son's wedding in Brooklyn. We reserved the King Suite so we could have a family "happy hour" in the suite. The staff helpfully brought us buckets of ice and glasses for this event. It was very successful and a good time was had by both families! Our suite had the highest ceilings I've ever seen in a hotel room. Although our stay was pleasant, I have a few criticisms. The decor is severely masculine and could be softened up a bit. The furniture isn't very comfortable although the bed is great. The absence of a dresser in the bedroom left us living out of our suitcases on the floor for 4 nights. Not very classy. I would stay again if I was visiting Brooklyn.

Just came back from NY this week after attending my son's wedding in Manhattan. Stayed at Gild Hall for 6 nights. Excellent boutique hotel, not average at all! Excellent service, the staff was very helpful and attentive to detail at all times. The rooms are spacious and very comfortable by NY standards. I highly recommend it if you like personalized service and want to enjoy NY without all the hustle and bustle of mid- town Manhattan. Esther Song, sales manager recommended many of the services used at the wedding and by our group, she really knows her stuff!

The boyfriend and I booked a single night stay at Gild Hall because my family was flying into town early the next day, and we thought it would be fun to spend a night on the town. (We live about an hour away from NYC.) The hotel was fantastic, with a wonderful ambiance and decor that we absolutely loved. We were greeted with glasses of prosecco when we checked in, and the staff immediately called a local restaurant that we were hoping to check out for dinner and booked us a reservation. We enjoyed after-dinner drinks and dessert in the bar at the hotel as well, and were quite pleased. We had a fantastic stay and everyone that we interacted with was friendly and super helpful. The room was a little bit small, but very nice and definitely not the smallest I've stayed in in NYC. Close to the subway, in a great downtown area. We will definitely be staying here again!

Overall a clean hotel with cool contemporary decor. The service was a little spotty but generally very good. The bar was busy and loud at night but it didn't bother us in our room.Room: It's a small space, but we didn't mind. Fun decor and magazines like TimeOut in the room for browsing added a nice touch. N.B. The bathroom door is made of frosted glass so you can basically see what your significant other is doing. Location: A nice location on a small street. There are plenty of convenience stores and grocery stores for essentials and close to century 21 for some retail therapy.

The Gild Hall is located blocks from Ground Zero and the Brooklyn Bridge, Fulton St subway station leading to all locations is blocks away. It is on a small obscure street, but the location is great. The hotel is small but does have a good restaurant and bar. The rooms are average for NYC, which is always on the small side. Staff is friendly and accomodating.Room was clean, glass doors into the bathroom are not for the modest.Overall it was a fine enough hotel, just not enough to earn 4 or 5 stars.

Some nice touches here - an umbrella in the wardrobe for you to borrow, pedal bikes at reception that guests can use. There's a happy hour at the foyer bar with great cocktails. The beds are REALLY comfortable and everything spotlessly clean. Handy for Statue of Liberty, Wall Street etc and subway stops. What more could you want? Well, a little more privacy in the bathroom might be nice! Get up in the night and you'll floodlight the entire room when you switch the bathroom light on as it has a glass wall. Hmm, who thought that was a good idea? And if you're at all shy, you won't enjoy the position of the toilet which is right next to the glass wall, albeit frosted, but leaving little to the imagination. Could spoil the romance? Maybe they could retro-fit a blind or curtain......

This is a hotel with some big pluses great staff, good size rooms for New York, really convenient location and good bar (especially happy hour weekdays four to seven). A couple of niggles which could really improve it - pay for internet in the rooms (really in this day and age) and overly trendy bathroom doors and walls with frosted glass in them (so if you have two in the room and one wants to ablute turning the light on lights up the bedroom). However, apart from these niggles highly recommended hotel internet is free in the lobby so spent time down there.

I have nothing bad to say! The room was nice and the bed was very comfortable. They have great service and the staff is friendly and professionnal. Very good location too. I particularly loved the design on the lobby, it rustic look.

Whenever I travel to a different city, I always look for hotels and restaurants off the beaten path. It is a thrill to find a cozy place to stay that bucks the cookie cutter molds of the big chains, or a restaurant that oozes atmosphere and caters to locals in the know. Gild Hall has all of that. The best word would be "boutique", but at reasonable rates for New York. From the unique, almost lodge-like lobby, to the utterly charming bar and restaurant, the first impression is, "This is a cool little place." The staff at the front desk is courteous and very pleasant. Robert checked us in and was engaging and professional. The hotel is small, but clean and charming, very European feeling. The location is on a quiet corner in the Financial District, not far from the Federal Reserve. There are a handful of coffee shops and small restaurants nearby, but it is a very short walk to Broadway. It was nice to be staying out of earshot from all of the hustle and bustle, but to have all of the shopping and dining you could want just a block and a half away. One of the reasons I booked with Gild Hall was not only the positive TripAdvisor reviews, but also the responsiveness of the hotel's general manager, Mr. Bjoern Blaha, to all of the reviews, whether they were gushing with compliments, or had a nit pick or two. And I would find out just how responsive Mr. Blaha is with his guests. I emailed him for advice on how best to get to the restaurant where my wife and I would be celebrating a special anniversary. Not only was he very helpful with several transportation options, but he upgraded our room, and showed as much enthusiasm for our special weekend as we did! We communicated several times leading up to our stay. I really felt the hotel was as invested in making our experience a memorable one as I was in planning it. As the weekend approached, I contacted Mr. Blaha once more to find a salon where my wife could have hair and makeup before our big night. He introduced his concierge, Ms. Peri Silverberg, and she got to work scheduling an amazing indulgence for my unsuspecting bride. Ms. Silverberg arranged an appointment with a very hip Soho salon, where makeup artists and stylists from Vogue transformed her from a beautiful mom into a stunning runway model! Every time she caught a glimpse in a mirror or storefront, she couldn't help but giggle with delight.We were thrilled with the spacious upgrade that Mr. Blaha provided. The King Suite was decadent by Manhattan standards, and featured a huge living room, a convenient efficiency kitchen, a sumptuous marble and glass tiled bath, and a very funky and comfortable bedroom. We almost wanted to skip dinner and just enjoy our chic pad.We returned to our room to find a complimentary bottle of Prosecco, a sweet note wishing us a happy anniversary, and vouchers for my wife's favorite drink at the bar. I can't compliment Mr. Blaha and his staff enough for making this a magical and very special weekend. We will definitely return to Gild Hall the next time we find ourselves in New York!

The hotel, staff and venue were excellent--I would stay at the Gild again if I had business on Wall Street. The location was convenient to everything. The rooms were well equipped and the beds were comfortable.

I spent 1 night with my boyfriend here and I found the service amazing. Very cozy hotel. My TV didn't work so they fixed it and sent a fruit platter with apologies, That is First class service..Bar was very nice and people very friendly. I will stay again soon. Felt like a get-a-away even though I only live an hour away!

I'm torn on how to rate the Gild Hall: should one rate it in comparison to all the other hotels that one has stayed at around the world or in relation to the way one expects it to be after reading reviews on TripAdvisor and seeing it promoted in magazines and the such-like? I'm going to err on the harsh side and rate it in relation to my expectations....So... the hotel is a flash place and obviously designed by or for some very masculine people. Dark bold colours, lots of leather and bookcases abound downstairs. Our room was missing quite a few perhaps expected items: no kettle (I'm a Brit, forgive me), no iron, no hairdryer, a brutally bright light in the bathroom and no way of turning the bathroom light on without waking up your bed colleague.But, most of all the thing that most made me deeply distrust the hotel was the bottle of water by the bed. A litre of lovely water, which after our twelve hour journey was much desired. However, just before opening it I spotted the $8 price tag. I know this is New York City but really, $8 for a bottle of water?! And printing on a clear plastic sticker that you are putting on a clear plastic bottle. What a pathetic piece of marketing. There was even a second smaller bottle for $6 on a shelf.The restaurant served a pleasant breakfast, if very overpriced. The mixologist barman worked some wonders for us and, if I was to return to the hotel, it would be only to have a drink at the bar.If you're thinking of visiting as a tourist to New York I'd recommend going somewhere further up Manhattan: East Village probably, for me. This really is so far south that it's only useful if you're (1) working in the financial district, (2) going to be visiting the Statue of Liberty every day or (3) plan on taking numerous helicopter flights.

This hotel is super convenient if you want to be by Wall St and lower Manhattan. The service is very helpful. When I checked in they were efficient and prompt, and I was very impressed with the young man who when out to get me a cab for the airport. The only downside is the rooms are quite small, and relatively spartan. There is also a nice bar and restaurant.

I spent five days in this Hotel in last April and I found everything fantastic. Rooms are very clean, and the staff are very kind to everybody and very helpful. It is close to an important subway station.FELICE Bar and Restaurant , inside the hotel, are extraordinary both for the staff and for the italian food.

I strongly recommend this hotel!I stayed at Gild Hall during my vacation and everything was great. The room is totaly clean and without noise,the staff are very polite and attentive, bar and restaurante are great, the hotel is near the metro and in quiet place in NY. I hope to return as soon as possible.You can book undoubtedly!

We went to this hotel thinking it was where we'd made our reservation (long story) and even though we did not have a reservation, the front desk clerks put a tag on our car so that it could stay out front of the hotel while we figured out where we needed to be, printed out directions to our reserved hotel, gave us glasses of champagne, and just, in general, were incredibly friendly and nice. The place was so romantic-looking.When we made plans to go to NY, this was the hotel we wanted -- but we changed our minds because in-room Internet required an ethernet cable and we didn't want the bother. If you're thinking of not reserving here because of the in-room internet bother, let that go. It would be so worth it to stay here. We'll stay at the Gild next time for sure.

We had a perfect stay at Gild Hall hotel, extending our business trip to NewJersey with 2 extra nights in NYC for leisure.Very friendly staff, remembering my name, even after returning from the city several hours later.Good internet connection in the lobby, nice atmosphere to sit and chat, discussing what to do and see the next day in this amazing city.Very close to subway station with several lines connecting.Thanks to the staff for a very nice stay in this wonderful hotel!

This was a great experience. A beautiful hotel close to Wall Street and my meetings. A very large room by NY standards. I asked for a quiet room and they gave me a corner room on a top floor. Service was outstanding. When I checked out I told the clerk that I understand why Gild Hall gets such great reviews.

Thank you to everyone at Gild Hall for making my stay in New York pretty near close to perfect. My son lives in lower Manhattan so Gild Hall was especially convenient, and there was a subway station right around the corner for those trips uptown.The room was attractive, clean and plenty large for New York standards, and the price was reasonable. But the selling point is the staff. Everyone, from all the wonderful folks at the front desk to the bartender to the housekeeping staff, was polite and personable. And being a Southerner, I especially appreciate the sincere interest given each time I walked in or out of the doors. I'll stay here again on my next trip and I'll recommend it enthusiastically to anyone I know headed for New York.Thank you so much for the good care.

We stayed at the Gild Hall for 3 nights last week (end of April 2014) - I was looking for a really special place to stay for a surprise trip to NYC for my girlfriend, with the intention of 'popping the question' whilst we were over there. To say that I was not disappointed is an understatement! I was in touch with the Hotel Manager before we arrived just to check everything went smoothly - Bjoern was really helpful..........a theme which carried on throughout the whole stay with all of the staff at the Gild Hall. Nothing was too much trouble!After the excitement of 'popping the question' and my girlfriend saying "Yes", we came back to the hotel on the first evening for a celebration drink and a meal (which was top quality), before catching up on some much needed sleep in the really comfy bed. Really importantly, the room was spotless! We thought the location of the hotel was amazing - after spending our days sight seeing and exploring NYC it was great to come back to the relaxed, comfortable, and lovely surroundings of the hotel. Close enough to busy streets and the subway to make it convenient, but hidden away and secluded enough to give you a little break from the activity of the big city. A really short walk to the nearest Subway station.......We'll definitely be coming back to the Gild Hall the next time we stay in NYC - great place, great location, AMAZING staff, great food and drink, great atmosphere.......a top notch place which really helped make this a really special weekend. Thanks to all the staff - top notch! :-)

We had a nice stay at the Gild while attending my niece's wedding. Comfortable rooms, friendly service. Room size was variable; ours was on the small size but the one our kids got was substantially roomier. (same price) Exercise room was small but there were 3 of them in the hotel! I only used the one on the 18th floor. Parking available across the street; NYC prices! Ordinarily wifi costs $15 /day but was complimentary to the wedding guests who had reserved a block of rooms. Overall a pleasant stay.

We are still hosted at the hotel but we wanted to be quick to review this terrific hotel. We have a fantastic room, full of little details that makes the room cozy and elegant. The service is being awesome helping fndind a vase for flowers I had bought. Also we used their free cool and fancy bikes. Just one small issue waking us up with a testing fire alarm but we will be back. Thanks!!!

My experience at Gild Hall was great. We stayed here for 2 nights. We arrived about 2 hours before check-in and they happily let us check-in early. The room was clean and nicely decorated. The room and bathroom were small, but that is typical for NYC hotels. My only complaint is the location. The hotel was far from our daily destinations, so getting around took up a lot of travel time (uber and subway).

We stayed for 2 nights in April and it's a very nice hotel. The rooms are upscale and clean and the shower is wonderful. Valet parking is a bit pricey and there is a garage just across the street. So rather than paying $45/car, $55/SUV, just park it yourself for less (or park on the street for free). The location is in the financial district and most things we wanted to do were in midtown, which required either the subway or Uber. Overall it's a good hotel with very friendly staff.

My husband and I recently stayed at Gild Hall as part of my birthday celebration. The staff at Gild Hall were very friendly, efficient, and knowledgeable about the area. The room was very large, beautifully decorated and well appointed with necessities as well as nice extras. The bar is a great spot to relax. The location is great, an authentic New York neighborhood, with good access to transportation, and plenty to see and do right there. We are looking forward to another visit soon.

My first experience with this hotel was so exceptional, that two months later I actually felt compelled to write the head of the company and share my thoughts. I have a special needs child who has minor autism and this hotel went so far out of their way to make our stay the best that I can't even list everything here. Let's start with the surprise gifts for my son, the staff pitched in and actually sent someone out to get him some considerably nice gifts. The service was BEYOND EXCEPTIONAL. I just can't say enough about this hotel. Location is nice and quiet, tucked away off the beaten path down in the Financial District. It is central to transportation and lots nearby. Quite simple, it's the only place we will stay in NYC, period, that's how great an impression they left on us.....

I was in New York recently for pleasure and found the Gild Hall through Booking.com. The hotel is 4* with 9 rooms per floor and 18 floors. Complementary breakfast was served. My room was a good size by New York standards, clean, comfortable and quiet. Breakfast was served in the Felice restaurant on the 1st Floor. Staff were exceedingly helpful and friendly and the hotel is located close to Fulton Street Subway station which is good for a range of subway lines. Just a couple of small quibbles. Firstly this is the 21st century so I am always amazed when hotels charge for in-room wifi. At Gild Hall in room wifi is $15 per day but the service is at least fast. Wifi is free in the lobby but I only found that our when I saw a lot of people sitting their with computers!Secondly you get a voucher from breakfast but it allows you only to have the continental breakfast which, although ok wore a bit thin after 5 days. A better option might have been a value voucher to be redeemed against whatever you want on the breakfast menu.Over all though it was a nice hotel and I would definitely stay there again.

Fantastic stay for a birthday visit to NYC! An extra thank you to Violet at the front desk, she was amazing and very helpful! Location was great and subway access was nearby. Highly recommend and will go back.

We had our wedding block here and the service was great the whole weekend! I applaud the professional folks who work here. They were genuinely interested in making our stay as worry free as possible. The Thompson Suite was beautiful!!The only minor con was the water pressure in the shower.
user_name:
RailGuy8
New York City, New York

review_body: The lobby is very cool. Max at the front desk is exceptional! The bar is excellent. The rooms are cozy but not claustrophobic. There is no view or much sunlight because of construction. However, you are guaranteed great service, a comfortable room in a convenient location in the financial district. We would stay here again.

Excellent stay, staff is very helpful and go out if their way to ensure you have a great stay! Rooms nice, quiet area compared to most in NYC! No horn blowing to wake you up like midtown hotels. Enjoyed my dinner at Felice! Would definitely stay again!!

Great hotel, feel like you are in a ski lodge, cozy lobby. Large rooms and only 8 per floor gives it air of boutique hotel. Funky bar and great restaurant. Hotel is in financial district but subway close by.. Will use it again.

In town on business and the boyfriend in tow. Doors - heavy and cumbersome in absence of a doorman (hint hint management)Check-in - prompt, efficient and courteous.Lobby - warm, cute little spaces, welcomingElevators - painfully slow, shared by guests and staff (big no-no in most places, hint hint management)Floors above - quiet, full of static (be careful of shocks), nicely appointed, pleasant art on the walls to observe.Rooms - clean, spacious, comfortable, dry, overhead lighting very 1950s (hint hint management)Bathrooms - clean, oddly appointed with two loo-roll holders, one behind the sink, one on a stand that was constantly in the way. Toiletries, never refreshed over the course of the week (cheap cheap!!) All finishings in stainless steel, except the hinges (in bronze)..... details Mary!! DETAILS!!Restaurant - overpriced, midrange quality, better off eating in the neighborhood. To revisit? Yes, but only if the company is paying for it again.

a charming hotel in the quiet night time part of the city. the staff all very helpful, the bed delicious! we got this room for a pass through of new york while we travelled to paris. how charming. i can't wait to go back to stay there again!

Staff was outstanding, facility is well located near the Financial District...and very handy for meetings throughout lower Manhattan. Rooms are clean and perfectly sized. The street/surroundings were quiet and perfect for the two-night stay. Value per night cannot be beat. See you again, Gild Hall!

Gild Hall is one of the nicest hotels my wife and I have used in the downtown Manhattan area. The staff is very personable and super attentive, the rooms are great and it is wonderfully positioned for all sites one would want to visit in lower Manhattan. It has become our go-to hotel when we are staying there.
user_name:
Steve C
Sayville, New York, United States

review_body: What a great stay. Quiet location, friendly and helpful staff and a glass of sparkling wine when you arrive. What is better than that? Close enough to transportation and everything you would need. I had a very relaxing weekend here and I would definitely return.

Stayed in March 2014 for the first time since the renovations were completed. This boutique hotel is a great alternative to the big chain hotels in the area and is every bit as comfortable, while having a more individual feel. I was fortunate to be upgraded to a suite, which was probably the largest room I've ever had in NYC. The staff are friendly, there's free wifi in the lobby and a nice bar area. Being on the smallest of back streets, the rooms are unusually lacking in traffic noise too!

My wife and I (recently married) approached Gild Hall to have one of our wedding blocks at their hotel. Needless to say the service and their customer service were spectacular. A large majority of our friends and family stayed at this hotel. From the price to the variety of rooms, Gild Hall had the best options. We would gladly recommend this hotel to anyone.
user_name:
Adam W
New York City, New York

review_body: Got deal through hot wire so great bargain. Greeted at check in with glass of champagne which was a nice touch. Free wifi in lobby bar looked nice but we didnt eat or drink there . Financial district lots of bars and near subway so bit further out from main touristy stuff.

I had the opportunity to stay at Gild Hall at the end of February 2014. I was very satisfied with my stay. The staff was extremely friendly. Upon arrival I was upgraded to a suite. This was totally unexpected. The room I received was huge, had a kitchenette, living room, and separate bedroom. Very nicely appointed. I saw that some people complained about the condition of the furniture on other reviews. The furniture I saw pictures of was leather. Typically you are going to see wear on soft leather furniture. That's just part of the aging process unless you polish it on a regular basis. Based on the look and decor of this hotel, they are going for an aged look. Those people who complained are being overly picky. I also found the bathroom to be very neat and clean. I would definitely stay here again and plan to on my next trip.

We came to New York with family for a wedding. The staff and service were outstanding. The rooms were comfortable and clean. When we experienced a minor glitch the management responded in an appropriate and generous manner.Problems will always arise, the test of quality is in the response.Credit to there hotel staff and particularly the manager Bjoern.

We stayed for a long weekend in early November...brrr! The room was very attractive, exceptionally clean, and the bed very comfortable. After visiting with our son who had recently moved to Brooklyn and visiting the pubs and restaurants on nearby Stone Street, we enjoyed warming up in the cozy lounge! Subway access was very convenient and the staff was very helpful with their suggestions.

I have stayed here a few times during fashion week. I love the location as it is so close to where I need to be. This hotel could not be better for the price though. You get all the amenities of the Thompson hotels.. a perfectly curated hotel, with lots of personality and very cozy so you feel at home. The staff could not be more helpful or friendly. The restaurant is really good, as is it's room service. It really is great and even better for the price!

We were very pleased with the friendly staff and the accomodation. Clean and nice hotel! The location of the hotel - financial district- is touristically spoken of strategic value! With the Metro you ll reach in 15 minutes 42/50 th street....Our next trip to NY will include Gild Hall in our plans- do I need to say more?One more thing: try to get WIFI in your reservation offer included, its necessary! If you dont, it will cost you 15$ per day, which is in my opinion quite expensive. They can do better with that issue!

Recently stayed here for a wedding weekend - I was very pleasantly surprised by the size of our room for a NYC hotel at the price we paid (there was a special rate for the wedding, but it doesn't seem much cheaper than other quotes I've seen). Service was great - we were given prosecco upon arrival, and staff were always ready to give a welcoming greeting, flag a cab, or help in whatever way they could. They also handled parking our car at the garage across the street, which was added to our bill as opposed to having to handle separately. The food and drinks at the onsite restaurant and bar were good if a bit overpriced. My only (small) complaint is that the bathrooms had an odd door - you could see the outline of a person inside, if it was a bit distorted. Not a huge deal, but it was a bit awkward.

I stayed at Gild Hall February 2014 and found the hotel to be great - accessible downtown location, hip vibe, comfortable, clean room and friendly and attentive staff. What made this a really memorable experience was working with Esther Song - she was my point of contact at the hotel and made sure that my stay was a good one. Aside from her general friendly and professional demeanor, Esther went above and beyond to help resolve an issue. Driving home after my stay, I realized I forgot my credit card in the restaurant across the street, Esther went over herself, retrieved the card and sent it back to me overnight - and didn't even charge me for the shipping fee...that is what I call exceptional customer service! I felt well-cared for as a guest at the hotel and really appreciated that extra mile - especially being three states away, I needed my credit card back ASAP and Esther saw that my issue was resolved personally, promptly and successfully.It's that kind of service that you remember and I look forward to coming back to Gild Hall.

Overall an amazing experience. The rooms are larger than most area hotels with a warm and inviting atmosphere. The hotel staff are very friendly and accommodating. This is a must stay hotel if you are in the Financial District.

Loved the room and bathroom Great service. Bar and restaurant right there. Fabulous weekend rate. Felt very safe as a single female. Decor like an upscale lodge, so a bit masculine. Absolutely will stay again especially with the glass of Proseco welcome.
