I had to travel to NY for business in the middle of February and the only good thing about the visit was Gild Hall - very beautiful lobby (kinda Susan Kassler), and nice sized rooms with great bathrooms. They must've done a remodel/refubish thing recently- everything looked brand spanking new! Of course it was warm inside as the snow swirled on the street but the service was warm too! Super helpful and friendly - esp for NYC. Had a couple of meals at the Felice (because who wants to go out in the middle of February) and it was cozy and the food was delicious.

Very nice place. Good location for the subway, financial area, southwest seaport, Brooklyn bridge. Pleasant small room, nice bathroom. Lots of restaurants within walking distance (this is NY of course). Busy upscale feeling bar.

Great value for the location, slightly off the main drag but still convenient in lower Manhattan. Friendly reception, slightly smaller room than expected though not a problem and very comfortable. One of those annoying bathroom lights that shines through a glass door into the room. Some would be troubled by this. Will certainly book again next time in NYC.

I had such a great experience throughout my stay at Gild Hall!! I chose this hotel because it was really close to my office which was really convenient for me. My check-in was awesome and the staff was so incredibly nice during my entire stay. I loved the toiletries in the room so much and selfishly requested for extra everyday and the staff graciously supplied more. I loved my hotel room- it was smaller (which is common for NYC hotels) but it was perfect for me. The decor was nice and sophisticated yet simplistic and it was equipped with a desk which is great for people traveling for business staying here. The bar was awesome and the lounge upstairs was cool- really great ambiance. Overall my stay at this hotel was pretty awesome. I will stay there every time I'm in the financial district and I will forever recommend this hotel to anyone :)

We had a really good stay at Gild Hall. We were in town for Super Bowl weekend and found this place and it was a great find. Room was clean, hotel lobby was very well designed and chic. I would recommend this place to people without hesitation.

As a born and bred New Yorker I'm always looking for great hotels that give you a NYC feel without the NYC noise. This hotel was perfect for all of my needs. The staff were friendly and very accomodating. is the pefect place to unwind and have fun as well!
user_name:
Rashana H
New York City, New York

review_body: My husband and I needed a place to stay last minute in NY for a family funeral, and we found Gild Hall on the Jetsetter website. It was an amazing rate and we booked it immediately. I always go on to tripadvisor to read about a hotel before making a reservation, but did not have the time to do so. Well, I was more than happy to read all of the wonderful reviews, and after our stay there last week - I see why! This is a fabulous GEM of a hotel - hip and inviting décor, good size comfortable room with a nice bathroom (great smelling bath products) and lots of good snacks, friendly and helpful staff, a great little bar area, and easy access to the subway and taxis. One other big plus is how quiet the hotel is, and what a nice thing in NY to have little if any street noise! We didn't get a chance to eat at Felice, but the menu looked delicious and is run by an Italian family who owns multiple properties in Manhattan.And to top it off, I emailed the manager Mr. Bjoern Blaha, to let him know of our family's situation, and he graciously upgraded our room and was more than happy to answer any and all questions.We will absolutely return to this hotel when back in NY- and make an effort to check out other Thompson properties from now on!

I was in NY for work, and Gild Hall was very close to the office downtown. What a surprise to find such a unique, fun, welcoming boutique hotel in this area! The staff was very welcoming and helped me get a good rate on their London sister hotel with no fuss at all. They also gave me a glass of champagne as I came in, and helped me make a reservation for three in Felice restaurant, which is on the ground floor. The hotel is very well decorated and trendy. The room decor was a bit dark for my taste, but it certainly looked great. I would also highly recommend a meal at Felice. Definitely intend to stay here on my next trip to NYC!

Love this hotel. The staff were very nice and welcoming. The rooms are wonderfully appointed. Only downside would be the size and privacy of the bathroom. The restaurant in the hotel is fabulous. The primary reason for choosing this hotel was its proximity to family living in the area; however, I have stayed in other areas of Manhattan and think that, for the price, this is a fantastic location with convenient subway access to pretty anywhere you want to go. Would definitely recommend particularly if you need to be located in lower Manhattan.

Such a cool hotel with great decor! The location is within walking distance to Subway stations, as well as most of the main financial district attractions (world trade center, Statue of Liberty, wall st etc.) The staff was very friendly, and accommodating. We were allowed to leave two suitcases in storage for a few days before we checked in so we could bring just carry ons to our short trip to the Caribbean. We were upgraded to a king suite due to our room not being ready before check in time. The room is comfortable, and stylish. We loved the complimentary plush robe to use. Definitely recommend this hotel for our next stay in nyc. We were also offered a 15% off coupon for next stay at any Thompson hotel. The only gripe I have is charging $5 delivery fee for room service. The hotel restaurant Felice looked really nice and had a great menu but we refused to pay $8 for a small bottle of water that was available in the room, as well paying a delivery fee. (Recommend going to Duane read around the corner and stock up on snacks and water for your room).Other then that this hotel is recommended!!n

My wife and I stayed in this hotel during a very snowy week in February. The staff were excellent as was our room. There is a very nice bar and small restaurant with lots of other good restaurants within a short walk. I will definitely stay again

Spent a weekend this winter. Had reserved thru Hotel webpage taking advantage of discount for advance payment. Everything as expected: friendly reception with no surprises, clean, comfortable and well equipped room, no noise at night. Breakfast kind of basic but ok anyway. Staff willing to help. 1 block from Fulton St subway hub, walking distance from many attractions, good restaurant across the street. Would recommend and come back. Final note: Price/value wise was the best option for my set of Musts and Wants.

On Valentine's Day we decided to try our luck with Hotel Tonight and ended up staying at Gild Hall in the King Suite. It was very impressive. A lot of the time, "suite" just means two bland rooms, one with a couch in it. The living room of this suite was huge and appealing, with high ceilings and well-appointed furnishings. The hotel is modeled on a kind of hunting lodge design, and it works well to make the bedroom cozy while still modern and spacious.I had to call down several times with questions about the neighborhood and whatnot, and the staff were always helpful. We ordered room service from the restaurant for dinner. It was quick, delicious, and reasonably priced (pretty sure it's just the same price as if we'd sat down in the dining room). There's a bar above the lobby that I wish I'd tried. I didn't get to look at it until we were checking out. I'd definitely stay here again.

We were hugely impressed by just how helpful and welcoming the staff were at this hotel! They went well above and beyond the call of duty in helping us out with everything from early check-in, to transport, sightseeing advice and more! Our room was lovely and location of the hotel made it easy to get to everywhere we wanted to see via the subway or by foot. Will definitely return to this hotel and 100% recommend it!

I stayed for 4 nights on a business trip. Great location in the Financial district, near useful shops (e.g. 24 hour Duane Read and Century 21). Lovely boutique hotel, funky but extremely welcoming. Very comfortable and quiet rooms. All the staff were excellent, very friendly and helpful. Some hotel rooms I've been in in NY can be blighted by noise from the elevator but this is a newer building and the elevators seemed generally quiet. Very pleasant room service food from the Felice restaurant. I would definitely stay here again, for business or pleasure.

My partner and I stayed at Gild Hall over a long weekend in February and really enjoyed our stay. The staff were extremely helpful -- I had had a gift basket delivered the week prior to our arrival and they expertly and stealthily set it up in our room so that it would be a Valentine's Day surprise for my partner when we checked in. (She was over the moon about it!) The decor is quite unique, and our room was comfortable, clean, and well-appointed. The location is also excellent, with easy access to the subway (just a block or two away) and the sights of Lower Manhattan. You _must_ go to Leo's Bagels (a few blocks south) for breakfast. Absolutely delicious.My only problems with our stay were the rather high prices for in-room WiFi and the incessant daytime noise from what I guess was nearby construction. The latter can't be helped, but free Internet would have been a nice perk.

Super hotel in a small street just off Broadway and Fulton and five minutes from the 9/11 memorial site.Welcoming staff, good bar with lots of choices of wine, beer and bar snacksGood italian restaurant on siteRooms are well equipped and comfortable. What's not to like about this hotel tucked away in a tiny street and only 1 minute's walk to the fab Harry's Italian Family Restaurant

The staff at Gild Hall goes the extra mile to make you feel at home--enthusiastic, helpful, thoughtful--we had a wonderful stay. I am a bit of neat freak and so when I say the place is immaculate, I mean spotless. And don't hesitate to eat in the hotel's restaurant, Felice. This is NOT hotel food--it's competitive with any great restaurant in NYC. They even have their own vineyard in Italy!We'll be back!

The room was clean and the staff were friendly and helpful. One problem was the room struggled to deal with the freezing temperatures outside. It wasn't cold in the room but it often felt like it could be warmer and the heating was on full all day. I realise the weather in New York has been unusually cold this winter but I think the heating looks a bit dated and could use being upgraded. I guess not being locals we aren't used to the bitter cold of New York. The location is good although it takes a while to get your bearings around the area. Even Taxi drivers didn't know the street. So make sure you bring a map. Surprised that breakfast wasn't included but I gather that this is normal in the USA. In Europe almost all hotels include breakfast. I liked the decor of the place, I like the classic look although my girlfriend disagreed. It does sometimes feel more like you're entering a bar in the evening rather than a hotel. The reception desk is not in the best place but not much they can do about that I suppose.Overall, apart from the cold, the rooms are quiet and the beds are comfortable. I suppose for New York prices we got a decent deal. I think it is a place more for business trips rather than tourists.

stayed at gild hall from Sunday to Wednesday with my two grand children and my friend. arrived Sunday at 1:30 pm and we were greeted by the most pleasant staff of any hotel i have ever stayed. the check in was flawless and room was ready even though we were early. after going to the room we went down to the lobby for a bite at a very up scale but casual rest. the service was excellent and the food was good. my 9 year old grand daughter we out to the front desk and quickly made friends with rob and the front desk staff. it was my grand children's birthday and as we came back to the hotel they had made up box of goodies for oliva and zach. the rooms were clean and comfortable. but what impressed me the most was the staff that made you feel like very special guests.

I found this hotel using the Hotel Tonight app. Got a room that was originally $330 for about $150. Totally worth it. The rooms are fancy but their age is somewhat apparent. Very cozy. I wouldn't say the financial district is a prime location for tourists. But I'm a New Yorker and I would stay again.
user_name:
TheWordOfYourLord
New York City, New York

review_body: I had a wonderful stay at Gild Hall February 3rd and 4th. I was in town for a job interview, and the staff was as excited as I was about it! I arrived early, getting in before a heavy snow. The gent at the front desk found a room for me and I was able to check in early. I had the day to myself to explore Manhattan in a snowstorm, which was a really cool experience.I enjoyed a delicious meal at Felice, where everyone was friendly and accommodating. The food was great, and the service was better. It was a bit pricey, but that's not unexpected for the area.My room was a delight. The decor was beautiful and comfortable, and I had all I needed right there. I even got a workout! The exercise rooms are a bit small, and the machine wipes were dry, but I still got a great workout. I ironed my interview clothes and used the wifi for some last minute preparations. After that, I settled in and was cozy and warm during the storm.I awoke to a requested wake-up call and had plenty of time to get ready. When I checked out, the two young women at the front desk were so excited and encouraging for me that I couldn't help but be optimistic going into my interviews. They let me store my luggage and help it for me during the day, which was a great help. When I was done, I came back and the bellman found me a place to get into traveling clothes and went way out of his way to find me a cab to Laguardia. I wish I had the names of the young ladies at the desk and the bellman so I could thank them. They were really sweet and that made all the difference in the world for me. If I get the job I will surely come back to say thank you!

Great find in the Financial District of NYC. Easy to navigate location surrounded by the pulse of Wall Street in the day and rather quiet and relaxing at night. Quick block to subway makes it easy get around, friendly and very accommodating staff, clean, big rooms, cozy beds and all the amenities you expect in a hotel. Will book again.

If you're looking for a great spot to stay in NYC Manhattan, try GILD HALL - A Thompson Hotel tucked away in the Financial District. Easily accessible to public transportation to any an all parts of the city. The hotel itself is quaint and clean, with spacious rooms for NYC. Cannot beat the service and if you like Italian, FELICE adjoining the hotel is superb. Bartenders are mixologists with stories to boot. A good place to stay if you want to imbibe the city but have a relatively quiet night after the hoopla. I spent my 50th birthday here while enjoying the city and this is a jewel I would revisit!

Gild Hall was a winner from the moment I stepped through the doors. The front desk staff were welcoming and helpful. The lobby library was warm and the bar quiet, just what I was looking for. My room, an upgraded King, was spacious and clean. Free champagne greeted us at check in. View was unremarkable, neighborhood was quiet with an inexpensive diner for breakfast only a block away. Wasn't there long enough to try the restaurant, but the menu looked delicious. Short walk to Wall Street. If you are looking for a quiet place with excellent service and attention, Gild Hall is your place. I would definitely come back again.

I stayed at Gild Hall on a business trip in Jan. 2014 for two weeks. Very nice boutique hotel, it has an intimate club-like atmosphere, without feeling stuffy or snobbish. The rooms were decent size (for NYC), clean and chic decor, beds were very comfortable, staff was friendly, lobby bar was great, we had drinks there every night. The price was reasonable (again for NYC). It was perfect for me since I work in the financial district, but if I were visiting NYC on vacation I would probably stay in a more interesting neighborhood, since the financial district has no nightlife to speak of, except for a few sports bars. Still, a great choice if you want stay downtown.

Great location if you want to be near Wall St./downtown. On a quiet side street, easy walking distance to restaurants and the subway. Small boutique hotel but a very good sized king room for NYC and a very competitive nightly rate. Food from the restaurant (via room service) was great and well portioned for the price. I travel for work and have stayed in several mid-town hotels and others around World Trade and Tribeca, but I'd have to say this is my new favorite. I'll be back in a few weeks and will definitely be there again.
user_name:
D W
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: if you are looking for a change from mid-town Manhattan, check out Gild Hall. We pass through NYC every few months and have switched over to always staying here. So different and warm compared to the big chains, and more predictable and organized than typical boutique hotels.Quiet, clean, safe, honest, great classy style, sophisticated and personable staff. Anthony Vasquez, the night manager, is the go-to guy when you have a "mission impossible". Mike Klasco

I was staying with friends in Williamsburg when my allergies were out of control due to their cat. I hotwire-d and was so pleased that Gild Hall came up. I was pleasantly surprised at the price and accommodations. When you walk into this hotel, it smells like how I imagine Tom Ford to smell. The lobby is very welcoming and chic. The rooms are top notch, especially by NYC standards. Bathroom was impeccable and the bed was very comfortable. C.O. Bigeleow products, slippers, and robe are nice touches to an already great experience.Location-wise, it's pretty far south so if you're looking for a central place it's not ideal. However, the Fulton stop is very close so getting around is very easy.
user_name:
Christina T
Los Angeles, California, United States

review_body: My husband and I are from NJ, and it was a nice treat to be able to stay in the city for the weekend for his birthday. We were pleasantly greeted by, friendly, helpful, staff at the valet/ front desk. The welcome champagne was a nice surprise! The decor is professional while warm, and all the accommodations in the room had everything you need. We highly recommend this hotel to those who are in the finical district or want to be close to the lower end of Manhattan. We even took a small trip to Williamsburg Brooklyn which is very close. We loved it here and plan on staying at other Thompson Hotels in the near future. A special thanks to - Esther Song!

Really great hotel! The decor was very cozy and hip with the use of lots of reclaimed wood and leather in the lobby. I also thought the books were a very nice touch in the lobby as well. I loved that the rooms were surprisingly bigger than your "usual" hotel room in NYC and they are very cozy and comfortable. The staff is very helpful and very kind to their guests and gives great suggestions on anything from restaurants to fun things to do around NYC. I plan on coming back the next time I stay in NYC!

Great hotel, highly recommend. Fabulous from A to Z, even the location in the financial district proved calm, a good respite from the loud and busy city pace. They got all the little details right, from windows that open to fabulous linens, generous upgrades, enthusiastic staff, welcome champagne, you name it.
user_name:
CristinaAtlanta_Ga
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I spent a long holiday weekend at the Gild Hall Hotel in the Financial District. It was a real discovery. The location was calm, a real retreat from the busy city. The staff was great, perfect welcoming and helpful without being scripted or overly obsequious. They got all the details right, from windows that open to splendid linens, wonderfully cozy restaurant, generous upgrades. And the low weekend prices did not hurt either. Already planning a return fling! Well done!!
user_name:
CristinaAtlanta_Ga
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: It's an obvious statement to say that NYC has plenty of hotels for an overnight stay, but only one hotel can offer perfect accommodations. Gild Hall is by far the most well thought out hotel in Manhattan, the attention to detail goes far beyond the aesthetically pleasing decor.I arrived to Gild Hall with my girlfriend shortly before 1pm looking just to drop our bags off because we knew their check-in was 3pm, but to my surprise our room which had been upgraded to a suite was available for an early check-in. The Guest Service Agent, if my memory serves me correctly I believe her name is Perry, was extremely helpful with recommending a great place for lunch and the best way to reach our destinations in Brooklyn.The Suite was amazing; it felt as if we were staying in a friends well furnished apartment for the weekend. The design of the suite was well thought out; our bathroom featured a double sink which for some people might not seem important, but they come in handy when two people are looking to prepare themselves for night on the town.Our sleep was enjoyable, we couldn’t hear any noise from the Saturday night activity of Manhattan, nor could we hear anything from the neighboring guests. The Kicker: Upon our return to the hotel on Saturday night the cable in the building had gone out due to some outside construction work, we were told this when we called the Front Desk looking to see why our TV wasn’t working. The Front Desk Agent told me that because of the cable outage that we could order movies and use WiFi without any charge. This was a great concession considering the room featured two nice mounted TVs. Overall, the experience we had at the Gild Hall was awesome. This has become the only hotel that we’ll visit when we have to make trips into Manhattan.

Decor was awesome, staff was attentive and fun, and the location is great. I have never stayed in the Financial District before but this hotel is very convenient to SOHO and Tribeca for parties and great food but right in the heart of the Financial District. I highly recommend this hotel. Thompson Hotels has a great product at terrific prices.

Loved my stay for 2 nights. Lobby feels like a loft in the woods. Super friendly staff, my room was official, bathroom doors are really cool. Bed comfy like no other, nice reading hanging lamps on both sides, Great decor, very at home-like. Quiet at night, nice size flat screen (DVD player woulda been an extra plus) they supply you with an ihome-touch, right next to wall st, Staten Island ferry. Great surrounding eateries. Definitely top notch hotel with more than affordable prices. No jacuzzi/pool but that was o.k. No complaints just compliments

I stayed here for one night during a business trip to NYC. The front desk staff were amazingly friendly, and even gave me a (much needed) glass of champagne while he was checking me in. The room was spacious, and very comfortable. I look forward to staying here again.

For my brother's wedding at the Brooklyn Botanical Gardens we all packed up and spent the weekend downtown at Gild Hall with all our of town guests. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone. It truly was the perfect weekend and this hotel made us feel at home, in a perfectly stylish yet upsale environment. This hotel is the perfect spot for both out of towners or just a couple looking for a weekend getaway!
user_name:
Brett S
New York City, New York

review_body: Excellent and clean hotel in the financial district of Manhattan, with pretty affordable prices. Great room service and dining options. The staff was extremely friendly and accommodating. Very close to many of the different subway lines. I stayed there with my fiancé on two separate occasions; we both loved it. Everything was clean with more than enough space. Will stay there again.

We stayed at the Gild Hall over new year, and can honestly say we could not have found a better place to stay. Everything from the moment we checked in was superb.We stayed in room 156, it was really clean, spacious and very comfortable. The bathroom was great and brilliant to have a shower in a city hotel with good water pressure.The staff on reception were all fantastic, and would do anything to help. The bar area is very warm and welcoming, bar staff are superb, with a fantastic drinks range, and a great area to relax with friends. We didn't get chance to eat at the hotels restaurant but it looked very nice.We would 100% stay at the Gild Hall again, and it deserves it's place amongst the top hotels in New York City.A big thank you to all at the Gild Hall Hotel for making our stay in NYC a memorable one. We will see you again soon.

The Gild Hall was our first accommodation stop in New York and we were extremely pleased with quality of the rooms and it's location to many of the major attractions, including the proximity of the subway which enabled us to to move around the city quickly and easily.

This was our best experience in NYC hotel's ever. The hotel is charming, cool, with an excellent location, away from the crowded tourist spots in New York and the most amazing, friendly and efficient staff.

My husband and I stayed here for New Year's Eve this year. We were having dinner and attending a concern in Brooklyn and wanted to stay downtown. Gild Hall was a great choice for us. As others have noted, the hotel is located on a relatively quiet street, but is close to many subway stops, restaurants, shops, the financial district businesses, the World Trade Center construction, City Hall, etc. I did not dine at the restaurant (La Felice), but I had a drink at the bar. It was fine. Free Internet is available in the lobby, but not in the rooms (which was a disappointment).The rooms are clean and decorated in a contemporary-type way. I agree with others who say the glass bathroom walls are a disadvantage, but we weren't there long enough to really be bothered by this. I thought he bed was fine, and I liked the down comforter. Also, the room temperature was great (something I have had trouble with in other hotels).But I have to say that one of the best parts about our stay was the friendly, helpful staff. The folks at the desk were amazingly efficient, friendly, service-oriented staff. They answered every question, no matter how small, and smiled while they did it. When I was coughing excessively while sitting in the lobby, a staff member brought me a bottle of water and commiserated with me. This really made me feel great about our stay, which we enjoyed in any case. If I need to be in that neighborhood, I will definitely go back . . . .

I wanted to give high praise to Gild Hall, as well as Thompson Hotels. My now husband and I stayed there in the Fall, and we could have not been happier with the impeccable service, accommodations and staff at the hotel. We stayed there, along with our family, in October to get married in New York. We loved how the room along with the bathroom was quite spacious, especially for Manhattan. They treated us and our guests with such kindness, from the check in to grabbing a taxi for us. Even when the weather was horrible and we had to move our wedding from outdoors to the hotel, they were incredibly accommodating, from coordinating the ceremony in one of the suites to arranging transportation to dinner. I can’t say enough how happy we were with Gild Hall. Can’t wait to stay there again for our next trip to New York!

My husband and I recently stayed at this hotel for one night after a New Year’s Eve concert. Most hotels trump up their prices for this night but this hotel was still within our budget. This is one reason I was pleasantly surprised it was a nice hotel. The hotel was easy to get to, about four stops from New York Penn station, and only a few blocks from the subway. At check-in we were greeted with a smile and two welcome glasses of champagne. The size of the room was average, enough space to move around plus a sitting area. Plenty of nice treats (chips and nuts by Dean and Deluca) and other amenities (wine, candles, outlet adaptor, etc.) I would not have expected (though you should check the price list before snacking). The only concerns (not really complaints) I have about the room is the bed frame and the glass enclosure of the bathroom. The bed frame is larger than the mattress so you can imagine the many stars I saw when I walked into corner of the frame and wacked my shin. Please be careful! (Suggestion to the hotel: cover the corners).Although the bathroom was very nicely updated, there was not much privacy. The walls are made of frosted glass. I like the way ‘Brendan d’ worded it, “If you're using the toilet with someone else in the room, they know exactly what’s going on.” All-in-all, it was a very pleasant stay, and we are hoping to come back in the near future.

Had a bad experience with the shower when I got there but they immediately found me another room and a courtesy bottle of champagne for me and my girlfriend for the inconvenience caused. Very helpful reception they answered all questions I had and even got us reservations at a very busy time of the year.Highly recommended and away from all the hustle and bustle of mid town.Definitely will be returning.

My wife and I stayed here last weekend. Great place! Nice location. Clean. Pleasant staff. Good food. Nice room. Everything and more than we expected. Highly recommend this hotel. We'll go back again.

Many thanks to the staff at Gild Hall for making our stay in ny so enjoyable. From check in to check out everything was perfect. Our room was fashionable, clean and comfortable. Our only regret is not having the time to have dinner at la Felice . So that being said we will see you soon.

My girlfriend and I recently stayed at this hotel during our weekend getaway. There are many good things to say about the hotel but there are a couple things that we noted. First the good things. The staff at the hotel greeted us with a smile and two free glasses of champagne. We felt like valued customers and we also felt safe and treated right. Check in was prompt and we arrived at our room without delay. The lobby of the hotel is charmingly unique. It is not the typical hotel you would see when staying at a large chain hotel, and that is why we choose to stay here. The location is safe as well as quiet. It is in walking distance of several attractions and subway stops. The hallways are nicely painted and the facility looks well taken care of. The rooms however are honestly pretty average. The bed is nothing special, and the decor didn't blow me away. The size is also not that great, for the price, I thought it would be slightly larger. The bathroom was something of a concern. It was a nice bathroom with great toiletries, however as far as privacy goes, it was lacking. The bathroom is right next to the bed and it's walls are made of frosted glass. If you're using the toilet with someone else in the room, they know exactly whats going on. We ate at the restaurant, and we felt it could have been a better experience. That's how I would rate the hotel overall, it was very nice however you can clearly notice some aspects that could be improved upon.

This was my second time here, and a good one again. Been lately tempted to choose accomodation in Brooklyn, but this time we stayed so little time that this Low-Manhattan neighbourhood seemed a good compromise. Its easy to take a walk from here to everywhere, especially to Century21 which is just a few blocks away. (If you are in need of a good and inexpensive haircut, I would recommend an Azerbaizanian one just the next door Platt Street) The Platt/Gold streets are relatively quiet, so no problem with sleeping either. The staff is great, so is the restaurant and bar, only a little overpriced. Rooms, housekeeping - just great. We occupied the lady in the front desk with many questions daily, so thanks for her. She was very co-operative, complaining only her bad web connections to fulfill our needs fast. (We were fine waiting) Can somebody there upgrade her web, please?

I would definitely stay at Gild Hall again. It is impeccably maintained and the staff is professional and friendly, great customer service. Hotel restaurant, bar and room service were excellent. I recommend upgrading to the suite. The room was clean, comfortable and well maintained. If the weather is nice take the time to walk across the Brooklyn Bridge.

Me and my husband recently returned from a 4 night stay at Gild Hall. This hotel is absolutely charming and spotless! There is a wonderful signature scent as you enter the hotel that is mesmerizing. The food in the restaurant was delicious and the bar had our favorite prosecco on hand. The bed was very comfortable and it was very quiet to sleep there. Everyone was extremely helpful as we tried to make our way through New York City and we also loved the location. There were several grocery stores, coffee houses, and drugstores within minutes of walking. Fulton Subway station was desireably located around the corner as well. We're looking forward to our next visit and stay at Gildhall.

We had several problems:1. Our room phone was broken and was not fixed during our stay. While some of the staff came up to our room to communicate with us, others did not and completely kept us hanging, which was not professional.2. There was dried urine on the toilet seat when we checked in. That is quite unacceptable.3. We asked for slippers on our first night. The staff said they couldn't find the slippers, but promised that housekeeping would leave two pairs of slippers in our room the next morning. When we came back to the room the next evening, we still did not have slippers in our room. When I went to the front desk (since I could not call the front desk because our room phone was still broken), the lady at the front desk rudely told me I would likely not get slippers until the next morning (when we would be checking out!). I walked her through the previous night, and she asked another staff member to find slippers for me. After waiting for over half an hour for our slippers to arrive, my husband called the front desk from his cell phone. We were then told that the hotel is out of slippers and won't have any until the next shipment. I told the staff member that this was unprofessional and unacceptable, and they should have left a note in our room or communicated this with us somehow. About half an hour after we hung up, a staff member showed up with slippers, at which point, we had already showered and it was too late...4) Housekeeping should be quieter in the hallway in the mornings, when they're knocking on the doors and *yelling* "housekeeping!" loudly early in the morning. It is really not a pleasant way to wake up.While the hotel looks very nice, and initially quite welcoming and impressive with the complementary Prosecco, it does not follow through.While the bedcover was quite comfortable, the noise from the hallway ruined the prospect of a good night's sleep.The staff's lack of communication skills also soured what could have been a pleasant stay.

I stayed just one night while in NYC for work. It's a very nice looking, clean, small hotel. I was able to check in early and my room was average size, very clean and very quiet. I spent little time in the hotel and didn't get to check out the bar and restaurant which looked good. The service by all staff encountered was exceptional! This is what impressed me the most. I was sick and woke up with laryngitis the next morning. Robert at the front desk brought me water and helped me with directions. At the end of the day when I returned to get my luggage, Robert was there and asked how I was feeling. He got me more water, had me take a seat and went down the street to get me a cab (it was a shift change time so cabs were scarce). I'm sure to him this was just part of the job but for me it made a difference in my long tiring work week. For the downtown area I highly recommend. It's very close to NYSE.

I stayed at Gild Hall for one night a couple of months ago on a combined business/leisure trip, and I’m not quite sure what everyone else is seeing that I missed. I simply didn’t think that this hotel was nearly as great as many other reviewers have indicated. I’m young and pretty open to all types of hotel and décor, but nothing here really stood out to me as great. I thought it was just ok overall.The first thing to note is Gild Hall’s location. I was well aware of the meandering, narrow streets of the area ahead of time, but I was unhappy with the fact that Gild Hall is located on a very depressing sort of side street. The particular street the hotel is on just had an alley-like, overly dirty feel to it that I did not like. It took away from the experience. However, I will admit that I heard no noise from the room and got a very good night’s sleep, so the location may be good in that sense, and if you need to be downtown, it is convenient to many things. It was an easy walk from the office I needed to get to, as well as to many major downtown restaurants and attractions. We enjoyed being able to easily walk to Battery Park, South Street Seaport, and the World Trade Center area.We drove in and parked at the hotel. I really didn’t find it as hard to find the hotel as others have mentioned. It’s definitely harder to find things downtown versus other areas of Manhattan, but it was no problem with the aid of a GPS. The hotel is at the corner of Gold & Platt Streets, with an address on Gold Street. However, if you’re driving in, note that you’ll want to come in on Platt Street for the hotel’s front entrance and valet. Parking for the night was $65 (my small SUV was a little bit extra because it counted as oversized), which will always be a lot of money just to park, but really isn’t unexpected or outrageous in New York. We arrived at normal check-in time in the late afternoon, and I was surprised how unprepared the front desk staff was to handle guests at that time. It wasn’t even very busy, but the woman who was working the front desk was totally flustered and not overly professional (but nice enough). I’m not sure if she was new at the time, but it took almost five minutes to get my credit card successfully swiped before someone else had to come show her what to do, and the overall process just felt laborious. She also failed to provide functioning room keys, so after the lengthy check-in process, I only had to come right back down from the room to get new keys when I couldn’t get into my room. She was apologetic, and it wasn’t a huge deal, but my initial impression of the hotel wasn’t the best. This was a bit odd, since the staff I encountered at the front desk the next day was 100% more competent and efficient, handling billing and putting in a late checkout with ease. I guess it’s somewhat hit-or-miss at the front desk. The overall feel of Gild Hall is a sort of dark, masculine hunting lodge, which I definitely do like in principle. The lobby, while a bit small, definitely carries this out, as do the rooms. The rooms are very dark, with dark carpet and wood throughout. However, I think the rooms go beyond being nicely masculine, bordering on gloomy. The fact that the rooms get basically no natural sunlight due to closely neighboring buildings contributes to the overall gloominess, which I didn’t like. It doesn’t help that the lighting was quite dim. The room wasn’t a bad size, and the king bed was comfortable with a really interesting leather headboard. However, on the whole, it just felt a bit more depressing than I would like. The bathroom was nicely appointed and seemed recently redone, with nice tile and marble floors. It was an ok size for New York, although there was really no storage space for toiletries. Be aware that the bathrooms lack privacy. One bathroom wall and the door are completely glass. Although it’s not totally see-through, it’s close enough. My girlfriend and I both commented that it was a bit too much for our taste. You’ll be on display to anyone you’re traveling with at all times in the bathroom. I also felt that our room had an ever-so-slightly dirty feel to it. I couldn’t really put my finger on what made it feel that way, since it was generally clean. I think this feeling came from the old air/heater unit, a bit of dust/grime in the corners of the carpet, and some wear and tear to the baseboards. Also, don’t expect to get work done at the desk in the room. The desk is very narrow and the desk chair, while visually appealing, isn’t comfortable. The same goes for the sort of bench seating by the window. It looks comfortable and seems like a good idea, but is not very functional.One thing I found a bit odd about this hotel is that it seems there isn’t any sort of service elevator. I never realized that this makes a difference, but I’ve never been in a hotel where the elevator was so frequently filled employees with maid carts, linens, and maintenance supplies. I have no problem sharing the elevator with employees, and they were all very friendly, but it got to be a bit much, especially in the morning. There were multiple times that I had to wait for a second elevator when trying to leave because the elevators were full of employees going places. We enjoyed breakfast at the hotel’s restaurant, Felice. The restaurant is small and cheery. Breakfast wasn’t overly expensive, and I was very happy with the quality and presentation of the food. The design-your-own smoothie option was nice. The food was pretty slow to come out, and it seemed that there wasn’t much staff there to get things going. However, the meal was enjoyable and the service was very friendly. It was a good, convenient breakfast option.Overall, I wouldn’t say that we had a bad stay at Gild Hall, but it was a bit disappointing to me, given my expectations after reading TripAdvisor reviews. I expected much more for close to $500 per night. I found the location and rooms to be dark and depressing. The room was nice, but simply too dark and dingy for my liking. It simply didn’t feel as upscale as it should for the price. I wouldn’t come back unless I had a good reason to do so, since there are tons of hotels in New York City and I’m sure I could find others more to my liking in the downtown area.

The reviews do not lie. The staff at Gild Hall are exceptionally friendly and helpful. We were greeted enthusiastically and it set the stage for a wonderful stay. The hotel is chic and hip but at the same time comfortable and accommodating - not intimidating or cold at all. Our television did not work properly - one phone call was made to the front desk and in less than 5 minutes someone was at our door to fix the problem. Thank you for a great stay Gild Hall - we will definitely be returning.

Stayed in this hotel in December 2013. The hotel is 2 minutes from Fulton street subway with access to red blue lines so airport and uptown are quickly access able. The hotel staff are friendly and polite alway taking time to welcome you back or offer advice if your heading for the street. The hallways on each floor have picture of Hollywood stars from the past, worth a look. Rooms are clean and the decor is boutique with a positive feel. The bath room partition leaves little to the imagination the screen could do with some modesty panels. Other wise this is a beautiful hotel and location. Great location that I hope to visit again
user_name:
Gedcranny
North East England, United Kingdom

review_body: We loved the hidden hipness of this hotel situated on a small street named Gold in downtown Nyc. It has a very warm & welcoming atmosphere which will remind you of a modern cabin-like feel, and the staff are very friendly too. The rooms were quite suitable for the price we paid, and we enjoyed the restaurant & bar down in the lobby, which added life to the entrance of the property. There are cool restaurants & shops nearby to the hotel, so the location worked for us as well. Overall, a very enjoyable experience from beginning to end!

Gild Hall is now my favourite hotel in the city. From the wonderful scent that greats you upon arrival in the lobby, to the extremely helpful and pleasant staff, to the complimentary prosecco upon check-in...it seemed as if our trip to NYC was off to a really good start. Little did we know that we would also fall in love with the beds, the QUIET, the amazing Tuscan food at Felice, the lobby restaurant. I just can't say enough about this lovely gem of a hotel. There was something magical about calling Gild Hall home for 3 nights-I loved being in the financial district with it's charming non-grid streets, fantastic nearby restaurants and bars, and proximity to the Fulton Street Subway. Thank you Gild Hall for a wonderful stay-see you again!

We stayed here for 5 nights from the 7th dec. Found the hotel round the corner from subway easy trip from the airport. On checking in we were given a glass of prosecco and our room was upgraded :) the lady checking us in was very nice think her name was Violet. Room was very spacious, clean and warm. Half an hour after checking in a bottle of prosecco and a plate of fresh fruit was brought to the room, thank you very much Mr Blaha.The hotel is in the financial district but within easy reach of all the major attractions by use of the subway or walking.We always enjoyed walking back into the lobby of the hotel as it had a lovely smell (what is it please?) The bar and restaurant looked nice and always seemed busy.Each night a small cake was placed by the bedside,nice touch. The only negative was the air con was a bit noisy when it kicked in, apart from that we had a great stay thanks.

I was looking for a small boutique hotel. Was afraid that it might comes out with not the appropriate level and was glad to find out that the room were large enough and very clean, staff was friendly and very helpful. The atmosphere is great. close to metro station and enough to dine around.

I went to NYC with my girlfriend for a day trip and found this hotel for very reasonable rate. The ambience of the place is very unique compared to other franchise hotels. It definitely added an entirely new element to our trip to NY. We actually enjoyed staying at Gild Hall more than traveling about the city! The entrance to this place might be a little tricky to find, but with a smart phone and general awareness it wasn't a problem getting there. The lady at the concierge was very helpful in directing us to the nearest subway station and did everything possible to guarantee our good time. This will be the first hotel I look up the next time I visit NYC.

Took my family here and wasn't sure what to expect when I saw the lobby. Very cool and kind of hipster and we are not. However, don't let that fool you....the staff was incredibly friendly and welcoming. My kids loved to sit in the lobby and pretend to play checkers. The room is a very good size for NYC. The bed was crazy comfortable and the room was quiet. The hotel is on a small street without a great deal of traffic, so there was very little noise at all. Easy parking across the street. Amazing pizza place also across the street, that we enjoyed back in our room after a long day of site seeing.

The lobby, bar and restaurant are really beautiful. Unlike any other i've seen in a hotel. Even the smell reminds me of the rural outdoors. The service was as you would expect from a premium brand like Thompson. Everyone was helpful and was excellent at their job. Virtually no waiting to check-in or check-out. The cleaning staff did a great job, the room was perfect. The bed and linens were perfect. I slept better than i do at home. Some might complain that it feels old, but thats part of the charm. Lots of amenities around ( grocery, pharmacy, coffee shops and restaurants), so you dont have to go far to get what you need. Would definitely stay again and highly recommended.

Gild Hall is located in tight area that is hard to find if you are not familiar with that area. There is a lot of ambiance with the design of the lobby and the hotel restaurant. This hotel might not be a good fit for families or seniors.The rooms are not large but the one I stayed in has a high ceiling. Since the building faces another building, there is not much natural light coming through the window. The light bulbs used for the ceiling lights and lamp are also not bright so expect a gloomy surrounding. Compounding the gloominess is the black carpeting.The bed frame is larger than the mattress and due to the tight space between the bed and the desk, I keep hitting my shins at the edge of the bed when I walk between them. The pillows seems to have no firmness as you lay your head down on them, your head sinks to the bottom.It is also difficult to work on the desk as its depth is short and work space is limited. The heating\AC unit seems to need maintenance as it produces a loud buzzing sound that is very distracting.Even though the room is small, the bathroom size seems adequate. The water pressure from the shower is weak. The lighting around the bathroom mirror is bright but the sink is a pedestal so there is no counter space. The toiletries are good.The front desk people are nice and helpful but I see them treat some guests a little bit better than others.

We picked Gild Hall because it was right across the street from our daughter's apartment. She moved to NYC just 4 months ago. We loved the neighborhood with grocery, .diners, drug store , subway and restaurants all close by. Any an all help that we asked for was taken care of immediately. Everyone was so friendly and greeted as we came in or went out. They gave my daughter her own key so she could come and go as she pleased.

Nice lobby, friendly, helpfull staff. Nice and clean room with an awesome bed, comfortable and soft, really cozy.We just stayed 1 nigth, but i would definately book this hotel again, if i'll be in NYC again.

I recently had the opportunity to stay at the Gild Hall and was blow away by the experience. Not only were the staff helpful and welcoming, the hotel itself was great a property. The lobby and hallways smelled amazing, the rooms were all updated and large even given the location of the hotel in the city. I would absolutely stay at this hotel again if possible. If you are looking for a unique experience that will leave you feeling refreshed and relaxed then this is the hotel for you.
user_name:
Steve L
Carmel, Indiana, United States

review_body: We stayed here over Thanksgiving. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. The location was reasonably good, not far from a subway station. The room was very comfortable and quite large for a NYC hotel.

I've stayed at two other Thompson properties in manhattan - both were pretty good. The images online - particularly of the lobby interiors - make gild hall look beautiful. When you get in the elevator you feel that this is just "old" with a paint job. In the room: old a/c unit, old light switches etc. lamps are all Fluro or compact Fluro, and cool color temp, so feels depressing. No menu on tv - just says "no signal", so you need to find the channel guide in the hotel directory folder. No spare towels - just two; and they're not on the nice side. Interiors and finishes are not generous at all. It's fine and all, just don't get excited.

I got a great deal from Hotwire for this hotel (under $120 + tax) as I wanted to spend a night in NYC before flying out of JFK early the next morning. I'd have to concur with many of the other reviewers of this having a "gentlemen's club" feel to it. Front desk staff were very friendly/accommodating when I checked in. Lobby felt like an old world living room. The bedroom itself was well designed (a tad small) with a big bathroom and very good quality fixtures. Since I was traveling alone, the fact that the bathroom door was semi-transparent didn't bother me at all. The bed was quite comfortable and I got a good night's sleep before heading to the airport at 6 am the following day. The only complaint I had is that the bar closes very early. I was sitting at the bar around 11 or 11:30 pm and they turned the lights off. I was told it is managed by another company and that the hotel does not have control over its hours. I happened to find a nice Irish pub a few blocks away after the hotel bar closed, though.

We always come to NY before Xmas for fun, Broadway and restaurants (over 20 years now). Decided to stay downtown to avoid the weekend crowds and high midtown/uptown holiday room rates. Subway station only two blocks from the hotel with Broadway/Times Square only a 15 minute subway ride away. Two $2.50 subway tokens Vs a total $50 to $60 cab fare to get you to Times Square and back. The hotel is clean, the holiday rates very competitive and the staff exceptional. The hotel's room decor is on the minimalist side, not our preference but well executed. The staff was exceedingly friendly, very helpful and all we encountered had a wonderful sense of humor making for a fun stay.Felice the restaurant affiliated with Gild Hall was used for breakfast each day of our stay. The quality and selection of entrees was excellent. More importantly you can get a great breakfast with a bottomless cup of coffee from $10 to $15. This is very modest pricing by NY standards. Katie, our server for each of our three days, was exceptional. Had our preferences down after our first visit, was a lot of fun and took very good care of us.We took advantage of Gild Hall's "Suite Deal" promotion, a 560 sq. ft. suite including a small bar area, large bath with double sinks, welcoming gift, free paper, free Internet service, living room, separate bedroom with king bed and two large screen HD TV's. Since the hotel is in the financial district, their weekend rates are very competitive. We stayed from Thurs. to Sunday with the average night's tariff, with out taxes, of $355. I would challenge anyone to find a comparable priced full suite in any mid or uptown hotel during the Xmas season for this price.We will consider this downtown holiday option in the future. There is much to see in and around the downtown financial district, including the 911 Memorial and Museum, Statue of Liberty, Ellis Island, Fraunces Tavern, the oldest building in New York serving great food and fun, walk the Brooklyn Bridge, the South Side Seaport, a nice walk to both China Town and Little Italy,etc. Our thanks to the Gild Hall team for providing us with a fun long weekend stay.

Never have I experienced such great service at a hotel in NY. The bellman are quick to say hello and the front desk is very welcoming. They upgraded me to a suite while I was here for a training and was always offering ways to assist. From directions to wake-up calls, the staff is top notch. The housekeepers even stop to say hello. The rooms are very nicely decorated and the beds are SO COMFY. Their restaurant Felice has amazing pasta and a pumpkin ricotta cheesecake you can kill for. Gild Hall has a very unique design but does not have the attitude to match. They are all about the service and providing a great experience. WE SHALL BE BACK!!! Gild Hall gets a A++++++++ from me.

Amazing boutique hotel with tons of charm and character, unlike anything else in this part of the city. Stayed here for my wedding and it played such a huge part in our amazing weekend. If you’re looking for a room block for your wedding, book here!!!My wife and I got married at Battery Gardens and Gild Hall is one of their preferred vendors. For a higher end boutique hotel, we got really affordable rates for the room block that gave our guests a cool hotel experience without breaking the bank. Esther coordinated our room block reservation and we worked with her in the weeks leading up to the wedding. She was super helpful, very responsive and a pleasure to work with. We didn’t want to blow a ton of dough on our hotel room, so we booked a standard king suite. Nothing too fancy. But when we checked in, Esther upgraded us to their Thompson Suite, then upgraded my father’s room to the king suite. The Thompson suite was HUGE, with 20 foot soaring ceilings, 2 bathrooms, laid out like a giant loft apartment. It was waaaay out of our price range and HUGELY appreciated. Thanks Esther for hooking it up!When we checked in for the weekend, the girl working the front desk, Perry, had just graduated from the same college I went to. She somehow quickly made friends with my entire family and was so unbelievably helpful all weekend long with whatever we needed. From sending out a dress shirt last minute to get dry cleaned, to letting up vendors to the room for deliveries, to recommending nearby food spots, she was so accommodating and is a tremendous asset to the hotel. Thanks Perry!!!I didn’t eat at the hotel but some family members did and said the food was great. At night the lobby and adjacent bar gets pretty lively, turning into a cool place to hang out, grab drinks. Not too sceney, but enough energy to make it fun for out of town guests. Overall, GREAT option for a wedding weekend, or a weekend In NY. Sure as hell beats staying in a generic Hilton!
user_name:
McNutty187
New York City, New York

review_body: Was checked in efficiently by a very professional and friendly desk staff who filled the time telling me about the hotel. Each time I left and came back someone at the front desk wished me a nice day/run and welcomed me back. Breakfast and dinner were superb. The bar gets a bit busy but I think that's a good thing and there's a nice atmosphere about the place. The room is very well appointed, wifi signal is excellent (unusual for hotels) and the bed /pillows comfortable.Probably my favourite hotel in Lower Manhattan and i must have stayed in 15 over the years.As an extra I left me kindle in the safe (idiot) but after one phone call (two weeks later) it was returned to me with no bother.I will definitely stay here on every trip I do now. I work on Wall St so the location is superb for me but it's very close to the simple to use subway system to be able to get further afield easily.

We just spent 2 nights here and could not have been more pleased with the service, courtesy and style of the hotel. Super location in the financial district. Super staff! No problems of any kind, room was clean and as advertised, all amenities (am I up to the 200 word minimum for a review by tripadvisor yet?)....(silly requirement TA..)..
user_name:
Robert p
New York City, New York

review_body: As someone who often travels, I could not have been more pleased with my experience at the hotel. The staff is phenomenal and provided me with first class service before I even arrived by staying on the phone with me and feeding me directions as I walked from the subway. The room was spacious and very nicely decorated. When I couldn't figure out how to properly use the thermostat, someone from maintenance appeared at my door within minutes. The bed was incredibly comfortable and (very important to me personally) the drapes kept out much of the light so I was able to sleep soundly. Unlike many of the people who have provided reviews, the location was not convenient for me...however, my experience was so great that I will be staying at Gild Hall next time I'm in NY just the same.

On a recent business trip my company booked me at Gild Hall. Not really knowing what to expect, I was very pleasantly surprised. The customer service at this hotel is excellent! The staff at the hotel went out of their way to make sure I had a wonderful stay. Such a wonderful experience. I travel quite a bit for work and this is the first time I have felt compelled to write a review. The rooms are typical "Manhattan small" but very well appointed, very clean and quiet for being in the city. A great location but a little difficult to find. The fitness/work-out rooms are small but they have several throughout the hotel. I will definitely stay here again!

I almost hesitate to write this review, because I fear it might drive more guests to the hotel and make it impossible to get a room. This was one of the nicest surprises we have ever had staying in Manhattan--the price was very reasonable, and the hotel was great--the staff was friendly and helpful, the room was much larger than one would have expected and the location, in lower Manhattan, near the Freedom Tower and city hall, was perfect for us.We will be staying here again.
user_name:
Steve C
Sayville, New York, United States

review_body: I rarely have a hotel experience worth writing about and I don't remember ever having such an experience in NY until I stayed at Gild Hall on a recent business trip.The staff were very friendly from the moment I checked in and seemed to have a genuine interest in a conversation. The hotel was in a great location and well appointed. The attached restaurant was excellent. The rooms were beautiful and comfortable. One of the best experiences in a hotel I have had in a while.

My husband and I have stayed at Guild Hall many times. It is one of our favorite hotels in the city. The rooms are spotless, extremely comfortable and very quiet. The staff has always been extremely helpful and courteous. The location is wonderful. It is an interesting area to explore. It is a nice change from the crowds of uptown. There are many fine restaurants and shops in the area. As usual, a wonderful stay!
user_name:
Margaret K
Garden City, New York

review_body: we booked Gild Hall for our wedding this past summer and it was amazing. The rooms are spacious especially for NYC and the staff was attentive and accomodating and made my husband and I as well as our guests feel at home. We highly recommend it for a large group or just for a weekened away
user_name:
Mollie G
New York City, New York

review_body: Since it was my first time in New York and I have heard that New Yorkers are "not that friendly", I was totally surprised with the treatment the hotel staff gave me. From the never-ending towel service to the helpful,friendly, and sincere smiles I got when I asked for close to impossible directions. They were just perfect! Notes of welcome were hand written too! Very personal and warm. Will definitely recommend this to friends and family going to the big apple soon! Loved it! My only regret is I only got to stay for two days.....

Attractive, clean boutique hotel in the financial district. The rooms are comfortable and of typical Manhattan size (fairly small). The staff are friendly and helpful and the decor is attractive. If you are a fan of fitness facilitiies, they are very small, so heading over to Battery Park for a run alongside the Hudson is probably a better bet in good weather, but otherwise this is a good, all round hotel.
user_name:
andy_hitchin
New York City, New York

review_body: This hotel is gorgeous. Beautiful decor (very masculine), comfortable, and rustic. It was extremely relaxing (very little noise, which is great), and the staff could not be more helpful. The rooms are beautiful, clean, and well kept. Should I need to be in the financial district again, I will certainly return. Felice was also quite good.

My fiance and I had a fantastic romantic stay at Gild Hall. We were OBSESSED with the decor. So unique and hip, with rustic charm. We had a super king in our bedroom which made us feel like royalty. Not only that, the staff was beyond amazing -- when they heard it was our anniversary they gifted us with a bottle of Prosecco. Also loved the financial district (WAY cooler than we thought it would be) and the convenience of the hotel's location. Will definitely be returning and telling all our friends.

I stay in NY a lot and in a lot of different hotels. Last week I went again to Gild Hall and this is definitely one of my favorites.This is a Thompson hotel so the lobby and rooms are all stylish but not overwhelmingly so. Gild Hall is small enough that it doesn't feel busy or crowded when you come in and out of the hotel. I like the location which is away from the bustle of the city, but a convenient base to get around (all subways converge to lower Manhattan), especially if you are going to hang out in SOHO, NoLita, or Tribeca.Service at Gild Hall is top notch. My stay started with a glass of Prosecco offered at check in, and while the attendant was working my paperwork I mentioned to my wife that we still need to confirm our dinner reservation - he overheard this and offered to make the call himself.

We had a great night at the Gild Hall hotel. It was very convenient, the staff was excellent and there are some new places to try nearby. The rooms have an eclectic style but are comfortably appointed.

My girlfriend and I stayed in the Gild Hall for 10 days at the end of October. The entire interior looks fantastic, and the rooms we're very comfortable. We bought our stay through Hotwire, so it was fantastic value for money.The location is great, far enough from the chaos of the traditional tourist areas, and the Fulton subway is only a couple of minutes walk away.The staff we're superb. Everyone was incredibly friendly and helpful, especially Tomo and Perry who welcomed us and gave us a pretty comprehensive list of speakeasies all over Manhattan for us to try out. We would absolutely stay here again.
user_name:
Adam W
Liverpool, England, United Kingdom

review_body: I returned a week ago from a week-long business trip at Gild Hall. Throughout my stay the service was prompt, professional and above all else, engaging on a personal level. The atmosphere feels, probably more than any city-based hotel I've ever stayed in, like home. This is an important quality for someone who regularly travels on business and who is accustomed to a more clinical approach. The same applies to the adjoining restaurant and bar concession - whilst under separate management, it has the same warm feel and great approach to its customers. Staff trouble to remember your name, and make you feel like a real human being. Thanks to the whole team for a wonderful time. I'll be back!!!

Our second stay here was as great as our first, not least as the staff are the best. The design of the rooms is tasteful (great leather mirror!) and spacious enough to spend an evening in the room. When the lift was briefly out of order, the manager offered free prosecco and lovely cakes as an apology: that is real top customer service. Easy access to subway, lots of delis etc nearby if needed. breakfast is high quality and at a reasonable price for a top brand of hotel. very quiet street for NY = good sleep.

Pleasant, boutique comfy not high design cold but warm and friendly - great location close to Fulton subway stations - quick connects to every part of the city. Rooms are big for new York, staff all around helpful and the downstairs restaurant Felice and bar are very inviting.

Stayed here for my son's wedding. Reception staff very helpful and rooms nice. Didn't eat here but several good places nearby. Room was clean and a reasonable size for a city hotel. All-in-all great value and ideally placed.

I travel throughout the year. I have been staying at the Guild Hotel for business and with my family. The hotel is by far the best hotel anyone can find in the city of New York and could compete with any five star hotel in the world. It is an eclectic hotel with a front desk that will help and a concierge service that is always one step away. The Martinis are great in a wonderful nook of a bar, The bathtubs are more than inviting they are just plain comfortable. You cannot pass up the Guild, it is my favorite after working and travelling the world for the past 25 years. Thank you Guild an experience worth remembering, like a dream with your eyes wide open!

As someone who is extremely allergic to dogs and cats, it would have been REALLY important to know that this hotel is pet friendly and they DO NOT have designated floors for pets, so any room has the possibility of having had a pet in; which our room had. The staff tried to be accommodating but moving to another room was pointless as there was no guarantee that room hadn't had a pet either. Total bummer. Other reviews mention a 'scent' throughout the hotel - like men's aftershave - and this is very noticeable. Location is not great unless you're in NY to be in the financial district for business. There are no good restaurants within walking distance, unless you like pubs or fast food. The hotel has a restaurant, but who likes to eat at a hotel restaurant with so many other options in the city. Aside from the pet issue, room was a good size and could have been comfortable, sneezing and antihistamine taking aside. Staff were nice. We would never choose to stay there again if it were an option, but the price was right which made it appealing.

My wife and I stayed in this Hotel for 5 nights. We were both really impressed with the Hotel and would stay here again when visiting NYC.Only 5 minute walk to the nearest subway (Fulton Street) which had good connections.Rooms were spacious, clean and quite (we stayed on the 12th floor) Staff at the hotel were very friendly and always greeted us with a smile when returning from a long day sigh seeing. There are numerous restaurants and bars within 5 minutes walk of the hotel. The Full Shilling, Open Door Gastro pub and Jim Brady's all had a great selection of beer, with a good atmosphere. Harrys Restaurant which is located next to the Hotel served amazing pizza's. The hotel restaurant was average, the food was nice but the portions were quite small. Two dinners close to the hotel (Peal Dinner and The Dinner) The food was excellent and reasonably priced.

This hotel has a very refined style. While the room was small it had that air of European efficiency and elegance. It had a comfortable bed, and a functional yet stylish bathroom. The internet was included. It is certainly in a great location!

Love and impressed with the service provided by Gildhall. I especially want to praise night manager - Anthony Vasquez for his service. He has been a tremendous help to me…(bought/loan me adaptor, try to fix my laptop to get connected to the wifi, get me hot water for my cup noodle) I guess, its these little gestures that makes a stay unforgettable. Will definitely return back to Gildhall if I go back to NY.Thanks to all staffs from Gildhall.

My family and I stayed in the hotel for my wedding weekend. The rooms were comfortable and clean. The staff was excellent. The one major draw back is how difficult it can be to get a taxi since the hotel is tucked away in the financial district. The staff knows this is a problem so often a bellhop will go out to find one and bring it in. I stayed in the Rivington Hotel another night the same weekend and have to say the Rivington was a HUGE disappointment. For almost double the cost, the Rivington provided poor service and a dirty room. I would highly recommend Gild Hall again.
user_name:
Jennykatc
New York City, New York

review_body: Very friendly staff but I suspect that is part of the training here. Consciously trying hard on the design..;but I suspect that's what to expect in New York! Comfy and clean bedrooms, we didn't try breakfast - there are so many coffee and bagel places nearby I don't really see the point - especially 15 dollars each when you could spend 5/10 and eat just as well. Only problem is the wifi really should be free in a hotel in the financial district! All in all good value for a New York 4 star hotel.

We luckily found out about Gild Hall through booking on Hotwire. What a great little boutique hotel in the Financial District. Tucked away on a quiet street but close enough to all sorts of transportation and very walkable. You walk in and feel like you're in a very hip but somewhat grandfatherly library. Luscious leather everywhere. Staff was incredibly friendly. We even got a free room upgrade (this NEVER happens when you book on hotwire), so that started us off in a great way. They also have interesting one-room gyms, which makes for a private workout. Definitely recommend checking this one out.

If staying in the financial districts this is an amazing choice. The biggest rooms I've ever seen in a NY hotel, nice decor, extremely quiet, über comfortable bed, friendly helpful staff. My only complaint is the water pressure was inconsistent, to the point of a trickle at times, but it would always come back on momentarily. When I mentioned this to the staff, they apologized and gave me a certificate to upgrade to a premium king room for my next stay. Good location for walking/running the Brooklyn Bridge and visiting the World Trade Center Memorial too.

I have stayed many times in New York over the years and the Gild Hall was perfect for me on my last few trips with it`s proximity to the city and it`s unique decor gives it a nice vibe to stay at. The staff were really helpful and rooms are quiet.

I needed to make a last-minute change to my NYC trip and ended up using Hotwire to add a night to my stay. I got Gild Hall and after checking it out on Tripadvisor I was very pleased. But when I got to the hotel... different story :-( When I checked in (on the early side, maybe noonish) the woman at the front desk told me they only had one room available, with two beds, but if I didn't mind two beds then I could check in right away. In retrospect I think there was a reason they hadn't put anyone in that room! As soon as I got into the room I was really surprised. It was dark, ugly, and not in great shape. The lighting was all cheap fluorescents and it started giving me a migraine almost immediately (something that normally only happens with strobe lights or something extreme like that). Everything was just shabby and not very clean - the radiator was dented, there were greasy-looking fingerprints all over the guest information book on the bedside table, the headboard had marks all over it, there were bits of peeling wallpaper and worn-off paint, the baseboards are all beat up, the shower had mildew, the shower curtain had blue pen marks on it, the furniture was all scratched up, it looked like the area by the snacks hadn't been cleaned (drip marks etc.). I was late to meet someone for lunch, and I was only going to be in the room for 18 hours, so I just figured I would suck it up instead of demanding a new room since I knew there weren't any available and I would have to wait some unknown amount of time (probably making me miss my lunch appointment). I have NO IDEA how this hotel has got such good reviews on Tripadvisor. No idea. Unless this is just the one bad room in the hotel or something. But I certainly can't recommend it and it's kind of scared me off using Hotwire for a while since I feel like I can't trust their star ratings to be even remotely accurate. Aside from the actual room, the person at the front desk was very friendly and the location was quite convenient.

I've stayed at well over 75 hotels in the city all 3 + times each and this is one of the best. First of all, the location is prefect. Your no more than a 5 min walk to basically every subway line that runs through the city. 2 stations are a block away. The Fulton station is an express stop for each line which is nice if you need to get back to hotel quick. Gild Hall is is in a quiet but busy part of city. Nice little area for any traveler. You are a 5 min walk away from the Sea Port, Brooklyn Bridge, Wall Street area, Stone Street... And you could walk to Battery Park if you wanted. There is 24 hr grocery store across the street that has every thing you need for your stay. The rooms are nice and big. 18 x 20 with a king bed in the room. Very very clean and modern. Probably the cleanest rooms I've ever stayed in NYC. Have a mini bar in the room so you can put your stuff in. TV's in room are new. Nice 47 inch in the room I stayed in each time. Beds are very comfortable. Bathroom are super clean and modern as well. The doors are transparent like the reviews say which is a little odd but they match the interior of bathroom so I see why they designed it that way. No complaints really...Hotel lobby is has a log cabin kinda feel but very unique. Not many hotels can pull it off, feels like your in a fancy hotel. .. well you are...Service was great each time. Super friendly and helpful. Always smiling. One of the best in the city no doubt! Excellent hotel!
user_name:
NYCKID414
New York City, New York

review_body: Ended up at Gild Hall via a Hotwire deal. Normally when I book through Hotwire I prepare myself for a so-so room, but Gild Hall was a total pleasure. The room was spacious, not just for New York City standards, and very nicely appointed with modern furnishings and bedding. The bathroom was spotless and modern and something I'd love to have in my own home. Although I didn't interact very much with the staff, when I did my interactions were very pleasant and courteous.If you have business in New York, even uptown, the location of the hotel is great. You're very close to the Fulton Street station, getting you anywhere you need to go in short order.The only real negatives? Terrible cell reception, and no free wireless in the rooms, so I couldn't get much real work done. If they added free internet, this would be the perfect business hotel for me. Also, there is no in-room recycling, which seems to put Gild Hall behind the environmental practices of many of its competitors.

I stay here regularly for work and the staff is always incredibly accomodating and the rooms are always extremely clean. The location is excellent, with many subway options close by...There is nothing like staying at the Gild Hall for a special and satisfying experience.Thanks to their staff for such excellent support!

We recently spent two nights at Gild House, mid-week. The hotel is clean, rooms are spacious for NYC, and staff couldn't be nicer. Word has it that rooms on the first five floors (or so) are nicer that those above (where we were). The lobby/restaurant/bar area looks nicer at night than in daylight. Lunch was delicious and reasonably priced.The room's vibe was masculine, which may be their targeted audience. Decor is primarily black and white, with hard edges, and a black leather headboard complete with ornamental metal rings. Despite frosted glass, the interior bathroom space is clearly visible from the bedroom area. Very little privacy there. Visitors have a choice of two condoms, priced at $8 each.

My job requires a great deal of travel; too much according to my wife and children. Travelling and specifically hotel stays can become burdensome, tiring, and add to occupational pressures. This is not the case with Gild Hall. The location is absolutely perfect for anyone conducting business in, or touring the financial district. Additionally, from downtown, access to entire subway system is ideal making citywide travel efficient. The rooms at this hotel are reminiscent of European boutique hotel offerings and if within your budget, I would recommend a suite. The hotel furnishings are a cool mix of chic/retro/ contemporary which combine to provide a great ambience. The service is friendly and courteous.
