They go out of their way to assure you stay is a pleasant one. Thanks Esther!The bar and restaurant offer a fantastic venue for dining and partaking in your favorite libation(s). Go for the house wine--- you will not be disappointed. I look forward to my next trip and will certainly be staying with my friends at Gild Hall.

The rooms are very clean and the front desk is also very helpful. Moreover the hotel has a 2 floor bar area where you can enjoy drinks, play chess or checker or access the free wifi (wifi on room is extra). The AC was a bit loud and also the bathroom did not provide big privacy because of the nearly transparent (glass) wall/door. So I only giv 4 out of 5 points. The location of the hotel is amazing. You can walk just a few minutes to Ground Zero, Wall Street, Battery Park, Pier 15. Also Brooklyn Bridge is not very far away. There were a lot of "business people" in the hotel, whereas we use the hotel as a holiday hotel.

Like many people, I've had my fair share of travel to NY for business. It's always been a challenge to find a nice place to stay, particularly within corporate budget restraints. Gild Hall delivered on many levels. Not only was it incredibly clean, comfortable, and quiet, but the decor was beautiful, the staff extremely friendly, and my meal from the hotel restaurant was delicious. I found myself with all the comforts of home, but taken up a notch since I was in a luxurious environment with a great meal I didn't have to cook. I also had the best night of sleep I've had since becoming a mom six months ago :-) I'll definitely look for Thompson Hotels for future travel.

Staff from our company has traveled to the city 10-15 times for business over the past year and this hotel is our top pick to date! We love the location, atmosphere, staff, bar and restaurant. I'm amazed at how nice the rooms are and just love the high ceilings, cool chandeliers in the guest rooms and the cleanliness of the whole place in general. The rooms are also a great size for a NYC hotel. It was booked on our last trip so we couldn't stay and the team was bummed. We love Gild Hall and would recommend it to anyone traveling to the city!

I am a frequent guest at Gild Hall and travel quite a bit for work throughout the US. They consistently meet my rather high standards for hotel accomodations. The rooms are better than average size for Manhattan, always clean, and the staff are always pleasant and helpful. it is a unique space, not like your standard hotels, which I like and my Wife loves, since she is in the furniture business. I recommend the hotel to many friends and business travelers.

We chose the hotel at the last minute, and didn't realize it was quite so far downtown. I was worried at first that it would be inconvenient, but it is actually very accessable to the Meat Packing District and Soho, the two areas we were planning to visit, at a much better price than hotels we normally stay at in those areas. The sevice was amazing from the valet, to the bell hop, and front staff.The area around the hotel is fun and bustling, even at night, and the rooms, beds and bedding were extremely comfortable.We would absolutely stay here again.

We have just returned from a 9 night stay in this excellent hotel. Having stayed in midtown on two previous occasions we wanted a change, but were reluctant at being so far downtown. We shouldn't have worried, this is an ideal location for even the first time visitor to NYC, the hotel is two streets from Fulton Street subway, which has almost every line running through it, or a further street to get to City Hall subway for another very useful line.It is also useful for the East river ferry, this will get you up to midtown for $4, and in our view is the best $4 you could ever spend in New York.The hotel staff are excellent,fom the front desk, to the doorman, to the staff in Felice restaurant. We have had larger rooms in Manhattan, but these are perfectly adequate. Apart from sleeping we spend very little time in them. Clothes storage is minimal, especially if you are in a twin double. We found the air conditioning in the room to be alittle on the noisy side, but not enough to keep you awake.I do feel that a hotel of this caliber should offer in-room tea and coffee, we have stayed in budget hotels that offer this.There are plenty of places to have breakfast as most workers in the financial district tend to have breakfast on the way to work.During the week the area is buzzing, from early till late, restaurants and bars are lively. At the weekend it is bit quieter, which is a pleasant change.As can be seen from previous reviews on choosing this hotel you wont be disappointed.

I stayed here over the weekend and absolutely loved Gild Hall. Complimentary Prosecco at check in was a nice touch and it spoke well towards the type of hotel Gild Hall is: boutique styling with the courtesy of a corporate, but very cool, parent company, Thompson. What this equates to is the ability to be unique, small and intimate while not carrying the associations of a spotty staff or maintenance record. Gild Hall brilliantly blends modern design with warm comfort, a feat not easily achieved. The room was fantastic - 12' + ceilings opened the space and the absence of the typical hotel "stock art" was well received by both parties. They do very well with the little space they had, but for an NYC hotel, and one downtown, the room felt spacious and well appointed. One thing that made a huge impact was the cleanliness of the bathroom. White pedestal sink was spotless and the water pressure and hot water will not disappoint. One thing though, the bathroom has a modern touch that maybe not everyone will appreciate: the wall between it and the bedroom is translucent, and you will see the figure of whoever's in there. So, it's not for the squeamish or overly private. Otherwise a fantastic, comfortable, clean and fashionable place for those that don't want the hustle, bustle and frenzy of a some of the larger design oriented stays. Also, many hotels like this try to make their lobby into a club (Tribeca/Soho Grand), probably to boost revenue. You won't find that here, which I personally find to be great. When I go home, I don't want to push through a bunch of drunk revelers, slamming bass, and have to show my keycard to a bouncer. Here its a nice quiet trip back to my room, past the friendly front desk staff and up to bed. Thanks Gild, you made for a great weekend.

Welcome to downtown NYC in the world famous financial area, near World Trade Center and Wall Street tourist sites. Everything you need is available at this hotel. The rooms are good, with drinks and a young crowd in house. A very good restaurant in the hotel, with a very good menu. Sports bar too. All the amenities that you need, and many more that you might want. Try it.

This elegantly appointed hotel is quiet on weekends, when the financial district shuts down and it becomes more residential. We like quiet, but if you want nightlife, you have to go only a short distance to other neighborhoods.The room was nicely appointed and roomy for two. Service was very friendly and courteous. The only thing I would comment on is that we had only one robe and asked for another to be left n our room when we went out for the day. It was not there and we didn't want to call for one once we undressed for the evening. Why is a room for two outfitted with one robe anyway?They use a scent throughout the hotel. I happened to find it nice, but it might be a problem if you have scent sensitivities. We got a good rate on a weekend. I understand it is rather pricy at full price, which could affect the value rating.It is conveniently located only a few blocks to several subway lines, and a nice walk to the Brooklyn Bridge (to walk over) and to the Seaport, which is scheduled for demolition and may be disrupted in the near future.

The Gild Hall is a boutique hotel. Great location for downtown, and close to my office. On this stay (my fifth), I have decided enough is enough. The issues that I experienced were:- Arrival and they had no note of previous stays (I was advised that they had changed their systems and lost data)- Placed in a room with generator noise outside. Understandable after Hurricane Sandy, however there are no quiet rooms. If you arrive with jetlag - like me - you will also have insomnia - Having reported the room issue at 03:00 on night two to Anthony at reception, no-one called back. Nor did anyone feel the need to contact me at any point during my stay. I stayed for six nights, mainly as I had unpacked and had meetings until late most days- The next morning, after the early morning generator wake-up – I called down for breakfast at 06:30 when room service was due to start. The chef had not turned up, they would call me back. At 06:45 I called again (no call to my room). Still no chef. I noted that I needed coffee and asked for some toast. At 07:00 they called me and advised that the supervisor had decided that they could make coffee and toast. At 07:25 a bagel and coffee – and cheque - to be paid arrived. The bread for toast had not been delivered yet…… - The next morning I delivered two pairs of trousers at 06:45 for same day delivery. At 19:30 when they hadn’t arrived, I had to call reception. I was advised that the van had an accident and they would be delivered later. No note under the door…- I then searched for the TV remote, it had been removed from the room. iI notified reception. 20 minutes later, another call to reception. After 30 minutes it was handed to me with no apology, just an "ok"? Actually Gil Hall - NOT OK!So there we have it. Every day niggles which stressed and made me dread returning to the hotel. At more than USD 300 per night – you – and I – can surely find somewhere better.

Lower Manhattan is a great place to stay on the weekend and Gild Hall was fabulous. Our room was clean and comfortable and everyone who worked there was pleasant and easy to work with. They really work hard to make you feel welcome and not just some random tourist. They offer valet parking but are quick to tell you to check out local garages for better rates. We stayed on the 11th floor by the elevator and it was extremely quiet (I am a light sleeper). My husband and I plan on returning!

My recent stay at this hotel was great. Seriously cool, unexpected place with very eclectic decor, great aroma in the air throughout the hotel. Spacious rooms with high ceiilings, great lighting in the bathroom. Extremely friendly and helpful front desk staff. I didn't notice typical city "street noise" so the location quiet (I was on the 4th floor). I did not have a chance to experience any of the on-site amenities.

We just stayed three nights at Gild Hall. Our total experience was exceptional for NYC. Staff is very friendly, great help with taxis, room very comfortable and entire hotel impeccably clean. Champagne and chocolate for our anniversary was a nice treat. Thank you Scott Koster and staff.

We stayed in Gild Hall for 4 nights in September 2013. The location of the hotel is very convenient. 5 minutes walk to 2-3, 4-5 subway and A-C train. the hotel room was small but it was clean and the bathroom was recently renovated. The staff seemed polite and nice.The last day, when we picked up our luggage and we wanted to take a taxi, the doorman told us he will take a taxi for us. After few minutes he came with a black car which asked us for 75$ to LaGuardia airport. I asked the doorman to take us a real taxi and it seems expensive ,but he told us it was rush hour and there were no taxis available. The driver then asked for 60$.The traffic was not that heavy. When we got to the airport out of curiosity I asked a cab driver and he told us it is going to be between 40 to maximum 50$! (And now I have ched the fair in internet: http://www.taxifarefinder.com/main.php?city=NY&from=15+Gold+Street%2C+New+York+City%2C+NY+10038&to=LGA+airport%2C+Queens%2C+NY)Feeling to be dupped, I called the hotel from the public phone to let them know of the doorman, but the receptionist put me on hold for 10 minutes and at last I hung up! The few bucks more was not important at all! But the way the doorman tricked us and also the attitude of the receptionist made me feel really bad about the hotel.

I arrived around 11am and the room was not ready but Rob quickly helped me out and rushed the room for me. He gave me directions to head out and eat which was great. They stored my bags and I came back around 1:30pm to get the keys to my room. The room was amazing and I would definitely only stay at this hotel next time I am in New York. The beautiful woman at reception during 3-11pm was a huge help with directions and where to go as well. All of the staff was amazing, including the lovely Elisa at the bar in Felice. Big props to all of the staff and bellman, especially Max who made the decision for me to go out. Gentlemen all around.

Stayed at this hotel for a few nights. The room and the bath room were very clean and I like the air freshener they use.The staff were very helpful and friendly.My room had a king sized bed which was very comfortable. The room has very high ceilings which made me feel easier to breath. :)Unlike some hotel rooms that feels stuffy from the moment you enter. Location was good, though the Google maps was not pointing to the hotel correctly for some reason. Please report this to google to have this corrected.Next time I visit NYC I definitely want to stay here again.

So after driving around NYC from 3am - 9am searching for a hotel, I hotwired this hotel and got it. I was greeted with friendliness from the moment I walked in, and both the young lady and young man working the counter working the desk that morning instantly began to help me. They told me that they weren't entirely full the night before and they offered me an early check in by about 5 hours at no cost, they did a walk around with the car before they parked it which personally I think all valets should do. When we got to our room, everything was neat and tidy, and the room was spotless. The bed was very comfortable and the hotel is located in a great location near many shops and restaurants. My girlfriend and I really enjoyed our stay at the Gild Hall and if we ever go back to NYC this is definitely where we will stay. Not only because the hotel is really nice, but because the staff at this hotel will really go out of their way to make you feel at home. I can't thank them enough. A+++++

We stayed at this hotel during a wedding weekend and were pleased. It is suited for business travelers, as it has a computer work area with a nominal $15 charge per day for Internet access. The lobby area provides free wi-fi. No frills... there is no pool or complimentary continental breakfast, although a mid to upper price restaurant and lounge is attached. We got a wedding group discount of $219 per night; I don't know what their regular pricing is, though. The building seemed to be well-insulated, providing us a quiet night's sleep. Generally, we would recommend this hotel.

Hosted a private event on the 2nd floor and the staff had prepared the venue exactly as we had previously discussed and the food catered from the hotel restaurant, Felice, was amazing. The space was very inviting as it looks like a library.I also stayed over at the hotel and was impressed at the size of the room. Definitely more bang for your buck than the cramped hotels in midtown. The fridge is stocked with yummy treats too! I highly recommend hosting an event or staying at Gild Hall.
user_name:
travelsofpearl
New York City, New York

review_body: A beautiful, stylish but cozy hotel in a great location. I have stayed at quite a few hotels in NYC over the past 15 years and this is one of the nicest ones, I highly recommend it. The restaurant had excellent food.

I have stayed here on several occasions and find the hotel a true bargain and relaxing place to stay. It is clean. The staff helpful. It is on a quiet off beat street, yet within 1 block you have a major drug store and gourmet deli and several cafes and restuarants to choose from. 3-4 blocks away are all the major subway lines. Any by the way, did I mention the bar scene after work? It is a good crowd.
user_name:
James P
New York City, New York

review_body: This is a very distinctive and unique property...from the time you enter till the time you check out, the service, furnishings, staff and the incredibly well designed rooms and common areas impress you. Large bathroom, huge tv, very comfortable bed, big window, large room by NYC standards and great furnishings in room overall. highly recommend this property and look forward to going back again very soon as well as sending all our business associates back there too.

not sure what hotel in NYC you think has bigger rooms but Gild Hall as some of the largest standard rooms I have seen in the City. I live here and have people in from out of town all the time. I don't stay at Motel 6 or Doubletree's but am sure this property is no where in alignment with that.This is a great property. Very European and intimate service. You meet everyone that works there if you have a stay longer than a few nights. The restaurant has amazing food although it is run by separate owners the experience is seamless. I found the housekeeping staff to be the most courteous and respectful. No dirty laundry or carts n the hallway, ever.The bellman runs around the block to find you a cab in seconds. Try and find that service in Manhattan!

really nice hotel, very close to the city center, the hotel is close to many shops which is a plus, public transport ok, there is Internet access and a telephone in the hotel is very clean and nice, cool place I would recommend, the service is very nice and what we need to help the food eaten in the city, is the bathroom a nice atmosphere, I recommend plus low price

I was really excited about staying at Gild Hall, but this place disappointed me terribly. But for the fact that it was in NYC, it was like staying at a cheap motel (Motel 6) or something; the rooms were tiny and there were no amenities at all as far as I could tell. It was clean, but the place was old and not anything special at all. I've stayed at regular Doubletree Inns for half of what I paid here, and had way nicer rooms. So, I paid about $500/night here, and I really don't think this place is worth more than about $200/night even considering that it is in NYC. There are much better options available, I would avoid this place.

Hi AllThis hotel was lovely, everything you could expect from a 4 star hotel. Yes its expensive, but this is NYC so you will pay more for everything.The room was lovely, clean, and well dressed. It looks exactly like the pictures.Bar and restaurant are great, especially if you can be bothered looking for a place to go.Staff were really helpful and knew their NYC stuffThe location was awesome, short walk to the sea port, mtr stations to Manhattan and Brooklyn. Plus you are near wall st, which means there are police everywhere, which makes it safe.I cant fault this hotel in anyway. Just book it you wont regret it.

Love, love , love this boutique hotel. One of the best hotels I've stayed at in NYC , or anywhere for that matter. The ambiance, the decor or the lobby , the rooms , everything far exceeded my expectations. We even received a glass of prosseco while checking in. The staff is super friendly and attentive. The room decor was manly, yet warm and cozy, very inviting. So much nicer than the large chain hotels. I loved the leather headboard, very comfy bed and comforter. The bathroom was beautiful , with gray glass tiles, very nice quality white , silver and glass fixtures and that door, very cool! Didn't get to try the restaurant, will do that on my next stay. I can't wait to come back, and I for sure will be back!

I had to be in NYC for two nights and stayed here for the first time. I was really impressed with the ambiance. Really clean and crisp hotel with courteous helpful and professional staff. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Stayed for one night and loved it! I enjoyed that it was away from the hustle and bustle because I needed my beauty rest after a long day of doing touristy things and then partying wee into the night. I loved the little detailed personal touches in the decor of the hotel. The ambiance of the hotel reminds me of a warm, cozy, romantic cabin in Aspen! The restaurant in the hotel, Felice is a bit tiny but the food was great. Their house wine was better than I expected and would recommend with the charcuterie!

Stayed at this hotel a few times and have always found the expirience to be exceptional, the restaurant is also very good. I must to being a fan of this type of hotel, but it so much better thant the corporate box hotels you find in major chains. I havent used the hotels buisness services, but as a place to stay downtown it is is superb.

Hands down, one of the best hotel experiences ever. The staff: knowledgeable, personable, more than helpful. The room: beyond expectation! Enormous, well-appointed, spotless. I felt soooooo pampered! Many thanks for pumping up the volume for my birthday!

My boyfriend surprised me by booking a night at the hotel for my birthday. The ambiance was so romantic and chic. The food at Felice restaurant downstairs is AMAZING!!! They have a great staff with great customer service. I would highly recommend Gild Hall, whether you are traveling for business, pleasure or just for an anniversary night out!

Awesome staff good in room dining and overall great experience. Would highly recommend to anyone wishing to stay downtown good dining in nearby areas and close to many subway lines. Nice cozy furniture and clean beds fast service hood sncks

I have nothing but great things to say about this hotel. This is definitely my go to whenever I am in the New York area. Everything from the value, to the rooms are all really top notch. The customer service, amazing! I am all about quality when it comes to customer service and will say the staff sure beats my expectations, always being attentive and kind. The rooms are large and spotless and I love the mod look they exude. Location is great, your surrounded by good restaurants and cafes. Overall a great hotel that I would recommend anyone to stay in when coming to NYC.
user_name:
Gso358
New York City, New York

review_body: Love this hotel! The ambience and decor amazing! The staff are so friendly, definitely will recommend! Great place!!!!!!!! The location is in a quite and close to the trains.. the restaurant is definitely something I would want to try if I say again. They have gluten free options for those who are gluten Tolerate. The rooms are spacious and cozy. Love it!

I bought my parents a one night stay in Gild Hall's luxurious king suite for my dad's big birthday - and spent a lot of time with them there! My parents were so thrilled with the entire experience - from the location, to the huge room (by any standards, not just NYC!), the amenities including the fabulous Felice restaurant, and the complimentary bonuses the incredible staff offered in honor of the occasion. This is the only hotel I recommend my friends and family to stay at when they come to visit me in NYC! Can't beat the location (proximity to Wall Street, South Street Seaport, East and Hudson Rivers), service, or chic-ness!

Highly recommended. I've been to NYC a few times already and Gild Hall was the best hotel I've stayed by far. I would definitely stay there again. The hotel is in the Manhattan area, 5 minutes walking distance to Fulton St subway station or Wall St subway station. It is walking distance to Wall Street, Battery Park, World Trade Memorial Park, Brooklyn bridge. There is a good grocery store, coffee shops, restaurants and fast food joints around the corner. Les Halles (Anthony Bourdain's old restaurant) is also within 5 minutes walking distance. The bedroom is spacious by NYC standards and very clean. The bed is king size and comfortable. The bathroom is spacious and spotless. The staff are friendly and helpful. Definitely worth staying.

Gild Hall is located in the center of historic Financial District of Manhattan with very close proximity to the Brooklyn Bridge, tons of shops, Chinatown and the always bustling South Street Seaport. However, it is not only its location that makes this Downtown oasis great. Staying at Gild is an experience, thanks unique ambiance, high end décor and phenomenal restaurant Felice. The staff "knows there stuff about" about the entire city and are eager to serve customers, its situated two blocks away from the a subway that offers every train the services every area of the city; including Midtown which is 10 minutes away.Put simply, if you're coming to New York City? Stay at Gild Hall. I did and love it (clearly).
user_location: New York, New York, United States
user_name:
De'Juan G
New York, New York, United States

review_body: I have stayed in NYC on numerous occasions this time we needed to stay for 3 nights after crossing the Atlantic on QM2. This hotel is a gem of a find, the room is small but good for NY. The hotel is spotless, staff are very friendly and not in your face. A rare find.

Very cool place at a great price too. I wasn't excited about the financial district location but there are 2 stops on the 2-3 train within a 3 minute walk. This made it very convenient to visit friends in Brooklyn or to head uptown. The hotel looked awesome, the staff was very friendly and efficient, and the rooms were large by NYC standards. I highly recommend this place.

I came here for a business event and was blown away by my experience. The service was great and the decor was very tasteful. The overall ambiance was energetic and trendy, yet professional. The hotel's food and alcohol selection was perfect for my group and we were conveniently located to everywhere we needed to be. Highly recommended!
user_name:
Alon B
New York City, New York

review_body: This is a great hotel located in Manhatten. I have stayed at this hotel several times in the last 2 years while traveling on business. The staff is friendly and the hotel is so charming. They are quick to assist with any needs whether it's directions, recommendations for restuarants or emminities. The room is very comfortable and stylish. The bar is quaint and its a great relaxing atmosphere to meet clients or collegues.I highly recommend.

Stayed at Gild Hall for one night with my boyfriend. It isn't a bad option, there are just better options out there. I didn't like the wall street location. Much rather stay around midtown or village/soho. Showers- Did not leave enough toiletries for two people and only left one bath robe. Shower-head doesn't have a hand held part (what happens if a lady doesn't want to get her hair wet?)

Second time back to this little gem within the hustle of Wall Street area. Just so great to have a quiet place to go.Room clean and not "worned" look. Bed very comfy. Bathroom with enough room to actually move about with a really great shower. What more can I say. Friendly staff--they even had a small plastic bag for an ice pack on my ankle (ouch!).

We found out large room with two queen's beds.I was traveling with 2 children.I like this place cause of short distance to subway - Fulton/very helpful reception and clean rooms.Shops with food are nearby.Good base close to OTC/Wallstreet to look at NYC. Wi-Fi is free in the lobby.

We loved staying in the hotel, it is very charming. It's in a nice area of town but it was a walk to the subway. The stop close to or hotel shuts down at 6pm. I don't know if this was just temporary thing or if it is year round. The rooms are a nice size for NYC and the staff is very friendly. They have free wifi only in the lobby. In your room it is 15 a day.

This is the second Thompson hotel I have stayed in, and I am really impressed with the quality of their customer service and the comfort of the rooms. The desk staff could not have been more helpful - charging my cell phone in the office, confirming the address of the museum I wanted to visit and giving me directions, and just in general being welcoming. I really enjoyed my room. It was quiet, comfortable and very clean. I would certainly stay here again. It was very convenient to the subway.
user_name:
tilda54
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Gild Hall is a diamond of a boutique hotel in FiDi that i loved to boast to my peers about. It truly isan oasis at night in a quiet neighborhood. I stayed more than 20 nights over the course of the last 7 months and got to know the entire staff on a personal level. I have seen these guys deal with foreign and domestictravelers with great customer service; help me find a late late night spot for food when my flight was superdelayed; accommodate my random room needs based on the trip (Bathtub vs shower; extra pillows, ironing board, etc)What I most loved about Gild and will miss dearly now that i'm not traveling to NYC: - You are greeted every time with a professional and genuinely courteous smile - The hotel has a great "Father's Contemporary Library" vibe  - The food at Felice is craveable and delicious! Very good cheese plates, great wine and bar selections,  veal ragu, housemade pasta, amazing salads and fish dishes...everything is great - Updated and Modern guest rooms with really amazing smelling shampoos. Trust me at the end of a long day Eucalyptus shampoo is a much welcomed stress reliever. - The rooms are quiet and the noise from the outside is just about non-existant...very important! - bathrobe that just envelopes you after your eucalyptus shower This hotel really offers the best trilogy of what makes a hotel a great accommodation:  - Clean / Inviting - Location & Proximity - Value for hotel night based on quality of servicesafe travels friends!

It's one of the best hotels we've ever stayed. Everything is great, enjoyed our stay for three nights. Great value in NYC. Complimentary luxurious toiletries. Beautiful deco, amazing staff, excellent service and excellent location. Bed and pillows are comfy. Nothing to complain at all. We love this hotel and will definitely stay there again.

This is the perfect location for any activities in lower Manhattan. On a narrow side street, and with a European façade, it's a refreshing change from the chains. The lobby and staff are first rate, and the surrounding block has every amenity (including a hardware store). The rooms are spacious and quiet. Room rates are below market, making it an excellent choice for business and vacation travelers.

I recently stayed at Gild Hall this past weekend of 7/21 and I must say this hotel is amazing. The location and esthetics of the place is 2nd to none. The staff and services are great. I will definitely recomend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a beautiful place to stay in NYC.

My mom and I stayed at the Gild Hall for 7 nights while we were on vacation in NYC! We shared a Superior King room which is their smallest room and we didn't feel cramped at all. The bed was great, the pillows were comfy, the bathroom was gorgeous. Overall we really loved the decor of the whole hotel, we were a little worried with the whole modern/masculine hunting lodgeish feel but it was a lovely space.The staff at the front desk was wonderful! They gave us great suggestions for activities and food in the surrounding area as well as the other boroughs. Overall they were just a pleasure to work with. The hotel is on the smaller side with only 18 floors and about 8 rooms on each floor. We enjoyed this part because we didn't hear any foot traffic from guests or any maid traffic the entire stay. Very quiet and nice to come back to at the end of the day.Our only complaint (if you can call it that) was that the bathroom didn't have a fan which made for a muggy room after showering. But with 10 minutes of the AC running it was back to normal.

We stayed here for our son's orientation weekend for Pace University. The location was great, the staff was helpful and the lobby bar was fun! We had dinner at Felice (Itatlian restaurant in the lobby) our first night when we got in (no time to go out anywhere) and we were so impressed (props to our server, Josie (sp?) for a great evening). A great funky little hotel - - loved the vibe. While the rooms are nothing to write home about, they are clean, the bathroom is a good size (with great water pressue in the shower) and the bedding is nice. All in all, a great find.

Great location in lower Manhattan. Right by Fulton Stn so easy access to 2,3,A,C trains. Pier 17 & South St Seaport are minutes away by foot. As is City Hall & Brooklyn. Front desk staff are friendly and helpful. Room was clean, though not much of a view from my 12th floor room. The masculine theme of dark wood, leather and plaid suited me just fine. The theme of a hunting lodge is found in the lobby & bar as well. As with most big city hotels free wifi is only in the lobby.

Stayed for my wedding night... Hotel was flat out awesome. Robert- who seemed to be doorman, valet, man about town was absolutely the sweetest And most courteous staff member- he made our stay perfect. Would absolutely recommend this hotel and the attached restaurant Felice

A business hotel located in the heart of Wall Street. The Gild Hall is a boutique hotel with a somewhat funky style. The rooms are OK – I’m not a big fan of the design but they are clean, the beds are comfy and the bathroom is good. Staff are friendly but nothing exceptional. There are only two lifts, which are also used by the service staff. A bit awkward.

Gild Hall in Lower Manhattan is a good option if you want to stay at some distance to the stressful Times Square. The metro station is close by, it's no problem to get around. Nearby attractions includes the 9/11 memorial (5 minute walk), Brooklyn Bridge. However, you must assume that there is a certain amount of travel time, if the stores on 5th ave and Broadway theaters is your main purpose of the stay.Wi stayed at the Gild Hall for 3 nights, had 2 rooms on the 12th floor. Our rooms was fresh, clean, and comfortable, The rooms are reasonable priced compared to standard and NY in general. Note: the bathroom - it's basically a glass cube, so when a person uses it in the middle of the night it lights up & illuminates the whole room. The air conditioning was very noisy. Wifi costs $15/day if you want it in your room, but is free in the lobby.

Currently staying here and so so glad to have picked this hotel for our wedding stay! super clean, well located, kind, considerate staff, valet parking and great, authentic northern Italian style food. staff appeared at our door to gift us tiny specialty cupcakes once they realized we were getting married... Likewise, the restaurant offered us complimentary and amazing desserts to celebrate. That , with suggestions about where to celebrate after our ceremony made us feel super cared for... Quiet and comfy place... Is this really in the big apple?! We were treated like We Imagine STRAIGHT BRIDES might expect to be treated... what a wonderful feeling. Love this place.

My husband and I stayed here on the last 3 nights of our honeymoon. We were met by Peri who upgraded us to a bigger room and spent ages with us showing us the best places to visit in New York. In all the places we stayed on our honeymoon, we were most impressed with Peri and how nothing was too much trouble. The room was amazing, the ambience in the lobby was gorgeous and we will definitely be back!! New York was fab too ;-)

Stayed for one night only - but I'll be back. This was a great hotel, excellent location. Staff was friendly, it was easy access from Subway (2) and it has plenty of conveniences. Our room was fresh, clean, attractive and comfortable.

Let me get the problem out of the way first: $15 A DAY FOR WIFI IN YOUR ROOM AND NO CHARGE IN THE LOBBY?????So: people can wander in off the street to check their email, but once you are a paying customer, no such. This is totally idiotic but if you aren't using a laptop ignore this part and move on.The rest was just magical! Great helpful staff, very cool public premises. Felice is a worthy Italian restaurant and the bars are perfectly decorated.Location is excellent, Wall St/South St Seaport area. Too many tourists but what can you do, it's NYC in the summer, Ground Zero, etc. Very near Fulton St for subway access.Room was big enough for two, unusual for a boutique hotel. GREAT A/C !!! Nice furnishings and prompt hot water.Wifi policy only loses the fifth star. I got a great rate on booking.com, elsewise would have been way too pricey for me.Wonderful choice, highly reccomended!

Whether or not you fully agree with my assessment of this hotel, if you've stayed at other NYC hotels, you're bound to find that Gild Hall is above average--at a minimum. And, to boot, it's very reasonably priced. It's particularly well-suited for those leisure travelers who prefer not to be in the commotion of Time Square and other touristy areas of the city.

We stayed at Gild Hall in May and enjoyed our stay. Since it was our first visit to NYC, we had lots of questions for the concierge. We were pleasantly surprised by the friendliness of the staff and their helpfulness. For us, the location (financial district) was good. It was on the subway line, and an easy 10 min walk from the South Street Seaport (where we caught the hop-on-hop-off bus). The rooms were very clean and the bed was extremely comfortable. The air conditioning worked GREAT. The only downside I can think of is that there are not very many places to eat nearby at night. Not a huge deal though once you know this as you can just make sure to plan around that or hop on the subway. We did have one dinner at the Italian place across the street from the hotel and it was really good. One tip would be that wifi costs $15/day if you want it in your room, but is free in the lobby.

I found Gild Hall on Hotwire.com and wasn't sure what to expect since I had never heard of it. When I pulled up the website I was both shocked and excited to see where I would be staying over the weekend. Though the hotel doesn't have much signage out front and the street is rather bla, when you walk in the door the ambiance and eclectic decor instantly make you feel like your in a modern luxury hotel. The unique ambiance and furniture alongside the spectacular bookshelf staircase help make it such an unexpected Wall Street find. The lobby also has a quaint bar and additional whine bar upstairs with dimmed lights and a romantic yet hipster feel. All of the staff I interacted with were very real, pleasant, and seemed to genuinely care that I had the best and most comfortable stay possible. The room was very classy and the bed was very comfortable with exquisite leather like head boards and fluffy pillows. I usually can find a complaint to make but here I found none. This hotel is truly a gem of a find and I will most definitely be staying here on my next trip to to New York City.

My family and I stayed at GIld Hall for 4 nights and enjoyed our stay. The hotel has a very rustic and charming feel to it. The staff are all very friendly and helpful and don't shy away from any requests. As for the rooms, I would say it is a very standard NYC room. I've definitely seen better, but it's a great place to just crash at night. If I were to sum it up, it's a small, but pricey boutique hotel. If you are looking to stay closer to all of the action, stay somewhere more uptown. If you don't mind being away from the hustle and bustle, Gild Hall is a great place to stay

My wife and I stayed here recently while visiting the city for a friends' wedding. We mainly went off of the sites' web site and the recommendation of the wedding party. The stay was absolutely a pleasant surprise. From the friendliness of the front desk staff, to the upscale look and feel of the furnishings in the common areas and in our room, it really felt like we were getting a lot more hotel than what we paid for. Check in was smooth pleasant, the desk was in direct view of the restaurant, which looked really appealing after a three hour drive. We headed there immediately after check in and had a very good meal.The room was very sleek and modern, the housekeeping staff did their job perfectly, not much more to say here really. We did not get a chance to check out the fitness facilities.Honestly the only downside is that the location is a little bit removed from some parts of the city. It was not by any means bad, but the Financial District is a bit dead on the weekends -- the nearby Starbucks all closed at 8pm (although there was a pretty sweet grocery store down the street with lots of baked goods and plenty to grab for a late night snack). It is also a bit of a hike to head uptown. I feel this is a fair tradeoff considering how much hotel you get for your money here, but it is something to keep in mind.We would absolutely stay here again and have recommended it to several friends already.

Stayed there with my business partner in June 2013.Staff are all very friendly and helpful. Especially, David at the front desk.David is presentable, professional and very helpful during our stay.Room- compare to standard New York hotel, I see it as reasonably spacious.- Spotless Clean and very comfy bed.- provide C.O. Bigelow Apothecaries shampoo and conditioner.- extra cost for wifi.- extra cost for consuming the bottle water provided by the hotel. Hotel- Really like the decor style of the hotel- free wifi at the lobby- convenient location ( very close to Wall St/ the financial district/ the subway /and the pier)- small gym room- no roof top terrace- have a nice lobby / library area

Gild Hall will become a regular place for Mrs and Me. They took amazing care of us. I can't thank them enough. David, Shimmy and the entire crew. The hotel is a short walk from South Street Seaport and The Freedom Tower. It's a slightly longer walk to the Brooklyn Bridge. It's a great place to make a home base while exploring NYC.
user_location: New York, New York, United States
user_name:
FrankThebaldguy
New York, New York, United States

review_body: We stayed at the Gild Hall while we were in town to join in the 5boro bike ride in May. We chose this hotel for its convenient location to the ride start but were wowed by its great atmosphere, the comfortable rooms, and especially the attentiveness and genuine friendliness of the staff. It realy seemed there was no need to large or to trivial for any one of them to take care of. The location was easily walkable to some terrific low key restaurants that bustled despite the neighborhood emptying out for the week-end so it was still a vibrant NYC experience. We were particularly impressed by the barista who made sure to make us some terrific coffee in time for our early ride start and the bellhops who took such good care of storing our bikes. I'd love to come back soon.

An excellent hotel that definitely has the best value for money during our stay. Nicely located and friendly place with rooms which, while not huge, are definitely comfortable. We had no issue and the staff is very friendly.

The rooms are nice and quiet for NYC. The location is great, near by The Brooklyn Bridge and the 911 memorial. This area is busy during the week but quiet on the weekends. The staff are attentive and the atmosphere is modern and funky.

We stayed at the Gild Hall when we were in town for a family wedding. It was my first time staying in the financial district of NYC (all other times I've stayed in mid-town), so some pros and cons:Pros: --Much quieter than most hotels in mid-town - most other hotels, even if you're on a high floor in a good hotel, you still hear constant street noise all night. Here, it's pretty quiet after about 7pm (and completely quiet all weekend). Also, the hotel attracts business people for the most part, so not a lot of young kids running around making noise.--Convenient to the subway (about a block and a half walk to Fulton St. station), then only about a 10 minute ride to midtown. Also plenty of good coffee/bagel places , as well as several drug stores and convenience stores within a block or two.--Excellent service. Whether we needed a cab, theatre tickets, recommendations on good restaurants nearby, or a bandaid after a long day of walking, the front desk staff was ready to help, and among the friendliest hotel staff I've ever encountered in New York. Tomo in particular was awesome.--My husband still has not stopped raving about the great gelato at the hotel restaurant.Cons:--The financial district shuts down in the early evening, so if you want to be in the midst of NY nightlife and hotspots, it's not the best location. But again, it's only a short subway ride to mid-town.--Most cabbies in NY have never heard of the hotel (since it's a smaller boutique hotel), so make sure you know the address and cross street if you're taking a cab to the hotel.All in all, I'd definitely recommend it! Thank you to the staff there for being so friendly!

Our stay was a combination of business and pleasure. The staff was extremely attentive to our needs. They were a tremendous help by providing directions, assistance, recommendations for dining and sightseeing - anything we needed. I would love to find a reason to get back to NY and stay here again.

I really enjoyed this hotel. It's convenient to the subway for anywhere you might need to go in NYC. I went on the weekend and found it refreshing to have good coffee shops for breakfast close by without the lines and crowds you find elsewhere in Manhattan. My hands were full (with hot coffees) and a front desk staffer pushed my elevator button without my asking so I give them credit for great customer service. Rooms were clean and beds were comfy.

Nice hotel, staff were kind and helpful.Location is too far downtown for most NYC tourist hotspots. Good for Ground Zero,Staten island ferries,Wall Street etcTransport using subway & buses is good.Quinny

Off the beaten path yet convenient to transportation and within walking distance to the sights of lower Manhattan, this hotel delivers on many levels! The neighborhood is quiet with very little car traffic. Hotel decor is sophisticated and comfortable. Our rooms were equally comfy and good sized. Rooms were immaculately clean! Big comfy bathrobes and slippers, ahhh. The suite had a well appointed kitchenette and spacious sitting area. The concierge staff are knowledgeable, very helpful and genuinely nice. The in-house restaurant and bar were lively and apparently popular with locals. The food was good Italian and the wine list was three pages long! Finding this hotel was such good luck! To be sure, I will stay there on my next trip to NYC.

We found this hotel through Trip Advisor and were not disappointed. If you are looking for a quiet boutique hotel away from the chaos of Times Square, consider this hotel. The service is excellent and the facilities as described on the website. Travel delays into LGA turned a 1 hour flight into a 13 hour delay. The front desk was very sympathetic and apologetic when the hotel keys would not work properly. After four attempts we did finally get into an upgraded room. A bottle of champagne and fruit tray from David Finch, Asst Manager of the Front Office proves the service you will get at this fine hotel. We had an opportunity to eat in Felice (hotel restaurant). It was delicious! You are walking distance to South Street Seaport, Brooklyn Bridge, World Trade Centre and major subway lines. There are no sounds of any traffic as this hotel is tucked down a few small side streets. There is a convenience store 2 mins away that supplies everything you might need and a Starbucks as well. We will definitely return!

Traveled for work, which is located a few blocks from the hotel. I travel every month or so and so far, this was the cheapest and yet most likely the best hotel I've been at this year. Great service, awesome room, no BS. exactly what I need.Will come back again.I wish that had a some loyalty program affiliation.

What a wonderful place. Tucked off the bustle just enough, entering the lobby actually made a tired, middle aged guy on business feel really cool and suave for a moment. The staff is more than friendly, the rooms are spacious and quiet. The attached restaurant has wonderful food. Try the steak sandwich. At night, the quaint upstairs bar is a fabulous retreat. An easy walk to great sights, including the 911 memorial. You will not be disappointed with this hotel.

This hotel was located within blocks of the 9-11 memorial and close to the financial district to see the bull. The staff were very pleasant and helpful. Parking was across the street and cost about 35.00 a day to park they offer a discount with the hotel. The room was small but with very good taste, the view was another building across the street. Excellent location and a great price. I would recommend the hotel.

Amazing prices, wonderful amenities, perfect service, great rooms. Trust me, it's worth getting to know this hotel. I have stayed here many times over the last few years, and I will surely continue to do so.

Our cab from LaGuardia was about $50 (w tax/tip) to the door of Gild Hall. The modern library type foyer with leather couches was warm and inviting. Service was quick and easy to check in and the front desk staff were genuinely pleasant and helpful. Our room was on the 14th floor. Rooms are small, but that is typical in NYC. Bed was comfy, bathroom was updated and had wonderful lavendar bath amenties from a local apothecary. Mini bar, lots of pricey bottled water, a robe, and other nuances were not used, but appreciated. Our only disappointments were that the carpet was black, which I don't know about you, but it isn't very inviting to me to take your shoes off with black carpet as it is meant to hide yucky things, and the black distressed wood furnishings just looked worn, versus faux rustic, which made the room feel tired. What would have made all that go away, would have been a coffee maker... alas not one in the room.We would recommend the hotel, especially if going to the 911 Memorial or sites in the lower part of Manhattan. It is a simple walk to many of the attractions, and there is a subway segment near Fulton St about 3 blocks away which runs all the different lines up through the city. Very convenient.The best part about the hotel we thought was the in-house restaurant Felice. We are writing a review about that next!

I had never heard of Gild Hall when my client booked us there. I was som impressed with the facility (very boutique), the restaurant (the Italian food especially the pasta) and most importantly the staff. The staff was very client focused and they always wanted to help in any way. I was so thrilled with my stay that I am going back on a personal visit as my first stay was on business. What a gem!!!!
user_location: Dix Hills, New York, United States
user_name:
Peter H
Dix Hills, New York, United States

review_body: Sure, this hotel is located in the Financial District which can be a little bit of a pain if you have meetings in Midtown, but it is very close to a subway stop and I really liked this place. Got a great deal on this place on JetSetter and was able to get a very large room which I loved. Room was very big for NYC and clean. Had a kitchenette, microwave, and a Keurig coffee maker.Only minor things are the location (but not that big of a deal), the gym was small and stuffy, think walk-in closet sized, but they did have 2 others to choose from. Worked for me. Other than that, was a home run.

The hotel is pretty nice. The rooms are small but quite comfortable. Super expensive. I'd give it a rave review if price was around $300 but cost was excessive. Neighborhood isn't much and I was disappointed that the roof of the hotel isn't open like their hotel in Soho.
user_name:
Nate501
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed at this cool little gem of a hotel after seeing the photo of the lobby on the website. We were in NY for the weekend and going between there and Brooklyn so the location was perfect and over the weekend - quiet! The room was very quiet and comfortable, nice furnishings and interesting front desk staff. Stay here - you will feel quite at home!

We found the Gild Hall via a booking website, and as I been to sister hotel 60 Thompson I figured the quality would be up there; we weren't disappointed. My wife and I received a warm welcome for our three night stay, speedy check in and good banter from a genuinely friendly and helpful front desk. Unlike some of the fake "have a nice day" types that you get, these guys seemed like it really mattered to them that you had the best time. We got upgraded on arrival which is always a nice bonus, the bed was huge and comfortable and the room, whilst minimal, was perfect for a long weekend in NY.The hotel is a little tucked away but easy enough to remember once you know where you are, and well placed for Fulton Street subway which takes you to wherever you would want to be within 20-30 minutes.We didn't eat in the restaurant but it was packed every night and my friend who lives nearby said she visits frequently. We were lucky enough to try some of the Italian tapas during the happy hour (only $3 a dish!) and they were excellent, especially the fig, honey and ricotta crostini! If we hadn't had such a full schedule we would have loved to have sampled the larger menu. Also the Italian wine selection was excellent and reasonably priced by NY standards. With a small baby our chances to visit NY just as a couple don't come around that often but this is a weekend we will never forget, and if the opportunity arose again we would be back in a flash.

The lobby and upstairs lounge are unique and classy. The atmosphere feels like you've stepped into your cool uncle's classy, yet homey den. The rooms are not as small as some in NYC. If you need a good deal on a boutique Financial District hotel, give this place a shot.

We were pleasantly surprised when we checked into our hotel. We chose to stay in the Financial District to participate in the NYC Bike Tour. The staff immediately helped us unload our gear and checked our bikes into the basement. They informed us of their valet parking service, but they also let us know that less expensive parking was just a few blocks away. That night we ate a delicious pasta meal in the hotel restaurant. Our service was excellent from the hostess to the bus boy. We slept so good in the soft sheets and was even able to open the window a bit for some fresh air. While the bathroom was small, it had everything except body lotion. Our request for a later check-out was happily honored by the front desk. We plan to book the exact same trip next year. Gild Hall is a charming boutique hotel with exceptional service in a quiet location downtown.

So I tried to get rooms all over NYC last minute but the TriBeCa fim festival was on so ended up further south than planned but what a super place. It's boutique without trying too hard , if you like simple design with a sense of humour you'll like the decor and beds you don't want to get out of. If the wifi and bottled water were comped then you are close to perfect. Bjorn on the front desk was friendly, practical and went all out to help you- which is what you what right? Seek out this hotel and see a little bit of Manhatten you'd normally miss out.

The location is a little out of the way but we enjoyed the quiet respite from the rest of busy manhattan. Loved the lobby and the rooms were a good size especially for New York. We were able to get free wi fi by checking in on four square. The restaurant is a bit pricey but the food was good. Front desk staff was nice and our stay was just lovely.

I recently spent two nights at Gild Hall for a weekend reunion with a group of friends. Right off the bat, I was impressed with the decor and boutique feel of the property. The room was, by NYC standards, spacious and didn't feel cramped with two beds in it. The hotel was modern with a slightly quirky design. The beds were absolutely fantastic and the rooms were silent all night. The one drawback was that our room had a bathroom with a frosted glass wall which didn't provide much privacy. What really impressed me was the staff; they were all friendly and helpful - a great group of people. When we requested extra towels and shampoo, it arrived in about 5 minutes. They gave us good directions to get to the touristy areas and even recommended places to stop along the way. I spent a while in the lobby using the wifi and noticed that the staff really seemed to be having fun with their work. I will definitely check this place out as an affordable option next time I'm in NYC. Pros:- Friendly and helpful staff- Clean rooms- Extremely comfortable beds- Affordable rooms- The shampoo and conditioner - amazing!! - Concierge recommended Long Island Bagels, great call. Cons:- Location was a bit out of the way- Glass wall for the bathroom was awkward - Hotel bar was more expensive than other bars in the neighborhood
user_name:
DCbiztraveler_11
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The rooms are very clean and large for NY standards! This section of the city is quieter on the weekends than most other parts, but I think it is nice and still an easy cab ride anywhere in Manhattan. There are some good bars and restaurants in the area (Harry's Italian, Stone Street, etc). I highly recommend the financial district vs times square. If it is your first time to NY, visit Times Square but you don't need to stay there.
user_location: New York, New York, United States
user_name:
Joe M
New York, New York, United States

review_body: We stayed here for five nights at the end of March/beginning of April. We thoroughly enjoyed our time there. The fact that this hotel is located on a small street in the financial district means that you can walk outside in the morning without a crush of people immediately upon you. However, it is very easy to walk to Broadway, Century 21or any of the subway lines (in less than five minutes) to experience the liveliness of the city you came for. The rooms are very modern and clean. The bed is super comfortable and the bathrooms are really nice. The hotel is very welcoming and stylish. You must swipe your room card to use the elevator to which is a nice security feature.  We arrived early in the day and the hotel held our bags (free of charge -- I have been charged in NYC for this before up to $5 per bag!). The staff was always very helpful.There is a daily charge for internet access in the rooms but super fast Wifi is free in the lobby.The hotel in general is very peaceful, and being away from any major tourist attractions meant the streets were generally quiet at night. The only complaint we would have is that the walls are relatively thin. We could hear the guest in the next room coughing (constantly) and/or playing music for two of the days that we were there. They generally quieted down by 11pm -- that or we were so tired we just drifted off. : )We would recommend staying here. Having visited NYC several times, the biggest "chore" or stress of the trip is finding a hotel and then hoping it stands up to what it said online. The Gild Hall delivered.

Great place. Very clean, cute and with a modern antiquy look. Staff was very accommodating and friendly. Made me feel like I was a VIP. The room was perfect, great bathroom. I slept like a baby, the most comfortable bed and pillow that I've ever slept on besides my own bed.

The Gild Hall is a stylish hotel with an exceptional service, a great location, and an authentic Italian restaurant!! A home run combination! The suites are so nice that we wanted to stay extra time.We look forward to visiting again soon.

We stayed in the king suite the night of our wedding at nearby Battery Gardens. It was lovely! The room was great, a tad sparsely decorated given how quirky the hotel's lobby decor is, but it was very, very comfortable and stylish. The living room was the perfect gathering spot for my husband and his 5 groomsmen + dad. There's also a really convenient/spacious "bar" area right off of the "living room" that had a separate bar sink, snacks, plenty of counter space, lots of full sized bottles of booze (altho we did not dip into those, god knows what they charge), and glassware. The bathroom is gorgeous and very spacious and the fuzzy flip flops were fabulous after a night of dancing.

My and my two teenage boys, just came home from a nice vacation i NYC, staying at Gild Hall hotel. Nice and freindly staff, clean and comfortable rooms. Two squares from ground zero, close to metro. Convenient in all matters.

We just got back from a week long trip to NYC, for both business and pleasure. Gild Hall was recommended by the conference I was attending just a few minutes walk from the hotel. I found their rates to be comparable to most of the 2-3 star hotels I researched, but I'm not sure what sort of discount was given for being referred. However,half of the nights were to be paid for by me, and Gild Hall agreed to extend the discount even though the business part of the trip was only 2 nights. The hotel staff was super helpful, friendly, and knowledgable. The hotel itself was beautifully decorated - super chic and classy. The rooms are small, but all hotel rooms in NYC are small. The bed was average, but the cleanliness was superior. I had a great experience, and will definitely look to book there on my next trip!

My family & I just finished an extended stay at Gild Hall, following Hurricane Sandy. It was, bar none, the best experience we have ever had at any hotel, including domestic & international. The staff is exceptional: David Finch and the entire Gild Hall crew (alphabetically: Brian, Caitlin, Jeanette, Khloe, Max, Perri, Randy, Robert, Sara, & Tomo) were perfectly attuned to our every need. Everyone was unfailingly polite, helpful & friendly. In our 3 months of residence, we never once had any issue with the service of the hotel. It really seemed as though everyone we got to know who works there was a graduate of the top Hospitality Programs in the world. As for the accommodations & accoutrements themselves, on a sybaritic level, who doesn't love Frette bathrobes & Sferra sheets? I am still dreaming about the bed- it was ridiculous how comfortable it was. The rooms are beautifully appointed with wood & leather furniture. Room service is fantastic & rapid; housekeeping & maintenance on-the-ball & thoroughly professional. It's a very cool place to be, & one that I will recommend to anyone visiting NYC.
user_name:
LCK212
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed in the Gild Hall for a weekend in the City. The location was good - on a quiet street in the heart of the Financial District, with the Fulton Street & Coutland Street subway stops within easy walking distance. The staff were extremely friendly, and the room well-appointed with a large bed, high ceilings, and nice bathroom. Well recommended.

Stayed here for 2 nights in March 2013 and it was perfect! The service was excellent and staff very helpful and friendly. The hotel was very nice decorated and clean. The beds are extremely good! Located in a nice and quiet street:)

An excellent, underrated hotel. Great location and service. Jeanette wanted us to be able to check in early, because we had a long ride and arrived early, but our room wasn't ready, and she upgraded us for free. Very, very quiet, if you like that (we do), and close to many attractions. Would definitely stay there again.

Stayed last week for four days with my wife. The location in the Financial District was a change from our usual Midtown choice but the subway was so convenient. The staff were very helpful. Janette and Robert provided great assistance. The hotel room was just the right size for people on the go. The bed was comfortable and the hotel was very quiet, a plus in New York. Would defintley stay here again on the Porter Escapes package.

I stayed at Gild Hall for 2 nights / 3 days in March 2013. I booked the Superior Room through their website, where the room ended up being US$230 per night after all the taxes were worked in. The hotel is located in lower Manhattan, where a Holiday Inn Express will cost you the same amount. With this in view, Gild Hall represented excellent value for what you got in the room, hotel environment, location, and comparison to other hotels in the area.I thought the location was great, however, if you are a tourist, please consider Gild Hall's Lower Manhattan location. This area of the city is quieter than midtown and downtown (especially so on weekends, when the financial offices are closed). It is about a US$10 to US$20 taxi ride away from downtown and midtown, respectively. There is excellent access to the subway system (24 hours), with the Fulton Street station being a couple of blocks away -- convenient lines of the A, C, 2, 3, 4, 5.The internet was available for an extra US$15 per day (probably excluded taxes), where I declined on the internet as it was an additional charge. It is lower than what other business hotels would charge, however, it would have been great if it could have been free, even if only in the lobby. There is a Starbucks on William Street 1 block away with free Wifi access.  The staff were well-mannered, pleasant, helpful, and appeared trained for customer service. They seemed to enjoy working there and with each other. We found Brian at the front desk to be especially helpful during our stay.Gild Hall uses Bigelow toiletries, which is a plus.Rooms were clean and of interesting appointments. I loved the hallway corridors of Gild Hall. The air felt dry through the HVAC system where I didn't sleep great at night -- but this may be due to the overall dryer air in Northeast US where I was still adjusting. I'm not convinced on the light pillows used in the beds, where I would have preferred standard larger/firmer pillows. There is a lounge on the second floor where the hotel was flexible to turn down the volume of the music while I took an early morning conference call. After check-out, I learned that there are fitness facilities on several floors of the hotel. I didn't have a chance to use these facilities even if I would have known up-front. Good to know for next time.Really a good experience.

As tourists unfamiliar with New York City we booked this lower Manhattan hotel through the British Airways website, mostly based upon cost and appearance. We were not disappointed.On check-in we were welcomed enthusiastically by the reception staff, who throughout the week were helpful and friendly.Due to the lower-rise nature of the hotel (relative to its surroundings) we didn't have much of a view our, but after long and hectic days of touring the city this made the perfect retreat. With its quiet location we were not disturbed at all by traffic noise or the city bustle.The room itself was immaculately clean, cosy and extremely comfortable. The only fault personally would be the lack of tea / coffee making facilities in the room, but that could just be my English ways.The library bar(s) and reception do feel like a world away after busy touristy days and the Felice restaurant within the hotel is excellent.Initially I was concerned the downtown location was a little isolated but there are many facilities nearby such as Duane Reade & local stores, fast-food, Fulton Street subway, Battery Park, Staten Island Ferry as well as great dining at Felice in the hotel and Harry's Bar at Hanover Square.Thank you Gild Hall for your great hospitality and for making our NY trip even more enjoyable. I would recommend this hotel with confidence if your looking for a quieter out-of-town spot.

The hotel was just perfect for us. We stayed in Feb. for 2 weeks in total and loved it. As other reviews said, it is a GEM. It has a boutique hotel atmosphere, feels welcoming and cozy, especially in winter! The staff throughout were young, helpful and friendly. In New York were life is full on it was a pleasure to come " home" every night.The restaurant and bar are lively and add to the overall atmosphere of a good place to be. the food, a little slow in getting to the table maybe, is good with an Italian feel to it.Our room was perfect, bed comfortable with super quality linen. Bathroom spacious and every thing worked. Even with all the guest in the restaurant and upstairs bar there was not noise and we slept undisturbed. Just a great place, perfectly managed

I stayed at the Gildhall for two nights. It is very conveniently located in Downtown NYC close to Wall St and Seaport. The rooms are a good size (for NYC) and the whole hotel has the feel of a boutique style hotel being very tastefully decorated.The staff were extremely helpful and were able to answer all of my questions. On my departure the receptionist went out in the rain to find a taxi for me and brought it back to the hotel so that I didn't have to wait outside.The downstairs bar is very pleasant and again, the staff were very friendly.I did not get a chance to use the fitness rooms but colleagues told me that they are quite small.In summary - a very good business hotel with a friendly feel to it.

I just returned from a 3-day stay at Gild Hall and I was so impressed with their amazing customer service. I came to New York for a business/industry related function and didn’t choose this hotel, but I’m glad the organization I belong to did. Tomo and Janette and the other desk attendants and were very attentive to all our needs. From arranging cab service to making sure items were quickly delivered to our rooms, from helping us find delicious local eateries, to printing out documents for us at no charge; very impressive. The hotel rooms are very clean and comfortable and surprisingly very quiet! The library, wine bar, eclectic décor, and comfortable seating areas in the hotel give it a hip, chic vibe which fits the area very well. There was a grocery store, some shops, and many restaurants within walking distance so it was also very convenient, but off the beaten path just enough to get a quiet night’s sleep. I would definitely stay there again and would recommend to others.

It's late on a Friday night in NYC lower manhattan and the event I am at is coming to an end. I have no hotel yet. Using my iPhone app I discover Gild Hall only a few blocks from where I'm at.You know those discoveries in life where you by happenstance come across a remarkable great find? A treasure of a place or location that you probably never would have found except for unusual circumstances. Well Gild Hall for me is just such a place.I knew as soon as I walked in it was special. You could feel it. Wonderful ambience. And the deal they gave me for a room the next two nights was an outstanding value.My room felt so comfy. I truly felt at home. Like a second home in NYC for me. The bed was excellent and I fell into a deep restful sleep; unusual for a hotel bed in my experience. The hotel's attributes are many; beautiful lobby, restaurant, wine lounge, and bar. The room decor, especially the bathroom with its frosted glass door, were great. I think Gild Hall offers tremendous value, even at their full rate.What I liked most was how they integrated a great Library from the lobby all the way up into the 2nd floor wine lounge.The staff are excellent, professional, and on top of everything.For me Gild Hall is now my latest Treasure Find and I truly hope to have a chance soon to go back to NYC just so I can stay there!!
user_name:
Erik F
Santa Fe, New Mexico

review_body: If you're into boutique hotels that give you an incredible bang for your buck, Gild Hall is the place to be. Simply put, you get everything (swank, service, style, cleanliness, etc.) from Gild Hall that you would get at almost any other top boutique hotel in NYC, but at a significantly lower cost. The staff is friendlier (and cooler) than most hotels in the area - but just as professional and well maintained.

We got this hotel on Priceline and had no idea what to expect. The lobby was gorgeous. The room was bigger than you'd expect in NYC. The subway is a couple blocks away. Only downside is the area is kind of vacant on weekends, but there was no street noise, which can be an issue in NYC hotels located in busier areas. The front desk staff were the best.
user_name:
CarolineMcMuffin
New York City, New York

review_body: The location is in the financial area. My family lives over the Brooklyn Bridge. We love walking over the bridge or had subway options. The area is surprisingly residential. The hotel was a nice boutique hotel. Service was very good. The decor is great. We had a suite which was too large for us- yet great when family came to our room.The only downside is the rooms are dark- due to the area and the poor room lighting.

here is the letter that I wrote to the general manager of Guild Hall after my recent stay:Scott,I just wanted to say thank you. I stayed with you guys last night and had a great experience. Although I was not in the hotel for that long, the level of service that you guys provided was excellent. I just wanted to let you know that it did not go unnoticed. From the unexpected upgrade to the little dish of cookies from Felice (the restaurant in the hotel) and the letter that accompanied it, everything was handled wonderfully. You have definitely earned my repeat business going fwd. Feel free to forward this letter to your staff as I feel that this level of service was exceptional and I am happy to know that businesses still care. I have been very unhappy with most services lately but you guys went above and beyond and it was greatly appreciated.Thank you,JB
user_name:
jerbailer
New York City, New York

review_body: An absolutely lovely little hotel in the heart of the financial district. Great service and ambiance. Room on the small side, but it is Manhattan after all. ;-) Clean and comfortable. Very convenient from the subway. Library a great spot for an evening drink or two.

I have stayed at Gild Hall close to 10 times over the past 3 years. Very easy to get to whether your business is over the Brooklyn Bridge or in the financial district. I appreciate the consistency of the high level of service, the quiet location, the great food, and unique atmosphere. Staff is attentive and welcoming - from front desk to bartenders, wait staff, bell men. Rooms are comfortable in their decor and size, beds allow for a great night's sleep. Short walk to many outstanding bars and restaurants. If you want to get a real workout in, you'll need to go to Crunch (1 block away) or other local gym. Getting a cab from front of the hotel can be tricky...bell men are more than willing to help and can get it done quickly. Highly recommend. One of my favorites in NYC.

This is the second time we've stayed at Gild Hall. We were just there for 24 hours but it was a wonderful getaway. Very convenient from the Seastreak Ferry and subway. The staff was great, we got a room upgrade, a late check out. The 2nd floor bar The Library was a great place for an evening nightcap. The hotel room was exquisite, and the price extremely reasonable.

First of all, I would definitely give this place a rating of 5, but I refuse to give a 5 to any upscale property that insists on billing me $15/day for wifi; they might as well tack on a water bill.However, it's a great spot, other than that glitch. It's a small, intimate hotel, so the front desk was never overwhelmed, there were never lines, and the staff couldn't have been more pleasant or helpful. I was upgraded from the basic room; my room had incredibly high ceilings, making the room seem big and airy. The actual footprint isn't that big, though; but you don't feel cramped at all. The room was very quiet and dark, and the bed was comfortable. The water pressure in the shower was outstanding -- better than any hotel I've ever stayed in. You can't beat the location, if you have business in the financial district -- two blocks to Wall Street. The decor, particularly the lobby, was unique -- a sort of western feel, with faux animal hides and big leather pieces, as well as the big iron chandeliers in the rooms. Neat place.

Quirkiness, without lapsing into kookiness, is a difficult act to pull off, but the Gild Hall manages to be the perfect antidote to bland, chain hotels while delivering 5* levels of service. The small book-lined lobby, leads into the bar with restuarant (Felice - very good) beyond and a further wine bar area up a short flight of stairs on the mezzanine. Warm welcome and attentive service throughout stay. Room was well-sized and comfortable, with excellent bed, quality linens, etc. Bathroom well fitted out. Surprised that they charge for wi-fi ($15 a day), but that's about all I can find to moan about. Great downtown location (actually on Platt St, not Gold St), and definitely a hotel I would return to.

I just spent a week at Gild Hall, and I am really glad that I picked that hotel. I felt so welcomed and just like home. Giving me all the service I needed to focus on my work during daytime, and warm genuine welcome after a day at work. I will definitely stay at Gild Hall next time I go to New York!Thanks for everything!
user_name:
Eric J
Göteborg, Västra Götaland, Sweden

review_body: We stayed at Gild Hall for 5 nights over new year and I have to say that the hotel is fantastic. The staff are extremely helpful and friendly and nothing is too much trouble. The hotel is really quirky and the rooms are very large for NY, very clean and with a spacious bathroom. The hotel is very close to the subway, ground zero, century 21 etc so although its away from the main hustle and bustle of NY everything is still really accessible. We would definitely stay there again.

We stayed at Gild Hall in the aftermath of Hurricane Sandy. Our apartment in the Seaport has been under repair and so we were hotel-bound for all of December and the first part of January. As residents of Seaport/Financial District we have a good handle on the hotels in our neighborhood since we frequently have friends and family come to town and ask about places near our apartment to stay. Going forward this is the only hotel I will recommend. The quality of the staff we've met - David, Janette, Tomo, Robert, Sandy - is simply outstanding and the rooms are impeccably clean. Housekeeping is also very friendly and professional. As a frequent business traveler I've stayed in hotels from Chicago to LA, Las Vegas, Dublin, Montreal, etc. and this ranks among the best hotel experiences I've ever had.

My organization holds several large meetings per year in the financial district and we always book accommodations for all of our attendees at Gild Hall. We do this for several reasons: (1) The sales staff are incredibly helpful, especially when having to make last minute adjustments; (2) The hotel itself is beautiful with a great restaurant and convenient location - all of our attendees specifically ask if we are still booking at Gild Hall and are excited when we say yes; (3) the rates for the hotel are extremely competitive and Gild Hall offers group rates when making several bookings. I simply can't recommend Gild Hall highly enough.
user_name:
B N
New York City, New York

review_body: I was pretty impressed with the Gild Hall on my last visit, so it set a standard for this visit.Though not awful it's fair to say it didn't live up to my original visit.
