My room was markedly smaller, maybe I was unknowingly upgraded last time. To be clear by NY standards it was still acceptable, it was larger than other rooms I have stayed in this price brackets. It seemed the cleaner was a little lax this time. There was a mark on the top of the duvet and one of the bath towels had quite a few marks. They both appeared to have been laundered but nobody had noticed that they weren't quite clean. I complained about the towel but decided to let the duvet slide.The service on the front desk and from the bell guys is always friendly and helpful.The breakfast room service didn't have a menu available and had to be ordered in the morning which put me off. It all seemed to be rather suffering from teething troubles.There seemed to be no meaningful Room Service outside of restaurant hours which surely defeats the point. Getting back to my hotel at about midnight, I was unable to get any food or a recommendation for take out. Leaving me going to bed hungry.The most troublesome experience was the restaurant, Felice which had opened since my last visit. It had been relocated upstairs to the wine bar as the downstairs space was hired out for a wall st. party. The to me seemed like an average middle of the range menu, but then maybe I've been spoilt here in Europe. I had a Burrata Toast (Crostone ?) with Aubergine(Eggplant) and Courgette (Zuchini), which was fine, there wasn't a great amount of Cheese and it could have had more taste. Then I was asked to order my main as the kitchen was closing (before 9:30), I dutifully ordered a Ragu. A few minutes later the waiter came back and let me know that the kitchen had actually closed! He was very apologetic and clearly just seemed rather helpless.I was speechless for a moment and then let him know this just wasn't acceptable. I had a glass of wine and half a starter and wasn't prepared to pay for that and then seek the remainder of my meal elsewhere. He went away to consult with the manager and a while later the manager came back to apologise and said he'd resolved it and I would have my meal. When it arrived it was decent, nothing mind blowing but perfectly nice. I had another glass of wine and some cake which both ended up being on the house to apologise for the earlier issue.So though they were very sweet and they resolved the issue it wasn't a positive experience. Average food, and needing to complain just left a bitter taste.Overall this is still a well priced option in downtown NY, with a decent FiDi location if you need to be near Wall St or World Trade Center, and nice staff, it just needs to pick up it's game. Improvements in Room Service, Restaurant and Cleanliness would put this back to a 4 or 5 rating.

I've stayed at this hotel several times and always found the staff helpful and accommodating. Located near several subway lines, it's convenient to get around and quiet at night due to its neighborhood location. Quirky decor due to a glass wall between the room and the bathroom, but for solo or couple stays it's not a problem. Beds are comfortable and rooms are clean.

Needed a place in the financial district and we discovered Gild Hall. A neat place. The room is OK, not a wow, but the best thing about the hotel is Felice-the wine bar and small restaurant off the lobby. Great selection of Italian wines, creative cocktails and good food. What more is there.

Stayed for a weekend with my friends. Great value for a hotel in the financial district and a great spot if you spend your time split between manhattan and Brooklyn. Rooms are decent sized for NYC hotel and the staff were so friendly. Will definitely make this my hotel of choice to stay at in the future - there are so many overpriced and drab hotels in NYC so it was a pleasant surprise when I stayed at the Gild Hall.

I have to say it is, by far, the most interesting hotel I've ever stayed at. I was looking for a 4-star reasonably priced hotel around the downtown area so I could quickly shuttle to Brooklyn at 6:30am on a Saturday morning for the Rock 'N Roll Brooklyn 10K. And this is actually one of the hotels I was looking at because I heard good things about it. And when I did the Hotwire Super Secret hotel booking I was able to get a good deal for this hotel. It is pretty much in the middle of the busy and dirty downtown/financial district area but it's location is great! It is about half a block from the Fulton St subway station, it's a few streets away from Leo's bagel (yum!), and it's so close to Wall St and it is like a block or 2 away form South Street. Oh yeah, the WTC is probably a block away. It is in a sweet corner between Platt and Gold so it is not awfully busy. It looks like other brown buildings around it so it can be easily missed but the flag can help spot it. The doormen and reception desk people are very nice and accommodating and helpful. The lobby has that nice modernized sitting area with "animal skin" as carpet (cool!) and it has it's own pub area too. The elevator is room key activated because of the pub area and the 2nd floor library/private party area, so that only guests can access the hotel room floors. As for the 2nd floor library, it has a lot of books around, a nice sitting area, and actually a bar area. The room that I got was the regular king room on the 5th floor. It is SMALL. Pretty much looked like a loft. The bathroom is literally 5 steps from the bed and though the sink and bath tub and bathroom decor are nice and new the door is frosted glass and you can see whoever is in the bathroom. So my best friend and I when we each use the bathroom had to make sure the lights are off so the other cannot see the inside of the bathroom. The room decor is modernized country home-- it has antler looking chandelier and the bed board is this padded leather board and the cabinets and tables are this rustic-brown color scheme. It is very MODERN. The housekeepers are very good. They keep the room clean and smell clean. I also like how fast they are to get us a taxi when we needed it. Overall, my experience is good. It's a nice retreat after being outside in the busy financial district area.

I live in New York and checked into the Gild Hall after being displaced as a result of Hurricane Sandy. After staying here for nearly two weeks, I can't say enough good things about this place. The hotel, from top to bottom, is beautiful and modern. The restaurant Felice (which is a huge improvement from its predecessor, the Libertine), wine bar on the second floor (the whiskey cocktails are amazing), and the pristine rooms are sophisticated without being pretentious. The staff - Scott Koster the general manager, Tomo, David and Caitlin, the assistant managers - have been nothing short of amazing. Their care and attention have made my husband and I feel so at home during an otherwise trying time, and we couldn't be more grateful. We are now fans of the Gild Hall for life and look forward to coming here for dinner and drinks in the future!
user_name:
Rosa H
New York City, New York

review_body: this is not an easy hotel to find in the financial district, especially on foot from the subway. deserted late at night down there and tons of construction. small bar on site but not very appealing. harry's pizza bar is next door, which is a plus. if you have business downtown this is a decent spot. nice modern rooms and mine was reasonably spacious. a bit of a trek if you've got business elsewhere in the city but with some very low rates over the summer it was worth it for me.

I stayed there recently and wasn't happy. I had a pretty depressing room, very dark although the weather outside was sunny. The bathroom was small and cramped, service was polite but not friendly and there was a mess with my reservation that took a few days to sort out. I was glad to leave and will not try again.Furthermore, and this is no fault of the hotel, I wouldn't really advise anyone to stay in that area unless there is a special need to stay there (eg. work in the financial district) - it is pretty dead at night and very difficult to find a cab after 6pm.Finally, I would have probably rated average instead of poor but took off a point for the $15 per day wifi - that is unacceptable as far as I am concerned.

I was expecting much more from the buzz associated with this property, and that of Thompson's other places in New York. The staff seems well kitted out and friendly; beyond that, however, it appears that structural inefficiencies will keep the place from improving much.I arrived latish at night and check-in was seamless. I was told I was being given an upgraded room, and went off happily in search of same. Well, first the electronic key did not work for the door. Returning many stories down to explain and get re-keyed, I was getting a bit peeved. I found my way back up to the door, opened it and entered. Only to discover that someone else was in residence, with clothes, towels, luggage and the like strewn everywhere. I quickly retreated, went back downstairs and wondered aloud how in the world this could have occurred. No intelligent answer issued.I was given another room, key worked at first chance, and found it to be confining, unwelcoming and over the top unimpressive. The hvac chugged away like it had asthma, making a quiet room environment impossible. The bathroom was small and confining, but the water pressure at least was acceptable. I had been comped a breakfast based upon my first round of adventures, and must say that it was very good - thank goodness I didn't have to lay out cash for it.So, if you have the need to say you've stayed here, go for it. You'll be awed by its average-ness.

This hotel was only 2 blocks away from my son's apartment. Located in a very old section of NYC, this hotel is difficult to find. Very narrow streets are hard to negotiate. The hotel is very small by most standards No complimentary coffee, parking for the hotel was across the street at $55/24 hrs. No in/out service. We chose to park around the corner where my car was lifted up on a rack. Price was $10 less & could access my car. The standard King room was very small with only 1 chair placed at the desk. No place to sit other than the bed. Guests using the bathroom were very uncomfortable--the bathroom door was beveled glass with an extremely bright light as the backdrop. You had complete exposure to everyone in the room! There was no top sheet on the bed, only the comforter which I'm certain was not laundered after the previous guest(s). The room was clean, furniture showed signs of wear. Kept hitting my shin on the corner of the bed frame. The price was fair, especially for NYC.

We had never visited NY prior to this trip and so booked this hotel a little blind.However we found the location ideal and compared to the other hotels in NY it was significantly cheaper but still had a very good standard of service and cleanliness.The booking in was swift and without any problems and we found the room to be clean and cosy on our arrival...On the down side I thought the bottles of water in the room would be complimentary but they were if fact $10 each, and the hotel itself is not that easy to find especially if you were arriving in the hours of darkness.Overall a very pleasant stay and experience and I would visit again which is always a positive sign.

There is much wrong with this hotel but there is nothing all that special either . I have stayed at a lot of ny boutique hotels and this is at the lower end . I am mystified at some of the gushing reviews . Yes the place is quite stylish ,the staff helpful and the restaurant ok and the bedroom has a comfortable bed but there are little things that give the impression of cheese paring .These days to charge for broadband is ridiculous and to charge $ 15 for 24 hours is a bad joke . There are no coffee /tea making facilities in the room nor any complimentary water although you can pay for some . There are no toiletries in the bathroom . Also complimentary breakfast is a well hidden secret . I could also have done with bigger public areas the mezzanine bar seems unused and unstaffed .All in all it was ok but i was disappointed .

I did search for a long time for a very stylish hotel for a good price! £749 for 2 bargain!!!Staying in the Financial district worked out fantastically well, walking distance for TriBeCa and SoHo areas and you will find at Fulton Street Subway you are at a Hub for transport as all four main lines come into there. South sea port round the corner is historic and some good food places and shops also lovely market on Saturdays..breakfast at fresh salt fab... Staff at hotel always very polite and friendly especially one of the guys who helps you with your bags and door etc forgot to get his name. Rooms have plenty of space Art Deco feel. Reception is gorgeous . We did not eat at hotel so cannot comment! Only negative one evening asked for a coffee in reception as we just wanted to sit and read and take in surroundings and they were brought in paper cups and not nice.Overall I would stay again

it is a nice and cozy boutique hotel, friendly staff and very clean rooms. If you are staying on the weekends, it is very quiet neighbourhood at nights and not as convenient as midtown area. Food is good (only had breakfast), service fast and I really like Thomson Chain, next time I will try their other locations in NYC.

The hotel is in a quiet part of downtown Manhattan so it takes a bit to find the small street entrance on Gold Street. Check in was fast and friendly and they changed my room to a higher floor and away from the elevator on my request without issue. The hotel tries to throw off a trendy boutique vibe and only partially succeeds. The prints and photos on each floor are nostalgic and chic. But the room itself was just ordinary. It was dark old wood with leather accents which made it look a bit rustic and maybe that was the look they were trying to create. Smallish rooms standard for lower Manhattan and nothing to write home about. After having stayed at various midtown hotels like the Westin and W near Times Square, this one doesn't come close and I felt like I paid high rents for an average experience. The attached restaurant is lively at night and is good for a quiet breakfast which I had a on a couple of days (not included and no buffet option available). I haven't stayed at Thompson hotels before and based on this one, probably won't go looking for one in LA or London.

If you're coming to NYC and plan to only want to hang around Wall Street, it's a good spot. Boutique hotel, pleasant staff, quiet. It's not terribly convenient to tourists/visitors' interests. No coffee in the room, and they're proud of their coffee when you pick up a cup in the lobby. Everything comes at a cost...coffee, water, tea...is that just NYC? Maybe. Cabbies have a difficult time finding the place. Restaurant and bar staff are friendly. Glad I was on an expense account!

I stayed at Gild Hall in NYC this past weekend. The experience was excellent and the service was fantastic. Will definitely stay there again! I will list the pros and cons of this fabulous hotel:Pros:- Excellent front desk service and response to requests from my room- Gorgeous decor - The most comfortable bed and sheets I have slept in at a hotel ... ever.- Fantastic water pressure and excellent lighting in the bathroom for make-up- Quiet locationCons- $15/day for internet service and $20+ cab fares to go uptown- Doors to bathroom are clear/blurred, so if sharing a room, make sure you know them well- Rate went up $100 / night from Friday night to Saturday night

This hotel is right in the midst of the financial district. Beds are good rooms cleaned efficiently no coming back to unmade beds. As usual in NY they are small but not the smallest just don't bring too much luggage or you will fall over it! Reception is chatty almost at a 5 star level. New restaurant Feliche an Italian opening tomorrow. Free wine and food today lucky me. Food is good, service fast but the chain is excellent so ought to be! This will be my new haunt in new York.

The Gild Hall hotel is a small hotel in NYC Financial District with friendly staff. Rooms are typically small but comfortable and clean. Beds are very comfortable. The location is great for meetings in the Downtown area. The Felice restaurant serves a good selection of meals throughout the day.

It's been one year since my wife and I stayed at Gild Hall for our wedding. They set us up with a room for her and her sisters to get ready and then moved us to a suite for our wedding night. All of the staff was exceptional and extremely accommodating. I would stay for every anniversary if we could!

I booked this hotel through a reputable travel site but when we went to check out they produced a bill that was higher than it should have been. I told them the rate was incorrect and showed them the confirmation but they simply said we'd have the pay the higher rate, that it really wasn't their problem and we should sort it out with the travel site ourselves. We didn't have time to get into a prolonged debate as we had a flight to catch so we had to leave and I then had to waste time during my holiday writing a formal complaint and chasing them up several times before they finally agreed to honor the rate we had originally been given.It's shameful that a hotel of this calibre should behave in this manner. If there is an issue with the rate then the hotel should take it up with the travel site directly. Not their paying customers.What makes this more disgraceful is that it absolutely isn't a one off because there is at least one other reviewer of this hotel who had a problem when booking with a 3rd party travel site. In his case he had to pay more for a lesser room. Disgusting.Anything positive that I might otherwise have said about this hotel is negated by the shoddy service and dishonourable practice that I experienced.In addition, you might be interested in the following:* Air condition unit is noisy.* The bathroom wall is made up of glass so when you turn the light on during the night, the whole room is illuminated. * Wifi is not complimentary which is a real bugbear of mine in this day and age.* There was no room service or restaurant although that will have changed by now as they were about to open one.* The checkout staff were just rude and unhelpful.* And finally, it's the only "high end" hotel I've ever stayed in where they only provide shampoo & conditioner but no body lotion. There are plenty of other hotels in New York so go for one of those!

Our entire stay was just perfect, from check-in to check-out. The front desk staff was very friendly and accommodating. The king superior suite was beautifully furnished and decorated, spacious and super clean. I've stayed in many hotels, and I can say with confidence that that was the best night's sleep I've ever gotten outside of my own bed. Thank you Gild Hall, for a great experience!
user_location: New York, New York, United States
user_name:
Riccardo D
New York, New York, United States

review_body: My husband and I went to nyc to have dinner with some friends who were in from Germany, and we stayed at the Guild Hall Hotel, downtown in the financial district (my old neighborhood). I found the hotel to be very good for the price we paid, it was super quiet and the staff was very nice. Our room was spacious and the bathroom was great. Very clean all in all. Check out time was flawless and quick, and we had a nice breakfast at Felice, the restaurant at the hotel... which was under renovation, but I'm sure once is all done, it will be very nice.

Everything was great in this business hotel except they did not have a coffee machine in the room. I think this is something always needed in any type of the hotel. The location is very nice in the hart of the historic old New Amsterdam.

Spent 3 nights in Gild Hall for Labour Day long weekend. It's not the first time i stayed in the hotel. I can tell some good stuff are missing.Hotel is tucked in a small street in Wall Street area. About 5 mins to walk to subway station. Nothing around the area but there are 2 grocery stores which you can buy water and fruits. Also a Starbucks close by.Interior of the hotel is nice. Service... DEPENDS! I checked in Fri morning, got a room on 4th floor right the way which I was really impress. King bed room was big and clean. A/C on the nosy side but I have no complains. Bathroom was spacious too, but the amenities were not as good as before. They didn't use 'Fresh' bath products anymore. They replaced it with something else... and there was NO SHOWER GEL! They gave me a SOAP in the shower! I was very disappointed. I picked a Thompson Hotel which expected more and better things in all these details. There are return customers, who can tell the good stuff are being missed!Saturday was a joke. We left the hotel at 9:30am and got back to the hotel at 4:30pm... Wow once I got the room, I saw the WHOLE ROOM WASN'T BEING CLEANED!!! My sister called concierge right he way. The staff asked 'what service are you actually looking for'?! She explained to to the staff, and the staff said they would send someone to clean it up. We left the hotel around 5pm... We actually asked the staff at concierge: DO YOU PROVIDE DAILY CLEANING SERVICE IN THIS HOTEL?! As I've seen, the hotel was not crazy busy. The cleaning team just totally missed our room!But it's NOT the end of the story. We came back to the hotel at 12:00am. Room was clean... then there was another problem. Room was HOT!!! It was 8x F in the room! We called the concierge right the way. The staff said they didn't have any onsite electrician in the hotel. They assume it's the problem of the fuse. If it's the problem of the fuse, they could easily fix it. otherwise... THEY WOULD SEND US A FAN!!! I could never imagine myself sitting in a Thompson room, paying $200-300 per night with a fan. This is a joke. Fortunately there was problem of fuse and they fixed it. So we had a good sleep... until 5:45am Sunday!!! We called the concierge and told them to fix the fuse!Sunday was totally fine. I had a mixed feeling when staying at this hotel. The hotel looked pretty inside, but amenities and service need to be upgrade. It doesn't reach the Thompson standard at all. Also the cost of internet usage in business center is on a pricy side. Just go to Starbuck across garb a coffee from them, which they provide free wi-fi.

amazing nice semi translucent bathroom and the heating system is great during winter. it is located at the financial district and short distance to convenient store. it is chic and swanky. I like the lobby area which is v unique and charismatic. It feels romantic for a couple to stay as the lighting has got good ambience.The only downside is they do not provide a kettle which is a bit odd. the room is also a bit tight to circulate but i guess this is new york style. It was expensive as we went on NYE.

This was our first time in NYC and we loved it which helped finishing the day at such a comfortable hotel located in a great location and very friendly staff. Would definitely stay there again! Thanks so much Gild Hall.

When we arrived at the Gild Hall on Saturday, September 15th, we met Caitlin who welcomed us with a smile that was so incredible. It seemed liked she was just waiting for us to arrive. We were celebrating our anniversary and our daughter's birthday. She upgraded us to the same suite where we had celebrated a previous anniversary. When we asked if this was the same beautiful room, she just smiled. Her smile is infectious! She was so excited about making our anniversary memorable.We were given suite 50. Shimmy helped us with our luggage, and he made sure we were comfortable before he left. Yes, it was Saturday, and a wedding party of about 30+ people was also checking in. Shimmy took the time to help us. He answered all of our questions and just smiled! He wanted us to call if we needed anything. We love downtown! Both of our children went to and graduated from NYU (New York University). During the past eight years, we have stayed in almost every hotel in NYC. The Gild Hall is one of the best! When you arrive at Gild Hall, they will treat you as old friends and special guests. My husband and I are public school teachers, so we’re not rich. However, when we arrived at Gild Hall, we were treated like royalty. The bed was so comfortable! I was worried about no top sheet, so I brought my own. No need! The room was pristine clean. I read every review, all 300 of them, before we went.We love the Gild Hall. We were on the 5th floor and we heard no noise; we don’t go to bed at 8pm, but we are not up until 2 am either. We had great service from Caitlin, Louis, Shimmy, Fang, Ginette, and Brian.A wonderful room and great people made our stay fantastic. We highly recommend Gild Hall.Mike and Jane Cappiello

Every time I travel, it is a new adventure with new experiences and new places to discover. Even though a hotel is basically only a place to sleep, little things can make huge difference and shape how I remember places.I for example note how the reception staff comes across (stressed, artificial or relaxed and genuinely friendly etc), how clean the hotel is and if booked, what is offered complimentary and how. Certainly the size of the room and the location of the hotel is important as well, but those are minor points to me.I booked this hotel as it was one of a few (within a price range below $300/night) that offered valet parking in Manhattan and indeed, the location (walking distance to the 9/11 memorial etc) did not disappoint. The hotel also has a very nice interior, is clean and the rooms have a good size.What buggered me however was that it appears to be so up-market, that not only you would have to pay $10 for a 1l bottle of fancy water from the mini bar, but also that the complimentary breakfast ($15 value) was a bowl of fruit served with two slices of toast and some jam. All this accompanied by a cup of "resurrection coffee" (so strong it could wake the dead) and apparently freshly squeezed orange juice that didn't taste anything like fresh. When asked (beforehand) if it was possible to exchange the set complimentary breakfast for another item on the menu with less value, we were told that it was hotel policy not to do this...So what do I take away from my stay: great location, nice hotel, good sleep, next morning ruined by a management that wants to save money and only offers one set breakfast (while other hotels offer you a continental breakfast buffet) accompanied by coffee that can wake the dead and staff that is irritated if you ask for hot water to water it down.PS. If you drive into Manhattan and you are nervous where to park your car (as I was), you don't need a hotel with valet parking, where are plenty of car parks around you can choose from at a lower rate.

A side trip to New York City after a 30 year absence from the Big Apple, I was so looking forward to this fleeting visit and the welcoming and friendly check in at the Gild Hall convinced me I had picked the right place! I was feeling quite pleased with myself for having found my way from Fulton Street subway without referring to a map, even more pleased when I was told my booking was being upgraded to a king room and that reception would take care of my bags until the room was ready an hour later at 3pm. Quick little visit to the South Street Seaport, less than 5 minutes walk away - yes, it's touristy, but I am a tourist and there's no shortage of bars and restaurants; there were some Brazilian musicians promoting Recife and a very nice little bar in the sun where I enjoyed a strawberry daiquiri before heading back to check in. The room was great, 14th floor, fresh and well fitted, Frette bathrobe, beautiful quality bedlinen, iPhone/iPod docking station, plenty of power points for plugging in power adaptors to recharge non-iPhone etc. In fact the room was so nice and I had got up so early that there was a huge temptation, resisted, to have a little zizz for an hour or so.Returning to hotel on foot late night was a bit of a maze. NYC police officers, despite being very helpful with suggested directions, just don't have the comparable geographical knowledge of a typical UK police officer! Free wifi would have made the stay totally perfect; in a city where there is plenty of free wifi in coffee shops, restaurants, in parks and plazas charging $15 seemed quite excessive, especially as I was probably only going to access wifi for about half an hour. I missed having it.Breakfast was nicely casual, continental breakfast items set out along the ground floor cocktail bar, decent sized mugs for coffee or tea, different types of milk for those avoiding or enjoying the various fat contents! Bread for toasting, cheese, butter, pots of jam, halved crossants, fruit juice, newspapers, staff busily clearing tables and topping up the breakfast stocks on the bar as people came and went. Having decided I fancied an extra day or two there, the reception was unable to offer me a price approaching that which I had paid online. They suggested that I checked online to try and find a better price, but I didn't feel inclined to pay for wifi to try and better the prices and when I was out and about, my phone battery ran down fairly quickly as I was photo snapping and draining the battery with wifi usage. It does seem daft that one has to go online to try and get a better price than the hotel in which you are already staying can offer when they have room availabilty!I loved the location; the Brooklyn Bridge was minutes away and the walk there and back was a highlight, quite breathtaking views and I cannot believe how many photographs got taken. There's a supermarket open late on Gold Street, a block towards Fulton Street, and very well stocked. However, it was totally upstaged by 55 Fulton Market, a newly refurbished supermarket and deli, open 24 hours daily with such a good product selection as well as a fab deli counter, hot food and salad bar, even a sushi chef. There are some tables and chairs just by the cash register and some outside too. I want to live opposite such a good place! I have googled it since returning and it was, apparently, refurbished less than 2 months ago. Staff were also friendly and said all the food was cooked from scratch in the kitchens upstairs; they had a real pride in the place.Boy, did I sleep well both nights. After pounding the pavements of Manhattan, walking on the Saturday right the way up to Central Park South in baking hot sunshine with lots of side distractions en route, I was fairly tired, but an excellent quality bed and nice pillows sent me straight off to the land of nod! Air con was easily controllable so I did not have to endure icy blasts that are so popular on your (very nice) side of the Atlantic.DId I like the place? Oh, yes. Would I stay there again? Most definitely. Would I stay there rather than midtown or uptown? Absolutely, since from where else can you walk over the Brooklyn Bridge (and see a Tree grow in Brooklyn, literally), hit Century 21 (which I didn't actually like), get onto the Staten Island Ferry and pretend you are Barbra Streisand in Funny Girl, be so close to that Frank Gehry skyscraper (which is my favourite building in the world for making titanium look so organic and draped!), be in part of the most historic area of the city, small old synagogues and churches snuggling up next to skyscrapers, and be so close to subway lines at Fulton Street that go everywhere (even, if like me, you preferred Shanks's pony)?Loved it!

what a wonderful hotel from when you walked thru the door ,smily friendly staff .superb rooms decor of a high standard bathroom clean and fresh ,comfy beds .we requested extra towels at the desk by the time we had reach our room the ,towels were there .it was fun to play draughs or chess ,while waiting for the rest of the family to meet up . i would definitely stay at this hotel again with out question

Much prefer the rooms in this hotel than Soho Grand. Very impressive, a great deal of thought has obviously been made in the design of this hotel. Shame about the 15$ charge for internet. But then it is for 24 hrs.Amazingly, they had the same fan as Soho Grand and the same engineer. Pic attached.

This is a wonderful hotel in the financial district. We arrived early before out room was ready and the staff offered to keep our luggage until the room was ready. The rooms are very nice and clean, with comfy beds. The staff were helpful and had great recommendations for restaurants, and sight-seeing. This hotel was close to the subway and very conveniently located. We were able to get to the World Trade Center, South Street Seaport, and Battery Park very easily. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Very nice rooms with tall ceilings. Very well decorated with contemporary furnishings. Bathrooms are very nicely designed. Very clean. Beds very comfortable. Good downtown location. Rooms are quiet, and the place is modern but has a warm feel. Great quiet place for business travel or a vacation stay. We booked because of the value and did not know what to expect. We had a great stay and would book again without question.

My husband and I stayed here this past week and we were delighted with the location but most of all the service. We arrive late on Wednesday night and asked about a pizza place. The front desk told us about the place across the street and we were about to go up to our room when he kindly offered to put our bags behind the desk. So accomodating. The same attention was given when I asked about good running routes or when we called down because our remote wasn't working. Very friendly staff.The room was spacious by NYC standards and very clean.We would have liked a coffee pot in the room but there is a Starbucks right across the street.Location is great with the subway a short walk.For running, I went over to the South Seaport and then around Battery Park and up the West side. There is a great route relatively free of traffic lights.
user_name:
goldbeadz
New York City, New York

review_body: I can't say enough about the Gild Hall/Thompson Staff. They were very helpful, courteous, and responsive. They even printed out our boarding passes at the front desk and secured cabs in a blink of an eye. My wife and I decided to spend our 16th wedding anniversary in NYC (we are from Northern California). The Gild Hall was a perfect spot for us and we went to the oldest steak house in the US near the hotel. We were very comfortable and loved the decor. It was our best anniversary ever! I highly recommend staying here and you won't be disappointed.
user_name:
Siggi Jeff R
Walnut Creek, California

review_body: We went a few days for honeymoon to new York and we stayed to Gild Hall Thompson Hotel, it was a very nice hotel in the center of Manhattan , it was very clean and the staff was really friendly!!!!!!The hotel was close to every place that a tourist wants to visit and it was near to a subway station too, so everything became easier!!!!!!we love New York and if we ever visit New York again , we will stay to Gild Hall Hotel for sure!!!!!!!!!

we often stay overnight, in Manhattan for business, entertainment or dinner etc.Over the last 6 years or so, we decided against getting a pied-a-terre and rather staying for weekends etc in interesting and generally 4 star hotels. Consequently we have stayed at a large number of hotels from the upper east side (e.g., the Regency) to midtown ( Hotel Eylsee) to Soho (the Grand--thebetter one) and the Financial district (now our favorite area)-- the Gild.It is a superb boutique style hotel, the staff is well informed, pleasant, helpful and attentive. The rooms are incredibly quite and the rooms decor, structure are clever and well thought out. Somewhere between art deco, industrial progressive,and steampunk. It is not easily categorized. This is a hidden gem. They often have excellent discounts as well from various hotel booking groups. Nonetheless, not a tourist sink. The South Street seaport (which is mostly a tourist trap.. but for breakfast--"Cowgirl-Seahorse--right under the BB) is nearby and the brooklyn bridge blocks away. Soho, chinatown etc are close by. Try it.

If you going to New York city and want to be near everything, Gild Hall is the perfect and only choice. Very clean rooms, excellent room service comes twice a day so always have clean towels. superb not only the room the the bar. Desk service was very knowledgeable, and helpful. So close to everything. Great location, and best service I have ever had in any city.

Great location and friendly staff. I see that some people complained about the "small rooms" but obviously they are not familiar with NYC. These rooms are plenty large and they are well decorated. The food was good that ordered from room service, and I had no problem coming and going. Some larger hotels are a pain with long walks to get around. This is a boutique style hotel with a cute lobby and a nice bar. I will return to this hotel if I am looking to stay in the financial district again, and I recommend this place to anyone looking to be down in that area. 2 subway lines are very close by.

Had an event in NYC for charity and the organization suggested staying here... had to admit for the Thurs and Friday night price seemed pretty good. Location was a tad hard to find driving in but was a cool friendly spot. Nice design, staff was super nice.... room was killer in a king suite. Def recommend it.

Last month my friends and I booked a stay here. I can't say enough about how great this hotel is! Absolutely everyone from the employees at the front desk, to the bartenders to the bellhops was incredibly accommodating and kind. They all went that extra mile to ensure my friends and I had as perfect a stay as possible and I will be booking my stays in New York at Gild Hall from here on out!

I needed to be near the PATH for NJ and so this worked out very well. Competitively priced, nice service, large room and yummy rooms service like other Thompson's. Overall a good option for working downtown or in NJ Exchange Place.Positives:Large RoomsCleanGood ServiceDrawbacks were:Quite darkLoud A/C

Because of how pleasant my last stay at a Thompson Hotel was, I booked a weekend at Gild Hall for my boyfriend and I, and was not disappointed. There are not many hotels in the area, which makes this hotel such a wonderful find! It is about a block and a half from the South Street Seaport, a few blocks from Wall Street, and a couple of blocks from so many subways (2 3, 4 5, A C, and the J M). Everyone at the front desk was always so accommodating and helpful. My boyfriend and I both live in the city but like to take mini "vacations," occasionally staying in hotels in different neighborhoods as a change of scenery. The staff treated us so well, we really felt like we were vacationing in a new city, and not staying 20 minutes from our apartment. The decor is also so warm and perfectly furnished, almost like you're in an expensive bed and breakfast, not a hotel. Overall, the hotel exudes class and I definitely recommend it for a delightful NY experience.
user_name:
Gina N
New York City, New York

review_body: Good location and easy to access many areas of Manhattan. Lobby and reception area were quirky, but the bedroom was a decent size with a high ceiling and very effective air conditioning. The fitness centres - while small- were also adequately equipped and fit for purpose! Would certainly stay again.

Neat little hotel in a great neighborhood; Seaport/Wall Street area. Well trained staff and excellent atmosphere. Hopping bar scene. Rooms very nicely done; one strange thing (guess it is an European thing) is no top sheet on the bed. Charge for Wi-Fi excessive; it should be free.
user_name:
David C M
Oklahoma City, Oklahoma

review_body: Probably singularly the second-best hotel I've stayed in. Great atmosphere very un-hotel-like, and amazing rooms IMHO.I actually very much liked the fact that it was hidden down a side-street. It oozed class and ambiance, and was just a cool trendy place to be.

I had two nights in NYC and needed a fun, relaxing break after dealing with 2 very sick family members. I choose to split my nights to see different areas of the city. Our first night was at the Eventi Kimpton Hotel which was everything you would hope for...modern, hip, roomy with a view and bathroom to die for. I thought from the photos of this property it would be fun, hip and different. The hotel is on a dark street with very little daylight. The lobby and bar are very attractive. I agree with the other reviewer that the front desk was just ok. Not rude but not warm either. The red hallways make you think this is going to be great but it's not. Small room with window looking into another persons apt. The room was dark and musty. My husband sat at the desk to check emails and I had to climb over the bed to get to the other side of the room. The bathroom was bright and clean looking, really didn't match the room. Why wouldn't you get soap or shower gel? We used the directions from the desk and took the subway which was a mistake it was having issues and several trains worth of people waiting to board. We were late for our dinner reservations. If you need to stay in the Financial District for business that is one thing but don't stay here if you want to see other parts of the city. Too far. The bar is nice to have a drink before retiring. Didn't venture up to the second floor libaray area until leaving. Nicer spot to sit and relax. Might have been nice to know about before hand from the front desk. We did not have a good night sleep because of the air conditioning, on and really cold, off and the musty smell again. Our key card didn't work in the room, my car didn't work in the elevator. The only think good about this trip was the recommendation to the Financier Patisserie. A must for breakfast. I also had an issue with the front desk attempting to charge me again when my room was prepaid. I spent my drive away from the hotel dealing with who I booked the room from. Fine place to stop by for a drink but don't spend the night. Better options for the price.

This hotel is down a side street and even the cab driver couldn't find it without going round the block twice!We were on Honeymoon from the UK and had just landed from Vegas, it was midnight and we walked into the hotel to a club and music so loud you couldn't hear the receptionist speaking. I thought (and hoped) we were in the wrong place and the hotel rooms were further along the street. No, this was the right place and the rooms were above reception. I asked if we would be able to hear the music in our room and luckily because we were on the 7th floor we wouldn't be able to. When we got to our room, the music was very faint and not enough to keep you awake. We were also close to the lifts, which you could hear most of the time.The room was very nice and fairly chic. Well presented. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was nice and clean. It was quite cold and the air con was loud. The view was of a brick wall with a few offices.There was no room service available on a weekend???!!! We had to go out searching for food in the early hours!Overall, the hotel was nicely presented but I would never stay there again due to the reasons above. The set up of the club didn't make any sense and really put me off wanting to stay as soon as we walked in, but we had already booked for 4 nights.

Stayed three nights on our way to DC. Location was ideal and the the room was very clean and well kitted out. The bed was large and comfortable and the air con was efficient if a little noisy.When we booked breakfast was included but when we arrived for it we discovered that tea, coffeee, orange juice were not included! Come on! Breakfast without tea or coffee is not breakfast .Anyway resigned to this we asked for English breakfast tea...got Earl Grey..asked for EB again...didn't have any! Only continental breakfast included in breakfast deal. However if you want anything else, American etc you get a token for $10. Great! Omelette with a couple of sausages as a side...No bangers!!! I could go on. Suffice to say disappointed with this nice little hotel. 'Have a nice day' means hee-haw if they can't help get it started well for you

Overall, I had a great stay at Gild. The design is cohesive and welcoming, and the rooms are a very good size for NYC. The hotel is very close to pretty much every subway line. The room was clean and comfortable, with lots of seating for friends to be in the room. If you want to be in the financial district and enjoy boutique concepts, this is a great hotel for you.

The positive of staying at Gild Hall in the financial district is its location! There was serval things that disappointed my husband and I. First we were not told of the extra $100 hold that would be put on your credit card and would not be releases till a week later! The next issue that I had was you could here everyone go in and out there rooms! All night long all I heard was sliding of key cards and doors closing! Lastly the bed was extremely uncomfortable! Sad to say I would not recommend this hotel to anyone! Only as a last resort!

Last time I was in NY downtown I was staying in Marriot, and it was better- more elegant, more space. Gild Hall is more economic in price, I had quite a small room (single), but not too small and similar would apply to bathroom. Water for outrageous price in the room. There is nothing special about this hotel and at the same time not a lot to complain about. It was clean and had a normal exposure to noise for NY.

I was really looking forward to this one night stay, which was a layover for my daughter and I for a one night on our way back from 2 weeks in Europe. The photos and website showed a hotel I would like. Unfortunately for us it was not so great. When we checked in around midnight, we were given a king room which majorly reeked of cigarette smoke (the whole 2nd floor did). So I went down and asked for a non-smoking room. The nonchalant English desk clerk said he may have one other room available and then brought us the key to a 5th floor double room, which was fine with us. Upon our entry we thought the room was a bit muggy and the thermostat, which was set at 72 read 76 room temp. But we stayed thinking this was better than the smoky room and reset the thermo to 65 hoping it would get cooler overnight - and we were really tired by this time (plus apparently we had the last available room). In the night the hall light would come on and go off arbitrarily (this was something I had read as a complaint on other reviews on booking.com and was surprised that it was still a problem). And worse, the temp continued to rise in the room. It was hot, damp (it had recently rained) and had no air movement at all. It was impossible to sleep and the room smelled so musty and gross. By morning it was 78 degrees.I went to the desk at 6am to tell them and the desk clerk only offered me a late check out and to send an engineer (why do we want an engineer when we are checking out?). While I loved the decor of the hotel and the soft beds, these problems and the lack of any offering of reduction for the price we paid for the room was too much to be able to give this hotel anything better than a bad rating. The hotel sent me a survey which I completed referencing this problem and also asked for a response, and I separately sent the hotel corporate office an email. I have not had a communication from either. I think if my AC had been operational my review would have been really good, but that was not the case. I would have been better off at the airport Holiday Inn Express...

The Gild Hall is a very nice boutique hotel that offers pretty good rates for weekend nights. It is located in the Financial district, but it is quite convenient as it is only two bloks away from a subway station. From there you can get to Midtown in less than 20 minutes. Our room was nice, it had a decent size and the bathroom was also pretty big and well appointed. Some people have said that it lacks room service during weekends and that the breakfast is somewhat expensive. We did not bother about it as there is a coffeeshop in the same block.Some others have complained about the very noisy parties they have on Saturday night. We did not hear a sound and had a great night's sleep. A very good option for the budget contious.

Gild Hall has a lot going for it. It's very pretty, the rooms are big for New York, and everything's very nice. But that's about all it has going for it. It completely drops the ball on the little things, and that adds up. The staff isn't rude, but they're not at all friendly. There's no iron in the room, and there's only one soap for the sink and the shower. There's no coffeemaker in the room, and the only coffee available in the lobby comes with the continental breakfast -- the $15 contintental breakfast. The internet is slow, even for a hotel, and is also $15. The deal we paid for included two drinks, but they didn't mention that it didn't include cocktails.
user_name:
Chris B
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Gild Hall was a great hotel for us. We were debating whether we wanted something a little north to be closer to things but it doesn't matter because you can get everywhere with the subway. Service was great, the King bed was amazing. I always get better sleep on vacation than at home. We went to the hotel's club. They had two dj's on two floors. It was fun. There is a Century 21 nearby for anyone looking for bargains! This was a shopping trip and I was not disappointed. Would definetely recommend this hotel. The only thing is, most rooms won't have a view but you're in Wall Street and buildings are everywhere so don't expect amazing views.So overall, we had a great stay. Thank you!I had Five Guys burgers for the first time - there is one 5 minutes from the hotel. Love at first site.

Interesting decor, friendly staff, and good location. Housekeeping left a cleaning rag on our sink, and they don't seem to use fitted sheets: there was a flat sheet tucked in to replace a fitted, and no top flat. Ask for a top sheet unless you're comfortable just using the top duvet/comforter. Took a few calls in order to actually receive the top sheet, due to multiple front desk employees. Overall positive experience.

The room is clean. The decor is unique, quite different from other hotel chains. The bed is comfy enough but the pillows are too soft. Had to fold mine in half to double the layer. The bathroom lacked some amenities. There was only 1 soap for both shower and sink, no body wash or lotion. The AC was good but it was quite loud, kept waking up whenever it turned on at night. You can hear some honking outside, but since the hotel faces a quiet street, the noise isn't a problem. No view. This is a good location if you are on business, walkable to Wall St, Brooklyn Bridge, and other lower Manhattan attractions. Your eating options are limited but only a short taxi ride away from Soho or Chinatown.

Great location, stylish and not too small rooms (which is not a given in NYC...) - and it of course helps I got a great deal from booking.com. Nonetheless, I love Thompson hotels, and at my first time at this one, it gets confirmed again

This hotel is so close to being a financial district gem. Unfortunately, it's falling apart. When we arrived and got to our room we looked in the directory to find the gym and found only 2 room service menus (??), a promotional flyer for Thompson hotels, and a guest feedback card. We called down , the gyms were on the uhh 6th, 7th, and 18th floor? Also, after paying $15 for Internet, it stopped working...we called down and they supposedly restarted the router twice, to no avail. Also, for an upscale business hotel the bathroom amenities should include more than shampoo, conditioner, and a bar of soap. Finally, half the staff at this hotel have a huge attitude. The front desk attendant who checked me in, for instance, was very rude. And when we ordered toothpaste sent up to the room at 8am, the woman who delivered it knocked twice and then opened the door herself. The rooms are nice enough, and if you can get past the fact that it's eerily empty it's a pretty good value hotel. But unfortunately I am very disappointed with my stay at Gild Hall, given what I've come to expect from Thompson properties.

I have stayed in Thompson Hotels before and, as usual, this one was excellent. The lobby is very cozy and inviting - the dark wood walls, leather couches and low lighting were very soothing after a long train ride. We were upgraded to a suite which was a nice surprise. The room was quite large by NYC standards and the bed with Sferra linens was luxurious. While we didn't eat in the restaurant, Libertine, it looked very nice and unpretentious. I had never stayed this far downtown before, but was pleasantly surprised at how easy it was to get to other parts of NYC from here. They also let us store our luggage the day we checked out as our train home didn't leave until that night. All in all, a very very nice and relaxing stay. I would definitely stay here again.

I stayed at this hotel in downtown Manhattan and was pleasantly surprised. The rate was good and the room was bigger that usual for a NY hotel. The rate I had include a free drink at the bar which was a nice touch at the end of long travel day.

We made a very last minute booking on the spur-of-the-moment to stay here earlier this month. The hotel was within walking distance of the NY Stock Exchange, The World Trade, Center Memorial and on a nice quiet side street away from heavy traffic.The lobby/lounge has a decadent old library feel to it & the room was a funky mixture of baroque & minimalist (imagine that if you can) - a wonderful heavy looking chandelier was the centerpiece of the room. My only small complaint is that the bathroom has a frosted glass wall but if you have the light on in there you can basically see the other person on the loo etc - so you may want to keep the light of at night ;pVery easy check-in/out, took less than 5 mins each time & the staff were all very polite & helpful. Hope to be coming back sometime soon

Stayed in room 183 which was on the 18th floor and had a partial view of the Brooklyn bridge. The room was smallish but it had a comfortable king bed and a decent size bathroom. We only stayed for one quick night, but we actually preferred Gild Hall to the Andaz, which is a few blocks away. It's cheaper and the staff was nicer. We also liked the layout of the lobby and the quaint bar setup off the lobby, although we didn't spend much time in either. The location is ideal as it's close to both south street seaport and wall street. The prosecco offering at check-in is a great touch too!

I travel to New York for work quite a bit and whenever possible, I like to extend my trip into the weekend and enjoy the city. Usually I book a room via Hotwire or Priceline and often get a great deal. That's how I ended up at Gild Hall.There were a lot of positives to this hotel. First, it's 2 blocks from the subway in a very safe neighborhood. The room I has was very large by New York standards. I particularly like the quirky decor of the lobby, guest rooms and common areas. I think by far, the best part of this hotel is it's staff. To a person, everyone was super friendly and helpful. I felt less like I was staying in a hotel and more like I was staying in some private club. The staff just made me feel welcome. If you go to a larger midtown hotel, I promise you, that's hard to find. Before I forget, I loved the prosecco at check in -- it was a really nice touch.That said, there were some negatives, but just a few. First, the guest room was super dark. I mean, there was no natural light. Part of that is the Financial District location, but most of that is the hotel's design. If that's important to you, don't stay here.Also, I was there on a Saturday morning and they only offered a continental breakfast in the bar for $15. I skipped it and had a full diner breakfast around the corner at the Pearl St. Diner for less than that. I honestly don't think you can be considered a 4 star hotel if you don't serve breakfast, but somehow, Gild Hall pulls it off. If a weekend breakfast is important to you, don't stay here. (I think it would be smarter for the management to offer this continental breakfast free on the weekends, but that's just me.) I also had a technical glitch with my TV -- something about the cable connection meant the audio wasn't quite right. It wasn't enough to complain about, but that and a few housekeeping details -- like a missing bar of soap -- made me think that the very pleasant team needed a bit of work.Despite these hiccups, I would return, mainly because of the friendly staff, the good price and a convenient to the subway location.
We had a wonderful weekend at this hotel! The staff were fabulous and the rooms are comfortable and quiet. Only negative is lack of free wifi. Will definitely stay here on our next visit to NYC!

Always love to stay at this hotel -- the rooms are fantastic and the front desk staff members are wonderful. It's very convenient for any meetings in the Wall Street area and it's just a minute walk to the South Street Seaport area. Dozens of very cool restaurants in the neighborhood and the subway is just two blocks away. Very stylish boutique hotel with extremely comfortable rooms and terrific amenities
user_name:
ng0667
New York City, New York

review_body: I just stayed at the Gild Hall it was a nice hotel well placed for our purpose but I was very surprised there was no free WiFi you would think in today's world it would be just there no questions.

Had a few business meeting in the area and tried Gild Hall. Scored a good rate through a private sale site. Very stylish, staff was friendly and rooms are well appointed and decent size by NYC standards. If you have a need to stay in this area of Manhattan by all means consider this nice little boutique hotel.

We were getting married in Battery Park and decided to stay at Gild Hall after a recommendation from a friend and couldn't have been happier. The hotel is located on a quieter street in the financial district which makes getting downtown easy (could walk to battery park) but can be tricky grabbing a cab on the weekends. Fortunately the hotel staff was so friendly and helpful flagging down cabs as we were able to transport 40 people to the lower east side without much of a hiccup. We stayed in a suite and the room was awesome. Very large space and just not by NYC standards, great mini bar and fridge, comfy couch, and nice sound system made it a perfect and roomy space for me and my 6 groomsmen to get ready for my big day. The finishing touches were great and this was absolutely one of the cooler boutique hotels I've stayed in. The downstairs bar was great and the library/ lounge gave off a very relaxing and trendy vibe. Our photographer was able to take a few pictures of me having a cocktail in the lounge and the photos came out incredible. The financial district isn't my favorite part of the city but if you need to stay down town I would highly recommend Gild Hall. Great service, cool/ artsy type vibe, and awesome rooms.

The Gild Hall is a good, boutique hotel. Spacious rooms, very comfortable and with good bathrooms. The staff was fantastic when I was there - reception, restaurant, housekeeping - all totally professional and attentive. I had only had one problem the entire week I stayed, and that was with the wifi (billing) and it was resolved immediately. There is street noise (other reviews commented on it), but it is the norm for NY. I've stayed upper east side, and midtown and now downtown, and they all have the same level of street noise. The restaurant has lovely a-la-carte breakfast, and continental breakfast at the weekends. There are 2 very good grocery shops a block away (and these are short blocks) if you don't want to spend hotel prices. All the remaining Wall Street firms are within a 10 minute stroll, max., as is the 9/11 memorial. Tribeca and Chinatown are also walkable, as is the infamous J&R. That said, it is a schlep to get to the theatre district or midtown locations. But the subway connections are great for both the east and west sides. It took around 20 mins to get to 59th St. All in, a very good stay.

There is a wonderful European feel as you approach Gild Hall. The location is private and serene midst busy avenues all around. Cozy, artistic, thoughtful - sure to please the creative side of you as well as the sophisticated and structured desire as well.

Was there from out of town for a wedding and the Gild was great. Staff was friendly and helpful, location was good if you need to be in that part of town and the rooms were suprisingly "big" for a NYC hotel. And by "big" I mean you can actually move around a little and not feel like you are in a coffin. Most importantly, the rooms were very clean.We got a wedding rate so the price was just right.

Overall, this hotel exceeded my expectations. Nice lobby and bar area - the decor is "curated ecletic". Had a simple yet delicious dinner at the bar – I recommend the shrimp tempura and ceasar salad! Interesting beers and tasty cocktails. Bar and food service stop around 10. The room was very comfortable, with a decent sized bathroom (with a tub) and with crazy high celings! My two minor negatives: A downtown hotel with rates close to $400 (catering primarily to business travelers) shouldn’t be charging $15 a night for wifi in this day and age. So yes, I'm docking them one star for charging for wifi.My non-smoking 6th floor room at one point must have had a aigar smoker in it – there was a residual musty smell that didn’t go away despite leaving the windows open all night. Didn't make a stink about it (no pun intended) but mentioned it to front desk staff on check out so it will get taken care of. I am sure I will stay here again.

I stayed here for three nights recently. I found the rooms clean, spacious and well appointed. For New York the hotel is reasonably priced and not in a bad area for local shops and restaurants. The staff are very friendly and helpful and very responsive to requests.There are a few downsides: Firstly, if you plan to stay at a weekend, the hotel restaurant is closed. And if you fancy a drink in the bar, then make sure it's happy hour or a beer will cost you an eye-watering $9! Finally, there's some pretty heavy duty construction going on in the immediate vicinity. This goes on from around 7:00 am to around 11:00 pm during week days and is very intrusive - I certainly could not sleep through it.Overall, though, a good experience and I'd stay there again.

This is a difficult review, and yet it should be straight forward. Yet again (somewhat) another case where the product (The hotel) is pretty decent but the Service doesn't follow through.The Lobby and bar are absolutely beautiful. I had a Premium Room that, to be honest, looked quite average to me. I had tried another Thompson before (in Tribeca) and the rooms were superior. The size was adequate though. Even though I was on the highest floor (room 181), the view was average. I lucked out I got it at a discounted price (about $210 a night?). Had I paid full price I would have been seriously disappointed.I felt that the ambiance (music etc) around the end of PM/evening was great. even more welcoming that the Tribeca sister (too trendy sometimes?). But otherwise the hotel felt a bit deserted at timesThe worst part was the reception. Even for NYC it felt cold. You almost have the impression you annoy them. To be fair not all the people were that cold, but it's more miss than hit. Typical example: we come out around 7:30AM from the elevators right in front of the lobby, walk by 3 people who are too busy having fun between them to say Hi, we go all the way to the restaurant, one of them sees us standing there for a solid 3-4 min (no one comes by) and doesn't intervene. I go to the reception just to hear the guy tell us that their breakfast doesn't open until later on WE. I wish he had told me that before. Not big things but seriously not what you would expect in a Thompson hotel. We had a few similar incidents. Each one not annoying enough but all of them add up.We tried the breakfast once. Average at best. Don't go out of your way to try it.On the plus side: the area is not as deserted as I thought it would be. I wouldn't return again unless it was on discount. And knowing not to expect much in term of service.

I was visiting NYC for a birthday weekend with a few other friends. Hotel was great - nice, clean rooms, friendly helpful staff. Very small gym, but fine for a few days. Only small challenge was that it was a wee bit of a challenge getting cabs in the financial district on a weekend, but if give yourself a bit of extra time, shouldn't be a problem.

The decor is definitely something to remember. Green leather carpet in the lobby with deer antlers? Sure I'll take that! The rooms are definitely decently-sized by NYC standards. Walking distance to Seaport, there's a great restaurant Barbarini with amazing prosciutto! We definitely took advantage of the minibar and the little Bigleow shampoos- LOVE!

If you want to stay in a modern hotel that has beautiful class and luxury, far enough away from the hustle and bustle yet only a short train right away if you want to be part of the action, then gild hall is the place for you. I requested an early check in from the regular 3 o'clock time and arrived at 7 AM. Not only was the staff accommodating, but they also gave me a free upgrade to the most beautiful room I've ever seen! The Thompson suite. This service was unmatched they sent over cookies filled up my ice and brought chocolates. The Thompson chain has never disappointed me, and I will definitely be back! Thank you Esther Song for making this all happen:) you've made my anniversary so special!!

pre-paid for a king room (*not* Priceline/Hotwire mind you), given a doublebroken light fixturesroom phone out of orderis some body lotion too much to ask for?no--I repeat none whatsoever--servers available at restaurant during dinner hoursreception clerk promised help with something--never happened; I finally got up & leftthe 2 stars are for the limited positives: very clean, staff are friendly (incompetent, but friendly), decor is great, (small) bed was comfyhave stayed at other Thompsons before (BH, NYC) but not this oneoften in the Financial Dist overnight--going back to the Andaz
I had a great short-stay experience at the Gild Hall. The lobby and rooms have an interesting vibe... The staff is friendly and the bed was nice and comfortable. I highly recommend it!
user_location: New York, New York, United States
user_name:
Iga B
New York, New York, United States

review_body: We stayed here for a long weekend escape. We explored a good deal of New York City, which meant we were often traveling far away from this secluded Financial District location. But even being off the beaten path, we enjoyed this hotel. A short walk to the subway, we were able to easily get further North. This is of course also quite close to the new WTC memorial which we were glad to explore. The service was decent, but nothing to brag about.Overall, a fun boutique hotel, if you're looking for a quiet spot as your home base.

I needed a one night stay in New York for a work trip. A Bloomspot deal arrived in my email inbox for Gild Hall, so I purchased it, since the reviews were very good and the overall vibe looked appealing. The decor appeared modern retro, with a lodge in the woods type of vibe, but stylish.Everything went smoothly upon my arrival and check in. The room was a bit more spacious than other boutique hotels in the city. Whenever I needed something, the front desk staff was very responsive and very quick (i.e. free drink vouchers that were part of my Bloomspot deal: someone delivered those to my door promptly, as well as a cord I needed to borrow for the internet). The bar in the lobby (The Libertine) was comfortable, and there is an upstairs lounge above the bar, which was a nice option. The location is a bit tucked away down some smaller streets, which made it feel slightly more private for being in New York. Very convenient to Financial District attractions and easy walk to SoHo.

I enjoyed the hotel. It has multiple sitting/bar areas and is a good hangout spot, with lots of interesting people to watch and talk to. The room itself is nice, but i think i got upgraded as i got in late and they were sold out. Sometimes a bit too reliant on being cool from a service standpoint. Area is all offices, not much of interest to see if you want to kill some time. If you are there on business and stay in the hotel for a few hours, i think you will like it.
user_name:
Flyway2much
New York City, New York

review_body: 1. Put on a smoking floor without being told (did not know they still existed)2. Charged for every incidental items (internet, apples in the lobby, etc.)3. Front desk decidly unhelpful, had to call down twice for things they should have told me at check in.4. Bathrooms not up to date5. Excercise room out of water.Overall, just a lack of attention to detail and nickle and diming.

Stsyed here in April. In heart of financial. Good for weekday business travel. A little far from weekend activities. Is very close to seaport. Few markets nearby. Subway 1 block away. Staff very friendly. Loved the decor. Creative, interesting. Would highly recommend. Especially for the price.

Just returned from a 3 day trip to NYC. Stayed at Gild Hall with a friend. While I can't say it was a horrible stay, the room is lovely, just like the pics. The hotel decor is great. I just think the staff needs more training on how to be consistent. My friend arrived before me, she checked in, then I arrived 2 hours later. Neither of us were offered a glass of Prosecco, as I observed other guests were, the next day, but to be fair, this was a totally different staff checking in the newly arrived :-(. No coffee available, unless you walk a short distance to Starbucks, which isn't bad, however, when you're hungover you really just want it at your fingertips (don't judge). The next day the cleaning person only left one wash towel?? We called down and it took over an hour to get another. If you are use to getting body lotion, shower gel, shampoo & conditioner, bring your own lotion & shower gel, these are not provided. I liked the location, the cab drivers did not, but it was quiet, and not hard to walk to. There isn't weekend room service, but it's New York, you can easily, walk out the door, turn the corner and right up the street is a wonderful restaurant & gourmet grocery. In all it's not a kid friendly hotel, and since I don't have any that was fine by me. Its is a boutique hotel, whatever that means. Not sure if I would stay there again, given that there are other places to choose, that provide simple amenities, for around the same price or less.

On a weekend, Lower Manhattan is less frenetic than Midtown. My husband and I had a very pleasant stay at the Gild Hall over the past weekend. The location is great, tucked away in one of the maze of little streets in that part of the city, and really close to several subway lines. If, like me, you are a runner, you have easy access to some great routes (Battery Park, Hudson River Park, Brooklyn Bridge). If, like me, you are a shopper, you are close to Century 21 and a short walk from the Tribeca and SoHo shops between West Broadway and Broadway. (Tip: SoHo gets very crowded by 2 PM - most shops open at 11 AM on Saturdays so aim to go between 11 and 2 if you want to avoid the crowds).The room we had was well-appointed and on a high floor so far enough away from street noise, although this area seems pretty quiet at the weekend.The hotel bar was chocker with the after-work crowd on the Friday but very quiet on the Saturday. The only disappointment was the breakfast. The restaurant is closed at weekends so there is a continental breakfast buffet only. Not very good value or quality. I can overlook that - I'll stay at the Gild Hall again.

My son and I recently stayed at Gild Hall for 5 nights. Having never stayed in the Financial District before we found it a nice change from the usual Manhattan locations. It was close to the subway for trips uptown, but also close to the 911 Memorial, Wall St, the Staten Is Ferry, Seaport and Brooklyn. There were a few bars and restaurants close, but it was also easy to jump in a cab to go a little farther afield if you want. There is also a supermarket and laundry next door. Part of our stay was over the weekend when the Financial District is very quiet. This was great for walking around without the crowds but no so good for nightlife, On one occasion I had arranged to meet friends for drinks at the hotel but found that the barman had failed to turn up for work, however on our return later that evening we found that someone had been called in. The decor itself is very eclectic and fabulous, from the red painted halls with Hollywood 60"s photo's, to the wood paneled library and bar. The room was also quite large for NYC, the bed very comfortable and the bathroom and amenities very good. The only thing that I would have liked included was free wifi, which I think is expected in a hotel of this standard. We didn't eat in the restaurant (closed on weekends) but it looked lovely and the bar snacks were delicious.  All in all a great place to stay. Good staff and location and a little bit quirky.

I stayed overnight this week and I was very pleased with my stay. I usually stay at another Thompson property (The Smyth), but they didn't have a room. I liked the lower key style of Gild Hall and as I have come to expect, the service was the best. Quick from the door to the room, very helpful and attentive staff - all of them. I will be back and would recommend to any business or leisure traveler for a short stay.

We stayed at Gild Hall for two nights over Easter. We were greeted upon arrival with a glass of Proseco which was very nice. The room was beautiful, really nice linens, marble bathroom, very roomy by NYC standards. The best thing was that I left my Blackberry in the room and didn't discover it until I was halfway back to Boston. When I called the hotel the next day, they reported that the phone had not been turned in, but they would search the room again. The very nice Executive Housekeeper, called me the next day and told me they had found it had fallen behind the safe! She was so nice!!! I would definitely go back to this hotel and would recommend it highly! It's also a quick walk to Fulton Station, so easy to get around.

My husband and I decided at the last minute to see a show with friends in NYC. I used a hotel site that doesn't tell you what the hotel is till you buy it and chose a 4star. After purchase I was nervous because the reviews weren't good. Though I wouldn't call it a 4star, we were pleasantly surprised and had a wonderful stay. First off, the location was perfect. Walking distance to the train, Seaport, a supermarket, places to eat, coffee, bars. We were greeted with unique decor, a glass of Prosecco, and excellent customer service. It wasn't "luxury", but "boutique" hotels are a welcome change from the usual. We felt at home and enjoyed our stay. The bed was comfortable, room clean. Missing, however, was wifi. Got to have free wifi! A small fridge would have been nice too. And an odd thing; the key reader in the door woke me up a few times because it makes a clicking noise.

We also purchased the Travelzoo deal but were staying over a Monday night so had no problem booking a room. They even advised that we received an upgrade without my asking. We ordered room service for breakfast and the food was wonderfully prepared. Staff were very helpful upon check-in and we needed some extra assist.We loved the location which was close to the 911 memorial, Seaport, Trinity Church and Wall St. Great location for crossing the Brooklyn Bridge and enjoying some of Brooklyn as well as close to multiple subway stops on Fulton St. The room was large by Manhattan standards, bed was comfortable, and bathroom one of the cleanest we had seen in the city. As to someones comment about no top sheet, the comforter was covered with sheets and I found the sheets of good quality which is also becoming harder to find in Manhattan.Our one minor issue was that we were placed in a room on the Platt St. side of the building which is where trash trucks seem to load trash and recycables from a neighboring building for two hours at a time. They actually were loading two trucks at a time with the noise of constant compacting. We were only on the 4th floor so it made it difficult to listen to the TV or each other from 8-10 pm. It was also going on during the daytime but the good news is that it stopped around 10 pm so no problem sleeping. We would return to this hotel but request a room on the opposite side of the hotel.

I stayed at the Gild Hall with my girlfriend and two other couples back in December. The hotel was easy to locate and we even found a parking spot on the street around the corner form the hotel. I liked this property because it didn't have the feel of a bigger hotel such as a Weston or Marriott. We had three rooms between the six of us and all of our rooms were ready upon our arrival. The front desk staff was very accommodating to our group and quickly checked us in. The room was very clean and had nice high ceilings. My favorite part of the room was the king size bed. Overall I had a great experience at the Gild Hall and I would definitely stay here again.

I got a Travelzoo coupon for this hotel. Bad idea. Because when I tried to redeem it, they told me they were out of the "class" of rooms that were on the coupon for the date I wanted. The coupon offered two upgrades for the price, so I told them I would be happy to take a lower grade room. They were happy to book me in a lower grade room. But for a HIGHER PRICE. Then I asked them what rooms they had available. They told me they only had premium rooms. That was the room grade on the coupon. When I told them that, they said they didn't have those available, they only had suites available. Then I asked them why they were offering me a lower grade room. They kept changing the story. I should have took the hint and booked somewhere else, but I went ahead and paid the extra money.Mind you, I was supposed to get free WiFi and free continental breakfast with the coupon, but since I got the LOWER GRADE room for a HIGHER PRICE, they were not going to honor the coupon. So I called Travelzoo and got a refund.When I got to the hotel, they were nice enough and the hotel was pretty and the decorations were nice. However. The room was just ok. First thing. Why didn't they have a top sheet? That is just unsanitary. Who knows if they wash those comforters every day. Second. There is no coffee maker in the room. If you want your morning cup of joe, you better be prepared to go downstairs and pay a full $15.00 for their continental breakfast, which consists of some cereal, a little fruit, a few danishes and some juice. And coffee. I just wanted the coffee. So I grabbed a cup and went upstairs to my room.
